EKOenergy for Ireland and the UK

Suomen luonnonsuojeluliitto (Finnish Association for Nature Conservation)

Helsinki, Finland

Apply

Project description

PLEASE DO NOT SEND AN AUTOMATIC MESSAGE "THAT YOU ARE INTERESTED" BUT SEND CV AND MOTIVATION LETTER TO info@ekoenergy.org. - EKOenergy is an international not-for-profit ecolabel for sustainable renewable energy. We are hosted by the Finnish Association for Nature Conservation and are active in over 40 countries. We welcome a new ESC/EVS volunteer to help us promote renewable energy in English speaking countries, The project activities include setting up climate change campaigns, contacting energy consumers, writing articles,... Other tasks include general support of the EKOenergy secretariat, social media...  All tasks happen from our office in Helsinki (The office is hosted by the Finnish Association for Nature Conservation). The volunteers will cooperate with about 6 other volunteers, from 6 countries.  For more information see also https://www.ekoenergy.org/ekoenergy-is-looking-for-an-arabic-speaking-volunteer/

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation: volunteers get a private room in an apartment shared with students.   Volunteers also get money to buy food, a bus ticket for transportation within Helsinki, language course, health insurance and EVS pocket money.   Travel: we pay the travel from your home country to Finland (and return)

Training during the project

Pre-arrival training by the sending organisation  - On arrival training organised by Opetushallitus, the Finnish national Agency - Information on the electricity market  - Regular webinars about climate change and EU climate policy

Volunteer profile

The volunteer will be part of the young and dynamic EKOenergy team. They should be eager and enthusiastic to promote nature-friendly renewable energy. We are looking for team-players, interested in initiating and managing own activities and sub-projects.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/08/2019 to 31/12/2020

Itälahdenkatu 22 B, 00210 Helsinki

Looking for volunteers from

READY FOR CORPS "Plural Hosting" in Biella

CONSORZIO SOCIALE IL FILO DA TESSERE

BIELLA, Italy

Apply

Project description

PLACE: Biella (Piedmont region, Italy). PROJECT START: April 2019 at the earliest (to be agreed among volunteer and host). PROJECT END: December 2019. PROJECT NAME: "Ready for corps in Biella". ACTIVITY IN SOCIAL FIELD WITH POVERTY http://www.mariacecilia.it/servizi/2014-04-10-14-28-21/accoglienza-plurale.html

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

LIVING CONDITIONS: Volunteers will live in cohousing in a flat in the center of Biella, in double room, with wifi, bus-stop some metres from the door, all services in the city very close. MONTHLY ALLOWANCE: around 150€ pocket money + 160€ food money. Lunch on service days is provided at the service office. LOCAL TRANSPORT: At the arrival volunteer will receive some tickets for bus and in a few days will receive a monthly card for the bus, that connects Biella with the place of service. Possibility to receive a bicycle for all project period also.

Training during the project

OLS online Italian language course in Italian class. Opportunity to participate in Italian class

Volunteer profile

We're searching for 1 Volunteers between the ages of 18 and 30 FROM POLAND. We don't need “Expert Professionals”, we want people that are interested in sharing values and points of view, ready to collaborate, to learn, to ask and to think together. We're searching young people with strong motivation in volunteering activities, available to put themeselves in the condition of learn from the experience. Flexibility, to be open-mind and motivated are the charachters we're expecting for.

Placement dates

A total of 39 week(s) during the period 01/04/2019 to 31/12/2019

Placement location

VIA TRIPOLI 24, 13900 BIELLA

Looking for volunteers from

Poland

Social challenges

Education and training

Project 45: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11966_en


SMILE & GO in Francia - 6 mesi

Pistes-Solidaires

Pau, France

Apply

Project description

SMILE & GO è un progetto di Servizio Volontario Europeo (SVE) coordinato dal CEMEA del Mezzogiorno onlus che permette a 30 giovani tra i 18 ed i 30 anni residenti in Italia di fare una esperienza di apprendimento all'estero in organizzazioni no profit che operano nel campo dell'animazione socio-culturale in Bulgaria, Croazia, Francia, Portogallo, Romania, Regno Unito, Slovenia e Spagna. Uno dei progetti in partenza ad Ottobre 2019: quello in Francia, presso l'organizzazione Pistes-Solidaires. Il campo principale d’azione è quello della promozione dell’educazione non formale. Tra le attività previste: -Attività legate all’Europa e alle culture europee -Promozione delle opportunità offerte dal Programma Europeo Erasmus+ -Supporto ad eventi e campagne di informazione sull'Europa, la diversità europea e la cittadinanza Per saperne di più: https://www.progettosmile.eu/vuoi-partire/pistes-solidaires/

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Alloggio: in un appartamento, condiviso con altri volontari. Il volontario avrà una camera condivisa (2 persone / camera); la cucina ed il bagno condivisi con altri volontari. Il viaggio andata e ritorno verrà rimborsato fino all'ammontare massimo di 275 euro. Ogni volontario riceverà un budget per il vitto, oltre al pocket money mensile.

Training during the project

I volontari saranno supportati e guidati dall'organizzazione di accoglienza durante le attività. I volontari parteciperanno alla formazione all'arrivo organizzata dall'Agenzia Nazionale Francese.

Volunteer profile

Il progetto è rivolto a giovani tra i 18 ed i 30 anni, residenti in Italia. Ai volontari non è richiesta alcuna competenza specifica nel campo. I requisiti più importanti sono l’interesse per la tematica del progetto e la motivazione a mettersi in gioco in un’esperienza di apprendimento in un contesto interculturale. La conoscenza della lingua francese è gradita.

Placement dates

A total of 26 week(s) during the period 01/10/2019 to 28/03/2020

Placement location

3, rue de Livron, 64000 Pau

Looking for volunteers from

Italy

Placement topics

Education and training

Employment and entrepreneurship

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 14/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 46: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11962_en


Let's live Europe in rural area - France /3

Maison Familiale Rurale Sarthe

Le Mans, France

Apply

Project description

http://europe-en-sarthe.eu/esc-in-france/ : All the informations (infopack and application form) are here Your application won't be considered if not complete with the application form + CV + video. Europe is looking forward to your contribution! Help develop the cultural openness of young people and participate in their learning of citizenship and tolerance. Support their curiosity on intercultural aspects and encourage them to discover Europe! Become a volunteer in the training center for teenagers and young people ! This project will involve 6 volunteers from 6 different European countries. Each one of them will volunteer in one of the 6 local training centers for teenagers from the area of Sarthe, France. The local training centers are called: the “Maisons familiales rurales” or MFR. The main missions will be: 1. European cultural openness 2. Educational and pedagogical mission 3. Joint project with the 6 volunteers in the 6 training centers …

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will be accommodated in Le Mans, with the other 5 volunteers taking part in this project. They will live in a house next to the train station in Le Mans, not far from the city center. Each volunteer will have his own room in this big house, and they’ll all share the common parts. There is a garden, the house is fully furnished, and was renovated last year. Accommodation and transportation fees are under the responsibility of the host organization. Money will be given to the volunteer every month to cover food expenses, as such as pocket money.

Training during the project

Volunteers will participate in the arrival and mid-term meetings.

Volunteer profile

Living in the EU, being motivated, between 18 and 30 years old, driving license required, interested in youth work, education, europe and intercultural topics, willing to learn french. The MFR is located on rural area so the volunteer should have a driving license and be ready to drive every working days to reach the training center (up to 1 hour for a one-way trip: train + car). Candidates should be motivated, ready to work in a team, flexible, creative, open-minded, pro-active, dynamic, communicative, and interested in working with teenagers and young people.

Placement dates

A total of 47 week(s) during the period 19/08/2019 to 12/07/2020

Placement location

72000 Le Mans

Looking for volunteers from

Austria

Placement topics

Social challenges

Citizenship and democratic participation

Environment and natural protection

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 07/04/2019

Sign in / Join

Project 47: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11955_en


Super Heroes Volunteers - volunteering team

Fundacja CampoSfera

Sędziszów, Poland

Apply

Project description

Project "Super Heroes Volunteers - volunteering teams" is a short-term ESC volunteering project. During 6 weeks we will be exploring our artistic skills and talk about diversity and multicultural education. We will decorate our building and try to bring the art outside to the village! Also we will organize a small Festival for kids on 1st of June. Main tasks and activities: - Painting mural in school with an artist from Cracov; - Creating cultural activities - organizing a small local Festival in Klimontów on Children’s Day (1st June); - Exploring the needs of local community; - Preparing workshops and animations for kids; - Presenting your culture; - Working in garden and Foundation’s building; - First aid course; - And more…

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will be accommodated in 3 big rooms (4-5 people per room) in an ex-school building owned by Foundation (2nd floor). They will have access to bathroom with showers and toilets, to the kitchen where they can prepare meals for themselves.The volunteers will receive pocket money in the amount of the equivalent of 4 EUR per day. Travel expenses to the project and back will be reimbursed.

Training during the project

Foundation CampoSfera offers volunteers knowledge and skills like: work in a complex international team; work with youth and children from rural areas; teamwork; knowledge and methods of leading workshops and organizing small cultural event; developing practical, artistic and gardening skills; improving planning skills, work division, and learning responsibility for your own tasks; exploring and improving artistic skills, etc.

Volunteer profile

People passionate about ART and multicultural learning. Creative, open-minded, ready to share their culture and artistic skills! Maybe You already know something about art and multiculturalism or maybe You want to explore more and challenge Yourself in a creative way – as long as You are motivated to work and happy to help - there is a place in our team exactly for You! Super Hero Volunteer is willing to live and work in the rural area, not afraid of physical and outdoor works; motivated to work in an intercultural group of 14-25 people.

Placement dates

A total of 6 week(s) during the period 05/05/2019 to 16/06/2019

Placement location

Klimontów 31, 28-340 Sędziszów

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Social challenges

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 04/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 48: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11942_en


SPJ/Le Relais

SPJ/le Relais

Neupré, Belgium

Apply

Project description

Service volontaire dans une Maison d'enfants accueillant des enfants et adolescents placés par le juge. Le volontaire soutiendra l'équipe éducative sur place en proposant des activités diverses aux enfants et en les accompagnant dans la vie quotidienne. Ce sont surtout des petites choses que le volontaire pourra mettre en place. Par exemple: aider pour les devoirs, accompagner un enfant au foot, présenter son pays d'accueil,... aider pour les repas, seconder l'équipe éducative dans les tâches quotidiennes.... Ce sont des enfants qui viennent de situations familiales pas faciles et qui peuvent par moment montrer des comportements inhabituels.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Le volontaire aura une chambre dans la Maison d'enfants avec accès à la cuisine ou petite kitchenette. Il pourra manger avec l'équipe et les enfants ou cuisiner lui même ses repas. Il partagera la salle de bain et les toilettes avec les plus grands enfants.

Training during the project

Le volontaire va participer aux séminaires organisés par l'organisation de coordination (+/- 15 jours) ainsi qu'aux séminaires organisés par l'agence nationale belge. Dans le projet il aura un tuteur et un "parrain" qui sera là pour des questions plus spécifiques concernant le service dans le projet local.

Volunteer profile

Une personne qui a envie de s’engager auprès d'enfants en difficultés. Qui aime les enfants et les adolescents mais qui sait aussi dire non. Personne ouverte aux autres, curieuse d'apprendre et qui a envie de donner un peu de son temps. Personne flexible qui sait s'adapter facilement à des nouvelles situations. Car le travail avec les enfants n'est jamais pareil d'un jour à l'autre. Savoir faire face à l'imprévu.

Placement dates

A total of 44 week(s) during the period 02/09/2019 to 30/06/2020

Placement location

Neupré

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Malta

Placement topics

Social challenges

Education and training

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 30/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 49: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11934_en


Volunteering at Werkschulheim Felbertal

Werkschulheim Felbertal

Ebenau, Austria

Apply

Project description

The Werkschulheim Felbertal is a private secondary school focusing on trade. It is also a boarding school with public status, which was founded in 1951 based on the idea of the Scout Movement. The four year long focus on technical handwork in the lower school, as well as the emphasis on language and computer science in the upper school are distinctive features of this educational program. There are about 335 pupils at the school (180 in the boarding school and 135 in the day care till five o´clock). They also spend their leisure time here. The target group are youngsters between 11 and 20 years. Regular activities include excursions to the surrounding cultural and sportive attractions of the area, such as hiking, skiing and visits to Salzburg. The school offers a variety of different sports activities at the place such as archery, a tennis court, a boulder room, a fitness room, a soccer court as well as creative activities. There is also a group of scouts that holds activities.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

A local standard accommodation (host family/ students dorm or apartment) is provided. The volunteer receives food money monthly from the host organization. Local transport is provided by the host organization.

Training during the project

The volunteer will have and on-arrival training as well as a mid-term training. All the costs are covered.

Volunteer profile

You will support the staff at the boarding school houses and carry out leisure time activities with the youngsters. You will support the staff during study lessons in the afternoon and with planning and implementing cultural/sportive/creative activites as a leisure time activities. You will also support the weekly scouts meetings and activities and social activities and excursions of the boarding school. Applications will only be considered if directed to erziehungsleiter@werkschulheim.at indicating the project applied for in the E-mail subject and containing CV and motivation letter.

Placement dates

A total of 49 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/07/2020

Placement location

Werkschulheimstraße 11, 5323 Ebenau

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Education and training

Employment and entrepreneurship

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 30/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 50: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11928_en


!ONLY FOR EUROPEAN ! Arche - Vie avec des personnes handicapées

ICE-RF / L'Arche en France

Différents lieux en France, France

Apply

Project description

! ONLY FOR EUROPEAN CITIZENS ! ICE-RF recrute des volontaires, pour effectuer un "Service Civique" dans une Arche, dans le partage de la vie quotidienne avec des personnes en situation d'handicap. La mission se déroulera du 02/09/2019 au 20/08/2020. Il est demandé à chaque volontaire de participer à une préparation de 2.5 semaines au mois d'août 2019, à Niederbronn les Bains. ! ONLY FOR EUROPEAN CITIZENS ! ICE-RF is recruiting european volunteers to do a "Service Civique" in an Arche, in the aim of shairing daily life with people with disabilities. The mission is from the 02/09/2019 to the 20/08/2020. All volunteer has to take part on a 2,5 weeks preparation in august 2019, in Niederbronn-les-Bains.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Les volontaires disposeront de leur chambre à coucher individuelle. Ils devront partager la cuisine, la salle de bains avec d'autres personnes. The young volunteer will have his own bedroom, kitchen and bathroom are shared.

Training during the project

Il est demandé à chaque volontaire de participer à une préparation de 2,5 semaines au mois d'août 2019. D'autres rencontre de quelques jours auront lieu au mois de novembre 2019 et avril/mai 2020. Before the beginning of his voluntary, in august 2019, he has to take part on a 2,5 weeks preparation, which included french courses, administrative tasks and many other interesting activities. This seminar is good to meet other volunteers. It's organised by the coordinating organisation. 2 months and 8 months after the beginning the volunteer is invited to take part on another seminars.

Volunteer profile

! ONLY FOR EUROPEAN CITIZENS ! - A motivated european young boy or girl from 18 to 25 years old with the sense of responsibility, - ready to give 12 months of your time to others and to live in community, - interested in discovering French culture.

Placement dates

A total of 51 week(s) during the period 02/09/2019 to 20/08/2020

Placement location

Différents lieux en France

Looking for volunteers from

!!! ONLY FOR EUROPEAN !!! Service Civique dans le domaine du handicap

ICE-RF et site d'accueil en France

Différents lieux en France, France

Apply

Project description

!!! Only for european citizens !!! ICE-RF recrute des volontaires européens, pour effectuer un Service Civique (statut français du volontariat), dans une structure française, dans l'accompagnement de personnes en situation d'handicap. La mission se déroulera du 02/09/2019 au 31/07/2020. Il est demandé à chaque volontaire de participer à une préparation de 2,5 semaines au mois d'août 2019, à Niederbronn les Bains. !!! Uniquement disponible pour les citoyens européens !!! (statut service civique français) ICE-RF is recruiting european volunteers to do a Service Civique(french voluntary statute) in a french structure in the aim of helping people with disabilities. The mission is from the 01/09/2019 to the 31/07/2020. All volunteer has to take part on a 2,5 weeks preparation in august 2019, in Niederbronn-les-Bains. !!! Only for european citizens !!! (because of the french service civique statute)

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Les volontaires disposeront de leur chambre à coucher individuelle. Ils devront partager la cuisine, la salle de bains avec d'autres personnes. The young volunteer will have his own bedroom, kitchen and bathroom are shared.

Training during the project

Il est demandé à chaque volontaire de participer à une préparation de 2.5 semaines, fin août 2019, à Niederbronn. D'autres rencontres de quelques jours auront lieu au mois de novembre 2019 et avril 2020. Before the beginning of the voluntary, in august 2019, everyone has to take part on a 2,5 weeks preparation, which included french courses, administrative tasks and many other activities. This seminar is good to meet other volunteers. It's organised by the coordinating organisation. 2 months and 8 months after the beginning the volunteer is invited to take part on another seminars.

Volunteer profile

!!! Only for european citizens !!! - A motivated european young boy or girl from 18 to 25 years old, - ready to give 11 months of your time to others. - interested in discovering French culture. !!! Only for european citizens !!! (because of the french service civique statute)

Placement dates

A total of 48 week(s) during the period 02/09/2019 to 31/07/2020

Placement location

Différents lieux en France

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Malta

Looking for one french volunteer: Informal and environmental education

HORAZDOVIC, Czech Republic

Apply

Project description

During long-term EVS projects (1 year) our organisation offers sharing experience and knowledge in environmental and informal education by becaming a part of our lecturer/organizator team. Volunteers are also involved in daily animal/garden care in our Educational Farm. Serene atmosphere of a small historical town Horazdovice offers volunteers space and time to learn and develop new skills (archery, river-sailing, photography...) and to create a project on their own, bringing new ideas. The main activities of the project are : INFORMAL EDUCATION Get involved in regular leisure time activities for children and youth (cratio and art, natural sciences, music, sport, languages...) and realization of summer camps. EDUCATIONAL FARM Experience farm work and perform basic duties of farm keepers such as regular care of garden and farm animals. ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION Accompain school classes on outdoor exkursions and cooperate with our lectors in prepa and teaching both short and long term envi

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

include inthe programm

Volunteer profile

Participants should be interested in the tematics mentionned and be available as soon as possible

EVShape up

A4ACTION - ASSOCIATION FOR INITIATIVES AND CONTINUOUS DEVELOPMENT

Ghermanesti, Romania

Apply

Project description

We are interested to host four volunteers from Belgium, and three from Latvia to take part in an EVS project in Ghermănești (Snagov), Romania. The project will be deployed from 20 of May 2019 until the 18th of November 2019. During the 6 months of the project, the volunteers will have the possibility to organize and develop new educational programs based on non-formal education for the youngsters and children from the community. They will also learn how to promote volunteering projects, the work of an NGO and Erasmus+/European Solidarity Corp Programmes among youngsters and the general public.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

We will provide to the next volunteers: transport cost reimbursement - 275 euro/volunteer (to come to Romania and to go back in their countries); pocket money - 60 euro/volunteer; food money- 120 euro/volunteer; accommodation shared with the other volunteers - 2 volunteers/room; logistical support for activities; online Romanian language courses; a mentor who will support the process of learning and personal development; the opportunity to work in a multicultural team; medical insurance during the full volunteering period assured by CIGNA Insurance Pan.

Training during the project

During this project, volunteers will had the opportunity to be involved in: writing projects, non-formal education, English language courses, online Romanian language courses, communication and solve problems course.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for volunteers aged between 18 and 30 years, who are actively involved in a NGO in their country, and they should have worked with young people or children at least once. We value result orientated, ambitious youngsters, willing to develop themselves. You can find more information about volunteers details in the following link: https://docs.google.com/document/d/10qXegns8L15V_yjrouCNxE5ceir7mMEF89_ztqf18MA/edit .

Placement dates

A total of 26 week(s) during the period 20/05/2019 to 18/11/2019

Placement location

Aleea Islaz, Culture House Ghermanesti, 077170 Ghermanesti

Looking for volunteers from

Belgium, Latvia

Placement topics

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Application deadline: 15/04/2019

Volunteering for rural development

Associatia Tinerilor Formatori pentru Promovarea Dezvoltarii Rurale

Ramnicu Valcea, Romania

Apply

Project description

The project "Volunteering for rural development" comes to meet the activities implemented by ATFPDR in rural communities from Valcea County The specific objectives of the project are: - Personal and professional development for 8 EVS volunteers who will participate for 12 months at an EVS stage. - promoting the European Solidarity Corps in rural communities from Valcea County. - providing both individual and group learning experiences, in a non-formal context. The results of the project will be: - an innovative volunteering internship in order to support six rural communities that will benefit from the specific social entrepreneurship workshops, and also the promoting of Erasmus + program and the European Solidarity Corps. -10 steps to follow in order to organize a theater-forum play: a DVD with the steps that are required to make a forum-theatre and 3 forum-theatre plays with social themes made by volunteers.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accomodation in shared apartaments. Free local transport. 130 euro per month for food.

Training during the project

On arrival training course Mid Term evaluation meeting. Local trainings.

Volunteer profile

Youngster aged between 17-30 years old. - Young people resident in partner countries. - Knowledge and skills specific for EVS traineeship activities - Equal number of girls and boys. - Young people motivated to promote cultural activities and to carry out workshops on cultural and intercultural education.

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 02/09/2019 to 01/09/2020

Placement location

1 Tineretului, 240101 Ramnicu Valcea

Looking for volunteers from

France, Italy, Spain, Turkey

Placement topics

Social challenges

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Solo per italiani: Volontariato in Slovenia

Skofja Loka, Slovenia

Apply

Project description

Volontariato di un anno da Luglio 2019 a Luglio 2020 in Slovenia, a Skofja Loka, paese che dista 25 km dalla capitale Lubiana, Slovenia. Il partecipante svolgerà la propria attività in un centro che si occupa di terapia per ragazzi e genitori con problemi di dipendenza. Considerando il tema del progetto, è preferibile un back ground in pedagogia e psicologia. Per saperne di più https://bit.ly/2TNptl4. Per partecipare invia CV e lettera di motivazione in inglese a molfetta@incoweb.org.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Il candidato vivrà in un appartamento nel centro storico di Skofja Loka, dotato di Wi.Fi, condiviso con altri volontari Europei. A disposizione del volontariato vitto di 176€ mensili e pocket money mensile di 120€. Per facilitare gli spostamenti a disposizione del volontario una bicicletta e biglietti di transporto pubblico, se necessari.

Training during the project

Il volontario svolgerà due training, (arrival e mid-term) organizzati dall'Agenzia Nazionale Giovani Slovena. Al training parteciperanno tutti i ragazzi che stanno svolgendo in quel momento il volontariato in Slovenia.

Volunteer profile

Il candidato ideale è un ragazzo/a fra i 18-30 anni, motivato, creativo, open-mind, flessibile e interessato a lavorare con i ragazzi. Preferibile l'abilità nel comunicare in lingua inglese. Passata esperienza in attvità sportive, musica, danza, arte, multimedia verrà presa in considerazione. Preferibile un background in psicologia e/o pedagogia.

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 01/07/2019 to 01/07/2020

Placement location

Skofja Loka

Looking for volunteers from

Italy

Placement topics

Social challenges

Education and training

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 15/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.

Apply

Project description

L'obbettivo del centro è garantire maggiori opportunità ai ragazzi dell'area con minori opportunità . Per saperne di più https://bit.ly/2TNptl4. Per partecipare invia CV e lettera di motivazione in inglese a molfetta@incoweb.org.

Volunteer profile

Project 62: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11892_en


addicted to freedom

ANMRF LOUIS PASTEUR CLUB VOLTIN BRAILA

BRAILA, Romania

Apply

Project description

The EVS Project "Volunteering changes lives" implemented by ANMRF Louis Pasteur - Club Voltin, Braila and funded by the European Solidarity Corps program takes place in Braila, Romania, for a period of 9 months (18.03.2018-30.11.2019). We included 6 volunteers, we have 4, we need 2 more from EU countries. The main purpose of our project is to be a novelty solution, by using volunteering as an active learning pathway, thus making available to young detainees their own models of voluntary ESC youth. It targets the subconscious to facilitate the behavior of minors. Modeling occurs through the success of ESC volunteers to turn the detained minor through all proposed activities, from a passive receptor to one who actively assumes responsibility for their own change.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

volunteers live in a big apartment with all utilities, they receive 250 euro monthly allowance and food money. Our organisation is reimbursing travel tickets.

Training during the project

In order to accomplish the goals, we will offer volunteers: language training in Romanian, non-formal education training, photography, journalism, PC, communication, project writing, conflict mediation and negotiation, book writing. Once acquired, this knowledge will be applied in a Detention Center, where there are 152 inmates - the beneficiaries of the project. There will be debates on violence in schools and high schools, voluntary actions in partner institutions, multicultural nights, Treasure Hunt contest.

Volunteer profile

SERIOUS, TOLERANT, POSITIVE, PUNCTUAL, TRUSTWORTHY

Placement dates

A total of 32 week(s) during the period 01/04/2019 to 31/12/2019

Placement location

MIHAI BRAVU, 172, BRAILA

Looking for volunteers from

Germany, Bulgaria, Spain, France, Italy, Belgium, Austria, Czech Republic, Slovenia

Placement topics

Social challenges

Citizenship and democratic participation

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 30/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 63: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11886_en


Mobility keys !

La Maison de l'Europe de Tours

Tours, France

Apply

Project description

Volunteer’s missions: Organisation and animation of workshops/events on different themes on Europe and the European Union: intercultural evenings, presentation of my country/culture etc / To guide a group of volunteers in the intercultural events’ organisation / Front office activity to the general public and EVS: As our association is also a sending organization for EVS volunteers, one of your missions will be to inform young people about EVS. / To contribute to the mobility project : help young people to find and apply to a volunteering during the workshops ; help to organise a group volunteering / To help us to find new partners for our events or our projects. Creation of panels on specific themes and/or pedagogic tools./ Information and promotion about mobility: The volunteer will have to visit different schools, training centres, etc... to promote the EVS and speak about its experience./ Organization of the Europe Day: big scaled event in a city park to celebrate the Europe Day

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The accommodation will be provided for the volunteer, a single room in a private house or in a shared apartment. Volunteers receive pocket money (183€ p/ month), a food allowance (180€ p/ month), and all costs associated with the mission (public transportation, bike...) will be covered. Travel costs will be covered to a maximum of 275 euro for the round-trip. The tickets can be bought by the sending organization or by the volunteer, who will send the reimbursement after presenting the original tickets upon arrival.

Training during the project

All volunteers will receive introduction and orientation upon arrival. This includes details about the Maison de l’Europe, their project, the community, the region and culture. They will also learn about different beneficiaries of project activities, how to work with them and volunteering standards, rights and responsibilities. We will support the volunteers in the learning of French Language and the volunteers will participate in trainings promoted by National Agency.

Volunteer profile

An active, curious and open-minded volunteer, interested in France and French language (a basic French knowledge would be considered a plus). Be motivated to work with volunteers, about the European Union and Europe in general. Mission presentation : http://maisoneuropetours.fr/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/MDE-volunteer-mission-presentation.pdf Please send us your CV and motivation letter (in English or French) to mobilite.mdetours@gmail.com before the 10 th of June 2019 For further information, you can contact us by phone +33247200555 or by e-mail mobilite.mdetours@gmail.com

Placement dates

A total of 44 week(s) during the period 30/08/2019 to 28/06/2020

Placement location

97bis Boulevard Jean Royer, 37000 Tours

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Malta, Netherlands

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 10/06/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 64: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11882_en


EVS ON BOARD

Hors Pistes

Marseille, France

Apply

Project description

Hors Pistes develops volunteering missions in different schools and high schools in the region « Provence Alpes Côte d’Azur ». The main objective of the project is to allow pupils and students to broaden their perspectives to an intercultural and international level thanks to the presence of international volunteers. The volunteers will take part in the school daily life by organising activities for the pupils and students. Here are some examples of activities that the volunteers can set up during their missions: • educational support (e.g. helping with homework or during language classes). • giving a hand at the school library. • developing language clubs. • participating and helping in the organisation and development of schools twinings and school trips. • promoting volunteering among the pupils and students. • participating in the development of school communication tools (newspaper, web-radio, social networks, etc).

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will be hosted in shared appartment with other volunteers and language assistants directly in the schools. They will have their own room but will share the common spaces (bathroom, kitchen, livingroom...). In some cases it is possible that volunteers will be hosted in hosting families. Volunteers will receive a monthly allowance for food costs. In some cases volunteers will be able to have meals in the schools. They will also receive a monthly pocket money. If necessary, volunteers will benefit from a local transport card.

Training during the project

Volunteers will participate in the two trainings organised by the French National Agency : one on-arrival training, one mid-term training. Hors Pistes organises aswell training for all volunteers coordinated in the region : one on-arrival, one mid-term.

Volunteer profile

The volunteers need to be between 18 and 30 years old. The schools are looking for volunteers who are motivated to do activities with young people and willing to help to improve the daily life in the schools. Depending on the interests of the volunteers they can take part into different projects. * The volunteers who were involved in different highschools in 2017-2018 produced a video in which they are telling about their experience in France : https://video.helloeko.com/v/MYokrA?autoplay=true

Placement dates

A total of 45 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 30/06/2020

Placement location

54 rue du coq, 13001 Marseille

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 15/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 65: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11875_en


YOUth in Borås

Borås Stad, Fritid och Folkhälsa

Borås, Sweden

Apply

Project description

1 project - 3 youth centres - 6 volunteers 1. Dalsjöfors and Fristad youth centres are located in the countryside of Borås. They are a natural meeting place for the youths in the areas, which means that the atmosphere is welcoming and warm. They offer activities for youth aged 10-18 with focus on ages 14-16. 2. Norrbyhuset is an activity house located in a neighbourhood of Borås open to all ages, from children to adults. It contains a library, a café, an arena with stage, a music room, a project room and a workshop room. In the house you will find activities such as citizen service, language café, homework help and activities for youth. 3. Brygghuset is an activity house for young adults aged 16-29 . It contains a café, a music studio, dance spaces, an open stage, cinema and meeting rooms. In the house you will find activities such as leadership training for young adults, music and movie production, poetry evenings, concerts, etc.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will live in a shared accommodation where they have their own room. They will be provided with monthly pocket/food and bus card.

Training during the project

-on-arrival training, mid-term training, and internal trainings (violence prevention, summer activities, etc)

Volunteer profile

FOR PROGRAMME C. We're looking for volunteers who have a genuine interest in working with young people and who feel comfortable in social environments. We think that you are social, creative and willing to work in a team. Send your CV + a motivation letter stating why you want to participant in OUR PROJECT, as well as information about your sending organisation to: evs@boras.se. Deadline for application is 7th of April. We will get back to suitable candidate for a Skype call in the upcoming weeks. (Make sure that you are registered to Solidarity corps and send us your reference number)

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 04/09/2019 to 04/09/2020

Placement location

Sturegatan 38, 503 42 Borås

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Project 66: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11867_en


Volunteering at Youth centre Oberndorf

Jugendzentrum Oberndorf

Oberndorf, Austria

Apply

Project description

The youth centre Oberndorf has been founded in 1999 as an open meeting point for the local youth groups. The centre is the main meeting point in Oberndorf for the youth scene between 12 and 18 years. The average number of visitors is about 70 per opening. The young people coming to our centre are mainly from Oberndorf or neighbourhood. Target groups are beside the local youth scene especially disadvantaged and underprivileged youngsters as migrants, unemployed, and socially discriminated youngsters etc. With a mix of activities and regular opening hours, the youth center tries to support participation within the community of Oberndorf, to improve the integration status and to give shelter and backup when necessary. Further it wants to support useful leasure time activities. Please send your CV and motivational letter to info@juz-oberndorf.at! Please indicate the subject: Volunteering at JUZ Oberndorf

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

A local standard accommodation (host family/ students dorm or apartment) is provided. The volunteer receives food money monthly from the host organization. Local transport is provided by the host organizatio

Training during the project

The volunteer will have and on-arrival training as well as a mid-term training. All the costs are covered.

Volunteer profile

The tasks we can offer cover a wide spectrum, especially through the cooperation in the local community. We will ask the volunteer to tell his/her expectations and goals at the beginning of the project so that the team can help you. We are willing to host volunteers from various disadvantaged backgrounds, if we know in advance to be able to support him/her. The volunteer should be able to work independently and to be motivated to show his/her own initiative working with youth.

Placement dates

A total of 44 week(s) during the period 01/10/2019 to 31/07/2020

Placement location

Joseph-Mohr-Straße 4, 5110 Oberndorf

CHALETS TOUT « LÀ-EAU » (1)

Solidarités Jeunesses

Saint Julien en Beauchêne, France

Apply

Project description

You will participate in a large-scale project. Five cottages used to be inhabited within the hamlet, however a lack of water supply made this no longer possible. In 2017, the association searched for and located a new water source that could supply the these homes. Your mission will be to continue this work begun in 2018 by connecting the new water source to the cottages by pipes that will bring the two together. With a technical supervisor, you will discover several methods and different types of work such as: masonry, clearing work, plumbing, etc.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

You will be residing in tents in the hamlet of Vaunières. A sanitary block will be at your disposal, including 3 showers and 3 WC. Meals will be shared among the community of villagers, as well as other people and volunteers. In turns, everyone will help with dishes and cleaning the kitchen.

Volunteer profile

Looking for motivated volunteers

Placement dates

A total of 2 week(s) during the period 08/07/2019 to 27/07/2019

Placement location

Saint Julien en Beauchêne

Looking for volunteers from

France, Germany, Spain, Italy

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 08/07/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 68: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11863_en


TRACING THE STEPS OF THE DUKE OF LESDIGUIÈRES

Solidarités Jeunesses

Le Glaizil, France

Apply

Project description

Project : At the foot of the Massif du Dévoluy, in the Hautes-Alpes, are the remains of the castle of Lesdiguières, located at the entrance of a hamlet of the same name, in the district of Glaizil. This castle was built in the 16th century by François de Bonne, the future duke of Lesdiguières and the last constable of France. Today, only the ruins of the old chapel, the towers, and broken down sections of the walls can be found at the site of this once-grand castle, ranked as a French national historic monument. Since 2010, an international youth workcamp is organized here every year. Work : You will participate in the restoration of an escape wall. This wall, at the time, was used for defense and protection of the castle (outer moat wall). Today, this moat is dry. You will intervene with the help of a technical supervisor to restore this wall using traditional masonry techniques. Searching and sorting of the stones will be done, then you will re-use these stones to fill the gaps. You

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation and food : In tents on the «La Pra » campsite, located at the entrance of the Valgaudemar valley. On the campsite, you will enjoy a calm stay in a green setting. You will have access to camping facilities : toilets, cater fountains, and a communal barbecue. The leaders will encourage you to participate in the community's life: menu and meal preparation using local products, dishwashing, and clean-up...

Volunteer profile

Looking for motivated volunteers

Placement dates

A total of 3 week(s) during the period 15/06/2019 to 05/07/2019

Placement location

Le Glaizil

Looking for volunteers from

France, Italy, Czech Republic

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 15/06/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 69: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11862_en


LE FORT DE L’AIGUILLE (1)

Solidarités Jeunesses

Fouras-les-Bains, France

Apply

Project description

Project: Located at the mouth of the Charente river, the peninsula of Fouras-les-Bains contains three harbours and five beaches along the Atlantic coast. In an idyllic setting with views of Fort Boyard, you will work on the rehabilitation of the Fort of the Aiguille. This fort is a redoubt, a fortification system built by the French military engineer Vauban. The redoubt protected Fouras from a potential enemy sea invasion. Work: This project is a continuation of the work undertaken last year by the volunteers. You will work on the restoration of a new part of the main facade of the redoubt. You will help the technical leader to remove plants from the facade, and to remove and replace the chalk mortar joints between the stones. Other works of traditional masonry are also planned, such as redoing the stone coping (top layer of the wall) and stone-cutting.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation: In groups, in tents on Fouras’ campground *** (swimming pool, multi-sports area, WIFI, snacks…) Meals will be prepared by «kitchen teams» in turns.

Volunteer profile

Looking for motivated volunteers

Placement dates

A total of 3 week(s) during the period 17/05/2019 to 07/06/2019

Placement location

Fouras-les-Bains

Looking for volunteers from

France, Germany, Belgium, Spain

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 17/05/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 70: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11846_en


United Learning 2019 - Volunteering at Treloar Trust

Treloar Trust

Alton, United Kingdom

Apply

Project description

Treloar Trust provides education, care, therapy, medical support and independence training to young people with physical disabilities from across the UK and overseas. The aim of Treloar Trust is to prepare these young people for adult life, giving them the confidence and skills to achieve their full potential. Treloar Trust is looking for volunteers for an 11 month volunteering placement to start on 24th August 2019. Volunteers play an important role in helping the students engage in the full range of activities on offer by providing creative, practical and motivational support. Volunteers support either in Treloar School, Treloar College or in the therapies department. Volunteers in the School or College will support the tutor groups in a range of different educational, creative and sports sessions. Volunteers in the therapies departments will support the staff with arranging and delivering physiotherapy, speech and language or occupational therapy sessions for students.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers are accommodated together on-site at Treloar Trust, although separately from the students. Each volunteer has their own bedroom. Treloar Trust is on the outskirts of Alton, which is a market town in Southern England. Treloar Trust is a 20 minute walk from the town which has a transport links to other nearby towns. The volunteers will be provided with food in the canteen for all of their meals during term time and during the holidays they will be provided with a food allowance. The canteen offers a choice of meals and can cater to a variety of requirements.

Training during the project

Volunteers are provided with training by the coordinating organisation on arrival to the UK which includes intercultural learning, linguistic support, practical information, etc. They are also provided with evaluation training at the mid-term point and at the end of the placement. At the Treloar Trust volunteers have a comprehensive induction to introduce them to the work of the centre, its procedures and policies. They initially shadow staff members while they become familiar with their role and they receive training in any aspect of the role for which it is required.

Volunteer profile

The Treloar Trust is looking volunteers who are keen to work with young adults with disabilities and motivated to share their time and enthusiasm with others. They are looking for volunteers with a reasonable level of English as many of the students at the centre have communication difficulties. The volunteer positions would be well suited to people who are keen to share their time and interests with young people with disabilities, those who are interested in learning more about specialist education in the UK or therapies.

Placement dates

A total of 49 week(s) during the period 24/08/2019 to 25/07/2020

Placement location

Alton

Looking for volunteers from

Denmark, Germany, Finland, Italy, Spain, Czech Republic

Placement topics

Health and wellbeing

Education and training

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 26/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 71: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11842_en


United Learning 2019 - Volunteering at the Orpheus Centre

The Orpheus Centre

Godstone, United Kingdom

Apply

Project description

The Orpheus Centre is an inclusive, residential, performing arts centre founded by entertainer and musician Richard Stigloe in 1998. The Orpheus Centre provides opportunities for personal development through the performing arts and other learning experiences for young adults with disabilities so that they can make informed choices about the future and gain skills to enable them to live more independently in the community. The Centre offers sessions in a wide range of activities including music, drama, dance, visual arts, music technology, song writing, numeracy, budgeting, logistics, etc. The Orpheus Centre is looking for volunteers for an 11 month volunteering placement to start at the end of August 2019. Volunteers play an important role at the Orpheus Centre in helping the students engage in the full range of activities on offer and achieve an independent lifestyle by providing creative, practical and motivational support.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers are accommodated at the centre. The accommodation is separate from that of the students and is shared with the other volunteers. Each volunteer has their own bedroom. The centre is in a very rural location and there is limited public transport from the centre. The centre is a 20-25 minute walk from the nearest village, Godstone. Volunteers need to be prepared to live in the countryside. Volunteers are provided with a weekly allowance for food costs. Volunteers then buy and prepare their own food.

Training during the project

Volunteers are provided with training by the coordinating organisation on arrival to the UK which includes intercultural learning, linguistic support, practical information, etc. They are also provided with evaluation training at the mid-term point and at the end of the placement. At the Orpheus Centre volunteers have a comprehensive induction to introduce them to the work of the centre, its procedures and policies. They initially shadow staff members while they become familiar with their role and they receive training in any aspect of the role for which it is required.

Volunteer profile

The Orpheus Centre is looking for volunteers with a strong interest in music and/or the performing arts and who are keen to share their time and interests with young adults with disabilities. The volunteers should have a reasonable level of English as many of the students at the centre have communication difficulties. The Orpheus Centre is in a rural location with limited public transport options so it is important that volunteers are happy to live in the countryside.

Placement dates

A total of 49 week(s) during the period 24/08/2019 to 24/07/2020

Placement location

Godstone

Looking for volunteers from

Denmark, Finland, Spain, Czech Republic, Italy, Germany

Placement topics

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 26/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 72: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11831_en


ESC volunteering project "Earth stories"

Društvo za sonaravno in ustvarjalno bivanje Sajan / Association for sustainable and creative living Sajan

Jakobski dol, Slovenia

Apply

Project description

“Earth stories” is an ESC volunteering project offering sustainable and creative non-formal learning opportunities for two volunteers, that will be actively involved in environmentalistic, organic farming and artistic work in Organisation, situated on permacultural and organic farm Sajan in Jakobski dol, Slovenia. We wish to welcome two enthusiastic, positive, nature-loving volunteers that will be (for a period of 3 months) actively involved in work in Organisation. The project offers a hands-on experience on the functioning of an organic homestead - helping in everyday farm activities, organising and participating in sustainable and creative workshops (permaculture, organic farming, clay, pottery, wood).

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

For the volunteers we will provide a private living space next to the house (place with two beds for two volunteers, little-kitchen, solar shower and compost toilets). Household appliances which are needed (washing machine, dryer, vacuum cleaner, etc.) are located in the main house and can be used by everyone. Along with accommodation, we will also offer a healthy organic food, on wish of the volunteer food can be self-prepared. In frame of the project each volunteer is entitled to receive monthly pocket money and travel expenses.

Training during the project

pre-departure training on-arrival training on-line linguistic support natural building eco-art

Volunteer profile

We wish to welcome two enthusiastic, positive, nature-loving volunteers; interested in eco-farming, environmentalism, eco-art

Suomen luonnonsuojeluliitto (Finnish Association for Nature Conservation)

Helsinki, Finland

Apply

Project description

PLEASE DO NOT SEND AN AUTOMATIC MESSAGE "THAT YOU ARE INTERESTED" BUT SEND CV AND MOTIVATION LETTER TO STEVEN.VANHOLME@SLL.FI EKOenergy is an international not-for-profit ecolabel for sustainable renewable energy. We are hosted by the Finnish Association for Nature Conservation and are active in over 40 countries. We welcome new 3 EVS volunteers to help us promote renewable energy in Germany, Italy and Russia. The project activities include setting up climate change campaigns, contacting energy consumers, writing articles,... Other tasks include general support of the EKOenergy secretariat, social media...  All tasks happen from our office in Helsinki (The office is hosted by the Finnish Association for Nature Conservation, Suomen luonnonsuojeluliitto). The volunteers will cooperate with about 6 other volunteers, from 6 countries.  For more information see also http://www.ekoenergy.org/volunteers-and-trainees-welcome/.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation: volunteers get a private room in an apartment shared with students.   Volunteers also get money to buy food, a bus ticket for transportation within Helsinki, language course, health insurance and EVS pocket money.   Travel: we pay the travel from your home country to Finland (and return)

Training during the project

Pre-arrival training by the sending organisation  - On arrival training organised by the Finnish national EVS Agency - Information on the electricity market  - Webinars about climate change and climate policy

Volunteer profile

PLEASE DO NOT SEND AN AUTOMATIC MESSAGE "THAT YOU ARE INTERESTED" BUT SEND CV AND MOTIVATION LETTER TO STEVEN.VANHOLME@SLL.FI We are looking for 3 volunteers, 1 from Germany, 1 from Italy and 1 from Russia. The volunteers will be part of the young and dynamic EKOenergy team. They should be eager and enthusiastic to promote nature-friendly renewable energy. We are looking for team players, interested in initiating and managing own activities and sub-projects.

Building together, living together in Luxembourg and Greater Region

Maison des Associations asbl

Itzig, Luxembourg

Apply

Project description

Maison des Associations (a non-profit organisation) develops intercultural and intergenerational projects in Luxembourg in the aim of integration (48% of foreigners). The volunteer helps us with everyday tasks and is involved in the organisation of our activities: literary events, culinary activities, “Café des Âges” (intergenerational debates), “Café des Langues” (language cafés), fairs, promotion of diversity and living together, hosting of refugees, etc. He/she also establishes contact with partners for our events, helps us with their promotion (for example, designing the flyers) and contributes to project development with his/her creativity. The volunteer also takes part in promoting the association: updating the website and social networks, preparing and sending our monthly newsletter. Within the association, there are also other projects in which the volunteer can take part. The volunteer can also develop a personal project or a project in collaboration with other volunteers.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will live in a house with other European volunteers and/or students in the city of Luxembourg. The transport arrangements to Luxembourg will be provided by the coordinating organisation. The local transports will be payed with the subsistance money (it is however important to notice that transports in Luxembourg will be free from March 2020).

Training during the project

On-arrival and mid-term trainings will be organized by the National Agency in Luxembourg. Other relevant trainings might be offered to the volunteer during his/her activity period.

Volunteer profile

Our activities combine both administrative work in an office and events outside. We work with people from different social backgrounds and with different origins or nationalities. Therefore, the volunteer must be open-minded and curious, creative and reactive. Luxembourg is a multilingual country. The working language in Maison des Associations is French. Therefore, it is a great advantage for the volunteer to be able to express himself or herself in that language and, if possible, in at least another foreign language (English, German, Italian, Spanish, Portuguese…).

Placement dates

A total of 54 week(s) during the period 15/09/2019 to 14/09/2020

Placement location

20, rue de Contern, 5955 Itzig

Estonia

SOCIAL COHESION AMONG SYRIAN AFGHAN AND TURKISH COMMUNITIES

GEGED

Şahinbey/Gaziantep, Turkey

Apply

Project description

GEGED is a Youth NGO located in Gaziantep Turkey which is providing non formal learning opportunities and integration activities for kids, teenagers and youngsters of disadvantaged families, refugees and aslyum seekers. We need volunteers for our youth events and social works that GEGED implements together with the social centres, community centres and youth centres in the city. There are 350.000 migrants from Syria and Afghanistan who needs a lot of effort for education and social cohesion and it is only possible with youthwork and NGO's hand. Since 2007 we have hosted more than a thousand volunteers and we need more in 2019 and 2020. Gaziantep is a town with 2 Million inhabitant and hossting many refugees in need. Thats why we need volunteers to make a change and help their education and social needs throuh youthworks and non formal learning sessions, games, arts and youth meetings. We also organise activities for orphans and lokemia kids.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

GEGED is located in an historical typical house with bedrooms, kitchen, garden, offices, a hall, with all furniture, central heating, wifi and laundry. We deliver food money to volunteers and they shop-cook together in the kitchen with all equipment. All the activities are nearby and walking distances. incase a an activity takes place ina far distance then we provide a minibus or public transport. For more details you can ask for an infopack by email to aliaslanozaslan@gmail.com

Training during the project

Our volunteers are involved in non formal trainings which will help them to find a good method while working with specific target groups and they also learn ice breakers, energisers, team building activities etc. And we provide Turkish Language Lessons by our local staff or volunteers.

Volunteer profile

Volunteers who are motivated to take part in a large group of young people and help the organisation of learning activities for Syrian Afghan and Turkish people are all welcome. No need to be professional in teaching or youthworks. A volunteering spirit is enough for find a place in our teams. Gaziantep is a cosy and original anaotlian city in south east of Turkey so everybody will fell in love with this town and have a great and safe experience. More information will be in the infopack.

2 EVS for 3 months : Thailand and Indonesia

Java, Indonesia

Apply

Project description

The WORLD EXCHANGE 2 project wants to combine the European Youth Exchange model with the Asian Work Camp model, in order to exchange good practices among partners. Youngsters involved in the project will gain knowledge about how to organise and manage a youth exchange from different point of views and will have the opportunity to put it in practice by organising a youth exchange in Asia themselves. The main activities selected volunteers/participants will join are the following: 1) Participation in the Training course in France (21 May - 04 June 2019). 2) Participation in the Youth Exchange in Portugal (07 - 21 September 2019). 3) Participation in the European Voluntary Service in Asia (December - February 2020). We are looking for 2 French volunteers, one for Thailand and one for Indonesia. Website: https://youthexchanges.org/youth-exchange/2019-call-for-world-exchange-2/

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accomodation, food and transport are provided by the project.

Training during the project

The project provides a training course in France (21 May - 04 June 2019), with the aim of: strengthening the knowledge and capacities of youngsters and NGOs in organising youth exchanges in Europe and Asia; promoting cooperation, networking and peer-learning activities fostering efficient management, internationalisation and leadership of youth work organisations.

Volunteer profile

Age 18 – 30; Commitment to the project idea; Commitment to each phase of the planned involvement of volunteers; High motivation and interest for the topic; Interest in the themes of volunteering, non-formal learning, Erasmus+ projects, cultural diversity; Intermediate knowledge of English (mandatory); Able to work in a team and share private spaces; Open-minded and easy going; Positive attitude and proactivity.

Project 78: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11723_en


Boys’ and Girls’ Clubs of Wales

Boys and Girls Clubs of Wales

Cardiff, United Kingdom

Apply

Project description

Boys' and Girls' Clubs of Wales is a registered charity which offers help and support to youth clubs/groups/sports clubs, offering constructive youth projects, sporting opportunities, training, advice on funding and lots more. Boys’ and Girls’ Club is looking for 2 volunteers to help support and develop their work at their office based in the lovely Cardiff. The volunteers will be involved in different areas but focusing on communication including social media, promotion and marketing and will be involved in workshops and other activities for young people. Main tasks: -Work with other members of the staff team to promote opportunities offered by Boys and Girls Clubs of Wales and their wider network: -Support the Boys' and Girls' Club and the wider network connect Cymru in their social media work -Support the staff team on events, activities and projects

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will live centrally in Cardiff with other ESC volunteers in a shared house. Each person will have their own bedroom and will share kitchen, bathroom and living room. An amount of approximately £255 will be paid once a month for food and pocket money.

Volunteer profile

BGC is looking for a volunteer with an interest in arts/sports and media/digital communication. It is vital that the volunteer be able and willing to work on his or her own initiative and use her or his own ideas for inclusion in the project. Experience of working with young people and in communications may be useful but is not our foremost criteria. Experience with social media & of promotions will also be considered an asset. APPLICATION: please go to http://www.unaexchange.org/walesevs/ . Fill in the specific application form and send it to evscoordinator@unaexchange.org with your CV

Placement dates

A total of 49 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/07/2020

Placement location

Crane House, Rover Way, CF10 4US Cardiff

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Italy, Spain, Belgium, Germany, France, Estonia, Czech Republic

Placement topics

Health and wellbeing

Education and training

Physical education and sport

Placement deadline

Project 79: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11722_en


Super Heroes Volunteers

Fundacja CampoSfera

Sędziszów, Poland

Apply

Project description

Project: "Super Heroes Volunteers" it's a long-term volunteering where we combine activities for nature with the help of the local community. In this project you can become a super hero!Tasksfor the whole team of 8 volunteers: 1. Work connected with the local community - organizing small fests in the whole region-the volunteers will use the EuroCan to reach small places; - organizing meetings and workshops in schools and kindergartens; 2. Work connected with the Foundation’s building and area around. - taking care of the permaculture garden; - organizing the area according to the season; - works connected with some finishing work in the building; - creative mnual work. 3. Helping with the events organized and hosted by the Foundation. 4. Pursue your own ideas and passions

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will be accommodated in two rooms (max. 2 person in one room) in the ex-school building owned by the Foundation (2nd floor). They will have access to bathroom with showers, a toilet and a kitchen to prepare meals. Volunteers will be provided with food allowance and they will cook their own meals. Additionally, each volunteer will receive pocket money+additional money for weekend leisure travel. Altogether around 800 PLN montly. Travel expences to the project and back will be reimbursed.

Training during the project

Foundation CampoSfera offers volunteers knowledge and skills such as: - gardening, - handcraft work: furniture renovation, working with wood, upcyling, - making and baking bread, making home-made preserves, etc. - working and living in a small community, - working with youth and children from rural areas, - knowledge and methods of leading workshops, - public speaking, - knowledge of organizing international projects, such as youth exchanges, - knowledge in organizing events such as small festivals, outdoor cinema, etc. - Polish language - working in international environment

Volunteer profile

The volunteers we would like to host should, first of all, be willing to live and work in the rural area and not be afraid of physical and outdoor works. We would especially welcome people who are interested in natural sciene,protected environment, working with the small local community in rural areas (especially kids and youth). Our main concern is that the volunteers will find the project interesting, personally developing, fruitful it terms of knowledge and skills and simply satisfying. In our opinion, people with the above mentioned features and interest would feel most fulfilled.

Placement dates

A total of 34 week(s) during the period 01/04/2019 to 30/11/2019

Placement location

Klimontów 31, 31, 28-340 Sędziszów

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Project description

UNA Exchange is looking for 2 ESC volunteers. The placements will be based in our offices in Cardiff together with staff members and local volunteers. The two ESC volunteers will work very closely together on this placement and tasks will be divided according to their interest and motivation. The volunteers will focus on communication (online and offline), creating/ maintaining our Alumni Network and help us to tell the story of UNA Exchange, to highlight our impact and increase transparency. Main tasks Help with UNA Exchange communication (offline and online). Engage with current, previous and potential volunteers Story telling - Tell the story of UNA Exchange and its impact. Capture case studies and impact stories, creatively visualised through photos, videos, blogs, social media. Other tasks Help promote the work of UNA Exchange: talk to young people about international volunteering opportunities and develop presentations and, possibly, workshops, for specific groups.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will live centrally in Cardiff with other ESC volunteers in a shared house. Each person will have their own bedroom and will share kitchen, bathroom and living room. An amount of approximately £255 will be paid once a month for food and pocket money.

Project description

PROJECT NAME: "Ready for corps in Biella". ACTIVITY: in social field - detailed description of activities here: http://www.galileoprogetti.hu/hirek.html. VOLUNTEER: 1 volunteer from HUNGARY.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

LIVING CONDITIONS: Volunteers will live in cohousing in a flat in the center of Biella, in double room, with wifi, bus-stop some metres from the door, all services in the city very close. MONTHLY ALLOWANCE: around 150€ pocket money + 160€ food money. Lunch on service days is provided at the service office. LOCAL TRANSPORT: At the arrival volunteer will receive some tickets for bus and in a few days will receive a monthly card for the bus, that connects Biella with the place of service. Possibility to receive a bicycle for all project period also.

Training during the project

OLS online Italian language course in Italian class. Opportunity to participate in Italian class two times a week.
