Project 82: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11708_en


Activity Assistant at UWC Red Cross Nordic

UWC Red Cross Nordic, Stiftinga Røde Kors Nordiske United World College

Flekke, Norway

Apply

Project description

UWC Red Cross Nordic is always working towards providing opportunities for youth irrespective of race, religion, nationality and social standing. Through this project we wish to provide a young adult with the opportunity for work training and exposure to the inter cultural environment at the College through volunteering alongside professional staff, setting up and leading extra academic activities for youth from around 90 different countries. The outdoor department at the school focus on experiential learning through the outdoors and aim to expose the volunteer to the benefits of this type of learning. Many early school leavers or youth that are marginalized in society often responds better to this "way" of learning and through this we expect the volunteer to find out more about him/her self and to gain confidence as he/she develops skills in interacting/leading activities and groups as well as practical outdoor skills.

Training during the project

In house training for relevant activities and tasks. Participants in the project will by the end of the project have acquired basic outdoor skills and dependent on their interests, specialist skills in one or more of the following activities; canoe, kayak, archery, climbing, team building but also in leading and facilitating youth activities.

Volunteer profile

Participants should be interested in people and the outdoors/being active in the outdoors. No prior skills are required and we favor participants who face some sort of challenge (in particular social, economic or educational), though seek to select those who can live independently and manage the absolute basics of a working life and who can become completely independent through support and guidance.

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 12/08/2019 to 12/08/2020

Placement location

6968 Flekke

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Finland, Ireland, France, Iceland, Italy, Malta, United Kingdom, Sweden, Hungary, Romania, Greece, Slovakia

Placement topics

Health and wellbeing

Education and training

Physical education and sport

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 01/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 83: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11699_en


Aid for a Sustainable Future

Tools For Solidarity

Belfast, United Kingdom

Apply

Project description

Tools For Solidarity is an environmental and development organisation run by volunteers. Our EVS volunteers will be encouraged and facilitated to be active in all aspects of the work of the organisation from tool refurbishment to administration, management and promotional work. We are looking for volunteers to take part in tool and sewing machine refurbishment for people, communities and projects in some of the poorest countries to enable them to improve the quality of their lives It is crucial for TFS to have volunteers who take an interest in getting involved in the work of different sub-groups, such as our publicity team and Education for Sustainable Development team, delivering an education programme in local primary schools TFS works with between 15-20 supported volunteers - people with disabilities, refugees and those facing social exclusion. in our workshops in Belfast and Downpatrick. We need people who can communicate with and supervise the work for them.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will share a house with other volunteers from TFS. He/she will have his/her own room and share kitchen, living rooms and bathroom. Lunch will be provided on workdays. The volunteer must share in cooking( vegetarian) and cleaning in the house The volunteer must pay for his/her other meals from the allowance they receive (approximately 310 Euro every 4 weeks - £268). . Each volunteer receives a bicycle for their own use. The distance from the accommodation to the workplace is about 30 minutes by bicycle.

Training during the project

The volunteer will receive an induction in the first week. It covers the aim/ethos of the organisation and practical conditions to help the volunteer to integrate into the local community. Each volunteer receives training and support from the volunteer coordinator in areas of work involving organisational/administrative duties. Our workshop manager is responsible for providing overall task related support to all volunteers involved in sewing machine and tool work. Additional training will be provided to the volunteers who decide to get involved in the work of our sub-groups.

Volunteer profile

Tools For Solidarity works well if the volunteers are happy and committed to be there. Therefore motivation and commitment are the key elements that are essential for the organisation. The volunteers are not required to have any previous experience in using or fixing tools and sewing machines - though it is useful. But they should be open to learn new skills and to question their own relationship to sustainability. We particularly welcome applications from volunteers with fewer opportunities

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 30/04/2021

Placement location

55a Sunnyside St, BT73EX Belfast

Looking for volunteers from

Italy, Spain, Greece, Finland, Liechtenstein, Belgium, Austria, France, Croatia, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Denmark, Germany, Czech Republic, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Netherlands, Norway, Poland

Placement topics

Social challenges

Environment and natural protection

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 02/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 84: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11695_en


Understand the world from individual creation to collective expression

CEMEA Mayotte

Mamoudzou, France

Apply

Project description

In order to develop an efficient society project for Mayotte and respond to the lack of perspective of its youth, CEMEA Mayotte operate throughout 4 sectors: voluntary and professional animation, social, school and territorial support. The volunteer will work to the benefit of all these sectors - and therefore with their different audiences - on the theme of media awareness raising and/or media creation. For example: create films with young people, conduct local advocacy on social issues known by the territory, support webradio, lead media awareness workshops/GAFAM ... The main objective of this project is to work on the worldview of young people affected by the volunteer activities: this one-year volunteer journey aims to develop openness to the world through collaborative creation but also through social commitment of volunteer as well as of the youth in Mayotte to promote their inclusion in society "to know and make themselves known".

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

According to volunteer's wish and availability of accommodation, s-he can be accommodated in the Centre for Young People in Inclusion and Vocational Training (close to Mayotte's capital), in a cottage in Kani Kéli or at a colleague local house. There is no public transport on the island: the volunteer will travel with their colleagues (carpooling) or in collective taxis, many on the island. S-he will receive weekly food money (42€) & pocket/transport money (49€) for a total of 390€/month for daily life. The volunteer will work from Monday to Friday and will have two days off per month.

Training during the project

Our association will provide the volunteer first aid training (PSC1 in french) and the National Youth Worker Qualification training (BAFA) to capitalize the skills s-he has or plan to get; the BAFA enables animators to offer youth quality educational activities. S-he will also get trainings provided by European Commision. Depending on their interests, the volunteer will also be able to participate in workshops of meetings and thematic activities (games, rights, educational films). In addition, tutors and supervisors will use active education methods for a continuous training of volunteer.

Volunteer profile

The volunteer must be open, curious and motivated to engage in cultural, socio-educational and/or artistic activities with Mayotte's youth. S-he must have a background in creating communication tools: visual (videos, art activism ...), auditive (radio, music ...) or both. In view of today’s digital stakes, he has to be aware of GAFAs’ dangers and of the importance of communicating on these issues. If you like to create innovative communication tools with young people and at the service of their emancipation, including from the GAFAs domination, this mission is for you!!

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/07/2019 to 30/09/2020

Placement location

Rue du Stade Kavani, Maison des associations, 97600 Mamoudzou

Looking for volunteers from

Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Spain, Greece, Germany, Luxembourg, Slovenia, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 06/05/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 85: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11694_en


From creation to expression at the Youth Support and Listening Center

CEMEA Mayotte

Mamoudzou, France

Apply

Project description

Based on their experience with Mayotte's youth, CEMEA opened a Youth Support and Listening Center (PAEJ in french) in 2015 to promote their access to autonomy. The PAEJ team is staffed by educators and animators trained in receiving/listening to young people with fewer opportunities and their families. While collective actions have been developed, few have focused on art, which is a formidable tool for expression and emancipation. The volunteer's mission would thus be to lead, with those young people, projects around creation. For example: creation of frescoes, posters or games, animation of artistic workshops, street animation around theatre... The main objective of this project is to work on the worldview of young people affected by the volunteer activities: this one-year volunteer journey aims to develop openness to the world through collaborative creation but also through social commitment of volunteer as well as of the youth in Mayotte to promote their inclusion in society.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

According to volunteer's wish and availability of accommodation, s-he can be accommodated in the Centre for Young People in Inclusion and Vocational Training (close to Mayotte's capital), in a cottage in Kani Kéli or at a colleague local house. There is no public transport on the island: the volunteer will travel with their colleagues (carpooling) or in collective taxis, many on the island. S-he will receive weekly food money (42€) & pocket/transport money (49€) for a total of 390€/month for daily life. The volunteer will work from Monday to Friday and will have two days off per month.

Training during the project

Our association will provide the volunteer first aid training (PSC1 in french) and the National Youth Worker Qualification training (BAFA) to capitalize the skills s-he has or plan to get; the BAFA enables animators to offer youth quality educational activities. S-he will also get trainings provided by European Commision. Depending on their interests, the volunteer will also be able to participate in workshops of meetings and thematic activities (games, rights, educational films). In addition, tutors and supervisors will use active education methods for a continuous training of volunteer.

Volunteer profile

The volunteer must be curious and motivated to carry out artistic/plastic activities with young people with fewer opportunities in Mayotte. His-her missions will not be frozen but open to initiatives that s-he would propose and for which planning will be adapted. S-he must have a minimum of experience in visual practice or artistic expression. It would be interesting if the volunteer had a minimum of knowledge on art history, particularly on its subversive and emancipatory aspect.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/07/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

Rue du Stade Kavani, Maison des associations, 97600 Mamoudzou

Looking for volunteers from

Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Spain, Greece, Germany, Luxembourg, Slovenia, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 06/05/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 86: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11682_en


ESC : Creativity 4 Sociability, Romania

romania, Romania

Apply

Project description

Creativity 4 Sociability is the 3rd project of hosting 4 European volunteers in Constanta, Romania, by Association for Promoting Creative&Eco Education and Innovative Abilities Objectives: Increase awareness of the bullying phenomenon in the real and space, among 4 European volunteers and young people from at least 3 institutions in Constanta (high school, day care center, center for blind people). Developing assertiveness and encouraging social activism for 4 EVS volunteers and at least 250 Constanta youngsters. Increase the level of information of young people from at least 3 high schools in Constanta and ­­­for the partner organizations regarding the volunteering activities and the opportunities of the Erasmus + KA1 program.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Travel reimbursement from his/her home place till Constanta, Romania and back; Pocket money; 2 days/month holiday; Mentoring support; Complete meal & accommodation, city transportation, phone & internet allowance. The project is funded by Erasmus+ Volunteering Activities program.

Training during the project

Activities, 6 hours daily: Creative workshops (upcycling art and hand craft activities) with 7-14 year-olds from the Day Care Centre. Theatre workshops fighting discrimination. Assertive training by means of non formal methods and games, for high school students. Various non-formal activities to promote volunteering in the community, including promotion during festivals. Work in hosting NGO in all administrative issues: writing projects, PR, organize community actions etc.

Volunteer profile

– age between 18-30; – Motivated for creative activities (hand craft, theater, games) and having a playful attitude; – Willing to facilitate activities for children and teenagers; – Having a volunteering attitude, being open minded, willing to learn how to be assertive and accept challenges to meet a new culture in a new community; – Taking care about environment, respect the limited resources of the planet; – Willing to learn and work in an NGO in all administrative issues. – Knowing English.

Placement dates

A total of 17 week(s) during the period 01/04/2019 to 31/07/2019

Placement location

romania

Looking for volunteers from

Spain

Placement topics

Education and training

Creativity and culture

“FREE- Focus Resources on Education and Enviornment”, Latvia

Latvia, Latvia

Apply

Project description

Ikšķile Free school is looking for European Solidarity Corps volunteers for an approved project “FREE- Focus Resources on Education and Enviornment”. Project takes place in an alternative school “Ikšķile Free school” for 10 months. 2 positions available : 1 teacher’s assistants and 1 assistant in permaculture garden.Ikšķile Free school is a school established and managed by parents. Values of the school are freedom, nature, community and Latvian traditions. Teachers’ assistants in the school will assist teachers in pre-school and teaching classes (sports, music, language classes) and extraculrriculum activities (woodworks) for school children, assist children in developing household and self-care skills. Volunteers will help to introduce more sustainable practises in school and develop their own activities, for example, play traditional games of their country, teach some songs or phrase in their language, organise events and carry out initiatives.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Erasmus+ is covering 100% of the project.

Training during the project

Assistant in the permaculture garden will assist in developing seed library, organize educational activities on biological diversity and principles of permaculture, plan and develop permaculture garden in the school, assist in organic shop hosted by school. Project in a small town youth center, a place youngsters call their second home, are searching for two volunteers for a year full of new experiences.

Open for 18 up to 30 years old

Project description

The first volunteering service of the Start ESC project will take place for 4 months with the participation of 6 volunteers from 3 European countries (1.04.2019 – 31.07.2019). The implementation of the service will take place in Romania, Drăgășani municipality and its suroundings in the community where APDD operates. All activities of the project are based on and promote solidarity.The calendar of activities will include: • Preparing activities for the ESC volunteers at the beginning and during the service; • Activities of familiarizing and accommodating the volunteers; • Activities of adapting to the local community and intercultural knowledge; • Organizing and carrying out at least 2 times / week: Workshops on the main themes of the project: Promoting volunteering, employability, entrepreneurship, inclusion with local partners (eg schools, colleges, faculties, libraries).

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

How much ? Erasmus+ is covering 100% of the project.

Training during the project

Activities duration : will be within 35 hours / week. The volunteers will receive Youthpass certificates at the end of their European Solidarity Corps service issued by the APDD (host organization). In their activities, the ESC participants will interact with various social categories mainly young people in order to meet their needs for social inclusion, inclusion on the labor market as well as on learning (pupils, students), children (including kindergartens stimulating their orientation towards study and future career), as well as decision-makers

Volunteer profile

ESC in Alternative Education Schools in Poland (long term)

poland, Poland

Apply

Project description

The main idea of the project: using non formal education and active methods in free education institutions – Free Democratic School, Wild School and Montessori & Waldorf School to make the volunteer contribute to the development and grow of the pupils. The project provides volunteer the opportunity to gain professional experience in organizing learning non-formal activities in alternative approach – nature connection, ecology, NVC (Nonviolent Communication) and others democratic values. Volunteer will participate in creative educational activities, various development groups, outdoor sport, active trainings, cultural and artistic events, meetings, exhibitions, outdoor trips, language classes.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Erasmus+ is covering 100% of the project.

Training during the project

Volunteers will be involved in the day to day life of the school, especially: – taking active part in a daily life of our community – supporting the children in community in following the school rules – organization of active and creative activities with pupils in accordance with personal skills, interests and passions using non-formal methods – co-organization and participating in outdoor events – support to the teachers and educators in taking care of the kids – creating own educational projects which are part of an Volunteers’ learning process ...

Volunteer profile

age: 18 – 30 years old – socially active, eager to work for local community, communicative and ready to face challenges that internationalcooperation brings – motivated, eager to take initiatives, open minded, flexible – empathic, patient, able to show friendliness and comprehension for the youth, – motivated to improve language skills and learn new languages – openly expressing opinions, open to new experiences, showing own initiativeness – artistic & creative skills (painting/drawing, dancing, singing) highly appreciated – need to show interest in deeply democratic, alternative education ..

poland

Project 90: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11655_en


SMILE & GO in Francia - 2 mesi

Pistes-Solidaires

Pau, France

Apply

Project description

SMILE & GO è un progetto di Servizio Volontario Europeo (SVE) coordinato dal CEMEA del Mezzogiorno onlus che permette a 30 giovani tra i 18 ed i 30 anni residenti in Italia di fare una esperienza di apprendimento all'estero in organizzazioni no profit che operano nel campo dell'animazione socio-culturale in Bulgaria, Croazia, Francia, Portogallo, Romania, Regno Unito, Slovenia e Spagna. Uno dei progetti in partenza a Luglio 2019: quello in Francia, presso l'organizzazione Pistes-Solidaires. Il campo principale d’azione è quello della promozione dell’educazione non formale. Tra le attività previste: -Attività legate all’Europa e alle culture europee -Promozione delle opportunità offerte dal Programma Europeo Erasmus+ -Supporto ad eventi e campagne di informazione sull'Europa, la diversità europea e la cittadinanza Per saperne di più: https://www.progettosmile.eu/vuoi-partire/pistes-solidaires/

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Alloggio: in un appartamento, condiviso con altri volontari. Il volontario avrà una camera condivisa (2 persone / camera); la cucina ed il bagno condivisi con altri volontari. Il viaggio andata e ritorno verrà rimborsato fino all'ammontare massimo di 275 euro. Ogni volontario riceverà un budget per il vitto, oltre al pocket money mensile.

Training during the project

I volontari saranno supportati e guidati dall'organizzazione di accoglienza durante le attività.

Volunteer profile

Il progetto è rivolto a giovani tra i 18 ed i 30 anni, residenti in Italia. Ai volontari non è richiesta alcuna competenza specifica nel campo, né la conoscenza della lingua del paese di accoglienza. I requisiti più importanti sono l’interesse per la tematica del progetto e la motivazione a mettersi in gioco in un’esperienza di apprendimento in un contesto interculturale. 20 posti e la partecipazione ai laboratori locali Comp-pass a Roma sono riservati prioritariamente a giovani della Regione Lazio che non studiano, non lavorano e non frequentano corsi di formazione professionale.

Placement dates

A total of 8 week(s) during the period 03/07/2019 to 30/08/2019

Placement location

3, rue de Livron, 64000 Pau

Looking for volunteers from

Italy

Placement topics

Education and training

Employment and entrepreneurship

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 14/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 91: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11650_en


SMILE & GO in Croazia - 6 mesi

Udruga IKS

Petrinja, Croatia

Apply

Project description

SMILE & GO è un progetto di Servizio Volontario Europeo (SVE) coordinato dal CEMEA del Mezzogiorno onlus che permette a 30 giovani tra i 18 ed i 30 anni residenti in Italia di fare una esperienza di apprendimento all'estero in organizzazioni no profit che operano nel campo dell'animazione socio-culturale in Bulgaria, Croazia, Francia, Portogallo, Romania, Regno Unito, Slovenia e Spagna. Uno dei progetti in partenza ad Aprile 2019: quello in Croazia, presso l'organizzazione IKS. I volontari coopereranno tra di loro, con l’organizzazione ospitante e con scuole e altre realtà locali per promuovere la cittadinanza attiva, lo scambio interculturale, la cultura ed l’apprendimento non formale attraverso attività rivolte a giovani, bambini e a tutta la comunità locale: - Laboratori creativi e attività ludiche per bambini - Condividere la propria cultura con i membri della comunità locale - Azioni e materiali promozionali per promuovere il dialogo interculturale e la mobilità giovanile

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Alloggio: in un appartamento, condiviso con altri volontari. Il volontario avrà una camera condivisa (2 persone / camera); la cucina ed il bagno condivisi con altri volontari. Il viaggio andata e ritorno verrà rimborsato fino all'ammontare massimo di 180 euro. Ogni volontario riceverà un budget per il vitto, oltre al pocket money mensile.

Training during the project

Il volontario/a sarà supporto/a e guidato/a dall'organizzazione di accoglienza durante le attività. Il volontario/a parteciperà alla formazione all'arrivo organizzata dall'Agenzia Nazionale Croata.

Volunteer profile

Il progetto è rivolto a giovani tra i 18 ed i 30 anni, residenti in Italia. Ai volontari non è richiesta alcuna competenza specifica nel campo, né la conoscenza della lingua del paese di accoglienza. I requisiti più importanti sono l’interesse per la tematica del progetto e la motivazione a mettersi in gioco in un’esperienza di apprendimento in un contesto interculturale.

Placement dates

A total of 25 week(s) during the period 03/06/2019 to 29/11/2019

Placement location

Turkulinova 9, 44250 Petrinja

Looking for volunteers from

Italy

Placement topics

Education and training

Employment and entrepreneurship

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 14/04/2019

EVS IN MUZEUM VYSOČINY PELHŘIMOV

Muzeum Vysociny Pelhrimov, prispevkova organizace

Pelhrimov, Czech Republic

Apply

Project description

The museum is a public institution focusing on history and culture. It is specialized in scientific activities in the field of history, culture and art. Largely the museum is focused on museum education - lectures for children and youth, public lectures. The volunteer will be part of activities and assist the work according to their abilities and knowledge. The volunteer will work in an institution that focuses on the history, culture, art and museum education. They will be involved in working with historical collections, educational activities, installation of exhibitions and mainly in propagation - PR (photo, poster, blogs, social network, etc.). The following knowledge and skills are welcome and useful, but not a condition of selection, as volunteers can learn and gain these knowledge and skills during EVS: - work with a camera and use a program for editing photos and making graphic design - creativity and inventiveness - thoroughness and patience

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation is arranged in the students' dormitory in the individual rooms with all other equiplments for all volunteers who are hosted in Pelhrimov. Local transport is not needed and in case of activities in other venues there will be travel costs reimbursed, the volunteer will have full information about the connection or the volunteer will travel with the staff of the museum. Food: volunteers receive the food money at the beginning of the month together with the pocket money, they can cook for themselves, they receive the information about lunch in the canteen and places to eat out.

Volunteer profile

Tasks for the volunteer: propagation - PR – making photo, posters, communication for blogs, social network, etc. educational activities - assisting with lectures and educational programs in the exhibition, with opportunity and space for implementation of individual activities (creative club, language lessons etc.) assistance and help to research and technical staff - manual work, installation of exhibitions, control of collections, documentation collections Please, if you are interested in EVS in the Museum, send me your cover letter to h.vondru@muzeumpe.cz

Placement dates

A total of 33 week(s) during the period 01/05/2019 to 20/12/2019

Placement location

Masarykovo namesti 12, 39301 Pelhrimov

Looking for volunteers from

Time for young people

Jugendbildungsstätte Aktionszentrum

Benediktbeuern, Germany

Apply

Project description

The youth centre Aktionszentrum (Christian organisation run by the religious congregation of the Salesians of Don Bosco) has sent and hosted many volunteers from different countries of the world. Through the project "Time for young people" we want to enable volunteering commitment at two different levels: working with children aged 3-6 and working with young people aged 14-18. We are looking for two volunteers, who will work in two different settings, but will be linked by a common red line, which is the commitment as European volunteers in the frame of the European solidarity corps. Both volunteers will join the activities from 1st September 2019 till 31st July 2020. One volunteer will work in the public Kindergarden of Benediktbeuern from Monday till Friday. One volunteer will be in the Don Bosco Youth Centre, working with young people between 14-18. Benediktbeuern is a small town close to the Alps in southern Bavaria.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will get single rooms in the youth centre Aktionszentrum. In this centre we already have a community of around 10 volunteers from Germany working in the youth centre and youth hostel. The volunteers can join this community and share the community rooms (kitchen and living room) with them. The volunteers will get meals in the cantine of the youth centre Aktionszentrum, according to the different time schedules. Travel costs will be reimbursed according to the SC-programme rules. Pocket money and insurance will be provided.

Training during the project

The volunteers will join the ESC-trainings (on-arrival training and mid-term meeting).

Volunteer profile

Young people between 18 and 25, with knowledge of German, interested in working with children or young people.

Placement dates

A total of 49 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/07/2020

Placement location

Don-Bosco-Str., 1, 83671 Benediktbeuern

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Malta, Netherlands

Placement topics

Education and training

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 01/05/2019

Do you want to spend 12 months in the capital of Slovakia and help people through your creativity? Who: 18-30 years old from EU countries interested in social work with people of all ages and backgrounds in the family center Where: Bratislava, Slovakia When: starting since April 2019 (12 months) Costs covered by Erasmus+: accommodation, food, pocket money, insurance, travel About the project Centrum Rodiny (website, Facebook) is a non-profit organization in Bratislava. They offer regular free-time activities, educational, counselling and social activities for the community around, for people of all ages and backgrounds. At the same time, it offers space and support for those who want to share knowledge, talents, skills and time with others. Centrum rodiny promotes volunteering and encourages the community members to be active citizens and become a positive changemaker in the society. The project is supported by European Solidarity Corps programme.

Project 96: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11598_en


EARTH RECALL

Asociatia Voluntariat Pentru Viata

MARASESTI, Romania

Apply

Project description

Earth Recall is an 8-month volunteering project which aims to raise awareness among children and young people about the globalized world they live in and their role as citizens of this world. The project involves 8 volunteers who are going to be involved in non-formal activities on the topic of Global Education, Solidarity Education, or Education for Development. Project activities will have the form of thematic workshops, organized in schools and they aim to put students in concrete and different life situations in order to understand as much as possible the idea of change in order to identify the resources needed to support and cover the needs of each. The activities will address issues of diversity and inequality, both locally and globally, thus providing an understanding of the main issues of global citizenship and responsibility. All activities will be based on non-formal education and will be achieved through an interactive approach.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will live in 2 flats in Focșani and Marasesti, in shared bedrooms, individual beds, with common area, shared cooking, washing, laundry and social facilities, free wi-fi included. Food: Volunteers will receive a monthly food allowance of 150 Euro to buy food products and cook for themselves and a monthly allowance of 90 Euro in form of “pocket money”. Transport: Volunteers are responsible for arranging their travel. The travel costs will be reimbursed at the end of the project according to the distance band limits imposed by the European Commission.

Training during the project

The volunteers will be accompanied and supported at all times during the activities by teachers from classes and they will receive training at the beginning of their stage in order to become familiar with the way the activities will be implemented. They will receive ongoing support from activity coordinators, teachers and staff of our organization. The volunteers will attend the On-Arrival Training and Mid-Term Evaluation, organized by the Romanian National Agency. The volunteers will also receive Romanian language training during the first 3 months.

Volunteer profile

Volunteers should be dynamic, creative, sociable, willing to spend time with children/youngsters and patient in working with them; Volunteers should be 18 -30 years old; They should be motivated, willing to learn Romanian, able to work in a team, flexible and open to different cultures. Volunteers should be responsible and they should have a non-discriminatory attitude. Volunteers should be motivated by this project and able to attend the full duration of the project. More info about the project and the Application form here: http://www.voluntaryforlife.ro/voluntary-in-romania/

Placement dates

A total of 36 week(s) during the period 15/10/2019 to 15/06/2020

Placement location

Nicolae Balcescu 2, 625200 MARASESTI

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 15/06/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

EcoSociety

"IRELI" Public Union

Baku, Azerbaijan

Apply

Project description

EcoSociety project is a long-term one, which in some terms will assist our society to firstly, completely realize the whole situation concerning environment and its issues not only in Azerbaijan, but also around the world; secondly, to engage youth in decreasing the certain circumambiency’s problem, making research regarding current situation in regions, writing projects and holding diverse workshops and so on.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

- We are part of the European Solidarity Corps, so your age should be 18 to 30 years. - We will provide the volunteers all their costs: one way tickets, accommodation, money for food, pocket money and visa (for countries that are necessary) - Volunteers will live in an agroturistic house with other volunteers in a shared room (2-3 volunteers in a room) in the city of Hajnówka in Podlasie, a unique region in eastern Poland with a rich history and traditions, surrounded by beautiful Białowieza forest.

Training during the project

There will be training relative to environmental issues and problems by foreign trainers

Volunteer profile

We are looking for volunteers with interest in environmental issues. Would like volunteers with an interest in community living ready to take an active part in community life. Social skills: group facilitation, organizing youth activities, social media advertising, fund-raising, project management & volunteer management. Teaching ability: any of above, NVC, conflict resolution.

Project 98: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11583_en


Il gusto della solidarietà

Buseto Palizzolo (Trapani), Italy

Apply

Project description

The project will mainly be carried out in an agritourism and educational farm. Our Volunteer will be engaged in a journey during which she will be given the opportunity to know and personally create typical local dishes, characteristic products of the Sicilian wine and food culture, techniques related to the cultivation of aromatic plants and the production of honey, oil, wine and other agricultural products. Will also be made excursions to promote the territory of Trapani, and activities with disadvantaged people. With our project, we will give the volunteers the opportunity to know and spread the Sicilian culture abroad, to increase the entrepreneurial spirit towards the gastronomic, agricultural and tourist sector, to share initiatives, expectations and reflections and to break down the psychological barriers that hinder the processes of socialization and integration.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The accommodation (only shared with a volunteer of the same sex), is equipped with entrance-living room, small room used as a kitchen, bathroom, bedroom, television and wi-fi system. The volunteer is responsible for the care and cleaning of the accommodation. Local transport, board, lodging, will not involve any expenses to be paid by the Volunteer. Every month, each volunteer will receive the pocket money, fixed by the European Commission, and a sum for food. For their movements, the volunteers will use the public service vehicles.

Training during the project

The volunteers will receive the access to Online Language Service platform to study independently Italian Language. All the activities of the project, will be carried out by encouraging the use of the Italian language. The continuous exposure to the language, will contribute to promote the gradual improvement of the expressive abilities of the volunteer.

Volunteer profile

For the implementation of the project, we will look for volunteers (from 18 to 30 years) with an open, creative, enterprising mind, strongly interested in the themes of our project, eager to work in a team, to propose initiatives and to transform - with our contribution - their experience in a valuable educational and training source, rich in knowledge and skills, expendable in the future.

Placement dates

A total of 35 week(s) during the period 28/03/2019 to 27/11/2019

Placement location

Buseto Palizzolo (Trapani)

Looking for volunteers from

Netherlands, Poland, France, Spain

Placement topics

No application deadline

Vanhamäen Hyvinvointikeskus / Vanhamäki Activity Center

Vanhamäen Hyvinvointikeskus / Vanhamäki Activity Center

Suonenjoki, Finland

Apply

Project description

The volunteer works as an assistant in Vanhamäki Activity Centre in Suonenjoki. Vanhamäki provides different kinds of activities for visitors and it also runs organic farm, horse stables and a foster home. Volunteering tasks vary according to the season: in the summer time the volunteers work more in Vanhamäki and in the autumn and spring there is more cooperation with other local organizations, such as local folk academy, association of unemployed people and a school. At Vanhamäki the volunteers assist in different kinds of tasks, both outdoors and indoors. They take part in organic farming and maintenance work. Volunteers also assist in planning and carrying out events in Vanhamäki according to their skills and interests... >>> READ MORE ABOUT THE PROJECT AND APPLYING TO IT AT https://maailmanvaihto.fi/en/volunteer-in-finland/esc-available-projects | Please note that you must download, fill in and send to evs@maailmanvaihto.fi the application form which can be found from the website!

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer is accommodated in the Vanhamäki centre in a single room, shared kitchen and bathroom facilities. Vanhamäki is situated in the countryside surroundings, by a lake. Vanhamäki also has a lunch restaurant, which is very famous of its food, using organic and local ingredients as much as possible. Volunteers are provided with breakfast, lunch, afternoon coffee and dinner in the restaurant.

Volunteer profile

It is important that the volunteer enjoys both practical and social work tasks. It is good to have an interest in organic farming and nature. Due to a tight schedule we are looking for a candidate who does not need to apply for visa or residents permit to Finland.

Project 102: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11546_en


Working for Stray Pets

Sahipsiz Hayvanları Koruma ve Yaşatma Derneği

Sinop, Turkey

Apply

Project description

We need a young vet from Italy to work in the animal shelter. The tasks of the volunteer: Working in the shelter of stray cats and dogs in Sinop and assisting the vet and the staff with their work such as treatment, surgery, check-ups, keeping the record of the stages of the illnesses and feeding. The main challenge in the shelter is to fight against Distemper, Panleukopenia and Parvoviral Enteritis. Organising adopting, fund raising and food collecting campaigns, going to rescue operations, city tours to feed the stray animals are the tasks of the volunteer outside the animal shelter. The day starts at 09:00 and ends at 15:30 in the shelter. Saturdays and Sundays are off. *** The volunteer can be called any time of the day to run to the emergency calls! In the afternoon after 15:30, the volunteer may work in a clinic where there is an X-Ray and the devices for tests in order to have more experience on diagnosis and treatment.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will share a flat with the other volunteers but they will have their own room. They will get 400 Euros for food and pocket money for 2 months. Cooking at home will be much cheaper. Volunteer will be picked up with the vehicle of the shelter, which is 10 mins away by car.

Training during the project

The volunteer will learn first-aid on cats and dogs. Since he/she is a vet, the volunteer will get more experienced on the following: o Cat and dog sterilization o Diagnosis and treatment in internal medicine o Traumatic surgery and amputation o Post-op care o Distemper, Panleukopenia and parvoviral enteritis treatment o Nursing the orphans o Daily check-up of the patients and babies o Cooking especially for the babies and the patients and feeding

Volunteer profile

We would like volunteer to be a vet student or a vet with diploma.

Placement dates

A total of 8 week(s) during the period 08/07/2019 to 04/09/2019

Placement location

Tülay Erşahin Can Dostları Yaşam Evi - Ada Mah. Sis Düdüğü Mevki - PO. Box:17, 57000 Sinop

Looking for volunteers from

Italy

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Health and wellbeing

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 31/05/2019

Romania, Romania

Apply

Project description

Volunteering starting in April, 8 months, Romania Join Nocrich Scout Centre as an EVS volunteer in Nocrich Scout Centre Make it Happen!Is an opportunity of personal development for young people where they can experience volunteering, international scouting, living in a new country and multiculturality. You will get to live in the Transylvanian village of Nocrich, located 30 km away from Sibiu where you can discover scouting, nature and enjoy a lively atmosphere together with other scouts by making your contribution to the local community while also discovering Romania and its culture. Nocrich Scout Centre organizes various scout camps, activities for the children in the village and there’s even a pottery and ceramics workshop where you can learn a new craft.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Project 104: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11521_en


PEER SOLIDARITY

Ofensiva Tinerilor

Arad, Romania

Apply

Project description

In each volunteering activity of Peer Solidarity project there will be implemented specific measures for local social transformation, that address each of the three main directions of action related to such an objective: - education: offering educational opportunities to youngsters belonging to vulnerable groups as a mean of facilitating their inclusion in society and also educating their peers to show an inclusive attitude towards them; - action: direct actions are taken in favor of the target group, either in terms of supporting the development of adequate infrastructure that they need or in facilitating their inclusion through dedicated initiatives that address them (workshops, volunteering opportunities, social activities, etc.); - inspiration: volunteers will provide direct inspiration to their peers, who can observe concrete steps that are made by others like them and positive effects of these contributions. The project is composed of 2 activity flows of 2 months each.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation: - students' dormitory, 2 persons in the same room, private bathroom, common kitchen with everything needed for preparing food, washing machine, refrigerator, wifi; Food: - volunteers will prepare their own food; Monthly allowance: - volunteers will receive every month food money and pocket money; Transportation: - international travel for the beginning and end of stage is fully covered withing the budget set by the European Union for such projects; - local transportation is fully covered by the coordinating/hosting organisation.

Training during the project

Participants will benefit from: - introductory training arranged by the coordinator upon the arrival of volunteers; - on-arrival training arranged by the National Agency of Romania and non-formal education training arranged by the coordinator through a certified trainer.

Volunteer profile

- Between 18-30 years old; - Resident of the sending country; - Interested in the theme of the project; - Willing to participate in an non-formal intercultural experience; - Having difficulties in choosing a career; - NEET youngsters; - Without employment options due to lack of practical experience; Fewer opportunities; - Youngsters from: Italy, Spain, Romania and Turkey.

Placement dates

A total of 9 week(s) during the period 01/05/2019 to 01/07/2019

Placement location

no. 43, bl. 207, Mioritei street, 310123 Arad

Looking for volunteers from

Romania, Italy, Spain

Placement topics

Social challenges

Education and training

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 01/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 105: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11517_en


Bildungscampus an der Rothleimmühle

Bildungscampus an der Rothleimmühle

Nordhausen, Germany

Apply

Project description

The Project "Rothleimmühle " is a youth guesthouse and educational home. Different groups such as school classes, children's and youth groups undertake educational activities (photo safari, climbing, night walks ....) and stay overnight in the guesthouse. The work is based on the "Gut Drauf" concept, which includes healthy eating, experiences in nature and stress management. In addition, topics such as the environment, music or creativity are part of the youth guesthouse. In total, the house has 130 beds as well as seminar and meeting rooms. Various European and international projects (such as youth exchanges) of the association are also represented at the site. Moreover the volunteer will be a part of our EDIC Europahaus Nordthüringen. A Service Center which works with differebnt target groups. The entire team has many years of experience in supporting European volunteers.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Our volunteers live in a flat with other volunteers. Everyone has an own room. Only the kitchen and the bath room are used together. Our volunteers get Money to buy food and so they cook for themselves. Moreover they get pocket Money. Every volunteer gets a Bahncard to travel by Train in Germany for lower costs. For the mobility in Nordhausen you will get a bike. Nordhausen is a small town in the North of thuringia near the harz mountains. Here you find a Theater or a Cinema. The next bigger cities are Erfurt or Leipzig.

Training during the project

During your voluntary Service you will visit two seminars which are organized by our national agency. Moreover you visit a linguistic course for six months.

Volunteer profile

you love working with children you want to gain experience in lifelong learning you want to get to know pedagogy methods in Germany you want to test yourself and learn more about the german language and culture Our volunteers do not Need any Special skills or experience. It is important, that you want to be a part of the ESC.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/10/2019 to 31/12/2020

Placement location

Parkallee 2, 99734 Nordhausen

Looking for volunteers from

Project description

The Project kindergarten "kinderwelt am Frauenberg" is a Kindergarten which caring for 235 children in the ages of 3 months to the age of school enrollment. The team is working with an open concept which. That means children can choose by themselves which activities they like to do. Therefor the children have different opportunities to choose: creative-, role-, handicraft-, experiment rooms and a workshop for writing. As a team we accompany the children to unfold need-based. In doing so, we address the individual conditions of the children and promote their individual self-development. We are happy about a great variety of children in our institution. Our team has many years of experience with caring about European volunteers.

Ida´s Wald- und Wiesenkinder

Ida´s Wald- und Wiesenkinder

Nordhausen, Germany

Apply

Project description

The Project "Ida´s Wald- und Wiesenkinder" is a Kindergarten which caring for 63 children in the ages of 2 years to the age of school enrollment. In the groups are children with and without disabilities. We work with the concept of Maria Montessori and Friedrich Froebel. Integration is a living, unclosable process. Our basic idea: "Because we are different, we are all the same!" Only diversity makes being together interesting and rich. That’s why we support respect and tolerance against diversity. We have groups rooms, a rotation-, music-, speech- and Montessori-room. Moreover the children are welcome to use our children’s kitchen, creative area, balls bath and outdoor play ground. Our team has many years’ experience in taking care of European volunteers.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Our volunteers live in a flat with other volunteers. Everyone has an own room. Only the kitchen and the bath room are used together. Our volunteers get Money to buy food and so they cook for themselves. Moreover they get pocket Money. Every volunteer gets a Bahncard to travel by Train in Germany for lower costs. For the mobility in Nordhausen you will get a bike. Nordhausen is a small town in the North of thuringia near the harz mountains. Here you find a Theater or a Cinema. Nordhausen, Germany

Apply

Project description

The Project Kindergarten "Montessori Kinderhaus" is a kindergarten which caring for 200 children in the Ages of 1 year to the Age of School enrollment. The team is working with the "Montessori"guiding priciple: "Help me to do it on my own.". The kindergarten teacher support and help the children during this porcess. The children are supported in an independent personality development. Our institution has group rooms ans also a childrens kitchen, rooms to use Montessori material, a music- and rotation room and an outdoor play ground. The children can chosse which activities they want to do. There is also a nursey and primary school on the ground of the kindergarten. The whole Team has many years experience in caring about european volunteers.

ESC “ONBOARD” in Bulgaria about Theater-Art-Culture

bulgaria, Bulgaria

Apply

Project description

Volunteering for 6 months, Bulgaria (starting in March-April) European Solidarity Corps “ONBOARD is a group volunteer project for theatre, carnival, community arts and promotion of European values, self-awareness and development of the civil society. The youngsters will be mainly engaged in creative, artistic and auxiliary activities related to the cultural and educational projects of FIRE Theatre-Art-Culture FOUNDATION, which will take place in Sofia and Plovdiv . We plan also short trips for activities across the country. Art will be used as a tool of public expression and impact, personal realization and social cohesion. The training methods will be mostly informal and interactive, providing the opportunity for personal initiative and creativity and development aim.”

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Erasmus+ is covering 100% of the project (accomodation, travel cost , food and pocket money).

Training during the project

Making large parade puppets, masks, costumes etc. – including with local communities (children, youth, families, etc.) – participation in the entire process, together with the relevant team (from initial design to production and audience presentation) Artistic tasks (acting, dance, choreography and performance, carnival techniques)... More info : http://viajealasostenibilidad.org/volunteering-onboard-in-bulgaria-about-theatre-art-culture/

Volunteer profile

The project is aimed at young people (18 – 30 years old) with strong interests in Arts and Culture (theatre and performing arts mainly, in particular: outdoor theatre; puppetry; circus; carnival; street performing arts as well as some related to theatre arts such as visual arts; sculpture; costume, set and graphical design; community arts; photography and video making; new technologies and social media etc.). If you have a long-term interest in the mentioned above art fields, willing to develop a professional carrier in art and culture after the project.

Placement dates

A total of 24 week(s) during the period 01/03/2019 to 31/08/2019

Placement location

bulgaria

Looking for volunteers from

Spain

Placement topics

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

Project description

EVS for 12months, Nica, Latvia, in rural area. WHAT TO DO? Nīca Youth center is looking for 2 volunteers aged 18 to 26 to join our awesome team. You will have a chance to take part in planning day to day activities at the Youth center, organizing events and workshops at the centre and within the local community (language studies, art classes, cooking workshops, sports events – you name it!) Daily tasks will include planning events and preparation for the events and workshops, daily youth centre activities such as discussions with the youth, playing board games etc. We love spending time outside, so you will have plenty of opportunities to discover the beautiful nature around us – walks, camping trips and outdoor sports events.

Volunteer profile

WE ARE LOOKING FOR VOLUNTEERS WHO: • are between 18 and 26 years old • are interested in work with young adults, teenagers and kids • are able to work individually and in teams • are able to take initiative • are creative and ready to share their ideas with the local community • are willing to spend a year in rural area

Hosting events in Funkibator NGO

Funkibator Ideell Förening

Växjö, Sweden

Apply

Project description

Funkibator has a specific focus on mobility impairment, visual impairment, neuropsychiatric diagnoses, as well as different kinds of hidden disabilities. Our average age is a bit lower as we mostly work with children, youth and young adults. We're very digital and like to do things hands on. However, we draw no limit on diagnoses, age, where you live or who you are. Activities for volunteers: Hosting both people and events Arrange activity evenings in our activity house (Kväll@SIP) Come up with and create your own activities Receive others who wants to create activities and assist them with the process Computer ang gaming activities Arrange “Social club” where people are gathering around a topic and do different activities Friday meet-up where we have coffee and cake Other social events that might happen in the activity house Assist and coach summer workers at the age of 16-19. Both youth with disabilites and newly arrived youth Arts and crafts or other creative workshops

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will live in shared apartment either outside Växjö or in the City, having his/her own room and sharing bathroom, kitchen and other common areas. The volunteer will get either a bus card or bicycle to commute, depending on the distance from our office to the housing. There is Internet in the accommodation. The volunteers receive food-money and pocket every month. The pocket money will be 115 euros.

Training during the project

The volunteer will take part in 2 obligatory trainings with the National Agency, arrival-training and Midterm-training.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for a volonteer who: - Is social and open-minded - A people-person with a wide experince of working with people from different backgrounds - Self-motivated - Take initiavites - Enjoy working with people - Are willing to work 2-3 evenings a week and one weekend a month - Technical skills – computer, projector etc - Thinks outside the box. OBS! EU-COUNTRIES ONLY.

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 01/05/2019 to 30/04/2020

Placement location

Infanterigatan 10, 35235 Växjö

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

SVE Institution Notre Dame Saint François

Institution Notre Dame Saint François

Evreux, France

Apply

Project description

Le jeune aura en charge d'organiser et gérer des activités sportives sur l'heure du midi en lien avec les enseignants et éducateurs du lycée. L'objectif est de permettre aux jeunes qui le souhaitent de pratiquer une activité sportive. Le SVE pourra également, s'il maitrise l'anglais, aider les professeurs de langue au sein de langues, notamment en cours d'anglais européen. Il pourra aussi aider à l'organisation de sorties pédagogiques et à la mise en place des départs en stage à l’étranger, dans le cadre des bourses Erasmus +. Le SVE pourra aider l'équipe locale dans différentes activités : - projets éducatifs pour la jeunesse - aider les jeunes a prendre conscience de leurs compétences et les aider à les améliorer - participation aux activités et événements ( diversité culturelle, éducation non discriminante, tolérance) Le jeune sera en charge d'aider les élèves en difficulté, une heure en fin de matinée, ainsi qu'une heure le soir dans le cadre des heures d'études.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Le SVE sera logé à l'internat au sein de l'intitution ou dans une colocation selon le souhait du jeune. En ce qui concerne les repas, le service de restauration de l'établissements sera en charge de lui préparer ces repas. Pour ce qui est des transports, le lycée étant situé au cœur d’Évreux, le jeune pourra donc se rendre en centre ville à pieds, sans aucun soucis. De plus, il pourra prendre un bus ou train s'il souhaite se rendre en dehors d’Évreux, puisque le lycée est à coté de la gare d'Evreux. Un vélo sera mis à disposition par l'UNSS si besoin.

Training during the project

Le jeune pourra également travailler son projet personnel et professionnel durant le SVE.

Volunteer profile

Il serait souhaitable que le jeune sache s'exprimer en anglais afin de pouvoir participer aux cours d'anglais européens ou pour organiser les activités extérieures tels que le séjours linguistiques. Le jeune peut également être sportif afin de pouvoir travailler en lien avec les professeurs d'EPS qui souhaitent mettre en place du sport le midi. Il doit être ouvert d'esprit pour aider les élèves qui en ont besoin. Nous aimerions qu'il participe à la lutte contre le décrochage scolaire en mettant en place une aide individualisée an fin de matinée et une aide aux devoirs le soir.

Placement dates

A total of 44 week(s) during the period 02/09/2019 to 30/06/2020

Placement location

8 rue portevin, 27000 Evreux

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 01/05/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Freie Integrative Gemeinschaftschule "Alleeschule Rudolstadt"

Freie Integrative Gemeinschaftschule "Alleeschule Rudolstadt"

Rudolstadt, Germany

Apply

Project description

The Project "Frei integrative Gemeinschaftsschule" is a small elementary School which teaching children with and without disabilities from 1st to 4th grade. The School is working with the concept of "Friedrich Fröbel" and children are supported very individually. Different methods of individual learning are used in class. For other educational offerings, there is a workshop, a student kitchen, a construction area, a libary, a Computer room and a Relaxation area. The outdoor area also offers sports facilities and a garden. The Primary School Team already has many yeras of experiences in the care of European volunteers. More over every volunteer get a Tutor by his side for all peronal Needs and questions. Rudolstadt is a small town in the south of thuringia. Here you find a Theater and a Cinema. Nearly you find Jena or Ilmenau.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

You as our volunteer live in a flat with one other volunteer. You have your own room and use the kitchen and the bath room together. In the flat you have Internet. Our volunteers get money for food per months and cook by themselves. Moreover you get pocket money every month. For traveling in Germany our volunteers get a Bahncard. So you can travel by train for lower costs. For the mobility in Rudolstadt you get a bike.

Training during the project

During the volunteering you will be a part of two seminars. The first Seminar is the on-Arrival-Training after 6 weeks. The second Seminar is the mid.term.Meeting in the half of the volunteering Service. Both will be organize by our national agency.

Volunteer profile

you love working with children, you want to gain experience in lifelong learning, get to know pedagogy methods in Germany, test yourself and learn more about the german language and culture. You do not Need any Special skills or experience. It is important for us, that you will be a part of the ESC-Programm, learn new things and you have an open mind.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/12/2020

Placement location

Robert-Birkner-Straße 17, 07407 Rudolstadt

YMCA recreation centre Kollm

CVJM Freizeit- und Bildungszentrum Kollm

Quitzdorf am See, Germany

Apply

Project description

In the Southeast of Germany, surrounded by forest, you will find the small village “Kollm” and right next to the church the youth and leisure home. Our house has a simple but practical and functional equipment with a good kitchen. Children's and youth groups as well as school classes feel particularly comfortable with us. Family leisure and seminars are also possible in our house. The house offers full meals (3 meals) and is open all year round. The EVS project is divided in two areas: 1. YMCA recreation centre Kollm Here the volunteer supports the staff by the following tasks: - welcome, contact to the guests - do a lot of things like lawnmowing, to paint walls or other objects, in winter to remove snow and spread - to repair little items - help to perpare the meals, help to clean rooms - practical work for the renovation of the centre 2. activities with pupils in the school club of the secondary school in Niesky - Sports, games (two times per week)

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will live together with other EVS volunteers in a shared flat in Görlitz or in a host family. He will get money for food and a German language course depending of his language level. For transport there is a bike or a ticket for bus/train.

Training during the project

trainig about youth work organised by the YMCA

Volunteer profile

Practical skills, interest in the work with children, active person, open for our Christian profile, German language skills

Placement dates

A total of 54 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

Diehsaer Str. 1, 02906 Quitzdorf am See

Looking for volunteers from

ESC vacancy in Bratislava, Slovakia

Mladiinfo Slovensko

Bratislava, Slovakia

Apply

Project description

The project will last 12 months and it has to start as soon as possible (preferably in March 2019). The volunteer will work in the organization Mladiinfo Slovensko and will have the following tasks: Assisting in the organization of events of Mladiinfo and their partners *and participating in the same); promotion of the European Voluntary Service and other Erasmus + opportunities in local schools; implementation of non-formal activities; implementation of Portuguese/English workshops; assistance in the creation and implementation of Erasmus + projects; creation of media content for the social networks of Mladiinfo;

Volunteer profile

Aged 18-30; Eager to learn about this field of work; Positive and proactive attitude, show tolerance, flexibility, motivation and enthusiasm, patience, responsibility and the capacity to work in a team For more information, please consult the full call at http://www.a-spin.pt/?p=5460

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/03/2019 to 29/02/2020

Placement location

Bratislava

Portugal

Project 119: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11398_en


Take me in Europe vol. 1

Associazione InCo-Molfetta

Molfetta, Italy

Apply

Project description

InCo is ready for the first ESC partnership and has started to look for the future volunteers for 7 hosting projects with the deadline of 13th of March 2019. Hosting organizations are based in the cities of Molfetta, Bisceglie and Ostuni. The placement are the following: 1 - Liceo Classico Scientifico Molfetta, 9 months activities in the local high school with youngsters 13-19 years old 2 - Scuola Battisti-Ferraris Bisceglie, 9 months activities with students 10-13 years old 3 - ITET Molfetta, 9 months activities in the local high school with youngsters 13-19 years old 4 - Scuola Monterisi Bisceglie, 9 months activities with students 10-13 years old 5 - I.C. Manzoni-Poli Molfetta, 9 months activities in a primary school with kids 5-13 years old 6 - Comune di Molfetta, 9-12 months activity in the municipality of Molfetta 7 - Associazione InCo-Molfetta, 9-12 months activity in InCo office regarding youth mobility 8 - Villaggio SOS Ostuni, 9 months, kids with family problems

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will live in a shared flat (max 4 people) in double room, fully equipped with shared kitchen and bathroom. For food an extra pocket money of 150 euros monthly will be provided. Regarding transportation there is no need to take public service since the town is very small. In case the volunteer will work in different city a monthly card will be provided

Training during the project

Volunteers will receive an Italian language course and job shadowing during the first month of activity. Mentor and tutor will be available for the whole duration of the activity.

Volunteer profile

Please read all the condition here: https://www.incoweb.org/ita/Progetti/In-Italia/Take-me-in-Europe-vol.-1 Requirements for participation: - Candidate should be over 18 years old and registered to the ESC portal - Must be very motivated and committed to the voluntary activity. - Interested in the topic of the project - A minimum B1 level of English. Knowledge of italian language is a plus Candidates are required to send cv e motivation letter in english. Candidates who will fill a generic application form, with no details and without clear motivation will be not considered.

Placement dates

A total of 51 week(s) during the period 15/07/2019 to 30/06/2020

Placement location

via Enrico de Nicola, 12, 70056 Molfetta

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Slovakia

Placement topics

Social challenges

Citizenship and democratic participation

Education and training

Employment and entrepreneurship

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 14/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Positive Vibes: 14/10-12/12~2019 ***WINTER IS COMING***

FUNDACJA CENTRUM AKTYWNOSCI TWORCZEJ

Leszno, Poland

Apply

Project description

https://www.facebook.com/EVSfundacjaCAT/videos/1925900437719810/ The main objective of the activities is to support young people with fewer opportunities, give them a new opportunity for development, the necessary tools to find themselves in the labor market / e.g. flexibility and readiness for quick changes and decisions, ability to use foreign languages.EVS project in Poland assumes an animation of free time children and young people from Leszno and promotion of foreign cultures and ideas for volunteering,. As during two months we will have winter holidays and many schools events - volunteers will be involved in organising activities for kids/youth during that time. EVS volunteers themselves will be able to share their passions and learn new social skills.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Working hours: Volunteers will be working 35 hours per week, and will have 2 days off per month of holidays, Saturdays and Sundays are free. Accommodation: Volunteers will live in a common flats with max 2 in one room. The kitchen and the bathrooms are common in every flat.The volunteers can prepare the food on their own. Every flat has Internet wireless connections. Every volunteer will receive a Polish SIM card. Money: - Pocket money – The volunteer will receive monthly pocket money on – 120 euros - Food allowances - The volunteer will receive monthly food allowance –400 pln

Training during the project

- will create and manage social events and cultural gatherings -Human rights and Cultural clash training -will have opportunity to teach English or Spanish language locally. -will receive Youth Pass / Mobility Certificate. - weekly evaluations. -participate at Polish Cultural/Traditional experiences, helping in developing one’s cultural awareness. -will have a mentor throughout his/her stay. -will develop office skills, working in team & individual projects, will learn to use office equipment. -will learn new non formal educational platforms and technics to teach.

Volunteer profile

-speak communicative English -desire to work in foreign language -creative thinking, ability to communicate , teach and develop local youth . -desire to work in a team -passionate about spending human rights and equality knowledge, working together for sustainable Europe. -motivational speakers, social developers are welcome.

Placement dates

A total of 8 week(s) during the period 14/10/2019 to 12/12/2019

Placement location

Więzienna 3, 64-100 Leszno

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Education and training

Employment and entrepreneurship

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 15/08/2019

Solo per italiani: Volontariato in biblioteca

Daineta

Siauliai; Utena; Zarasai; Klaipeda; Plunge; Ignalina, Lithuania

Apply

Project description

Volontariato di otto mesi in Lituania, presso le maggiori biblioteche pubbliche del paese. Hai la possibilità di scegliere di svolgere l'attività nelle città di Plungė, Klaipeda, Zarasai, Utena, Siauliai e Ignalina. Uno degli obbiettivi del progetto è di diffondere le metodologie di apprendimento non-formale e le opportunità del programma Erasmus+ e ESC (Corpo Europeo di Solidarietà) ai ragazzi della comunità locale. Per partecipare invia un'e-mail a molfetta@incoweb.org, allegando cv e lettera di motivazione in inglese. Nell'e-mail si potrebbe indicare la città in cui si vorrebbe svolgere l'attività. Per saperne di più (http://www.deineta.lt/projektai/volunteering-at-lithuanian-libraries/.)

Volunteer profile

Il partecipante è un/a ragazzo/a fra i 18-30 anni. Non sono richieste competenze specifiche, se non la voglia di mettersi in gioco, uscire dalla propria comfort-area e vivere l'esperienza all'estero. Il volontariao/a si occuperà di: attività educative per gruppi di età diverse (creazione di libri a fumetti, modellazione e stampa 3D, creazione di realtà virtuale, progettazione di robot LEGO, programmazione, realtà aumentata); supporto per i bambini; manutenzione del sito web; assistenza nelle attività quotidiane della biblioteca; organizzazione di campi per bambini; visite guidate.

Placement dates

A total of 30 week(s) during the period 01/05/2019 to 30/11/2019

Placement location

Siauliai; Utena; Zarasai; Klaipeda; Plunge; Ignalina

Looking for volunteers from

Italy

Placement topics

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 14/04/2019

Apply

Project description

https://www.facebook.com/EVSfundacjaCAT/videos/370466736862378/ - development in neighbouring surroundings - learning new skills and competences to help volunteers look ahead in the labor market - learning as active citizens, expressing solidarity, helping their own / foreign communities - promoting the learning of new knowledge, skills, attitudes and values ​​essential for personal development and application in society, for creating and supporting an individual volunteer educational plan - gaining personal, educational and vocational skills as well as social integration - promoting participation, active citizenship and a sense of initiative - supporting the development of creativity, self-realization, i.e. the ability to formulate, consult, process thoughts, implement their own projects and introduce them to the European element - increase of media-related competences and knowledge of foreign languages - promoting intercultural dialogue, shared values, solidari

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation: Volunteers will live in a common flats with max 2 in one room. The kitchen and the bathrooms are common in every flat.The volunteers can prepare the food on their own. Every flat has Internet wireless connections. Every volunteer will receive a Polish SIM card. Training during the project

-will have opportunity to take part in SUMMER work camps, managing sport, artistic, culture-educational activities for children . -will have opportunity to take part in Teaching English , Spanish languages to support development of locals. -will create activities fro European youth week. -will receive Youth Pass / Mobility Certificate. -will go through weekly evaluations and project development meetings. -participate at Polish Cultural/Traditional experiences, helping in developing one’s cultural awareness. -will have a mentor throughout his/her stay.

Volunteer profile

-Speak communicative English -Have desire to work in a large group and want to develop skills managing large crowds. -Have desire to create, experiment and teach others. -Be enthusiastic, energetic and expressing interest to work with youth and kids. -Animators, street artist, musicians are welcome.
