Project 123: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11375_en


DIVERSITY - Vacancy in Germany

Jugendwerk der AWO Württemberg

Stuttgart, Germany

Apply

Project description

Jugendwerk der AWO Württemberg (JW) is a nonprofit NGO with the focus on non-formal education, intercultural projects, youth camps and projects for children and young people. The main objective is to support young people in their process of personal development and education besides school and university to improve social, educational, (inter)cultural and other skills and competences. By this the aim of JW is to improve tolerance, solidarity, self-determination and democracy in our society. The main activities of the JW are seminars in non-formal education, youth travel, international youth work (youth exchange, support measures and international volunteering), and then coordination of local projects and groups. The target groups are children and young people from 7 to 30 years with a focus on the age of 18 to 27 in which we train and educate a large number of volunteers and also motivate them to take over responsibility as multipliers in training others, organizing projects etc.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Will be organized by the hosting organisation.

Training during the project

Will be organized by the hosting organisation and the German National Agency.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for open minded, flexible and hard-working volunteers. Having a dricing license is a plus, but not mandatory. You can find ALL the information on our homepage: https://jw24volunteers.wordpress.com/2019/02/22/d-i-v-e-r-s-i-t-y-we-are-looking-for-you/

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 01/10/2019 to 30/09/2020

Placement location

Olgastr. 71, 70182 Stuttgart

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Social challenges

Reception and integration of refugees and migrants

Education and training

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 02/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Come to volunteer in Samara Russia (1-year)

Center of voluntary movement "Lastochki"

Samara, Russian Federation

Apply

Project description

We are looking for one volunteer to help Center of Voluntary Movement "Lastochki". The volunteering opportunity is one of a kind as not many placements are open in Russia. The work includes managing international projects and support local youth work in the region. Read more about the project (in Estonian): http://continuousaction.ee/?module=news&id=375

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation and local transport: Volunteer is living in a shared flat together with other international volunteers. In addition, organisation is offering local transportation. International transport: The travel grant for a volunteer is 275€ for return tickets. Visa costs and other exceptional cost are covered up to real costs.

Training during the project

Volunteer is attending at on-arrival training and mid-term training organised by SALTO. In addition volunteer is supported before mobility by support organisation and will also take part in local orientation in host organisation. If possible, volunteer is sent to pre-departure training in Estonia.

Volunteer profile

Volunteer with a level of English language ability, interest and willingness to work in this field. Openness to integrate into new culture. No extra experience required, but having it is an advantage.

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 01/04/2019 to 01/04/2020

Placement location

Frunze 14, 443099, Samara

Looking for volunteers from

Estonia

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Employment and entrepreneurship

Project 125: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11357_en


"DEMOCRATIC VALUES @ WORK!" - A3: 9 months service for EUropean youth

American International School of Transylvania

Baia Mare, Romania

Apply

Project description

HH4EU project will take place in the city of Baia Mare & 14 other rural & urban communities from the Metropolitan Area, within AIST & local partner premises. The geographic scope of the project covers Romania plus 8 other countries: Danmark, France, Germany, Italy, Latvia, Spain, Portugal, United Kingdom, involving 12 other promoters acting as SOs. Our project has during Year I 3 youth mobility Activities, that follow our project objectives with Target group: kindergarten (4-6) primary (7-11) secondary, highschool & university students. Year I: 01.01.2019 - 30.06.2020, "DEMOCRATIC VALUES@work!", total participants 28, out of which 22 cross-border & 6 in-country volunteers: A3 Individual volunteering, 12 cross-border youth, 9 months, Sept. 1 2019 - June 1, 2020.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Travel: project coordinator informs counterparts in SOs/EVSers on travel routes & prices to match set budget. AIST reimburses eligible costs to SO/EVSer using transport documents, invoices & boarding passes/tickets needed to justify travel. AIST will provide volunteers with bikes for local transport & bus tickets for activities in rural areas outside Baia Mare city. Accommodation: EVSers will be hosted in safe & central lodging within Baia Mare, all facilities & utilities included. 150 euro/month - food allowance 90 euro/month - volunteer's allowance Romanian courses & mentoring included.

Training during the project

Learning environment & outcomes: volunteers will gain diverse social & educational skills & competences, that will be useful for their upcoming educational/training & employment opportunities. They will be involved in designing & implementing activities of social inclusion through nonformal educational methods practiced daily. EVSers will learn to plan, implement & adjust educational activities for children & youth, typical & underprivileged, from urban & rural environments as well. They'll also learn to be more flexible & adapt to changes as unexpected situations come up despite all planning.

Volunteer profile

Volunteers, over 18 years old, need to be interested in learning & personal development, enjoy working with kids & youth, be open & tolerant to other cultures. Flexibility is required, as they'll work in a multicultural environment as part of an international team. Being responsible, positive, energetic, communicative & a basic level of English is desirable to ease communication during project activities & within the international project team of staff & volunteers.

Placement dates

A total of 41 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 01/06/2020

Placement location

Str. Victoriei nr. 47, RO-430141 Baia Mare

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway

Placement topics

Social challenges

Citizenship and democratic participation

Health and wellbeing

Education and training

Employment and entrepreneurship

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 01/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 126: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11354_en

American International School of Transylvania

Baia Mare, Romania

Apply

Project description

HH4EU project will take place in the city of Baia Mare & 14 other rural & urban communities from the Metropolitan Area, within AIST & local partner premises. The geographic scope of the project covers Romania plus 8 other countries: Danmark, France, Germany, Italy, Latvia, Spain, Portugal, United Kingdom, involving 12 other promoters acting as SOs. Our project has during Year I 3 youth mobility Activities, that follow our project objectives with Target group: kindergarten (4-6) primary (7-11) secondary, highschool & university students. Year I: 01.01.2019 - 30.06.2020, "DEMOCRATIC VALUES@work!", total participants 28, out of which 22 cross-border & 6 in-country volunteers: Act. 1: A1 Individual volunteering, 6 youth (Romanian) in-country, 12 months, June 1, 2019 - June 1, 2020.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

AIST reimburses eligible costs to EVSer using transport documents, invoices & boarding passes/tickets needed to justify travel. AIST will provide volunteers with bikes for local transport & bus tickets for activities in rural areas outside Baia Mare city. They will be involved in designing & implementing activities of social inclusion through nonformal educational methods practiced daily. They'll also learn to be more flexible & adapt to changes as unexpected situations come up despite all planning

Toate costurile sunt acoperite! Pentru mai multe detalii: onoriu.dan@aistschool.ro

Urgent ! Volunteering for inclusion

PVN Albania

Tirana, Albania

Apply

Project description

Nous recherchons 2 volontaires pour une mission proposée par PVN Albania, à Tirana ! Active en matière de solidarité et d'insertion, PVN Albania souhaite donner aux jeunes l’opportunité de se rencontrer et de faire connaissance, de développer réciproquement leur intérêt et leur compréhension pour la culture et le pays de l’autre, d’accroître leur engagement citoyen, leur employabilité. PVN utilise les échanges régionaux et internationaux pour renforcer le dialogue interculturel, promouvoir la paix, la compréhension mutuelle, les droits humains, l'insertion sociale des personnes défavorisées, etc. PVN intervient dans les établissements scolaires, de l'école primaire jusqu'à l'université. Vous pouvez opter pour une mission de 9 mois ou une de 12 mois et une mission de 3 semaines pour 10 volontaires sera également organisée témoignage d'un volontaire accueilli par PVN : https://relations-internationales.nevers.fr/petit-temoignage-de-dorian-volontaire-europeen-actuellement-en-albanie/

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

PVN loue un appartement meublé et équipé à proximité du centre-ville et le met à disposition des volontaires européens, qui disposent chacun d'une chambre. Les indemnités mensuelles (argent de poche et pour l'alimentation) sont versées aux volontaires par la Ville de Nevers qui est coordinatrice du projet sur les plans administratif et financier.

Training during the project

cours d'albanais 1 fois par semaine

Volunteer profile

Jeunes gens intéressés par : - une mission volontaire dans les domaines des droits humains, de la communication non-violente - l’organisation d’activités avec des enfants et des jeunes - des activités de promotion et de communication - l’apprentissage de nouvelles cultures, les échanges et le dialogue interculturels, l’éducation non-formelle ayant des capacités en matière de coordination et de communication. La sélection des volontaires se fera conjointement par l’organisation d’envoi et l’organisation d’accueil. Un entretien par Skype suivra l’étude de la candidature écrite.

Placement dates

A total of 38 week(s) during the period 01/04/2019 to 30/04/2020

Placement location

Gjergj Elezia street, Arslis Palace 4, 1000 Tirana

Looking for volunteers from

France

Placement topics

Social challenges

Education and training

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 129: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11347_en


Be In(volved)

Jaunuolių Dienos Centras

Panevezys, Lithuania

Apply

Project description

La Cooperativa Sociale Kara Bobowski di Modigliana (ITALIA) sta cercando 1 volontario/a da INVIARE in LITUANIA (nella città di Panevezys) per uno SVE di 10 mesi nel settore sociale. L'esperienza si terrà nel centro diurno per persone con disabilità intellettiva dell'organizzazione Jaunuolių Dienos Centras. https://www.facebook.com/Jaunuoli%C5%B3-Dienos-Centras-323700284494685/ http://pjdc.lt/about-us/

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Il Programma Erasmus+ finanzia il viaggio, vitto e alloggio del volontario, piccolo pocket money mensile, assicurazione sanitaria europea e corso di lingua. Per più informazioni contattare: progettazione@karabobowski.org

Training during the project

Il/La volontario/a avrà una formazione pre-partenza fornita dall'organizzazione di invio. Durante l'esperienza avrà 2 formazioni in Lituania organizzate dall'Agenzia Nazionale lituana: On-Arrival Training e Mid-term Evaluation. Avrà anche accesso a un corso di lingua.

Volunteer profile

Cerchiamo un/a volontario/a ITALIANO/A o con residenza in ITALIA, dai 18 ai 30 anni, con capacità umane e sociali disposto a lavorare con persone con disabilità intellettiva in tutte le attività ricreative offerte dal centro diurno. Non ci sono requisiti particolari, solamente la voglia di mettersi in gioco, imparare e la sensibilità ed apertura alla diversità.

Placement dates

A total of 49 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/07/2020

Placement location

Panevezys

Looking for volunteers from

Italy

Placement topics

Social challenges

Health and wellbeing

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 01/06/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 130: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11343_en


SMILE & GO in Romania

ACTOR - Asociatia Culturala pentru Teatru si Origami din Romania

Bucharest, Romania

Apply

Project description

SMILE & GO è un progetto di Servizio Volontario Europeo (SVE) coordinato dal CEMEA del Mezzogiorno onlus che permette a 30 giovani tra i 18 ed i 30 anni residenti in Italia di fare una esperienza di apprendimento all'estero in organizzazioni no profit che operano nel campo dell'animazione socio-culturale in Bulgaria, Croazia, Francia, Portogallo, Romania, Regno Unito, Slovenia e Spagna. Uno dei progetti in partenza a Giugno 2019: quello in Romania, a Bucarest, presso l'organizzazione ACTOR. I volontari promuoveranno la diversità culturale e lo scambio interculturale, attraverso attività di educazione non formale rivolte a giovani e bambini: - Attività artistiche e socio-culturali (teatro forum, laboratori di teatro delle marionette) - Eventi artistici (spettacoli, mostre, laboratori artistici…) - Realizzazione di programmi di animazione in ospedale (attività ludiche, origami e teatro) per bambini malati - Promozione dello spirito di volontariato e dei progetti europei

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Alloggio: in un appartamento, condiviso con altri volontari. Il volontario avrà una camera condivisa (2 persone / camera); la cucina ed il bagno condivisi con altri volontari. Il viaggio andata e ritorno verrà rimborsato fino all'ammontare massimo di 275 euro. Ogni volontario riceverà un budget per il vitto, oltre al pocket money mensile.

Training during the project

I volontari saranno supportati e guidati dall'organizzazione di accoglienza durante le attività. I volontari potranno beneficiare di supporto e sessioni formative, organizzate dall'associazione di accoglienza ACTOR, di: metodi e strumenti di educazione non formale, origami, teatro delle marionette. I volontari parteciperanno ad un evento di formazione all'arrivo organizzato dall'Agenzia Nazionale per i Giovani Rumena.

Volunteer profile

Il progetto è rivolto a giovani tra i 18 ed i 30 anni, residenti in Italia. Ai volontari non è richiesta alcuna competenza specifica nel campo, né la conoscenza della lingua del paese di accoglienza. I requisiti più importanti sono l’interesse per la tematica del progetto e la motivazione a mettersi in gioco in un’esperienza di apprendimento in un contesto interculturale. 20 posti e la partecipazione ai laboratori locali Comp-pass sono riservati prioritariamente a giovani della Regione Lazio che non studiano, non lavorano e non frequentano corsi di formazione professionale.

Placement dates

A total of 25 week(s) during the period 03/06/2019 to 29/11/2019

Placement location

Str DOINA nr 13-17, bloc 1, scara 2, etaj 1, apartament 17, sector 5, Bucharest

Looking for volunteers from

Italy

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 14/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Know & Can

Sofia, Bulgaria

Apply

Project description

SMILE & GO è un progetto di Servizio Volontario Europeo (SVE) coordinato dal CEMEA del Mezzogiorno onlus che permette a 30 giovani tra i 18 ed i 30 anni residenti in Italia di fare una esperienza di apprendimento all'estero in organizzazioni no profit che operano nel campo dell'animazione socio-culturale in Bulgaria, Croazia, Francia, Portogallo, Romania, Regno Unito, Slovenia e Spagna. Uno dei progetti in partenza ad Aprile 2019: quello in Bulgaria, presso l'organizzazione Know & Can. Il/la volontario/a farà parte dell’èquipe di Know & Can e contribuirà allo sviluppo dei suoi progetti sia a livello locale che internazionale. Durante i 6 mesi di progetto sono previste: -Attività educative, di animazione e per il tempo libero -Attività ludiche a sostegno della disabilità -Creazione e realizzazione di materiali ed eventi per presentare la propria cultura di appartenenza e promuovere la mobilità educativa -Supporto per l’implementazione dei progetti locali ed internazionali

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Alloggio: in un appartamento, condiviso con altri volontari. Il volontario avrà una camera condivisa (2 persone / camera); la cucina ed il bagno condivisi con altri volontari. Training during the project

Volunteer profile

Il progetto è rivolto a giovani tra i 18 ed i 30 anni, residenti in Italia. Ai volontari non è richiesta alcuna competenza specifica nel campo, né la conoscenza della lingua del paese di accoglienza. I requisiti più importanti sono l’interesse per la tematica del progetto e la motivazione a mettersi in gioco in un’esperienza di apprendimento in un contesto interculturale. 20 posti e la partecipazione ai laboratori locali Comp-pass sono riservati prioritariamente a giovani della Regione Lazio che non studiano, non lavorano e non frequentano corsi di formazione professionale.

SMILE & GO a Peniche - 6 mesi

AJP - Associação Juvenil de Peniche

Peniche, Portugal

Apply

Project description

SMILE & GO è un progetto di Servizio Volontario Europeo (SVE) coordinato dal CEMEA del Mezzogiorno onlus che permette a 30 giovani tra i 18 ed i 30 anni residenti in Italia di fare una esperienza di apprendimento all'estero in organizzazioni no profit che operano nel campo dell'animazione socio-culturale in Bulgaria, Croazia, Francia, Portogallo, Romania, Regno Unito, Slovenia e Spagna. Uno dei progetti in partenza ad Aprile 2019: quello in Portogallo, presso l'organizzazione AJP. Il campo principale d’azione è quello della promozione dell’educazione non formale e dell’animazione socio-culturale con bambini (dai 6 ai 12 anni) ed adolescenti (dai 13 ai 16 anni), sia indoor che outdoor. I volontari potranno essere coinvolti in: - Attività educative e di tempo libero nei centri ricreativi - Attività educative, di animazione ed espressione artistica in ludoteca - Attività ambientali, culturali e di tempo libero in centri per bambini ed adolescenti

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Alloggio: in un appartamento, condiviso con altri volontari. Il volontario avrà una camera condivisa (2 persone / camera); la cucina ed il bagno condivisi con altri volontari. Il viaggio andata e ritorno verrà rimborsato fino all'ammontare massimo di 275 euro. Ogni volontario riceverà un budget per il vitto, oltre al pocket money mensile.

I volontari saranno supportati e guidati dall'organizzazione di accoglienza durante le attività. I volontari parteciperanno ad un evento di formazione all'arrivo organizzato dall'Agenzia Nazionale per i Giovani Portoghese.

Il progetto è rivolto a giovani tra i 18 ed i 30 anni, residenti in Italia. Ai volontari non è richiesta alcuna competenza specifica nel campo, né la conoscenza della lingua del paese di accoglienza. I requisiti più importanti sono l’interesse per la tematica del progetto e la motivazione a mettersi in gioco in un’esperienza di apprendimento in un contesto interculturale. 20 posti e la partecipazione ai laboratori locali Comp-pass sono riservati prioritariamente a giovani della Regione Lazio che non studiano, non lavorano e non frequentano corsi di formazione professionale.

EFD in Ostrava/Tschechien

Ostrava, Czech Republic

Apply

Project description

Für ein bewilligtes Freiwilligendienstprojekt in Ostrava nehmen wir Bewerbungen entgegen! Das Projekt soll von Anfang Mai bis Ende des Jahres oder auf Wunsch auch bis April 2019 laufen. Es dreht sich alles um das Thema Cyber-Bullying. Bei uns mehr unter dem Begriff Cyber-Mobbing bekannt. Hier ein paar Infos zum Projekt: We had such a fantastic experience with a previous EVS project, involving the new, fresh, young, inspiring people as volunteers with emphasis on the dangers of cyber-bullying and irresponsible use of social networks. In the context of mutual inspiration of the project and its partnership that aims to increase the competence of adolescents from all the partner organisations, in the way they are able to share experience efficiently. The project focuses on preventive educations for young people and adults, teachers and parents in the issue of unsafe use of the Internet and communication technologies.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Warns against misuse of personal data and the introduction of new phenomena in cyberspace, such as sexting, grooming, phishing, Happy Slapping. We are dedicated shooting movies, comics and creating educational programs, lectures and implementing effective projects. Becoming an international team will allow us use foreign languages, what is also a great opportunity for us to practice mainly English, but also German. The communicating language that will be used among all the team members and a volunteers will be English.

Training during the project

At the moment, we are opening a community café in the centre of Ostrava. For that part, we have a capacity for volunteers to plan and run their activities, based on their own preferences. Be it musical, theatre, science, ICT, or any courses, competitions, activities. The main aim is to bring the local communities together. All the volunteers are free to arrange their own activities, with (more or less) no limits.

Volunteer profile

18 - 30

Placement dates

A total of 36 week(s) during the period 01/05/2019 to 31/12/2019

Placement location

Ostrava

Looking for volunteers from

Germany

Placement topics

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 04/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 134: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11326_en

Creative tool claiming artistic excellence, PIANOANDCO is engaged in a process of valorization of the contemporary repertory and contributing to the renewal of the artistic expression.

YouAreThe+, Diversity and Volunteering in the University of Murcia

Service for Attention to Diversity and Volunteering

Murcia, Spain

Apply

Project description

Aiming to volunteer in a multi-field project? Are you ready for a schedule changing every week? This may be your project! Our service manages a large university volunteering program with more than 190 currently active projects with regional organisations, all divided into fifteen fields. It is also in charge of providing support to students with disabilities and specific needs in their university everyday life. We are looking for ONE VOLUNTEER from GREECE to join us from October 2019 to July 2020 with the following tasks: - Volunteering in existing projects. - Supporting the management of the volunteering program. - Promoting the volunteering program by creating audio-visual media and participating in informative events. - Supporting the attention to disability and specific needs programs. - Accompanying students with disabilities and specific needs in exams and classes. - Promoting the EVS program among the society in general and the university community in particular.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will be accommodated in a shared flat with other volunteers or Spanish students located in the city centre so they can easily integrate into the city life. The office is located on one of the University campuses, Campus de Espinardo. It takes about 30 min to arrive from the city centre to the office by bus or by tramway. Volunteers will be provided by 22€ budget per month for transport, which is the price of the general travel card. They will receive 150€ each month for food to manage on their own, that could be used for eating in the soup kitchen, which is in the same building.

Training during the project

Volunteers could receive specific training for some volunteering projects and activities, if specific abilities or knowledge is needed. This will depend on their specific schedules. About Spanish language, volunteers will have a weekly meeting with Spanish volunteers that are currently finishing languages-related studies at the University of Murcia. In January, they will participate in an intensive Spanish course provided by the University and they will additionally count the Erasmus+ Online Linguistic Platform as a basic resource.

Volunteer profile

Dynamic, independent and flexible people with a great adaptative capacity to very diverse tasks and fields. Ready to participate in dynamic volunteering activities in contact with social issues, but also to complete office tasks with the aim to make the volunteering program possible. It would be a plus to be able to create audio-visual content and/or to manage social media content, as well as initiative and entrepreneurship skills. Despite language is not mandatory, a good Spanish level will be appreciated.

Placement dates

A total of 42 week(s) during the period 01/10/2019 to 15/07/2020

Placement location

Centro Social Universitario, Campus de Espinardo., 30100 Murcia

Looking for volunteers from

Greece

Placement topics

Social challenges

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 136: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11311_en


European Volunteers In Solidarity Actions (E.V.I.S.A.)

PROGETTO CITTA' SOCIETA' COOPERATIVA SOCIALE

SAVONA, Italy

Apply

Project description

VOLUNTEERING activity: With this kind of activity six volunteers from SPAIN, FRANCE, PORTUGAL,HUNGARY and NORWAY will be hosted in Savona, in a large apartment, for a Long term project (duration12 months). START DATE of the activities planned for MAY/JUNE 2019. The FOCUS of the project will be the involvement of volunteers in the educative activities and thematic laboratories offered for free to minors and young people attending the following centers and Playrooms near Savona:Youthclub "Centro Ragazzi " of Albisola, the Ludoteca Playroom “Il cappellaio Matto" by Vado Ligure and the municipal playroom "I treni a vapore" of Finale Ligure, the Arbaxia Ludoteca in Spotorno. The volunteers will be involved in activities of animation and socializing through the game and recreational activities-sports and oriented to social inclusion.Volunteers will support educators by devising and realizing solidarity actions such as involvement and facilitation in the participation of foreign minors.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will live in a big flat in the city center of Savona. The apartment is located at the sixth floor of a stately building with lift and close to shops and services (Mail, pharmacy, bar, discount, market, etc.).. It is close to the bus stop and the Train station (ten minutes walk).Consists of four rooms (each of which can accommodate two persons), two bathrooms, kitchen, a large living room. It is equipped with new appliances or in good condition.Meals: Volunteers each month will receive the necessary sums for the FOOD and POCKET MONEY provided by the Project.

Training during the project

Professional educational training in the centers. Free Italian language long training. COMPLEMENTARY ACTIVITIES: WORKSHOP with final event in Valpolcevera (Genoa). The European volunteers will participate in workshops of construction of toys together with the children and young people of the centers, using different materials (wood, recycled material...) to be used and donated to Citizenship of Valpolcevera (Genoa) during a great event open to all citizenship and children of schools called BUILDING BRIDGES of SOLIDARITY-Ludobus in the square!

Volunteer profile

For our purposes we will use the criteria for the selection of volunteers will bee available to participate in a long-term (12 months); Have a high motivation to the type of project and activities;Be willing to experiment with different kinds of activities (both practical and theoretical);Have experimented experiences in volunteering;Share the apartment with other volunteers.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/05/2019 to 31/07/2020

Placement location

CORSO ITALIA 13/2, 17100 SAVONA

Looking for volunteers from

France, Spain, Hungary, Portugal, Norway

Placement topics

Social challenges

Education and training

Employment and entrepreneurship

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 30/09/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Baia Mare, Romania

Apply

Project description

The aim of this project is the personal development of 6 young foreign volunteers in the context of the social integration facility for disadvantaged children and young people. - socio-educational animation with disadvantaged young people (to mark various events: Roma Day, Youth Day, and during the activity of the mobile school), - mobile school (literacy, mathematics, fundamental general knowledge), - world café (theme- facilitating the integration of disadvantaged young people), - events and photo-voice exhibition, - intercultural evenings, - dissemination activities, - mentoring, - participation in the Youth Summit in Romania, - other activities proposed by the participants. - Usual activities in Somaschi Foundation (playing, hiking, personal development sessions, literacy, creative activities, animation and other activities proposed by volunteers);

Team of volunteers for heritage - Strollad ar glad

Etudes et Chantiers Bretagne Pays de la Loire

Rennes, France

Apply

Project description

The team will have two missions: Enhancement of Breton heritage and development of activities with locals. Integration: June 10th to 14th, the team will be welcome to Rennes in order to have the integration period. In addition to some team buildings activities, the volunteers will have the chance to get to know the city and do some touristic activities. Work camp:14th June to 5 July, the volunteers will go to Chateaugiron. They will restore and preserve the castle of the city. In addition to the physical work, they will organize actions toward locals. Break: 5th to 12th July, break week in Rennes. (evaluation activities of the project, touristic visits, trips). Work camp:12th July to 2nd August, the volunteers will go to Saint-Thegonnec. As the first work camp they will have restoration of heritage activities they will organize activities with the local population. Evaluation: 2nd to 8th August, the team will come back to Rennes in order to evaluate the project.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The accommodation during the work-camp is done in tents. All the equipment to sleep (tents, mattresses, blankets, sheets, pillows, etc.), the cooking staff, and normal self-hygiene elements (toilets, showers, etc.) are provided. During the time in Rennes they will have an individual room in a dormitory. A common food budget managed by the own group is provided during the workcamp. volunteers are in Rennes. Food allowance of 7 euros/day during the period in Rennes. Pocket money :6 euros/day --- INFO PACK: https://www.dropbox.com/s/1cya2lesqx46wvb/Info%20Pack%20-%20EVS%20-%20Team%20of%20

Training during the project

No training

Volunteer profile

18 - 30 years old Being a volunteer requires commitment, sense of responsability, open minded, motivation and availability during all the project.The volunteers will have to deal with a mixed group of different nationalities (Spain, Italy, Germany, Poland, Romania, Estonia) and create relationships with local communities. Also, the volunteer have to be interested by french language and culture, and be able to do physical outside work.

Placement dates

A total of 8 week(s) during the period 10/06/2019 to 08/08/2019

Placement location

3 rue Jean Lemaistre, 358000 Rennes

Looking for volunteers from

Estonia, Spain, Italy, Portugal, Romania, Poland, Germany

Call for project Young for elders

Youth Peace Group Danube

Vukovar, Croatia

Apply

Project description

Project „Youth for elders“ aim is to enable development and gaining new knowledge, skills and competencies of young volunteers by helping elderly and disabled people and people with disabilities in Vukovar and activities for young people and ensure better social life of the elderly and in same time improve social inclusion of elderly people, raising awareness of the immediate and wider surrounding and in particular the young people of the needs for social inclusion, tolerance, and to provide direct assistance to elderly and disabled people and people with disabilities.We are hosting 2 volunteers. Main activities:House assistance for the elderly and disabled, Social activities for the elderly and persons with disabilities; Social activities for young people; Participation in organizing the events and promotional activities for young people; Intercultural evenings; Personal project

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will be hosted in a house, sharing room in center of Vukovar. There are 2 beds in every room, bathroom, kitchen and living room. The towels, sheets and blankets are provided but you are welcome to bring your own if wanted. Wifi available in the house. The volunteers will receive monthly allowance for food in amount of 180,00 euro in Croatian kuna (HRK) by the 5th of each month and be responsible for own cooking and preparation of meals.Transport from accommodation to workplace would be provided or covered by Host organization if necessary.

Training during the project

According to programme European solidarity corps( preparation training, on arrival and mid term training in Croatia, and final traning)

Volunteer profile

The candidates profile comes to terms with the conditions requested in the ESC Program. The program is opened to all volunteers between 18-30 years.

Placement dates

A total of 26 week(s) during the period 01/04/2019 to 30/09/2019

Placement location

Voćarska 17, 32000 Vukovar

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Mind the solidarity

Asociatia Lumea lui Pinocchio

Panciu (Judet Vrancea), Romania

Apply

Project description

The project „Mind the Solidarity” will include volunteers form different EU countries; according to their interests/competences they could be involved in different socio-educational activities in Panciu (Judet Vrancea): - at the Daily Centre Pinocchio with children (3-16 y.o.); - at the Kindergarden nr. 1 of with children 3-6 y.o.; - at the Documentation and Information Centre of the "Ioan Slavici" Theoretical High School; - at the Social Residential Centre for elderly people. - at the Family Modules for orphans minors in Panciu.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will live in an apartment în Panciu sharing the accommodation with other international volunteers. The volunteers will take care of the house cleaning, of the purchase of their food and their meals' preparation.

Volunteer profile

- Age 18-30 (30+ 364 days at the moment of the project's submission); - Basic English knowledge and strong motivation to volunteering; - Not having already taken part in an Erasmus+ volunteering activity or an EVS for more than 2 months; - Registration in the European Solidarity Corps Portal; - In addition, for the volunteers of the educational sector a previous experience in the educational field, better if with disadvantaged children, is preferable; - Previous experiences/competences in the IT, graphical and promotional fields are welcome.

asociacion building bridges

savona, Italy

Apply

Project description

Estamos buscando personas interesadas en hacer voluntariado europeo con este SVE en Liguria en animación y actividades recreativas. ACTIVITIES START DATE 29/04/2019 (12 months) VOLUNTEERING activity: With this kind of activity six volunteers from Spain, France, Portugal, Hungary and Norway will be hosted in Savona, in a large apartment, for a Long term project. Duration: 12 months. Start date of the activities planned for the end of April 2019. The FOCUS of the project will be the involvement of volunteers in the educative activities and thematic laboratories offered for free to minors and young people attending the centers and Playrooms near Savona. Actividades de este SVE en Liguria The volunteers will be involved in activities of animation and socializing through the game and recreational activities-sports and oriented to social inclusion. Volunteers will support educators by devising and realizing solidarity actions such as involvement and facilitation

Volunteer profile

Spanish residents

Huddle in Broby

Broby-Emmislövs församling

Broby, Sweden

Apply

Project description

Do you want to spend up to 12 months working with children and youth and at the same time live with other young adults? We are looking for one to three young adults who would volunteer in Broby-Emmislövs församling in Broby, Sweden. Here you get to be a part of different activites in our church such as child care, youth groups, confirmation classes, camps and more. You get to shape and lead the groups. You also get to live with 4-8 other young adults in a community where you cook, clean and share daily life together. This house in an open house for the young people in our village to come and spend time with you. This is an opportunity for you who wants to learn the Swedish language, build community and friendships, learn to lead and shape childerens group and learn more about the UN and meet peole This is a program where you will learn more about yourself, others and the world. You will have a mentor that will guide you and help you with adapting to the new culture.

Training during the project

- Working with childrens groups, with children in the ages of 5-10 years old. Crafting, helping out with leading music. - Participating in youth camps - Living in a young adult community with other young adults, in a house that also is open for youth to come and hangout 6 days a week - Leader in youth group and confirmation class. Orgazining activities and camps, teaching and prepare meetings - Training youth in leadership - Friendly support at Göingeschool (ages: 13-16) - Diaconal work: open cafés

Volunteer profile

You should have an interest in young people and to be a role model. You want to learn how to guide, teach and support christian youth. You should like to work with children in groups, leading and planing aktivities. It is an advantage to have a personal christian faith and to want to be a part of the congregation during your stay.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/08/2019 to 31/10/2020

Placement location

Storgatan 6, 28992 Broby

Looking for volunteers from

Germany, Spain, Greece, Belgium, Finland, Denmark, Cyprus, France, Croatia, Ireland, Hungary, Iceland, Italy, Lithuania, Malta, Portugal, United Kingdom

Breton team of volunteers - strollad breizh

Etudes et Chantiers Bretagne Pays de la Loire

Rennes, France

Apply

Project description

The volunteers will have 2 missions. The enhancement of Breton heritage and the development of relations with locals. 1- Integration: from June 1st to 5th, the team will be welcome to Rennes in order to have the integration period. In addition to some team buildings activities, the volunteers will have the chance to get to know the city and do some touristic activities. 2- Workcamp: from 5th July to 26nd July, the volunteers will go to Plêchatel, a small and welcoming village near Rennes. Every day, they will split in 2 teams to carry out different activities. One part of the team will work doing the maintenance of a trekking path and the masonry on ancient Brittany heritage buildings.Tthe other part of the international volunteer team will organize activities with the locals: intercultural café, activities with the youth population of the village, presentation of their countries... 3- Evaluation: from 26th July to 1st August, the volunteers will come back to Rennes

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The accommodation during the work-camp is done in tents in the local football stadium. All the equipment to sleep (tents, mattresses, blankets, sheets, pillows, etc.), the cooking staff, and normal self-hygiene elements (toilets, bathrooms, showers, etc.) are provided. During the time in Rennes they will have an individual room in a dormitory. A common food budget managed by the own group is provided during the workcamp. volunteers are in Rennes. Food allowance of 7 euros/day during the period in Rennes. Pocket money :6 euros/day

Training during the project

no training

Volunteer profile

18 - 30 years old Being a volunteer requires commitment, sense of responsability, open minded, motivation and availability during all the project.The volunteers will have to deal with a mixed group of different nationalities (Spain, Italy, Germany, Poland, Romania, Estonia) and create relationships with local communities. Also, the volunteer have to be interested by french language and culture, and be able to do physical outside work.

Placement dates

A total of 4 week(s) during the period 01/07/2019 to 01/08/2019

Placement location

3 rue Jean Lemaistre, 35000 Rennes

Looking for volunteers from

Spain, Estonia, Poland, Italy, Portugal, Germany

Koli National Park and Koli Nature Centre Ukko

Metsähallitus – Parks & Wildlife Finland / Koli National Park and Koli Nature Centre Ukko

Lieksa, Finland

Apply

Project description

Koli National Park is one of Finland’s 39 national parks. It is located in Eastern Finland in the municipality of Lieksa. Koli’s hills, lakes and forests provide a beautiful scenery for enjoyable outdoor activities at any time of year. The Nature Centre Ukko is the heart of the activities and the volunteer tasks. The centre offers hiking and tourist information services, guided tours, national park rental hut bookings, conference services and a small café. Tasks vary from customer service tasks at centre to outdoor work in the nature. The volunteers assist the staff at the centre and help to run the café. As a volunteer you might be able to conduct small... >>> READ MORE ABOUT THE PROJECT AND APPLYING TO IT AT https://maailmanvaihto.fi/en/volunteer-in-finland/esc-available-projects | Please note that you must download, fill in and send to evs@maailmanvaihto.fi the application form which can be found from the website!

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will be offered accommodation in a house within walking distance from the nature Centre Ukko. They will live together with another volunteer. Upstairs there are two separate rooms for volunteers and downstairs there are offices, kitchen, bathroom and living room. The participant should be able to adapt in modest living conditions in the nature with no frequent connections to the cities.

Volunteer profile

Moderate English skills are required. The work also involves physical labour in field conditions and the volunteer should be able to adopt to a variety of tasks. Our protected areas are located in remote places, where are no good public transportation, so we are looking for outdoor-oriented volunteers. We are looking for a volunteer who is interested in sharing in public (e.g. social media) their learning experiences during the volunteering period. Due to a tight schedule we are looking for a candidate who does not need to apply for visa or residents permit to Finland.

Project description

The volunteer works as an assistant in Lyhty C housing unit of the non-profit NGO “Lyhty ry”, which provides housing, education and work activity services for adults with learning disabilities. Lyhty C housing unit is a home for 8 adults with disabilities and it is situated in a lovely neighborhood in Helsinki. The volunteer’s tasks include supporting the residents, who are adults with learning disabilities to take an active role in their everyday activities. This means assisting with the daily household tasks, like keeping the housing unit clean and aesthetic, cooking together, doing the laundry and participating and supporting the residents to participate... >>> READ MORE ABOUT THE PROJECT AND APPLYING TO IT AT https://maailmanvaihto.fi/en/volunteer-in-finland/esc-available-projects | Please note that you must download, fill in and send to evs@maailmanvaihto.fi the application form which can be found from the website!

Educational project in Russia - supporting an NGO

Sodrujestvo, Russia

Cheboksary, Russian Federation

Apply

Project description

We are offering a 10-month volunteering service in Russia. The volunteer will be working in the field of education and promotion of volunteering. The volunteer will work together with Sodrujestvo staff and local volunteers. Possible activities are: Go to places like local schools, language school, culture house, etc. to run weekly intercultural communication clubs discussing the acute problems of the modern world, such as intercultural communication, tolerance to other cultures and, youth employment, drugs, and so on; support the English and German speaking clubs of Sodrujestvo and therefore give the locals kids an opportunity to practice foreign languages and improve their skills; be actively involved in the preparation of the training sessions for volunteers willing to take part in workcamps, and similar things. The volunteer can bring in own ideas as well.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will live in a shared flat. You will receive money for food and pocket money.

Training during the project

- Russian language training

Volunteer profile

The volunteer is expected to have a specific interest in the objectives and issues proposed by the hosting organization. Intercultural learning and voluntary work shall be interesting to the volunteer. He or she shall also have a positive attitude towards the organization of cultural events on a local level. The volunteer is supposed to be active, positive-thinking, expressing initiative, open-minded, flexible. The volunteer shall be mature enough to live in a foreign country. Participants

"Volunteering 4 Change"

International Initiatives for Cooperation (IIC)

Razlog, Bulgaria

Apply

Project description

The project "Volunteering 4 Change" envisages the implementation of individual volunteering activities on the territory of five European countries for a period of three years. The volunteers will engage in activities for a period of 9 months in the following European countries: Bulgaria, Slovakia, Poland, Italy and Spain. The working week of each volunteer will consist of 5 working days and each working day will have 6 working hours.The volunteers in Bulgaria will work three times a week with representatives of the local community living in the villages around Razlog.The topics that will be in their focus of work and that will be promoted during their stay are social inclusion, stimulating youth participation of youngsters from rural areas, enhancing the solidarity and tolerance as well as intercultural communication.During the rest two days of the working week, the volunteers will implement activities in Razlog, they will maintain the information channels of the project.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements will be full covered according the rules of European Solidarity Corp programme. The amount for travel is determined according to the Distance Calculator of EU.

Training during the project

Each volunteer will have a predeparture training with him/her sending organisation, an onarrival and a midtemr trainings which will bw orginised from Bulgarian National agency. The host organisation will offer different trainings during the mobility of the volunteer.

Volunteer profile

The age of the volunteer should be according to the requirements of the ESC 18 -30 years, young people will be sought with strong motivation to participate in the project and to work with the target groups, excellent communication skills, readiness for intercultural communication, adaptability to a new social and cultural reality and willingness to learn and acquiring new skills. It will be important for the volunteers to have artistic skills as well.

Placement dates

A total of 71 week(s) during the period 01/03/2019 to 30/06/2020

Placement location

Looking for volunteers from

Poland, Italy, Slovakia, Spain

Social challenges

Citizenship and democratic participation

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

Vitamin T18 - 6 month EVS - starting as soon as possible

A.C.T.O.R. - Cultural Association for Theatre and Origami in Romania

Bucharest, Romania

Apply

Project description

– Developing artistic skills (origami, theatre, crafts etc) for 10 volunteers to create social artistic events for disadvantaged youth – Build cooperation between the stakeholders of the educational environment through non formal and art methods. – Cultivate the importance of cultural diversity & performing arts in education and art-therapy Activities: - designing and leading intercultural workshops (in the field of non-formal education) for children in schools (primary level) and kindergartens • implementing clinical animation sessions for children & youngsters in hospitals & social centres in Bucharest and rural areas • promoting volunteering through non-formal activities and Forum Theatre sessions with youngsters • Organising the Easter Campaign Fundraiser for children in hospitals & social centres • designing and performing artistic social events for disadvantaged children in Romania • running the visibility of the project • creating a toolkit about artistic practices

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The organisation will provide to the volunteers free accommodation, a flat where to live with roommates, money for food, pocket money, reimbursement for the flights to come and go back home, reimbursement for the monthly metro and bus tickets and a Romanian telephone card. Volunteers will live in a flat specially rented for them in double rooms, with a kitchen and a bathroom totally equipped. They will receive 120€ per month for food, with those money volunteers will have to provide to cook by themselves. They will also receive 60€ per month for pocket money.

Training during the project

- On Arrival Training and Mid Term organised by the National Agency - basic trainings in ACTOR about socio-cultural animation and theatre – ex. psycho-pedagogy trainings, clinical animation, movie making/visibility, balloon modelling, origami, puppet/ shadow theatre, face painting, circus training; - Forum Theatre - Romanian language course;

Volunteer profile

Young person between 18-30 years with: – motivation to live and work in a big and challenging European Capital; – motivation to work with youngsters and children in hospitals and social centres (also disadvantaged ones) – motivation to work with children in schools (primary schools and kindergartens); – interest in any form of art (cuisine, music, dance, theatre, art, art & crafts, etc…); – interest in psycho-pedagogy and childhood education; – flexibility, adaptability and enthusiasm. - a CV and cover letter and availability for selection through Skype interview - fast e-mail response

Placement dates

A total of 24 week(s) during the period 01/05/2019 to 30/11/2019

Placement location

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Estonia, Italy, Spain, Portugal

Project 151: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11203_en


Volunteering at SEAD

SEAD

Salzburg, Austria

Apply

Project description

SEAD, Salzburg Experimental Acadamy of Dance, is a centre for training contemporary dancers and choreographers as well as a vibrant space that provides the public with performances and education in contemporary dance art. Founded by Susan Quinn in 1995, the curriculum of SEAD rests on the philosophical position that making art engenders knowledge. The premises that learning is by doing, thinking is by making, dictates the structures of SEAD's classes and requirements. With a faculty that rotates throughout the year SEAD provides students with opportunities to work with renowned and innovative artists from around the world as well as to choreograph and present their work to teach in the public adult and childrens education program offered by the house, to perform in and outside school, to participate in exchange programs abroad and to create and make life long contacts.

Volunteer profile

Participants should be interested in culture, art, performing arts and dance. Above-average social Skills and the wish to work in a positively challenging environment are clearly assets. English skills are a benefit as it is the main spoken language at SEAD. Typical tasks of volunteers at SEAD can be supporting the academy administration and coordination in their daily tasks in the office. Applications will only be considered if directed to volunteering.salzburg@akzente.net indicating the project applied for in the E-mail subject and containing CV and individualized motivation letter.

Placement dates

A total of 40 week(s) during the period 01/04/2019 to 31/12/2019

Placement location

Schallmooser Hauptstraße 48, 5020 Salzburg

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

!!! ONLY FOR EUROPEAN !!! Service Civique dans le domaine du handicap

ICE-RF et site d'accueil en France

Différents lieux en France, France

Apply

Project description

!!! Only for european citizens !!! ICE-RF recrute des volontaires européens, pour effectuer un Service Civique (statut français du volontariat), dans une structure française, dans l'accompagnement de personnes en situation d'handicap. La mission se déroulera du 02/09/2019 au 31/07/2020. Il est demandé à chaque volontaire de participer à une préparation de 2,5 semaines au mois d'août 2019, à Niederbronn les Bains. !!! Uniquement disponible pour les citoyens européens !!! (statut service civique français) ICE-RF is recruiting european volunteers to do a Service Civique(french voluntary statute) in a french structure in the aim of helping people with disabilities. The mission is from the 01/09/2019 to the 31/07/2020. All volunteer has to take part on a 2,5 weeks preparation in august 2019, in Niederbronn-les-Bains. !!! Only for european citizens !!! (because of the french service civique statute)

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Les volontaires disposeront de leur chambre à coucher individuelle. Ils devront partager la cuisine, la salle de bains avec d'autres personnes. The young volunteer will have his own bedroom, kitchen and bathroom are shared.

Training during the project

Il est demandé à chaque volontaire de participer à une préparation de 2.5 semaines, fin août 2019, à Niederbronn. D'autres rencontres de quelques jours auront lieu au mois de novembre 2019 et avril 2020. Before the beginning of the voluntary, in august 2019, everyone has to take part on a 2,5 weeks preparation, which included french courses, administrative tasks and many other activities. This seminar is good to meet other volunteers. It's organised by the coordinating organisation. 2 months and 8 months after the beginning the volunteer is invited to take part on another seminars.

Volunteer profile

!!! Only for european citizens !!! - A motivated european young boy or girl from 18 to 25 years old, - ready to give 11 months of your time to others. - interested in discovering French culture. !!! Only for european citizens !!! (because of the french service civique statute)

Placement dates

A total of 48 week(s) during the period 02/09/2019 to 31/07/2020

Placement location

Différents lieux en France

Project 154: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11180_en


Burgos Solidaria y Sostenible 2018 (BSS)

Amycos ONG

Burgos, Spain

Apply

Project description

Our volunteering project will involve 3 volunteers coming from different countries, who will be inserted for 9 months, from March 2019, in the context of Amycos´ work in Burgos and its province. Actually, the project aims to involve the volunteer in a local network promoting the Sustainable Development Goals. The main activity will be work in an urban organic garden and boosting ethical purchasing groups in Burgos, contributing to awareness-raising of concepts such as responsible consumption and production. The work will be strictly physical but depending on the characteristics of the volunteer there will be space to promote a “green” network in Burgos collaborating with other organization in educational and communication activities. Also, in according to his/her profile the volunteer will be involved in: • Educational and Awareness activities with children and adults • Social area supporting the immigrant population • Administrative and Organizational tasks from the office

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will be hosted at an apartment chosen by Amycos and in accordance to the basic qualitative standards. Specifically, accommodation will be in the city of Burgos (in a single room or twin room) depending on the availability. Sharing of common spaces will be encouraged with other volunteers; although the privacy of the volunteers will be respected. Accommodation will be in charge to Amycos and the volunteer to receive monthly 150 € for Food plus a pocket money of 150 €. Burgos is a small city and it’s not necessary to use a local transport daily.

Volunteer profile

Interest in the project: The volunteers have to participate fully in the project having the desire to contribute actively and agree on the Amycos goals connected with the social change to a sustainable development Experiences and competences: Considering the tasks that will be assigned, the volunteer has to be perfectly able and happy to do a physical and hard work in the organic garden Personality: Generally, we need positive, flexible and willing people able to work in-group and in a multicultural context Spanish language skills will be appreciated but they are not essential condition.

Placement dates

A total of 40 week(s) during the period 26/04/2019 to 21/01/2020

Looking for volunteers from

Greece, Italy, France

Young Leaders for Projects in Berlin Youth Centres wanted!

Different Youth Centers

Berlin, Germany

Apply

Project description

We are searching for volunteers for 3 different youth centers in Berlin. The overall goal of the work is to enable children and young adults from different backgrounds to spend some quality time. Whilst working with the young visitors of the centers is going to take up much of the work time, volunteers may also be dealing with updating websites and the social media networks. Tasks may include administrative work, the organization of projects and events, public relations and working in a student cafe. In some youth centers volunteers are responsible for the organization and implementation of weekly movie theaters. In addition, the volunteers will have enough time and support to organize their own project based on their personal interests. In previous projects, volunteers were organizing concerts, movie nights, screen printing workshops, journalism courses for school newspapers, photo and video courses or intercultural evenings for local young people.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Local Transport: The volunteer will receive a monthly ticket for public transportation in Berlin. Accommodation & Food: The volunteer will live in a flat, located in Pankow together with three other ESC volunteers. This flat includes four single rooms, a living room, a kitchen and a bathroom. Money for food will be provided on a monthly basis. Pocket money: will be provided on a monthly basis. It is about 150 Euro per month.

Training during the project

The volunteers are going to receive support and information before the start of their service. In Germany, they are going to participate in mandatory seminars. This way we are ensuring that the volunteers are going to be able to make the most of their time and have the chance for rapid personal development. In the youth centers the volunteers are going to be assigned a mentor to help. Another mentor, working for the VJF, is helping out with bureaucratical hurdles and problems that may be occurring in the working environment.

Volunteer profile

It is an advantage to have a some knowledge of German, good skills in written and spoken English as well as computer skills (including Microsoft Office). The positions require a teamwork spirit as well as the ability to work independently. The youth centers welcome motivated, flexible, friendly, curious and self-confident volunteers with good communication skills and a sense of humor. Gender, nationality, religion and political and sexual orientation are not considered in the selection process, the volunteers are chosen regarding their abilities, experiences, interests, and motivation.

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 02/09/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

Looking for volunteers from

Spain, France, Austria

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The apartment will have all the necessary utilities (gas cooker, washing machine, refrigerator, TV, furniture in bedrooms, living rooms and kitchen, internet).The volunteers will stay 2 in one room.

Training during the project

Project 157: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11149_en


Adventure at Veľký Lél

BROZ

Bratislava, Slovakia

Apply

Project description

At the heart of the Danube floodplains, close to the city of Komárno lies the Veľký Lél river island. The island is one of the last remnants of the Danube inland delta that once spread wide on the Slovak-Hungarian border and represented one of the largest and most diverse wetland complexes in Central Europe. To preserve this unique and fast-disappearing ecosystem BROZ is focusing its activity on the island with the aim to restore its precious habitats – mainly through grazing. To support this effort, we run a small farm and kemping site near the island with long-term aim of turning it into an educational eco-center. We constantly improve the farm and the offer of eco-tourism activities. The island is already a popular destination for school excursions and is often visited by cyclist travelling the Eurovelo 6 cycling route. A local association – Zlaty Hucul organises summer horse riding camps on the island. This summer we will improve the infastructure for canoing on the river branch.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will live on the farm - a small 2-bedroom flat will be provided in the farmhouse. The farm is a busy workplace, especially during the season spring-autumn (BROZ staff, school excursions, tourists, summer camps, visitors), so a potential volunteer should keep this in mind. Lunch will be arranged by farm staff (ordered form a restaurant in Komárno), breakfast & dinner should be arranged by volunteers themselves - from a small local grocery shop or a food store in the nearby village Zlatná na Ostrove. Volunteers will have bicycles for transport and can use the organisation´s cars.

Training during the project

We will organise an into weekend - introducing BROZ, our work & activites, tour of the island with an explanation of the conservation activites, ecosystems, local context. The volunteers will also take slovak language lessons with a local teacher. Any technical work (building grazing fences,monitoring invasive plant species with a GPS) will be explained by staff on the job. However, the volunteers will mainly be involved in helping with school excursions, horse riding camps, organising a horse riding competition, managing camping site - using soft skills (communication, management).

Volunteer profile

Ideally we prefer Hungarian or Czech speaking volunteers with knowledge of English. Nature-lover, communicative, good with kids, not affraid to take on a challenge. Someone looking to experience life on a farm, in village setting (although good train connection to cities). Interensted in conservation & education. Horse-riding or horse-care experience is welcome. Technical type will have opportunities to put into practice, but this skill is not necessary. We are looking for independent, motivated people with a positive attitude, who can suggest improvements & can put own ideas into practice.

Placement dates

A total of 22 week(s) during the period 01/05/2019 to 30/09/2019

Placement location

Na Riviére 7/A, 841 04 Bratislava

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Education and training

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 10/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 158: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11122_en


Together for culture

Šibenik, Croatia

Apply

Project description

Culture Fortress Sibenik is a public institution in culture that cares for the fortified heritage of the city of Sibenik, managing its sustainable use by organizing cultural events for citizens and visitors of Sibenik. The institution now manages two revitalized Sibenik fortresses, the Fortress of St. Mihovil and Barone Fortress. Tasks of volunteers: Work with visitors in the fortress entrances - providing service information: - about the prices and types of tickets (individual, family, student, unified ticket for both fortresses); - promoting content on the fort (heritage, renewal, what to look at) - essential information about another fortress, encouragement to go to another fortress - about evening events on both fortresses - promotion of the events on fortresses - available to visitors for all other potential issues - cooperate with the other staff and perform other tasks

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

During whole duration of the volunteering activity volunteers will be located in Hostel Scala in Šibenik. Also to all volunteers will be provided three meals per day and pocket money (70 EUR per volunteer upon arrival). To all participants will be reimbursed travel costs in maximum amount which will depend on distance provided by Erasmus+ distance calculator.

Volunteer profile

All candidates should have good knowledge of English and one more language (preferably German, French, Czech and Polish). We generally look for volunteers who are dynamic, creative, sociable, patient, able to work in a team, flexible and creative: we would like to host people with interesting hobbies, with their own ideas and open to different cultures. Strong motivation, willingness to see and to do something new, curiosity about the world and other cultures are welcome.

Placement dates

A total of 1 week(s) during the period 26/08/2019 to 08/09/2019

Placement location

22000 Šibenik

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Germany, France, Croatia

Placement topics

Creativity and culture

Training during the project

The aims of the organization is to offer social services to residents of the area and to improve their life living. Beyond the social services to the sensitive groups of population, since 2011, the organization implemened projects like Youth in Action Program and now Erasmus + (Youth initiatives, Youth Exchange, EVS )as a Hosting Organization, Sending and coordinating organization, in cooperation with the NA of Cyprus. This Project will host 8 volunteers from different countries, civilization, community, national environment that will provide voluntary service for 8 months f and will live in Avgorou village.

Muratsan Hospital Complex

Muratsan Hospital complex

Yerevan/Armenia, Armenia

Apply

Project description

Yerevan State Medical University after Mkhitar Heratsi is the leading medical university in ... Hospital Complex No.1 is located near the university complex, while the Muratsan Hospital Complex is located in Erebuni District of Yerevan city.Muratsan» outpatient clinic is located at the same site where the hospital can be found, and serves more than 11000 children of 0-18 year-old and approximately 3000 adult population. The republican medical genetic center is functioning within the outpatient clinic, where hereditary and metabolic diseases are diagnosed and treated. Screening and further control is carried out at the centre for children suffering from PKU. There is a play therapy room at the outpatient clinic, as well as a room of healthy child where classes of «Parents’ School» are organized and conducted. Laboratory Diagnostic service at the «Muratsan» hospital carries out the following examinations:

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Each Month the volunteer will receive Pocket Money and Money for Food and Transportation. The Volunteer will also have Armenian class in a language center twice a week.

Training during the project

After His/Her Arrival in Armenia, The volunteer will meet the staff of Huj Office and be introduce to His/Her Mentor. They will go around the city for some cultural visit. Project 162: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11077_en


Botanical garden

Yerevan Botanical Garden of the Armenian National Academy of Sciences

Yerevan/Armenia, Armenia

Apply

Project description

he Institute of Botany After A. Takhtajyan of the national Academy of Science of the Republic of Armenia, is the responsible body for plant collections in Armenia. The Botanic Institute holds rich herbarium as well as collection of 1070 species which represent 40% of the national collection (650 species) and shrubs which represent 51% of the collection (850 species). It holds the important collection of Armenian flora (1.5 ha, with around 750 species). The collection includes around 200 species of endemic, rare and declining plant species, and provides a basis for the study of Armenian flora, and the ecological interactions of species, in a relatively natural environment. The collection and cultivation of endangered plant species is considered as a main task of the garden (there are 400 endangered plant species in Armenia). The collection and cultivation of endangered plant species is considered as a main task of the garden (there are 400 endangered plant species in Armenia).

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

They will be provided with a good accommodation dormitory of Yerevan Brusov State University which is close to Yerevan city center, the capital of Armenia, where they live with nearly 15 long term HUJ volunteers from different European countries. Each Month the volunteer will receive Pocket Money and Money for Food and Transportation. The Volunteer will also have Armenian class in a language center twice a week.

Training during the project

After His/Her Arrival in Armenia, The volunteer will meet the staff of HUJ Office and be introduce to His/Her Mentor. They will go around the city for some cultural visit. For long term ECS/EVS : 2 trainings will take place in Georgia (On arrival training and mid term training) For short term ESC/EVS : 1 training will take place in Georgia (On arrival training)

Volunteer profile

Project requires a motivated, enthusiastic volunteer who is passionate about environment, ecological education. The volunteer will gain info of a basic knowledge of work with environment, have information about environmental issues. Will help with administrative work and contacts with farmers from regions.The volunteer should also have his own sights and ideas, should improve the works and make the area of the garden more effective and beautiful.

The volunteer will live in Prato in a flat, completely furnished shared with three other volunteers of the program in double rooms. The volunteer will have for food a monthly amount of 150€. Italian language course, training course.

Project with people with disabilities in St.Petersburg,Russia

St.Petersburg Charitable Public Organisation «Perspektivy»

St.Petersburg, Russian Federation

Apply

Project description

We are charity organization PERSPEKTIVY. We work in St Petersburg, Russia. We help children and adults with physical and mental disabilities. WITH CHILDREN WITH PHYSICAL AND MENTAL DISABILITIES IN ORPHANAGE (Volunteering in state run orphanage with mentally and physicallу disabled children(aged 5to18).We support and provide individual assistance to the children living in the orphanage. WITH CHILDREN/ADULTS WITH PHYSICAL AND MENTAL DISABILITIES IN DAY CARE CENTRE We help children with physical and mental disabilities from families of St.Petersburg.They attend our day care centre for children/adults on daily basis. VOLUNTEERING WITH ADULTS WITH PHYSICAL AND MENTAL DISABILITIES IN BOARDING HOUSE ( age of people who living in 18-60). We support and provide individual assistance to the adult people living in the boarding house. Daily duties of volunteer in the projects include: hygieniccare, assistance in the workshops, feeding, accompanying wards

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers live in 3-4 room apartments located in the center of the city or in the areas where it is comfortable to get to work from. Each volunteer lives in a separated room. An apartment is equipped with a washing machine, refrigerator, stove and necessary furniture. Apartments will be provided with Internet connection; however, a volunteer shall pay for it. Every month volunteers are given travel cards to get to work. Every month volunteer received 110 euro on food and 90 euro for pocket expenses. Volunteer receives language course about 2 months at the begin of the project

Training during the project

On-arrival workshop (The aim is to get acquainted with each other, tell our volunteers about our organization, and show them how to work with people with physical and mental disabilities), Mid-term workshop, Final workshop (We summarize final results, share our future plans) Workshops and consultations related to specific subjects, e.g. work with people with autism spectrum disorders, playing possibilities for children, etc. Holidays / travel (e.g. travel to Moscow, Velikiy Novgorod, Christmas celebration). Supervision with a psychologist (every 3 months). First-aid workshop.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for responsible, motivated volunteers with some social experience, people who are interested experience in working with people with disabilities, the one who is ready to do not easy but very meaningfull tasks.

Placement dates

A total of 54 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

Gorokhovaya ul, 64-17, 191180 St.Petersburg
