Project 165: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11057_en


Jumeler nos différences - Twinning our differences

Ville de Vienne

VIENNE, France

Apply

Project description

The objectives of the Volunteering project at the City of Vienne (local government - municipality) are to raise the awareness of young people of the international openness as a personal richness (intercultural exchange, openness to others, reciprocity, the topics of identity and citizenship and the acquisition of personal competences, etc.) and to promote, with the help of an international engagement, the dynamics of citizenship and active engagement. The mission of the volunteer is divided between International Relations Department and the local Youth office sharing a common focus: international mobility. The volunteer will meet and work with young people (15-22 year old). Examples of tasks: promote the value of experiences thanks to international mobility, encourage people to take part in mobility programs, share information about mobility programs, contribute to the building of an active European citizenship, and increase the value of its own experience.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will live in an apartment (furnished and equipped) in a youth residence open for young people (18-30 year old). The charges are fully covered by the municipality. Possibility of eating at the municipal canteen weekdays for lunch. The volunteer will only have to self-arrange for the food for breakfast and dinner (weekends included). Travel expenses from/to the country (arrival-departure) are fully covered by the municipality. The fees for the arrival (ex. plane ticket) are covered by the volunteer and reimbursed on arrival. Local transport costs covered by the municipality.

Training during the project

Two national seminars: on arrival training and mid-term evaluation. To meet other volunteers welcomed in France, learn more about French culture, share experiences, exchange impressions, etc. Online Linguistic Support via the OLS platform open for volunteers (French language). French Language courses at the “Alliance Française” in Lyon (one month length intensive language course /60 hours). The costs of this course are fully covered by the municipality altogether with the travel costs (by train) to Lyon (30km from Vienne).

Volunteer profile

The selection criterias are based on different aspects: the capacity to adapt to a new environment, the solidness of professional skills, the capacity to interact with the target groups, the motivation, the openness of the volunteer, the ways of taking initiative, digital skills, awareness of the culture of the home country and an interest shown to Europe, team work and the ability to work autonomously, basic knowledge of French (to facilitate the integration process). The link between the volunteers’ profile, personal motivation and the mission: international youth mobility.

Placement dates

A total of 44 week(s) during the period 01/10/2019 to 31/07/2020

Placement location

Place de l'Hôtel de Ville - BP 126, 38200 VIENNE

Looking for volunteers from

Greece, Portugal, Spain, Slovenia, Malta, Netherlands, Luxembourg, Lithuania, Denmark, Finland, Bulgaria

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 18/04/2019

Sign in / Join

Project 166: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11035_en


Technical / creative volunteering long term, Netherlands

Batavialand

Lelystad, Netherlands

Apply

Project description

The Batavia yard is a historical center for shipbuilding. On the yard, as much as possible, we work according to the authentic and traditional construction methods from the 17th century, as well as research shipbuilding techniques specific for that time. The building of historical ships attracted much attention of visitors from the beginning, so the yard became a tourist attraction. In addition, the Batavia Yard has become a learning and working experience project for youth and for re-integration of people. Stichting Batavia is a private, non-profit foundation which can be characterized as a combination of tourist business, educational training, and volunteer organization.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

- Monday to Friday from 9:00 until 17:00 (1 day free during the week) - At 12 o'clock you get a meal in the yard. - Food and pocket money: 326 € per month - The trips to Holland and back are covered (please keep the recipes) - Shared flat with other two volunteers in Lelystad (possible sharing the room) - All the house bills are paid inclusive wifi. - Bike - Transport card: NS Weekend Vrij (provided) - Dutch lessons. - Health insurance provided during all the project - We will make an activity agreement (AA) and you will have to sign it (when it’s ready we will contact you).

Training during the project

Arrival training and Midterm training, you will participate with other volunteers that are doing other EVS projects in the Netherlands.

Volunteer profile

The volunteer is working in a very active and flexible foundation, so should be able to cope with this. However we point out that the volunteering work can be hard. - Technical, energetic, open-minded, sociable, creative in finding solutions. - Enthusiastic manual work (indoor and outdoor) - Interested in traditional ships - Good English communication skills - Technical background Will be a plus to also have: - Knowledge about Autocad and/or Photoshop

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/01/2019 to 30/06/2020

Placement location

oostvaardersdijk 01-09, 8200AC Lelystad

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Liechtenstein, Italy, Malta, United Kingdom, Slovakia, Slovenia

Placement topics

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 167: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11021_en


Volunteers 2019

Kalmar table tennis club

Kalmar, Sweden

Apply

Project description

Kalmar BTK is a table tennis club located just outside the center of Kalmar and founded in 1960. Overall, the club has about 100 active members of all ages. The club is working to support youngsters and develop them to become better table tennis players. The club is an ideal association and has a board of 7 members. Kalmar BTK has its own facilities with about 16 table tennis tables. The club is often hosted by regional and international competitions and training camps. In the club activities include players of all ages, from children and young people to retirees and people with disabilities. The club also organizes various study circles and table tennis courses for both leaders, coaches, parents and players. The club operates activities based on school, training and organizing competitions and tournaments. CRITERIA! You have to be active or background in playing table tennis. If you also are/have been a trainer is even better.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Their trip will be booked by themselves with the help of it Kumulus coordinated if they prefer Kumulus will do so otherwise. Volunteers work max 3 evenings a week, no more than 35 hours a week. Are available during all holidays. Volunteers have three weeks of planned holidays during the period. The volunteers live in a student apartment/room in the corridor or own apartment. If more than volunteer is at the table tennis club, they possibly live together. The volunteers cook their own food themselves. Grocery store is located near the residence. Volunteers will be helped to book

Volunteer profile

CRITERIA! - Active or background in playing table tennis. If you also are/have been a trainer is even better. - English skills to be able to communicate with the members in the club (before learnt enough Swedish) - Positive attitude, interested in developing yours and our members skills in table tennis.

Placement dates

A total of 45 week(s) during the period 15/08/2019 to 16/06/2020

Placement location

Kalmar

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Health and wellbeing

Physical education and sport

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 15/04/2019

Project 168: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/11005_en


Confiscated Assets, Common Goods

Giovani Senza Frontiere - Giosef Italy

Casapesenna, Italy

Apply

Project description

The project "Confiscated Assets, Common Goods" will involve 6 volunteers from Portugal and Spain in activities of promotion and social inclusion of young people of the Agro-Aversa area within assets confiscated from organized crime for 8 months. This project represents a great opportunity to increase the impact that Giosef Italy aims to reach on the local territory and bring the European themes and more specifically those of the European Solidarity Corp Program in an area too often considered as a periphery of Europe. The volunteers will be accompanied in an important personal growth and training experience thanks to the skills they will acquire in the interaction with the territory, among the local youths and in the management of the activities in the confused goods.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

* food: volunteers will receive each month beginning sum of money to be able to buy your own food. In the same way, they will receive monthly pocket money. * Accommodation: Volunteers will stay in our facility in quadruple rooms. The 3-storey structure is set up to accommodate 24 people, each floor has two bathrooms, 3 bathrooms and 3 sinks and one for the disabled. On the ground floor, there is a very large common area with tables, chairs, sofas. *Transportation will be guaranteed with an automobile made available to volunteers

Training during the project

The project involves volunteers mainly to support the activities in the Paguro, and partly in other confiscated assets. In particular, the activities include:- Communication and Promotion: management and updating of websites, newsletters and pages of social networks and creation of multimedia and nonpromotional material; - Organization and promotion of awareness events and promotional initiatives in the area.- Support for confiscated assets: volunteers can work alongside the maintenance, management of customer services based on the type of activity developed in the confiscate goods.

Volunteer profile

The volunteers involved are 6, 3 from Spain and 3 from Portugal, aged between 18 and 28. They are characterized to have: - small English base, - openness and interest in different cultures, - Interest and awareness on the themes of the project, - Motivation to learn a new language (Italian).

Placement dates

A total of 35 week(s) during the period 04/06/2019 to 30/01/2020

Placement location

Via Raffaello n.5 IV traversa, 81030 Casapesenna

Looking for volunteers from

Spain, Portugal

Placement topics

Social challenges

Citizenship and democratic participation

Environment and natural protection

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

Volunteering activities - Czech Republic - Volunteers from Portugal

Kadaň, Czech Republic

Apply

Project description

We welcome 3 young people at a time, who are looking for a change in their lives, who want to see new experiences and learn new skills. Each of them will work in different center/service, but they can meet and cooperate at the events. We provide varied activities in which everyone can find what suits him the best and we can help him to develop it (types of leisure activities, children´s age group...). - Volunteer in Maternity center will work with the assistant and will participate on daily leisure program for parents with children (1-4 years) in morning time (8 a.m. - 1 p.m.); - Volunteer in the Kindergarten and Day nursery will assist a teacher according to day mode shifts (6 a.m. - 5 p.m.) Our Kindergarten provides varied educational program, including teaching English by play, therefore the volunteer with good English is welcome. - Volunteer in Social center will help the assistant 3 times a week with non-formal leisure activity program for parents with children.

Project 171: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10959_en


12 months EVS opportunity in project management in Italy

CESIE

Palermo, Italy

Apply

Project description

CESIE will host 6 EVS volunteers through the project YOUTH CROSSROADS starting from May 2019. the mobilities will last for 12 months, the project aim is to promote active citizenship, social inclusion and solidarity of all young people by involving them with different social background groups. Mobility and volunteering are among the most powerful educational tools for integration, supporting the acquisition of these skills, competencies and values important also for entering in any working field. Youth crossroads aim to build up with young volunteers, receiving organisations, reception centres and high schools a positive relation and interaction model, carrying out integration paths among local, with migrant background and new arrived (mainly unaccompanied minors) young people.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will be hosted in flats in a double room with a volunteer of the same gender, located in city centres; the flat includes a shared kitchen, toilet and bathroom, Wi-Fi. All local organizations that collaborate with CESIE are in the city center. Most of them are maximum 15 minutes by foot from the accommodations. In case of far distances, CESIE will cover the cost of the public local transport. At the beginning of each month, CESIE will provide food money (175 euro per month) and pocket money (120 euro); the volunteers.

Training during the project

OAT at CESIE office and at national level provided by ENAIP & Amesci MTE at CESIE and at national level provided by CEMEA del Lazio Final evaluation at CESIE. Online linguistic course and 40 hours of an Italian language course at the Italian language institute.

Volunteer profile

- 18 -30 years old - english language (level B2) - interested in the main theme of the project; Migrants, Integration of refugees, youth - basic knowledge & experiences in the field of EU projects (ERASMUS+ program) - strong motivation to undertake an intercultural experience -volunteers will have the chance to develop teamwork competencies and analysis of internal working dynamics of project management and project writing; -They will gain knowledge of European programmes, calls and policies, sports activities to integrate young people non-formal learning.

Placement dates

A total of 57 week(s) during the period 01/05/2019 to 31/05/2020

Placement location

Via roma 94, 90133 Palermo

Looking for volunteers from

Estonia, France, Hungary

Placement topics

Social challenges

Reception and integration of refugees and migrants

Education and training

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 30/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 172: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10955_en

CESIE

PALERMO, Italy

Apply

Project description

CESIE is looking for 1 young people to involve in 12 months long term European Voluntary Service (EVS) through the project YOUTH CROSSROADS. The project aim is to promote active citizenship, social inclusion and solidarity of all young people by involving them with different social background groups. Mobility and volunteering are among the most powerful educational tools for integration, supporting the acquisition of these skills, competences and values important also for entering in any working field. Youth crossroads aim to build up with young volunteers, receiving organisations, reception centres and high schools a positive relation and interaction model, carrying out integration paths among local, with migrant background and new arrived (mainly unaccompanied minors) young people.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will be hosted in flats in a double room with a volunteer of the same gender, located in city centres; the flat includes a shared kitchen, toilet and bathroom, Wi-Fi. All local organizations that collaborate with CESIE are in the city center. Most of them are maximum 15 minutes by foot from the accommodations. In case of far distances, CESIE will cover the cost of the public local transport. At the beginning of each month, CESIE will provide food money (175 euro per month) and pocket money (120 euro); the volunteers.

Training during the project

OAT at CESIE office and at national level provided by ENAIP & Amesci MTE at CESIE and at national level provided by CEMEA del Lazio Final evaluation at CESIE.

Volunteer profile

- Age 18 – 30 years old - Portuguese Nationality/Resident - English language – Basic - Motivation to work with different target group (children, migrants, disable adults etc..)

Project 173: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10952_en


LET'S DISCOVER THE AIX ISLAND HERITAGE! (2)

Solidarités Jeunesses

Ile d'Aix, France

Apply

Project description

The Aix Island (Ile d'Aix in French) is a small pedestrian island located in the North Atlantic ocean. Marked by an eventful maritime past, this island contains lots of places steeped in history, especially the Fort Liedot, which was built by Vauban and classified as a historical monument. This town is a loyal partner of the association Solidarités Jeunesses. In fact, for several years now, l'île d'Aix has hosted international workcamps.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation in group, indoors, on the island. Meals will be prepared by kitchen teams, in turns.

Training during the project

You will work on the restoration of the large west stone shooting site, which faces the Fort Liédot. The work will consist in de-vegetating the site in order to start traditional masonry work on rubble walls, to replace the stones, to jog and rejoin with hydraulic lime.

Volunteer profile

Volunteers should be motivated for the project

Placement dates

A total of 3 week(s) during the period 27/04/2019 to 18/05/2019

Placement location

17123 Ile d'Aix

Looking for volunteers from

Belgium

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Environment and natural protection

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 18/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 174: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10943_en


Circus Immersion - looking for volunteers from Germany!

Let's Circus

Newcastle-upon-Thyne, United Kingdom

Apply

Project description

Hosting organisation Let's Circus is a community circus and charity based in Newcastle-upon-Tyne which works with a range of delivery partners in the fields of youth work, cultural services, arts, education and health/well-being. It receives very little subsidised support to run its activities and it currently survives off a mixture of commercial work and user-paid activities. It relies heavily on voluntary contributions of time and energy in developing and delivering its projects, which allow young people from all different backgrounds and walks of life to access its programmes throughout the UK.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Newcastle is a small city. Local transport would be the responsibility of Let's Circus, and where working away from base, a no-cost option will be provided. The volunteers will be supported with information about local public transport and encouraged to have a lifestyle that can include walking and cycling as a local means of transport. Accommodation will be in a shared flat with other volunteers where volunteers will cook for themselves with the allowance provided.

Training during the project

Initial induction including IT policies, child protection in the UK, health and safety in the workplace, relevant UK laws, secretarial duties and other operational policies. Volunteers will be able to take part in master classes, short courses and different training opportunities for different circus disciplines.

Volunteer profile

Volunteers will be involved in all aspects of what Let's Circus does. An ideal volunteer will have a 'can-do' attitude as the tasks and opportunities are so diverse. Volunteers need to have least some experience of either administrative work, marketing or PR or have a grounding in the field of circus arts, or another related discipline, such as theatre, sport, gymnastics, dance or music, as the work involves engaging and developing young people through these mediums. Candidates should have an interest in pursuing a career in arts administration, as well as teaching/performing.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/02/2019 to 29/02/2020

Placement location

Newcastle-upon-Thyne

Looking for volunteers from

Germany

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Creativity and culture

Physical education and sport

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 175: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10909_en


Europa es Solidaria - ARC Os Tilos

Asociación Recreativa Cultural Os Tilos

Os Tilos, Teo, Spain

Apply

Project description

The main objetive to host an european volunteer is to promote the knowledge of Europe and of the programmes offered for youth, between youngsters from Santiago, in particular, and from Galicia in general. Moreover we realize that is interesting to promote between european youngsters the knowledge and relationship with another diferent cultures that living in the same frame of convivence, Europe. Finally we think that is very enriching to know diferent ways of working in the leasure time in the differents countries in Europe. Since our center is a center for and by youth, where youngsters are participants and volunteers at the same time, the participation of one young european volunteer it will help to a bigger diversity and richness of the activities offered. More information: https://goo.gl/EfZxK5

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The ETL Don Bosco has a rented flat for volunteers. The apartment has everything they need to live: washing machine, fridge, iron, heating, blankets ... The property is managed from the ETL Don Bosco, which will be responsible for paying all expenses: rent, electricity, water, gas... In case of need another extra accommodation we will search for a rented apartment with similar characteristics. The volunteer will receive a monthly transfer(at the beginning) to manage the meals Local transport will be not needed because the flat is few meters close to the organisation

Training during the project

The volunteer will participate in the same activities as the rest of the local volunteers and staff members, and will participate in the same training activities. The volunteer also will participate in the EVS learning process and he/she will attend to the pre-departure training, on-arrival training and mid term evaluation. The partcipant will have Spanish lessons according to his/her level and also he/she will be registered in the Online Language Platform.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for young volunteers with interest and motivation in cultural activities and leasure time with children and teenagers. We are looking for youngsters with capabilities of comunication, social skills, enthusiasts, creatives, with initiative and values and ideals about solidarity and europena identity. We value highly the desire and the motivation to participate in this experience. To apply fill the application form (with questions for your support organisation in your country): https://goo.gl/w2fCec

Placement dates

A total of 30 week(s) during the period 01/05/2019 to 30/11/2019

Placement location

Rúa Ameneiro nº 8, 15894 Os Tilos, Teo

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Latvia, Malta

Placement topics

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 02/04/2019

support a kindergarden in Vienna - Kindergruppe Farbklecks

Kindergruppe Farbklecks

Vienna, Austria

Apply

Project description

Our focus lies on intercultural education. The Farbklecks is organized and run by parents with two teachers. Our target group are parents and their children who support our pedagogical aims as well as the day centre on a voluntary basis. The group consists of up to 14 children between the age of 2 and 6 years. The different ages of the children should empower the social learning aspects of younger from older children and vice versa. Proposed activities As a volunteer, you will support the teachers in the daily activities with the children. A more detailed description can be founde here: http://www.melange.at/wp-content/uploads/2015/06/kindergruppe_farbklecks.pdf You can find pictures of the kindergarden online: http://www.farbklecks.org/fotos/

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Every volunteer has a room of his/her own and will live with an Austrian landlord/lady, with students or with other volunteers. We try to satisfy everybody with their room, but please also be flexible about this! Every room is furnished, there should be a bed, table and seats and a cupboard. You share kitchen and bath with your flatmates. Lunch will be provided during the working hours. You will receive food money for breakfast and dinner. You will receive a monthly ticket for the public transport in Vienna.

Training during the project

The volunteer will participate in the regular OAT, MTM trainings by the National Agency. Additionally to that, the volunteer will have the Chance to join free time activities and local Training activities organised in the frame of the Melange-Programme.

Volunteer profile

As a volunteer, you should be an open-minded person and willing to work in a team and fulfil tasks. It would be great if you are interested in cultural and outdoor activities. Since you should be able to communicate with the children and the staff, you also should be willing to learn German during you volunteering. ll available placements are open to everyone (fulfilling the general programme criteria). However, in the selection procedure a preference is shown for candidates with fewer opportunities.

Placement dates

A total of 25 week(s) during the period 01/02/2019 to 30/09/2019

Placement location

Vienna

Looking for volunteers from

Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia

Protecting EU Biodiversity - Growing as Active EU citizens

Life Youth Foundation

Oradea, Romania

Apply

Project description

EVS volunteers will work on promoting Education for Nature and Raise Awareness about Nature protected Areas in Bihor County Romania. Tasks: 1. Prepare and organise workshops about Education for nature for kids 1-8 grades in Schools in Oradea city 2. work together with specialised organisations in promoting the Protected Areas and and encouraging Ecoturism in these areas to people in Bihor county and tourists 3. Assist in actions dedicate to raise awareness about protected areas, the benefits of protected areas for Nature and Ecotourism 4. Organise trips for kids to visit the Protected areas in Bihor County, learn about Ecosystems and protected species, teach kids proper behaviors in respect for Nature and protected species

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation - in apartments in Oradea city very close to public transportation, market and shoping areas. Each volunteer will his / her own room or sharing room with maximum 1 person. Renting and all utilities are covered by ERASMUS+, WIFI in the apartment, Food - volunteers receive an amount of money for food at the beginning of each month, International transport - covered according to the rules of Erasmus+ maximum covered ( Spain – 360 Euro; Germany and Turkey- 275 Euro) Local transport - a pass which allows transport with all local buses and trams

Training during the project

The trainings provided by National Agency of Erasmus+ in Romania - respectively On Arrival Training. Sending and Coordinating organisations -provide support and help volunteers in the Preparation phase. Our Organisation provides: orientation at arrival - training on how to work with the team in preparing and running activities. We offer supervision, monitoring and feedback during volunteers active involvement -supervision and mentoring in organising activities, periodic evaluations. Training will be provided to ensure team has the skills for activities and for working with young people

Volunteer profile

IDEAL Candidate Young people 18 to 30 years from the 3 countries.- Germany, Spain and Turkey. We are looking for: people curios and willing to learn to work in outdoor activities, people passionate in working in and about NATURE, young people with training in the areas associated to Nature protection, Environment Protection, Ecology, Biology, Conservation, Wild Life protection WE WANT young people willing to learn and open minded, able to speak english basic, people passionate about PROTECTION OF WILDLIFE and interested in awareness activities about NATURE PROTECTED AREAS, EDUCATION

Placement dates

A total of 22 week(s) during the period 10/04/2019 to 14/09/2019

Placement location

Cuza Voda Nr.17, Oradea, 410101 Oradea

Looking for volunteers from

Spain, Germany, Turkey

!!! ONLY FOR EUROPEAN !!! Service Civique avec des personnes âgées

ICE-RF

Différents lieux en France, France

Apply

Project description

!!! Only for european citizens !!! ICE-RF recrute des volontaires européens, pour effectuer un Service Civique (statut français du volontariat), dans une structure française, dans l'accompagnement de personnes âgées. La mission se déroulera du 02/09/2019 au 31/07/2020. Il est demandé à chaque volontaire de participer à une préparation de 2,5 semaines au mois d'août 2019, à Niederbronn les Bains. !!! Uniquement disponible pour les citoyens européens !!! (statut service civique français) ICE-RF is recruiting european volunteers to do a Service Civique (french voluntary statute) in a french structure in the aim of helping elderly people. The mission is from the 02/09/2019 to the 31/07/2020. All volunteer has to take part on a 2,5 weeks preparation in august 2019, in Niederbronn-les-Bains. !!! Only for european citizens !!! (because of the french service civique statute)

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Les volontaires disposeront de leur chambre à coucher individuelle. Ils devront partager la cuisine, la salle de bains avec d'autres personnes. The young volunteer will have his own bedroom, kitchen and bathroom are shared.

Training during the project

Il est demandé à chaque volontaire de participer à une préparation de 2.5 semaines, fin août 2019, à Niederbronn. D'autres rencontres de quelques jours auront lieu au mois de novembre 2019 et avril 2020. Before the beginning of the voluntary, in august 2019, everyone has to take part on a 2,5 weeks preparation, which included french courses, administrative tasks and many other activities. This seminar is good to meet other volunteers. It's organised by the coordinating organisation. 2 months and 8 months after the beginning the volunteer is invited to take part on another seminars.

Volunteer profile

!!! Only for european citizens !!! - A motivated european young boy or girl from 18 to 25 years old, - ready to give 11 months of your time to others. - interested in discovering French culture. !!! Only for european citizens !!! (because of the french service civique statute)

Placement dates

A total of 48 week(s) during the period 02/09/2019 to 31/07/2020

Placement location

Différents lieux en France

Project 180: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10838_en


YOUTH CONNECT 2.0

ASOCIACION IDEAPOLIS.EU

Ayerbe, Spain

Apply

Project description

Il progetto si svolgerà nel villaggio di Ayerbe (1.200 abitanti), uno dei più importanti villaggi del Nord Ovest della Comarca Hoya de Huesca, Communità di Aragon. Il/la volontario/a sarà in contatto con diversi target group: bambini, giovani, senior, immigrati, ecc. Il campo principale d’azione è quello della promozione dell’educazione non formale e dello spirito di volontariato. Durante i 5 mesi di progetto il/la volontario/a darà il suo contributo: Nelle attività del centro giovanile di Ayerbe Partecipando all’organizzazione di eventi locali Organizzando diverse attività culturali o sportive e laboratori (manuali, artistici) per giovani, anziani, bambini, ecc. Promuovendo le iniziative dell’associazione e le opportunità di volontariato attraverso newsletter, blog, volantini, comunicazione nelle scuole ecc.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Alloggio: in un appartamento, condiviso con altri volontari. Il volontario avrà una camera singola; la cucina ed il bagno condivisi con altri volontari. Il viaggio andata e ritorno verrà rimborsato fino all'ammontare massimo di 275 euro. Ogni volontario riceverà un budget per il vitto, oltre al pocket money mensile.

Training during the project

I volontari saranno supportati e guidati dall'organizzazione di accoglienza durante le attività. I volontari parteciperanno ad un evento di formazione all'arrivo organizzato dall'Agenzia Nazionale per i Giovani Spagnola.

Volunteer profile

Al volontario non è richiesta alcuna competenza specifica nel campo, né la conoscenza della lingua del paese di accoglienza. I requisiti più importanti sono l’interesse per la tematica del progetto e la motivazione a mettersi in gioco in un’esperienza di apprendimento in un contesto interculturale. Il/la volontario/a deve essere una persona responsabile e propositiva, aperta al dialogo, alla condivisione e al lavoro di gruppo. Inoltre, deve essere motivata a vivere in un piccolo paese in una zona rurale e ad imparare la lingua spagnola. L'esperienza di lavoro con i giovani è benvenuta.

Placement dates

A total of 14 week(s) during the period 02/05/2019 to 11/08/2019

Placement location

Av. Estación, 8 bajo, 22800 Ayerbe

Looking for volunteers from

Italy

Placement topics

Education and training

Employment and entrepreneurship

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 12/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 181: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10766_en


EFD in Luxemburg

Luxemburg, Luxembourg

Apply

Project description

Wir sind die deutsche Entsendeorganisation für einen Freiwilligendienst in Luxemburg. Wir haben bereits mehrfach dorthin entsendet und haben auch aktuell eine Freiwillige dort. Man sollte über 20 Jahre alt sein und vielleicht bereits erste universitäre Erfahrungen mitbringen! Der EFD findet in einer Studentenorganisation an der luxemburgischen Uni statt, die sich um die ausländischen Studenten/innen an der Uni kümmert! Sehr spannend! Vielleicht als beste Beschreibung zu dem Projekt die Berichte einiger unserer bisherigen Freiwilligen: https://www.eurocircle.de/improve-your-skills-enlarge-your-mind-go-international/ https://www.eurocircle.de/create-unforgettable-moments-and-memories/ https://www.eurocircle.de/change-the-world-by-a-culture-of-welcoming-and-hospitality/ https://www.eurocircle.de/non-formal-learning-from-the-diversity-and-experience-of-international-students/

Volunteer profile

20 - 30 Jahre Bitte mit tabellarischem Lebenslauf und Motivationsschreiben - beides auf Englisch - bei uns bewerben: info@eurocircle.de

"Corners of Europe"

Aizpute, Latvia

Apply

Project description

Aizputes region youth house “IDEJU MĀJA” is looking for 2 volunteers from age 18 till 27, male and female, with interests in youth work, music, photo, video, non-formal education, self-development and are open to new ideas to create, work together and explore new opportunities. Volunteers will be able to organize events and workshops for local youth groups, help us to organize bigger events, organize language studies, work and help in music studio, participate in photo and video workshops. Daily tasks will include team meetings, preparation for workshops and events, planning activities, daily youth house activities (board games, discussions, cooking with youngsters etc.) and youth house popularization in local community.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation, food and transport are covered by the project. The volunteer will receive food and pocket money which is calculated by the European Commission and the National Agency. The volunteer will have a separate bedroom and will share the bathroom and kitchen with other volunteer.

Training during the project

Volunteer will participate in first day training in youth house and will join two trainings organized by National Agency on -arrival and mid-term training.

Volunteer profile

WE ARE LOOKING FOR VOLUNTEER WHO: • are from EU countries • are between 18 and 26 years old • are interested in work with young adults, teenagers and kids • are able to work individually and in teams • is able to take initiative • is creative and interested in music, non- formal education, photo and video • has intermediate English level • is willing to spend a year in rural area

Placement dates

Looking for volunteers from

Summer Volunteering at Kapraluv mlyn

Junák - český skaut, Kaprálův mlýn, z. s.

Ochoz u Brna, Czech Republic

Apply

Project description

Kaprálův mlýn is a scout environmental education centre situated in Moravian karst landscape protected area. Summer volunteering at Kaprálův mlýn consists of various activities:  operation and development of the centre,  helping providing programmes (e.g. caving),  work in the garden and campsite,  help in the kitchen, cleaning,  guests-care and info-shop shifts,  nature conservation projects,  enjoying summer time in the community of international volunteers and scouts camping at Kaprálův mlýn.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation Volunteers live in a two-storey straw house (equipped kitchen, common room, bedrooms) situated on a nice place just 50 m from the main bulding of Kapraluv mlyn. Food Because meals for the guests are being prepared we can provide home-made cuisine three times a day for volunteers as well, respecting individual diets; volunteers can also cook on their own in the kitchen in their house. Transport Volunteers get ticket for public transport, Brno downtown is accesible within 30 minutes. There are bikes which volunteers can use as well.

Training during the project

Introductory training in the organisation: health and safety, programmes, building maintanance, office skills, surrounding...

Volunteer profile

In accordance with the mission of Kapraluv mlyn Scout Environmental Education Centre we prefer volunteers who are interested in nature conservation, scouting, environmental education, sustainable technologies and leisure time activities for kids and youth. That is why open-mindness, willingness to learn new things and discipline are the qualities we are asking for. This vacancy is for volunteers with fewer opportunities (social obstacles, economic obstacles, educational difficulties, cultural differences, health problems, geographical obstacles, refugees).

Placement dates

A total of 4 week(s) during the period 01/07/2019 to 30/11/2019

Placement location

Ochoz u Brna 235, Ochoz u Brna Ochoz u Brna

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 01/04/2019

Local Volunteering Initiative - LVI

Asociatia Comunitati Pentru Tineret

Bailesti, Romania

Apply

Project description

The project is designed to consists of 2 volunteering activities: 5-month activity in Craiova and a second 5-month in Bailesti. The general objective of the project is: Develop a set of best practices in terms of promoting the concept of volunteering and social inclusion among youth in Craiova and Bailesti while strengthening the role and image of ACT as a local volunteering opportunities provider. Specific project objectives: 1. Adjust the working methodologies of ACT and develop new best practices in the context of mixing international and local volunteers . Develop a set of transferable social inclusion practices between beneficiaries in Craiova and Bailesti. 3.Promote the concept of volunteering and of the Solidarity Corps in Craiova and Bailesti. 4. Formulate and implement a personal development plan for a total of 12 volunteers 5. Create and implement with the help of volunteer’s non-formal educational activities for children's with disadvantaged

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

International travel, local transport, accommodation and utility fees, monthly communication costs, costs related to activities are covered directly by Association ACT. Monthly food allowance: 150 euro/month Pocket money: 90 euro/month

Training during the project

On-Arraivel training and MidTerm training will consist in meetings with the National Agency trainers. Capacity Building - Week 1 is focused on project understanding (objectives,roles,responsibilities,activities, rules to be followed)non formal education training(animation module), discovering Craiova (paces to shop, cultural landmarks,public transportation).Week 2 will be dedicated to thematic trainings(Social Inclusion, social work, best practice examples, needs analysis) and workplace induction(visiting and understanding the institution. Romania Lesson 2 times/week

Volunteer profile

The general profile of volunteers we will be looking for: - Age range between 18 and 30 years old - Unemployed - Has just finished a form of education or quit a job and is undecided about the career, study and future life path. Given our focus on personal development and the assistance we give to volunteers in deciding on life long learning goals we want to use the volunteering experience as a told to help undecided youth how to further advance their path in life. - Medium level of English – sufficient for regular conversations - Is a sociable, warm and empathic person

Placement dates

A total of 44 week(s) during the period 01/04/2019 to 28/01/2020

Placement location

Victoriei Nr.163, 2015100 Bailesti

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Project 185: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10704_en


Social Networking&Communications Volunteer with Graphic Design Skills

Vluchtelingenwerk Vlaanderen (Flemish Refugee Action)

Brussel, Belgium

Apply

Project description

Vluchtelingenwerk Vlaanderen (Flemish Refugee Action) is an independent NGO based in Brussels that defends the rights and interests of refugees and asylum seekers. Together with over 30 member-organisations and the support of numerous volunteers we work on facilitating the integration of refugees and asylum seekers; providing legal information, offering learning opportunities; stimulating active societal participation. Our project, Young Voices of Solidarity, intends to raise critical understanding of, and broaden support for the development goals set out in the People and Planet pillars of the European Consensus, and it aims to engage young Europeans in solidarity activities in order to strengthen cohesion, solidarity, democracy and citizenship all across the member states. Therefore, this project will inform, educate and engage young EU citizens on the facts and figures of the root causes of migration and promote recognition for human rights in an evidence based way.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will stay in Brussels under Euroepan Solidarity Corps (ESC) conditions, and is lodged by Flemish Refugee Action that is located just a 5 minute subway ride away from the historical centre of Brussels. According to the ESC guidelines and the workplace rules of Flemish Refugee Action, the volunteer will work 37,5 hours per week on average. Weekends are free. The volunteer will have 2 vacation days per month (in addition to the weekends).

Training during the project

Flemish Refugee Action offers its extensive expertise in the field of refugee protection and human rights advocacy so that the candidate will be able to work and acquire different skills while performing the following tasks: - Develop, support and promote project goals, including message development, social media content creation and media outreach campaigns - Ensure digital marketing content aligns with our project’s identity/message, and assist with marketing campaigns as needed - Develop digital content such as short videos, newsletters, social media posts - Assist to build a website

Volunteer profile

Tasks - Usage of Social Media - Assist with the implementation of the Strategic Development plan for communications, including newsletters - Assist in the production of advertisements, campaigns, press releases, and promotional materials - Create the look of a website, visual brand - Daily update/maintain of (graphic) content on the website - Short video content and editing Skills - Graphic design - Experience with graphic design - Good knowledge of Adobe, Photoshop, InDesign, Publisher, Illustrator - Proactive, analytical thinking - Planning and organization skills - Activist

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 01/06/2019 to 31/05/2020

Placement location

Kruidtuinstraat 75, 1210 Brussel

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Slovenia

Placement topics

Reception and integration of refugees and migrants

Citizenship and democratic participation

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

assisting English/art/music/sports teacher

Drunen, Netherlands

Apply

Project description

There are unique possibilities for the right volunteer. The ESC volunteer will assist in teaching children (4-12 year) in English, craftmanship, sports, culture, video making, programming and/or sustainability. This will take place during class lessons when some extra hands are needed, e.g. for reading and further small group activities, also after school. The ESC volunteer will develop new activities such as playing games during short breaks and lunch breaks. Ideas for this can be taken from the foundations TEAMUP. Depending on the interests and talents of the volunteer, he/she can help the professional with cultural activities, for example music, dance, acting, craftsmanship or physical education. During the summer holidays, the ESC volunteer will assist with Summercamp(s). Primary School De Duinsprong (500 children of 4-12 years old). It is a training school for teachers.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Food allowance and pocket money will be paid. Bike is available. Dutch lessons are provided. You will be part of 10 ESC volunteers and you will have your own room.

Training during the project

The volunteer will receive an on-arrival and mid-term training. Dutch lessons are provided.

Volunteer profile

Open-minded, social, energetic and creative youngsters who have affinity with children and are interested in music, acting, dance and craftmanship. Furthermore, he or she likes to organize and plan events and teach children.

Project 187: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10690_en


TRAINING OPPORTUNITY PERSPECTIVES - TOP

Regional Centre for Social Economy - CRES

Craiova, Romania

Apply

Project description

The volunteers of the TOP Project will be directly involved in the planning, organization and implementation of non-formal activities in educational institutions in the city of Craiova, activities directed towards the achievements of the project objectives. The main activity of the project is a 8 months EVS group activity that will involve 8 volunteers working in 4 high schools using non-formal methods and youth development principles to support the personal and professional development of 160 students from 4 high schools and raise knowledge on hate speech, tolerance and cultural diversity. General project objective: Increase and develop youth leadership skill, competencies and knowledge and provide opportunities for practice of leadership positions for both the target group and the volunteers while contributing to their personal and professional development.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

CRES will host the volunteers in rented apartments in the city of Craiova. Each accommodation will assure good living conditions (private beds,equipped kitchen and bathroom, heating system, running cold/ hot water, Wi-Fi).CRES will purchase flight tickets and together with the Sending Organization will make sure that the volunteer is well informed, has all documents and gets safely on board.Local transport, accommodation and utility fees, monthly communication costs, costs related to activities are covered directly by CRES Monthly food allowance: 120 euro/month,Pocket money: 60 euro/month

Training during the project

Pre-daparture training organized by Sending Organization Preparation, Adaptation and Training Phase (PAT) – start immediately after volunteers arrival and will last 3 weeks, each week with a different objective and agenda - organized by CRES (hosting organization) On Arrival Training -All volunteer must participate in the on arrival training which will gather all 8 volunteers and shall be provided by the National Agency . Mid – Term Evaluation (under provision to be decided by the NA only for long term EVS projects)

Volunteer profile

-Aged between 18 to 30 years -active, open-minded, creative, innovative, responsible and motivated volunteers -The volunteers need to be a pro-active and social persons who enjoys working with youth and to want to dedicate themselves to a 8 months long personal and professional development process. -The volunteers of this project should, above all else, show willingness to learn and see their EVS experience as a learning process. -Basic level of English (being able to make herself/himself understood by the others – able to communicate) -Genuine interest in working with non-formal activity

Placement dates

A total of 34 week(s) during the period 01/04/2019 to 30/11/2019

Placement location

str. Grigore Plesoianu, nr. 11H, ap.2, Craiova, Romania, 200485 Craiova

Looking for volunteers from

Spain, Germany, Italy, Turkey

Placement topics

Education and training

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 31/05/2019

Avatar

Szivárvány Törzs Közhasznú Egyesület

Apply

Project description

What you can learn: - lot of things abouth Hungarian culture and history - Archery,horse riding, Hungarian folk dance - to work with children with mental difficulties - how to organise an international youth exchange, cultural festival and write a project Goals and jobs: 1. Care about horses for the sake of horse riding of local youngsters 2. Care about our campside 3. Involve the children and youngsters from Vereb through different activities 4. Organise games, workshops for mentally handicap children 5. Involve more and more youngsters in our activities from the schools which are in the area of the lake. Help them to live with the opportunities improved by the Erasmus + 6. Help on the archery trainings of th e Rainbow Tribe 7. Build a jurta camp 8. Weekend camps or excursions with children 9. Office work: keep contact with international partners, edit photos and videos. And if you have the motivation you can figure out an own project and application!

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Location: Vereb, Velence and Kápolnásnyék, Hungary Duration: 12 months Accomodation: in Vereb/Velence Other volunteer: a 21 years old girl from Germany Food: Local bakery, restaurant or cooking at home Transport: bicucles, buses, train, car

on arrivel, mid-term training by NA archery, baranta, handcraft, horse riding, Erasmus+, informal and nonformal education, goals and topics and metod of our organisation, training about handicap childrens

Volunteer profile

The Rainbow Tribe which is giving support to the integration of the disatvantaged youngsters. Support them to be active, participating members of a peacefull European society. And build a society where the sustainable living, natural consciousness is the start point of the human behavior – atmosphere of thinking. The only thing you have to do to be part of our teem is to make a decision to go and contact us! You don’t have to be a genius, to have an extra professional skills, to speak english on high level etc. You just have to be open-minded, to want to help, to love children and nature!

Promotion de la langue et de la culture françaises en Macédoine

Alliance Française de Tetovo

Tetovo, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia

Apply

Project description

Le réseau des "Alliances Françaises" oeuvre pour la promotion de la langue et de la culture françaises dans 134 pays à travers le monde. C'est la mission de l'Alliance Française de Tetovo, en Macédoine, depuis 2001, et cette année, elle propose une mission de volontariat pour deux volontaires français. Tâches proposées : Aidés et accompagnés par leur coordinatrice, les volontaires se verront confiés les tâches suivantes : - Participer à l’organisation de différents événements culturels et artistiques; - Animation d’ateliers linguistiques en Français; - Sensibilisation à la culture et langues françaises dans les écoles ; -Autres activité si vous avez des idées !

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

- Les volontaires seront logés soit à la résidence universitaire de Tetovo ou dans des familles d’accueil. Selon ce choix, les volontaires reçoivent soit l’allocation hebdomadaire pour la nourriture ou le repas fournis par la famille d’accueil. - Une indemnité mensuelle sera remise au volontaires pour leur argent de poche. - Un billet d’avion aller/retour est pris en charge. - Les volontaires seront couverts par une assurance universelle pendant tout leur séjour.

Volunteer profile

Jeunes femmes et jeunes hommes âgés entre 18 ans et 30 ans, sensibles aux valeurs du volontariat et désireux de s'engager dans la promotion de la langue et culture françaises dans un pays étranger.

Placement dates

Placement location

Tetovo

Looking for volunteers from

France

Placement topics

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Project 190: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10645_en


GIOVANI DI VALORE - Banco

BANCO NONSOLOPANE

VARESE, Italy

Apply

Project description

Il Banco di Solidarietà Alimentare Nonsolopane onlus (Nonsolopane) is a Food Bank founded in 1999 as no profit and charity organisation collecting food and redistributing it to people and families in need. Mission of the association is charity as basic value of human being life experience: sharing needs to share humankind sense of life. More than 100 volunteers collect, store and re-distribute food at home to people in need, visiting each person or family and creating a relation based on solidarity and wish to share a new zest for life. Evs volunteer will be involved in the storehouse activities, the periodic visit to the families we help, the fundraising and foodraising campaigns of the association, the office and administrative activities Nonsolopane promotes sharing fairly and without any discrimination, helping people in need for various reasons (job loss,

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers are hosted in a fully equipped house, with two bedrooms, living room, kitchen and bathroom. The house has also a garden. The volunteer will share bedroom with another volunteer. The house is 5 minutes walk far the associations place. A food allowance is provided. A monthly ticket to travel in Lombardy 7 day a week is provided.

Training during the project

On arrival training is provided by coordinating organisation about the project aims and the overall community partnerships. Volunteers will also be given all the instruction regarding EVS principle and functioning in our organisation. Training on working with vulnerable adults is provided to all our volunteers by staff members in the hosting organisations and volunteer will be trained on the job with staff help . Volunteers will be given informal learning process support through the active participation to a monthly 4 hours group trainings on YOUTHPASS certificate.

Volunteer profile

All people aged 18 - 30, who have a genuine interest and passion for working in a community project to develop solidarity in various ways. He/she has express interest for the no-profit sector and the active participation in society.

Placement dates

A total of 34 week(s) during the period 04/02/2019 to 30/09/2019

Placement location

21100 VARESE

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Si cerca una persona creativa, vogliosa di mettersi in gioco ed uscire dalla propria confort-area. Necessaria una conoscenza basilare della lingua tedesca.

Project description

Due opportunità di volontariato in Germania a Hegenberg (vicino a Ravensburg) con l'associazione Liebenau Teilhabe. Per partecipare invia curriculum e lettera di motivazione in inglese a molfetta@incoweb.org, specificando a quale progetto (gruppo residenziale o scuola) si voglia prender parte.

Project 194: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10567_en


Conservation of natural areas in Campanarios de Azaba

Fundación Naturaleza y Hombre

EL ASTILLERO, Spain

Apply

Project description

The Campanarios de Azaba Biological Reserve is located in the province of Salamanca, in the cross-border area of Portugal and Spain. The location and characteristics of this enclave make it a privileged natural area for different species that find a favorable habitat in the meadows with Mediterranean forest. You will have the opportunity to participate in the monitoring and study of habitats, plant species and fauna. You will also participate in the management of the reserve, environmental education and communication and dissemination of the activities in social networks. In this way you will acquire knowledge about the functioning of the different ecosystems, the identification and differentiation of species. You will put into practice different methodologies of population study, you will know strategies for the recovery of species and the restoration of natural degraded areas attending to the management of the same and identifying the challenges as well as the solutions adopted.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will be staying at the Rural Tourism Center “La Estación” in Espeja, 10 km away of the reserve. You will have access to a common kitchen equipped with all appliances. Transport to the work center will be ensured, either by bicycles or by an alternative means of transport. Pocket money will be provided according to the conditions set out in the Erasmus + Program, food, accommodation and local transportation costs will be also covered by the program.

Training during the project

Activities related to the conservation of the nature and environment of Campanarios de Azaba will be carried out, among which are the monitoring or census of flora, fauna and habitats characteristic of the area, in addition to carrying out environmental education activities or dissemination both with adults as with children or university students. The volunteers will also collaborate with the tasks of management and administration of the Biological Reserve and maintenance of natural spaces.

Volunteer profile

There is no need for a specific educational profile but it is desirable to show interest in issues related to the protection of nature as well as motivation to work in various tasks both outdoors and indoors. The motivations and the benefit that the project will have on the volunteer will be evaluated, as well as the capacity to adapt to intense field trips that involve flexible timetables to adapt the activity to the behaviors of the fauna.

Placement dates

A total of 24 week(s) during the period 01/05/2019 to 31/12/2019

Placement location

AV. DE ESPAÑA, Nº 25, ENTLO, 39610 EL ASTILLERO

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 195: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10564_en


Conservation of natural areas in Cantabria

Fundación Naturaleza y Hombre

EL ASTILLERO, Spain

Apply

Project description

The “Fundación Naturaleza y Hombre” has its main headquarters in Astillero, near the capital, Santander. It is a locality that has all the services and is well communicated with other points of the region. The activities will be carried out both in the offices and in the projects that are developed in other points: - “Ecomuseo Fluviarium de Liérganes”, Liérganes. - “Centro etnobotánico del Pendo y de los Bosques del Anillo Verde”, Escobedo. - “Casa de la Naturaleza Humedales del Anillo Verde Marismas de Alday”, Camargo. - Montaña Oriental: high area of the river Miera. - Vivero El Pendo, Escobedo de Camargo. The activities to be carried out include guided tours, nursery work, aquarium maintenance, census of chamois, reforestation... These activities will improve your knowledge about environmental education and the different ecosystems, species, methodologies of population studies, recovery of species and restoration of spaces.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will be accommodated in a rented house nearby our headquartes, Boo de Guardizo, and it will be shared with other euroepan volunteers. Public transportation will be provided; access to field activities will be made on FNYH vehicles. Pocket money will be provided according to the conditions set out in the Erasmus + Program, food, accommodation and local transport costs will be covered by the program.

Training during the project

Work center Ecomuseo-Fluviarium, Liérganes, Cantabria: guided tours, aquarium maintenance, animals care such as otters, butterflies, etc. Implementation of activities related to environmental education; workshops, guided tours, visits, etc. - Work center Forest nursery El Pendo, Escobedo de Camargo: development of environmental education tasks such as guided tours; maintenance of the arboretum.Work center of the NatureHouse, Alday Camargo Marshes: monitoring of the fauna and flora of Alday marshes and other natural areas following invinvasive vegetation,helping guided tours...

Volunteer profile

There is no need for a specific educational profile but it is desirable to show interest in issues related to the protection of nature as well as motivation to work in various tasks both outdoors and indoors. The motivations and the benefit that the project will have on the volunteer will be evaluated, as well as the capacity to adapt to intense field trips that involve flexible timetables to adapt the activity to the behaviors of the fauna.

Placement dates

A total of 48 week(s) during the period 01/03/2019 to 30/04/2020

Placement location

AV. DE ESPAÑA, Nº 25, ENTLO, 39610 EL ASTILLERO

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Moving in another country means learning and adjust the new knowledge to develop as a person and help the social and daily life development in your community. Through non formal activities our project will redefine the habits and the needs of youth in Agros underline the need to respect our environment and our health. This EVS project means to adopt a Green life style in the most trendy way that is beneficial for youth as well as the environment they live in. The volunteers will be the example for the whole community as they will create events and implement various activities. The rose festival is the best way to support our aims.

They should also be able to work in English since the working language of this Project will be English. Gender balance and group diversity in terms of different social and cultural backgrounds should be taken into consideration. Bournemouth’s Chaplaincy and Housing Role Start Date 24 th April 2019 – Completion Date 4th September 2019 These dates can be negotiated before you sign the Volunteer Agreement Bournemouth’s chaplaincy service exists to offer spiritual support, pastoral care and moral guidance to the organisation’s staff, volunteers, clients and their families. In working closely with the Housing Department we support men and women between the ages of 18 and 60 living in our accommodations. The chaplaincy team also works externally through community outreach projects with people of all ages. The main activities will include: Support staff to deliver activities for residents including social, sports and artistic events. Help staff to oversee group sessions for residents such as “Overcomers Outreach” and “Snack and Chat”. Assisting kitchen staff

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Bournemouth’s youth work department offers a variety of youth-led projects for young people aged 5-25 years old in the Bournemouth, Poole and Dorset area, which focus on Equality, Diversity and community inclusion. Activities include open access youth work, children’s youth work, disability youth action projects and holiday activities, citizenship, community outreach and peer mentoring.

The long term volunteers will be working in Antalya-Turkey city center, in a nice venue. 10 minutes from the seaside and 10 minutes to city center by walking. We are mostly working with 16-30 age youngsters coming from socio-economically disadvantaged background. As a youth worker, the volunteers participate in some sportive activities such as daily walkins on Sunday, participating summer camps , will organize English conversation club, write projects, and help us to carry some projects, publish our news on our webpage ect. The long term EVS activities are not super sportive,so volunteers with motivation for healthy life and good English skills are welcome. The short term activities in Olimpos whis is 90 km from Antalya city center near seaside. Olimpos is a place mostly tourist come for staying in the nature. There will be 2 working area for all short terms: 1- is to work in youth camp as a leader, 2- is to work on caretta nests.

Voluntariado corta duración Turquía

Association Buidling Bridges

Sinop, Turkey

Apply

Project description

Apúntate ya a este voluntariado corta duración Turquía con el Cuerpo Europeo de Solidaridad que cubre todos los gastos. The project aims to help inclusion of the disabled people in the society by empowering their cognitive, behavioral and personal developments with volunteering work. Hosting organisation was established in 2012 for the purpose of creating and developing cultural and educational programs for the disadvantaged young people and women. We are a non-governmental and non-profit organisation. We are active on the field of contemporary art, non-formal education, ecology, entrepreneurship, local handicrafts, youth programs and volunteering, especially in EU programs. We provide non-formal education abroad and in our town with multi-cultural atmosphere for the young people that we are working with. We send them to European countries to learn in international group of young people such as youth exchanges, training courses for youth and youth volunteering.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

We are also the accredited as sending and hosting organization for the European Voluntary Service. Within EVS, we host young volunteers in our town in the rehabilitation center for the mentally and physically disabled people. We also provide traineeship in Sinop for the university students whose major is SEN. We also organize student exchange programs with different countries from all around the world. We also work for the disadvantaged women. We provide cooking, handicrafts, and English courses for the women who are lower educated and unemployed. We raise awareness on the animal

Training during the project

As the hosting organisation will orientate the volunteer to her/his service and the environment, provide a mentor for the volunteer and organise regular mentor meetings every week to provide some certain skills to the volunteer: basic information on SEN methodology, competences on personal development and intercultural competences. They will help the volunteer develop a tool to provide a new skill for the disabled person and be responsible to disseminate the project and its results in their environment. as the hosting organisation will provide a Youthpass certificate for the volunteer

Volunteer profile

The volunteer will organise fun time activities with the disabled people such as art, music, sports, drama, dance, handicrafts, games, etc. At the end of the activity, we expect the disabled person to have at least one new skill. We also expect the volunteer to document the new skill she/he provided for the disabled person with film, photos, power point, etc.

Placement dates

A total of 8 week(s) during the period 04/02/2019 to 03/04/2019

Placement location

Voluntariado en Austria en educacion pedagógica

Association Buidling Bridges

Thal, Austria

Apply

Project description

No pierdas la oportunidad de hacer Voluntariado en Austria y trabajar en el campo de la educación social, cultural y social. The goal of the organization is to make concepts for youth welfare institutions and to administrate them, to administrate child care institutions and to plan and provide educational offers in issues which range from pedagogical, psychological, school-, health- and job market-related matters to socio-political ones. Children and young people in a state of social need, who cannot live in their original family and are therefore sheltered elsewhere by the youth welfare. These children and young people have made all kinds of negative experiences: use of force as an “educational tool” in the family, sexual abuse, alcohol abuse by their parents, lack of support in school issues, difficulties to learn, behavioural problems etc.

Training during the project

Due to the socialization conditions which are unfavourable to the development of the personality they are disadvantaged in many fields, such as personal development, integration in the school, ability to take part in group activities etc.

Volunteer profile

Children and young people in a state of social need, who cannot live in their original family and are therefore sheltered elsewhere by the youth welfare. These children and young people have made all kinds of negative experiences: use of force as an “educational tool” in the family, sexual abuse, alcohol abuse by their parents, lack of support in school issues, difficulties to learn, behavioural problems etc.

Hacer un voluntariado en Reino Unido (cerca de Londres)

Association Buidling Bridges

sutton, United Kingdom

Apply

Project description

Apúntate ya a hacer un voluntariado en Reino Unido, esto es lo que te ofrecemos: tenemos estaPlaza de Servicio Voluntariado Europeo Reino Unido para participar en un pequeño pueblo (Sutton). It offers a variety of cultural, leisure-time and youth projects. We work closely together with other organizations and services such as, Princes Trust, local church;s and local schools. We promote an inclusive environment for learning and informal education to take place. By hosting a volunteer we aim to make them aware of how valuable they are and how much they will benefit the local community, as-well as the wider community. Projects include, Fruitful communities gardening project – A community garden project managed by Coventry and Warwickshire to provide young people with the opportunity to learn new skills and gain experience Youth work and sports activities – Sessions are informal and educational, with young people supported in their development and understanding of others i

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The accommodation is on-site, and a shared ( with another EVS) flat with own bathroom ( as seen in the video) although when possible we try to give own room.

Training during the project

There will be many specific learning outcomes and on different levels for the volunteers, the project will promote diversity and inter cultural awareness. The project will also give an opportunity for the participants to learn new skills, knowledge and attitudes such as critical thinking, media literacy and developing the initiative of young people helping them to achieve the outcomes of the project.

Volunteer profile

We do not have a special target group concerning the profile of the volunteer. For us voluntary service should be open to everyone. We believe that social projects are enriched through the personality of the volunteers and not only through their skills and experiences. What we do expect from the volunteers is that they are motivated to take part in the project and really want to be part of it. Basic knowledge of English would be necessary. As the project has a social focus, it is important that the volunteers have an element of resilience, open-mindedness, good work ethic, creativity

No te pierdas la oportunidad de Hacer voluntariado europeo en Portugal en el contexto de las asociaciones de jóvenes por 1 año. Thus the volunteer will be involved in supporting the Community School of the association, providing support to the monitors, and developing, under their guidance, the daily activities with children and young people (study time, arts, body language, science, computer, free time, etc.).

Training during the project

pon arrival, the host/coordinating organisation will ensure that volunteer attend an on-arrival training and later a mid- term training. In a similar way, during the performance of his/her tasks, the volunteer will receive support, guidance and supervision by the monitor/supervisor who is responsible for each activity. The host/coordinating organisation will ensure that volunteer have a free language training throughout the whole service. For personal support, the volunteer will have a mentor, with who he/she will meet weekly throughout the service period. The mentor will assist

Volunteer profile

He/She must demonstrate his/her will to learn a new language, to be open to experience a new culture and to contribute to support the people in a rural area. Moreover, the volunteer should feel the need to prove his/her personal strengths, weaknesses and limits, to discover a new environment and a strong desire to make new friends. Showing interest in foreign cultures and having this experience at this stage in his/her life will help him/her to make decisions for the future, both in terms of employment and education/training.

Aims: – Build a positive attitude of volunteers from local communities and other organizations and expand their view. – Creating a safe and creative environment for European volunteers so that they can effectively share their skills, creatively manifest themselves in the development of their needs. – To promote the volunteering opportunities offered by the Erasmus + projects. – To promote volunteering (in particular, EVS), not only in the institutions they operate, but also outside them. Volunteers will go to schools, institutions and other country organizations, to meet with them or offer the opportunity for the volunteer to go somewhere and present himself, country from where volunteers are, traditions, culture.

Training during the project

There is available various workshops – clay, wood, handicrafts, drawing, art workshops, as well as sports activities, cooking room. All workshops are equipped with appropriate equipment and materials. Center has a bus for excursions, as well as for going to swimming pool or different events. Volunteer will not do routine work and will not replace the staff of the institution. Specific volunteering activities will be developed under the supervision

Volunteer profile

No specific skills are required, more volunteer interest and motivation to work is important. Choosing candidates, care center will look for volunteer’s interest in gaining new experience, learning how to do and being open for communication, cooperation. Project closing event – this event will be a complete volunteer planned. They will choose place, time, content and form, as well as people involved.
