Volunteer at a Theatre in education company in Budapest

Nyitott Kör Egyesület

Budapest, Hungary

Apply

Project description

Are you interested in Theatre and Drama in Education (TiE and DiE) and art-­pedagogy? Would you like to spend 11 months in an inspiring environment participating in common and individual projects in the youth sector? Are you older then 18 and younger then 30? Project start: as soon as possible Length of the project: 11 months Application: continuous Nyitott Kör Egyesület (Open Circle Association, http://nyitottkor.hu/english) is an organization whose mission is to open new aspects and achieve significant changes in approach to education, and to develop the character and communication skills of young people and children by drama and theater. Our main target group is the age of 5­-18 years olds (children, young people) who are in public education, and special needs people from all age groups.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

We offer: - accomodation in Budapest living together with our other volunteers (6 people in total) - maintenance and pocket money according to the EVS Charter - monthly ticket for the public transport in Budapest/bicycle - drama, theatre, clown and physical trainings - professional mentoring and personal support - opportunity to learn about TiE and DiE methodology - to work in a supporting and professional environment, in the biggest center of the independent performing arts of Budapest - 2 free days per week + 2 free days per month

Training during the project

- drama in education - on-arrival EVS - midterm EVS - optionally found artistic trainings

Volunteer profile

We need: - help in the Maybug group (special needs young people’s theatre group) - help with photo/video/graphic design and creation, improve our online presence, creative campaigns - a continously maintained and updated blog about our activities, with personal reflections, observations - management of an online tool kit/database of drama and theatre exercises and games - help in international project coordination: communication with partners, event organization - help in watching international proposals, finding international partners

Placement dates

A total of 34 week(s) during the period 01/01/2019 to 31/12/2019

Placement location

Jurányi utca 1-3., 1027 Budapest

Looking for volunteers from

France, Romania, Spain, Hungary

Placement topics

Project 205: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10480_en


Development Support for Transylvania: Volume 6

Youth Association from Transylvania

Cristuru Secuiesc, Romania

Apply

Project description

We are embarking on a new adventure as we will host 24 European Solidarity Corps (ESC) volunteers in Cristuru Secuiesc in 2019 and 2020 through an already approved project. The candidates have the choice to be active in 8 different areas: support person for entities working with disabled youth, kindergarten, herbalist, www.keresztur.info news portal and host organization SUPPORT PERSON, up-cycling education and puppet show group MANAGER and as PROMOTER of rural traditions. Candidates can apply from 9 EU countries in 3 activities (8 volunteers/activity) for 6 month long stays: - Starting April 1. 2019: 2-2 volunteers from Portugal, Spain & Hungary & 1-1 from Italy & Latvia, - Starting October 1. 2019: 2-2 volunteers from Portugal, Spain & Hungary & 1-1 from France & Estonia, - Starting April 1. 2020: 2-2 volunteers from Portugal, Spain & Hungary & 1-1 from Germany & Lithuania. This is flexible as long as in the end of the project all countries fulfill the numbers written here.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will be housed in a rented house which is fully furbished with 5 large bedrooms, a spacious kitchen, 3 bathrooms, 2 living rooms, 2 workshop rooms a small youth center and a yard The house also has electricity, gas, hot and cold water and internet connection with Wi-Fi connection. Volunteers will receive 120 € as food allowance and 90 € as pocket money each month. The house is in the center of the city of Cristuru Secuiesc and it is a part of the small youth center and main office of the NGO. There is no local bus service in the city but we can provide some bikes.

Training during the project

The working language in the city and in the greater region is Hungarian, so the main focus will be put on learning this with a teacher, while Romanian will be learned with the Online Linguistic Support system. Training for all the 8 activities is provided and if volunteers require training on how to manage events, non-formal education, establishing NGOs, applying and managing Erasmus+ projects, we offer these. We will also offer a Digital Storytelling training so that the learn how to edit videos. Beside all these we also regularly have team-building activities with volunteers and staff.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for any youth aged 17 to 30 who is serious and motivated to come to a small city and support us in the development of a community with a lot of potential. We do not require volunteers to have any pre-determined skills in order to carry out the activity, only an inquisitive demeanor and an openness to learn new things. Also, we do not require participants to have advanced English speaking skills, we only require them to have a basic skill in English and an openness to learn the local language. Lastly, we are looking for energetic, creative open minded and independent youth.

Placement dates

A total of 26 week(s) during the period 01/04/2019 to 31/10/2020

Placement location

str. Kriza janos nr 11, 535400 Cristuru Secuiesc

Looking for volunteers from

Portugal, Spain, Hungary, Germany, France, Italy, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania

Placement topics

Social challenges

Environment and natural protection

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

Project description

The main challenge of this project is the implementation of volunteering activities under the "Second chance" program, a program attended by the young people from Roma communities, young people who have never been to school or who have dropped out of their studies. - Specific activities within an info point on ecological education and environmental protection in Dragasani; - Greening the Dragasani city and the villages around this city; -The implementation of sport activities; -Workshops on intercultural education, active participation; -Street animation regarding the awareness of the local community in order to protect the environment; -Media campaign Say no to the plastic bags; - Fundraising exhibition of recyclable materials made within open-door workshops.

Be Active, Be criative 2018

H2O - Associação de Jovens de Arrouquelas

Arrouquelas, Portugal

Apply

Project description

This is Social project. Volunteers will live in our local community helping children and trying to integrate them with the elderly population. Volunteers need to be prepared to team up with the "H2O" volunteers in all the work our organization does, both on a practical and logistical level. In Arrouquelas the population is mostly elderly, so we want volunteers to create a greater interaction between the young people and these people. The volunteer will work within the youth work team and will develop activities related to manual, pedagogical activities and occupation of musical leisure, holiday camps, thematic weekends, activities for the children's free time, photography, newspaper, outdoor activities and Sports activities, including others that volunteers propose.The project has a clear structure, but we are also totally open to ideas that may arise before and during the project, we are also able to adapt the motivations of the volunteers toour reality in order to best manage

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

"H2O" provides volunteers with a work space that includes the space of the association's headquarters with activity rooms, an office, materials and equipment that will be the responsibility of the volunteers, as well as the space security. computers; Sound and Television; Internet Office Supplies. will be staying in the village of Arrouquelas, in a rented house, first hand. We ask the volunteers to be responsible and careful. The house has a kitchen, three bedrooms (2 volunteers per room, separated by gender), a living room with fireplace, 3 bathrooms, 4 multifunctional spaces.

Training during the project

Language support Volunteers will have the opportunity to learn Portuguese and our culture. The Portuguese classes will be given by an accredited trainer, in a partnership that we have with the Secondary School Augusto César da Silva Ferreira in Rio Maior. Arrival and Midle trainings. https://www.facebook.com/h2oarrouquelas/?eid=ARBXKIPnm-wwsz-yE7PcAPlEQRCVuBYAI2xmLW9gz1QinKNK8NZoMsUESeFNJP__WWpk9INDVIEe1tDP

Volunteer profile

Motivate and active, to work with us in Social project and environment project. that like to work and live in small community in rural area of Portugal, 1 hour from Lisbon, in centre of Portugal. Show criativity inside of organization, like to take responsabilities connected with organization activities. Able to live with youngs from others countries.

LAST MINUTE! Ditch the "dis" in disABILITY. Social farm in ITALY

A Ruota Libera

Nettuno, Italy

Apply

Project description

Are you ready to leave your comfort zone and open for a new experiences? Do you see yourself being on a frontier of social changes? Working surrounded by nature, animals, family-like relationships? Well in this case – we are looking for you - a volunteer for 8 months project, in a social farm “Asino chi legge” south of Rome. This project offers an alternative surroundings (outdoor farm) and approaches (social agriculture) to practice inclusion, which lead to deep reflection to the meaning of what the disability is. The farm is open air place of learning for everyone and instead of focusing on DISability, focuses on enhancing different ABILITIES and learning to live with the values of respect, relationships and the natural rhythms. The main tasks of the volunteer will be to support the educators on the daily tasks of the farm (working in the garden, participate in educational workshops of farm products taking care of the donkeys), interact with disabled people and learn

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will live in the shared apartment close to the town center. There will be shared double rooms, a shared bathroom and common spaces as kitchen, living room and balconies. Wi-fi connection and utilities provided by the organisation. The volunteer will receive monthly pocket money, monthly bus ticket to reach a work place (3km away from the house) or/and bicycle to move around the area as everything is situated in a close-by area. The travel cost is reimbursed and the health insurance provided according to Erasmus+ rules.

Training during the project

The participant will receive: Volunteering training; Training provided by the National Agency; Language classes online and with a certified Italian teacher for foreigners.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for an EU resident, 18-30 years old, ready to START THE PROJECT ASAP and to stay the whole time of the project (March-December 2019). The participant should be open-minded, motivated to work in a natural environment, in close contact with animals, special need people and local community. ***Interested candidates should send their CV and motivation letter to the e-mail mobilita.aruotaliberaonlus@gmail.com AS SOON AS POSSIBLE***

Solo per Italiani: Volontariato fra i parchi naturali

Palūšė/Ignalina, Lithuania

Apply

Project description

InCo Molfetta cerca un volontario/a che svolga la propria attività presso il parco nazionale dell'Aukštaitija e il parco regionale Labanoras, in Lituania. Il partecipante sarà impegnato in visite guidate, tour, eventi con la comunità locale, programmi educativi, scrittura di articoli su giornali e blogs, manutenzione del parco e dell' habitat naturale. Il volontario/a sarà assistito da un tutor e un mentor durante l'esperienza che durerà 250 giorni.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accomodation: Il volontario/a alloggerà con un altro/a ragazzo/a in un appartamento con camere separate; cucina e servizi in comune. L'appartamento, dotato di Wi-fi dista 3 km dalla città di Palūšė. Per facilitare gli spostamenti verrà fornita una bicicletta. Pocket money: 4€ al giorno

Volunteer profile

Il/la volontario/a sarà una persona interessata alla protezione dell'ambiente, al mantenimento dell' habitat naturale, voglioso/a e capace di trasmettere la propria passione in materia ad altre persone. Fondamentale non sono le competenze acquisite in passato, ma la motivazione a prendere parte all' esperienza, in considerazione dell'argomento del progetto. Per partecipare invia un'email a molfetta@incoweb.org, allegando cv e lettera di motivazione in inglese.

Placement dates

Fraternity to break the isolation of seniors

Mairie de Chalette

Chalette-sur-Loing, France

Apply

Project description

We are looking for two volunteers who will bring new and dynamic ideas to break the isolation of the seniors residents of our institution “Foyer Jacques Duclos” (not medicalized). Our goal is to help the residents to connect together (thanks to various activities) and to the local community (by participating in local events). Volunteers are brought to : • To visit the residents at home : reading, discussion, small games, development of an home newspaper… • Participate in collective actions : artistic expressions, gardening, cooking, visit… Initially, the volunteer will accompany the leader of the collective actions. He can then determine an lead his own project. • Participate in the organization of local events : parties, conferences, festivals, commemoration… • Participate in professional exchange.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation in a studio with bathroom and kitchen. Free transport by bus in the agglomeration and a bike. Compensation of 465 euros each month (meal and spending money). One to three half day to learn French in a UTL (Université du temps Libre)

To have artistic sensitivity. Be enthusiastic, patient and enjoy teamwork.

Project 211: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10393_en


Research and conservation for mediterranean wetlands

A ROCHA FRANCE

ARLES, France

Apply

Project description

The project offers young people the opportunity to acquire competences in scientific studies of flora, fauna and ecosystems and to put this into practice by implementing projects for managing and protecting the sensitive and threatened wetlands of the Vallée des Baux near Arles. Volunteers will take part in observation, monitoring or censing of species, taking samples and analyzing them, protecting biodiversity of the sites managed by A Rocha by planting hedges, creating ponds, removing invasive species, setting up nesting boxes or perches, etc. They will benefit from French language courses, 10% of the time will be devoted to communicating about the ESC through different medium (video, stands, articles). 30% of the time will be spent on tasks related to the proper functioning of the Centre A Rocha France: - Welcoming visitors - Maintenance of the domain and its park, various tasks related to Community life.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers are housed at the study centre, which is also the logistic base for the projects, the head office and the hub for running the life of the team. They share rooms (1 to 4 people of the same sex per room, depending on the number of people in the centre). Lunch and supper are eaten together during the week with the team and any other participants at fixed times. Breakfasts are self-service. The team members take turns at preparing the meals for the group. Special diets are catered for. The centre is no-smoking. Bikes are available for getting around.

Training during the project

Training will be provided at arrival concerning the rules of life at the center, community life, week planning and project and activity description. Field work training is provided all along the project to the volunteer such as: species identification skills, protocols, use of observation tools and other field equipment. Training in database management, data analysis and report drafting is also provided depending on the volunteer skills at arrival. French lessons will be provided to the volunteer.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for volunteers who have a real interest in protecting the environment. They will need to enjoy life in the country and the contact with the flora and fauna, which means sometimes putting up with difficult conditions, getting around by bike, the wind, dry heat, etc. The volunteers will have to show that they can take initiatives in the tasks they undertake and take them through to completion. They should not hesitate to ask for clarification or direction if necessary for their projects. A basic knowledge of French is an advantage for the volunteers, but not a necessity.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/02/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

233 route de Coste Basse, 13200 ARLES

Looking for volunteers from

Spain, Portugal, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom, Netherlands, Slovenia, Malta, Luxembourg, Ireland

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 212: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10390_en


No One is Out- 2 months EVS in Italy

CESIE

Palermo, Italy, Italy

Apply

Project description

Migration is firmly at the top of the European Union's policy agenda. Indeed, the current data shows how the number of arrivals, mainly youth, in EU countries, firstly in Italy, is still important. Last data point out that in 2015 49% of third-country nationals were at risk of social exclusion compared with 22% among host-country nationals. Mobility and volunteering are among the most powerful educational tools for integration; the acquisition of soft and transversal skills is the foundation for further learning and the gateway to employment and social inclusion; a mobility abroad can deeply help to encourage these young people to improve not only their self- confidence, sense of social responsibility and level of psychological well-being, but also those soft and transversal skills which are necessary to enter in any working field.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

ACCOMMODATION The volunteers will live together in different houses with other volunteers belonging to other projects managed by CESIE in the city centre. Before their arrival, we will prepare the houses ensuring safe and clean conditions The volunteer will share a bedroom with another volunteer of the same gender. The cost of electricity, water, gas, are covered by the HO. Bedclothes and towels will not be provided. The management and the cleaning of the room have to be done in agreement with the other residents.

Training during the project

On arrival training, midterm and final evaluation at CESIE office and other training, workshops organised by CESIE.

Volunteer profile

EVS volunteers will implement EVS activities in Palermo targeting asylum seekers, refugees and young migrants and children from migration background; the activities could be run in shelter centres. EVS service will last for 2 months;

Placement dates

A total of 8 week(s) during the period 06/05/2019 to 05/07/2019

Placement location

Via roma 91,, 90133 Palermo, Italy

Looking for volunteers from

Greece, Germany

Placement topics

Social challenges

Reception and integration of refugees and migrants

Education and training

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 15/04/2019

Project 213: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10375_en


Face to face: Health included II

CIRIUS Kamnik, Center for rehabilitation, education and training

Kamnik, Slovenia

Apply

Project description

CIRIUS Kamnik (Center for rehabilitation, education and training) is a public institution, specialised for education and wholesome training of children and youngsters who are physically handicapped or have other various longterm illnesses. We offer a range of opportunities for youngsters to live a full and dynamic life beside offering them Educational and Training courses. We offer primary school and secondary school programs, special program of education, physiotherapy, occupational therapy, speech therapy, medical services and health care. Volunteers can be included in following activities: - organizing and implementing different activities for children and youngsters - presenting their country and culture - teaching basics of their language - helping with the organization of projects on local and international level - helping with sport activities and competitions, school garden, healthy life-style activities, different international projects - develop their own ideas

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation is in our new apartment, just a step away from our Center. Food is organized in our Center or you can also cook in your apartment.

Training during the project

Volunteers will have a constant support of professionals working in CIRIUS Kamnik. For the project we will train volunteers through basic begginers training, we will offer them on-going support. Volunteers will learn about methods of team work, group dynamic, method of active listening, experiental pedagogy, method of individual work and method of project work (from the idea, preparation, implementation and evaluation of the project). Being a part of activities will enable volunteers to get to know new and current methods of working with people with special needs and youngsters in general.

Volunteer profile

We are welcoming in our Center young people who would like to work with children and youngsters with special needs and recognise that every individual has something to offer to the community. We would like to co-operate with individuals who are patient, have good communication skills, are independent and like to work in a group setting. We support initiatives and suggestions and are looking forward to projects that can bring out the best out of people and support them on their journey of growth and inter-cultural understanding.

Placement dates

A total of 1 week(s) during the period 01/01/2019 to 31/07/2019

Placement location

Novi trg 43a, 1241 Kamnik

Looking for volunteers from

Latvia, Portugal

Placement topics

Social challenges

Health and wellbeing

No application deadline

Project 214: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10368_en


Smile To You

Asociatia Voluntariat Pentru Viata

Marasesti, Romania

Apply

Project description

A 6-month volunteering project aiming to prevent the phenomenon of bullying among children/youngsters in schools through non-formal education activities.The project takes place in 2 different towns, which are 20 km apart: Mărăşeşti and Focsani and will be implemented by a group of 8 volunteers from different countries. • 4 volunteers will live in Focsani and 4 volunteers in Marasesti town and they will work with children/youngsters (6-18 years) from different schools. Project activities will have the form of thematic workshops, organized in schools and they are aimed at providing a neutral area to the children/youngsters to explore the deep causes of bullying and the possible measures and actions to address them from a constructive perspective. All activities will be based on non-formal education and will be achieved through an interactive approach.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will live in 2 flats in Focșani and Marasesti, in shared bedrooms, individual beds, with common area, shared cooking, washing, laundry and social facilities, free wi-fi included. Food: Volunteers will receive a monthly food allowance of 120 Euro to buy food products and cook for themselves and a monthly allowance of 90 Euro in form of “pocket money”. Transport: Volunteers are responsible for arranging their travel. The travel costs will be reimbursed at the end of the project according to the distance band limits imposed by the European Commission.

Training during the project

The volunteers will be accompanied and supported at all times during the activities by teachers from classes and they will receive training at the beginning of their stage in order to become familiar with the way the activities will be implemented. They will receive ongoing support from activity coordinators, teachers and staff of our organization. The volunteers will attend the On-Arrival Training and Mid-Term Evaluation, organized by the Romanian National Agency. The volunteers will also receive Romanian language training during the first 3 months.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for volunteers who are dynamic, creative, sociable, willing to spend time with children and patient in working with them; • The volunteers should be 18 -30 years old and should not have bad habits; • They should be motivated, willing to learn Romanian, able to work in a team, be flexible and creative and open to different cultures. The volunteers should be responsible and they should have a non-discriminatory attitude. • The volunteers should be motivated by this project and able to attend the full duration of the project.

Placement dates

A total of 21 week(s) during the period 15/01/2019 to 15/06/2019

Placement location

Nicolae Balcescu 2, 625200 Marasesti

Looking for volunteers from

Belgium, France, Italy, United Kingdom, Greece

Placement topics

Social challenges

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.

ANAWOJ is searching for someone who is active, independent and creative to support our local and international activities. proposed tasks are the following: - organizing/or support events (logistic and content) in local community particularly for kids, youngsters and other volunteers - taking care of promotion, creating interesting materials (videos and photos), finding new ways of promoting Erasmus+, ANAWOJ and European Solidarity Corps, - assisting in office work (especial correspondence, public relations, updating of our homepage and local web-forum, edition of newsletter, creation of posters and information sheets etc. - organization of outdoor activities for children (in summer camps, forest activities or on playground, animation of cultural weeks during summer holidays) - Conducting "European workshop" in school, kindergarten and therapy center for disabled people,

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The life condition in Michalowo will be simple (for instance wooden houses heated by stove), so the volunteer should be sure that he/ she want to live in those simple conditions. The offer accommodation is in a nice and quiet environment, near nature.

Training during the project

Volunteers will participate in training courses provided by Polish National Agency (On-arrival training and Mid-term meeting), and in at least one training about animation-methods (for instance circus animation methods) for local activities. - organised by hosting organisation.

Volunteer profile

• skills in graphic design and making movies/ videos, taking photos, Someone flexible, who likes office work, but also move around when it is needed Someone who is able to manage his/her own time and is focused on tasks • He/ she should be open to live in a small village (3000 inhabitants). The next big city is far 40 km and can be reached by local busses. • The volunteer should be interested in work with kids and youth and need to have the ability to take initiative;

We welcome 3 young people at a time, who are looking for a change in their lives, who want to see new experiences and learn new skills. Each of them will work in different center/service, but they can meet and cooperate at the events. We provide varied activities in which everyone can find what suits him the best and we can help him to develop it (types of leisure activities, children´s age group...). - Volunteer in Maternity center will work with the assistant and will participate on daily leisure program for parents with children (1-4 years) in morning time (8 a.m. - 1 p.m.); - Volunteer in the Kindergarten and Day nursery will assist a teacher according to day mode shifts (6 a.m. - 5 p.m.) Our Kindergarten provides varied educational program, including teaching English by play, therefore the volunteer with good English is welcome. - Volunteer in Social center will help the assistant 3 times a week with non-formal leisure activity program for parents with children.

12 months EVS opportunity in project management in Italy

CESIE

Palermo, Italy

Apply

Project description

CESIE will host 6 EVS volunteers through the project YOUTH CROSSROADS starting from May 2019. the mobilities will last for 12 months, the project aim is to promote active citizenship, social inclusion and solidarity of all young people by involving them with different social background groups. Mobility and volunteering are among the most powerful educational tools for integration, supporting the acquisition of these skills, competencies and values important also for entering in any working field. Youth crossroads aim to build up with young volunteers, receiving organisations, reception centres and high schools a positive relation and interaction model, carrying out integration paths among local, with migrant background and new arrived (mainly unaccompanied minors) young people.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will be hosted in flats in a double room with a volunteer of the same gender, located in city centres; the flat includes a shared kitchen, toilet and bathroom, Wi-Fi. All local organizations that collaborate with CESIE are in the city center. Most of them are maximum 15 minutes by foot from the accommodations. In case of far distances, CESIE will cover the cost of the public local transport. At the beginning of each month, CESIE will provide food money (175 euro per month) and pocket money (120 euro); the volunteers.

Training during the project

OAT at CESIE office and at national level provided by ENAIP & Amesci MTE at CESIE and at national level provided by CEMEA del Lazio Final evaluation at CESIE. Online linguistic course and 40 hours of an Italian language course at the Italian language institute.

Volunteer profile

- 18 -30 years old - english language (level B2) - interested in the main theme of the project; Migrants, Integration of refugees, youth - basic knowledge & experiences in the field of EU projects (ERASMUS+ program) - strong motivation to undertake an intercultural experience -volunteers will have the chance to develop teamwork competencies and analysis of internal working dynamics of project management and project writing; -They will gain knowledge of European programmes, calls and policies, sports activities to integrate young people non-formal learning.

Placement dates

A total of 57 week(s) during the period 01/05/2019 to 31/05/2020

Placement location

Via roma 94, 90133 Palermo

Looking for volunteers from

Estonia, France, Hungary

Placement topics

Social challenges

Reception and integration of refugees and migrants

Education and training

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 30/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

12 MONTHS EVS PROJECT IN ITALY, ACTIVITIES WITH MIGRANTS & CHILDREN

CESIE

PALERMO, Italy

Apply

Project description

CESIE is looking for 1 young people to involve in 12 months long term European Voluntary Service (EVS) through the project YOUTH CROSSROADS. The project aim is to promote active citizenship, social inclusion and solidarity of all young people by involving them with different social background groups. Mobility and volunteering are among the most powerful educational tools for integration, supporting the acquisition of these skills, competences and values important also for entering in any working field. Youth crossroads aim to build up with young volunteers, receiving organisations, reception centres and high schools a positive relation and interaction model, carrying out integration paths among local, with migrant background and new arrived (mainly unaccompanied minors) young people.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will be hosted in flats in a double room with a volunteer of the same gender, located in city centres; the flat includes a shared kitchen, toilet and bathroom, Wi-Fi. All local organizations that collaborate with CESIE are in the city center. Most of them are maximum 15 minutes by foot from the accommodations. In case of far distances, CESIE will cover the cost of the public local transport. At the beginning of each month, CESIE will provide food money (175 euro per month) and pocket money (120 euro); the volunteers.

Training during the project

OAT at CESIE office and at national level provided by ENAIP & Amesci MTE at CESIE and at national level provided by CEMEA del Lazio Final evaluation at CESIE.

Volunteer profile

- Age 18 – 30 years old - Portuguese Nationality/Resident - English language – Basic - Motivation to work with different target group (children, migrants, disable adults etc..)

Placement dates

A total of 62 week(s) during the period 01/05/2019 to 30/06/2020

Placement location

VIA ROMA 94, 90133 PALERMO

Looking for volunteers from

Portugal

Placement topics

Social challenges

Reception and integration of refugees and migrants

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 28/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 219: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10952_en


LET'S DISCOVER THE AIX ISLAND HERITAGE! (2)

Solidarités Jeunesses

Ile d'Aix, France

Apply

Project description

The Aix Island (Ile d'Aix in French) is a small pedestrian island located in the North Atlantic ocean. Marked by an eventful maritime past, this island contains lots of places steeped in history, especially the Fort Liedot, which was built by Vauban and classified as a historical monument. This town is a loyal partner of the association Solidarités Jeunesses. In fact, for several years now, l'île d'Aix has hosted international workcamps.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation in group, indoors, on the island. Meals will be prepared by kitchen teams, in turns.

Training during the project

You will work on the restoration of the large west stone shooting site, which faces the Fort Liédot. The work will consist in de-vegetating the site in order to start traditional masonry work on rubble walls, to replace the stones, to jog and rejoin with hydraulic lime.

Volunteer profile

Volunteers should be motivated for the project

Placement dates

A total of 3 week(s) during the period 27/04/2019 to 18/05/2019

Placement location

17123 Ile d'Aix

Looking for volunteers from

Belgium

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Environment and natural protection

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 18/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 220: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10943_en


Circus Immersion - looking for volunteers from Germany!

Let's Circus

Newcastle-upon-Thyne, United Kingdom

Apply

Project description

Hosting organisation Let's Circus is a community circus and charity based in Newcastle-upon-Tyne which works with a range of delivery partners in the fields of youth work, cultural services, arts, education and health/well-being. It receives very little subsidised support to run its activities and it currently survives off a mixture of commercial work and user-paid activities. It relies heavily on voluntary contributions of time and energy in developing and delivering its projects, which allow young people from all different backgrounds and walks of life to access its programmes throughout the UK.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Newcastle is a small city. Local transport would be the responsibility of Let's Circus, and where working away from base, a no-cost option will be provided. The volunteers will be supported with information about local public transport and encouraged to have a lifestyle that can include walking and cycling as a local means of transport. Accommodation will be in a shared flat with other volunteers where volunteers will cook for themselves with the allowance provided.

Training during the project

Initial induction including IT policies, child protection in the UK, health and safety in the workplace, relevant UK laws, secretarial duties and other operational policies. Volunteers will be able to take part in master classes, short courses and different training opportunities for different circus disciplines.

Volunteer profile

Volunteers will be involved in all aspects of what Let's Circus does. An ideal volunteer will have a 'can-do' attitude as the tasks and opportunities are so diverse. Volunteers need to have least some experience of either administrative work, marketing or PR or have a grounding in the field of circus arts, or another related discipline, such as theatre, sport, gymnastics, dance or music, as the work involves engaging and developing young people through these mediums. Candidates should have an interest in pursuing a career in arts administration, as well as teaching/performing.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/02/2019 to 29/02/2020

Placement location

Newcastle-upon-Thyne

Looking for volunteers from

Germany

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Creativity and culture

Physical education and sport

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 221: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10909_en


Europa es Solidaria - ARC Os Tilos

Asociación Recreativa Cultural Os Tilos

Os Tilos, Teo, Spain

Apply

Project description

The main objetive to host an european volunteer is to promote the knowledge of Europe and of the programmes offered for youth, between youngsters from Santiago, in particular, and from Galicia in general. Moreover we realize that is interesting to promote between european youngsters the knowledge and relationship with another diferent cultures that living in the same frame of convivence, Europe. Finally we think that is very enriching to know diferent ways of working in the leasure time in the differents countries in Europe. Since our center is a center for and by youth, where youngsters are participants and volunteers at the same time, the participation of one young european volunteer it will help to a bigger diversity and richness of the activities offered. More information: https://goo.gl/EfZxK5

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The ETL Don Bosco has a rented flat for volunteers. The apartment has everything they need to live: washing machine, fridge, iron, heating, blankets ... The property is managed from the ETL Don Bosco, which will be responsible for paying all expenses: rent, electricity, water, gas... In case of need another extra accommodation we will search for a rented apartment with similar characteristics. The volunteer will receive a monthly transfer(at the beginning) to manage the meals Local transport will be not needed because the flat is few meters close to the organisation

Training during the project

The volunteer will participate in the same activities as the rest of the local volunteers and staff members, and will participate in the same training activities. The volunteer also will participate in the EVS learning process and he/she will attend to the pre-departure training, on-arrival training and mid term evaluation. The partcipant will have Spanish lessons according to his/her level and also he/she will be registered in the Online Language Platform.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for young volunteers with interest and motivation in cultural activities and leasure time with children and teenagers. We are looking for youngsters with capabilities of comunication, social skills, enthusiasts, creatives, with initiative and values and ideals about solidarity and europena identity. We value highly the desire and the motivation to participate in this experience. To apply fill the application form (with questions for your support organisation in your country): https://goo.gl/w2fCec

Placement dates

A total of 30 week(s) during the period 01/05/2019 to 30/11/2019

Placement location

Rúa Ameneiro nº 8, 15894 Os Tilos, Teo

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Latvia, Malta

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Impact through Scouting

The Scout Association of Malta

Ghajn Tuffieha & Floriana, Malta

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

The project will bring 4 volunteers from 4 different countries to have a long-term EVS supporting The Scout Association of Malta and Ghajn Tuffieha International Campsite both in its building and nature maintenance, administration, reception as well as campsite and national activities. The activities being proposed will be done within a scouting context and hence it would be better that volunteers love being outdoors, working in a team as well as helping out with young scouts. LINK TO VOLUNTEER INFO PACK: http://bit.ly/2sT2HZ0

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Shared accommodation will initially be provided at St Pauls Bay, with all necessary utilities (including kitchen, washing machine and internet). Accommodation will then be offered in a shared apartment. A monthly allowance (Euro160) is given for food expenses at the start of each month. Apart from this, each volunteer is entitled to Euro 5 daily as monthly pocket money. A Public Transport Card is provided free of charge along with free monthly top up. This allows the volunteer to travel freely within the Maltese islands both during volunteering hours and free time.

Training during the project

This EVS experience is aimed at supporting each volunteer to discover hidden talents and support his/her learning course. The experience will provide: External -Introduction to Health and Safety Awareness -Basic First Aid Course -Possibly Fire-fighting Course -On Arrival Training -Mid-Term Training -Online Language System (ENGLISH only) Internal -1-2 week Intro to Project & Malta -Team Building Activity every month -2 day Course (Introduction to Scouting) -E-learning Modules regarding Scouting and Leadership Course -Group Support Preparation & Integration

Volunteer profile

A volunteer from Turkey & the Czech Republic is still needed. They will join the project which started in mid-Feb 2019 with a Lithuanian and Italian volunteer. Apply via evs@scout.org.mt All participants from different strata of the society are welcome to volunteer as long as they uphold the Scout Promise and the Scout Law (can be accessed on http://www.scout.org/node/64) during their volunteering placement. The participants need to have an open mind and be able to work and communicate with a number of people and local volunteers

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/04/2019 to 30/06/2020

Placement location

Ghajn Tuffieha & Floriana

Looking for volunteers from

Czech Republic, Turkey

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Education and training

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 31/03/2019

support a kindergarden in Vienna - Kindergruppe Farbklecks

Kindergruppe Farbklecks

Vienna, Austria

Apply

Project description

Our focus lies on intercultural education. The Farbklecks is organized and run by parents with two teachers. Our target group are parents and their children who support our pedagogical aims as well as the day centre on a voluntary basis. The group consists of up to 14 children between the age of 2 and 6 years. The different ages of the children should empower the social learning aspects of younger from older children and vice versa. Proposed activities As a volunteer, you will support the teachers in the daily activities with the children. A more detailed description can be founde here: http://www.melange.at/wp-content/uploads/2015/06/kindergruppe_farbklecks.pdf You can find pictures of the kindergarden online: http://www.farbklecks.org/fotos/

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Every volunteer has a room of his/her own and will live with an Austrian landlord/lady, with students or with other volunteers. We try to satisfy everybody with their room, but please also be flexible about this! Every room is furnished, there should be a bed, table and seats and a cupboard. You share kitchen and bath with your flatmates. Lunch will be provided during the working hours. You will receive food money for breakfast and dinner. You will receive a monthly ticket for the public transport in Vienna.

Training during the project

The volunteer will participate in the regular OAT, MTM trainings by the National Agency. Additionally to that, the volunteer will have the Chance to join free time activities and local Training activities organised in the frame of the Melange-Programme.

Volunteer profile

As a volunteer, you should be an open-minded person and willing to work in a team and fulfil tasks. It would be great if you are interested in cultural and outdoor activities. Since you should be able to communicate with the children and the staff, you also should be willing to learn German during you volunteering. ll available placements are open to everyone (fulfilling the general programme criteria). However, in the selection procedure a preference is shown for candidates with fewer opportunities.

Placement dates

A total of 25 week(s) during the period 01/02/2019 to 30/09/2019

Placement location

Vienna

Looking for volunteers from

Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia

Placement topics

Education and training

No application deadline

Protecting EU Biodiversity - Growing as Active EU citizens

Life Youth Foundation

Oradea, Romania

Apply

Project description

EVS volunteers will work on promoting Education for Nature and Raise Awareness about Nature protected Areas in Bihor County Romania. Tasks: 1. Prepare and organise workshops about Education for nature for kids 1-8 grades in Schools in Oradea city 2. work together with specialised organisations in promoting the Protected Areas and and encouraging Ecoturism in these areas to people in Bihor county and tourists 3. Assist in actions dedicate to raise awareness about protected areas, the benefits of protected areas for Nature and Ecotourism 4. Organise trips for kids to visit the Protected areas in Bihor County, learn about Ecosystems and protected species, teach kids proper behaviors in respect for Nature and protected species

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation - in apartments in Oradea city very close to public transportation, market and shoping areas. Each volunteer will his / her own room or sharing room with maximum 1 person. Renting and all utilities are covered by ERASMUS+, WIFI in the apartment, Food - volunteers receive an amount of money for food at the beginning of each month, International transport - covered according to the rules of Erasmus+ maximum covered ( Spain – 360 Euro; Germany and Turkey- 275 Euro) Local transport - a pass which allows transport with all local buses and trams

Training during the project

The trainings provided by National Agency of Erasmus+ in Romania - respectively On Arrival Training. Sending and Coordinating organisations -provide support and help volunteers in the Preparation phase. Our Organisation provides: orientation at arrival - training on how to work with the team in preparing and running activities. We offer supervision, monitoring and feedback during volunteers active involvement -supervision and mentoring in organising activities, periodic evaluations. Training will be provided to ensure team has the skills for activities and for working with young people

Volunteer profile

IDEAL Candidate Young people 18 to 30 years from the 3 countries.- Germany, Spain and Turkey. We are looking for: people curios and willing to learn to work in outdoor activities, people passionate in working in and about NATURE, young people with training in the areas associated to Nature protection, Environment Protection, Ecology, Biology, Conservation, Wild Life protection WE WANT young people willing to learn and open minded, able to speak english basic, people passionate about PROTECTION OF WILDLIFE and interested in awareness activities about NATURE PROTECTED AREAS, EDUCATION

Placement dates

A total of 22 week(s) during the period 10/04/2019 to 14/09/2019

Placement location

Looking for volunteers from

Spain, Germany, Turkey

!!! ONLY FOR EUROPEAN !!! Service Civique avec des personnes âgées

ICE-RF

Différents lieux en France, France

Apply

Project description

!!! Only for european citizens !!! ICE-RF recrute des volontaires européens, pour effectuer un Service Civique (statut français du volontariat), dans une structure française, dans l'accompagnement de personnes âgées. La mission se déroulera du 02/09/2019 au 31/07/2020. Il est demandé à chaque volontaire de participer à une préparation de 2,5 semaines au mois d'août 2019, à Niederbronn les Bains. !!! Uniquement disponible pour les citoyens européens !!! (statut service civique français) ICE-RF is recruiting european volunteers to do a Service Civique (french voluntary statute) in a french structure in the aim of helping elderly people. The mission is from the 02/09/2019 to the 31/07/2020. All volunteer has to take part on a 2,5 weeks preparation in august 2019, in Niederbronn-les-Bains. !!! Only for european citizens !!! (because of the french service civique statute)

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Les volontaires disposeront de leur chambre à coucher individuelle. Ils devront partager la cuisine, la salle de bains avec d'autres personnes. The young volunteer will have his own bedroom, kitchen and bathroom are shared.

Training during the project

Il est demandé à chaque volontaire de participer à une préparation de 2.5 semaines, fin août 2019, à Niederbronn. D'autres rencontres de quelques jours auront lieu au mois de novembre 2019 et avril 2020. Before the beginning of the voluntary, in august 2019, everyone has to take part on a 2,5 weeks preparation, which included french courses, administrative tasks and many other activities. This seminar is good to meet other volunteers. It's organised by the coordinating organisation. 2 months and 8 months after the beginning the volunteer is invited to take part on another seminars.

Volunteer profile

!!! Only for european citizens !!! - A motivated european young boy or girl from 18 to 25 years old, - ready to give 11 months of your time to others. - interested in discovering French culture. !!! Only for european citizens !!! (because of the french service civique statute)

YOUTH CONNECT 2.0

ASOCIACION IDEAPOLIS.EU

Ayerbe, Spain

Apply

Project description

Il progetto si svolgerà nel villaggio di Ayerbe (1.200 abitanti), uno dei più importanti villaggi del Nord Ovest della Comarca Hoya de Huesca, Communità di Aragon. Il/la volontario/a sarà in contatto con diversi target group: bambini, giovani, senior, immigrati, ecc. Il campo principale d’azione è quello della promozione dell’educazione non formale e dello spirito di volontariato. Durante i 5 mesi di progetto il/la volontario/a darà il suo contributo: Nelle attività del centro giovanile di Ayerbe Partecipando all’organizzazione di eventi locali Organizzando diverse attività culturali o sportive e laboratori (manuali, artistici) per giovani, anziani, bambini, ecc. Promuovendo le iniziative dell’associazione e le opportunità di volontariato attraverso newsletter, blog, volantini, comunicazione nelle scuole ecc.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Alloggio: in un appartamento, condiviso con altri volontari. Il volontario avrà una camera singola; la cucina ed il bagno condivisi con altri volontari. Il viaggio andata e ritorno verrà rimborsato fino all'ammontare massimo di 275 euro. Ogni volontario riceverà un budget per il vitto, oltre al pocket money mensile.

Training during the project

I volontari saranno supportati e guidati dall'organizzazione di accoglienza durante le attività. I volontari parteciperanno ad un evento di formazione all'arrivo organizzato dall'Agenzia Nazionale per i Giovani Spagnola.

Volunteer profile

Al volontario non è richiesta alcuna competenza specifica nel campo, né la conoscenza della lingua del paese di accoglienza. I requisiti più importanti sono l’interesse per la tematica del progetto e la motivazione a mettersi in gioco in un’esperienza di apprendimento in un contesto interculturale. Il/la volontario/a deve essere una persona responsabile e propositiva, aperta al dialogo, alla condivisione e al lavoro di gruppo. Inoltre, deve essere motivata a vivere in un piccolo paese in una zona rurale e ad imparare la lingua spagnola. L'esperienza di lavoro con i giovani è benvenuta.

Placement dates

A total of 14 week(s) during the period 02/05/2019 to 11/08/2019

Placement location

Av. Estación, 8 bajo, 22800 Ayerbe

Looking for volunteers from

Italy

Placement topics

Education and training

Employment and entrepreneurship

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 12/04/2019

Sign in / Join

Project description

Aizputes region youth house “IDEJU MĀJA” is looking for 2 volunteers from age 18 till 27, male and female, with interests in youth work, music, photo, video, non-formal education, self-development and are open to new ideas to create, work together and explore new opportunities. Volunteers will be able to organize events and workshops for local youth groups, help us to organize bigger events, organize language studies, work and help in music studio, participate in photo and video workshops. Daily tasks will include team meetings, preparation for workshops and events, planning activities, daily youth house activities (board games, discussions, cooking with youngsters etc.) and youth house popularization in local community.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation, food and transport are covered by the project. The volunteer will receive food and pocket money which is calculated by the European Commission and the National Agency. The volunteer will have a separate bedroom and will share the bathroom and kitchen with other volunteer.

Training during the project

WE ARE LOOKING FOR VOLUNTEER WHO: • are from EU countries • are between 18 and 26 years old • are interested in work with young adults, teenagers and kids • are able to work individually and in teams • is able to take initiative • is creative and interested in music, non- formal education, photo and video • has intermediate English level • is willing to spend a year in rural area

Summer Volunteering at Kapraluv mlyn

Junák - český skaut, Kaprálův mlýn, z. s.

Ochoz u Brna, Czech Republic

Apply

Project description

Kaprálův mlýn is a scout environmental education centre situated in Moravian karst landscape protected area. Summer volunteering at Kaprálův mlýn consists of various activities:  operation and development of the centre,  helping providing programmes (e.g. caving),  work in the garden and campsite,  help in the kitchen, cleaning,  guests-care and info-shop shifts,  nature conservation projects,  enjoying summer time in the community of international volunteers and scouts camping at Kaprálův mlýn.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation Volunteers live in a two-storey straw house (equipped kitchen, common room, bedrooms) situated on a nice place just 50 m from the main bulding of Kapraluv mlyn. Food Because meals for the guests are being prepared we can provide home-made cuisine three times a day for volunteers as well, respecting individual diets; volunteers can also cook on their own in the kitchen in their house. Transport Volunteers get ticket for public transport, Brno downtown is accesible within 30 minutes. There are bikes which volunteers can use as well.

Training during the project

Introductory training in the organisation: health and safety, programmes, building maintanance, office skills, surrounding...

Volunteer profile

In accordance with the mission of Kapraluv mlyn Scout Environmental Education Centre we prefer volunteers who are interested in nature conservation, scouting, environmental education, sustainable technologies and leisure time activities for kids and youth. That is why open-mindness, willingness to learn new things and discipline are the qualities we are asking for. This vacancy is for volunteers with fewer opportunities (social obstacles, economic obstacles, educational difficulties, cultural differences, health problems, geographical obstacles, refugees).

Placement dates

A total of 4 week(s) during the period 01/07/2019 to 30/11/2019

Placement location

Ochoz u Brna 235, Ochoz u Brna Ochoz u Brna

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 01/04/2019

Local Volunteering Initiative - LVI

Asociatia Comunitati Pentru Tineret

Bailesti, Romania

Apply

Project description

The project is designed to consists of 2 volunteering activities: 5-month activity in Craiova and a second 5-month in Bailesti. The general objective of the project is: Develop a set of best practices in terms of promoting the concept of volunteering and social inclusion among youth in Craiova and Bailesti while strengthening the role and image of ACT as a local volunteering opportunities provider. Specific project objectives: 1. Adjust the working methodologies of ACT and develop new best practices in the context of mixing international and local volunteers . Develop a set of transferable social inclusion practices between beneficiaries in Craiova and Bailesti. 3.Promote the concept of volunteering and of the Solidarity Corps in Craiova and Bailesti. 4. Formulate and implement a personal development plan for a total of 12 volunteers 5. Create and implement with the help of volunteer’s non-formal educational activities for children's with disadvantaged

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

International travel, local transport, accommodation and utility fees, monthly communication costs, costs related to activities are covered directly by Association ACT. Monthly food allowance: 150 euro/month Pocket money: 90 euro/month

Training during the project

On-Arraivel training and MidTerm training will consist in meetings with the National Agency trainers. Capacity Building - Week 1 is focused on project understanding (objectives,roles,responsibilities,activities, rules to be followed)non formal education training(animation module), discovering Craiova (paces to shop, cultural landmarks,public transportation).Week 2 will be dedicated to thematic trainings(Social Inclusion, social work, best practice examples, needs analysis) and workplace induction(visiting and understanding the institution. Romania Lesson 2 times/week

Volunteer profile

The general profile of volunteers we will be looking for: - Age range between 18 and 30 years old - Unemployed - Has just finished a form of education or quit a job and is undecided about the career, study and future life path. Given our focus on personal development and the assistance we give to volunteers in deciding on life long learning goals we want to use the volunteering experience as a told to help undecided youth how to further advance their path in life. - Medium level of English – sufficient for regular conversations - Is a sociable, warm and empathic person

Placement dates

A total of 44 week(s) during the period 01/04/2019 to 28/01/2020

Placement location

Victoriei Nr.163, 2015100 Bailesti

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Placement deadline

Project 232: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10723_en


Sustainable Organization for Sustainable Community

Eko Centar Latinovac

Latinovac, Čaglin, Croatia

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

SOSC is a long term project that takes place in a rural area of Croatia, in the village of Latinovac. The purpose of the project is to provide support to the NGO Eco Center Latinovac in all of their activities which will focus on sustainability and raising the quality of life for wider community. Three selected volunteers can expect to work in dynamic atmosphere, alongside project team of Eco Center: project proposal writing ideas, fieldwork with international and local volunteers, setting up and having workshops, lectures and promotions, visits to local school as well as funded volunteers personal projects - depending on current need. Candidates profession, experience and education are important, but main criteria of selection is personal motivation. This definitely won't be service of office work and administration, instead we offer loads outdoor activity and good vibes. Volunteers are expected to have 6 working hours per day, 5 days a week. With free days to use as they please.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will be accomodated in the village and will have access to shared room(s) with beds, WiFi, a shower, washing machine and a kitchen area. During working days, Eco center will prepare 3 epic and tasty vegetarian meals (because "sustainable"). For non-working days, volunteers will receive "food money". Also, we have huge garden/orchard area. Locals produce milk, eggs and, for carnivores, meat. Transport - depending on the distance calculator the travel costs are covered by grant. We will help as well. Pocket money - included by grant. Got questions? Send us an email!

Training during the project

Where to start? Croatian lessons, which will help you in all of Balkans region (Serbian, Bosnian, Polish, a bit of Slovenian and Hungarian. That's 6 languages right there. Working language is english and you can expect it to improve. Daily sustainability practical training - gardening, cooking, composting. You'll be doing REAL WORK alongside experienced group of people. You will plan with us, you will have responsibilities and you will be a part of the team. Projects, coordinating volunteers activities etc. Also, mentor will be provided and Youth Pass certificate issued. And much more!

Volunteer profile

Basic English skills and is from EU country. Candidates with any skillset, as we will put to use pretty much anyone from web developer, children animator to an experienced construction worker. Still, some points are worth mentioning: Motivated to learn about "ins and outs" of working in NGO. Responsible and punctual. Adaptable and patient. Able to articulate his/her needs, open and polite in communication. Bonus points if you enjoy biking, hiking, outdoors in general, are a team player and looking to expand your horizons. Previous experience in volunteering is not obligatory.

Placement dates

A total of 26 week(s) during the period 01/03/2019 to 27/08/2019

Placement location

Latinovac 11, 34350 Latinovac, Čaglin

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Poland, Portugal, Slovenia, Lithuania, Latvia

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Health and wellbeing

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 31/03/2019

Tailwind in Nagyvázsony II.

I costi di vitto, alloggio e trasporti e viaggio sono coperti dall'organizzazione di accoglienza. Il costo del viaggio Internazionale sarà coperto secondo le regole di ERAMUS+ KA1 (distance band calculator, 500-1999 km = 275 euro).

Heritage is forever

Research and Education Centre Mansion Rakičan (RIS Dvorec Rakičan)

Murska Sobota, Slovenia

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

The aim of this project is to raise awareness and social responsibility in the field of cultural heritage preservation in the local environment and, consequently, in the European Union. We want to encourage young people in particularly to think about how their own behaviour and responsibilities helps improve the relationships towards cultural heritage that our ancestors have left behind. At the same time, it is an important goal of the volunteer, who is interested in the field of protection and preservation of cultural heritage using also the ICT technology, to enable active participation in the implementation of the project, as well as in the implementation of the activities planned within the project. Within the framework of the project, we are planning various activities: a round table, themed evenings, local consultation with the inclusion of cultural organisations, photography competition and exhibition, workshops etc.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteer will be accommodated in the room of RIS Mansion Rakičan. In Mansion we also have a kitchen where volunteer can prepare daily meals. Webstite of our organisation: https://www.ris-dr.si/ Photos of the accomodation: https://www.ris-dr.si/go/540/288/SOBE_

Volunteer profile

Volunteer between the ages of 18 and 30 with a legal residence in the sender country, interested in protecting and preserving of cultural heritage.

Placement dates

A total of 30 week(s) during the period 01/04/2019 to 31/10/2019

Placement location

Lendavska street 28, Rakičan, 9000 Murska Sobota

Looking for volunteers from

Hungary, Romania

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 31/03/2019

Project 235: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10704_en


Social Networking&Communications Volunteer with Graphic Design Skills

Vluchtelingenwerk Vlaanderen (Flemish Refugee Action)

Brussel, Belgium

Apply

Project description

Vluchtelingenwerk Vlaanderen (Flemish Refugee Action) is an independent NGO based in Brussels that defends the rights and interests of refugees and asylum seekers. Together with over 30 member-organisations and the support of numerous volunteers we work on facilitating the integration of refugees and asylum seekers; providing legal information, offering learning opportunities; stimulating active societal participation. Our project, Young Voices of Solidarity, intends to raise critical understanding of, and broaden support for the development goals set out in the People and Planet pillars of the European Consensus, and it aims to engage young Europeans in solidarity activities in order to strengthen cohesion, solidarity, democracy and citizenship all across the member states. Therefore, this project will inform, educate and engage young EU citizens on the facts and figures of the root causes of migration and promote recognition for human rights in an evidence based way.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will stay in Brussels under Euroepan Solidarity Corps (ESC) conditions, and is lodged by Flemish Refugee Action that is located just a 5 minute subway ride away from the historical centre of Brussels. According to the ESC guidelines and the workplace rules of Flemish Refugee Action, the volunteer will work 37,5 hours per week on average. Weekends are free. The volunteer will have 2 vacation days per month (in addition to the weekends).

Training during the project

Flemish Refugee Action offers its extensive expertise in the field of refugee protection and human rights advocacy so that the candidate will be able to work and acquire different skills while performing the following tasks: - Develop, support and promote project goals, including message development, social media content creation and media outreach campaigns - Ensure digital marketing content aligns with our project’s identity/message, and assist with marketing campaigns as needed - Develop digital content such as short videos, newsletters, social media posts - Assist to build a website

Volunteer profile

Tasks - Usage of Social Media - Assist with the implementation of the Strategic Development plan for communications, including newsletters - Assist in the production of advertisements, campaigns, press releases, and promotional materials - Create the look of a website, visual brand - Daily update/maintain of (graphic) content on the website - Short video content and editing Skills - Graphic design - Experience with graphic design - Good knowledge of Adobe, Photoshop, InDesign, Publisher, Illustrator - Proactive, analytical thinking - Planning and organization skills - Activist

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 01/06/2019 to 31/05/2020

Placement location

Kruidtuinstraat 75, 1210 Brussel

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Slovenia

Placement topics

Reception and integration of refugees and migrants

Citizenship and democratic participation

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 236: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10702_en


S.A.S (Social Assistance Smiling)

Altamura, Italy

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

The S.A.S.project Social Assistance Smiling wants to give to the minor guests of the Auxilium cooperative in Altamura the chance to experiment in the relationship with a person "different" from them. Auxilium is a social enterprise created in 1984 in Altamura which manages social healthcare services. The volunteer will take part in the implementation of various rehabilitation activities carried out in structure, to support educators and users. The volunteer will be initially trained about a correct approach with people with disabilities, the working methods of the team, spaces, roles and rules within it. After this phase, there will be an observation period during which he/she will be able to better internalize the information previously learned. Finally, the volunteer, assisted by an educator, will be involved in the daily life of the Centre, in its relations with users and the realization of activities. After the first period the volunteer will develope the favorite activities.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will be hosted in a shared flats in center of Altamura. The flat has a kitchen, living room, shared sleeping rooms, shared bathroom. The apartment is shared with other EVS volunteers, everyone is responsible for taking care of the flat - cleaning, shopping and cooking. Each month every volunteer has the right to receive an individual support and money for food. There is no need for transport because the working and living place is 20 min away by feet. It is not allowed to host other person in the volunteer flat.

Training during the project

The volunteers will receive the access to Online Language Service platform to study independently Italian Language. Moreover the coordinating organization Link will offer to all an intensive Language Training Course to help the volunteers to integrate in local environment and activity work.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for volunteers aged between 18 and 30, with a basic knowledge of English and with a willingness to work with disadvantaged and disabled people. Preferential requirement will be a previous experience with this type of activity

Placement dates

A total of 35 week(s) during the period 01/02/2019 to 01/10/2019

Placement location

70022 Altamura

Looking for volunteers from

Spain, Romania, Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Finland, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Lithuania, Latvia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway

Placement topics

Social challenges

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 31/03/2019

Project 237: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10694_en


assisting English/art/music/sports teacher

Drunen, Netherlands

Apply

Project description

There are unique possibilities for the right volunteer. The ESC volunteer will assist in teaching children (4-12 year) in English, craftmanship, sports, culture, video making, programming and/or sustainability. This will take place during class lessons when some extra hands are needed, e.g. for reading and further small group activities, also after school. The ESC volunteer will develop new activities such as playing games during short breaks and lunch breaks. Ideas for this can be taken from the foundations TEAMUP. Depending on the interests and talents of the volunteer, he/she can help the professional with cultural activities, for example music, dance, acting, craftsmanship or physical education. During the summer holidays, the ESC volunteer will assist with Summercamp(s). Primary School De Duinsprong (500 children of 4-12 years old). It is a training school for teachers.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Food allowance and pocket money will be paid. Bike is available. Dutch lessons are provided. You will be part of 10 ESC volunteers and you will have your own room.

Training during the project

The volunteer will receive an on-arrival and mid-term training. Dutch lessons are provided.

Volunteer profile

Open-minded, social, energetic and creative youngsters who have affinity with children and are interested in music, acting, dance and craftmanship. Furthermore, he or she likes to organize and plan events and teach children.

TRAINING OPPORTUNITY PERSPECTIVES - TOP

Regional Centre for Social Economy - CRES

Craiova, Romania

Apply

Project description

The volunteers of the TOP Project will be directly involved in the planning, organization and implementation of non-formal activities in educational institutions in the city of Craiova, activities directed towards the achievements of the project objectives. The main activity of the project is a 8 months EVS group activity that will involve 8 volunteers working in 4 high schools using non-formal methods and youth development principles to support the personal and professional development of 160 students from 4 high schools and raise knowledge on hate speech, tolerance and cultural diversity. General project objective: Increase and develop youth leadership skill, competencies and knowledge and provide opportunities for practice of leadership positions for both the target group and the volunteers while contributing to their personal and professional development.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

CRES will host the volunteers in rented apartments in the city of Craiova. Each accommodation will assure good living conditions (private beds,equipped kitchen and bathroom, heating system, running cold/ hot water, Wi-Fi).CRES will purchase flight tickets and together with the Sending Organization will make sure that the volunteer is well informed, has all documents and gets safely on board.Local transport, accommodation and utility fees, monthly communication costs, costs related to activities are covered directly by CRES Monthly food allowance: 120 euro/month,Pocket money: 60 euro/month

Training during the project

Pre-daparture training organized by Sending Organization Preparation, Adaptation and Training Phase (PAT) – start immediately after volunteers arrival and will last 3 weeks, each week with a different objective and agenda - organized by CRES (hosting organization) On Arrival Training -All volunteer must participate in the on arrival training which will gather all 8 volunteers and shall be provided by the National Agency . Mid – Term Evaluation (under provision to be decided by the NA only for long term EVS projects)

Volunteer profile

-Aged between 18 to 30 years -active, open-minded, creative, innovative, responsible and motivated volunteers -The volunteers need to be a pro-active and social persons who enjoys working with youth and to want to dedicate themselves to a 8 months long personal and professional development process. -The volunteers of this project should, above all else, show willingness to learn and see their EVS experience as a learning process. -Basic level of English (being able to make herself/himself understood by the others – able to communicate) -Genuine interest in working with non-formal activity

Placement dates

A total of 34 week(s) during the period 01/04/2019 to 30/11/2019

Placement location

str. Grigore Plesoianu, nr. 11H, ap.2, Craiova, Romania, 200485 Craiova

Looking for volunteers from

Spain, Germany, Italy, Turkey

Placement topics

Education and training

What you can learn: - lot of things abouth Hungarian culture and history - Archery,horse riding, Hungarian folk dance - to work with children with mental difficulties - how to organise an international youth exchange, cultural festival and write a project Goals and jobs: 1. And build a society where the sustainable living, natural consciousness is the start point of the human behavior – atmosphere of thinking. The only thing you have to do to be part of our teem is to make a decision to go and contact us! You don’t have to be a genius, to have an extra professional skills, to speak english on high level etc. You just have to be open-minded, to want to help, to love children and nature!
