Promotion de la langue et de la culture françaises en Macédoine

Alliance Française de Tetovo

Tetovo, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia

Apply

Project description

Le réseau des "Alliances Françaises" oeuvre pour la promotion de la langue et de la culture françaises dans 134 pays à travers le monde. C'est la mission de l'Alliance Française de Tetovo, en Macédoine, depuis 2001, et cette année, elle propose une mission de volontariat pour deux volontaires français. Tâches proposées : Aidés et accompagnés par leur coordinatrice, les volontaires se verront confiés les tâches suivantes : - Participer à l’organisation de différents événements culturels et artistiques; - Animation d’ateliers linguistiques en Français; - Sensibilisation à la culture et langues françaises dans les écoles ; -Autres activité si vous avez des idées !

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

- Les volontaires seront logés soit à la résidence universitaire de Tetovo ou dans des familles d’accueil. Selon ce choix, les volontaires reçoivent soit l’allocation hebdomadaire pour la nourriture ou le repas fournis par la famille d’accueil. - Une indemnité mensuelle sera remise au volontaires pour leur argent de poche. - Un billet d’avion aller/retour est pris en charge. - Les volontaires seront couverts par une assurance universelle pendant tout leur séjour.

Volunteer profile

Jeunes femmes et jeunes hommes âgés entre 18 ans et 30 ans, sensibles aux valeurs du volontariat et désireux de s'engager dans la promotion de la langue et culture françaises dans un pays étranger.

GIOVANI DI VALORE - Banco

BANCO NONSOLOPANE

VARESE, Italy

Apply

Project description

Il Banco di Solidarietà Alimentare Nonsolopane onlus (Nonsolopane) is a Food Bank founded in 1999 as no profit and charity organisation collecting food and redistributing it to people and families in need. Mission of the association is charity as basic value of human being life experience: sharing needs to share humankind sense of life. More than 100 volunteers collect, store and re-distribute food at home to people in need, visiting each person or family and creating a relation based on solidarity and wish to share a new zest for life. Evs volunteer will be involved in the storehouse activities, the periodic visit to the families we help, the fundraising and foodraising campaigns of the association, the office and administrative activities Nonsolopane promotes sharing fairly and without any discrimination, helping people in need for various reasons (job loss,

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers are hosted in a fully equipped house, with two bedrooms, living room, kitchen and bathroom. The house has also a garden. The volunteer will share bedroom with another volunteer. The house is 5 minutes walk far the associations place. A food allowance is provided. A monthly ticket to travel in Lombardy 7 day a week is provided.

Training during the project

On arrival training is provided by coordinating organisation about the project aims and the overall community partnerships. Volunteers will also be given all the instruction regarding EVS principle and functioning in our organisation. Training on working with vulnerable adults is provided to all our volunteers by staff members in the hosting organisations and volunteer will be trained on the job with staff help . Volunteers will be given informal learning process support through the active participation to a monthly 4 hours group trainings on YOUTHPASS certificate.

Volunteer profile

All people aged 18 - 30, who have a genuine interest and passion for working in a community project to develop solidarity in various ways. He/she has express interest for the no-profit sector and the active participation in society.

Placement dates

A total of 34 week(s) during the period 04/02/2019 to 30/09/2019

Placement location

21100 VARESE

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Solo per Italiani: Volontariato in Germania con ragazzi disabili

Hegenberg, Germany

Apply

Project description

Due opportunità di volontariato in Germania a Hegenberg (vicino a Ravensburg) con l'associazione Liebenau Teilhabe. Il primo ragazzo/a supporterà lo staff nell'aiutare otto ragazzi disabili in un gruppo residenziale. Progetto di un anno dal 1 Agosto al 31 Luglio. Il secondo volontario/a assisterà gli insegnanti della scuola Don Bosco nel prendersi cura di giovani con disabilità. Progetto di un anno dal 1 Ottobre al 30 Settembre. Per partecipare invia curriculum e lettera di motivazione in inglese a molfetta@incoweb.org, specificando a quale progetto (gruppo residenziale o scuola) si voglia prender parte.

Training during the project

I volontari frequenteranno un corso di lingua tedesca presso all'università di Weingarten.

Volunteer profile

Il partecipante deve essere fortemente motivato a prendere parte all'esperienza di volontariato e supportare ragazzi disabili. Preferenziale una conoscenza basica della lingua tedesca e precedenti esperienze lavorative o di volontariato riguardanti il progetto.

Project 245: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10570_en


Extremadura Solidarity Corps

Plasencia, Spain

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

“Extremadura Solidarity Corps” is a social project aimed to improve the quality of life of people with fewer opportunities, by organizing leisure and free-time activities with them, such as: sports, handicrafts, drawing, excursions, theatre, workshops of photography, walking, board games... Volunteering activities will be carried out in Plasencia, Spain, from 20 of May 2019 to 20 of March 2020 (10 mounths), in 3 different centers: 1) Placeat. Association for people with intellectual disabilities ( https://placeat.org/ ); 2) Centro Sociosanitario. Psychiatric Hospital for people with mental diseases; 3) Caritas. Organization for people at risk of social exclusión ( http://www.caritasplasencia.org/w/ )

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will live in two apartments located in the center of the city with other european volunteers. Each volunteer will have his/her private room, and common areas to share with other volunteers: kitchen, living room, bathrooms, balcony. They will receive a pocket money of 5 €/day + 120 €/month for food. Volunteers will be given bus tickets to reach the hosting organizations, if needed. They will also have bycicles at their disposal.

Training during the project

The volunteer will participate to on-arrival training and mid-term evaluation provided by the National Agency in Spain. Furthermore he/she will participate in workshops of conversational Spanish provided by the supporting organization and to talks and conferences about voluntary activities provided by the hosting organizations.

Volunteer profile

Youngsters aged 18 to 30 years old,from Estonia, Romania, Italy,France, Lthuania or Portugal : high motivated, willing to help others, to collaborate and with initiative. Interest in intellectual disabilities, mental diseases and people at risk of social exclusion is required. Sport competences and basic Spanish would be appreciated. Interested volunteers , please fill the following form: https://goo.gl/forms/1axpXJjfgUe3C4Mk1

Placement dates

A total of 44 week(s) during the period 20/05/2019 to 20/03/2020

Placement location

10600 Plasencia

Looking for volunteers from

Estonia, Italy, France, Lithuania, Portugal, Romania

Placement topics

Social challenges

Health and wellbeing

Physical education and sport

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 31/03/2019

Project 246: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10567_en


Conservation of natural areas in Campanarios de Azaba

Fundación Naturaleza y Hombre

EL ASTILLERO, Spain

Apply

Project description

The Campanarios de Azaba Biological Reserve is located in the province of Salamanca, in the cross-border area of Portugal and Spain. The location and characteristics of this enclave make it a privileged natural area for different species that find a favorable habitat in the meadows with Mediterranean forest. You will have the opportunity to participate in the monitoring and study of habitats, plant species and fauna. You will also participate in the management of the reserve, environmental education and communication and dissemination of the activities in social networks. In this way you will acquire knowledge about the functioning of the different ecosystems, the identification and differentiation of species. You will put into practice different methodologies of population study, you will know strategies for the recovery of species and the restoration of natural degraded areas attending to the management of the same and identifying the challenges as well as the solutions adopted.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will be staying at the Rural Tourism Center “La Estación” in Espeja, 10 km away of the reserve. You will have access to a common kitchen equipped with all appliances. Transport to the work center will be ensured, either by bicycles or by an alternative means of transport. Pocket money will be provided according to the conditions set out in the Erasmus + Program, food, accommodation and local transportation costs will be also covered by the program.

Training during the project

Activities related to the conservation of the nature and environment of Campanarios de Azaba will be carried out, among which are the monitoring or census of flora, fauna and habitats characteristic of the area, in addition to carrying out environmental education activities or dissemination both with adults as with children or university students. The volunteers will also collaborate with the tasks of management and administration of the Biological Reserve and maintenance of natural spaces.

Volunteer profile

There is no need for a specific educational profile but it is desirable to show interest in issues related to the protection of nature as well as motivation to work in various tasks both outdoors and indoors. The motivations and the benefit that the project will have on the volunteer will be evaluated, as well as the capacity to adapt to intense field trips that involve flexible timetables to adapt the activity to the behaviors of the fauna.

Placement dates

A total of 24 week(s) during the period 01/05/2019 to 31/12/2019

Placement location

AV. DE ESPAÑA, Nº 25, ENTLO, 39610 EL ASTILLERO

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 247: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10564_en


Conservation of natural areas in Cantabria

Fundación Naturaleza y Hombre

EL ASTILLERO, Spain

Apply

Project description

The “Fundación Naturaleza y Hombre” has its main headquarters in Astillero, near the capital, Santander. It is a locality that has all the services and is well communicated with other points of the region. The activities will be carried out both in the offices and in the projects that are developed in other points: - “Ecomuseo Fluviarium de Liérganes”, Liérganes. - “Centro etnobotánico del Pendo y de los Bosques del Anillo Verde”, Escobedo. - “Casa de la Naturaleza Humedales del Anillo Verde Marismas de Alday”, Camargo. - Montaña Oriental: high area of the river Miera. - Vivero El Pendo, Escobedo de Camargo. The activities to be carried out include guided tours, nursery work, aquarium maintenance, census of chamois, reforestation... These activities will improve your knowledge about environmental education and the different ecosystems, species, methodologies of population studies, recovery of species and restoration of spaces.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will be accommodated in a rented house nearby our headquartes, Boo de Guardizo, and it will be shared with other euroepan volunteers. Public transportation will be provided; access to field activities will be made on FNYH vehicles. Pocket money will be provided according to the conditions set out in the Erasmus + Program, food, accommodation and local transport costs will be covered by the program.

Training during the project

Work center Ecomuseo-Fluviarium, Liérganes, Cantabria: guided tours, aquarium maintenance, animals care such as otters, butterflies, etc. Implementation of activities related to environmental education; workshops, guided tours, visits, etc. - Work center Forest nursery El Pendo, Escobedo de Camargo: development of environmental education tasks such as guided tours; maintenance of the arboretum.Work center of the NatureHouse, Alday Camargo Marshes: monitoring of the fauna and flora of Alday marshes and other natural areas following invinvasive vegetation,helping guided tours...

Volunteer profile

There is no need for a specific educational profile but it is desirable to show interest in issues related to the protection of nature as well as motivation to work in various tasks both outdoors and indoors. The motivations and the benefit that the project will have on the volunteer will be evaluated, as well as the capacity to adapt to intense field trips that involve flexible timetables to adapt the activity to the behaviors of the fauna.

Placement dates

A total of 48 week(s) during the period 01/03/2019 to 30/04/2020

Placement location

AV. DE ESPAÑA, Nº 25, ENTLO, 39610 EL ASTILLERO

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Placement deadline

ESC in Verkiai and Pavilniai regional parks

Pavilniai ir Verkiai regional parks

Vilnius, Lithuania

Apply

Project description

The Directorate of Pavilniai and Verkiai regional parks were established in 1992 to preserve and protect natural and cultural heritage. The Directorates' activity areas are public education and recreation. Daily activities of staff members are different. Volunteer will take care of park enviroment. There are many simple works that volunteers are awaiting-to hoe and to rake soil, to remove weeds, to water plants, to cut of old branches or flowers, work on making new forest paths etc.. Second area where volunteers can do a lot is dealing with visitors or with social network accounts of Regional parks. There are possibility to help organize events (different technical activities – to prepare event areas, leaflets, information tables etc.), to help with guided tours in English, to help educators (assistance during Lithuanian educations, creation of new activities etc.)

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will be hosted in flat together with other volunteers in Vilnius. Each volunteer will have their own room. A monthly bus card will be provided. Volunteers will receive food and pocket money every month.

Training during the project

The volunteer will have an integration week organised by coordinting organisation. During the volunteery service, volunterers will also have On-Arrival and Mid Term trainings organised by National Agency.

Volunteer profile

There are no specific requirements for the volunteers: generally they must be self-motivated, willing to take on new challenges, and open to working with people of all backgrounds and cultures, dynamic, versatile, good mood, flexible, with self-initiative, experienced in being in nature (scouting, hiking, few horticulture experience) is advantage.

Placement dates

Vilnius

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Moving in another country means learning and adjust the new knowledge to develop as a person and help the social and daily life development in your community. Through non formal activities our project will redefine the habits and the needs of youth in Agros underline the need to respect our environment and our health. This EVS project means to adopt a Green life style in the most trendy way that is beneficial for youth as well as the environment they live in. The volunteers will be the example for the whole community as they will create events and implement various activities. The rose festival is the best way to support our aims.

They should also be able to work in English since the working language of this Project will be English. Gender balance and group diversity in terms of different social and cultural backgrounds should be taken into consideration. Bournemouth’s Chaplaincy and Housing Role Start Date 24 th April 2019 – Completion Date 4th September 2019 These dates can be negotiated before you sign the Volunteer Agreement Bournemouth’s chaplaincy service exists to offer spiritual support, pastoral care and moral guidance to the organisation’s staff, volunteers, clients and their families. In working closely with the Housing Department we support men and women between the ages of 18 and 60 living in our accommodations. The chaplaincy team also works externally through community outreach projects with people of all ages. The main activities will include: Support staff to deliver activities for residents including social, sports and artistic events. Help staff to oversee group sessions for residents such as “Overcomers Outreach” and “Snack and Chat”. Assisting kitchen staff

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Bournemouth’s youth work department offers a variety of youth-led projects for young people aged 5-25 years old in the Bournemouth, Poole and Dorset area, which focus on Equality, Diversity and community inclusion. Activities include open access youth work, children’s youth work, disability youth action projects and holiday activities, citizenship, community outreach and peer mentoring.

The long term volunteers will be working in Antalya-Turkey city center, in a nice venue. 10 minutes from the seaside and 10 minutes to city center by walking. We are mostly working with 16-30 age youngsters coming from socio-economically disadvantaged background. As a youth worker, the volunteers participate in some sportive activities such as daily walkins on Sunday, participating summer camps , will organize English conversation club, write projects, and help us to carry some projects, publish our news on our webpage ect. The long term EVS activities are not super sportive,so volunteers with motivation for healthy life and good English skills are welcome. The short term activities in Olimpos whis is 90 km from Antalya city center near seaside. Olimpos is a place mostly tourist come for staying in the nature. There will be 2 working area for all short terms: 1- is to work in youth camp as a leader, 2- is to work on caretta nests.

Voluntariado corta duración Turquía

Association Buidling Bridges

Sinop, Turkey

Apply

Project description

Apúntate ya a este voluntariado corta duración Turquía con el Cuerpo Europeo de Solidaridad que cubre todos los gastos. The project aims to help inclusion of the disabled people in the society by empowering their cognitive, behavioral and personal developments with volunteering work. Hosting organisation was established in 2012 for the purpose of creating and developing cultural and educational programs for the disadvantaged young people and women. We are a non-governmental and non-profit organisation. We are active on the field of contemporary art, non-formal education, ecology, entrepreneurship, local handicrafts, youth programs and volunteering, especially in EU programs. We provide non-formal education abroad and in our town with multi-cultural atmosphere for the young people that we are working with. We send them to European countries to learn in international group of young people such as youth exchanges, training courses for youth and youth volunteering.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

We are also the accredited as sending and hosting organization for the European Voluntary Service. Within EVS, we host young volunteers in our town in the rehabilitation center for the mentally and physically disabled people. We also provide traineeship in Sinop for the university students whose major is SEN. We also organize student exchange programs with different countries from all around the world. We also work for the disadvantaged women. We provide cooking, handicrafts, and English courses for the women who are lower educated and unemployed. We raise awareness on the animal

Training during the project

As the hosting organisation will orientate the volunteer to her/his service and the environment, provide a mentor for the volunteer and organise regular mentor meetings every week to provide some certain skills to the volunteer: basic information on SEN methodology, competences on personal development and intercultural competences. They will help the volunteer develop a tool to provide a new skill for the disabled person and be responsible to disseminate the project and its results in their environment. as the hosting organisation will provide a Youthpass certificate for the volunteer

Volunteer profile

The volunteer will organise fun time activities with the disabled people such as art, music, sports, drama, dance, handicrafts, games, etc. At the end of the activity, we expect the disabled person to have at least one new skill. We also expect the volunteer to document the new skill she/he provided for the disabled person with film, photos, power point, etc.

Placement dates

A total of 8 week(s) during the period 04/02/2019 to 03/04/2019

Placement location

Sinop, 28042 Sinop

Voluntariado en Austria en educacion pedagógica

Association Buidling Bridges

Thal, Austria

Apply

Project description

No pierdas la oportunidad de hacer Voluntariado en Austria y trabajar en el campo de la educación social, cultural y social. The goal of the organization is to make concepts for youth welfare institutions and to administrate them, to administrate child care institutions and to plan and provide educational offers in issues which range from pedagogical, psychological, school-, health- and job market-related matters to socio-political ones. Children and young people in a state of social need, who cannot live in their original family and are therefore sheltered elsewhere by the youth welfare. These children and young people have made all kinds of negative experiences: use of force as an “educational tool” in the family, sexual abuse, alcohol abuse by their parents, lack of support in school issues, difficulties to learn, behavioural problems etc.

Training during the project

Due to the socialization conditions which are unfavourable to the development of the personality they are disadvantaged in many fields, such as personal development, integration in the school, ability to take part in group activities etc.

Volunteer profile

Children and young people in a state of social need, who cannot live in their original family and are therefore sheltered elsewhere by the youth welfare. These children and young people have made all kinds of negative experiences: use of force as an “educational tool” in the family, sexual abuse, alcohol abuse by their parents, lack of support in school issues, difficulties to learn, behavioural problems etc.

Thal, 28042 Thal

Hacer un voluntariado en Reino Unido (cerca de Londres)

Association Buidling Bridges

sutton, United Kingdom

Apply

Project description

Apúntate ya a hacer un voluntariado en Reino Unido, esto es lo que te ofrecemos: tenemos estaPlaza de Servicio Voluntariado Europeo Reino Unido para participar en un pequeño pueblo (Sutton). It offers a variety of cultural, leisure-time and youth projects. We work closely together with other organizations and services such as, Princes Trust, local church;s and local schools. We promote an inclusive environment for learning and informal education to take place. By hosting a volunteer we aim to make them aware of how valuable they are and how much they will benefit the local community, as-well as the wider community. Projects include, Fruitful communities gardening project – A community garden project managed by Coventry and Warwickshire to provide young people with the opportunity to learn new skills and gain experience Youth work and sports activities – Sessions are informal and educational, with young people supported in their development and understanding of others i

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The accommodation is on-site, and a shared ( with another EVS) flat with own bathroom ( as seen in the video) although when possible we try to give own room.

Training during the project

There will be many specific learning outcomes and on different levels for the volunteers, the project will promote diversity and inter cultural awareness. The project will also give an opportunity for the participants to learn new skills, knowledge and attitudes such as critical thinking, media literacy and developing the initiative of young people helping them to achieve the outcomes of the project.

Volunteer profile

We do not have a special target group concerning the profile of the volunteer. For us voluntary service should be open to everyone. We believe that social projects are enriched through the personality of the volunteers and not only through their skills and experiences. What we do expect from the volunteers is that they are motivated to take part in the project and really want to be part of it. Basic knowledge of English would be necessary. As the project has a social focus, it is important that the volunteers have an element of resilience, open-mindedness, good work ethic, creativity

Placement dates

A total of 48 week(s) during the period 18/01/2019 to 17/12/2019

Placement location

sutton, 28042 sutton

Apúntate ya a hacer un voluntariado en Reino Unido, esto es lo que te ofrecemos: tenemos estaPlaza de Servicio Voluntariado Europeo Reino Unido para participar en un pequeño pueblo (Sutton). Housing department – we provide accommodation for local young people, aged 18-30 who are homeless, or at risk of homelessness. We provide a range of support, based on the person’s needs. Everyone who lives with us is offered advice and guidance when they need it and can access a host of training and activities to help develop confidence and skills to access education, training and employment and ultimately move on to independent living.

EVS sobre interculturalidad en el sur de Portugal

asociacion building bridges

Olhao, Portugal

Apply

Project description

Te animamos a realizar este EVS sobre interculturalidad en el sur de Portugal, donde podrás realizar actividades con jóvenes de la zona y ayudarás a crear conciencia europea entre la comunidad local. The volunteers will be placed for a 12 month period in the southern Portuguese city of Olhão, starting in October 2018, where they´ll have the opportunity to experience a totally different culture and way of living, to learn and experience new things, and to use the knowledge and experience gained in their countries so that they can act as a liaison between partner organisations. The volunteers will be involved in the activities and projects developed by the hosting organisation and will be encouraged to develop and implement their own projects/ideas.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The project will promote young people’s active citizenship in general and European citizenship in particular since living and working abroad will be an important learning experience in itself for the volunteers. Also the contact with the local youth will allow the discussion about the European values with persons from different backgrounds and realities, but also will be a chance to promote changes in different areas and different topics. In terms of specific objectives for youth under the Erasmus + Program, VEEhYcLE will help to improve the level of skills and key skills of young people

Volunteer profile

The volunteer’s selection process is intended to be transparent and open to all involved. There are no preferences regarding gender, age or study areas. However a special concern is taken on the analysis of volunteers’ expressed interest in working with children and young people with fewer opportunities and at risk of exclusion, since these will be the main goal of the proposed activities. The fact that the volunteer has some experience linked with youth associations was seen as positive for the development of the activities/ projects, although it was not an exclusion point for the decision.

Placement dates

A total of 48 week(s) during the period 01/11/2018 to 30/09/2019

Placement location

Olhao

Looking for volunteers from

Spain

Social challenges

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Hacer voluntariado europeo en Portugal

asociacion building bridges

Viana, Portugal

Apply

Project description

No te pierdas la oportunidad de Hacer voluntariado europeo en Portugal en el contexto de las asociaciones de jóvenes por 1 año. The volunteer will develop, according to his/her competences/skills and knowledge, activities that fall within the existing departments of the hosting organization. Thus the volunteer will be involved in supporting the Community School of the association, providing support to the monitors, and developing, under their guidance, the daily activities with children and young people (study time, arts, body language, science, computer, free time, etc.). The educational/recreational activities are developed in the Community School, a space where children, the youth and local people have Internet access and they can find books, newspapers, DVDs, games, etc. The volunteer will receive adequate language training and he/she will contribute to the Newsletter “O Caroça” and to the blog, with the aim to report the experiences and activities

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will work 35 hours per week and will have free weekends (Saturday and Sunday). Eventually, some activities may be developed during the weekends; however, if this happens, it will be compensated with other two consecutive days during the week, agreed on mutually between the volunteer and the association. The volunteer will also be entitled to two days off per month, which will be taken according to their own interests and needs. The hosting organization provides meals for the volunteer. The host/coordinating organisation will also provide monthly subsidy (pocket money).

Volunteer profile

He/She must demonstrate his/her will to learn a new language, to be open to experience a new culture and to contribute to support the people in a rural area. Moreover, the volunteer should feel the need to prove his/her personal strengths, weaknesses and limits, to discover a new environment and a strong desire to make new friends. Showing interest in foreign cultures and having this experience at this stage in his/her life will help him/her to make decisions for the future, both in terms of employment and education/training.

Placement dates

A total of 40 week(s) during the period 27/10/2018 to 31/07/2019

Placement location

Viana

Looking for volunteers from

Spain

Placement topics

Education and training

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Te traemos una vacante para participar en un voluntariado en escuela primaria en Polonia. La incorporación es inmediata y hasta final de curso. ¡Anímate a vivir una experiencia única!

Training during the project

1. Organize workshops, meetings and games about their countries, cultures and traditions. 2. Participation and support in different school clubs. 3. Organize activities and games for pupils during the breaks between lessons and in the “day-room”. 4. Organising language workshops and providing “language cafe” in the school. The volunteer can also introduce new forms of language trainings, games, different kind of creative activities which helps pupils to open for communication in foreign language. 5. Support pupils in the learning process – in regular lessons during morning

Volunteer profile

The volunteer should take great pleasure in working with kids and youth (from 6 to 16 years), be creative and have initiative. It is important that the volunteer has his/her own ideas for activities and motivation to realise them independently. He/ she should be open to live in the rural and economically poor region without lot of comfort. The volunteer should have a high motivation for learning polish language, because not so many people in Gródek are speaking english.

The volunteer will cooperate with Youth Specialists and local youth ( 7 to 25 years old), to provide a friendly

Financial questions. The volunteer will get 120 euros per month as pocket money, and 150 euros for food/groceries. We will help the volunteer out to get a Latvian bank account.

"European Diversity in Human Unity", 2nd service

American International School of Transylvania

Baia Mare, Romania

Apply

Project description

"EDIHU" is a youth mobility, as a long term EVS activity, 274 days of service, NOV. 2018 - August 2019, for volunteers +18 & under 30 years old. It involves a wide European partnership between AIST as CO/HO & 10 other partner SOs from 7 EU member countries: Great Britain, Denmark, Germany, Spain, Italy, France, Latvia. Objectives: 1. Providing learning opportunities as well as practical life experience for 4 EVS volunteers, within their 9 months of service, but also for 30 young volunteers, through educational activities with 1200 children and 500 youth, from 2 urban and 8 rural communities. 2. Promoting healthy life styles for 800 children and youth, within at least 10 rural and urban communities, from Baia Mare City and Maramureş County, throughout the service by practice of grassroots sports and daily outdoor activities. 3. Promoting proactive involvement of disadvantaged youths, mainly from rural areas, in a more inclusive growth by volunteering & nonformal education

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Travel: project coordinator informs counterparts in SOs/EVSers on travel routes & prices to match set budget. AIST reimburses eligible costs to SO/EVSer using transport documents, invoices & boarding passes/tickets needed to justify travel. AIST will provide volunteers with bikes for local transport & bus tickets for activities in rural areas outside Baia Mare city. Accommodation: EVSers will be hosted in safe & central lodging within Baia Mare, all facilities & utilities included. 120 euro/month - food allowance 60 euro/month - volunteer's allowance Romanian courses & mentroing included.

Training during the project

Learning environment & outcomes: EVSers will gain diverse social & educational skills & competences, that will be useful for their upcoming educational/training & employment opportunities. They will be involved in designing & implementing activities of social inclusion through nonformal educational methods practiced daily. EVSers will learn to plan, implement & adjust educational activities for children & youth, typical & underprivileged, from urban & rural environments as well. They'll also learn to be more flexible & adapt to changes as unexpected situations come up despite all planning.

Volunteer profile

Volunteers, over 18 years old, need to be interested in learning & personal development, enjoy working with kids & youth, be open & tolerant to other cultures. Flexibility is required, as they'll work in a multicultural environment as part of an international team. Being responsible, positive, energetic, communicative & a basic level of English is desirable to ease communication during project activities & within the international project team of staff & volunteers.

Placement dates

A total of 21 week(s) during the period 01/04/2019 to 30/09/2019

Placement location

47 Victoriei Steet, RO-4800 Maramures Baia Mare

Looking for volunteers from

Germany, Denmark, Spain, France, Italy, Latvia, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Social challenges

Citizenship and democratic participation

Health and wellbeing

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 08/04/2019

Our project has during Year I 3 youth mobility Activities, that follow our project objectives with Target group: kindergarten (4-6) primary (7-11) secondary, highschool & university students. Year I: 01.01.2019 - 30.06.2020, "DEMOCRATIC VALUES@work!", total participants 28, out of which 22 cross-border & 6 in-country volunteers: Act. 1: A1 Individual volunteering, 6 youth (Romanian) in-country, 12 months, June 1, 2019 - June 1, 2020.

LAST MINUTE! Ditch the "dis" in disABILITY. Social farm in ITALY

A Ruota Libera

Nettuno, Italy

Apply

Project description

Are you ready to leave your comfort zone and open for a new experiences? Do you see yourself being on a frontier of social changes? Working surrounded by nature, animals, family-like relationships? Well in this case – we are looking for you - a volunteer for 8 months project, in a social farm “Asino chi legge” south of Rome. This project offers an alternative surroundings (outdoor farm) and approaches (social agriculture) to practice inclusion, which lead to deep reflection to the meaning of what the disability is. The farm is open air place of learning for everyone and instead of focusing on DISability, focuses on enhancing different ABILITIES and learning to live with the values of respect, relationships and the natural rhythms. The main tasks of the volunteer will be to support the educators on the daily tasks of the farm (working in the garden, participate in educational workshops of farm products taking care of the donkeys), interact with disabled people and learn

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will live in the shared apartment close to the town center. There will be shared double rooms, a shared bathroom and common spaces as kitchen, living room and balconies. Wi-fi connection and utilities provided by the organisation. The volunteer will receive monthly pocket money, monthly bus ticket to reach a work place (3km away from the house) or/and bicycle to move around the area as everything is situated in a close-by area. The travel cost is reimbursed and the health insurance provided according to Erasmus+ rules.

Training during the project

The participant will receive: Volunteering training; Training provided by the National Agency; Language classes online and with a certified Italian teacher for foreigners.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for an EU resident, 18-30 years old, ready to START THE PROJECT ASAP and to stay the whole time of the project (March-December 2019). The participant should be open-minded, motivated to work in a natural environment, in close contact with animals, special need people and local community. ***Interested candidates should send their CV and motivation letter to the e-mail mobilita.aruotaliberaonlus@gmail.com AS SOON AS POSSIBLE***

Project description

Volunteer profile

Fondamentale non sono le competenze acquisite in passato, ma la motivazione a prendere parte all' esperienza, in considerazione dell'argomento del progetto. Per partecipare invia un'email a molfetta@incoweb.org, allegando cv e lettera di motivazione in inglese.

Changing the world from my neighborhood

Syncro - Synergy Croatia

Zagreb, Croatia

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

During 8 weeks (27.04. - 22.6.2019.) 10 volunteers will implement intercultural workshops in local school and library in Savica neighbourhood, Zagreb for kids aged 6 - 10. Participants of this project will create and implement those workshop in pair with elderly volunteers who are keen to volunteer together with young international volunteers. Volunteers will be presenting their countries, language, history and culture to 120 kids in 6 groups through an after-school stay in the local school and estimated additional 120 kids from neighbourhood attending 3 other schools in the area through workshops in the local library. Volunteers will organize 5 Syncro workshops through 5 Mondays on the activity. These workshops will give the opportunity for local youth to get to know the volunteers and the countries they come from. The content of the workshops will be based on the topic of interculturality. Apart from that volunteers will implement their individual personal projects.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation: all 10 volunteers will be living in Funky lounge hostel (7 tram stops, 20 min away from the office). For the purpose of this project, there will be rooms booked only for the participants of this project. Pocket and food money: the volunteers will receive 500 EUR/per project, in two payments. Transportation during the project: the volunteers will be provided with public transportation tickets. Health insurance: CIGNA Health Insurance is provided to volunteers as part of the project. Travel costs to and from Zagreb: will be reimbursed in accordance with EC distance calculator

Training during the project

During the first two week of their service, volunteers will have 20 hours of pedagogical, didactical and methodological training done by an elementary school teacher. Volunteers will also meet a social worker who shall provide 5 additional hours of the traing to prepare them for the social and emotional challenges of working with elderly people.

Volunteer profile

- resident in countries mentioned on the right - between 18 and 30 years - open to new experiences and want to meet new people from different countries - motivated to do tasks and activities planned, regardless of your previous experience - highly motivated to explore a new culture and to live like a local. and: - you want to change something in your life, step outside of your comfort zone and be inspired by other people you meet - you are ready to share your experience and learn from others - you are happy and you know it :

Placement dates

A total of 8 week(s) during the period 27/04/2019 to 22/06/2019

Placement location

Lastovska 2a, 10000 Zagreb

Looking for volunteers from

Belgium, Austria, Bulgaria, Slovakia, Hungary, France, Finland, Slovenia, Sweden, Germany

Fraternity to break the isolation of seniors

Mairie de Chalette

Chalette-sur-Loing, France

Project description

We are looking for two volunteers who will bring new and dynamic ideas to break the isolation of the seniors residents of our institution “Foyer Jacques Duclos” (not medicalized). Our goal is to help the residents to connect together (thanks to various activities) and to the local community (by participating in local events). Volunteers are brought to : • To visit the residents at home : reading, discussion, small games, development of an home newspaper… • Participate in collective actions : artistic expressions, gardening, cooking, visit… Initially, the volunteer will accompany the leader of the collective actions. He can then determine an lead his own project. • Participate in the organization of local events : parties, conferences, festivals, commemoration… • Participate in professional exchange.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Project 268: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10393_en


Research and conservation for mediterranean wetlands

A ROCHA FRANCE

ARLES, France

Apply

Project description

The project offers young people the opportunity to acquire competences in scientific studies of flora, fauna and ecosystems and to put this into practice by implementing projects for managing and protecting the sensitive and threatened wetlands of the Vallée des Baux near Arles. Volunteers will take part in observation, monitoring or censing of species, taking samples and analyzing them, protecting biodiversity of the sites managed by A Rocha by planting hedges, creating ponds, removing invasive species, setting up nesting boxes or perches, etc. They will benefit from French language courses, 10% of the time will be devoted to communicating about the ESC through different medium (video, stands, articles). 30% of the time will be spent on tasks related to the proper functioning of the Centre A Rocha France: - Welcoming visitors - Maintenance of the domain and its park, various tasks related to Community life.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers are housed at the study centre, which is also the logistic base for the projects, the head office and the hub for running the life of the team. They share rooms (1 to 4 people of the same sex per room, depending on the number of people in the centre). Lunch and supper are eaten together during the week with the team and any other participants at fixed times. Breakfasts are self-service. The team members take turns at preparing the meals for the group. Special diets are catered for. The centre is no-smoking. Bikes are available for getting around.

Training during the project

Training will be provided at arrival concerning the rules of life at the center, community life, week planning and project and activity description. Field work training is provided all along the project to the volunteer such as: species identification skills, protocols, use of observation tools and other field equipment. Training in database management, data analysis and report drafting is also provided depending on the volunteer skills at arrival. French lessons will be provided to the volunteer.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for volunteers who have a real interest in protecting the environment. They will need to enjoy life in the country and the contact with the flora and fauna, which means sometimes putting up with difficult conditions, getting around by bike, the wind, dry heat, etc. The volunteers will have to show that they can take initiatives in the tasks they undertake and take them through to completion. They should not hesitate to ask for clarification or direction if necessary for their projects. A basic knowledge of French is an advantage for the volunteers, but not a necessity.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/02/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

233 route de Coste Basse, 13200 ARLES

Looking for volunteers from

Spain, Portugal, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom, Netherlands, Slovenia, Malta, Luxembourg, Ireland

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 269: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10390_en


No One is Out- 2 months EVS in Italy

CESIE

Palermo, Italy, Italy

Apply

Project description

Migration is firmly at the top of the European Union's policy agenda. Indeed, the current data shows how the number of arrivals, mainly youth, in EU countries, firstly in Italy, is still important. Last data point out that in 2015 49% of third-country nationals were at risk of social exclusion compared with 22% among host-country nationals. Mobility and volunteering are among the most powerful educational tools for integration; the acquisition of soft and transversal skills is the foundation for further learning and the gateway to employment and social inclusion; a mobility abroad can deeply help to encourage these young people to improve not only their self- confidence, sense of social responsibility and level of psychological well-being, but also those soft and transversal skills which are necessary to enter in any working field.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

ACCOMMODATION The volunteers will live together in different houses with other volunteers belonging to other projects managed by CESIE in the city centre. Before their arrival, we will prepare the houses ensuring safe and clean conditions The volunteer will share a bedroom with another volunteer of the same gender. The cost of electricity, water, gas, are covered by the HO. Bedclothes and towels will not be provided. The management and the cleaning of the room have to be done in agreement with the other residents.

Training during the project

On arrival training, midterm and final evaluation at CESIE office and other training, workshops organised by CESIE.

Volunteer profile

EVS volunteers will implement EVS activities in Palermo targeting asylum seekers, refugees and young migrants and children from migration background; the activities could be run in shelter centres. EVS service will last for 2 months;

Placement dates

A total of 8 week(s) during the period 06/05/2019 to 05/07/2019

Placement location

Via roma 91,, 90133 Palermo, Italy

Looking for volunteers from

Greece, Germany

Placement topics

Social challenges

Reception and integration of refugees and migrants

Education and training

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 15/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 270: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10375_en


Face to face: Health included II

CIRIUS Kamnik, Center for rehabilitation, education and training

Kamnik, Slovenia

Apply

Project description

CIRIUS Kamnik (Center for rehabilitation, education and training) is a public institution, specialised for education and wholesome training of children and youngsters who are physically handicapped or have other various longterm illnesses. We offer a range of opportunities for youngsters to live a full and dynamic life beside offering them Educational and Training courses. We offer primary school and secondary school programs, special program of education, physiotherapy, occupational therapy, speech therapy, medical services and health care. Volunteers can be included in following activities: - organizing and implementing different activities for children and youngsters - presenting their country and culture - teaching basics of their language - helping with the organization of projects on local and international level - helping with sport activities and competitions, school garden, healthy life-style activities, different international projects - develop their own ideas

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation is in our new apartment, just a step away from our Center. Food is organized in our Center or you can also cook in your apartment.

Training during the project

Volunteers will have a constant support of professionals working in CIRIUS Kamnik. For the project we will train volunteers through basic begginers training, we will offer them on-going support. Volunteers will learn about methods of team work, group dynamic, method of active listening, experiental pedagogy, method of individual work and method of project work (from the idea, preparation, implementation and evaluation of the project). Being a part of activities will enable volunteers to get to know new and current methods of working with people with special needs and youngsters in general.

Volunteer profile

We are welcoming in our Center young people who would like to work with children and youngsters with special needs and recognise that every individual has something to offer to the community. We would like to co-operate with individuals who are patient, have good communication skills, are independent and like to work in a group setting. We support initiatives and suggestions and are looking forward to projects that can bring out the best out of people and support them on their journey of growth and inter-cultural understanding.

Placement dates

A total of 1 week(s) during the period 01/01/2019 to 31/07/2019

Placement location

Novi trg 43a, 1241 Kamnik

Looking for volunteers from

Latvia, Portugal

Placement topics

Social challenges

Health and wellbeing

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 271: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10368_en


Smile To You

Asociatia Voluntariat Pentru Viata

Marasesti, Romania

Apply

Project description

A 6-month volunteering project aiming to prevent the phenomenon of bullying among children/youngsters in schools through non-formal education activities.The project takes place in 2 different towns, which are 20 km apart: Mărăşeşti and Focsani and will be implemented by a group of 8 volunteers from different countries. • 4 volunteers will live in Focsani and 4 volunteers in Marasesti town and they will work with children/youngsters (6-18 years) from different schools. Project activities will have the form of thematic workshops, organized in schools and they are aimed at providing a neutral area to the children/youngsters to explore the deep causes of bullying and the possible measures and actions to address them from a constructive perspective. All activities will be based on non-formal education and will be achieved through an interactive approach.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will live in 2 flats in Focșani and Marasesti, in shared bedrooms, individual beds, with common area, shared cooking, washing, laundry and social facilities, free wi-fi included. Food: Volunteers will receive a monthly food allowance of 120 Euro to buy food products and cook for themselves and a monthly allowance of 90 Euro in form of “pocket money”. Transport: Volunteers are responsible for arranging their travel. The travel costs will be reimbursed at the end of the project according to the distance band limits imposed by the European Commission.

Training during the project

The volunteers will be accompanied and supported at all times during the activities by teachers from classes and they will receive training at the beginning of their stage in order to become familiar with the way the activities will be implemented. They will receive ongoing support from activity coordinators, teachers and staff of our organization. The volunteers will attend the On-Arrival Training and Mid-Term Evaluation, organized by the Romanian National Agency. The volunteers will also receive Romanian language training during the first 3 months.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for volunteers who are dynamic, creative, sociable, willing to spend time with children and patient in working with them; • The volunteers should be 18 -30 years old and should not have bad habits; • They should be motivated, willing to learn Romanian, able to work in a team, be flexible and creative and open to different cultures. The volunteers should be responsible and they should have a non-discriminatory attitude. • The volunteers should be motivated by this project and able to attend the full duration of the project.

Placement dates

A total of 21 week(s) during the period 15/01/2019 to 15/06/2019

Placement location

Nicolae Balcescu 2, 625200 Marasesti

Looking for volunteers from

Belgium, France, Italy, United Kingdom, Greece

Placement topics

Social challenges

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Stowarzyszenie ANAWOJ

Michałowo, Poland

Apply

Project description

ANAWOJ is searching for someone who is active, independent and creative to support our local and international activities. proposed tasks are the following: - organizing/or support events (logistic and content) in local community particularly for kids, youngsters and other volunteers - taking care of promotion, creating interesting materials (videos and photos), finding new ways of promoting Erasmus+, ANAWOJ and European Solidarity Corps, - assisting in office work (especial correspondence, public relations, updating of our homepage and local web-forum, edition of newsletter, creation of posters and information sheets etc. - organization of outdoor activities for children (in summer camps, forest activities or on playground, animation of cultural weeks during summer holidays) - Conducting "European workshop" in school, kindergarten and therapy center for disabled people,

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The life condition in Michalowo will be simple (for instance wooden houses heated by stove), so the volunteer should be sure that he/ she want to live in those simple conditions. The offer accommodation is in a nice and quiet environment, near nature.

Training during the project

Volunteers will participate in training courses provided by Polish National Agency (On-arrival training and Mid-term meeting), and in at least one training about animation-methods (for instance circus animation methods) for local activities. - organised by hosting organisation.

Volunteer profile

• skills in graphic design and making movies/ videos, taking photos, Someone flexible, who likes office work, but also move around when it is needed Someone who is able to manage his/her own time and is focused on tasks • He/ she should be open to live in a small village (3000 inhabitants). The next big city is far 40 km and can be reached by local busses. • The volunteer should be interested in work with kids and youth and need to have the ability to take initiative;

UNITY in culture diversity

MJC Vire-Normandie

Vire-Normandie, France

Apply

Project description

1. Support in the entertainment center – preparation and organisation of the activities for children. 2. Assistance in preparing the association's events (dance, games, youth developpement etc.) 3. Organisation of language workshops, expositions, meetings and games about the volunteer's country. 4. Creation of activities corresponding with volunteer's interests (like sport, music, photography, languages, multimedia, literature, theatre, journalism etc.). 5. Animation of informal activities (in cooperation with the local institutions, like CREAN Europe Direct). 6. Animation of European Club in the local college. 7. - Develop projects to connect young people from Vire with young people from twinned cities and/or other European cities. To stimulate among the young people of Vire the desire to go and live a European voluntary service. 8. To invest migrant or refugee families in projects of a cultural nature that promote their know-how and know-how (cooking, photography, etc)

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will live together in an appartement, based in Vire-Normandie, which is situated close to our organization. Every volunteer have one bedroom and there is one communal kitchen. It is a T4 apartment (three bedrooms with a living room, an equipped kitchen, a bathroom, toilets), in a residence located in the heart of the city. Young people will also be able to use a bicycle provided by the association, in order to be mobile in the city. The volunteers will get money for alimentation and pocket money.

Training during the project

All volunteers can improve their specific competences by working with young people. Besides the possibility of being volunteer in our organisation, we would like to offer the possibility of develope their personal projects (such as exchanges, events, seminaries, workshops) with our team's support. Thanks to this experience, the volunteers can develope their personal potential and their possibility to turn ideas into action. We would like to have an occasion to get familiar with different methods of informal education and to cooperate with local communities

Volunteer profile

The volunteers shoul be motivated to work with children and youth in the context of an non-formal education as well as they should be interseted in different domains like music, photography, culture, animation for children, sport and how this can be used in an association. A person creative, open-minded and with artistic and cultural competences. Furthermore, the volunteer should be interested in the animation of persons to include them in the public and social life. He or she should be able to work in a team, be flexible and in some independent way.

Placement dates

Les Pieds Mobiles - Volontariat en Géorgie

ISCR

Rustavi, Georgia

Apply

Project description

Association "International Scout Center Rustavi" (ISCR) est un organisme indépendant de jeunes. ISCR représente un mouvement éducatif volontaire pour les enfants et les jeunes ouverts à tous sans distinction d'origine, de race, de sexe et de religion. ISCR aide les enfants et les jeunes à recevoir une éducation formelle et non formelle. Les activités sont basées sur une autonomie complète et participation volontaire de ses membres. Compte tenu de la situation actuelle dans le pays et dans le pays l’ISCR a pour objectif principal de développer le travail de jeunesse et le scoutisme, qui contribueront au développement de la jeune génération à se développer en tant qu’individus et citoyens responsables, et en tant que membres de leurs communautés locales, nationales et internationales. L'ISCR gère également une maison des scouts et accueille des groupes internationaux de personnes qui assistent à un événement ou à un séminaire, ainsi que des groupes indépendants.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Le/la volontaire sera hébergé.e dans un appartement en colocation avec d'autres volontaires internationaux. Il/elle aura sa propre chambre mais partagera les parties communes (salon, salle de bain et cuisine). Le/la volontaire recevra une indemnité pour la nourriture et l'argent de poche tous les mois. Le voyage aller/retour sera pris en charge à hauteur du budget européen.

Training during the project

Le/la volontaire participera à une formation avant son départ organisée par Hors Pistes. Sur place, le/la volontaire participera à une formation à l'arrivée et à mi-parcours organisées par l'Agence Nationale.

Volunteer profile

Nous ne demandons aucune qualification particulière, le seul critère de sélection sera la motivation du volontaire. Le/la volontaire doit tout de même s'intéresser aux activités interculturelles, l'éducation non-formelle et l'animation avec les enfants.

Placement dates

A total of 1 week(s) during the period 01/02/2019 to 30/04/2020

Placement location

Rustavi

Looking for volunteers from

France

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.

Volunteering opportunities in France - Grand Est

Volunteering opportunities in the "Grand Est" region in France. A list of the partners and specific fact&info-sheets can be send to interested volunteers.

Luxembourg, Luxembourg

Apply

Project description

We are a sending organisation from Luxembourg that is working in close cooperation with partners from the "Grand Est"-region in France: Nancy, Verdun, Maxéville, Metz, Bonzée, Vecoux, Scy-Chazelles, ... others might follow in the near future. We are currently running a project which is already granted and which consists in sending volunteers to our partners' placements in the "Grand Est" region. We can only send volunteers who are residents in Luxembourg!

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

All our partners in France are offering appropriate accommodation to their volunteers. The concrete individual accommodation is to be checked with each partner. Arrangements for food differ from one partner to another. It can be a monthly food allocation or the possibility to have food provided by the hosting partner or a mixture of both. The same is true for the arrangements for local transportation. In any case, a sound management of these logistical issues is granted and all elements linked to these issues are clarified beforehand to any final decisions and agreements.

Training during the project

The volunteers will have appropriate training before their departure. This preparation consists in meeting with the Education4all staff and in the participation in the obligatory trainings offered by the Service national de la jeunesse (SNJ) in cooperation with the national agency. During the volunteering activity, the volunteers will participate in the obligatory trainings offered by the French national agency. Our partners will provide specific task-related training, if needed. Language courses are possible, if needed. These will be online courses adapted to the volunteers' skills (OLS)

Volunteer profile

* Resident in Luxembourg * Aged 18+ * Motivated to actively participate in the partners' activities * Ready to pick up the challenge of an own project * French language skills (basic) * Being autonomous enough to live on his/her own

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/01/2019 to 30/06/2020

Placement location

27b, Boulevard Grande-Duchesse Charlotte, 1330 Luxembourg

Looking for volunteers from

Luxembourg

Placement topics

Education and training

Creativity and culture

l'ESS au quotidien : petits et grands travaux

Les Ateliers

Castres, France

Apply

Project description

The center "Les Ateliers" is located in a renovated factory of 4000m² in Castres, in the south of Tarn, 70 km from Toulouse. It combines offices, co-working space, shops, restaurant, upcycling / recycling workshop organizes events. This gathering of structures within this same site reinforces their visibility. We also host various workshops: yoga, tap dancing, meditation, etc ... We propose a cultural offer every thursdays and fridays: concerts, debates, shows, slam sessions, citizen coffee, sign language evening. - Work in the market-recycling fl ow: renovation and creation of furniture from recycled elements. Work with various materials: wood, metal, fabrics, etc ... - Participation in the bike workshop - Participation in cultural evenings: reception of the artists, communication on the events, bar service and indoor. Learning opportunities: organizational, self-confidence, teamwork - Possibility to develop a personal project within a framework defined by the committee

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Public transport in the city of Castres is free, moreover we can put a bike available to the volunteer. We have planned to look for a flat share with a student in the city center in order to facilitate the integration of the volunteer. For food we have planned to invite the volunteer to eat at our restaurant. structure, we will give him a budget for breakfasts and weekends.

Training during the project

At the start in the CES we have planned to participate in tutoring training. -For the integration into the team and the life of the pole: participation of the volunteer in the team meeting monthly + a meeting every 15 days between the volunteer and his tutors (then more spaces) - creation of a book / agenda co-built with volunteers. For this project we are accompanied by a trainer for EVS, Laetitia Barbry, who is one of the members of the Workshops, and is committed to accompany us question of learning volunteers. We are familiar with the youthpass.

Volunteer profile

We have no prerequisites for the volunteers who will be welcomed, if not the motivation for the project and an understanding of the diversity of the proposed activities. We will promote as far as possible a woman / man pair, parity. We have no age or age criteria skills and experience. In order to facilitate a transparent and open selection, we will propose a questionnaire about their motivations and expectations and will carry out recruitment based on the answers to that survey.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/02/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

22 rue Merigonde, 81100 Castres

Looking for volunteers from

HUJ Voluntary Service of Armenia, Office

HUJ Voluntary Service of Armenia

Yerevan, Armenia

Apply

Project description

Voluntary Service of Armenia - Republican Headquarters of Student Brigades (HUJ) was founded in 1965 and is a registered Non-Profit Non-Governmental Organisation and is situated inYerevan, the administrative, cultural, and industrial centre of the country. HUJ is a member of the Coordinating Committee of International Voluntary Service (CCIVS) at UNESCO and the Alliance of European Voluntary Service Organisations. The principal tasks will be : -Assistance in HUJ activities and promotion of volunteering lifestyle. Support and active participation in conferences, meetings, training courses, seminars and other similar events. -Assistance in organization of international voluntary workcamps. -Promotion of HUJ Volunteering Project by going and having a speeches and presentations in different Universities of Armenia.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteer will be provided with a good accommodation dormitory of Yerevan Brusov State University which is close to Yerevan city center, the capital of Armenia, where they live with nearly 15 long term HUJ volunteers from different European countries. Each Month the volunteer will receive Pocket Money and Money for Food and Transportation. The Volunteer will also have Armenian class in a language center twice a week.

Training during the project

After His/Her Arrival in Armenia, The volunteer will meet the staff of Huj Office and be introduce to His/Her Mentor. They will go around the city for some cultural visit. For long term ECS/EVS : 2 trainings will take place in Georgia (On arrival training and mid term training) For short term ESC/EVS : 1 training will take place in Georgia (On arrival training)

Volunteer profile

There are no gender, age and other requirements for the selection/recruitment of volunteers. The volunteer should be open-minded, flexible, creative and communicative. The volunteer should be able to communicate in English or French to allow him/her a better integration in the team. During his/her Service, the volunteer will work with people who have a great experience of working with youth from different backgrounds and will become a full member of our team.

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 11/02/2019 to 10/02/2020

Placement location

Republican Pediatric Rehabilitation Center

Republican Pediatric Rehabilitation Center

Yerevan, Armenia

Apply

Project description

The Rehabilitation Center is giving treatment for underage patients with different chronic diseases. Rehabilitation medicine is new in Armenia, it needs to develop involving general rehabilitation events that will contribute to the disabled children’s physical and mental maximum development, will give them independence in their daily activities and will contribute to the integration into society. In 2002 an Integration Kindergarden was built on the grounds of Republican Paediatric Rehabilitation Centre. The organisation has a many-years experience of hosting international volunteers for short (international summer workcamps) and long term (EVS volunteers). As a good example of most successful projects of EVS volunteers we may give the opening of the Happy Room in the Centre, where the volunteers work with children and create an ambiance of being away from the Centre and letting the kids to forget they are in the process of receiving treatment.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

They will be provided with a good accommodation dormitory of Yerevan Brusov State University which is close to Yerevan city center, the capital of Armenia, where they live with nearly 15 long term HUJ volunteers from different European countries. Each Month the volunteer will receive Pocket Money and Money for Food and Transportation. The Volunteer will also have Armenian class in a language center twice a week.

Training during the project

After His/Her Arrival in Armenia, The volunteer will meet the staff of Huj Office and be introduce to His/Her Mentor. They will go around the city for some cultural visit. For long term ECS/EVS : 2 trainings will take place in Georgia (On arrival training and mid term training) For short term ESC/EVS : 1 training will take place in Georgia (On arrival training)

Volunteer profile

The volunteer will participate in most activities with the children and have a variety of different tasks. He/she will participate in all arts workshops and support the staff in organizing these activities (painting, sculpturing, handicrafts, etc.), maintain the “Happy room” in the Centre and organise recreational activities for the children and therapy. The fact that an international volunteer speaks a different language, and comes from a different culture brings new live to the Center. New ideas regarding activities are more than welcome. We wish that a volunteer develops an own project.

Placement dates

National Gallery of Armenia

National Gallery of Armenia

Yerevan, Armenia

Apply

Project description

The National Gallery of Armenia was founded in 1921, is the country’s major art gallery. National Gallery of Armenia has about 40 000 pieces of art. The programs are aimed at discovering the NGA collection as well as the masterpieces by the renowned artists exhibited in the leading world museums. They give them an opportunity to create themselves, to get an aesthetic education in specific museum atmosphere and to spend eventful time. Thematic- interactive and educational programs are organized for children including film and cartoon viewing, workshops and visits to some branches of the Gallery The volunteer will assist the excursion department.The work will be not only entertaining, but also educational. The volunteer will discover Armenian painters, treasures of NGA, to learn the history of the art and the science of museology in general. Moreover, the guides of NGA will help the volunteer to organize guide tours.he volunteer also will be given a task to moderate social media

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

They will be provided with a good accommodation dormitory of Yerevan Brusov State University which is close to Yerevan city center, the capital of Armenia, where they live with nearly 15 long term HUJ volunteers from different European countries. Each Month the volunteer will receive Pocket Money and Money for Food and Transportation. The Volunteer will also have Armenian class in a language center twice a week.

Training during the project

After His/Her Arrival in Armenia, The volunteer will meet the staff of Huj Office and be introduce to His/Her Mentor. They will go around the city for some cultural visit. For long term ECS/EVS : 2 trainings will take place in Georgia (On arrival training and mid term training) For short term ESC/EVS : 1 training will take place in Georgia (On arrival training)

Volunteer profile

Having an interest for Art and Culture is needed for this ECS programm. As a member of the marketing department, the volunteer will attend different meetings, staff brain-storming and will be given a chance to come up with his/her own ideas. The volunteer will aslo participe to educational programm and thematic- interactive organized for children including film and cartoon viewing, workshops, that's why he/she will need to be attentive and responsible about how to adapt his/she behaviour for working with children.

Project 280: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10095_en


SOS – Children’s Villages

SOS – Children’s Villages

Kotayk / Abovyan, Armenia

Apply

Project description

The SOS Children’s Village Kotayk is located about 20 km north of the capital of Yerevan. The plot of land measures about 6 ha and was donated by the local authorities. It was built earthquake-proof using pre-fabricated elements and was already completed in 1990. In 1992, a SOS-kindergarten was added, which takes in children from the neighbourhood as well. On 18 April 1998 the SOS Children’s Village Kotayk was officially opened in the presence of Mr. Helmut Kutin, president of SOS-Kinderdorf International, and other guests of honour. The SOS Children’s Village Kotayk consists of 12 family houses, a SOS kindergarten, a Village Director’s house, accommodation for the aunts, a Community House, offices and staff quarters. 15 children live in the SOS village and 8-9 children coming from nearby regions, where there are no kindergartens. The tasks for the volunteer will be to entertain the children with differents activities of his/her choice.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteer will be provided with a good accommodation dormitory of Yerevan Brusov State University which is close to Yerevan city center, the capital of Armenia, where they live with nearly 15 long term volunteers of HUJ from different European countries. Each Month the volunteer will receive Pocket Money and Money for Food and Transportation. The Volunteer will also have Armenian class in a language center twice a week.

Training during the project

After His/Her Arrival in Armenia, The volunteer will meet the staff of Huj Office and be introduce to His/Her Mentor. They will go around the city for some cultural visit. For long term ECS/EVS : 2 trainings will take place in Georgia (On arrival training and mid term training) For short term ESC/EVS : 1 training will take place in Georgia (On arrival training)

Volunteer profile

The Volunteer will need to be an organized and responsible person bacause he/she will provide own language courses to children in the SOS office, in Yerevan city centre. If the Volunteer have some hobbies or ideas that he/she wants to share by organizing activities for groups of kids, he/she is always welcome. The staff and the children of the village like meeting new people from differents culture. Being creative is important in SOS – Children’s Villages because it's a huge area so there is a plenty of possibility to vary activities depending on the weather.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 30/11/2020

Placement location

Kotayk / Abovyan
