Project 281: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10081_en


PAC - Parenting as Citizenship 6 month EVS - start as soon as possible

A.C.T.O.R. - Asociatia Culturala pentru Teatru si Origami din Romania

Bucharest, Romania

Apply

Project description

PaC’s GOAL: Increasing parents’ awareness about their role as active citizens in relation with the educative institutions. Activities - Designing and leading individual sessions with kids from schools and kindergartens about interculturality -Designing and leading non-formal activities (in the field of art for education) for children, teachers and parents in schools (primary schools and kindergartens); -Designing and leading clinical animation sessions for children & youngsters in hospitals & social centres; -Promoting volunteering through non-formal activities and Forum Theatre sessions with youngsters; -Organizing the Flower Campaign; collecting donations for kids in hospitals & social centers -Running the visibility of the project (writing articles, managing the blog and the Facebook page of the project); -Creating a toolkit about practices and non-formal activities for children engaging teachers and parents.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The organization will provide to the volunteers a flat where to live, money for food, pocket money, reimbursement for the flights to come and go back home, reimbursement for the monthly metro and bus tickets and a Romanian telephone card. Volunteers will live in a flat specially rented for them in double rooms, with a kitchen and a bathroom totally equipped. They will receive 120€ per month for food, with those money volunteers will have to provide to cook by themselves. They will also receive 60€ per month for pocket money. During the EVS they will have to keep the flat clean by themselves.

Training during the project

It will be assured them the EVS training cycle (pre-departure training in their sending organizations, arrival training in ACTOR, OAT and MTM by Romanian National Agency). They will also receive specific trainings related to the project topic. Example: administrative and technical information about ACTOR and local partners, Clinical Animation trainings, Psyco-pedagogical trainings, Origami Theater trainings, Parenting Worlshops etc.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for an 18-30 years old volunteer who has: – motivation to live and work in a big European Capital (Bucharest) – motivation to work with youngsters and children in hospitals and social centers (also disadvantage ones) – motivation to work with children in schools (primary schools and kindergartens) involving also teachers and parents – basic knowledge of English – interest in any form of art (cuisine, music, dance, theater, art, art & crafts, etc…) – interest in psycho-pedagogy and childhood education

Placement dates

A total of 24 week(s) during the period 01/05/2019 to 30/11/2019

Placement location

Str DOINA nr 13-17, bloc 1, scara 2, etaj 1, apartament 17, sector 5, 052151 Bucharest

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Estonia, France, Italy, Spain

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 282: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/10058_en


Child Care and Support Centre ZATIK

Zatik Child Care and Support center

Yerevan, Armenia

Apply

Project description

The Centre is located in Yerevan. There are 100 children visiting the centre, who study at different schools of the city. These children are those with varied challenges at home. The organisation has a many-years experience of hosting international volunteers for short (international summer workcamps) and long term (EVS volunteers). The staff of ZATIK is well experienced in working with the volunteers and providing them with a rich learning experience. The activities implemented by the organisation are in line with objectives of this project and will contribute to a fruitful flow of the project. The major achievements of volunteers include an open space for the “graduates” of the centre to live in: a village Zatikavan. The project there was opened in 2013 as a project in project of long-term volunteers. The volunteers also had varied activities, such as performances, concerts, various workshops on important topics, mediated by the volunteers for the children.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

They will be provided with a good accommodation dormitory of Yerevan Brusov State University which is close to Yerevan city center, the capital of Armenia, where they live with nearly 15 long term HUJ volunteers from different European countries. Each Month the volunteer will receive Pocket Money and Money for Food and Transportation. The Volunteer will also have Armenian class in a language center twice a week.

Training during the project

After His/Her Arrival in Armenia, The volunteer will meet the staff of Huj Office and be introduce to His/Her Mentor. They will go around the city for some cultural visit. For long term ECS/EVS : 2 trainings will take place in Georgia (On arrival training and mid term training) For short term ESC/EVS : 1 training will take place in Georgia (On arrival training)

Volunteer profile

If you like working and leading activities for Children and gain a lot of knowledge and skills from social workers of Zatik If you want to discover a new language, culture and environment. If you want to share your experience with the Organisation you will work with.

Placement dates

A total of 48 week(s) during the period 01/07/2019 to 31/07/2020

Placement location

Zakaria Kanakertsu building 145B, 0091 Yerevan

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg

Placement topics

Social challenges

Creativity and culture

History Museum of Armenia

History Museum of Armenia

Yerevan, Armenia

Apply

Project description

The History Museum of Armenia was founded in 1919 by the Parliament Law of the First Republic of Armenia.The History Museum of Armenia is entrusted with a national collection of c. 400,000 objects. The tasks delegated to the volunteer will cover such areas as: Assist the staff and admin-staff of the History Museum of Armenia: Volunteer once a week will participate in a well-regarded program for children which are managed by the HMA’s Education department. Assistance staff to collect visitors’ feedbacks which will be helpful in the development of the museum’s Support and active participation in events organise by the Museum conferences, meetings, International Museum Day, European Night of Museums. Promoting Museum Calendar on Social Network Any initiative taken by the volunteer will be highly appreciated, besides the volunteer will be gladly involved in any activity of History Museum of Armenia as he/she wishes.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

They will be provided with a good accommodation dormitory of Yerevan Brusov State University which is close to Yerevan city center, the capital of Armenia, where they live with nearly 15 long term HUJ volunteers from different European countries. Each Month the volunteer will receive Pocket Money and Money for Food and Transportation. The Volunteer will also have Armenian class in a language center twice a week.

Training during the project

After His/Her Arrival in Armenia, The volunteer will meet the staff of Huj Office and be introduce to His/Her Mentor. They will go around the city for some cultural visit. For long term ECS/EVS : 2 trainings will take place in Georgia (On arrival training and mid term training) For short term ESC/EVS : 1 training will take place in Georgia (On arrival training)

Volunteer profile

A person who like History and Art ready to learn new skills and knowledge Like working with children and interrested in leading activities. Someone able to take initiatives and who want to discover a new field of competence

4 Republic Square, 375010 Yerevan

Be green - EVS Long Term in south of France.

Initiative et Développement Citoyen

Lastours, France

Apply

Project description

Initiative et Developpement Citoyen is a non-profite cooperative based in a small village in the south of France. Its main activities include an ecologic campsite, open to tourists from April to October, environmental education activities, organic gardening, international youth mobility activities, such as youth exchanges and European Voluntary Service, workcamps, green building, events for local community and much more. It is situated in a very rural area with little connections to closest city (Carcassonne), 18km away from the campsite. he volunteer will support the team on different profiles, from the most easy who can participate and help in everything to the most specialize on communication, promotion, organization of events and entertainment, logistics, setting up and animation of seminars and Workcamp, discovery of environmental awareness and preservation of green spaces etc. Each activitie will be given according to the volunteers goal, which will be setup at arrival.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation, food and transport will be provided to each volunteer by IDC. The cooperative is based in an ecological camping and you will be hosted in the mobile homes. The general shopping for all the volunteer team will be done twice a month by a volunteer who is interested and responsable in purchasing. IDC, moreover, will provide a car. The volunteers can use to go to the nearest city (Carcassonne).

Training during the project

The volunteer will have the occasion to take part in none formal arrival and mid-term training.

Volunteer profile

The volunteers will be polyvalent in all the activities and they will have an important supporting role: - Taking care of the green spaces, watering plants, maintaining trees and vegetable garden. (2 times per week) - Participation in daily life with the cleaning of the common showers area and cooking for everyone; - Collaboration on party events and green buildings conducted by the structure projects; - Helping to create , manage and distribute information on the organisation. -Taking photos and videos -Painitng and renovate wood -Activities with children -Set up your own project.

Placement dates

A total of 26 week(s) during the period 01/06/2019 to 30/11/2019

Placement location

Camping le Belvédère, 11600 Lastours

Looking for volunteers from

Spain, Italy, Hungary, Turkey

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Health and wellbeing

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 01/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 287: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/9960_en


SMILE & GO in Slovenia

PiNA

Koper, Slovenia

Apply

Project description

SMILE & GO è un progetto di Servizio Volontario Europeo (SVE) coordinato dal CEMEA del Mezzogiorno onlus che permette a 30 giovani tra i 18 ed i 30 anni residenti in Italia di fare una esperienza di apprendimento all'estero in organizzazioni no profit che operano nel campo dell'animazione socio-culturale in Bulgaria, Croazia, Francia, Portogallo, Romania, Regno Unito, Slovenia e Spagna. Uno dei primi progetti in partenza a Giugno 2019: quello in Slovenia, presso l'organizzazione PiNA. Il campo principale è quello del giornalismo, multimedia e della promozione della mobilità educativa dei giovani. Il/la volontario/a farà parte dell’èquipe di PiNA e contribuirà allo sviluppo dei suoi progetti sia a livello locale che internazionale: Realizzazione di laboratori multimedia (fotografia, graphic design, animazione digitale, video riprese, video editing...); Attività di giornalismo (blog, articoli); Promuovere la mobilità educativa dei giovani; Networking locale & internazionale.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Alloggio: in un appartamento, condiviso con altri volontari. Il volontario avrà una camera condivisa (2 persone / camera); la cucina ed il bagno condivisi con altri volontari. Il viaggio andata e ritorno verrà rimborsato fino all'ammontare massimo di 180 euro. Ogni volontario riceverà un budget per il vitto, oltre al pocket money mensile.

Training during the project

I volontari saranno supportati e guidati dall'organizzazione di accoglienza durante le attività. I volontari parteciperanno ad un evento di formazione all'arrivo organizzato dall'Agenzia Nazionale per i Giovani Slovena.

Volunteer profile

Il progetto è rivolto a giovani tra i 18 ed i 30 anni, residenti in Italia. 20 posti e la partecipazione ai laboratori locali Comp-pass sono riservati prioritariamente a giovani della Regione Lazio che non studiano, non lavorano e non frequentano corsi di formazione professionale. Al volontario non è richiesta alcuna competenza specifica nel campo, né la conoscenza della lingua del paese di accoglienza. I requisiti più importanti sono l’interesse per la tematica del progetto e la motivazione a mettersi in gioco in un’esperienza di apprendimento in un contesto interculturale.

Placement dates

A total of 25 week(s) during the period 03/06/2019 to 29/11/2019

Placement location

Gregorčičeva 6, 6000 Koper

Looking for volunteers from

Italy

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 14/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 288: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/9930_en


Adventure of A Life Time

Arel University Istanbul

Istanbul, Turkey

Apply

Project description

"Adventure of A Life Time" is an Erasmus+ European Voluntary Service project which includes total 8 volunteers from Italy, Romania, Ukraine and Macedonia (2 volunteers per country). Activities will take place for 10 months each in İstanbul Turkey and hosting organisation is Istanbul Arel University. We wanted to run an EVS hosting project because with 68 youth clubs within our university, we are already running social responsibility projects but these activities are not well enough to be international and have the idea of globalisation. This EVS will help us and our local beneficiars to be open minded and have the cultural awareness. These youth clubes which are already running social, cultural and sport activities and their main activity types are; seminar, trainings, congrees, workshops, awareness campaigns, social responsibility activities, healthy life style activities. Our EVS volunteers will be attending mentioned activities with our students and local youth.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation will be provided by our organization Volunteers will stay in Beykent, Beylikdüzü which is approximately 20 KM away from the main campus. Volunteers will reside in shared flat with a local family which composed a mother and two siblings and a cat called Odis. There will be a private room for EVS Volunteers and 2(two) volunteers will stay in the shared room together according to the gender balance. The double room has private bathroom. Volunteers also will be able to use living room, kitchen and other common areas in the house.

Training during the project

- Predeparture Training - Training in hosting organization

Volunteer profile

- Age between 18-30 years old; - English – average (B1); - Interested and motivated in working with young people; - Willing to get involved in communicating with young people; - Patient, responsible, creative, open-minded;

Placement dates

A total of 8 week(s) during the period 01/02/2019 to 30/04/2019

Placement location

Turkoba Mah. Erguvan Sok. No: 26/K Tepekent Büyükçekmece, - Istanbul

Looking for volunteers from

Romania

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

Education and volunteering - Romania - Volunteers from Portugal only

Resita, Romania

Apply

Project description

The Association it’s a nonprofit apolitical organization which was founded by a group of teachers, Roma activists and Roma students from our county.. The aim of the association is to decrease the economic, social, educational and cultural differences in the society. Volunteers´ tasks: - weekly activities in 3 schools from the disadvantaged communities from Resita using non-formal education methods whith the aim to make school more attractive for kids (primary and secondary school). The activity will be done in teams of two people - Weekly activity with our local volunteer’s forum theater, civic activities, dance, music - Monthly activities to promote EVS and volunteering and recruit new volunteers - Weekly activity to promote languages Language cafee - Involvement in our office work (2 days/ week) online promotion for our projects, field work for the research activities developed by Nevo Parudimos, - Mentoring two local volunteers

Volunteer profile

• aged between 18 and 30 years; • enthusiastic and eager to learn more about inclusion, civic involvement and volunteering • english knowledge, at least the minimum bases, to be able to communicate with the staff and the other volunteers; • ability to work in teams; • to be open minded and sociable; • minimum knowledge about non formal education • minimum knowledge about voluntary work • have minimum knowledge about civic involvement and participation • tolerant and able to work in poor communities • want to work with youngsters and take part to educational inclusive activities

EVS in Curba de Cultura

Curba de Cultura

Izvoarele, Romania

Apply

Project description

The youth centre will be the base of operations for all projects taking place in the rural community of Izvoarele village, Prahova County in Romania. The beautiful surroundings and the mountain landscape will provide an excellent environment for building trust, tolerance and understanding and will create great personal development opportunities. The youth centre is serving the local community providing educational activities, training courses, campaigns and events. It also serves as a networking and friendship building framework for young people in the community offering the space and opportunity for planning trips throughout the country and mountain hikes. The youngsters also develop projects in the interest of the community with the help and support of the staff. The youth centre also offers a public library aimed at young people and plenty of games and juggling resources and materials.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will live inside the community, which is a regular mountain community in rural Romania. Accommodation will be provided in a traditional rural house, therefore the volunteers will be responsible for their own resource management and will have the opportunity of experimenting the rural life of the community thus developing strong civic and social skills.

Training during the project

On-Arrival and Midterm-Training in Romania Pre-Departure and Welcome-Back Seminar in Germany

Volunteer profile

The volunteer should accept living in a house together with other volunteers. He/she should be flexible, creative and should not be afraid to work outside.The volunteer should like to work with childen/youngster and young adults...

Placement dates

A total of 32 week(s) during the period 01/11/2018 to 31/07/2019

Placement location

Izvoarele

Looking for volunteers from

Germany

Social challenges

Education and training

Creativity and culture

No application deadline

Volunteer Experience in Education for Sustainability

Junák - český skaut, Kaprálův mlýn, z. s.

Ochoz u Brna, Czech Republic

Apply

Project description

Kaprálův mlýn is a scout environmental education centre situated in Moravian karst landscape protected area. Volunteering at Kaprálův mlýn consists of various activities: - assisting with the environmental education programmes (outdoor ecology for highschool students, outdoor activities, forest kindergarden), - helping with the operation of the centre (guest-care, cleaning, kitchen, info-shop duties), - working outside (looking after the garden, nature conservation work, preparing wood for winter, cutting the grass), - education (czech lessons, workshops, NGO, environmental projects, conservation), - your own personal project.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation Volunteers live in a two-storey straw house (equipped kitchen, common room, bedrooms) situated on a nice place just 50 m from the main bulding of Kapraluv mlyn. Food Because meals for the guests are being prepared we can provide home-made cuisine three times a day for volunteers as well, respecting individual diets; volunteers can also cook on their own in the kitchen in their house. Transport Volunteers get ticket for public transport, Brno downtown is accesible within 30 minutes. There are bikes which volunteers can use as well.

Training during the project

On-arrival and Midterm training organized by National Agency. Czech language lessons. Introductory training in the organisation (health and safety, programmes, building maintanance, office skills, surrounding...) Special workshops - depends on volunteers´ interests (Heritage interpretation, Grant applications, Corel Draw, GIS and GPS, Zoner, First aid, Environmental ethics, Natural resources, Eco-friendly housing...).

Volunteer profile

In accordance with the mission of Kapraluv mlyn Scout Environmental Education Centre we prefer volunteers who are interested in nature conservation, environmental education, sustainable technologies and leisure time activities for kids and youth. We consider the EVS project as a way to share our knowledge. That is why open-mindness, willingness to learn new things and discipline are the qualities we are asking for.

Placement dates

A total of 54 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

Ochoz u Brna 235, Ochoz u Brna Ochoz u Brna

Looking for volunteers from

Bulgaria, Germany, Denmark, Finland, Austria, Belgium, Cyprus, Estonia, Greece, Spain, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 01/04/2019

Project 292: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/9863_en


Working with social disadvantaged children and youngsters.

Gigos Genk

Genk, Belgium

Apply

Project description

Gigos Genk is an NGO with 5 youth centres located in 5 different places in Genk. All these different organizations work with social disadvantaged children and youngsters between 3 and 25 years old. We offer daily activities in the leisure time of the children and youngsters. Activities can be sport, games, handy craft but also educational activities: like activities to increase their confidence, education about drugs/ gambling, how to apply for a job, … Next to these activities, we also organize social, artistic, cultural workshops. Workshops we offer are: street theater, photography, dance, multi media. Through these workshops we want to offer a forum where youngsters can show their talents. We want to give volunteers the opportunity, through a solid/structured project, to experience how to interact with youngsters who are in a social vunerable position. Volunteers work 5 days a week with the children and youngsters. They will have the opportunity to create their own project.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

We, as coordinating organization, will arrange the travel for the volunteers. We send volunteers their e-ticket and all the info. Our 4 volunteers will live in a house that they need to share. They will have an own bedroom but the livingroom, kitchen and bathroom are common. Each month they will recieve money for food costs but next to that also pocketmoney. When they arrive we will provide them a pass to travel by bus whenever they want through the whole of Flanders. At the house where they will stay is also a bicycle provided for each volunteer.

Training during the project

Volunteers are obligated to attend the on-arrival and mid-term training organized by the National Agency.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for 4 volunteers ( M/F ) who stand in live with some dose of positivity and maturity and who is enthousiastic by the thought of working with children and youngsters. Having some experience in working with children and youngsters is a plus! We select volunteers on base of creativity, flexibility, social skills, open minded to all cultures and they have to like working with children and youngsters. Send us your CV and motiation letter! BE CREATIVE!

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 09/09/2019 to 07/09/2020

Placement location

Stalenstraat 15, 3600 Genk

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia

Placement topics

Social challenges

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 06/05/2019

Project 293: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/9859_en


Voluntariado con niños con dificultades o con discapacitados Francia

asociacion building bridges

Valence, France

Apply

Project description

Si eres una persona joven y con motivación para ayudar, anímate a realizar este voluntariado con niños con dificultades o con discapacitados en Francia. he missions of the center for children and teenagers in the Drôme are: to protect, assist and educate children, teenagers and young adults in difficulty or in danger for any reason to aware the public opinion of the problems of these young people in order to promote their development and their social integration to encourage their expression and facilitate their communication with their environment to create, manage and develop the facilities and services to fulfill those missions to participate in the consultative bodies set up by the authorities on all projects which could improve the protection of children and adolescents at risk Valence is a commune in southeastern France, the capital of the Drôme department and within the Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes region. It is situated on the left bank of the Rhône, about 100 kilometres

Training during the project

he volunteer will always be under the responsibility of a professional. He will accompany the children from day to day, because we want him to participate in the material support children need at crucial moments of their lives: getting up, taking the meals, getting to sleep. The volunteer may also lead games and workshops depending on the age of children (eg culinary workshop on regional specialties from the volunteer’s country of origin; music workshop if the volunteer plays an instrument …). During daytime, he will participate in various leisure and educational workshops (artistic expressio

Volunteer profile

The volunteer will perform his project within the framework of a residential centre or a house. The life implies to live on site during the missions’ days: take the meals with the disabled people, share their leisure time, sleep in the household. During the days off, the volunteer can stay or non in the household. The main activities will be as followed : Help people in their everyday life : daily gesture, go to the grocery store, help people to go outside Contribute to the educative action (participation to observation, reflexion, respect and implementation of a personal project).

Placement dates

A total of 39 week(s) during the period 01/01/2019 to 30/09/2019

Placement location

Valence

Looking for volunteers from

Spain

Placement topics

Social challenges

Education and training

Placement deadline

No application deadline

Voluntariado en escuela primaria en Polonia

asociacion building bridges

grodek, Poland

Apply

Project description

Te traemos una vacante para participar en un voluntariado en escuela primaria en Polonia. La incorporación es inmediata y hasta final de curso. ¡Anímate a vivir una experiencia única! The School Complex consists of Primary School as well as Grammar School. The Complex is equipped with a gym, a new playground, a computer lab, a library and a reading room at the school. Three classrooms are equipped with the interactive whiteboards, the Art classroom and the Biology classroom have projectors with PC computers. The pupils learn English (in a newly-equipped language laboratory), Russian as obligatory languages and Belorussian as facultative language. The school has long – established traditions, the most significant being: The School Day, the festive traditions with the character of the regional traditions (also related with the Belarusian Minority), family meetings and family feasts. The main aim of the school is also to over education for everyone and for free.

Volunteer profile

The volunteer should take great pleasure in working with kids and youth (from 6 to 16 years), be creative and have initiative. It is important that the volunteer has his/her own ideas for activities and motivation to realise them independently. He/ she should be open to live in the rural and economically poor region without lot of comfort. The volunteer should have a high motivation for learning polish language, because not so many people in Gródek are speaking english.

Placement dates

A total of 30 week(s) during the period 30/11/2018 to 30/06/2019

Placement location

grodek

Looking for volunteers from

Spain

Placement topics

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Periodista/Comunicación para hacer voluntariado europeo en Portugal

asociacion building bridges

viana do castelo, Portugal

Apply

Project description

No te pierdas la oportunidad de Hacer voluntariado europeo en Portugal en el contexto de las asociaciones de jóvenes por 1 año. Although the main activities are: – support of the educational/recreational activities plan, whith a non-formal educational methodology; – support internal and external communication plan, production of promotional materials and activities, multimedia work (photos and video); – support a community garden; There will be 1 volunteer in charge of the following activities: The volunteer will develop, according to his/her competences/skills and knowledge, activities that fall within the existing departments of the hosting organization. Thus the volunteer will be involved in supporting the Community School of the association, providing support to the monitors, and developing, under their guidance, the daily activities with children and young people (study time, arts, body language, science, computer, free time, etc.).

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Autonomy, creativity, responsibility, organisation skills, determination, empathy, dynamism, initiative, joy in interpersonal relationships and in teamwork, flexibility to perform different tasks and interest and motivation to work with children and young people.

Volunteer profile

He/She must demonstrate his/her will to learn a new language, to be open to experience a new culture and to contribute to support the people in a rural area. Moreover, the volunteer should feel the need to prove his/her personal strengths, weaknesses and limits, to discover a new environment and a strong desire to make new friends. Showing interest in foreign cultures and having this experience at this stage in his/her life will help him/her to make decisions for the future, both in terms of employment and education/training. He/She must have interest and backward knowledge

Project 296: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/9822_en


Work with children in the North of Italy

VKE

Bolzano-Bozen, Italy

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

VKE is an association of volunteers, founded in Bolzano in 1974 by a group of parents, who wanted to dedicate themselves to emphasizing children's and young people's right to play and creating playing areas for them, but also to the improvement of children's life quality, as well as that of the youth and their families in general. The main activities of VKE are: 1. "Spielbus/Ludobus" a small bus with several games to visit the different comunities of the Province of Bolzano offering children the opportunity to play and learn together. 2. "SpielHaus/CasaGioco" is a small house for the promotion of the free time where children can find different games. 3. "Estate Ragazzi VKE" are summer camps for children aged between 3 and 14 years. (https://europa.eu/youth/volunteering/organisation/947465640_cs)

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

You will get free accommodation for the whole duration of your voluntary service. You will live in a single room with shared bathroom, laundry facilities and a fully equipped kitchen with cooking facilities. You will share the apartment with other volunteers. You will get a food allowance to cover your food expenditures. The transport to and from Italy will be covered according to the EVS plan.

Training during the project

Pre-departure training in Germany, on-site training in Italy, online language course, 24-7 emergency number.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for a motivated GERMAN volunteer between 18 and 30 years who is interested in working with children. The volunteers' tasks may include: participation in the organization and implementation of games in the frame of the "Spielbus/Ludobus" and of the game centers (“Spielhaus/Centri Giochi”), support in the organization and development of summer centers, organization and realization of workshops about their own country or about Europe, organization of inter-cultural activities together with the other volunteers, raising awareness about the youths' right to play.

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 01/04/2019 to 31/03/2020

Placement location

Bolzano-Bozen

Looking for volunteers from

Germany

Placement topics

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 31/03/2019

Project description

CNTM promotes youth interests in Moldova, contributing to the development of associative youth structures through training programs and educational activities, information campaigns, lobbying, and consulting work. Volunteer tasks: • Support in realizing activities in the Youth Centre "TohaTEEN HUB" • Support in project writing • Organizing activities for the local volunteers • Participating in the recruitment process of the local volunteers • Support in organizing the YOUTH Festival • Participating in the Youth Clubs • Updating the youth portal with new opportunities: www.youth.md Find more on: http://www.cntm.md/en

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteer(s) will live in a host family or volunteer's flat with shared kitchen, toilet and bathroom. Also volunteer(s) will have access to the land line phone in their accommodation. Internet can be accessed in the internet cafes and wi-fi spots in the city, also some volunteer flats have internet access at individual basis. As well volunteer will be able to use internet in his Host Organization. Depending on the district of the city where volunteer will live he/she can reach the center by foot or by public transportation

Training during the project

OAT and mid term evaluation made by SALTO EECA and other trainings done by the Host and coordinating organization

Volunteer profile

Community building in Gemer region

Občiankse združenie Fundament

Rimavská Sobota, Slovakia

Apply

Project description

As most of the project activities take place in the region of Rimavská Sobota, where a significant part of the local community in addition to the majority of the nation are also members of the Hungarian and Roma community, by implementing activities we contribute to the priority of preserving cultural diversity. The city is in South Slovakia, 30km away from Hungarian border. The region struggling many years with the highest rate of unemployment in the country (over 30%), and faces with serious economic and social challenges. These bad social and economic conditions cause strong migration of young people to the Western Europe. Our organisation decided to give local young people positive examples and opportunity to meet other young people from Europe. These circumstances made a need for positive examples, sharing best practice and innovative methods in regional development. The information has the biggest value for socially excluded people, that's why we decided to start a regional news

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Rimavska Sobota, house

Training during the project

2 trainings

Volunteer profile

from France

Placement dates

A total of 57 week(s) during the period 01/04/2018 to 01/05/2019

Placement location

Daxnerova 33, 97901 Rimavská Sobota

Looking for volunteers from

France

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Placement deadline

No application deadline

YUOTHQUAKE: SVE di 4 mesi in Turchia per volontari italiani

ARCS - Arci Culture Solidali (Coordinating Organisation)

Gaziantep, Turkey

Apply

Project description

Youthquake è un progetto nato a seguito del terremoto che ha colpito le regioni del Centro Italia nel 2016 e coordinato dall'ONG ARCS Culture Solidali. L'obiettivo è quello di aiutare le comunità locali a risollevarsi dai danni del terremoto sia tramite l'arrivo di volontari in Lazio, Umbria e Marche, sia dando la possibilità ai giovani del territorio di fare un'esperienza di volontariato all'estero. Stiamo cercando volontari provenienti dalle regioni colpite dal sisma per uno SVE in Turchia! Se hai tra i 18 e i 30 anni e desideri fare questa esperienza di 4 mesi stiamo cercando te! L'organizzazione ospitante è GEGED, nostra partner turca, e le principali attività consistono in: educazione dei bambini, volontariato con giovani svantaggiati, accoglienza dei rifugiati, sviluppo.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

-Vitto e alloggio sono gratuiti! -Per il viaggio A/R riceverai fino a un massimo di 290 € di rimborso -Avrai un pocket money di circa 120 € al mese.

Volunteer profile

Stiamo cercando volontari italiani provenienti dalle regioni colpite dal terremoto nel 2016: Marche, Lazio, Umbria e Abruzzo. Cerchiamo volontari interessati a svolgere le attività proposte e motivati!

Placement location

Gaziantep

Cultural Manager at Institute for German Language and Culture

Institut für deutsche Sprache und Kultur e.V.

Lutherstadt Wittenberg, Germany

Apply

Project description

In our project we host one international volunteer who will be working together with another German volunteer. The main tasks are to be a contact person for our international course participants, to help them with questions regarding life in Germany, what to do during free times, how to meet other young people from Wittenberg and where to travel on weekends. During language course times the volunteers are working together to provide a variety of free time activities such as art workshops, sports events, arrange movie nights or barbecues, meetings to learn more about the student's countries and cultures etc. In the afternoon or on weekends volunteers accompany the student groups on their day trips to other cities, such as Berlin, Leipzig, Dresden, Halle and so on. During times when no courses are offered, the volunteers are supporting our team in the office and prepare their own projects for the next course.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

You live in a studio appartment with a walking distance of 5 Minutes to our Office.

Volunteer profile

You have fun working in an international environment. You would like to meet a lot of students from many different countries. You are creative. You like organizing free time activities and little projects. You want to get to know other German cities? You speak English and German.

Placement dates

A total of 41 week(s) during the period 13/01/2020 to 30/10/2020

Placement location

Collegienstraße 62, 06886 Lutherstadt Wittenberg

Looking for volunteers from

Denmark, France, Finland, Spain, Czech Republic, Greece, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Lithuania, Norway, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Sweden, Austria, Belgium

Project 301: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/9708_en


New Technologies and School Support in Chios Island

Experimental

VRONTADOS, Greece

Apply

Project description

a) (70%) Educational, Cultural & Sport cooperation on New Technologies: a1) Assisting at a Day Nursery, a Kindergarten, a Primary School or similar Institutions. a2) Organizing summer activities for children. a3) “Learning by using and Producing" Educational, Cultural, Sport & Tourist Projects. a4) Helping and learn how to sail on a sailing yacht. The (a1,a2,a3,a4,) activities depend on the capacity of the volunteer and the needs of the cooperating organizations. b) (20%) Realization of Non-profit making New Technologies, Educational, Sports and Cultural programs and Presentations. Creation of new ideas and realization of activities, texts translation participation in social activities. c) (05%) Our EVS Internet Radio. Development and realization of recordings, sound mixing, interviews, news to the Hosting organization’s EVS Internet Radio and web site www.chiosradio.gr. e) (05%) Our Place. Keeping the hosting and working place clean and in order (house, garden, yacht etc).

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The hosting organization is offering adequate accommodation for the volunteer, equipped with the necessary appliances and furniture to cover the basic needs of the volunteers. The Young volunteers live in shared rooms. Every two weeks the responsible of the H/O checks that everything is clean and in order at the hosting and the working place. Food: The young volunteers are responsible for making a cooking scheduler at home. They provide H/O a weekly list of the (regular) goods that they need each week for cooking at home and the H/O is supplying them.

Training during the project

Volunteers will be given, (by using the cooperative learning method), any training necessary to carry out their tasks. (Computer programs, sailing lessons etc). The mentors will meet regularly with the volunteers to check on their progress and help solve any problems. They will also ensure ongoing support for the volunteer in every possible way. Attempts will be made to help the volunteers integrate into the local community. At the end of each project, the volunteers will have more technical (computer programs) and educational skills that will make them have a very good Youth pass certificate.

Volunteer profile

We are not interested on high qualifications, millions of certificates, presidents, queens or kings. We are usually selecting positive and creative young people ready to "offer" and learning in cooperation and offer their time on the realization of New Technologies, Educational, Cultural and Sport projects. The suitable volunteer is a person who don’t need 5 stars accommodation, privacy and comforts, but a person who has as priority on learning, cooperating and living with European young people and looks the glass "half full" instead of "half empty".

Placement dates

A total of 43 week(s) during the period 01/06/2019 to 31/05/2020

Placement location

60 ANDRONIKOU STREET, 82200 VRONTADOS

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Germany, Poland

Placement topics

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Physical education and sport

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 30/04/2019

Project 302: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/9707_en


Action-Information

EDUQ Association

Lębork, Poland

Apply

Project description

The project involves sending and hosting 10 volunteers for short and long-term volunteering projects. abroad. The following activities are planned in the project: - hosting long-term volunteers from Spain and Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia by the EDUQ Association - coordination of 4 long-term volunteers hosted by accredited organizations from the Słupsk sub-region - sending 4 volunteers with fewer opportunities for short-term volunteering abroad The aim of the project is to increase the participation of young people (with an emphasis on people with fewer opportunities) in volunteering abroad, development of volunteers' competences, increasing the number and competence of accredited organizations and increasing the quality of EDUQ's work in volunteer management. As part of complementary activities, the Forum of accredited volunteer organizations will be established in the Słupsk subregion.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will be accommodated in a rented flat. A kitchen and a bathroom will be shared with all EVS volunteers living in the flat. Volunteers will have dinner provided by our organisation and money for other food.. All volunteers will have a monthly ticket for public means of transport.

Training during the project

All volunteers will participate in the On-arrival training and Mid-Term Evaluation. During the project volunteer will take part in special trainings connected with his/hers tasks in the organization as well as with his/hers interest. Training will develop his/hers skills and qualifications. This will have very big influence on his/her work and his/hers conscious participation in this project - e.g. workshops devoted to developing manual of interpersonal skills.

Volunteer profile

Our project is open for young people who wants to be volunteers and who is not under 18 years old.We expect the volunteers to be open-minded, communicative, patient and highly motivated to work in our institution. They should also be independent and prepared to work on various tasks.We value one's own initiative and creativity. It is recommended to all candidates that previous experience in teaching mother language may be useful but any qualifications are not vital. It is welcome if the volunteer has basic English language skills and is willing to study Polish.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/11/2018 to 31/12/2019

Placement location

Krzywoustego 1, 84-300 Lębork

Looking for volunteers from

Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Austria, Germany, Spain, Italy, Finland, Portugal, Turkey, Ireland

Placement topics

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

Project 303: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/9703_en


Steinbeis Strategic EVS

Marienhaus St. Johann e. V.

Freiburg, Germany

Apply

Project description

Marienhaus St. Johann e. V. This registered association helps very old people when extra care and support is necessary. At the same time, the association supports families who are responsible for their elderly family members. The organisation offers care and support in three old-age care homes: St. Marienhaus, Wohnheim St. Johann (St. Johann Residence) and Stahlbad St. Antonius. There is also a day-care centre in Freiburg Wiehre. St. Marienhaus 198 people live in the St. Marienhaus residence. It is located in the Freiburg city district called Wiehre. There are 14 residence groups. Each group has 9 – 25 residents. There are 192 single rooms and 3 double rooms. The residents live in the group which best meets their individual needs.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers get a single room at the institution or in a separate home near the institution. Volunteers get their meals for free at the old age home. They can also get food ingredients to cook their own meals or money to buy food. To travel around the region, European Volunteers get a monthly ticket. This ticket is for all forms of public transportation (ÖPNV) in the area of Breisgau-Hochschwarzwald. Volunteers can also use the ticket for public transportation in neighbouring areas of Freiburg on workdays after 2pm, weekends and during school holidays.

Training during the project

At the beginning, volunteers get important training and support so they can complete their duties. There is standard training for all workers. This will help to avoid problems from the start of the program. There is continuous professional support for the volunteers. One example of support is regular reflection talks. A neutral person from outside of the core group will lead these talks. Volunteers can also visit on-site or off-site training courses to get more qualifications.

Volunteer profile

This project is only for young people with less opportunities in terms of education (= without university entrance qualification) Volunteers should be interested in social work in the area of old-age care. They should also be open to working with old people who need care. Basic knowledge of the German language is helpful for the daily contact with: the residents, day-guests of the institution, family members and co-workers.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/11/2018 to 31/12/2019

Placement location

Talstraße 31, 79102 Freiburg

Looking for volunteers from

Italy

Placement topics

Social challenges

Education and training

Employment and entrepreneurship

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project description

Volunteer for Care center in Litene (1 person): In the Care center for volunteer will be chance to take part in various activities, later on propose and organize activities for people with special needs. We search volunteers fro Ukraine, France and Spain.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Participants will live in a apartment. Participants will receive monthly pocket and meals money.

Training during the project

On arrival training and midterm training.

Volunteer profile

No specific skills are required, more volunteer interest and motivation to work is important. Choosing candidates, care center will look for volunteer's interest in gaining new experience, learning how to do and being open for communication, cooperation. Volunteer will not do routine work and will not replace the staff of the institution. Volunteer will complement everyday life with participation and work,offering ourselves activities and engaging in the care center's life.

Building communities through volunteering

Greentin Center for Sustainable Development

Baia Mare, Romania

Apply

Project description

BCV - Building communities through volunteering aims to promote volunteering and non-formal education with the help of 6 international volunteers in several villages from Maramures county, Northern Romania. The volunteering stage will give the volunteers the opportunity to gain new skills and confidence in organizing educational activities and using English as communication language. By living in a multicultural environment they will have the chance to discover not only the Romanian culture, but also the cultures of their international colleagues involved in the volunteering activities.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will live in Baia Mare, they will receive a food allowance and a volunteering allowance. The local transportation for the activities will be organized by the association.

Training during the project

The volunteers will participate at the On Arrival Training and Mid-Term organized by Romanian National Agency.

Volunteer profile

Young volunteer age 18-30 years old interested in organizing educational activities in villages from Northern Romania.

Placement dates

Project 307: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/9681_en


RED BRACELET 2

ANDCTR

Craiova, Romania

Apply

Project description

Il progetto accoglierà 2 volontari italiani allo stesso tempo insieme ad altri volontari provenienti da tutto il mondo. I volontari coopereranno tra di loro, con l’organizzazione ospitante e con istituzioni locali per promuovere la cittadinanza attiva ed uno stile di vita sano attraverso attività di comunicazione e promozione, campagne sociali ed eventi locali rivolti a tutta la comunità locale. Nello specifico il progetto mira a sensibilizzare la comunità locale sull’importanza della donazione del sangue. Durante i 3 mesi di progetto i volontari potranno essere coinvolti in: - Organizzazione di campagne per promuovere la donazione del sangue; - Supporto nelle attività svolte dal Centro per la Donazione del Sangue del Distretto Dolj; - Attività di comunicazione e disseminazione (realizzazione di articoli, documentari foto-video, ecc.); - Ideazione e realizzazione di eventi pubblici per promuove lo spirito di volontariato.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Alloggio: I volontari saranno ospitati in un appartamento che condivideranno con altri volontari: camera condivisa (2 persone /camera); la cucina ed il bagno condivisi con altri volontari. La cucina sarà attrezzata con: frigorifero, forno, mobili da cucina, posate, piatti. Il bagno sarà dotato di lavatrice. Ogni camera avrà 2 letti e mobili per vestiti e oggetti personali. Il viaggio andata e ritorno verrà rimborsato fino all'ammontare massimo di 275 euro. Il volontario riceverà un abbonamento mensile per i trasporti locali. Ogni volontario riceverà aprox. 120 euro al mese per il vitto.

Training during the project

I volontari beneficeranno di supporto e sessioni formative, organizzate dall'associazione di accoglienza ANDCTR, di: lingua rumena, video editing. I volontari parteciperanno ad un evento di formazione all'arrivo organizzato dall'Agenzia Nazionale per i Giovani Rumena.

Volunteer profile

Giovani tra i 18 ed i 30 anni, residenti in Italia. I requisiti più importanti sono l’interesse per la tematica del progetto e la motivazione a mettersi in gioco in un’esperienza di apprendimento in un contesto interculturale. Al volontario non è richiesta alcuna competenza specifica nel campo, né la conoscenza della lingua del paese di accoglienza.

Placement dates

A total of 13 week(s) during the period 15/04/2019 to 15/07/2019

EVS in Kohtla-Järve Ahtme Gymnasium

Kohtla-Järve Ahtme Gümnaasium

Kohtla-Järve, Estonia

Apply

Project description

Volunteer will be working in Kohtla-Järve Ahtme Gymnasium, which is a general secondary school with 620 pupils in the age of 7-18 years old. He/she will be engaged in language club, cultural evenings, EVS promotion (meetings with pupils and bloging), school radio Kurumbus, enterprising teaching (participation in different projects), school decoration, events organization help, assistance in bicycle driving training, basic school pupils tutoring ( main teacher assistant). A volunteer can visit free of charge after-class lessons and learn different activities like ceramic, disain, media, droning, robotics, 3D printing, make-up etc. depends on volunteer interests. During the school projects, a volunteer can visit different museums and scientific centers together with school pupils and participate in thematic museum lessons.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteer will be accommodated in rented and appropriately furnished flat together with other international volunteers. He/she will have a private or shared bedroom and a shared kitchen, a bathroom and a toilet. Food allowance will be given to the volunteer monthly.

Training during the project

- On-arrival training course and mid-term evaluation meeting organized by Estonian National Agency; - "Check-in" training course upon arrival and EVS common days once in a month organized by coordinating organisation VitaTiim NGO for all volunteers doing their services in Narva, Sillamäe and Kohtla-Järve; - Russian language course.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for volunteer who is keen: - on teaching their mother tongue and promoting, introducing their culture, customs and country to our students - open-minded person who has passion for foreign languages - who has a certain skill or hobbies (e.g. ability to dance, master photography, journalism experience, create art or produce video materials, ability to play instruments, create a blog and more similar skills) to teach to our students - share our values on promoting equality, cooperation, multiculturalism, integration - like to plan and organize events or help with it

Placement dates

A total of 43 week(s) during the period 01/09/2018 to 30/06/2019

Placement location

Kohtla-Järve

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

AWO Kreisverband Konstanz e.V.

Singen/Hohentwiel, Germany

Apply

Project description

The Familiy House Taka-Tuka-Land belongs to the AWO Kreisverband Konstanz e.V. It is a kindergarten for children at the age of 0 to 6 years old. It is taken care of the children in special familiy groups. Children of different age are together in one group, so that they learn from each other. Children learn values like having respect before each other and be tolenrant to different lifestyles and backgrounds. Singen is a modern, developped town with a lot of shopping possibilities but also many citicens have got a migration background, so for many children is German not their mother tongue.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will have a room in a shared flat with W-lan and all necessary other arrangements (washing-mashine, bycicle and further more) Pocket money and food money will be paid Travel costs to Germany and back at the beginning and at the end of the stay will be paid.

Training during the project

There will be an On-Arrival training and a Midterm-Training. Language Course all over the year in German

Volunteer profile

The volunteer should be able to work in a team The volunteer should speak German in basics or better/if not be willing to learn German asap The volunteer should love Children and like to work play with them The volunteer should develop own projects for the Children and bring in ideas The volunteer should also be willing to fulfil routinte tasks like e.g. having meals together with the children Volunteers from everywhere wanted, but especially from Poland! The volunteer should be willing to learn about Paedagogigs

Berufskolleg Ibbenbüren

Ibbenbüren, Germany

Apply

Project description

Our vocational school is located in Ibbenbüren. Ibbenbüren has about 52,000 inhabitants, lies in the north of North Rhine-Westphalia and is located between Osnabrück and the Dutch border. Münster is located about 40 km from here. The area is mainly rural in nature. In the south of Ibbenbüren begin the wooded hills of the Teutoburger Forest. At our College we have 2400 students taught by 115 teachers. We offer: - Apprenticeships like electrical technicians, kindergarten teachers, hairdressers, motor mechanics, painters and decorators, mechanical technicians, joiners, plumbers and utilities, technicians - High School Diploma like Community Sports Leader, State-approved Educator and State-approved, IT Assistants - Full-time Technical School like Welfare and Health Care for Nursing Assistants, Welfare and Health Care for Social Workers, Mechanical Engineering - Higher Technical College like Design, Welfare and Health Care - Preparatory School like Mechanical Technicians

Volunteer profile

We don't expect any special skills. Would be good if you speak english or German. Most important fact: This project is already approved for our sending partner in Hungary. So you have to be a volunteer from Hungary. Interested? Please contact us and as well Mrs. Iris Garibovic (garibovic.iris@maltai.hu)

Jugendtreff Bansen - Youthcenter Bansen

Lotte (project); Westerkappeln (place of residence), Germany

Apply

Project description

The Jugendtreff Bansen is a municipal facility and is located in the district of Alt-Lotte in a beautiful half-timbered house with good spatial and physical facilities. The house is 25 years old, is attended by children and young people aged 6 to 20 years and is recognized in the community. “About our facility” priorities and user groups:- Open meeting place for children and young people - Services for Children "Kina" - Cooking with fun - Special events and action days: trips to swimming pool to Aaseebad, to ice rinks, musical trips, visits to the zoo, etc. - Holiday Specials - Babysitting courses for girls - Parties (carnival and Halloween) - Lotter Children's Theatre Project in the house Hehwerth

Volunteer profile

We don't expect any special skills. Would be good if you speak english or German. Of course you are working with kids and youngsters in a youth center you should like to work with them. So would be nice if you are a creative and /or sportive person. Please notice that this project is located in a rural area - you should be prepared to use buses or a bicycle. Most importans fact: This project is already approved for our sending partner in Italy, Bozen. So you have to be a volunteer from Italy. Interested? Please contact us and as well Mrs. de Pascuale (franca.depascuale@provinz.bz.it)

RURAL YOUTH- 5 volunteering positions in Northern-Finland 2019-2020

Rieska Leader ry

Ylivieska, Finland

Apply

Project description

We are looking for 5 volunteers: 2 for a small village, Eskola to take care of the free time activities of the children (1-12 y) of the village and help at events throughout the year. 1.9.2019 to 31.8.2020 (12 months) We are looking for 1 volunteer to the Rural Institute of Kannus to be the free time animator of the youngsters (16-24 y) living in the dormitory and help at the events. 1.9.2019-30.6.2020 (10 months) We are looking for a volunteer as well for the Christian College of Kalajoki, where the volunteer will work with refugees and their families, organizing free-time activities for them. 1.9.2019-30.6.2020. And we are looking for a volunteer for the Town of Kalajoki to help at youth and sport clubs and cultural events 1.9.2019-30.6.2020. We are looking for volunteers mostly from Spain, Hungary, Ukraine, Latvia, Lithuania and other Eastern European countries with a possible Russian language skills, but we are interested in other countries as well.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

In Eskola the volunteers are living in their own flat in separate rooms. They have lunch during the week in the restaurant of the village. The volunteers will receive monthly pocket money and additional support for meals. The volunteers will have bikes for local traveling. In Kannus and Kalajoki the volunteers will live in the dormitory of the school in an own room. The volunteer will get breakfast, lunch and dinner during the week in the school canteen and will receive monthly pocket money and additional support for meals. The volunteer will have a bike for local traveling.

Training during the project

The volunteers will participate in the arrival training and the mid-term meeting organized by the Finnish National Agency.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for volunteers who are: -over 18 -like to work with children and youngsters and/or have some experience with them -has at least basic English language skills -possibly have Russian language skills (Kalajoki) -are motivated and interested in learning innovative things -are familiar with rural areas -understand and are prepared for what it means to spend their time in a small place, in the middle of the Finnish countryside with lack of public entertainment

Placement dates

A total of 54 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

Vierimaantie 5, 84100 Ylivieska

Looking for volunteers from

Spain, Hungary, Latvia, Lithuania, Estonia, France, Croatia, Italy, Portugal, Slovakia, Romania

Placement topics

Reception and integration of refugees and migrants

Education and training

Physical education and sport

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 08/04/2019

Project 314: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/9575_en


"European Diversity in Human Unity", 2nd service

American International School of Transylvania

Baia Mare, Romania

Apply

Project description

"EDIHU" is a youth mobility, as a long term EVS activity, 274 days of service, NOV. 2018 - August 2019, for volunteers +18 & under 30 years old. It involves a wide European partnership between AIST as CO/HO & 10 other partner SOs from 7 EU member countries: Great Britain, Denmark, Germany, Spain, Italy, France, Latvia. Objectives: 1. Providing learning opportunities as well as practical life experience for 4 EVS volunteers, within their 9 months of service, but also for 30 young volunteers, through educational activities with 1200 children and 500 youth, from 2 urban and 8 rural communities. 2. Promoting healthy life styles for 800 children and youth, within at least 10 rural and urban communities, from Baia Mare City and Maramureş County, throughout the service by practice of grassroots sports and daily outdoor activities. 3. Promoting proactive involvement of disadvantaged youths, mainly from rural areas, in a more inclusive growth by volunteering & nonformal education

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Travel: project coordinator informs counterparts in SOs/EVSers on travel routes & prices to match set budget. AIST reimburses eligible costs to SO/EVSer using transport documents, invoices & boarding passes/tickets needed to justify travel. AIST will provide volunteers with bikes for local transport & bus tickets for activities in rural areas outside Baia Mare city. Accommodation: EVSers will be hosted in safe & central lodging within Baia Mare, all facilities & utilities included. 120 euro/month - food allowance 60 euro/month - volunteer's allowance Romanian courses & mentroing included.

Training during the project

Learning environment & outcomes: EVSers will gain diverse social & educational skills & competences, that will be useful for their upcoming educational/training & employment opportunities. They will be involved in designing & implementing activities of social inclusion through nonformal educational methods practiced daily. EVSers will learn to plan, implement & adjust educational activities for children & youth, typical & underprivileged, from urban & rural environments as well. They'll also learn to be more flexible & adapt to changes as unexpected situations come up despite all planning.

Volunteer profile

Volunteers, over 18 years old, need to be interested in learning & personal development, enjoy working with kids & youth, be open & tolerant to other cultures. Flexibility is required, as they'll work in a multicultural environment as part of an international team. Being responsible, positive, energetic, communicative & a basic level of English is desirable to ease communication during project activities & within the international project team of staff & volunteers.

Placement dates

A total of 21 week(s) during the period 01/04/2019 to 30/09/2019

Placement location

47 Victoriei Steet, RO-4800 Maramures Baia Mare

Looking for volunteers from

Germany, Denmark, Spain, France, Italy, Latvia, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Social challenges

Citizenship and democratic participation

Health and wellbeing

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 08/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 315: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/9562_en

American International School of Transylvania

Baia Mare, Romania

Apply

Project description

HH4EU project will take place in the city of Baia Mare & 14 other rural & urban communities from the Metropolitan Area, within AIST & local partner premises. The geographic scope of the project covers Romania plus 8 other countries: Danmark, France, Germany, Italy, Latvia, Spain, Portugal, United Kingdom, involving 12 other promoters acting as SOs. Our project has during Year I 3 youth mobility Activities, that follow our project objectives with Target group: kindergarten (4-6) primary (7-11) secondary, highschool & university students. Year I: 01.01.2019 - 30.06.2020, "DEMOCRATIC VALUES@work!", total participants 28, out of which 22 cross-border & 6 in-country volunteers: Act. 1: A1 Individual volunteering, 6 youth (Romanian) in-country, 12 months, June 1, 2019 - June 1, 2020.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Travel: project coordinator informs counterparts in SOs/EVSers on travel routes & prices to match set budget. AIST reimburses eligible costs to SO/EVSer using transport documents, invoices & boarding passes/tickets needed to justify travel. AIST will provide volunteers with bikes for local transport & bus tickets for activities in rural areas outside Baia Mare city. Accommodation: EVSers will be hosted in safe & central lodging within Baia Mare, all facilities & utilities included. 150 euro/month - food allowance 90 euro/month - volunteer's allowance, training courses & mentoring included.

Training during the project

Learning environment & outcomes: volunteers will gain diverse social & educational skills & competences, that will be useful for their upcoming educational/training & employment opportunities. They will be involved in designing & implementing activities of social inclusion through nonformal educational methods practiced daily. EVSers will learn to plan, implement & adjust educational activities for children & youth, typical & underprivileged, from urban & rural environments as well. They'll also learn to be more flexible & adapt to changes as unexpected situations come up despite all planning

Volunteer profile

APEL deschis pentru selecție tineri 18+ (la data începerii stagiului ESC), cetățeni români, preponderent cu oportunități reduse, pentru proiect de voluntariat aprobat "Democratic Values @ Work", stagiu de 12 luni: 1 iunie 2019 - 1 iunie 2020, în cadrul unei echipe internaționale, activități de promovare a valorilor democratice prin educație nonformală, în Baia Mare și alte 14 comunități din Maramureș. Toate costurile sunt acoperite! Pentru mai multe detalii: onoriu.dan@aistschool.ro

Call for project Youth for Youth

Youth peace group Danube

Vukovar, Croatia

Apply

Project description

Aim of this project is through organizing of educational and cultural activities within Youth club.Volunteer will have opportunity to assist in Youth club, organization and implementation of activities as movie nights, creative workshops with children and youth, sport activities, outdoor and outreach activities, educational courses in culture and art,informing young people. develop creativity , informing related to youth mobility (Eurodesk), promotion of volunteering, EU programmes, camps, trainings and activities for young people.Project will be implemented in the city of Vukovar and surrounding area. Project activities will last 7 months, and three volunteers will be involved in youth club.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will be hosted in a house, sharing room in center of Vukovar. There are 2 beds in every room, bathroom, kitchen and living room. Wifi available in the house. The volunteers will receive monthly allowance for food in amount of 160,00 euro in Croatian kuna (HRK) by the 5th of each month and be responsible for own cooking and preparation of meals.Each month, the volunteer will receive pocket money in amount set by Erasmus+ program guide to the standards of living in Croatia.Travel costs are fully covered and according to Erasmus+ .

Training during the project

According to Erasmus+ Program ( preparation training for EVS , on arrival and mid term training in Croatia, and final traning after project.

Volunteer profile

The program is opened to all volunteers between 18-30 years. Each potential or selected volunteer will complete a questionnaire prior to arrival where the volunteer will show his/her expectations from the project, activity, sending and hosting organization. It is questionnaire to see their understanding of tasks in order to prevent volunteers to give up due to the different expectations and understandings.

Placement dates

Placement location

Leadership & community building on a eco farm in Swedish nature

Hastekasen farm association

No city, Sweden

Apply

Project description

One month European volunteering (ESC) on a small scale community farm and adventure center in Sweden. Do not CLICK APPLY only send e-mail! Outside, dirty, practical work for practical people in beautiful nature. Special Topics: Leadership and entrepreneurship. Workshops in: community building, decision making and leadership. Main activities: - Workshops with challenging exercises, personal development. 33%. - Natural building with logs, wood, stones, clay, straw. With hand tools. 33%. - Survival nature skills / camping. - Permaculture gardening/ small scale farming (some animals). Soil and manure work. Recycling of resources. - Work in forest. - Possible to do handicraft. - Excursions. Mostly vegetarian food, absolutely no smoking (not even in your free time). Restricted use of shower, laundry, dryers, heating. Self sustainable and environmentally friendly life style, where we save resources, using less comfort. There is no city here - only trees, cliffs and sea.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Pocket money 125 euro, vegetarian food, accommodation, travel (up to a limit) is paid by EU-Erasmus+. Living and working on the country side rural area far from civilization. In a community with shared household. Simple living of low standard. Mostly vegetarian food, absolutely no smoking (not even in your free time). Restricted use of shower, laundry, dryers, heating. No Wifi. You will be part of a self sustainable and environmentally friendly life style, where we save resources, using less comfort. There is no city here - only trees, cliffs and sea.

Training during the project

- Workshops with challenging exercises, personal development. 33% - Natural building with logs, wood, stones, clay, straw. With hand tools. 33% - Survival nature skills / camping. - Permaculture gardening/ small scale farming (some animals). Soil and manure work. Recycling of resources.

Volunteer profile

Qualifications: (You need most of these): 1) Prior experience of practical handy-man work. 2) Be able to live simple with less comfort. 3) Initiative and work ethics (activities is obligatory) 4) Background of economic problems, or social problems, or school problems, emotional problems… or similar. These are also good: 5) Communicate in english… and able to express your personality. 6) Planning a future life on the country side. Mostly vegetarian food, absolutely no smoking (not even in your free time). Restricted use of shower, laundry, dryers, heating. No Wifi.

Placement dates

A total of 5 week(s) during the period 02/05/2019 to 05/06/2019

Placement location

Hästekasvägen 6, 45196 No city

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, France, Poland, Hungary, Spain

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Health and wellbeing

Employment and entrepreneurship

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 15/04/2019

Sign in / Join

3E EVS Eastern Express Vol.2

Active Bulgarian Society

Blagoevgrad, Bulgaria

Apply

Project description

"3E: EVS Eastern Express" part 2, foresees participation of 3 volunteers from Moldova, Georgia and Ukraine in 6-months project hosted by Active Bulgarian Society /ABS/ in Blagoevgrad, Bulgaria. The main "3EVS" idea is to give an opportunity to 3 young people with economic and educational obstacles from the partner countries to enter their path of social development, both personal and professional and in the same time to contribute to the reinforcement of cultural dialogue, youth policy and European awareness in the area of Blagoevgrad and Sofia. ​ The relationship of the Union with Ukraine, Republic of Moldova and Georgia is guided by the new Association Agreements, including Deep and Comprehensive Free Trade Areas - the Association agenda states that one of the priorities of EU is to ensure assessment of fundamental rights and "encourage a strategic approach to youth policy and improve exchanges and cooperation in the field of non-formal education for young people and youth.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

▪ Pocket and Food money: Volunteer will get pocket money every month: 90 euro (or the equivalent in Bulgarian currency) and food allowance:110 euro each month. Money will be transferred between 1 and 10 at the beginning of every month to the volunteers. ▪ Accommodation: Volunteer will be accommodated in a shared room with another volunteer (from the same sex) in their own flat, with new furniture, which is situated in a walking distance to our office and the city center. The flat has all necessary facilities for living.

Training during the project

Among activities offered to the volunteers are: support ABS communication channels including social media and communication with international partners, supporting organizations of international mobility activities such as trainings and youth exchanges, providing information about Erasmus+ and learning mobility to the local youth, organizing local social events / e.g. chat clubs/, language tandems and other interactive activities for young people, working with Eurodesk database and many others. Each volunteer will be encouraged to propose own personal project idea.

Volunteer profile

18-30 years old young person who is interested in a volunteering projects. There will be given priority to unemployed, finished or excluded of the formal education system, or with economical difficulties youth. The most important criteria in the selection process will be the motivation of the participants. The communication level of English language skills and basic computer skills will be a plus.

Placement dates

A total of 8 week(s) during the period 03/06/2019 to 02/08/2019

Placement location

Todor Aleksandrov 47, 2700 Blagoevgrad

Looking for volunteers from

United Kingdom, France, Italy

Placement topics

Social challenges

Citizenship and democratic participation

Environment and natural protection

Health and wellbeing

Education and training

Employment and entrepreneurship

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 320: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/9512_en
