Waidmannsfeld, Austria

Apply

Project description

In our Montessori-school we care for children of 1 to 15 years. We have children from several countries. To optimize development from different experiences wy try to work with different teachers to show different role models.We are looking fo a volonteer who likes children and who likes to tell and teach about her / his own cultural background. Recently we are not able to invite any volonteer.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Within the schoolhouse there is an extra room with access to kitchen, bath and toilet. The school offers breakfast and lunch from Monday. to Friday. Nearby is a trainstation, trains operate every day from 5 am to 11 pm hourly.

Training during the project

Language cours if necessary, Supervision together with the projectteam

Volunteer profile

The volonteer should be open minded in terms of religion or political ideology, open to work with children of different colours, cultures and nationalites. The volonteer may have cultural differences or physical disabilities. She / he may have a legal status as refugee or similar.

Progetto SVE in Georgia: BUILDING BRIGDES THROUGH EVS

ICPI

TIBLISI, Georgia

Apply

Project description

Il progetto "Building Bridges through EVS" è un progetto di volontariato di un anno a lungo termine nell'ambito del programma Erasmus + per due volontari provenienti dall'Italia. Sarà implementato da settembre 2018 fino a settembre 2019. Principalmente il servizio si svolgerà nella capitale della Georgia - Tbilisi, dove viene implementata la maggior parte delle attività locali dell'ICPI. Ma durante i progetti internazionali nell'ambito di Erasmus +, i volontari saranno coinvolti nel processo di implementazione e potrebbero trasferirsi in diverse regioni della Georgia insieme allo staff dell'ICPI.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Il progetto si propone di aumentare la consapevolezza del valore e dell'importanza dell'impegno attivo e della cittadinanza attiva come uno dei migliori strumenti per progredire o migliorare le competenze (abilità, conoscenze e attitudine) per lo sviluppo personale, sociale e professionale. I progetti promuovono la comprensione reciproca e la tolleranza tra i giovani di diverse culture e danno l'opportunità di conoscere "l'ignoto" ed evitare o scontrare stereotipi.

Volunteer profile

https://www.portaledeigiovani.it/scheda/progetto-sve-georgia-cercasi-due-volontari-un-anno-building-brigdes-through-evs

Placement location

Looking for volunteers from

Italy

Placement topics

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

MOVE

Centro Social de Ermesinde

Ermesinde, Portugal

Apply

Project description

We will involve 4 volunteers in different tasks, such as: • Participate in the coordination and implementation of activities (eg training, seminars, workshops, cultural activities, debates on Erasmus + projects and other international initiatives); • Develop and implement their own activities, with monitoring and evaluation (eg, workshops, film sessions, sensitization, community support, cultural exchanges and group discussions); • Support other young people in the development of their own projects (eg youth entrepreneurship initiatives); • Collaborate with local organizations on ad hoc activities (more learning opportunities, more impact and greater involvement); • Collaborate with the CSE in the strategy of operation, communication, marketing and promotion (eg, presentation of the institution, preparation of projects for fundraising and multimedia editing).

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will be housed in small dwellings with a single room. The meal will be according to the dietary diets of the volunteers in the organization's restaurant (lunch and dinner). Monthly trips are ensured by public transport.

Training during the project

This is a one year volunteer.

Volunteer profile

- 1 volunteer to be involved in:: • Participate in the coordination and implementation of activities (eg training, seminars, workshops, cultural activities, Erasmus + projects and other international initiatives); • Develop and implement their own activities (eg, workshops, film sessions, community support, cultural exchanges); • Support other young people in the development of their own projects; • Collaborate with local organizations on activities; • Collaborate with the CSE in the strategy of operation, communication, marketing and promotion.

Volunteering in library

Petras Kriaučiūnas Public library

MArijampolė, Lithuania

Apply

Project description

Petras Kriaučiūnas Library takes active role in the implementation of states‘ youth social policies: co- operates with local youth work centre, non-governmental organizations, participates in projects that promotes youth employment, volunteering, creativity and active lifestyle. The library participated in national project „Believe in yourself”. Library‘s specialists taught young unemployed people computer and digital literacy classes, introduced daily activities that took place in the library, socialized and motivated them .

Training during the project

Main place of volunteers’ activities will take place in Draugystė library (project “Library for a family”). Proposed exemplary activities will be organizing events for families, like planning family reading club activities, working with interactive table tutorial and implementing family game tournaments, preparation of content for library website, promotion of library’s services. With new and exciting projects ahead volunteers will able to participate and to contribute to the events that will be held in central library.

Volunteer profile

wide range of possible tasks: to organize the book collection and book Exchange, to help organize and participate in the events, exhibitions, to be involved in the project activities, teach people information and computer literacy skills, and show electronic catalogue usability. Organize creative workshops, seminars, discussions, movie or music events, table game tournaments, educational activities, themed events for all age groups. Volunteers could help organize foreign language clubs, active participation initiatives and youth representation in the city events.

Volunteering with unaccompanied minors in Mimosa and Equality

Mimosa

Padova, Italy

Apply

Project description

Mimosa mainly deal with social integration activities related to welcoming disadvantaged minors, minors victim of human traffic, unaccompanied minors and actions in the field of prostitution. Equality pursues the general interest of the community for human promotion and the social integration of people living in conditions of social exclusion and marginalization with special attention to victims of human trafficking, Italian and foreign minors and young adults in specific conditions of vulnerability. They run a residential care house for non accompanied minors, minors victims of trafficking for sexual exploitation, minors who committed juvenile penalties and are remanded in custody, and vulnerable minors. The general objective is to support social, educational and work inclusion programs oriented to individual autonomy.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will live in a flat in Padova with other volunteers or Italian people, in a single or double room upon availability. He/she will monthly receive some money to buy food and the pocket money. He/She will have a bus card to move around in the city.

Volunteer profile

We would appreciate candidates who are already involved in the topic speak at least a basic Italian, but especially motivated to take part and available in the given dates. Please note that the activities will take place in a proper house working 24/7, several people support the activites and daily chores of the house: volunteers will work 7 hours a day/5 days per week in shifts, so please consider that you will be likely working many weekends (of course getting other 2 days of rest during the following week) and on holidays as well.

Placement dates

A total of 38 week(s) during the period 01/08/2019 to 30/04/2020

Placement location

Padova

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Malta, Liechtenstein

Placement topics

Reception and integration of refugees and migrants

No application deadline

Holding Hands With Other Abilities

Associação de Paralisia Cerebral de Coimbra

Coimbra, Portugal

Apply

Project description

APCC, the Cerebral Palsy Association of Coimbra, PORTUGAL, offers volunteer opportunities working with DISABLED CHILDREN AND ADULTS! WE ARE LOOKING FOR VOLUNTEERS. project will be 6 months beginning in APRIL 2019. Send your CV and motivation letter to voluntariado@apc-coimbra.pt More information at www.apc-coimbra.org.pt. PROJECT DESCRIPTION The EVS project activities will involve several of APCC's services, namely the Rehabilitation Center, three Residential Units, and Conraria Farm (Quinta da Conraria). Both the Rehabilitation Center and the Residential Units are located near the city center in a lively and rather green area, close to the University and various other higher education colleges. The Conraria Farm is located about 6 km away from Coimbra, is about 600,000 square feet, and hosts several occupational activities as well as vocational training. It also hosts a Biological Farm, an Adventure Farm, a Learning Farm and a Riding School.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers’ housing accommodations will be near the work placement, in a first floor apartment, close to APCC’s premises. The flat has 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, and a kitchen. The house has all necessities (bed linens, bath towels, clothes washing machine, TV) and will also have wireless internet access. When necessary, volunteers will use public transportation (most likely buses within the city) and the cost will be covered with weekly bus passes issued for all the volunteers. All food necessities will be provided by APCC.

Training during the project

All volunteers will participate in information sessions with APCC staff to supply them with the necessary theoretical tools for the development of the different activities. The On-Arrival training will be arranged by the National Agency and will take place shortly after arrival, along with the Mid-Term training, near the mid-point of the project. During the second month of volunteering, and in the months following, the volunteers will participate in some activities already developed by APCC and will also help with the implementation of new activities. They will have portuguese lessons.

Volunteer profile

Willing to work with disabled people and very enthusiastic about it!

Placement dates

A total of 26 week(s) during the period 12/04/2019 to 12/10/2019

Placement location

Rua Garcia Orta, 3030 Coimbra

Looking for volunteers from

France, Italy

Placement topics

Social challenges

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 04/04/2019

UN TERREMOTO DI SOLIDARIETA' (An earthquake of Solidarity)

Municipality of Pescara

Pescara, Italy

Apply

Project description

Volunteers will support the work of organizations operating in territories affected by the earthquake through activities addressed mainly to children and old people but in general to the population which was more affected by the post-earthquake effects. The other part of the project will take place in Pescara through activities of risk prevention addressed to the population of Abruzzo and reconstruction of the history of places through the collection of photos, stories, memoirs, and videos to rebuild the identity of these population. There are 5 associations involved, each one will host 2 volunteers. associazione Movimentazioni, (PIC 945461232) Caritas Pescara (924657933), Volontari senza frontiere (PIC 911678557), Val Pescara, (PIC 911667305), Psicologi per i popoli d’Abruzzo (PIC 911600957) We look for 10 young dynamic volunteers, ready to be part of small communities. We look for volunteers with technical and artistic skills for the realization of documentaries, blog photo.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will be accommodated in an apartment in the city centre of Pescara; they will share rooms by 2/3 people and share common spaces. Food and accommodation will be covered by the European Commission; volunteers will have health insurance and personal pocket money (120 € a month). Travel expenses will be refunded according to the distance band (180 € up until 499 km, 275 € up until 1999 km, 360 € up until 2999 km).

Volunteer profile

The ideal profile of the volunteer matches the following criteria: Available for the whole duration of the project (16 May – 18 November) 23 – 30 years old Strong motivation, adaptation and enthusiasm Experience with kids/youth/elderly and/or in events organization Basic level of English Knowledge of other languages as Spanish, Portuguese and French could be a preference Registered in European Solidarity Corps portal (if you haven’t registered yet, you can do it here https://europa.eu/youth/solidarity_en)

Placement dates

A total of 27 week(s) during the period 16/05/2019 to 18/11/2019

Placement location

Piazza Italia 1,, 65121 Pescara

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

EVS Ledovec

Ledovec, z.s.

Ledce, Czech Republic

Apply

Project description

NGO Ledovec provides social services for and supports self-help activities of people with psychiatric illness and/or mental handicap to help their better integration in community. As a coordinating and also hosting organization Ledovec seeks for two long-term volunteers, that would want to help to make the services better and more diverse. Volunteers join everyday work of therapists and clients and help to create the atmosphere of mutual understanding in the group of people where everybody is unique thanks his/her talents and also thanks has his/her own special needs or handicap. We have the idea, one of the volunteers should be available mostly at The Therapeutic Centre at Ledce and the other one at the Club-house project in Pilsen. But these are not the only workloads they can have - they are welcomed to participate at handcraft workrooms, short extra projects that occure, cultural events, The Circus Paciento Project or make up and work at their own project.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accomodation - a flat for the volunteers in the city of Pilsen will be rented. There is a possibility to change it, if the volunteer will ask for some reason. In city of Pilsen and surrounding is good working nettwork of public transport. Volunteers will have prepaid card for public transport available.

Training during the project

- language courses - courses in communication with people with mental illnes, specialized courses in social work (possible if czech language ability of volunteers will increase) - cirkus skills - learn how to juggle :)

Volunteer profile

We would like to welcome two foreign volunteers, that want to work with people with dissability caused by mental illness or mental handicap. The volunteer shall be a social person, at least to be able to work with people, being helpful, sensitive, empathic, capable to bear the responsibility for task entrusted and able to learn new things. In the view of the fact that the volunteer meets many vulnerable people with special needs we prefer volunteers with certain level of personal maturity and responsibility.

Placement location

Be involved, be active

Varstveno delovni center Tončke Hočevar

Ljubljana, Slovenia

Apply

Project description

Care and working centre Toncka Hocevar is a social welfare institution. We offer help and support to adults with mental disabilities and co-occurring disabilities. We organize day care and institutional care. Within programs of day car adults with special needs do different forms of occupations. It helps them to stay active, to develop new knowledge and skills, to be socially included. Daily around 237 adults are attending programs of day care in 5 different units in Ljubljana. Beside the occupation and living, we organize numerous other activities that are offered to our users: we take trips, attend events and various institutions, celebrate birthdays and New Year’s together. We are also active in the field of sports, attending competitions under the organization of the Special Olympics. Tasks of volunteer: - Support daily activities: occupational workshops, different sport and therapeutic activities, cooking activities… - Develop new activities: music/dancing workshops

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

- Volunteer will live in single bedroom in student apartment in Ljubljana with other volunteer or students, near our centre. Kitchen, bathroom and laundry facility will be shared with other volunteers or students. - Volunteer while working gets meal and eats with other workers. - Volunteer gets monthly bus ticket for transport in Ljubljana.

Training during the project

- on arrival training - mid term training

Volunteer profile

We are looking for young people who are open-minded and communicative. Who are creative, self-motivated and proactive. It is desired to have handwork skills or other talents (dancing, cooking, music, sport). Volunteer should have ability to adjust working in unstable conditions. Volunteer should like to work with adults with special needs. In order to apply for this project please send an e-mail with your CV and motivation letter to petra.bizjak@vdc.si

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/06/2019 to 30/09/2020

Placement location

Vodnikova 56, 1000 Ljubljana

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Netherlands, Norway, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Poland

Education is a journey, not a race

Wild Carpathia

Sighisoara, Romania

Apply

Project description

The main idea of the project is to implement a pilot program in the local schools in order to decrease the level of school abandonment. Methods used will be mainly from the non-formal education field. The objectives that we are willing to achieve through this project are: 1.A higher participation in the local community life with the active and direct involvement of the EVS volunteers which will help volunteers to develop their attitudes, skills, to achieve a valuable and practical knowledge in a context of a job. 2.Introducing and developing a non-formal learning program, through European interculturality provided by the EVS volunteers based on tales, presentations, workshops, games, interactivity among at least 100 pupils from 4 school villages around Sighisoara, Mures department. 3.To increase the pupils’ knowledge about what it means to be a European citizen, why and what for the education is one of the most important European values.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will be accommodated in 2 apartments in the center of the city and really close to the association's headquarters and partner institutions where some activities will take place.

Volunteer profile

The selected 8 volunteers should be open minded persons aged between 18 - 30, whiling to push themselves to learn and evolve, courageous enough to get out from their comfort zone, decided and motivated to leave together with other people from different countries, respectful with themselves, their colleagues and the coordinating team, smiling, happy and enthusiastic for new experiences, responsible and serious when will be needed, dreamers about a positive future for themselves, enjoying activities with kids, youngsters or/and adults, capable to follow a specific working hour plan.

Placement dates

A total of 26 week(s) during the period 10/11/2018 to 10/05/2019

Placement location

Sighisoara

Looking for volunteers from

Czech Republic

Placement topics

Education and training

Placement deadline

Mens sana in corpore sano

Wild Carpathia

Sighisoara, Romania

Apply

Project description

We are looking for 5 volunteers from Greece, Estonia or Latvia to join our EVS project team from June 2019 for the next 8 months. Types of activities: 1) Practical workshops "What it means to be healthy" for kids and youngsters 2) Interactive sports activities for children and youth (English for all) ) 3) Local awareness campaigns on the importance of adopting a healthy lifestyle 4) Public events promoting volunteering and Erasmus + opportunities. The total number of volunteers for our project will be 8 (3 volunteers are already in Sighisoara with us since January and April). If you want to have a great experience and spend your 2019 together with us please send us an application.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will be accommodated in one apartment in the center of the city (2 pers./ room) and really close to the association's headquarters and partner institutions where some activities will take place and will benefit from a personal bed with bedding, pilot, pillow, furniture required for a bedroom (wardrobe, desk, chairs, bed lamp and carpet) The allowance for food will be 120 Euro/month + 90 Euro pocket money and transport will be reimbursed 275 Euro for both ways.

Training during the project

The selected volunteers will receive before leaving their home country all the necessary informational materials, after their arrival in Sighisoara they will have the Welcome Training provided by our association and after this they will have a second training offered by the Romanian National Agency. During the project volunteers will have weekly meetings with the project coordinator and will receive specific training for the specific tasks.

Volunteer profile

The selected volunteer should be open minded persons aged between 18 - 30, whiling to push themselves to learn and evolve, courageous enough to get out from their comfort zone, decided and motivated to leave together with other people from different countries, respectful with themselves, their colleagues and the coordinating team, smiling, happy and enthusiastic for new experiences, responsible and serious when will be needed, dreamers about a positive future for themselves, enjoying activities with kids, youngsters or/and adults.

Strategic EVS, "Future in Progress"

Arbetsmarknadsförvaltningen, Municipality of Helsingborg, Sweden

Helsingborg, Sweden

Apply

Project description

We are the municipality of Helsingborg, in the south of Sweden. We looking for volunteers that have interest in solutions for youth to gain a more employable profile, work in different projects concerning youth between the ages of 16-30. We try to match unemployed to the labor market and/or studies. With younger youth, we work to motivate them to continuing their studies and if applicable introduce them to the labor market. We also have large groups with language cafés. You are also free to come up with ideas that you want to do. During the summer, we have events in the city that it would be possible to partake. You will take part in daily activities during work hours, Monday - Friday between the hours 08:00 - 16:00. Your start the EVS will be focusing on the Swedish language since it will give you more confidence when working in an assignment with different constellations of youth and colleagues. You will not be the single volunteer you will share a flat with other volunteers.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Provided for: Accommodation, food, travel return trip from home destination, insurance, pocket money, language support, local bus card, trip to on arrival-, and midterm training in Stockholm. Not provided for: Cost for free time activities, transfer to and from main travel arrangement, visa,

Training during the project

Swedish language, on arrival training and midterm training with National agency, if it corresponds to given dates by the Swedish NA. If you have any kind of private interests such as basket, football or anything else it would be good, because that will give you a natural social connection to other Swedish people that attend in associations or organizations that deals with the same interest. To be noted the project does not pay for any of those engagement, but we encourage you to try to join. You will get all the help you need to talk to any association or alike, in order to get you enrolled.

Volunteer profile

You have to speak minimum good English, or such as, Swedish, Danish, German, Dutch, English, Norwegian will be appreciated. You must have a genuine interest in participate in our work, be curios, be on time, drug-free, honest, collaborative, have interest that we can try to match for your free time, self going, motivated and honest.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/01/2019 to 30/09/2020

Placement location

Järnvägsgatan 35, 251 89 Helsingborg

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Germany, Denmark, Ireland, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, United Kingdom, Luxembourg, Czech Republic, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Poland, Portugal

Employment and entrepreneurship

Dogs shelter in Moldova : fight for animal rights

Association for the protection of homeless animals: ALGA

Chisinau, Moldova (Republic of)

Apply

Project description

We are looking for a volunteer for a one-year-EVS project, starting as soon as possible, in Chisinau. The volunteer will take care of dogs and work together on the promotion of animal rights in Moldova: -writing articles on animals rights and ALGA activities for the web-page, for social networks, for local newspapers and Internet info portals -doing PR and meeting with media representatives and giving itws about ALGA work and the situation with animals rights in the home countries of EVS volunteers -helping in organizing events such as concerts with local artists, in order to raise awareness and to fundraise money for the association -organizing meetings with children in schools to inform them on how to respect animals rights -suggesting events to organize for the international Day of Animals Rights - to play and take out for walks the animals - to feed the animal,clean and take care of the cages -updating website about current residents of the two shelters and much more

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will stay either in a flat or with a host family (private room in both cases), internet connexion provided. For food and transport arrangements, the volunteer will receive a food allowance and local transport will be provided by the hosting organization. For more infos or to apply to this project, please send your motivation letter and your CV to Michaela Rohmann, evscoordinator@unaexchange.org

Training during the project

The volunteer will be introduced to the Youthpass before they leave The UK by sending organization, as well as attending a developed session on Youthpass competencies during their On Arrival Training and again in the Mid term evaluation : There will be a pre-departure meeting with the sending organization

Volunteer profile

-be able to work independently and in a team -willing to take initiative -sociable, patient, flexible -willing to learn local language -efficiency and ability to work effectively in stressful conditions and situations -good knowledge of English and working on PC is preferred -to love animals and to be very motivated to improve their living conditions in a country with no laws to protect animals -to be ready to do physical work in any weather conditions -It would be appreciated if the volunteer would have an experience in volunteering for an animal shelter in his/her own country

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/11/2018 to 30/11/2019

Placement location

COGILNICEANU, 46 F.10 Chisinau

Looking for volunteers from

United Kingdom

Placement topics

Placement deadline

SHIFT

Asociatia Comunitati Pentru Tineret

Craiova, Romania

Apply

Project description

The project aims to contribute towards the increasing media literacy of high school students in the spirit of promoting critial thinking and reasoning, tolerance and inclusion. It develops media competences that will allow them a critical reception of the media discourse, as well as a responsible presence in the public sphere, as "online content generators".

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

International travel, local transport, accommodation and utility fees, monthly communication costs, costs related to activities are covered directly by Association ACT. Monthly food allowance: 120 euro/month Pocket money: 90 euro/month

Training during the project

On-arrival training and Midterm Training will consist in meetings with trainers from Romania National Agency Upon arrival we will organize our most intensive preparation measure, a capacity building programme that addresses 5 main pillars: - Project Understanding and organizational integration - Youth work and non-formal methods training - Team building and team work development - Tools and project instruments understanding etc. Romanian lessons 2 times per/week

Volunteer profile

- Age range between 18 and 30 - Outgoing and communicative, can work with groups and has a good spirit of initiative - A medium level of English – this requirement will not be enforced very strictly, the ideas is for the level of English of the volunteer to be sufficient for day to day communication and to allow for the Romanian language lessons to be carried out - Has a solid motivation for his participation in the volunteering activity - Is interested in working with young people, organize and implement non-formal activities

Placement dates

A total of 27 week(s) during the period 01/08/2019 to 28/01/2020

Placement location

AI Cuza Nr. 48, 200530 Craiova

Project 334: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/9091_en


I am volunteer at Kamarád - Nenuda

Kamarád - Nenuda z. s.

Zlín, Czech Republic

Apply

Project description

The volunteer will be involved in the entire operation of the organization. She/ he well be given opportunities to work according to their best abilities and they will have the support of the staff while doing so. The volunteer will work in leisure time activities (workshops, courses, intercultural events), help children in the nursery school (helping the teacher, organise ativities for children of age 2 - 5) or work with adults. Volunteers work 7 hours per day (35 hours per week). The volunteer also organize language courses (in mother tongue or other language according to the interest of volunteer). Volunteers will also learn czech language. Occasionally volunteers organise or participate on activities or workshops during the weekend. Each volunteer will have a sufficient space to design and implement their own ideas. We also support volunteers in creating their own promotion materials for their workshops and activities.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer has his/ her owen room in a three-floor shared house close to the centre of Zlín. It is fully furnished (wifi included). Bathroom, washing machine and equipped kitchen is shared with other inhabitans. The volunteer has to self-manage his/ her room responsibly and cooperate with other users of the accomodation to keep it in order. The accomodation is around 10 minutes by bus from the organisation. The volunteer receives food money (150 CZK/day) and pocket money (by the rules of the programme) every month and the monthly tickets for the public transportation. Bike is available.

Training during the project

Volunteers will attend on-arrival and mid-term training. During the project they will also learn czech language and they will improve their language skills due to language lessons in mother tongue or other language they choose. During the work with children a volunteer adopts pedagogical methods, way of working with children. He/ She will improve their digital and technical skills. Volunteers will learn timemanagement, money, they will learn the Snoezelen method, Ebru, Encaustic, work with ADHD kids. During the stay there will be a coordinator and the mentor available for the volunteer.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for an active, motivated young person, who will be able to work in a team. A person who is interested in work with children, youth and adults and wants to impement new projects of his/her own. We would prefer a volunteer who can communicate in English, is responsible and creative. We are open to volunteers with limited opportunities but due to bad accessability to the first floor, we are not able to accept volunteers on a wheelchair. We also ask volunteers for their CV and motivation lette in English. Previous experiences with work with children are neccessary.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/09/2018 to 31/08/2019

Placement location

Gahurova 5265, 760 01 Zlín Zlín

Looking for volunteers from

Germany, Spain

Placement topics

Social challenges

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

14 plazas voluntariado Erasmus en guarderías de Varsovia, Polonia

asociacion building bridges

Varsovia, Poland

Apply

Project description

The Polish Foundation is searching for 14 European volunteers who would like to join our Erasmus+ project “(Dis)appearing (dis)abilities” in October 2018 until June/September 2019 (depending on the hosting organization) in Poland. Volunteering activities will take place in 7 Receiving Organizations: 3 special kindergartens, a regular kindergarten for children with special nutritional needs, a primary school with integrative classes, the Polish Robert Schuman Foundation and European Integration Club at the School Complex in Wojkowice. Apart of the last organization which is in Wojkowice in the Silesian region, all of the organizations are in Warsaw.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

We want to change the way of thinking about disabilities by focusing on abilities – actions that we can undertake to increase the participation of people with disabilities in our society. Main aim of the project is to promote common European values as identified in article 2, including solidarity, tolerance and respect for human dignity and rights by increasing knowledge about and understanding for people with disabilities who face the risk of exclusion & marginalization. Apart of European volunteering mobilities workshops for regular kindergarten children and kindergarten&primary school

Training during the project

 will participate in monthly meetings. Once a month all Schuman volunteers living Warsaw (and sometimes also those in Wojkowice) will have a meeting in the Foundation and occasionally outside the Foundation. These meetings organized to spend time all together with volunteers and coordinators, the coordinators always prepare activities for the volunteers: concerning evaluation of last month, preparing common activities or just integrating.

Volunteer profile

e are looking for volunteers aged between 18 and 30 years, legally residing in one of the Program or Partner Countries. We seek a balance of varied ages, genders and nationalities amongst our volunteers. As required by Erasmus+ Programme, all candidates from the European Union must be registered in European Solidarity Corps database. We are not looking for experienced volunteers but those that would learn a lot during the service in a given receiving organization. Apart from personal motivation of volunteers our requirement is volunteers’ strong will of learning Polish language

Placement dates

A total of 38 week(s) during the period 01/10/2018 to 30/06/2019

Placement location

Varsovia

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

G85466886

klaipedia, Lithuania

Apply

Project description

Si estás interesado en actividades culturales y te gustaría trabajar con jóvenes, esta oferta de voluntariado cultural en una biblioteca en Lituania puede ser para ti. ¡Sigue leyendo! This library in Klaipeda, founded in 1950, serves as a center of information research and the provider of educational and leisure activities. The Library is open to all visitors World Wide without any restrictions and age. Besides regular libraries functions it also offers exhibitions and other cultural events that are open for all visitors; organize various training activities, excursions round the library, volunteers activities, new book presentations, lectures, modern art exhibitions, cultural performances, after school programs, programs for reader development. Library also has open space for young people. Mission of the space is to provide meaningful activities and safe leisure opportunities for self-realization

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

-Media literacy: video making, Corel, Photoshop, online communication channels. -Organizational and coordination skills: trough help in event management (exhibitions, film evenings, book presentations, youth evenings, etc.) and implementing own project. The volunteers will reinforce their attitudes and widen their knowledge about issues of today that they will cover in their media materials.

https://www.yeseuropa.org/voluntariado-cultural-en-una-biblioteca-en-lituania/

Volunteers aged 18-30 years, open minded, eager to learn and motivated to work on the proposed project activities. The volunteers should be motivated to work on cultural activities, work with people, especially with youth in open youth space in a non-formal education context. Should like to develop and improve their skills and abilities, be open for experiments, have some hobbies or interests and like to share them when organizing activities, discussions and projects for the community. Wanted but not necessary: interested in photography, graphic design and preparation of workshops

The volunteer will be working within the Tourism Office team of the local community. The Tourism Office is deeply involved in the development and the promotion of the territory. The team is developing several types of activities : Land Reporters : make interviews and short report about touristic subjects Summer Games : create partnerships with shopkeepers – find prizes to be won – ensure promotion Foreign tourist ‘s survey : prepare questions – meet foreign tourists – analyse survey’s answer – report and provide suggestions / action plan

Meeting and reporting

Volunteer profile

-You have to be strongly motivated to work in a cultural environment within a team dealing with general public. -You should ideally be sensible to issues related to Art, Culture and Transmission -You have a good knowledge of the Windows environment, Office applications and multimedia tools. -You are sensitive to video or photo creation -You are able to interact with a lot of people to ensure the right follow-up and progress of our activities -You have excellent communication skills and a strong team spirit. -You are respectful, tolerant and responsible

Voluntariado en una guardería en Lituania

asociacion building bridges

Madrid, Spain

Apply

Project description

¿Te apasiona trabajar con niños? ¿Te gusta la naturaleza? No dejes escapar esta oportunidad de voluntariado en una guardería en Lituania donde los niños pasan todo el día al aire libre. To inspire young people to think critically about the problems of education system through getting specific knowledge about preschool teaching, outdoor education methods and working together in the field with NGOs. To organize the education process of preschool children and to provide the development of modern outdoor educational methods, raising awareness of critical thinking about educational system and the importance of preschool learning.o participate in the activities with preschool children in outdoor kindergarten daily tasks. Monday-Friday: such as assistance in playing with children, organizing educating games and activities, in having breakfast/dinner/supper, cleaning tables or dishes after breakfast/dinner/supper, cleaning toys, helping children going outside to play,

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

During the 11 months service the volunteer will live in the rented place in Vilnius. The volunteer will have his own separate living room. The kitchen, toilet and shower will be common with other EVS volunteers who will live at the same place, in their own rooms. All facilities will be provided (bed, table, chair, cupboard, dishes, sheets). The rules of accommodation will be introduced to the volunteer after the arrival. The volunteer will be responsible for his own room‘s cleaning and for cleaning of common rooms he uses.

Training during the project

9-16h or 8-15h (as preferred) Monday – Friday + once a week (or as agreed with the tutor) 1 hour meeting with the tutor. The days off are public holidays and other national occasions. Working days on the weekends would be compensated with extra days off during the week. Volunteer has 2 additional free days per month, and this means, as project lasts 11 months, the volunteer has 22 days for holidays that can be divided into smaller periods (depends on personal agreement with the volunteer and the hosting organisation).

Volunteer profile

Person who would be interested in outdoor activities, ecological lifestyle and working with preschool children during all the year seasons outside. Aged 18 to 30.

Placement dates

A total of 46 week(s) during the period 18/09/2018 to 11/08/2019

Placement location

Voluntariado en escuela infantil de Polonia

asociacion building bridges

Zielona Góra, Spain

Apply

Project description

This is another edition of the project “King Solomon’s Mines …” The project is for 3 volunteers who work in the Salomon Christian Elementry School with kids 6-13 years old. The volunteers help teachers with extracurricular activities, they organize the free time that kids have after school, help with homework etc. They work 5 days a week and once a month there is some kind of event organized by the volunteers for the families and local communities. Kopalnie is a project of the group European Voluntary Service which will be realized in the Christian Primary School in Zielona Góra. The main objective of the project is to develop pupils and volunteers in different areas during the extracurricular classes. Three volunteers supervised by a teacher will help during classes for children, increasing their skills in such areas as general knowledge, foreign languages, arts (art, music, theatre, technical classes) and sports. Volunteers’ work will take place at school o

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will get money for food / 14 PLN per day/ and prepare themselves their food. (with the exception of: 1. On-arrival training and mid-term evaluation, when the volunteer is provided with food by the National Agency, 2. Camps, when the volunteer is provided with food by hotel ) A volunteer can buy lunch at the school canteen. Accommodation: Volunteers will be lodged in rented flat in town centre.

Training during the project

Trainings for the volunteer: 1. Pre-Departure Training, organized by SENDING ORGANISATION: 2. On-Arrival Training, organized by – NA of program Erasmus + Youth 3. Mid-term training organized by – NA of program Erasmus + Youth 4. Final Evaluation, organized by SENDING ORGANISATION: The volunteers will be familiarized with the place of residence, they will be given advice which places to avoid, familiarized with the possible cultural differences, the place of activities and the basic principles of safety in the workplace. They will be familiarized with the youth groups

Volunteer profile

A volunteer should: – be open to cooperation and willing to act – agree to participate in activities throughout the duration of the contract and the training prepared for volunteers – have sufficient motivation to work with children aged 6-13

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 17/09/2018 to 16/09/2019

Voluntariado residencia mayores en Francia

asociacion building bridges

Strasbourg, Spain

Apply

Project description

Voluntariado residencia mayores en Estrasburgo, Francia, con todos los gastos pagados por Erasmus+, para jóvenes menores de 30 años de edad. The nursing home has 3 doctors, 10 nurses, 15 caregivers, 30 service agents, 1 physiotherapist, 1 psychologist, and 1 facilitator. We host 123 more or less dependent residents, with medical needs. Nevertheless, the retirement home is an environment where it feels good to live. It is closed to the city centre, and its 15000 m² enables pleasant walks, as well as nice talks on benches. The House has 12 living rooms, 7 dining rooms, 1 activity room, 1 meeting room, 7 treatment rooms, 1 hair salon, 1 exercise room, 119 bedrooms, of which 115 individuals, to host elderly people, able-bodied or not, with the most comfortable and secure conditions. The House remains human size, even if it is rather significant. The main idea of « la Retraite », is not to animate with the only purpose of doing it, but rather to find activities,

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Working hours, days off, and holidays: The volunteer will work a avage of 32 to 33 hours per week, divided into 5 days. See planning above. Week ends are usually free, and the volunteer also benefit from 2 days off per attended month. Food, accomodation and local transports: Our struture will provide the volunteer with a furnished and equiped room (sanitary, kitchen and internet access). The room is completely independent from other APAS buildings, and offers direct access to the site’s parc. The volunteer could also benefit from meals cooked by the structure’s kitchen.

Training during the project

The volunteers provide elderly people with a “well-being”, and is largely beneficial to the local community. Volunteeers are invited to take part in the local life, and to be in contact with structures such as mediathec, museums, linguistic centers, sport clubs, chors, etc. The volunteer tutor and referee with regularly meet to make a point with the volunteer. This procedure aims at evulating the difficulties the volunteer has meet, and to find appropriate solutions. This time also allows to evaluate the volunteer’s progress in terms of language, local life integration, autonomy,

Volunteer profile

The volunteer :  Will live this service as a valuable personal, social, and human experience;  Will discover a city, a region, a country, a new language and culture;  Will be in contact will a special population, and discover a professional environment. – For staff members that supervise our volunteer, this service is an opportunity to share knowledge and living experiences, while favouring exchanges, listening and asking questions.

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 16/09/2018 to 16/09/2019

Placement location

Calle Cruzada 3, 1ºD, 28013 Strasbourg

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Social challenges

Health and wellbeing

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 343: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/9042_en


"Create Opportunities" in Armenia

Youth Initiative Center Gyumri NGO

Gyumri, Armenia

Apply

Project description

Throughour the volunteering project "Create Opportunities" there is 1 vacancy for Estonian volunteer in Youth Initiative Center (YIC) Gyumri NGO in Armenia. The organisation is coordinating local youth work in Gyumri, managing newly opened Youth House and encouraging locals to be active in local or international level.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation and local transport: Volunteer is living in a shared flat together with other international volunteers. In addition, organisation is offering local transportation. International transport: The travel grant for a volunteer is 360€ for return tickets.

Training during the project

Volunteer is attending at on-arrival training and mid-term training organised by SALTO. In addition volunteer is supported before mobility by sending organisation and will also take part in local orientation in receiving organisation. If possible volunteer is sent to pre-departure training in Estonia.

Volunteer profile

Volunteer with a level of English language ability, interest and willingness to work in this field. Openness to integrate into new culture. No extra experience required, but having it is an advantage.

Project 344: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/9018_en


ESC in Familles Rurales

Fédération régionale Familles Rurales des Pays de la Loire

ANGERS, France

Apply

Project description

The ambition of Familles Rurales in Pays de la Loire region is to promote families and people living in rural areas and to improve their quality of life. To make it happen, Familles Rurales implements a large scale of various family-oriented actions such as: • Activities of proximity: offering childcare with infancy host organisations, after-school centres (infancy), youth activities, cultural and leisure activities, personalized services • Activities of accompaniment: providing a professional support to the associative life in terms of local development and territorial animation, trainings and assistance to defend family interests when facing the authorities. The volunteer will be hosted for 9 months (from October 2019 to June 2020). 1) Awareness of rural families in Europe and the European mobility: from childhood to seniors ... 2) The development of european cooperation of Familles Rurales networks

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

→ Accommodation: She will have a single room with individual sanitory in a residence for young people. This residence is situated in the city centre of Angers. Sometimes, when she will be on the field for meeting associations and young people, she will be accommodate in families. → She will have meals at lunch and diner in the residence. → The residence propose internet, laundry, animations in evenings… In Angers, there are buses, a train station and tramway to go around. To come to the office, the walk is better, or by tramway. We can find a bicycle.

Training during the project

 Acquiring experiences near young people and families of rural areas  Increasing her animation technics and methods near children and young people  Developing knowledges about intercultural concept and the european citizenship  Developing competences in cultural development and communication  Knowing more about the french culture and its language

Volunteer profile

The federation will welcome volunteers, men or women, from all countries wishing to get involved in the local social milieu. Volunteers will have an interest in animation, young people, the family, seniors, associations or rural areas. The federation wishes to cooperate with sending organizations coming from associations or invested in rural areas, youth or collective services for families.

Placement dates

A total of 40 week(s) during the period 01/10/2019 to 30/06/2020

Placement location

107 rue de Létanduère, 49000 ANGERS

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 25/04/2019

Project 345: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/9002_en


Learning by doing

Dom Opieki Kościoła Chrześcijan Baptystów

Białystok, Poland

Apply

Project description

Project "Learning by to doing - Diaconal Year in Poland 2018/ 2019" is involving volunteers from different countries into structures of social/charity/educational institution. One of them is The Elderly People Care Home in Białystok. The volunteer will join in tasks which encourage the residents to grow emotionally, mentally, physically, socially and spiritually. To give you an idea of the volunteer’s duties we mention here different sorts of tasks during the whole project: Assist/conduct in social/recreational programs for elderly residents: therapeutic activities, crafts, singing, reading, watching movies together, playing games, quizzes, organizing common meetings like teatime, birthday parties etc. Reminding the residents of activities and programs and encouraging them to join. Providing one on one support. Assist with exercise programs of residents. Assist residents to eat . Individual projects according to the volunteers skills.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will have a room with bathroom and access to the kitchen in a rented apartament. The volunteers will work from Monday till Friday, max 35 hours per week. Weekends are free. There are 18 days of vacations during the activity – 2 per worked month. Christmas and national holidays are free. The volunteer can cook for himself/herself or eat lunch at the hosting organisation canteen. The volunteer will have the monthly bus ticket to have an easy access to the public transport.

Training during the project

Our volunteers will participate in two EVS trainings. The volunteers will be supported by the mentor who is an emphatic and open person. Also all the other workers will be open and sensitive for the needs of the volunteer. The volunteer in a host country will be also supported by the coordinating organization that will organise 3 seminars during the 9 months, and important part of the seminars is the evaluation and giving support to the volunteers in their "project" life. The volunteers will learn also about Poland, its culture, histrory, traditions, regions.

Volunteer profile

We would like to host someone who is really interested in Poland, who wants to help the others, who is open for new activities, who wants to try work with different age groups. The Centre prefers the volunteers who promote healthy life style. In the hosting organisation are English speaking employees, so it would be good if the EVS volunteer speaks (at least basic) this language.We would like someone who is responsible, who is aware of the fact that is being observed as an ambassador of its own country, and in some ways is the model for the local people.

Placement dates

A total of 77 week(s) during the period 06/01/2018 to 30/06/2019

Placement location

ul. Kujawska 24, 15-552 Białystok

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Health and wellbeing

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.

Project 346: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/8982_en


Go Outside

Gulbene Municipality Council

Gulbene, Gulbenes pilsēta, Latvia

Apply

Project description

The project ‘GO OUTSIDE’ coordinated by Gulbene Municipality Council (ERASMUS PLUS project ). The project aims are to provide a supportive environment for volunteers to work and gain intercultural experience, personality development, offering a stable working structure in the organization, as well as the possibility to show their initiatives; to expand public knowledge about the European and local voluntary work promoting intercultural dialogue and expanding horizons; to raise awareness in the local community and fight stereotypes; to strengthen. The volunteers will cooperate with Youth Specialists and local youth ( 7 to 25 years old), to provide a friendly environment for youth, active leisure, healthy lifestyle and proposing and presenting new topics or ideas 3 days per week. The volunteer will have 2 days per week where to collaborate with one or more local institutions, with which propose her or his own ideas and make activities for the local community.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will be provided with flats paid by the project close to their working places. They will be fully equipped with all the necessary tools for living ( electrical devices, beds, etc. ). Also, we will take care of the volunteer living situation and public transportation costs. The volunteer will have the possibility to take part in sports, cultural and others kinds of events and make socialization with other volunteers in Gulbene. Finally, the volunteers will receive every month some money for their food expenses and some pocket money for other expenses.

Training during the project

The volunteers will be given training regarding their projects where they will meet other people who are also doing voluntary work in Latvia and will be able to deeply reflect on their tasks and goals (On-arrival training and Mid-term Meeting).

Volunteer profile

We are currently looking for three volunteers. One will live and work in Ranka, a village of the region and the other two will live in Gulbene. Yet, one of them will work in Staķi and the other in Lejasciems. All of them will cooperate with Youth Specialists and local youth to provide a friendly environment for youth, active leisure, healthy lifestyle and proposing and presenting new topics or ideas. We are looking for committed, active and creative people that will provide out-doors leisure activities. At least a basic English level is required for the development of these volunteering jobs.

Placement dates

A total of 43 week(s) during the period 01/10/2018 to 31/07/2019

Placement location

Ābeļu iela 2, LV-4401 Gulbene, Gulbenes pilsēta

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Social challenges

Education and training

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 347: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/8980_en


Glocality: Resilience in Reality

Omställning Järna

Järna, Sweden

Apply

Project description

You will live and spend half of your voluntary work at an ecofarm called Charlottendals Gård. Presently the volunteers are building a new house and base of operations for volunteers, which you will live in. At Charlottendal you will get to learn basic farming skills and knowledge, like: caring for animals; planting, managing and harvesting crops; maintaining farming facilities and equipment; as well as sharing life with a community. Charlottendal is also exploring the possibilities of hosting events, workshops, courses and gatherings. The other half of your time will be spent at projects supporting the transition movement both locally and globally. Through these projects you will get to learn permaculture design with a CSA project called Under Tallarna, support global sustainability projects with Föreningen SOFIA, play and build with the children of Lilla Bullerbyn, service bikes and customers at Cykelkultur, and be a part of developing togetherness with Nackunga Community.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

You will get free accommodation, food, and a small monthly allowance, as well as support with travel expenses to and from the project.

Training during the project

The general roles we wish to fill are that of: 1. Carpenter: A person who loves to build. You will be tasked with building ex. a greenhouse and kitchen at the current base for volunteers. 2. Caretaker: You will learn how to care for people and animals. Gardening and groceries will become your passion. 3. Administrator: You are an IT wizard wanting to take the farm and community to the next level in connectivity, marketing, outreach and visibility. Volunteers will share all of these tasks, but you will be responsible for one set of tasks and gain new skills and knowledge in the others.

Volunteer profile

We are still looking for an individual from FRANCE to join the team of three volunteers. Are you: • 18-30 years of age? • Driven, with a desire to work together, and share a transformative moment in life? • Willing to learn about and develop yourself in a unique place? • Capable of taking initiative, respecting your co-workers and willing to learn many new things? • A steward of our planet looking for a mission or to learn from peers and elders? Start by sending us a motivation letter and CV. Video interviews will be held with the coordinators of the project.

Placement dates

A total of 43 week(s) during the period 20/02/2019 to 20/12/2019

Placement location

Järna

Looking for volunteers from

France

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

Positive Vibes: 02/04-31/05

FUNDACJA CENTRUM AKTYWNOSCI TWORCZEJ

Leszno, Poland

Apply

Project description

The main objective of the activities is to support young people with fewer opportunities, give them a new opportunity for development, the necessary tools to find themselves in the labor market / e.g. flexibility and readiness for quick changes and decisions, ability to use foreign languages.EVS project in Poland assumes an animation of free time children and young people from Leszno and promotion of foreign cultures and ideas for volunteering,. As during two months we will have winter holidays and many schools events - volunteers will be involved in organising activities for kids/youth during that time. EVS volunteers themselves will be able to share their passions and learn new social skills. If you are still not sure show movie :https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jk0HJ1p_qOk&feature=youtu.be or fb page leaded by our volunteers:https://www.facebook.com/EVSfundacjaCAT/

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Working hours: Volunteers will be working 35 hours per week, and will have 2 days off per month of holidays, Saturdays and Sundays are free. Accommodation: Volunteers will live in a common flats with max 2 in one room. The kitchen and the bathrooms are common in every flat.The volunteers can prepare the food on their own. Every flat has Internet wireless connections. Every volunteer will receive a Polish SIM card. Money: - Pocket money – The volunteer will receive monthly pocket money on – 120 euros - Food allowances - The volunteer will receive monthly food allowance –400 pln

Training during the project

- will take place in animation training organised wishing our organisation. -will have opportunity to take part in Human Rights & Equality training at our Offices. -will have opportunity to take part in Language Support classes. -will receive Youth Pass / Mobility Certificate. -will go through weekly evaluations and project development meetings. -participate at Polish Cultural/Traditional experiences, helping in developing one’s cultural awareness. -will have a mentor throughout his/her stay.

Volunteer profile

-Speak Communicative English, Any other Language is and advantage. -Be motivated, have energy to work with children. -Addressing youth & local community. Ability to perform workshops, performances, spontaneous actions, raise awareness about European issues. -Candidate with interest in creative writing: to lead a newsletter. -Candidates with Artistic / Musical / Theatrical skills or interest ; street artist performer, animators, abstract expressionist, musicians, comedians. -Candidates with experience in Illustration & clip-art -Mass flash mobs -Travellers & Geography Lovers.

Placement dates

A total of 8 week(s) during the period 02/04/2019 to 31/05/2019

Placement location

Więzienna 3, 64-100 Leszno

Looking for volunteers from

Dive : 02/04 2019 - 31 Jan 2020 (305 days)

FUNDACJA CENTRUM AKTYWNOSCI TWORCZEJ

Leszno, Poland

Apply

Project description

Objectives in Dive Projects: to support young people with fewer opportunities, give them a new opportunity for development, the necessary tools to find themselves in the labour market / eg flexibility and readiness for quick changes and decisions, ability to use foreign languages. By giving space and tools to young volunteers, we want to have an impact on giving them positive feedback and positive emotions, raise their self-esteem and supporting their life choices, - promoting the learning, non formal education, new innovative ideas, skills, attitudes and values essential for personal development and application in society, for creating and supporting - supporting the development of creativity, the possibility of self-realization, i.e. the ability to formulate, consult, process thoughts, implement their own projects and introduce them to the EU parliament​- promoting intercultural dialogue, shared values, solidarity, freedom and tolerance. Supporting​ non-formal education plan.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Working hours: Volunteers will be working 35 hours per week, and will have 2 days off per month of holidays, Saturdays and Sundays are free. Accommodation: Volunteers will live in a common flats with max 2 in one room. The kitchen and the bathrooms are common in every flat.The volunteers can prepare the food on their own. Every flat has Internet wireless connections. Every volunteer will receive a Polish SIM card. Money: - Pocket money – The volunteer will receive monthly pocket money on – 85 euros - Food allowances - The volunteer will receive monthly food allowance –400 pln

Training during the project

-The volunteer will receive Adaptation training Organised by our Staff on his/her first weeks during service. -Within next two month the Volunteer will also receive ON Arrival Training by NA in Warsaw, Mid Term Evaluation will take place half way through the project in the city of Torun, if it’d elsewhere the volunteer will be notified. -Volunteer will take part in: *Animation training *Human Rights & Equality training at our Offices. *Take part in Language Support classes *Will receive Youth Pass / Mobility *Participate at Polish Cultural/Traditional experiences. *Have a mentor

Volunteer profile

-Speak communicative EN. -Candidate should be creative and have innovative ideas for teaching. Interest in non-formal education. Illustration & Clip-ar. -Be able to work in an International team. Be able to take lead/charge in events, happenings. Critically analytical people are welcome. -Candidate should have interest in creative writing: Volunteer will be responsible for writing international blog , updating social media . -Candidates with experience in graphic design: Volunteer will be responsible for creating advertisements, making of short movies or/and updating social media.

Placement dates

A total of 44 week(s) during the period 02/04/2019 to 31/01/2020

Placement location

Więzienna 3, 64-100 Leszno

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Stop Divisions!Reappropriation of European values through EVS

Center for Youth Activism CYA KRIK

Skopje, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia

Apply

Project description

Long term EVS for 11 months in Skopje, Macedonia for the period 25th September 2018 – 25th August 2019 Issues and needs that the partners are trying to address with this project relate to the promotion of NF education and Volunteering as responsive tools for active citizenship, participation and social inclusion starting from young generations, with an inner outlook to reasons of detachment from Europe. Volunteers will have the chance to learn and "experience" by doing, empowering their soft skills, approaching non formal education techniques and learn and practice through an experiential and creative approach. As well, volunteers shall bring to youth local community new European visions. Throughout the school year, there are youth programs in 4 special schools in Skopje. The programs are consisted of creative workshops and the target group are young people with and without disabilities. The volunteers will take participation in the preparation and delivering of the workshops

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation, food and transport are covered by the project. The volunteers will receive food and pocket money which is calculated by the European Commission and the National Agency. The volunteers will be accommodated in an apartment together with other volunteers.The address of the apartment is st. “Hristo Tatarchev 264d”. The apartment is located in Kisela Voda Municipality in South-eastern part of Skopje and it is 15 minutes by bus to the center of Skopje (30 minutes walking). The apartment is full prepared for living and has excellent conditions.

Training during the project

During the EVS the volunteers will receive the following training's: - training for social inclusion - training for preparing and adapting workshops/programs for young people with and without disabilities - training for youth work - on-arrival and mind-term training (provided by the National Agency)

Volunteer profile

Looking for 2 volunteers from Italy with the following profile: - interests in working with youth with and without disabilities, - has pedagogical background, - basic experience in delivering different activities for the social and personal development of the young people, - creative and open minded, - willing to experience an educational and innovative approach in a young and dynamic environment, - willing to improve her/his personal skills, - ready to work in a team of motivated people and fully participate to the active life of the association, mainly composed by peer youngsters.

Placement dates

A total of 48 week(s) during the period 01/01/2019 to 02/12/2019

Placement location

Karadzica 6, 1000 Skopje

Looking for volunteers from

Italy

Placement topics

Social challenges

Citizenship and democratic participation

Education and training

Placement deadline

No application deadline

Volunteering project in Youth centre in Czech R., from February 2019

OKO - vzdelavaci a rozvojove centrum, z.s.

Rychnov nad Kněžnou, Czech Republic

Apply

Project description

Project "Let's live Europe" is for 4 motivated volunteers who work together and make value for themselves and for the organization through non-formal education. Project duration: 7,5 months from February 2019 to August/September 2019. Main themes are: Art and culture + Media and communications/Youth information, Art + culture. Volunteers will cooperate with: high schools in the region, Unemployment office, primary schools, municipal office, companies and local people in our region. The secondary aims of the project are intercultural education, fulfilling of eight key competences of volunteers and EVS support program ERASMUS+, employment and raising awareness about healthy lifestyle especially for children and youth together with local orienteering Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eFkYGVEmpWk&feature=youtu.be More about our project: http://oko-centrum.cz/dospeli-evs-european-voluntary-service-in-oko/ Or contact us :) info@oko-centrum.cz

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

FREE = All costs are covered (food, accommodation, travel expenses + pocket money). Accommodation - the volunteer will be offered accommodation in a single room in a shared flat with other volunteers. Kitchen and bathroom will be shared. The rooms and the kitchen are fully furnished and can be used by the volunteer. Usually two volunteers will stay in one flat - each of them will have his/her own room. The flat is in the centre of our town and it is free. Travel costs to and back of the project + insurance is covered. Volunteers will receive table and pocked money.

Training during the project

Volunteers will free take part in: On-arrival and Mid-term training organised by National agency in Prague. Making bulletin training and teaching skills training and Czech lessons by OKO centre. Volunteers will have good support from organization and mentors.

Volunteer profile

Our project is varied and we would like to cooperate with volunteers who are creative, open and willing to work independently. We offer a possibility of personal growth and you can use your ideas, thoughts and abilities. It is also possible to say, the project is suitable for future teachers or young people, whose enjoy teaching and intercultural activities. It is very important also to know, that about 70% of volunteering tasks are activities with children or youngsters. Volunteer's age: 18-30. from EN, DE, SP and Georgia Send us your CV and Motivation letter :) Thank you. Jitka

Placement dates

A total of 32 week(s) during the period 01/02/2019 to 15/09/2019
