Project 352: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/8919_en


Volunteers for Sustainability

Momentum World

Keswick, United Kingdom

Apply

Project description

This is an EVS opportunity for 8 young people to work for 9 months on environmental and ecological activities in the Lake District National Park. There will be two rounds of EVS (expected to start March 2019 and October 2019 respectively), each with 4 young people from different countries. The activities will combine practical, hands-on environmental and outdoor education work around the local area combined with a smaller amount of administrative and participant support work for our local team on other projects. This combination of duties will give you an exceptional learning and development experience, enabling you to move forward in your education and career afterwards. Activities will take place in and around the town of Keswick (www.keswick.org). You will gain a wide range of knowledge and competences, including ecology, outdoor education, intercultural skills and English language. You will be encouraged to develop your own project within the local community.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will live together in rented accommodation within easy reach of Keswick town centre. Accommodation will be in single rooms wherever possible, but in some cases rooms may be shared. There are a number of other EVS volunteers on other Momentum World projects in the area, so you will have the chance of a fun and varied social life. Accommodation is self-catering, and you will be paid a monthly allowance of £200 for food plus £120 pocket money. You will probably walk to work, but there are buses to destinations across Cumbria and beyond, when required.

Training during the project

You will be given a general introductory training and local orientation by Momentum World (coordinating organisation). We will then provide full induction training together with the various local partner organisations where you will be working. Because of the nature of the activities, you can expect to be given continuous training, mentoring and support throughout your EVS. In addition, you will attend on-arrival and mid-term training provided by the UK National Agency. You will have a personal development plan, linked to Youthpass.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for enthusiastic, reliable young people with a strong interest in ecology, environmental education and outdoor activities. You should be motivated to live in a rural and touristic area, and to get actively involved in all kinds of practical, sports and outdoor activities in the National Park. You must be adaptable and able to work in a team. This is a great opportunity for anyone who is thinking about a career in environmental management or education. You do not need any special qualifications, but you should speak at least intermediate level English.

Placement dates

A total of 40 week(s) during the period 01/01/2019 to 30/09/2020

Placement location

Keswick

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 353: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/8913_en


CYZ Volunteer for Youth

Carlisle Youth Zone

Carlisle, United Kingdom

Apply

Project description

Carlisle Youth Zone http://www.carlisleyouthzone.org is a large regional provider of youth activities and services - "a safe and fun environment where the potential of young people is developed and fulfilled." This long term EVS is suitable for any young person interested in youth and community work, non formal education, or the NGO sector in general. You will be working with CYZ team leaders to provide innovative and challenging activities to build social and emotional skills of young people. Volunteer duties may general youth work (e.g. sport, music, drama, dance and arts and crafts), marketing and communications, social media output, membership, market research, fundraising, or general administrative support to the team. Learning opportunities will be numerous and varied. You will improve your language skills. You will be involved in local cultural life, with the chance to meet other young people in Carlisle, and the possibility to travel around both England and Scotland.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will live together in rented accommodation within easy reach of Carlisle city centre. Accommodation will be in single rooms wherever possible, but in some cases rooms may be shared. There are a number of other EVS volunteers on other Momentum World projects in the Cumbria region, so you will have the chance of a fun and varied social life. Accommodation is self-catering, and you will be paid a monthly allowance of £200 for food plus £120 pocket money. Carlisle is on the mainline railway to London and Glasgow, with rail and bus links to many other places.

Training during the project

You will be given a general introductory training by Momentum World (coordinating organisation). Carlisle Youth Zone (host organisation) will then provide full induction training. You will be working with highly experienced staff and so you can expect to be given continuous training, mentoring and support throughout your EVS. In addition, you will attend on-arrival and mid-term training provided by the UK National Agency. You will have a personal development plan, linked to Youthpass.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for highly motivated young people with an interest in youth and community work. You do not need qualifications but you should have some experience of working or volunteering in youth organisations or projects. Creative, administrative and social media skills will be an advantage. You must have an interest in other cultures, be adaptable, and be ready to live for a year away from home. You should speak English at intermediate level and be ready to learn quickly. Preference will be given to young people who have not had international opportunities before.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/01/2019 to 30/06/2020

Placement location

Victoria Place, CA1 1LR Carlisle

Looking for volunteers from

Germany, Italy, Spain, Slovakia

Placement topics

Health and wellbeing

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

Sign in / Join

Project 354: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/8903_en


Active Keswick

Keswick Community Rugby Trust

Keswick, United Kingdom

Apply

Project description

This is an opportunity for 2 volunteers from GEORGIA and ROMANIA to be part of an innovative project in a community sports organisation (Keswick Rugby http://www.keswickrugby.com) delivering active and healthy lifestyle coaching for a local schools, youth groups and the wider community as part of a new "Active Keswick" programme. You will work across generations, mentored by experienced sports coaches and other staff. Your duties may include a mixture of administrative support work and active, hands-on sports and fitness coaching, depending on your interests and capabilities. This EVS will build your CV and enhance your future employability; improve your competences in sports coaching (possibly including recognised qualifications); develop your English language skills; provide leadership experience; and increase your intercultural awareness. This will be interesting and rewarding work in a professional but fun environment, in the heart of the beautiful Lake District National Park.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will live together in rented accommodation within easy reach of Keswick town centre. Accommodation will be in single rooms wherever possible, but in some cases rooms may be shared. There are a number of other EVS volunteers on other Momentum World projects in the area, so you will have the chance of a fun and varied social life. Accommodation is self-catering, and you will be paid a monthly allowance of £200 for food plus £120 pocket money. You will probably walk to work, but there are local buses to destinations across Cumbria when required.

Training during the project

You will be given a general introductory training by Momentum World (coordinating organisation). Keswick Rugby (host organisation) will then provide full induction training. Because of the nature of the activities, you can expect to be given continuous training, mentoring and support throughout your EVS. In addition, you will attend on-arrival and mid-term training provided by the UK National Agency. You will have a personal development plan, linked to Youthpass.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for enthusiastic, outward-looking young people from GEORGIA or ROMANIA who want to work with other people of all generations. You should have an interest in sports and healthy lifestyles, and you should be motivated to get actively involved in all kinds of sport and outdoor activities in the National Park. You do not have to have previous experience playing Rugby, but you should be ready to learn about it. You should be thirsty for new knowledge and intercultural experience. You do not need any special qualifications, but you should speak at least intermediate level English.

Placement dates

A total of 26 week(s) during the period 01/12/2018 to 31/07/2019

Placement location

Davidson Park, CA12 5EG Keswick

Looking for volunteers from

Romania

Placement topics

Health and wellbeing

Physical education and sport

Placement deadline

No application deadline

Sign in / Join

We cover medical insurance via CIGNA.

The trainings provided by National Agency of Erasmus+ in Romania – respectively On Arrival Training and Mid Term Evaluation

V. ve Stuttgartu v rámci programu Evropského sboru solidarity. Enhancing employability for young nature conservationists - SW

Scottish Wildlife Trust

Castle Douglas, United Kingdom

Apply

Project description

This project will work with 10 EVS volunteers from 4 countries (Spain, France, Hungary, Germany) in protecting biodiversity on our nature reserves, broadening experience by offering the opportunity to work on and experience a broad range of habitats across Scotland. Volunteers will also be involved in enhancing access opportunities and raising awareness of Scotland's natural heritage, thus protecting biodiversity by encouraging local communities to value and conserve their local natural resources. We aim to make volunteers much more employable by providing 12 month placements with varied work experience and training. Examples of activities will be: - Meadow management - targeted cutting and raking of site, control of bracken - Control of non-native invasive species – cutting & hand pulling - Peat bog management - removal of scrub and including installation of plastic dams - Woodland management and restructuring - removal of non native species, felling of timber

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

We will rent private accommodation close to the project location. This may be shared with other volunteers. We will provide a monthly food and pocket money allowance for volunteers to purchase their own food. We provide transport from the project team base in Castle Douglas to the worksite & back.

Training during the project

We provide a range of on the job learning opportunities such as: use of tools, working as part of a group, communication, health & safety awareness, aspects of nature reserve management, learning about different habitats, seeing wildlife in Scotland.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for male & female volunteers who are interested in conservation/the environment and who want to undertake outdoor practical work on different nature reserves in South West Scotland. A desire to work in the environment would be useful. We are looking for enthusiasm, desire, an easy going attitude and an ability to get on with others.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 10/03/2019 to 28/02/2020

Placement location

Unit 3 Station Road, DG7 1LA Castle Douglas

Looking for volunteers from

Germany, Spain, Hungary, France

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Health and wellbeing

Education and training

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 361: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/7460_en


Non-formal hand in hand with formal

ZKMŠ Litija - Youth Center Litija

Litija, Slovenia

Apply

Project description

In our organization, Public Institute of Culture, Youth and Sports Litija, unit Youth Center Litija, we have prepared a project which is already accepted, in cooperation with 4 local primary schools. In this project we want to host 5 EVS volunteers from different European countries for 12 months. The main responsibility of volunteers will be participating in educational process and all other activities in primary schools and assistance at various school subjects. 4 days per week volunteers will work in primary school, one day per week and during school holidays they will work in Youth center Litija. School work will include assistance with classes of foreign language (English, German, Spanish), physical education, art classes, geography, and history. According to volunteers' interests and expressed desire they will be able to participate in other school subjects.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will live in an apartment at a local "farm". The apartment is fully equipped and provides all you need for a normal life (your own room, equipped kitchen, bathroom, internet connection). In Litija there are many options for food. There are many different restaurants, where you can find a varied selection of food. Also in every store in Litija is possible to shop for food and drink at favorable prices, which volunteers can freely prepare at home. There is no local transport in the area. We will provide bicycles for your transport.

Training during the project

Volunteers will have mentors and coordinators in both organizations - Youth center Litija and from primary school. Mentors will take care of your faster integration into the local environment and regularly monitor the achievement of learning outcomes. Coordinators will plan your work (In cooperation with you of course) and help you with setting the learning outcomes. You will also attend two training sessions for volunteers – on arrival training and mid-term evaluation - organized by the Slovenian National agency.

Volunteer profile

We would like to host volunteers who enjoy working with children and young people. It is an excellent opportunity for students of pedagogy, social sciences, youth workers. It is important that the participant is openminded, communicative and relaxed when working with children. It is an excellent opportunity for all who would like to work in the field of formal and non formal education. It is also important that volunteers have interesting hobbies related to music, sports, art, community, nature... We are looking for the volunteer from Germany.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/10/2018 to 30/09/2019

Placement location

Looking for volunteers from

Germany

Life & activities on an eco-community farm - long stay 2019

Hastekasen farm association

No city, Sweden

Apply

Project description

Life and activities on an eco-community farm - long stay. Start: 15th march 2019 Only way to be part of this project is to send a MAIL to the organization. CLICKING apply here, will lead to nothing. Hästekasen Farm and adventure center in Sweden is looking for volunteers to be here 6 months (maybe more): Only: Polish, Hungarian, German, Spanish and Italy, France, Greece Living simple, more sustainable with less "carbon footprint". Living creative and productive and less consuming. 6 hours work every day on an isolated farm in nature. 7-20 other people here. No smoking, very little meat and only people that fits into the VISION will be accepted. Practical work: digging, hammering, carrying, lifting, cutting, barking, mixing, sorting. We are also looking for people with leadership ambitions. Entrepreneur ambitions. https://goo.gl/forms/yILkLsq2j8Jw1aRA3 https://www.facebook.com/groups/hastekasen/ http://www.hastekasen.se/Ekoby/evs.html

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Food and accommodation is paid for. Only vegetarian food, very little sugar. YOU have to bake. Private room, but simple, maybe caravan, maybe ants and spiders. Only dry toilet. Not too many showers or laundry. No wifi. Travel is paid for, up to a limit. Not easy to leave the farm, 95% of the volunteers prefer to stay all the time at the farm. 150 euro in pocket money every month. Looking for people that like camping and being in nature.

Training during the project

Non-formal, meaning you have to learn what you can by taking part in the work. You will, if you pay attention, learn how to build your own house, how to create your own food, take control over water and sewage and live simple and more sustainable. We will do a Mini-music festival. We (you) will do a LARP event (www.lajv.info) If you really want to learn Swedish and can study independently, we will support you, if you stop studying, we stop giving you lessons. There will be some workshops on leadership, community building and decision making.

Volunteer profile

Practical work on an isolated farm in nature. No smoking, No meat, no wifi, no mobiles 1. Experience of manual/practical work. 2. A proven desire to live simple and close to nature. 3. Communicative skills, be able to express their opinion and needs. (English). 4. Ambitious with a work ethic, preferably quick learners. 5. A motivation to do lifestyle change and reduce our “footprint”. 6. Exploring self sustainable lifestyle. People with work ethics, entrepreneurial ambitions, leadership ambitions will be prioritized. Answer this: https://goo.gl/forms/yILkLsq2j8Jw1aRA3

Placement dates

A total of 24 week(s) during the period 01/03/2019 to 31/12/2019

Placement location

Hästekasvägen 6, Uddevalla, Sweden, 45196 No city

Looking for volunteers from

Germany, France, Spain, Hungary, Greece

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Health and wellbeing

Employment and entrepreneurship

Application deadline: 30/04/2019

Waldorf School in Palermo (Italy)

Libera Scuola Waldorf di Palermo

Palermo, Italy

Apply

Project description

The association Libera Scuola Waldorf di Palermo, is a non-profit organisation, founded in 1986, to which teachers and parents belong with the aim to promote the pedagogy and the educational activities based on anthroposophy, and to implement other educational activities open to everybody, particularly children and young people who live in disadvantaged conditions. Volunteers will support the staff in following tasks: - support to kids with learning difficulties or psycho-physical disabilities - support in the school kitchen - participation in artistic workshops (music, painting, theatre…) and leisure activities for kids - preparation and participation in cultural events organised by the school and open to the local community - promoting volunteering through events in local schools or youth centres (with InformaGiovani) - writing on the volunteers’ blog (InformaGiovani)

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteer will be hosted in shared room with another volunteer in shared flat. Flat is equipped with all needed (water, electricity, heating, furniture). Free wi-fi is available. Accommodation is located in city centre, and well connected with public transportation. Local transport tickets will be provided. Food will be provided through monthly cash allowance. Volunteers will receive monthly pocket money of € 150,00. Travel costs are covered on the basis of E+ distance band (between 500 and 1999 Km, up to € 275; from 2000 to 2999 Km up to €360; from 3000 to 3999, up to € 530).

Training during the project

On arrival training and Mid-Term Evaluation organised by Italian National Agency.

Volunteer profile

- aged 18-30 years - strong motivation for working with disabled child - ability to team working - creativity, proactivity and flexibility - artistic (e.g. music, painting, drawing) skills are welcome - curiosity toward Steinerian pedagogy - little knowledge of Italian language is welcome

Strategic EVS in Germany

Schwarzwaldwerkstatt GmbH

Dornstetten, Germany

Apply

Project description

This volunteering opportunity is opened for Croatian citizens who want to spend period of 12 months in Schwarzwaldwerkstatt GmbH is an institution operated by the city Freudenstadt and the organizations Lebenshilfen Freudenstadt und Horb/Sulz. It cares for mentally and physically disabled people, and people with mental illness. It operates a workshop with 230 places for mentally disabled people and 30 places in the special needs day care centre. There is also a branch workshop with 90 places for people with mental illness.The hosting institution is located in city of Dornstetten.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Steinbeis, coordinating organisation will offer an apartment or ‘granny-flat’ (a unit in a home with its own separate entrance) for the volunteers. This living-unit will be in or near Dornstetten. The closeness of the volunteer’s residence and the workshop guarantees a good connection to their workplace. So, volunteers can come and go to work by foot or with their bicycle. There are good public transportation links in Dornstetten and around Freudenstadt. So, volunteers can go to the next biggest cities like Freudenstadt, Tübingen or Stuttgart with the bus or train.

Training during the project

At the beginning, volunteers get basic training at the workshop. Every month, there is a big staff meeting for all the volunteers at the workshop. Volunteers can also visit on-site or off-site training courses to get more qualifications. There is also German language training. The language training purpose is for volunteers to understand everyday talk. Volunteers also learn the common technical vocabulary used in our workshops and residential area. In the continuous language training, volunteers will learn how to use the German language in typical, everyday events in Germany.

Volunteer profile

Volunteers should like working with people who have disabilities. They should be open to working with disadvantaged young people. The disadvantaged youth might have problems or are excluded from society. Past experience in working with disabled young people is helpful. Volunteers should be able to individually design activities. A Class B car driver’s licence is an asset. Candidates shouldn't have higher education than high school diploma!

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/09/2018 to 31/08/2019

Placement location

Siemensstraße 18, 72280 Dornstetten

Looking for volunteers from

Croatia

Placement topics

Health and wellbeing

Placement deadline

No application deadline

Sign in / Join

Project 365: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/8652_en


Concordia Moldova - Helping Kids in Moldova

Chisinau, Moldova (Republic of)

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

CONCORDIA is an international, independent aid organization dedicated to helping children, teenagers and families in need. CONCORDIA helps quickly and directly on site. We go where the need is greatest. CONCORDIA enables children to enjoy a happy and healthy childhood. We focus on building stable ties and strengthening families.The volunteers will have the possibility to work with our children and teenage beneficiaries. They can provide activities for children or teenagers or to participate in delivering lunches as home for the people in need. Other tasks● Come up with educational activities, ● To teach children some internet and computers skills, - To teach English. - To help children in preparation of the homework - To organize recreational activities, games, videos, excursions, exhibitions concerts, competitions; - If possible, to provide different workshops of art, of painting, of manual work and other creative activities and other different activities.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteer(s) will live in a host family or volunteer's flat with shared kitchen, toilet and bathroom. Also volunteer(s) will have access to the land line phone in their accommodation. Internet can be accessed in the internet cafes and wi-fi spots in the city, also some volunteer flats have internet access at individual basis. As well volunteer will be able to use internet in his Host Organization. Depending on the district of the city where volunteer will live he/she can reach the center by foot or by public transportation

Training during the project

OAT and mid term evaluation made by SALTO EECA and other trainings done by the Host and coordinating organization

Volunteer profile

There is no special recruitment requirements but we will appreciate if the applicant will be: - open to know a new culture and live in another country, being able to adapt to a new environment; - aware of their responsibilities as volunteers; - willing to have new experiences and share their own ones; - cooperative and flexible; We are open to young people without any specific educational background, because there are many activities to do and opportunities to learn through volunteering in our organization.

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 01/08/2019 to 01/08/2020

Placement location

Chisinau

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Reception and integration of refugees and migrants

Project 366: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/8647_en


Activating Youth VIII

ECOS - Cooperativa de Educação, Cooperação e Desenvolvimento

Faro, Portugal

Apply

Project description

The overall EVS project – Activating Youth – it’s an idea of involving organisations with different backgrounds and themes, within the area of Faro - Portugal, where the volunteers will be offering their voluntary service but at the same time, having joint activities throughout their voluntary service in order to promote the capacity building of organisations working with youth and informing and promoting mobility, learning, voluntary and training opportunities to the local youth. This is the 7th edition. At the moment, we are looking for volunteers for: * Two EVS activities hosted by ECOS – Cooperativa de Educação, Cooperação e Desenvolvimento in Faro 1 - Youth Mobility and Initiatives Centre * One EVS activity hosted by Centro Ciência Viva do Algarve (CCVAlg) - an Interactive Science Museum in Faro 1 - Inclusive Science Programme

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will be hosted in a private house in the city of Faro. Each volunteer will have their own room and the house will be fully equipped (kitchen, fridge, washing machine, furniture, beddings and cutlery) ensuring their safe hygienic and pleasant experience. The volunteers will receive each month 100 € for pocket money according to the rules of the programme and 145 € as food allowance. For the international transportation costs the flights must follow the amount stated by the rules of the new program ERASMUS+.

Training during the project

ECOS will provide the volunteers with a programmed learning cycle that includes 1 Induction training in the first weeks upon the arrival; 2 Mid-term evaluation & a Final evaluation during the last month of the project. Also, different occasional workshops will take place during the project, according to the learning needs of the volunteers and the local partner organisations, for the benefit of the personal and professional development but also to the EVS experience. The volunteer will have access to On-Arrival and Mid-Term EVS training, in case, provided by the Portuguese National Agency.

Volunteer profile

Coming from Spain, Greece or Lithuania -dynamic and motivated; -responsible and sympathetic; -thriving when working in a multicultural and international team; -will possess knowledge, experience and/or high motivation to work on Non-formal learning and Mobility, Social Media and Image Communication or Social Inclusion of Roma and immigrants minorities; -have previous volunteering experience at local level;- able to communicate in English

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 15/09/2018 to 14/09/2019

Placement location

Campus de Gambelas. Pavilhão A5. 8005-139 Faro, 8005-139 Faro

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Environment and natural protection

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

EVS in Ahtme School

Ahtme Kool

Kohtla-Järve, Estonia

Apply

Project description

A volunteer will work in Ahtme School, which is a public educational institution for children with disabilities. The preferable topics for the volunteer's activities are theatre, dance, arts and crafts or sports. These topics can be taught in a creative way and there is more freedom for volunteer to use movements, gestures and pictures if something is not understandable in English. Moreover, these activities help to develop students' communication and social competence and cultural expression and allow them to improve English fluency. Additionally, the volunteer will organise English language cafe for the teachers and English club for the students. The volunteer will work 33 - 37 hours per week and we will be happy to involve him/her in our extra-curricular activities. Some of our pupils stay in our boarding house, so it is necessary to arrange some pleasure activities for them (some club, games, outdoor activities). It would be a great help and extraordinary experience for children

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteer will be accommodated in rented and appropriately furnished flat together with other international volunteers. He/she will have a private or shared bedroom and a shared kitchen, a bathroom and a toilet. Food allowance will be given to the volunteer monthly. The volunteer will cook by themselves.

Training during the project

- On-arrival training course and mid-term evaluation meeting organized by Estonian National Agency; - "Check-in" training course upon arrival and EVS common days once in a month organized by coordinating organisation VitaTiim NGO for all volunteers doing their services in Narva, Sillamäe and Kohtla-Järve; - Russian language course.

Volunteer profile

We expect volunteer who loves children and have interest to work with them, is friendly, open for communication and exchange of experience, hard-working and with sense of initiative or wish to develop it, has some hobbies and interests and would love to work with children with disabilities.

Placement dates

A total of 43 week(s) during the period 01/09/2018 to 30/06/2019

Placement location

Õpetajate 3, Kohtla-Järve

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Kohtla-Järve Ahtme Gümnaasium

Kohtla-Järve, Estonia

Apply

Project description

Volunteer will be working in Kohtla-Järve Ahtme Gymnasium, which is a general secondary school with 620 pupils in the age of 7-18 years old. He/she will be engaged in language club, cultural evenings, EVS promotion (meetings with pupils and bloging), school radio Kurumbus, enterprising teaching (participation in different projects), school decoration, events organization help, assistance in bicycle driving training, basic school pupils tutoring ( main teacher assistant). A volunteer can visit free of charge after-class lessons and learn different activities like ceramic, disain, media, droning, robotics, 3D printing, make-up etc. depends on volunteer interests. During the school projects, a volunteer can visit different museums and scientific centers together with school pupils and participate in thematic museum lessons.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteer will be accommodated in rented and appropriately furnished flat together with other international volunteers. He/she will have a private or shared bedroom and a shared kitchen, a bathroom and a toilet. Food allowance will be given to the volunteer monthly.

Training during the project

- On-arrival training course and mid-term evaluation meeting organized by Estonian National Agency; - "Check-in" training course upon arrival and EVS common days once in a month organized by coordinating organisation VitaTiim NGO for all volunteers doing their services in Narva, Sillamäe and Kohtla-Järve; - Russian language course.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for volunteer who is keen: - on teaching their mother tongue and promoting, introducing their culture, customs and country to our students - open-minded person who has passion for foreign languages - who has a certain skill or hobbies (e.g. ability to dance, master photography, journalism experience, create art or produce video materials, ability to play instruments, create a blog and more similar skills) to teach to our students - share our values on promoting equality, cooperation, multiculturalism, integration - like to plan and organize events or help with it

AWO Kreisverband Konstanz e.V.

Singen/Hohentwiel, Germany

Apply

Project description

The Familiy House Taka-Tuka-Land belongs to the AWO Kreisverband Konstanz e.V. It is a kindergarten for children at the age of 0 to 6 years old. It is taken care of the children in special familiy groups. Children of different age are together in one group, so that they learn from each other. Children learn values like having respect before each other and be tolenrant to different lifestyles and backgrounds. Singen is a modern, developped town with a lot of shopping possibilities but also many citicens have got a migration background, so for many children is German not their mother tongue.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will have a room in a shared flat with W-lan and all necessary other arrangements (washing-mashine, bycicle and further more) Pocket money and food money will be paid Travel costs to Germany and back at the beginning and at the end of the stay will be paid.

There will be an On-Arrival training and a Midterm-Training. Language Course all over the year in German

Volunteer profile

The volunteer should be willing to learn about Paedagogigs

Berufskolleg Ibbenbüren

Ibbenbüren, Germany

Apply

Project description

Our vocational school is located in Ibbenbüren. Ibbenbüren has about 52,000 inhabitants, lies in the north of North Rhine-Westphalia and is located between Osnabrück and the Dutch border. Münster is located about 40 km from here. The area is mainly rural in nature. In the south of Ibbenbüren begin the wooded hills of the Teutoburger Forest. At our College we have 2400 students taught by 115 teachers. We offer: - Apprenticeships like electrical technicians, kindergarten teachers, hairdressers, motor mechanics, painters and decorators, mechanical technicians, joiners, plumbers and utilities, technicians - High School Diploma like Community Sports Leader, State-approved Educator and State-approved, IT Assistants - Full-time Technical School like Welfare and Health Care for Nursing Assistants, Welfare and Health Care for Social Workers, Mechanical Engineering - Higher Technical College like Design, Welfare and Health Care - Preparatory School like Mechanical Technicians

Volunteer profile

We don't expect any special skills. Would be good if you speak english or German. Most important fact: This project is already approved for our sending partner in Hungary. So you have to be a volunteer from Hungary. Interested? Please contact us and as well Mrs. Iris Garibovic (garibovic.iris@maltai.hu)

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/09/2018 to 31/08/2019

Placement location

Jugendtreff Bansen - Youthcenter Bansen

Lotte (project); Westerkappeln (place of residence), Germany

Apply

Project description

The Jugendtreff Bansen is a municipal facility and is located in the district of Alt-Lotte in a beautiful half-timbered house with good spatial and physical facilities. The house is 25 years old, is attended by children and young people aged 6 to 20 years and is recognized in the community. “About our facility” priorities and user groups:- Open meeting place for children and young people - Services for Children "Kina" - Cooking with fun - Special events and action days: trips to swimming pool to Aaseebad, to ice rinks, musical trips, visits to the zoo, etc. - Holiday Specials - Babysitting courses for girls - Parties (carnival and Halloween) - Lotter Children's Theatre Project in the house Hehwerth

Volunteer profile

We don't expect any special skills. Would be good if you speak english or German. Of course you are working with kids and youngsters in a youth center you should like to work with them. So would be nice if you are a creative and /or sportive person. Please notice that this project is located in a rural area - you should be prepared to use buses or a bicycle. Most importans fact: This project is already approved for our sending partner in Italy, Bozen. So you have to be a volunteer from Italy. Interested? Please contact us and as well Mrs. de Pascuale (franca.depascuale@provinz.bz.it)

RURAL YOUTH- 5 volunteering positions in Northern-Finland 2019-2020

Rieska Leader ry

Ylivieska, Finland

Apply

Project description

We are looking for 5 volunteers: 2 for a small village, Eskola to take care of the free time activities of the children (1-12 y) of the village and help at events throughout the year. 1.9.2019 to 31.8.2020 (12 months) We are looking for 1 volunteer to the Rural Institute of Kannus to be the free time animator of the youngsters (16-24 y) living in the dormitory and help at the events. 1.9.2019-30.6.2020 (10 months) We are looking for a volunteer as well for the Christian College of Kalajoki, where the volunteer will work with refugees and their families, organizing free-time activities for them. 1.9.2019-30.6.2020. And we are looking for a volunteer for the Town of Kalajoki to help at youth and sport clubs and cultural events 1.9.2019-30.6.2020. We are looking for volunteers mostly from Spain, Hungary, Ukraine, Latvia, Lithuania and other Eastern European countries with a possible Russian language skills, but we are interested in other countries as well.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

In Eskola the volunteers are living in their own flat in separate rooms. They have lunch during the week in the restaurant of the village. The volunteers will receive monthly pocket money and additional support for meals. The volunteers will have bikes for local traveling. In Kannus and Kalajoki the volunteers will live in the dormitory of the school in an own room. The volunteer will get breakfast, lunch and dinner during the week in the school canteen and will receive monthly pocket money and additional support for meals. The volunteer will have a bike for local traveling.

Training during the project

The volunteers will participate in the arrival training and the mid-term meeting organized by the Finnish National Agency.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for volunteers who are: -over 18 -like to work with children and youngsters and/or have some experience with them -has at least basic English language skills -possibly have Russian language skills (Kalajoki) -are motivated and interested in learning innovative things -are familiar with rural areas -understand and are prepared for what it means to spend their time in a small place, in the middle of the Finnish countryside with lack of public entertainment

Placement dates

A total of 54 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

Vierimaantie 5, 84100 Ylivieska

Looking for volunteers from

Spain, Hungary, Latvia, Lithuania, Estonia, France, Croatia, Italy, Portugal, Slovakia, Romania

"Empowered by Nature" - a short-term group volunteering - 30 days

Madárkórház Alapítvány

Hortobágy, Hungary

Apply

Project description

Venue: Hortobágy, Hungary (a village in the middle of the Hortobágy National Park) Dates: 2-31 May 2019 Topic: Empowered by Nature - nature as a source of self-development, creativity and cooperation Age of participants: 18-30 years Volunteering activities: The following works will be done on location in smaller groups - following a preparation: Maintaining the Bird Park resort: cutting grass (huge territory), painting the wooden gates, the fences, the bike stands, re-painting some of the recovery rooms, building the walking-path of the park. Helping with the recovery of the injured birds: feeding 4-times a day the little birds, helping with the preparation for examination, moving birds from cages to other cages (because of cleaning or examination), releasing birds back to nature

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation: stone house, shared rooms for volunteers of the same gender (2-3 volunteers share a room), fully equipped kitchen, 2 bathrooms + 6 separate toilets, the house uses solar energy, equipped with air-conditioning in each room. The house has a big training room for meetings and gatherings + a big garden. The house is just 5 minutes walk from the Bird Park, the venue of the volunteer activities. Food: 6 EUR/ day - transferred on the first working-day after arrival (180 EUR for 30 days) Pocket money: 5 EUR/day 2 free days/ week Nearest airport: Debrecen/ Budapest

Training during the project

on-arrival training, 5 days after arrival (intercultural communication, team-working, cultural input on Hungary, cultural adaption, Youthpass and insurance matters, conflict management, self-awareness, goal setting, mini project planning, basics of English and Hungarian language; non-formal language animations will be available in English every week; mentoring: at the beginning daily meetings (days: 1-7), later weekly meetings with the mentors; community activities: workshops on photography, treasure-hunting in the pusta, rowing on Hortobagy river, carriage-ride, handcrafts)

Volunteer profile

This project is planed for young people with fewer opportunities, who are facing different difficulties in their lives (social, economic, educational, territorial), NEET unemployed, minorities, low-level or unfinished education, family or economic problems, etc. There is no need for a good or any command of English.

Placement dates

A total of 4 week(s) during the period 02/05/2019 to 31/05/2019

Placement location

Petőfi tér 6., 4071 Hortobágy

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 01/04/2019

Call for participants for Mädchenzentrum Klagenfurt (Center for Girls)

Mädchenzentrum Klagenfurt

Klagenfurt am Wörthersee, Austria

Apply

Project description

Mädchenzentrum Klagenfurt offers counselling, support and information for a variety of situations and living conditions of girls* and young women*. The goal is to enable and assist girls* in making self-determined life choices. To achieve this goal we provide a broad variety of projects and courses in the fields of career orientation, social education, counselling... It is a meeting point for girls who can spend their leisure time three days a week (meet friends, homework, play games, participate in workshops or just want to hang out for a while...) Once a week we cook together and try to organise something special like creative activities, dance workshops, different excursions. Beside the fun factor young people can find help and talk about their problems at the „Mädchen*treff“. We advise in the fields of: Difficulties at school - Education advice - Family problems - Process of integration - Relationship difficulties That’s why we are a place to start, to meet, where people listen...

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will be accommodated in Klagenfurt. The volunteer will receive a monthly food allowance.

Training during the project

On Arrival Training, a Mit Term Training

Volunteer profile

Volunteers should be citizens from EU member states or associated countries. Volunters should be open-minded, tolerant.

Placement dates

A total of 48 week(s) during the period 01/03/2019 to 31/01/2020

Placement location

Karfreitstraße 8, 9020 Klagenfurt am Wörthersee

Looking for volunteers from

Activ8 Competences

Asociatia Lumea lui Pinocchio

Panciu, Romania

Apply

Project description

Asociatia Lumea lui Pinocchio is a non-profit organization founded in 2001 in Panciu, Romania, with the main objective of encouraging social integration and a sustainable local development, with a special attention to children and minors. LLP manages the Daily Socio-educational Centre Pinocchio, whose regular activities are targeted to 50 children belonging to the most disadvantaged brackets of the local population, in particular to the Roma minority. The centre is open from Monday to Friday, from 8.30am to 17.30am. The educational activities regard: alphabetization, afterschool, education to hygiene, respect for the environment, non formal education (workshops on recycling; music, theatre, painting, clownerie, jonglerie, games, etc.).The Educational Daily Centre “Pinocchio” has been founded in order to work on social integration starting from an early age. Volunteers will be actively involved in the socio-educational activities of the centre.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will be lodged at an apartment specifically dedicated to their hosting. The apartment is very close to the Centre Pinocchio. The apartment is equipped with all necessary facilities/stuff for the volunteers’ daily life. Volunteers will be provided with weekly food allowance for their grocery shopping. Volunteers will be responsible for meals preparation (if they want, for lunch they can also stay at the canteen of the Centre Pinocchio together with local staff and children) and also for the regular cleaning of the house.

Training during the project

- Pre-departure training about the volunteering experience and its conditions - On Arrival Training organized by the Romanian National Agency - On arrival training at the Centre Pinocchio - Language course - Mid-Term Evaluation organized by the Romanian National Agency

Volunteer profile

Requirements: • Age between 18 and 30 years old • Residence in the country of their sending organisation (Italy, Greece, Germany, Hungary, Czech Republic, Spain) • Registration in the European Solidarity Corps Portal • Not having already taken part in an Erasmus+ volunteering activity or a EVS for more than 2 months • High motivation to work with disadvantage children, youth and families • Basic knowledge of English • Previous experiences (work/voluntarism) in the socio-eductional field

Placement dates

A total of 1 week(s) during the period 23/01/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

strada Cuza Voda, 23 - 625400 Panciu (Jud. Vrancea)Romania, 625400 Panciu

Looking for volunteers from

Hungary, Italy, Spain, Germany, Greece, Czech Republic

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Education and training

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Volunteering for a smile - Romania - Volunteers from Portugal only

Resita, Romania

Apply

Project description

Nevo Parudimos Association it’s a non profit apolitical organization which was founded by a group of teachers, Roma activists and Roma students from Caras-Severin county, in the south-west of Romania in 2008. The aim of the Nevo Parudimos association is to decrease the economic, social, educational and cultural differences in the society. - Daily activities in 2 kindergartens from the disadvantaged communities from Resita, using non formal education methods whit the aim to make the educational activity more attractive for kids; - Daily activities in a daycenter from Resita; - Projects of the volunteers (individual or in teams) which promote civic involvement, participation, volunteering and tolerance in Resita once every 3 months; - Monthly activities to promote Erasmus+ and volunteering, and to recruit new volunteers; - Weekly activity to promote Language cafee;

Volunteer profile

The volunteer should be: • aged between 18 and 30 years; • enthusiastic and eager to learn more about inclusion, civic involvement and volunteering • english knowledge, at least the minimum bases, to be able to communicate with the staff and the other volunteers; • ability to work in teams; • to be open minded and sociable; • minimum knowledge about non formal education • minimum knowledge about voluntary work • have minimum knowledge about pedagogy and work with kids • tolerant and able to work in poor communities

Rapatac Activitycenter Nordost

Rapatac

Gävle, Sweden

Apply

Project description

Are you interested in being a volunteer in Sweden and working with children and young people? Then Rapatac is the place for you! Here is our center for children and adolescents aged 6-16 years. Volunteers are given the opportunity to develop and take part in activities for the children. Maybe you want to conduct activities in painting, dance, photography or music? Just the imagination sets limits. More information can be found at www.rapatac.se/nordost Welcome with your application!

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer lives in a fully furnished apartment near the activity center. You will live together with 2 other volunteers, and you all have your separat rooms. The apartment is of 114 kvadratmeters. Transport is arranged by Rapatac. Pocketmoney and money to buy food are given to the volunteer monthly. If you are unable to start the project right now, but are able to start later in the spring / summer, please apply anyway. We are open to all applications for Rapatac Activitycenter Nordost and will get back to all of you by email.

Training during the project

On arrival training and mid-term training in the capital Stockholm. Rapatac staff will together with the volunteer have discussions and follow-ups regualy to make sure that the volunteer feels happy and developes in its activities.

Volunteer profile

The important thing for us in Rapatac is that you as an applicant are interested in working with children and young people as well as looking at the possibility of keeping your own activities with them at our Activity Center. As mentioned earlier, the volunteer has great opportunities to come up with ideas for activities or choose to participate in existing activities. It's important that you enjoy taking your own initiative and meeting new people. Experienced work with children and young people is meritorious. You should not use any kind of tobacco, such as cigarettes or snus.

Placement dates

A total of 42 week(s) during the period 01/02/2019 to 31/12/2019

Placement location

Staketgatan 39, 803 21 Gävle

Call for participants for Waldorf Kindergarten Klagenfurt

Waldorf Kindergarten Klagenfurt

Klagenfurt am Wörthersee, Austria

Apply

Project description

The kindergarten in the city center of Klagenfurt is located in Carinthia (Austria), close to the borders of Italy and Slovenia. It offers children at the age of 1.5 to 6 years the chance to experience a daily routine, focusing on learning by doing and living a holistic view of mankind. Overall there are four kindergarten groups with about 20 children each aged 3 to 6 years and two nursery groups for up to 15 infants aged 1.5 to 3 years. Every kindergarten group is led by two educationalists while the groups for the infants are led by three educationalists each. Extraordinary about this kindergarten is the anthroposophical influence. Keeping up with rituals and repeating daily rhythms gives certainty to the children. Furthermore, mechanical and artistic skills are highly valued and supported, following the Waldorf pedagogy. As a basic principle the children are playing in the garden every day. Another element of both kindergartens is the intense cooperation with parents.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will be accommodated in Mozartheim, which is a student dorm close to the youth centre. The centre will be in walking distance to the accommodation. The volunteer will receive a monthly food allowance.

Training during the project

On Arrival Training and a Mit Term Training

Volunteer profile

You are motivated, interested, responsible, reliable, calm, easy-going, helpful, careful, farseeing, joyfully, neatly and on time? You are interested in working with children and being part of our team? If you can answer most of these questions with ‘yes’, we are happy to offer you a job as a volunteer in our kindergarten!

Placement dates

A total of 48 week(s) during the period 01/03/2019 to 31/01/2020

Placement location

Linsengasse 21, 9020 Klagenfurt am Wörthersee

Looking for volunteers from

Latvia, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Creativity and culture

Physical education and sport

Placement deadline

No application deadline

Call for participants for Youth Point Don Bosco Siebenhügel

Youth Point Don Bosco Siebenhügel

Klagenfurt am Wörthersee, Austria

Apply

Project description

Youth centre “Youth Point Don Bosco Siebenhügel” is a place where young people between 13-18 years can spend their free time 5 days a week, meet friends and have fun. In summertime we go in parks with games to play with children and youth who don’t visit our Youth Point. The team is formed by 3 educated employees. The Youth Point consists of a nice coffee area with a small kitchen, one room with 3 computers and internet and. We also have a billiard table as well as many board and card games. Regularly our Youth Point becomes an artists’ studio because our people love being creative. For people who like to do some sport we can offer football, basketball We mainly work with children and young people who are socially disadvantaged. Beside the fun factor young people can find help and talk about their problems. We try to help young people to be self-determined and self-confident, because we think that this is one of the most important conditions to be open-minded, tolerant.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will be accommodated in Mozartheim, which is a student dorm close to the youth centre. The centre will be in walking distance to the accommodation. The volunteer will receive a monthly food allowance.

Training during the project

On Arrival Training and a Mit Term Training

Volunteer profile

Volunteers should be citizens from EU member states or associated countries. Volunters should be open-minded, tolerant and like to work with children and young people.

Placement dates

A total of 48 week(s) during the period 01/03/2019 to 31/01/2020

Placement location

Siebenhügelstraße 64, 9020 Klagenfurt am Wörthersee

Looking for volunteers from

Latvia, Belgium, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta

Placement topics

Voluntariado con inmigrantes en Prato (Toscana, Italia)

asociacion building bridges

Prato, Spain

Apply

Project description

Te ofrecemos 2 plazas de voluntariado inmigrantes Italia en la Toscana, se valora conocimientos de francés en una fundación que trabaja con inmigrantes con ese idioma. Se desarrollará en Prato, en pleno corazón toscano. ¡Anímate a solicitarlo! Is an ONLUS of the Diocese of Prato that for over eighty years has been carrying out socio-educational and socio-health activities in the territory of Prato for minors and adults with psychomotor disabilities, personal difficulties, family and social distress. Moreover, since April 2011 it manages the reception services in favor of migrants from North Africa, to date it has carried out and is carrying out the first reception service of foreign citizens temporarily present in the territory: the service is carried out in 10 different structures for a number of around 400 refugees. Potential volunteers must register in the European ESC (European Solidarity Corps) portal Volunteers must have a great motivation to participate in activities

Volunteer profile

– between 18 and 30 years old; – willing to spend one year in Prato (Italy); – possess good adaptability; – possess excellent skills to work in a team; – great willingness to work with disadvantaged people; – ready to organize and participate in creative and social events; – knowledge of Italian and French (non-mandatory).

1 plaza de voluntariado europeo en Grecia en residencia ancianos

asociacion building bridges

Thiva, Spain

Apply

Project description

The “Agios Vlasios” Chronically Diseases Infirmary of the Holy Diocese of Thiva & Levadia is an elderly care center that aims to offer treatment, affection and care to people of both sexes with priority those suffering with chronicle illness. Working environment The working facilities are modern inside the hospitable 3-floor building with comfortable sitting and refreshing room. There is a seminar room with 200 persons capacity that is also used as an indoor group activities’ room. There is a restaurant and conservatory along the 2 floors and 34 rooms divided between the 2 floors with view to the gardens. The Infirmary operates in 3 shifts a day.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers accommodation will be in a multi-room rented apartment (1 person per room), with fully equipped kitchen, bathroom, hallway, common sitting room located in Levadia city. Three persons per apartment are allowed.

Training during the project

Six (6) hours per day, 5 days per week including weekends (In some cases, to organize special events which require the presence of the EVS volunteers during the weekend that will be deducted from the week days, established by common agreement with the management team). The volunteer will arrive at the “Agios Vlasios” Chronically Diseases Infirmary installations at the agreed hour and leave 6 hours later. Within this time 45 minutes all together are allowed for branch and/or lunch.

Volunteer profile

The proposed voluntary services in the Chronically Diseases Infirmary for elderly persons include: a) Voluntary service will follow the daily program of the Infirmary with the personal care of the elderly such as facial cleaning and beauty, serving water and food, walking them around the Infirmary. b) Voluntary service with weekly creative activities for the elderly such as handicrafts, physical education, music, communication, free time entertainment and walking companion to the city, through individual and group activities. c) Voluntary service on planning, organizing

Placement dates

A total of 48 week(s) during the period 01/09/2018 to 31/07/2019

Placement location

Calle Cruzada 3, 1ºD, 28013 Thiva

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Please read carefully the criteria below and send us the documents needed in case you want to apply. Eligibility: you are eligible to apply if you are 18 to 30 years old and if you have not done European Voluntary Service before. Remember you can choose preferred Kindergarten from the list but during the interview we will agree together where you fit better. Please be sure to open the links below Eligibility: You are eligible to apply if you are aged 21 to 30 years old. We would like to recruit volunteers from: Russia, Italy, Lithuania, Spain, Hungary.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The project will be implemented during next 2,5 years (01.02.2018 – 30.04.2020) in 16 different hosting organisations. Foundation will be the leader and coordinating organisation. We have planned full rounds of long-term EVS: The project starts in SEPTEMBER 2018 and finishes in JUNE 2019 (or February – check below)

Volunteer profile

Varias plazas voluntariado en Reino Unido

asociacion building bridges

bournemouth, United Kingdom

Apply

Project description

Nueva oferta de trabajo voluntariado europeo en Reino Unido con jóvenes desfavorecidos de Bournemouth (Reino Unido), esta vez de la mano de una organización con una amplia trayectoria , incluyendo como siempre en el SVE todos los gastos pagados. The EVS volunteers will have access to a Mentor throughout their stay with us. The Mentor will be objective and from a different hosting organisation Bournemouth department. The volunteers will meet with the Mentor on a monthly basis (or more if required) to review their chosen competences and to reflect and assess on their learning experiences for their Youthpass Certificates. They will also meet throughout their induction and then quarterly with their line managers for more task-focused supervision. Towards the end of the EVS volunteers’ stay, the line managers will help them to complete the Youthpass Certificate and to share their stories and achievements with others by writing articles for our newsletter.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Travel is included. Other costs are also covered (accommodation, language course, food, pocket money, insurance, and so on). There will be some evenings and weekend days. There may also be occasional overnight stays throughout the year and although these are usually optional for volunteers they will greatly enhance their experience with us. When the EVS volunteers want to book days off, this can be agreed in advance with their line managers.

Training during the project

Hosting organisation will usually use host families with a history of accommodating international students. The families often come recommended to us. We will draw up a contract with the families before the new volunteers arrive. The host families are unrelated to any hosting organisation employees. They are accessible by bus and have internet connections. We have a mobile number and email address to contact them whenever we need to and they have ours. If there are any special requirements for the accommodation, these will be discussed with the volunteers prior to their arrival.

Volunteer profile

We will study carefully all application and selected candidates will be invite for Skype interview. The selection of volunteers will take place in the coming weeks.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/09/2018 to 31/08/2019

Placement location

Calle Cruzada 3, 1ºD, 28013 bournemouth

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Voluntariado en escuela infantil de Polonia

asociacion building bridges

Zielona Góra, Spain

Apply

Project description

This is another edition of the project “King Solomon’s Mines …” The project is for 3 volunteers who work in the Salomon Christian Elementry School with kids 6-13 years old. The volunteers help teachers with extracurricular activities, they organize the free time that kids have after school, help with homework etc. They work 5 days a week and once a month there is some kind of event organized by the volunteers for the families and local communities. Kopalnie is a project of the group European Voluntary Service which will be realized in the Christian Primary School in Zielona Góra. The main objective of the project is to develop pupils and volunteers in different areas during the extracurricular classes. Three volunteers supervised by a teacher will help during classes for children, increasing their skills in such areas as general knowledge, foreign languages, arts (art, music, theatre, technical classes) and sports. Volunteers’ work will take place at school on working days

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will get money for food / 14 PLN per day/ and prepare themselves their food. (with the exception of: 1. On-arrival training and mid-term evaluation, when the volunteer is provided with food by the National Agency, 2. Camps, when the volunteer is provided with food by hotel ) A volunteer can buy lunch at the school canteen. Accommodation: Volunteers will be lodged in rented flat in town centre.

Training during the project

The organization of free time for students in Solomon's European Club Preparing and conducting Volunteer Day in their countries. Exemplary schedule of a day This is 35-40 hours including training volunteers in teaching languages and team meeting. In case, when a volunteer is engaged in special events, special day– she will get extra day off. Vacation: 20 days off work – 2 days each month. Days that hasn't been tapped go along to the next month. Volunteer, planning her vacation, informs the host organisation with two weeks notice (14 days).

Volunteer profile

A volunteer should: – be open to cooperation and willing to act – agree to participate in activities throughout the duration of the contract and the training prepared for volunteers – have sufficient motivation to work with children aged 6-13

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/09/2018 to 31/08/2019

Placement location

Calle Cruzada 3, 1ºD, 28013 Zielona Góra

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Servicio Voluntariado Europeo en guardería de Hungría

asociacion building bridges

pecs, Hungary

Apply

Project description

¿Quieres un servicio voluntariado europeo Hungria trabajar en una guardería a través del Servicio Voluntario Europeo con todos los gastos pagados?. Descubre además Pecs, que es una de las ciudades más bellas de Hungría. We are a kindergarten with three different establishments in the city centre of Pecs. In our kindergarten there are 13 groups of kids from 3-7 years old, 30 kids per group. All groups have 2 kindergarten teachers and 1 nanny. Our education-training system is flexible, innovative and open to emphasise tolerance, acceptation of different people, presentation of human values. The volunteers will work in three kindergartens. There are 6-4-3 groups in the kindergartens.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

he volunteers will have to live together – in the same room max. 2 people – with other volunteers in the flat that we already use for volunteers for years now. They will have to collect invoices about the food money that is app. 37.000 HUF (app. 120 EURs). They will receive the pocket money (90 EURs, app. 28.000 HUF), and they can use it freely. The houses are adjusted to the needs of our current volunteers, that we hope is also suitable for the needs of your volunteers as well. They will have responsibility for those things in the flats that are used by them, and if they destroy something

Training during the project

The volunteers cannot come by car and no parents can accompany the volunteers (they can come to visit, but not at the beginning of the project). The volunteers should bring towel and bed clothes and sheets and a passport photo with them

Volunteer profile

We will study carefully all application and selected candidates will be invite for Skype interview. The selection of volunteers will take place in the coming weeks.

Placement dates

A total of 48 week(s) during the period 01/09/2018 to 30/07/2019

Placement location

Calle Cruzada 3, 1ºD, 28013 pecs

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Becas Erasmus Italia de voluntariado en actividades con discapacitad@s

asociacion building bridges

Modigliana, Spain

Apply

Project description

Te ofrecemos estas becas Erasmus Italia que acaba de abrirse para desarrollar un voluntariado en Modigliana, en este proyecto con todos los gastos pagados. The volunteer must be between 18 and 30 years old. No Italian knowledge is required, as well as no studies in the social field are expected: the important thing is that the volunteer is motivated towards this experience. The arrival date should be inmediately. The volunteer will work inside the services of the cooperative: people with disability, young people, disadvantaged mums with their little children. We will host 4 volunteers at the same time for 9 months. The other volunteers come from Portugal, Poland and Sweden. They will share an apartment in the centre of the town. During the first week, the 4 volunteers will have a training in order to build up the group, to know the town, the culture, etc. Then, during the first month, the volunteers will do an experience in each service of the cooperative

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

It operates mainly in the territory of the Municipalities of Romagna Forlì – sub-area Acquacheta, which includes the Municipalities of Modigliana (where the Cooperative has its registered office), Tredozio, Rocca San Casciano, Dovadola and Portico and San Benedetto. It is a hilly-mountainous area, mainly rural, with a total population of just over 10,000 inhabitants. The decision to remain rooted in our territory, especially for social assistance and educational services, was the result of the desire to be a concrete resource for the community and for the weakest

Training during the project

Alongside services for people with disabilities at home, in schools, in the modern day and residential center “La Libellula” and in the “La Coccinella” social-employment laboratory, has contributed to: start up supplementary services for the education and protection of children in the Municipality of Tredozio, to support young families (even single-parent families), with particular attention to situations of fragility; animate Spaces lnFormaGiovani where young people find not only information but a place where they can be together and share their interests,

Volunteer profile

We will study carefully all application and selected candidates will be invite for Skype interview. The selection of volunteers will take place in the coming weeks.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/09/2018 to 31/08/2019

Placement location

Calle Cruzada 3, 1ºD, 28013 Modigliana

Voluntariado cultural en una biblioteca en Lituania

asociacion building bridges

klaipedia, Spain

Apply

Project description

Si estás interesado en actividades culturales y te gustaría trabajar con jóvenes, esta oferta de voluntariado cultural en una biblioteca en Lituania puede ser para ti. ¡Sigue leyendo! This library in Klaipeda, founded in 1950, serves as a center of information research and the provider of educational and leisure activities. The Library is open to all visitors World Wide without any restrictions and age. Besides regular libraries functions it also offers exhibitions and other cultural events that are open for all visitors; organize various training activities, excursions round the library, volunteers activities, new book presentations, lectures, modern art exhibitions, cultural performances, after school programs, programs for reader development. Library also has open space for young people. Mission of the space is to provide meaningful activities and safe leisure opportunities for self-realization 14-29 years old young people and to facilitate their integration

Volunteer profile

Volunteers aged 18-30 years, open minded, eager to learn and motivated to work on the proposed project activities. The volunteers should be motivated to work on cultural activities, work with people, especially with youth in open youth space in a non-formal education context. Should like to develop and improve their skills and abilities, be open for experiments, have some hobbies or interests and like to share them when organizing activities, discussions and projects for the community. Wanted but not necessary: interested in photography, graphic design and preparation of workshops

SVE en un centro de enseñanza en Francia

asociacion building bridges

rodez, Spain

Apply

Project description

¿Te apasiona la enseñanza y te gustaría vivir una experiencia diferente en otro país? Te traemos una oportunidad de voluntariado estupenda en un centro de enseñanza superior en Francia donde podrás participar en la preparación de actividades no formales, fomentar el aprendizaje de idiomas y ayudar a aumentar la conciencia europea. Las actividades propuestas se hacen en colaboración con el equipo pedagógico. Están dirigidas prioritariamente a los estudiantes del centro. También pueden estar dirigidas a personas ajenas a la institución. Responden a tres objetivos: Desarrollar la ciudadanía europea: el voluntario se verá invitado a intervenir ante los estudiantes para dar testimonio de su proyecto y sensibilizarlos a la ciudadanía europea y a la movilidad. Dará a conocer su país de origen y su cultura. Intervendrá en clase con los profesores sobre temas determinados, o de su elección. Se verá asociado a eventos relacionados con Europa, dentro y fuera del centro.

Volunteer profile

Todas las solicitudes son aceptadas sin distinción de competencia, nivel de formación o de lengua, de experiencia, de origen social o de género. Buscamos sin embargo a un voluntario: – reactivo – abierto – apto para el trabajo en grupo, en colaboración con profesores, estudiantes y estructuras asociativas. que tenga facilidad para las relaciones sociales y que sea motor en la creación de vínculos sociales. – capaz de adaptarse a un contexto de ciudad mediana situado en une región rural y de apreciar sus ventajas. –

Voluntariado europeo en Francia en zona rural

asociacion building bridges

le mans, France

Apply

Project description

Te ofrecemos un voluntariado Francia rural en un proyecto con una organización muy experimentada con una amplia experiencia en SVE y Erasmus+. Europe is looking forward to your contribution! Help develop the cultural openness of young people and participate in their learning of citizenship and tolerance. Support their curiosity on intercultural aspects and encourage them to discover Europe! Become a volunteer in the training center for teenagers and young people in the lovely town of Bernay en Champagne ! The volunteer will work full time with the team of the MFR from Monday to Friday, during the day, on a weekly bases of 30 hours/a week. Sometimes, they might be asked to take part in gatherings with the student that are organized in the evening. From time to time, the volunteer will have the opportunity to work in Le Mans with the other EVS volunteers in order to build a common project. The main missions for the volunteer will be: 1. European cultural openness

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation, pocket and food money, social protection, local transportation covered by the Erasmus+ programme. International round trip to EVS location provided. ACCOMODATION The volunteer will be accommodated in Le Mans, with the other 5 volunteers taking part in this project. They will a house next to the train station in Le Mans, not far from the city center. Each volunteer will have his own room in this big house, and they’ll all share the common parts. There is a garden, the house is fully furnished, and was renovated last year. Accommodation and transportation fees are included

Training during the project

This EVS project will involve 6 EVS volunteers from 6 different European countries. Each one of them will volunteer in one of the 6 local training centers for teenagers from the area of Sarthe, France. The local training centers Bernay welcomes 275 youth, studying two fields: Social and care-based jobs / agricultural education, from age 14 to 25. They all have one week it and one week in traineeships.

Volunteer profile

Living in Spain, being motivated, between 18 and 30 years old, driving license required, interested in youth work, education, europe and intercultural topics. The MFR is located on rural area so the volunteer should have a driving license and be ready to drive every working days to reach the training center (up to 1 hour for a one-way trip: train + car). Candidates should be motivated, ready to work in a team, flexible, creative, openminded, pro-active, dynamic, communicative, and interested in working with teenagers and young people. Previous experiences in teaching

Placement dates

A total of 47 week(s) during the period 20/08/2018 to 15/07/2019

Placement location

Calle Cruzada 3, 1ºD, 28013 le mans
