NOW - Rural Camps EVS for Italian, Portuguese and Spanish people

Team for Youth Association

Baia Mare, Romania

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

Through this project we would like to create new opportunities for 12 youngster from Europe to implement activities in rural areas in Romania. Moreover, we want to create an international environment for the kids from rural school, an environment that we hope to make them more open to new cultures and to make them more interested in finding more about the countries from where the volunteers will come. Not less, we want to give them the power of example, that you can do great things in any place, doesn't matter if is in a high school in the city or a normal school in rural area. All the activities into the project will be done through non formal education methods, as: icebreakers, team building games, name games, social animations. The job of the youth worker will be to assure that the volunteers understood the differences between the formal, nonformal and informal education.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Hosting, rent, utilities, materials for activities covered by project budget. Pre-departure training with the sending and hosting organisation. Pocket and food money - project budget. Transport to and from Romania - in limit of 275 E. The stages are as follows: 1st: 15 August 2018 – 15 February 2019 and 2nd: 15 May 2019 – 15 November 2019. The volunteers of Team for Youth are hosted in rented apartments in Baia Mare. Every flat has a kitchen in which the volunteers will find everything they need to cook their own food.The hosting organization is covering for the costs of all utilities.

Training during the project

The project is divided in 3 parts: The first activity is the one when the volunteers will meet the youth workers from the local community and will participate into different trainings to identify which competences do they need in order to implement the summer camps.The second activity is based on the summer camps in rural areas. Here, the volunteers will have the chance to implement what do they learned.The last part of the project is based on the evaluation and feedback.

Volunteer profile

T4UTH sketched the general features for the profile of the candidates, according to the activities proposed. The candidate should be citixen of Italy, Portugal or Spain, between 18 to 30 years and willing to know other cultures, to work with people from disadvantaged backgrounds, to be trained to grow personally and to learn and teach non-formal methods. It is preferable that the potential candidate can motivate themselves to get involved with T4UTH and have the initiative to organize new activities individually or with an international team.

Placement dates

A total of 26 week(s) during the period 15/05/2019 to 12/11/2019

Placement location

Vasile Lucaciu, 55A, Baia Mare

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Social challenges

Education and training

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 31/03/2019

Project 397: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/8074_en


Go Both Ways

KURO Hradec Králové z. s.

Hradec Králové, Czech Republic

Apply

Project description

The project is a long-term voluntary mobility programme aimed at promoting intercultural dialogue, social and civic competences as well as the European dimension of active citizenship through an voluntary experience of cultural exchange. Voluntary activities will last 10 months each. Project phases are following: - Mobility of 2 Czech volunteers to Italy (Sassari) - Mobility of 2 Italian volunteers to Czech Republic (Hradec Kralove and Kostelec nad Orlici) Project objectives are: - Promote volunteering as an effective pathway to developing social/civic competences, tolerance, understanding, intercultural dialogue representing the cornerstone of an active European citizenship. - Provide a visible testimony to EVS values of intercultural dialogue, diversity, social and civic engagement to local communities and youngsters. - Promote volunteering opportunities among youngsters.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteer will live in a shared apartment (in separate room or shared room with other volunteer of the same gender). Volunteer will receive monthly money for food (90 EUR) and pocket money (150 EUR). Moreover, volunteers will get train and public transport discount card, discount to water pool, city library card, opportunity to use bicycle etc.

Training during the project

• Volunteer will take part in pre-departure training in sending organization (country of origin). • After the arrival volunteer will be given brief training in hosting organization. • Volunteer will also participate in trainings organized by Czech National Agency (On-Arrival training and Mid-Term training). • Volunteer will have an opportunity to participate in Czech/Italian language course (online course or with a teacher in group lessons with other volunteers).

Volunteer profile

The present project foresees two phases: the sending of 2 volunteers from Czech Republic to Italy and the receiving of 2 Italian volunteers to Czech Republic. For Elementary School ZS Hucak and Youth House DDM Kostelec nad Orlici it is necessary to be willing to work with children and youth, because main project activities are related to this target group. For Italian organization MVNGO the main criteria is motivation to work with children and youth, as well as open mind and willingness to assist and contribute to migration/ refugee related activities.

Placement dates

A total of 45 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 30/06/2020

Placement location

Gagarinova 587, 50003 Hradec Králové

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Physical education and sport

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 31/08/2019

The House of the Dolls

Asociation Vasilica

Varna, Bulgaria

Apply

Project description

Are you creative, full of ideas and are you looking for a project where you have a lot of freedom in your work? Then you have found the right project! We are an organization in Varna, Bulgaria. We mainly work with children and adolescents from socially disadvantaged families and ethnic backgrounds. Our goal is to improve the present and future of these children. For this we plan leisure activities and offer the children alternatives that they do not have in their family environment. We here at Vasilica believe that every project can make a big difference in the lives of children. To support us and our dream, we are looking for you!

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will live in a room with a separate room. In the apartment live two people, including common rooms - kitchen, bathroom and toilet. Volunteers receive money for food and pocket money.

If you become a volunteer you will be able to work with disadvantaged children and young people.

Project 399: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/7999_en


EVS in Special social care home in Vilnius for elderly

"Tremtinių namai"

Vilnius, Lithuania

Apply

Project description

Special social care home "Tremtinių namai" is a modern institution the purpose of which is to assure the long-term social care of fully or partially dependent elderly people and to ensure secure and dignified aging. Preference to be accommodated is given to the exiles. Exiles are Lithuanians who were forcefully repatriated to labour camps and Gulags (prison camps) in Siberia by Soviet government. At the moment we have 80 people, aged 66-100. "Tremtinių namai" is located in Vilnius city in a peaceful place surrounded by a beautiful forest and the river Neris, you can reach it with a public transport. "Tremtiniu Namai" maintains an active bond with the local community: with a centre for Art and Education as well as with the people living in the surrounding area.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will be hosted in flat together with other volunteers in Vilnius. Each volunteer will have their own room. A monthly bus card will be provided. Volunteers will receive food and pocket money every month.

Training during the project

The volunteer will have an integration week organised by coordinting organisation. During the volunteery service, volunterers will also have On-Arrival and Mid Term trainings organised by National Agency.

Volunteer profile

Basic requirements - respect for the person, self-motivation in work with retired people, willingness to develop a bond in spite of a verbal barrier, patience, equal attentiveness towards each and every one, initiative (willingness to do something, bringing up new ideas), positive attitude towards the work, concentration on the process rather than the result, ability to do things slow, working according to the persons timing, team working skills.

Placement dates

A total of 48 week(s) during the period 02/09/2019 to 31/07/2020

Placement location

Vilnius

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Social challenges

Placement deadline

Rise Up

Expression o.z.

Spišská Belá, Slovakia

Apply

Project description

Come and join us in Face Club. The main activity of this project is work in the youth centre Face Club. The volunteers will be helpful in all of its activities during opening hours. They will be involved in activities, workshops, creative workshops for children, games of all kinds. Daily work in the “Face club” comprises: - preparing the space of club for daily work and activities (preparing materials, goods, repairing, cleaning) - preparing activities: children’s work (english thursday, sport days, creative days, program during holidays etc.), youth work (traveling evenings, film evenings, inspirational evening, English Thursday etc.), - morning programme at the club or outside the club for school (activities depend on running projects) - cooperation with our partners as needed, - occasional participation in cultural events (after mutual agreement), - participation in projects, activities and events organized by Expression o. z.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accomodation - we provide accommodation in 4-rooms flat near to Face Club, it is flat in family house at first floor, volunteers have their own room, fully equipped kitchen, bathroom, wifi. Food - every month you receive pocket money plus money for food - so you master your money. Transport - with the volunteer we will find the appropriate mode of transport to Slovakia. During EVS we can provide a bicycle for less transport, but it is not necessary within the city.

Training during the project

Volunteers will participate on on-arrival and mid-term training. Besides that they can participate on our trainings for youth - self development. And of course, they will have slovak lessons.

Volunteer profile

Volunteer: - from Portugal and Germany - openminded with enthusiasm - languages: english (basic communication) - some experience in working with children - creative person with new ideas - self-sustaining

Grodek school - sport and educational activities with kids

Primary School in Grodek

Grodek, Poland

Apply

Project description

Within this project we would like to create a space for learning for kids and youth in a primary school center in a rural region to help them to become responsible citizens, respectful of the environment and respected by all. TASKS OF THE VOLUNTEERS: 1. Support in the school club (care centre after formal lessons) by preparation and organizing of sport activities and workshops for kids 2. Assistance in preparation of school feasts and local ceremonies. 3. Organization of language workshops, non-formal meetings and games about their countries, cultures and traditions. 4. Creation of own sport activities 5. Animation of different activities inside and outside of the school (in co-operation with other local institutions)

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will live in the small village Gródek with 3000 inhabitants, in a own flat. Every volunteer has his own room and a kitchen and bathroom the share. In the accomodation the volunteer will find basic equipment (including bed sheet, towels ect.) For food volunteers receive money each month and have to feed himself. Lunch will be offered in the school centre. The next big city (Białystok) city can be reached by local busses during 40-50 minutes. The coordinating organization reimburse local travel costs twice per week.

Volunteer profile

• The volunteer should be interested in work with kids and youth; • The volunteer should be interested in sport and outdoor-activities and need to have the ability to take initiative; • skills in graphic design and making movies/ videos are welcome :) • He/ she should be open to live in a small village (3000 inhabitants). The next big city is far 40 km and can be reached by local busses.

Youth for Youth-The rural area as a field of participation

Asociata Curba de Cultura

Izvoarele, Romania

Apply

Project description

ONLY FOR GERMAN!!! This project aims to improve the level of integration of young people belonging to marginalized groups such as the ones facing economical issues, geographical issues, coming from ethnic, sexual or religious minorities etc. Tasks include: - working with children and youths in creative workshops - organise international events together with the community - Promote volunteering in the extended community of Izvoarele - Provide a framework for peer learning among the international volunteer and local young people; - Increase the sense of tolerance, understanding, solidarity and European Citizenship among the volunteers and the young people in the community by taking part in several different activities, talks, etc. - Creating promotional materials for the area/ community. (Films, brochures...)

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

accommodation in a traditional Romanian house (but with wi-fi :P) pocket money and budget for food bus permits for local transport phone sim cards and monthly credit for it international travel costs up to 275 EUR for Germany complete medical insurance through Cigna Insurrance Plan

Training during the project

- Departure Training in Germany - On Arrival Training and MidTerm Evaluation provided by the Romanian National Agency - induction and orientation training at arrival - education for environment training - basic nonformal learning, group dynamics and basic youthwork - event management and communication techniques - language support - mentor support - coordinator support

Volunteer profile

We are looking for an 18-30 years old volunteer who has: - motivation to live and work in rural area for 10 months - motivation to work with youngsters and children - motivation to do international volunteering - basic knowledge of English both in writing and speaking - interest in learning a different European language

Placement dates

Volunteering at school

Kazlu Rudos gymnasium

Kazlu Ruda, Lithuania

Apply

Project description

Gymnasium provides general education for students at the age of 16-19.The students are taught in multi-class environment by the staff comprising of 69 teachers. A broad and balanced curriculum is offered to all of our students: underpinned by the academic core of subjects (English, Maths, Science, Humanities and Languages), learning is enhanced by the study of the Arts, computing, technology and physical education, offering our students a course of study which prepares them for further education and university. The range of options we provide is as wide as possible so that each student can choose the most suitable orientation within the curriculum. Tolerance development center is aimed at teaching tolerance and respect to others. Also participate in some international projects and campaigns.

Volunteer profile

This organisation is willing to involve volunteers who face situations which make their participation in activities more difficult, from the following categories for different types of project:Geographical obstacles, Health problems, Economic obstacles.

Placement dates

A total of 38 week(s) during the period 04/12/2018 to 31/08/2019

Placement location

Kazlu Ruda

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Education and training

Placement deadline

No application deadline

Project 404: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/7878_en


Let's renovate,garden,facilitate in our hostingcenter of SEM&VOL

Solidarites jeunesses

CADOUIN, France

Apply

Project description

Solidarités Jeunesses is an organisation that works for non-formal education. It runs a 8 small community centres in rural environments and organises short and long-term international workcamps, social integration projects, training programmes and actions for international solidarity. The two main aims are: - to gather people from different culture and social background to participate in social, ecological and cultural development on the local level. - To contribute to the integration of people with fewer opportunities. We believe that cultural exchanges are a key for personal development which truly happens when people are living and working together throught workcamps. Sem&Vol as renovated and mantained the site as an international meeting and hosting center thanks to the collective work of the permanent staff, the international volunteers and the local population.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

It‘s located in Buisson de Cadouin, in the beautiful department of DORDOGNE, in the green center of France. The site includes a house with outbuilding, a vegetable garden, and also other surprises ! It‘s situated in the center of the small village. The volunteers are hosted in the same house, they share the food and the rooms in the mission place, and follow collective life and rules.

Training during the project

You will work about 35 hours per week, the work is varied and you will get the support of the staff. We work on : - Renovation of the buildings - Gardening - Organization and participation in cultural events (in the Center and outside) - Organization and participation in workshops and meetings - Organization and participation on the collective life (cooking, cleaning...) - Hosting groups and individuals (mostly in the summer) - Leading workcamps during the summer, you will receive a training for that.

Volunteer profile

Open to everybody from European Union between 18/30 years old, the driving licence is HIGHLY recommended but what matters the most is the motivation :) ! So if you like MANUAL WORK, NATURE and COLLECTIVE LIFE, or if you're interested to discover it, contact us !

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 01/03/2019 to 29/02/2020

Placement location

6 bis rue du St Suaire, 24480 CADOUIN

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Project 405: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/7843_en


Enhancing employability for nature conservationists - West

Scottish Wildlife Trust

Irvine, United Kingdom

Apply

Project description

This project will work with 10 EVS volunteers from 4 countries (Spain, France, Germany, Hungary) in protecting biodiversity on our nature reserves, broadening experience by offering the opportunity to work on and experience a broad range of habitats across Scotland. Volunteers will also be involved in enhancing access opportunities and raising awareness of Scotland's natural heritage, thus protecting biodiversity by encouraging local communities to value and conserve their local natural resources. We aim to make volunteers much more employable by providing 12 month placements with varied work experience and training. Examples of activities will be: - Meadow management - targeted cutting and raking of site, control of bracken - Control of non-native invasive species – cutting & hand pulling - Peat bog management - removal of scrub and including installation of plastic dams - Woodland management and restructuring - removal of non native species, felling of timber

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

We will rent private accommodation close to the project location. This may be shared with other volunteers. We will provide a monthly food and pocket money allowance for volunteers to purchase their own food. We provide transport from the project team base in Irvine to the worksite & back.

Training during the project

We provide a range of on the job learning opportunities such as: use of tools, working as part of a group, communication, health & safety awareness, aspects of nature reserve management, learning about different habitats, seeing wildlife in Scotland.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for male & female volunteers who are interested in conservation/the environment and who want to undertake outdoor practical work on different nature reserves in West Scotland. A desire to work in the environment would be useful. We are looking for enthusiasm, desire, an easy going attitude and an ability to get on with others.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/03/2019 to 30/11/2020

Placement location

Unit 6-7 Kyle Business Park, Cunninghame Road, KA12 8JJ Irvine

Looking for volunteers from

Germany, Spain, France, Hungary

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Health and wellbeing

Education and training

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 406: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/7842_en


Enhancing employability for young nature conservationists - North

Scottish Wildlife Trust

North Kessock, United Kingdom

Apply

Project description

This project will work with 10 EVS volunteers from 4 countries (Spain, France, Hungary, Germany) in protecting biodiversity on our nature reserves, broadening experience by offering the opportunity to work on and experience a broad range of habitats across Scotland. Volunteers will also be involved in enhancing access opportunities and raising awareness of Scotland's natural heritage, thus protecting biodiversity by encouraging local communities to value and conserve their local natural resources. We aim to make volunteers much more employable by providing 12 month placements with varied work experience and training. Examples of activities will be: - Meadow management - targeted cutting and raking of site, control of bracken - Control of non-native invasive species – cutting & hand pulling - Peat bog management - removal of scrub and including installation of plastic dams - Woodland management and restructuring - removal of non native species, felling of timber

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

We will rent private accommodation close to the project location. This may be shared with other volunteers. We will provide a monthly food and pocket money allowance for volunteers to purchase their own food. Volunteers can take public transport from their accommodation in Inverness to the project team base in North Kessock (near Inverness). We provide transport from North Kessock to the worksite and back.

Training during the project

We provide a range of on the job learning opportunities such as: use of tools, working as part of a group, communication, health & safety awareness, aspects of nature reserve management, learning about different habitats, seeing wildlife in Scotland. There might be the opportunity for more formal certificated skills training.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for male & female volunteers who are interested in conservation/the environment and who want to undertake outdoor practical work on different nature reserves in the North of Scotland. A desire to work in the environment would be useful. We are looking for enthusiasm, desire, an easy going attitude and an ability to get on with others.

EVS for youngsters living in Germany - Kindergarten HU

Lelekter Alapitvany

Veszprém, Hungary

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

Egri Uti Ovoda (Kindergarten) Every child in our kindergarten spends their pre-school years in an emotionally supported carefree environment. This is the place where children can best develop and their personal skills can best evolve in a loving, caring, playful and tranquil environment. Our teaching staff are highly educated and have advanced empathic skills. We pay attention to the children’s individual development and individual skills development, using different methods tailored to their own individual needs and stages of development making sure that the environment best facilitates the evolution of their abilities. Our joint effort aims to bring up well-educated, balanced children in an aesthetic pre-school environment by organizing programmes which highly contribute to the development of their personalities. For more information please contact tekla.gebhardt@jugendwerk24.de

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Will be organized by the hosting organsiation.

Training during the project

Will be organized by the hosting organsiation.

Minimal Lifestyle - EVS Short term in south of France.

Initiative et developpement citoyen

Lastours, France

Apply

Project description

Initiative et Developpement Citoyen is a non-profite cooperative based in a small village in the south of France. Its main activities include an ecologic campsite, open to tourists from April to October, environmental education activities, organic gardening, international youth mobility activities, such as youth exchanges and European Voluntary Service, workcamps, green building, events for local community and much more. It is situated in a very rural area with little connections to closest city (Carcassonne), 18km away from the campsite. he volunteer will support the team on different profiles, from the most easy who can participate and help in everything to the most specialize on communication, promotion, organization of events and entertainment, logistics, setting up and animation of seminars and Workcamp, discovery of environmental awareness and preservation of green spaces etc. Each activitie will be given according to the volunteers goal, which will be setup at arrival.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation, food and transport will be provided to each volunteer by IDC. The cooperative is based in an ecological camping and you will be hosted in the mobile homes. The general shopping for all the volunteer team will be done twice a month by a volunteer who is interested and responsable in purchasing. IDC, moreover, will provide a car. The volunteers can use to go to the nearest city (Carcassonne).

Training during the project

The volunteer will have the occasion to take part in none formal arrival training.

Volunteer profile

The volunteers will be polyvalent in all the activities and they will have an important supporting role: - Taking care of the green spaces, watering plants, maintaining trees and vegetable garden. (2 times per week) - Participation in daily life with the cleaning of the common showers area and cooking for everyone; - Collaboration on party events and green buildings conducted by the structure projects; - Helping to create , manage and distribute information on the organisation. -Taking photos and videos -Fixing bikes -Painitng and renovate wood -Activities with children

Placement dates

A total of 8 week(s) during the period 15/05/2019 to 13/07/2019

Placement location

Camping le belvedère, 11600 Lastours

Looking for volunteers from

Poland, Croatia

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Health and wellbeing

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 15/04/2019

Volunteering project - Let's live Europe in CZ

OKO - vzdelavaci a rozvojove centrum, z.s.

Rychnov nad Kneznou, Czech Republic

Apply

Project description

Project "Let's live Europe" is for 4 motivated volunteers who work together and make value for themselves and for the organization through non-formal education. Project duration: 1 year from October 2018 to Ocotber 2019. Main themes are: Art and culture + Media and communications/Youth information.These will be realised with: 1. Cooperation with high schools in the region 2. Cooperation with Unemployment office, primary schools, municipal office Rychnov and local people. 3. Cooperation with companies in our region. The secondary aims of the project are intercultural education, fulfilling of eight key competences of volunteers and EVS support program ERASMUS+, employment and raising awareness about healthy lifestyle especially for children and youth together with local orienteering Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eFkYGVEmpWk&feature=youtu.be More about project: http://oko-centrum.cz/dospeli-evs-european-voluntary-service-in-oko/ Or contact us :)

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation - the volunteer will be offered accommodation in a single room in a shared flat with other volunteers. Kitchen and bathroom will be shared. The rooms and the kitchen are fully furnished and can be used by the volunteer. Usually two volunteers will stay in one flat - each of them will have his/her own room. The flat is in the centre of our town and it is free. Travel costs to and back of the project is covered. Volunteers will receive table and pocked money.

Training during the project

Volunteers will take part in: On-arrival and Mid-term training organised by National agency in Prague. Making bulletin training and teaching skills training and Czech lessons by OKO centre.

Volunteer profile

Our project is varied and we would like to cooperate with volunteers who are creative, open and willing to work independently. We offer a possibility of personal growth and you can use your ideas, thoughts and abilities. It is also possible to say, the project is suitable for future teachers or young people, whose enjoy teaching and intercultural activities. It is very important also to know, that about 70% of volunteering tasks are activities with children or youngsters. Volunteer's age: 18-30. from EN, DE, SP and Georgia Send us your CV and Motivation letter :) Thank you. Jitka

Project 411: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/7552_en


Let’s fight against isolation and exclusion of the elderly

les petits frères des Pauvres

La Seyne-sur-Mer, France

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

In France, 1 older adult out of 4 is isolated. The phenomenon of isolation is increasing in many countries. The non-profit "Les petits frères des Pauvres" fights against isolation and loneliness amoung the elderly by creating with them a long term relationship based in trust and confidence. In recent years, a new isolation factor is developing: the non-access to new technologies excludes a part of the population from basic services as more and more services are totally online. The main mission will be to reflect with the team on how to help older people to become familiar with digital tools, with the help of new volunteers. The volunteer will also contributes to the core actions of the association: -visit elderly persons at home, -participation in social events, -cultural activities and communication... We want to allow a young European to have a memorable and exciting experience of volunteering within a well-known organization where staff and volunteers work alongside.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Location of accomodation and mission: La Seyne-sur-Mer (8km from Toulon, along the seaside). It is a rather small city, which is busy during Summer but quiet during Winter. The volunteer will have its own appartement in the first floor of a house owned by the organization. He/she receives monthly money for food and pocket money. The organization provides a monthly card for local transportation.

Training during the project

He/She will benefit from a dedicated training during the mission, along with young French volunteers. He/she will take part in On-arrival and Mid-term trainings organized by the French National Agency. Supervision and advices will be provided by experimented staff and volunteers. Conditions will be created to allow the EVS volunteer to fit-in well in its new environment and to get to meet other young people.

Volunteer profile

TO APPLY: 1/ answer this form IN FRENCH: https://urlz.fr/8Gnx ; 2/ send your availabilities for an interview between March 28th and 2nd April at: gaelle.dutordoir@petitsfreresdespauvres.fr. We are looking for a volunteer FROM PORTUGAL, GREECE or SPAIN who: - loves being with older adults, can recognise their value & appreciate their experience - is able to have a conversation in French and has the will to progress (pre-intermediate level) - can demonstrate autonomy/initiative - is open-minded and wants to acquire social, intercultural and personal skills

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/05/2019 to 31/07/2020

Placement location

136 Avenue des Fleurs, 83500 La Seyne-sur-Mer

Looking for volunteers from

Portugal, Greece, Spain

Placement topics

Social challenges

Health and wellbeing

Education and training

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 31/03/2019

Project 412: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/7547_en


Servicio Voluntariado Europeo en pueblo de Austria

asociacion building bridges

aSaefelden, Austria

Apply

Project description

Te ofrecemos esta Plaza de Servicio Voluntariado Austria para participar en un pequeño pueblo. The “Vogelsangschule” is an initiative of some engaged parents who created an alternative school in september 2006 to allow their childen a self-determined learning considering their individual development. The pedagogic background relies on the experiences and studies of Maria Montessori, Maurcio and Rebeca Wild and Jean Piaget as well as new cerebral and neuro-biological studies. We want to offer the children the possibility to learn in their own rhythm in an age-mixed group from 6 to 15 years. Actually we have 10 pupils subdivided into two groups (Primaria I: 6 – approx. 9 years and Primaria II: approx. 9 – approx. 12 years. The following school year we will probably have two children in Sekundaria: approx. 12 – 15 years.) There are two teachers with education and experience in reformative pedagogic.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer should support our team with excursions which will take place once a week, different workshops and other activities. School starts for children at 8:30pm and ende at 1pm. One afternoon the older children have school until 4pm. After the school there will be a brief review (15-30min) and once a week a longer review with the whole team for talking about what happend the week before and preview fort he next days/week.

Training during the project

We would like the volunteer to give our children an insight into his/her country, culture, language, way of life etc. in the way of music, theater, entertainment, pictures, stories to give the children an understanding for mulitculture in our common world, to respect the difference and the speciality of other cultures. What you should bring in: It is important for us that the volunteer is very interested, open and motivated in working with kids and youngsters, and we welcome any kind of creative talent which adds up to our ususal activities.

Volunteer profile

The volunteer should support our team with excursions which will take place once a week, different workshops and other activities. School starts for children at 8:30pm and ende at 1pm. One afternoon the older children have school until 4pm. After the school there will be a brief review (15-30min) and once a week a longer review with the whole team for talking about what happend the week before and preview fort he next days/week. We would like the volunteer to give our children an insight into his/her country, culture, language, way of life etc. in the way of music,

Placement dates

A total of 48 week(s) during the period 01/09/2018 to 31/07/2019

Placement location

aSaefelden

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Voluntariado cultural en Italia: trabaja en un ecomuseo

asociacion building bridges

macerata, Italy

Apply

Project description

Realiza un voluntariado cultural en Italia participando en la gestión de un ecomuseo, ayudando a mantener zonas naturales, organizando talleres y muchas cosas más. – Make and translate informational flyers and tourist material on the Ecomuseo, on the village and building techniques in one’s own language. – Support the management of a biological vegetable garden inside the urban park of Sasso d’Italia. – Develop activities in the Officina Artistica (Artistic Workshop) in the Borgo, where volunteers will create crafted and artisanal works useful to the project. – Maintain green and urban areas in Borgo Ficana. – Support the staff in organising workshops on traditional building techniques using “terra cruda” and straw and in cultural events organised in the Borgo in order to promote it. – Organising workshops for children and/or disabled in the Ecomuseo educational space. Make a “Learning Kit” for children and families visits, supported by the tutor.

Volunteer profile

Se buscan voluntarios/as para un castillo-residencia en Alemania

asociacion building bridges

Rieneck, Germany

Apply

Project description

Voluntariado en Alemania con todos los gastos pagados por el programa Erasmus+ de viaje, alojamiento, comida, transporte y dinero bolsillo en un castillo-residencia. Castle Rieneck is an international education and community centre of the Christian scouts union  Build as a guest house it is able to host groups throughout the year and offers a various educational programs  visitors are mainly school classes, church-related groups, seminars and conferences, families, youth organizations, associations and scouts groups  it offers accommodation and fare for 134 people at a time as well as a camping ground for up to 100 people

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

You will stay within the organization where you will get your own room  breakfast, lunch and dinner will be provided in the castle  if you’re absent during your days off, the meals will be replaces with an appropriated amount of money  BahnCard50: will reduce the price of most train ticket in Germany by 50%  you will be provided with a bicycle from the organization during your stay  Monthly pocket money of 200 €

Training during the project

 38 hours of work per week  Working on weekends is required (therefore you will get appropriated time off in lieu)  Working on public holiday is sometimes required  You will have 24 days of vacation

Volunteer profile

You must: possess good knowledge of the German and English language  … possess a driving license type B  … be able to concentrate and remember things well  … ideally have experience in working with youths  … possess various manual skills  … enjoy working with children and youths (playing, talking, do handicrafts)

Voluntariado en Alemania con todos los gastos pagados por el programa Erasmus+ de viaje, alojamiento, comida, transporte y dinero bolsillo en un centro juvenil located in west Germany in town called Oer Erkenschwick  you will find the essentials for your every day living within the town; the next bigger city Recklinghausen is 15 minutes away  thanks to the railway station, the train will bring you to the city Dortmund within under an hour  extended shopping will be possible in Recklinghausen or Dortmund This opens up the possibility of working with new projects in the summer arrival in August 2018 for 1 year. Program duration and start Projects available for the arrival in September 2018. Salvador Allende Haus is recognized as a community youth organization  The seminar center gives young people the possibility to expand their knowledge and competence in a wide range of fields  Main topics of the educational division include the encouragement of democratic behavior

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Voluntariado europeo Lituania en cuidado de niños

asociacion building bridges

vilnius, Lithuania

Apply

Project description

Place: VILNIUS, LITHUANIA, The Blessed Jurgis Date : from the end of August 2018 till the end of July 2019. Deadline: The selection of candidates we are planning till the 1st of July. “If you wish to work with children then this is a good choice. All dough you have to be very patient, especially in the beginning. It is not only difficult for you to adapt to the situation, but also for the children. Because of this it might be an advance to have some experience from working with children thinking about the fact that it might help you to understand them more, but it is not something that you need to have. What you need is to be open minded, and willing to try to see things from the children’s point of view.

Training during the project

For the selection of the volunteers we will need: – Europass CV with picture (made in the last month) – Motivational letter, writing that your sending organisation will be “Building Bridges”. We ask all candidates to send a specific letter of motivation – why they want to volunteer with us rather than just a general EVS one.

Volunteer profile

1. A work in social center with 6-11 year children. Two day centers for children 6-11 year old, who live in very poor material conditions, have emotional and behavior problems, have learning problems, and need psychological help. The main tasks for the volunteer who will make his EVS with children or young people are: 1. Helping with homework. 2. Participation in and helping to realize all the activities. 3. Organize / helping to organize/ day-activity with local volunteers or workers. 4. Camps and hikes. 5. Creative workshops for children (like handicrafts, theatre, sports, cooking,

You will learn: – Democratic education in everyday life – Learning and teaching with all senses – Self-reflection of you own development – Getting to know a new working environment – Change of roles from learner to educational tutor

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

 You will probably stay in a shared apartment  Keep in mind that travelling time up to one hour from your accommodation to the project might be possible  You are welcome to eat lunch in the school  Monthly ticket for public transportation  Monthly pocket money of 150 €

Training during the project

 39 hours of work per week  Working on weekends is required (therefore you will get appropriated time off in lieu)  Working on public holidays is sometimes required  You will have 30 days of vacation  You will probably stay in a shared apartm

Volunteer profile

Project description

Gran oportunidad de voluntariado ocio y tiempo libre para ayudar los niños y desarrollar todo tipo de actividades al aire libre. Si te gusta pasar tiempo al aire libre este es el proyecto perfecto para ti! We run 3 activities in Oradea: 1.Afterschool program for 6 to 12 years old kids:organise outdoor,sport activities and education for nature(Monday to Friday,6 hours daily) 2.Summer camp (in summer holiday): organise outdoor,sport activities and education for nature(Monday to Friday,6 hours daily) 3.Activities in Kindergarten Joyful Learning: organise educational activities for 2 to 5 years old kids(Monday to Friday,6 hours daily) Tasks of volunteers: – plan, prepare and organize sport and outdoor activities for young people from 2 to 12 years – plan, prepare and organize animation activities (dance, singing, playing an instrument, plastic arts, origami, painting, clay modelling, etc.) – share their experience as EVS volunteers and encourage volunteering among local young

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation – in apartments in Oradea very close to public transportation and shopping areas Renting apartments and all utilities are covered by the Coordinating organization WIFI is available Food – volunteers receive an amount of 120 Euro/month for food at the beginning of each month Pocket money – 60 Euro/month International transport – maximum covered according to rules of Erasmus+ (Germany – 275 Euro Spain – 360 Euro) Local transport – we cover a monthly pass which allows transport with all local buses and trams. We cover medical insurance via CIGNA.

Training during the project

The trainings provided by National Agency of Erasmus+ in Romania – respectively On Arrival Training and Mid Term Evaluation

Volunteer profile

Project description

Od října 2019 nabízíme mladým lidem z Česka účast na jednoletém dobrovolnickém projektu se ve spolku Vertriebene – Integration – Verständigung e. V. ve Stuttgartu v rámci programu Evropského sboru solidarity. Jsme skupina křesťanských spolků, která se snaží oživovat německo-česko-slovensko-polské sousedství, podporovat společné vztahy se zeměmi jižní Evropy a z křesťanského hlediska se zasazovat o sjednocenou Evropu. Enhancing employability for young nature conservationists - SW

Scottish Wildlife Trust

Castle Douglas, United Kingdom

Apply

Project description

This project will work with 10 EVS volunteers from 4 countries (Spain, France, Hungary, Germany) in protecting biodiversity on our nature reserves, broadening experience by offering the opportunity to work on and experience a broad range of habitats across Scotland. Volunteers will also be involved in enhancing access opportunities and raising awareness of Scotland's natural heritage, thus protecting biodiversity by encouraging local communities to value and conserve their local natural resources. We aim to make volunteers much more employable by providing 12 month placements with varied work experience and training. Examples of activities will be: - Meadow management - targeted cutting and raking of site, control of bracken - Control of non-native invasive species – cutting & hand pulling - Peat bog management - removal of scrub and including installation of plastic dams - Woodland management and restructuring - removal of non native species, felling of timber

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

We will rent private accommodation close to the project location. This may be shared with other volunteers. We will provide a monthly food and pocket money allowance for volunteers to purchase their own food. We provide transport from the project team base in Castle Douglas to the worksite & back.

Training during the project

We provide a range of on the job learning opportunities such as: use of tools, working as part of a group, communication, health & safety awareness, aspects of nature reserve management, learning about different habitats, seeing wildlife in Scotland.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for male & female volunteers who are interested in conservation/the environment and who want to undertake outdoor practical work on different nature reserves in South West Scotland. A desire to work in the environment would be useful. We are looking for enthusiasm, desire, an easy going attitude and an ability to get on with others.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 10/03/2019 to 28/02/2020

Placement location

Unit 3 Station Road, DG7 1LA Castle Douglas

Looking for volunteers from

Germany, Spain, Hungary, France

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Health and wellbeing

Education and training

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 421: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/7460_en


Non-formal hand in hand with formal

ZKMŠ Litija - Youth Center Litija

Litija, Slovenia

Apply

Project description

In our organization, Public Institute of Culture, Youth and Sports Litija, unit Youth Center Litija, we have prepared a project which is already accepted, in cooperation with 4 local primary schools. In this project we want to host 5 EVS volunteers from different European countries for 12 months. The main responsibility of volunteers will be participating in educational process and all other activities in primary schools and assistance at various school subjects. 4 days per week volunteers will work in primary school, one day per week and during school holidays they will work in Youth center Litija. School work will include assistance with classes of foreign language (English, German, Spanish), physical education, art classes, geography, and history. According to volunteers' interests and expressed desire they will be able to participate in other school subjects.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will live in an apartment at a local "farm". The apartment is fully equipped and provides all you need for a normal life (your own room, equipped kitchen, bathroom, internet connection). In Litija there are many options for food. There are many different restaurants, where you can find a varied selection of food. Also in every store in Litija is possible to shop for food and drink at favorable prices, which volunteers can freely prepare at home. There is no local transport in the area. We will provide bicycles for your transport.

Training during the project

Volunteers will have mentors and coordinators in both organizations - Youth center Litija and from primary school. Mentors will take care of your faster integration into the local environment and regularly monitor the achievement of learning outcomes. Coordinators will plan your work (In cooperation with you of course) and help you with setting the learning outcomes. You will also attend two training sessions for volunteers – on arrival training and mid-term evaluation - organized by the Slovenian National agency.

Volunteer profile

We would like to host volunteers who enjoy working with children and young people. It is an excellent opportunity for students of pedagogy, social sciences, youth workers. It is important that the participant is openminded, communicative and relaxed when working with children. It is an excellent opportunity for all who would like to work in the field of formal and non formal education. It is also important that volunteers have interesting hobbies related to music, sports, art, community, nature... We are looking for the volunteer from Germany.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/10/2018 to 30/09/2019

Placement location

Ponoviska cesta 12, 1270 Litija

Looking for volunteers from

Germany

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

Life & activities on an eco-community farm - long stay 2019

Hastekasen farm association

No city, Sweden

Apply

Project description

Life and activities on an eco-community farm - long stay. Start: 15th march 2019 Only way to be part of this project is to send a MAIL to the organization. CLICKING apply here, will lead to nothing. Hästekasen Farm and adventure center in Sweden is looking for volunteers to be here 6 months (maybe more): Only: Polish, Hungarian, German, Spanish and Italy, France, Greece Living simple, more sustainable with less "carbon footprint". Living creative and productive and less consuming. 6 hours work every day on an isolated farm in nature. 7-20 other people here. No smoking, very little meat and only people that fits into the VISION will be accepted. Practical work: digging, hammering, carrying, lifting, cutting, barking, mixing, sorting. We are also looking for people with leadership ambitions. Entrepreneur ambitions. https://goo.gl/forms/yILkLsq2j8Jw1aRA3 https://www.facebook.com/groups/hastekasen/ http://www.hastekasen.se/Ekoby/evs.html

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Food and accommodation is paid for. Only vegetarian food, very little sugar. YOU have to bake. Private room, but simple, maybe caravan, maybe ants and spiders. Only dry toilet. Not too many showers or laundry. No wifi. Travel is paid for, up to a limit. Not easy to leave the farm, 95% of the volunteers prefer to stay all the time at the farm. 150 euro in pocket money every month. Looking for people that like camping and being in nature.

Training during the project

Non-formal, meaning you have to learn what you can by taking part in the work. You will, if you pay attention, learn how to build your own house, how to create your own food, take control over water and sewage and live simple and more sustainable. We will do a Mini-music festival. We (you) will do a LARP event (www.lajv.info) If you really want to learn Swedish and can study independently, we will support you, if you stop studying, we stop giving you lessons. There will be some workshops on leadership, community building and decision making.

Volunteer profile

Practical work on an isolated farm in nature. No smoking, No meat, no wifi, no mobiles 1. Experience of manual/practical work. 2. A proven desire to live simple and close to nature. 3. Communicative skills, be able to express their opinion and needs. (English). 4. Ambitious with a work ethic, preferably quick learners. 5. A motivation to do lifestyle change and reduce our “footprint”. 6. Exploring self sustainable lifestyle. People with work ethics, entrepreneurial ambitions, leadership ambitions will be prioritized. Answer this: https://goo.gl/forms/yILkLsq2j8Jw1aRA3

Placement dates

A total of 24 week(s) during the period 01/03/2019 to 31/12/2019

Placement location

Hästekasvägen 6, Uddevalla, Sweden, 45196 No city

Looking for volunteers from

Germany, France, Spain, Hungary, Greece

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Health and wellbeing

Employment and entrepreneurship

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 30/04/2019

Waldorf School in Palermo (Italy)

Libera Scuola Waldorf di Palermo

Palermo, Italy

Apply

Project description

The association Libera Scuola Waldorf di Palermo, is a non-profit organisation, founded in 1986, to which teachers and parents belong with the aim to promote the pedagogy and the educational activities based on anthroposophy, and to implement other educational activities open to everybody, particularly children and young people who live in disadvantaged conditions. Volunteers will support the staff in following tasks: - support to kids with learning difficulties or psycho-physical disabilities - support in the school kitchen - participation in artistic workshops (music, painting, theatre…) and leisure activities for kids - preparation and participation in cultural events organised by the school and open to the local community - promoting volunteering through events in local schools or youth centres (with InformaGiovani) - writing on the volunteers’ blog (InformaGiovani)

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteer will be hosted in shared room with another volunteer in shared flat. Flat is equipped with all needed (water, electricity, heating, furniture). Free wi-fi is available. Accommodation is located in city centre, and well connected with public transportation. Local transport tickets will be provided. Food will be provided through monthly cash allowance. Volunteers will receive monthly pocket money of € 150,00. Travel costs are covered on the basis of E+ distance band (between 500 and 1999 Km, up to € 275; from 2000 to 2999 Km up to €360; from 3000 to 3999, up to € 530).

Training during the project

On arrival training and Mid-Term Evaluation organised by Italian National Agency.

Volunteer profile

- aged 18-30 years - strong motivation for working with disabled child - ability to team working - creativity, proactivity and flexibility - artistic (e.g. music, painting, drawing) skills are welcome - curiosity toward Steinerian pedagogy - little knowledge of Italian language is welcome

Placement dates

A total of 44 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

Via Filippo Parlatore, 20, 90145 Palermo

Looking for volunteers from

EVS in Madeira (Portugal) FOR UK PARTICIPANTS ONLY

AAUMa

Madeira, Portugal

Apply

Project description

Our partner in Portugal, Associação Académica da Universidade da Madeira (AAUMa), aims to represent and support all the students of the University of Madeira in Funchal, involving them in the promotion of different cultural activities. The placement would be ideal for a volunteer who is interested in a career in heritage and culture preservation, tourism, event management, marketing, languages and retail. Volunteer’s Tasks Among others, the Erasmus+ volunteer will be involved in following activities: Volunteers will be involved in the promotion of Madeira’s natural and cultural heritage Volunteers will be involved in a range of activities with children, young people, adults and the elderly Volunteers will work with local young people who face social isolation Volunteers will work on inter-generational projects Volunteers will prepare and perform guided tours Volunteers will collaborate in the development of exhibitions and musical events as well as the marketing

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

This project is based in Funchal on the Portuguese island of Madeira. As this is an EVS project, volunteers will receive insurance, accommodation (university residence in Funchal), food, local transportation and pocket money. Travel to/from Madeira will also be funded.

Training during the project

Volunteers will receive pre-departure training, as well as an induction on arrival in country. Volunteers will also have access to other training opportunities throughout the placement, as well as ongoing support and supervision with the host and sending organisations.

Volunteer profile

The placement would be ideal for a volunteer who is interested in a career in heritage and culture preservation, tourism, event management, marketing, languages and retail. Ideally, the volunteer will have some knowledge and experience of marketing, culture and heritage and working with children and young people.

Let's live Europe in rural area - France /3 - EU only

Maison Familiale Rurale Sarthe

Le Mans, France

Apply

Project description

http://europe-en-sarthe.eu/esc-in-france/ : All the informations (infopack and application form) are here Your application won't be considered if not complete with the application form + CV + video. Europe is looking forward to your contribution! Help develop the cultural openness of young people and participate in their learning of citizenship and tolerance. Support their curiosity on intercultural aspects and encourage them to discover Europe! Become a volunteer in the training center for teenagers and young people ! This project will involve 6 volunteers from 6 different European countries. Each one of them will volunteer in one of the 6 local training centers for teenagers from the area of Sarthe, France. The local training centers are called: the “Maisons familiales rurales” or MFR. The main missions will be: 1. European cultural openness 2. Educational and pedagogical mission 3. Joint project with the 6 volunteers in the 6 training centers …

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will be accommodated in Le Mans, with the other 5 volunteers taking part in this project. They will live in a house next to the train station in Le Mans, not far from the city center. Each volunteer will have his own room in this big house, and they’ll all share the common parts. There is a garden, the house is fully furnished, and was renovated last year. Accommodation and transportation fees are under the responsibility of the host organization. Money will be given to the volunteer every month to cover food expenses, as such as pocket money.

Training during the project

Volunteers will participate in the arrival and mid-term meetings.

Volunteer profile

Living in the EU, being motivated, between 18 and 30 years old, driving license required, interested in youth work, education, europe and intercultural topics, willing to learn french. The MFR is located on rural area so the volunteer should have a driving license and be ready to drive every working days to reach the training center (up to 1 hour for a one-way trip: train + car). Candidates should be motivated, ready to work in a team, flexible, creative, open-minded, pro-active, dynamic, communicative, and interested in working with teenagers and young people.

Voluntariado social en Irlanda

asociacion building bridges

galway, Ireland

Apply

Project description

Interesantísima oportunidad de voluntariado social Irlanda . Como voluntario en esta organización de acogida podrás ayudar a los más necesitados y aprender a desenvolverte en inglés sin ningún problema. ¡Sigue leyendo para saber cómo aplicar! The project will start from September 1st. As you know we require a minimum of 9 months and a maximum of 12 months commitment from volunteers. Ideally we would like to start volunteers in September but October is fine too. We will interview next year for participants for the second year. provide services to people who are homeless or at risk of becoming homeless in Galway. Volunteers work alongside qualified members of staff in our residential services and their role is to support staff in maintaining the high standard of care provided by the organisation. Working alongside qualified members of staff will allow volunteers to gain an insight into the area of Social Care. The volunteering opportunity is particularly beneficial to volunteers

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

3.2 The participant shall receive a financial support from EU funds for 12 months. The total amount for the mobility period shall be determined by multiplying the number of days/months of the mobility with the rate applicable per day/month for the receiving country concerned. In case of incomplete months, the financial support is calculated by multiplying the number of days in the incomplete month with 1/30 of the unit cost per month.

Training during the project

Each volunteer is provided with a placement agreement as part of their induction when they arrive. This agreement outlines the volunteers’ responsibilities and the terms and conditions of the placement.

Volunteer profile

We encourage and include each volunteer in different activities with the view to giving them a wider range of experiences. Previously we had a volunteer with an interest in journalism and writing and they were encouraged to facilitate a group with clients to produce a Galway Newsletter which shares information with everyone in the organisation. This involved teaching clients basic computer skills. For the volunteer this was an opportunity to develop their own skills, gain confidence and share their skills with others.

Placement dates

A total of 39 week(s) during the period 01/09/2018 to 31/05/2019

Placement location

galway

Project description

We need volunteers for these different target groups. You can choose one of 4: 1. A work in social center with 6-11 year children. Two day centers for children 6-11 year old, who live in very poor material conditions, have emotional and behavior problems, have learning problems, and need psychological help. The main tasks for the volunteer who will make his EVS with children or young people are: 1. Helping with homework. 2. Participation in and helping to realize all the activities. 3. Organize / helping to organize/ day-activity with local volunteers or workers. 4. Camps and hikes. 5. Creative workshops for children (like handicrafts, theatre, sports, cooking, arts, teaching a foreign language, etc.)

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

A work in social center with 12-18 year teenagers and youth. These activities are offering assistance to young people (12 to 18 years) from difficult social background. They have various difficulties: at school, behavior and emotional problems, psychological and life crises.

Training during the project

The main tasks for the volunteer who will make his EVS with preschool age children: 1. To help teachers to prepare everything for activities, sleeping, eating, etc. 2. Look after kids: help them get dressed, when going out – dress up, help to eat, to make their beds etc. 3. Play with children. The playing is the main form of learning, comunicating and living for children, so it is very important to interact with them in playing. 4. Create and do different art activities (drawing, music, theatre, etc.)

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The coordinating and receiving organizations will provide accommodation for each participant in a flat shared by two people of the same sex. The flat includes a kitchen, a bathroom and two rooms. Everything needed can be found in each flat. Special needs of the participants will be taken into account. An amount of 100 EUR and a pocket money of 120 EUR will be given at the beginning of each month to each participant. The volunteers will also benefit of a monthly local transportation pass each month.

Training during the project

Volunteer profile

Training during the project

The participants will achieve new knowledge, skills and competences, selfsufficiency, multicultural understanding and appurtenance to the European community. • Some of the direct results of the project will be an improved and well maintained internet site for touristic information for the town of Shipka and around, organized exhibitions and events, improved appearance and functionality of the demonstration ecological gardens, better waste management for Shipka, improved awareness and available information for the eco- trail and proposed protected territory.

Volunteer profile

Volunteer for the international exhibition of Jewish Culture

Social Institution "Sveikatingumo idėjos"

Marijampolė, Lithuania

This placement has expired, you cannot apply.

Project description

There were large Jewish communities living and working in European countries, acting together with locals in cultural, social, economic and political spheres forming the common vision of state. It was not meant to come true because of ostracism, repressions implemented by totalitarian regimes, the consequences of which are still felt in Europe. The aim of this project is to create opportunities for a debate on history of Jews and their ostracism under the totalitarian regimes from national perspectives, to share approaches and strengthen historical remembrance so as to inform the present.

Volunteer profile

The volunteer should work in Lithuania (Marijampolė), leader's organisation. He/she will have to work with information, process photos and other information, making design for visuals, compose handbook, the appearance of the project. He would volunteer by the start of the project for 3 month to help with design and visuals. The volunteer will be accommodated in rented room (as the experience from EVS), having the access to organisation's intellectual and material resources.

Placement dates

A total of 12 week(s) during the period 01/11/2018 to 31/03/2019

Placement location

J. Basanaviciaus sq. 8, LT-68308 Marijampolė

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

EVS: activities for disadvantaged youth - only for female volunteers

La Strada

Medicina, Italy

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

The no-profit Association La Strada has been working for fifteen years in the territory of the municipalities of Medicina and Castel Guelfo in the province of Bologna, in a social work especially to help children in conditions of social difficulties. Over the years, the work has expanded, involving young people and adults, especially immigrants. The activities of the association begin with the daily work, each afternoon, of specific and personalised support open to boys and girls reported by the school and local social services. Afternoon activities include educational and entertainment moments with various themes that are being developed over the entire year. The association is also helping the learning process of Italian for immigrants (children, young people, adults) who have recently arrived in our country and we started an information point about job research or other bureaucratic issues.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The accommodation will be in a shared flat for the 2 volunteers.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for a pro-active, dynamic and motivated young person. We are looking forward flexible volunteers willing to work with disadvantaged young people. At least basic level of Italian is needed.

Medicina

12 month EVS at the Munich Film Society

Münchner Filmwerkstatt e.V.

München, Germany

Apply

Project description

We aim at developing and supporting the independent film scene in Munich and in Germany alltogether. For this reason we offer trainings, workshops and seminars about film given by prominent German and international professionals who share their knowledge with our visitors. You will be taking part in our weekend trainings and will be the teaching assistant, so to speak. You will ensure the workshop goes smoothly. Anything from making coffee through taking care of technical problems will be a huge part of your job with us. Most of your working time will take place on weekends due to the fact, that our workshops are on the weekends. We can also offer you a huge playing field in terms of starting your own little projects. Apply with a motivation letter following this questionnaire: www.muenchner-filmwerkstatt.de/europaeischer-freiwilligendienst and send a CV, photo and motivation letter to efd@muenchner-filmwerkstatt.de

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

We will give you your food allowance and you can decide what to spend it on. We will organize your accommodation for the first 2-3 months aas well as pay for it for the whole year, but we advise you to find a flatshare with German flatmates for two reasons: You will have even more opportunities to improve your German; you will not be alone and will instantly have a social safety net. We can provide you with either a public transport ticket OR a bike. Munich is very bike friendly and wonderful to explore on two wheels.

Training during the project

You will take part in all our educational opportunities, since this is your main working fiels. You will leave with a thorough understanding of filmmaking and lots of contacts in the film making scene in Munich and Germany.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for inspired and motivated young people with some interest in filmmaking and cinematogrpahy and the willingness to learn a lot about the field. We are also looking for people who like organization, office work and communicating with others. You should like to take matters in your own hands and not be scared to get involved.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/06/2018 to 30/09/2020

Placement location

Rosenheimer Straße 145, 81671 München

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Let's renovate,garden,facilitate in our hostingcenter les Bateleurs

SOLIDARITES JEUNESSES LA MAISON DES BATELEURS

MONTENDRE, France

Apply

Project description

Solidarités Jeunesses is an organisation that works for non-formal education. It runs a 8 small community centres in rural environments and organises short and long-term international workcamps, social integration projects, training programmes and actions for international solidarity. The two main aims are: - to gather people from different culture and social background to participate in social, ecological and cultural development on the local level. - To contribute to the integration of people with fewer opportunities. We believe that cultural exchanges are a key for personal development which truly happens when people are living and working together throught workcamps. La Maison des Bateleurs has renovated and mantained the site as an international meeting and hosting center thanks to the collective work of the permanent staff, the international volunteers and the local population.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

It‘s located in MONTENDRE, in Poitou Charentes, in the west of France. The site includes a big main house with outbuilding, a vegetable garden, and also a bamboo forest ! It‘s situated in the center of the small village. The volunteers are hosted in the same house, they share the food and the rooms in the mission place, and follow collective life and rules.

Training during the project

You will work about 35 hours per week, the work is varied and you will get the support of the staff. We work on : - Renovation of the buildings - Gardening - Organization and participation in cultural events (in the Center and outside) - Organization and participation in workshops and meetings - Organization and participation on the collective life (cooking, cleaning...) - Hosting groups and individuals (mostly in the summer) - Leading workcamps during the summer, you will receive a training for that.

Volunteer profile

Open to everybody from European Union between 18/30 years old, the driving licence is HIGHLY recommended but what matters the most is the motivation :) ! So if you like MANUAL WORK, NATURE and COLLECTIVE LIFE, or if you're interested to discover it, contact us !

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 01/03/2019 to 28/02/2020

Placement location

4, avenue onda, 17130 MONTENDRE

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Education and training

Let's renovate, garden, facilitate in our Castle, LE CRENEAU!

SOLIDARITES JEUNESSES LE CRENEAU

MONTCOMBROUX LES MINES, France

Apply

Project description

Solidarités Jeunesses is an organisation that works for non-formal education. It runs a 8 small community centres in rural environments and organises short and long-term international workcamps, social integration projects, training programmes and actions for international solidarity. The two main aims are: - to gather people from different culture and social background to participate in social, ecological and cultural development on the local level. - To contribute to the integration of people with fewer opportunities. We believe that cultural exchanges are a key for personal development which truly happens when people are living and working together throught workcamps. Our Center, a castle, was built in 1873 . Since1993 Le Creneau has renovated and mantained the castle site as an international meeting and hosting center thanks to the collective work of the permanent staff, the international volunteers and the local population.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

It‘s located in Montcombroux Vieux Bourg in the Allier department, Auvergne region in the center of France. The site includes a main house, the two small towers, a farmyard, a vegetable garden, some othsome other workshops and it is sorrounded by the forest. It‘s a very isolated place, situated 6km from the “bigger“ village with shops. The volunteers are hosted in the same house, in shared room in the mission place, and following collective life and rules..

Training during the project

You will work about 35 hours per week, the work is varied and you will get the support of the staff. We work on : - Renovation of the buildings - Gardening - Reforestation and forest upkeep - Organization and participation in cultural events (in the castle and outside) - Organization and participation in workshops and meetings - Organization and participation on the collective life (cooking, cleaning...) - Hosting groups and individuals (mostly in the summer) - Leading workcamps during the summer, you will receive a training for that.

Volunteer profile

Open to everybody from European Union between 18/30 years old, the driving licence is HIGHLY recommended but what matters the most is the motivation :) ! So if you like MANUAL WORK, NATURE and COLLECTIVE LIFE, or if you're interested to discover it, contact us !

Placement dates

A total of 47 week(s) during the period 07/01/2019 to 06/12/2019

Placement location

Chateau des prureaux;, 03130 MONTCOMBROUX LES MINES
