Youth and the City

Stowarzyszenie Projektów Międzynarodowych "INPRO"

Rzeszow, Poland

Apply

Project description

Please read the call before applying. We are looking for 4 volunteers from EU to work with us for 6 months starting in October 2019. The volunteer can get involved in following activities (according to your interests): - organizing workshops for local youth - hosting open events such as country presentations or language cafe's, - visiting schools and promoting Erasmus Plus program, or delivering workshops about culture, human rights, youth opportunities, volunteering - hosting a radio show about youth, culture and education - helping us with administrative works in the office - working with media, photography, film (we own semi-professional equipment: camera, tripod, monopod, lenses etc) - writing articles, taking pictures of our events, - leading our social media, creating promo videos, movie recaps from our projects etc - initiating own projects/events/activities

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will receive: - 120 euro of pocket money per month - 150 euro for food per month - monthly pass for public transportation - a bicycle :) - reimbursement of travel up to Eras mus Plus limits The volunteers are accommodated in 2 room flat at Broniewskiego Street in Rzeszow, sharing a room with a person of the same gender, having access to common kitchen and bathroom. There are 4 volunteers in total living in the flat. The flat is allocated 25 min walk from the office based in the city center in Rzeszow, the capital city of Podkarpackie Province in South-East Poland.

Training during the project

The volunteers will take part in trainings organized by the Polish National Agency. Locally, we provide trainings during orientation week on organizational culture, job-related works etc. Besides that, volunteers are welcome to join our trainings and workshops we organize through Erasmus Plus projects in Rzeszow. Before applying, please get to know our organization and the city of Rzeszow. Visit our website, get to know our activities - it's important for us to know you are aware of our profile. Check out our promo video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YDo8MLb2PX

Volunteer profile

We are looking for motivated candidates passionate about working either with people or with media and technologies. Age or background is not relevant. The call is open to those with initiative to come up with own ideas, motivation to contribute to organizational development of INPRO. Apply via Corps or send us your CV and cover letter to elsa@goinpro.org (preferred). The call is NOT OPEN for TURKISH candidates (we have another volunteering project with Turkish partner already)

Creative summer

Association for promotion of IT, culture and coexistence (Association IKS)

Petrinja, Croatia

Apply

Project description

This project has the purpose to engage children and youth in fun, educational activities that are implemented in a multicultural team and promote youth mobility. Activities of this volunteering project, enriched by the talents and creativity of volunteers, will be creative and educational workshops, a multicultural festival and celebration of European diversity and positive migration aspects. This project will also involve summer games and volunteer actions in 7 rural primary school communities. These are disadvantaged populations living in areas with poor infrastructure, lowest indexes of development in Croatia and rising poverty. International volunteers working together with children, parents and other community members will create opportunity to exchange experiences, learn about different cultures and lifestyles and develop new skills but also new project ideas for community development.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will live in an apartment in which they will share a room with other volunteer/s. They will share the kitchen and bathroom. All volunteers will stay in the city centre, a maximum of 15 minutes walk from our organisation. In their apartment they will have the internet, all appliances, washing machine, central heating. Volunteers receive pocket money and food allowance and all living expenses as well as project related travel expenses are paid for from the Erasmus+ project funds.

Training during the project

All volunteers will receive induction and orientation upon arrival. This includes details about Association IKS, their project, the community, Croatian regions and culture. They will also learn about different beneficiaries of project activities, how to work with them and volunteering standards, rights and responsibilities. Volunteers will also attend different workshops within the organisation and community to make possible their own personal and professional development.

Volunteer profile

Young people from Italy, BiH, Spain, Hungary, France, with a thirst for learning and personal development, with empathy for diverse community issues and needs will suit this project. We focus on youth with fewer opportunities, unemployed, economically, geographically, socially or otherwise disadvantaged persons aged between 17 and 30 years regardless of ethnic background, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, level of education, religion or any other personal aspect. They must be registered on the European Solidarity Corps database.

Placement dates

A total of 9 week(s) during the period 01/06/2019 to 31/07/2019

Placement location

Turkulinova 9, 44250 Petrinja

Looking for volunteers from

Hungary

Project 438: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/6790_en


TENDER3

KENTRO EIDIKI PAIDEIA

Livadeia, Greece

Apply

Project description

“EIDIKI PAIDIA” CENTRE is a Day Care Center for mentally disabled persons. It was established on 1994 and in 2004 was moved to a new and hospitable place that offers all the necessary space and comforts for daily activities. The working place is located 3km far from Levadia city, capital of Viotia Prefecture. The working place is divided into 3 large rooms and an office. The Day Care Center is attached to the Chronically Diseases Infirmary building of the Holy Metropolis of Thiva & Levadia. Two rooms are used as activities playrooms and the third is the rest room. Rooms facing the NW side and there is direct access to the backyard. The Center operates same as school timetable from 08:00 to 15:00 weekdays only. Activities finish everyday at 14:00 and there is administration work until 15:00.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers accommodation will be in a multi-room rented apartment (1 person per room), with fully equipped kitchen, bathroom, hallway, common sitting room located in Levadia city. Food is provided at the Center's facilities cooked by professional cooks everyday and a food allowance is given for breakfast and extra food upon receipt. Transoprtation to and from the Center is offered free of charge by the host organization.

Training during the project

Volunteers will learn how to apply practical techniques on ergotherapy and will acquire and share knowledge and skills in social services. The role of volunteers is important because they will add important value to the activities of our Day Care Center, due to the new perspectives and opinions offered to our specialized personnel and apply to their daily tasks, while at the same time they learn new things by directly acquiring dexterities that will be recorded in the Youthpass at the end of their service.

Volunteer profile

-18-30 years old; -capable to create activities with simple materials by using hands; -open minded, in basics self-independent, responsible and with a strong motivation for youth work and intercultural communication with mentally disabled persons; -motivated to learn basic Greek phrases in a short time; -playing an musical instrument will be mostly appreciated; -interested in mental-health and (ideally) some experience/qualifications related to disability; -able to communicate in English.

Placement dates

A total of 17 week(s) during the period 01/03/2019 to 30/06/2019

Placement location

Tzimeika, Livadeias, 32100 Livadeia

Looking for volunteers from

Germany

Placement topics

Health and wellbeing

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 439: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/6663_en


#activeEVS for 21 volunteers

Stowarzyszenie POLITES

Szczecin, Poland

Apply

Project description

Our long term EVS project is concentrated on developing 8 key competences while doing various volunteer activities like working with kids, supporting the work of Regional Volunteer Centre and local nongovernmental organizations. During this time you will be presenting your culture, country, ideas and creative approach in organizing activities for kids, youth and local community. You will have a chance to participate in many workshops that will help you develop the skills in working with kids, will show you the basics of management, Social Media, idea of being a volunteer. Those workshops will prepare you to work in the chosen area, which could be kindergarten, middle school or NGO office – depending on the specific project.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Every volunteer who is taking part in the long term EVS in Szczecin is supported with pocket and food allowance money (not less than 180 Euro). It means that for your stay you will receive the money for your expenses that you can use to buy the food for yourself, travel around, buy new clothes or visit an art gallery. You will be accommodated in rented flat with the access to kitchen and bathroom. All the kitchen appliances like forks, spoons, plates, pots etc. will be there also. As your Coordinating Organization we will buy a local transportation ticket for the time of your stay.

Training during the project

Trainings provided by Polish National Agency: - on arrival training; - mid-term evaluation training. Trainings provided by Coordinating Organization - Stowarzyszenie POLITES: - games and plays for children; - key competences; - human rights workshops; - pedagogy.

Volunteer profile

If you're motivated and open for new experiences, ready to join our colorful team and work in an international group - you're the perfect candidate :) Do not hesitate and apply now! We're looking for 21 volunteers in total.

Placement dates

A total of 43 week(s) during the period 01/09/2018 to 30/06/2019

Placement location

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

“If you wish to work with children then this is a good choice. All dough you have to be very patient, especially in the beginning. It is not only difficult for you to adapt to the situation, but also for the children. Because of this it might be an advance to have some experience from working with children thinking about the fact that it might help you to understand them more, but it is not something that you need to have. What you need is to be open minded, and willing to try to see things from the children’s point of view.

Volunteer profile

For the selection of the volunteers we will need: – Europass CV with picture (made in the last month) – Motivational letter, writing that your sending organisation will be “Building Bridges”. We ask all candidates to send a specific letter of motivation – why they want to volunteer with us rather than just a general EVS one.

Furthermore, our goal is to organize and support national programs of the partner municipalities, heritage protection activities of the environment and organizing summer events, festivals, concerts, theatrical performances, exhibitions in cooperation with the local municipalities. Through our activities we try to develop solidarity and promote tolerance and understanding among young people in different countries. Our priorities are respecting cultural diversity, fighting against racism and xenophobia. By facilitating joint activities of young people from different cultural, ethnic

Task of the mentor is to be a help to the volunteers and especially to the one that he was assigned to. If during the project the volunteer needs any kind of support (doctor appointment, visit the bank or just go for a drink or a simple cup of coffee, the mentor is there for you). 2. Language support: Volunteers will participate in the Greek language course, once per week by a Greek teacher.

EUROPEAN COMMUNITY SUPPORT SERVICE

OFENSIVA TINERILOR

ARAD, Romania

Apply

Project description

The main activities of the project will be 2 EVS youth mobilities. In each of them, 10EVS volunteers will be hosted in Arad. The project aims to ensure the well-being & integration of marginalised young people while also providing personal development opportunities for young people in Europe. To achieve this, volunteers will work directly with the target group: persons with visual & mental disabilities, persons coming from a disadvantaged background and people belonging to different ethnic groups. 1. ASPIS volunteers will be working for integrating persons with low mental disabilities. 2. Arad Blind's Association volunteers will be offering services to persons with visual impairments like: guiding, helping them in their daily living, organising different workshops; 3. Gulliver kindergarten volunteers will offer educational activities to youngsters.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation: - rented apartments, 2 persons in the same room, bathroom, kitchen with everything needed for preparing food, washing machine, refrigerator, wifi; Food: - volunteers will prepare their own food Monthly allowance: - they will receive a monthly allowance of 180 euros (food+pocket money) Transportation: - international travel for the begining and end of stage is fully covered withing the budget set by the European Commission for such projects; - local transportation is fully covered by the coordinating organisation.

Training during the project

Volunteers will benefit from: - introductory training arranged by the coordinator upon the arrival of volunteers; - on-arrival training arranged by the National Agency of Romania; - non-formal education training arranged by the coordinator through a certified trainer; - mid-term evaluation meeting arranged by the National Agency of Romania.

Volunteer profile

- Between 18-30 years old; - Resident of the sending country; - Interested in the theme of the project; - Willing to participate in an non-formal intercultural experience; - Having difficulties in choosing a career; - NEET youngsters; - Without employment options due to lack of practical experience; - Youngsters from: Italy, Spain, Macedonia, Estonia and France.

Placement dates

A total of 30 week(s) during the period 01/05/2019 to 01/12/2019

Looking for volunteers from

Project description

European Voluntary Service in Luxemburg – September 2019 – July 2020 We are currently looking for 2 volunteers from Germany to be placed in the Institute St. Joseph in Betzdorf, Luxemburg., to work with children and youth with special needs Hosting organisation: Institut St Joseph, PIC 948063451, website: http://www.elisabeth.lu/Institut-St-Joseph.1650.0.html?&L=1 (deutsch) Das Institut St. Joseph in 6832 Betzdorf (Luxemburg) ist eine Betreuungseinrichtung für Menschen mit intellektuelle Beeinträchtigung. Wir verfügen über 14 Wohngruppen mit zusammen ca. 110 betreuten Menschen, über einen umfangreichen Tagesbereich mit Werkstätten für unsere Betreuten und über ein breites Dienstleistungsangebot. Im Projektzeitraum von 10-12 Monaten können drei Volontäre / Volontärinnen in unserer Kindergruppe für 3-15jährige, in unserer Jugendgruppe für 15-21 jährige und im Tagesbereich eingesetzt werden. Die Ausarbeitung eigener Projekte ist sehr willkommen.

Sept – 02. July 2020. We are looking for Young people aged 18 to 30. Those who are creative, active, communicative, willing to work with children and young people. With lots of ideas on how to work with young people and how to create activities that appeal to young people. Those who like sports, active lifestyle and also video filming and editing. With English language skills at a conversational level. In youth center everyday life volunteers will have a chance to carry out their oun activities, their initiatives. GIOVANI DI VALORE - Polha

POLHA

VARESE, Italy

Apply

Project description

Ina project o 5 evs volunteers we offer a position for a MALE VOLUNTEER in a sport association for disable people. Polha is affiliated to the major disabled people sport federations such at national and international level, and the association collaborates with other local and european NGOs on projects regarding the topic of sport in general and sport for disable people( technical development of sports for disabled people, healthy and sport life style) but is also involved in projects regarding raising awareness and disability in general Taking part to a the daily life of POLHA association especially in supporting disable people during the training in different sports ( handbike, sledgehockey, swimming, table tennis). In the office work volunteers will work on promotional activities, social networks communication and organisation of sport and communication events.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers are hosted in a fully equipped house, with two bedrooms, living room, kitchen and bathroom. The house has also a garden. The volunteer will share bedroom with another volunteer. The house is 5 minutes walk far the associations place. A food allowance is provided. A monthly ticket to travel in Lombardy 7 day a week is provided.

Training during the project

On arrival training is provided by coordinating organisation about the project aims and the overall community partnerships. Volunteers will also be given all the instruction regarding EVS principle and functioning in our organisation. Training on working with vulnerable adults is provided to all our volunteers by staff members in the hosting organisations and volunteer will be trained on the job with staff help . Volunteers will be given informal learning process support through the active participation to a monthly 4 hours group trainings on YOUTHPASS certificate.

Volunteer profile

We look for a male volunteer, able to speak a little Italian language. No experience with disability or sport is required. We want to enconter people willing to understand the value of solidarity within the daily efferts of volunteers group, able to create good feeling with people and willing to contribute to reaching the aim of the association

Project description

In a project of 5 evs in 5 different hosting project, we offer a position in a daily centre for elderly people ( 20 users, 1 educator, 4/5 social workers, volunteers), you work with social workers, educators, physiotherapists in activities aiming at social inclusion of elderly people and the maintenance of skills and ability. Tasks are : supporting the activities such as workshops ( creative art-lab, dance or sports, supporting during lunch in distributing dishes, helping some users, cleaning the room). Another part of work is training activity for evs volunteers ( italian language course, youthpass process or intercultural learning meetings ). Promotion of Evs in schools and with young people

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers are hosted in a fully equipped house, with two bedrooms, living room, kitchen and bathroom. The house has also a garden. The volunteer will share bedroom with another volunteer. Local transport for project activities are covered by the hosting organisation

On arrival training is provided by coordinating organisation about the project aims and the overall community partnerships. Volunteers will also be given all the instruction regarding EVS principle and functioning in our organisation.Training on working with vulnerable adults is provided to all our volunteers by staff members in the hosting organisations and volunteer will be trained on the job with staff help .Volunteers will be given informal learning process support through the active participation to a monthly 4 hours group trainings on YOUTHPASS certificate.

Volunteer profile

All people aged 18 - 30, who have a genuine interest and passion for working with people with disabilities and or elderly people. No professional skills and experience is required, however it is recommended that volunteers have an experience in similar sector or providing support in personal life in order to have a realistic idea of working with people with disabilities. As we work with vulnerable adults, the volunteers should be kind, patient and compassionate. hobbies and skills that they are willing to share with the residents, such as art, music, cooking, drama, sports.

Project 448: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/6282_en


Sustainable Living Lab

Ananda Gaorii Ashram, Farm and Learning Center

Vig, Denmark

Apply

Project description

This is an experiential learning project focusing on spirituality, sustainability and community. It is located at Ananda Gaorii Ashram, Farm and Learning Center one hour drive from Copenhagen. Ananda Gaorii offers retreats and workshops on the topics of yoga and meditation, health, personal growth, organic food growing, alternative economic models and other topics associated with personal and social change. We also host volunteers from around the world seeking a more meaningful and sustainable way of life. We have an organic bakery and grow organic veggies for market and for our own use. Yoga and meditation are part of our daily routine and we follow a vegetarian diet. Volunteer tasks include learning and practicing yoga and meditation, garden work, renovation and construction, cooking and cleaning, event organizing and hosting, organizing community activities, group facilitation, social media promotion, guiding guests and short term volunteers and regular household chores.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation is provided in shared rooms and dormitories depending on the number of volunteers present. Vegetarian food is also provided. Public transport is available to the nearby town of Vig and to Copenhagen. Note: The food we eat is a combination of food we grow, food we purchase and food we collect from what the supermarkets throw away. Collected food is a significant part of our diet. It enables us to support a larger number of volunteers and it helps to reduce food waste. Please consider the diet carefully before applying, especially if you are used to eating meat.

Training during the project

Volunteers will be given guidance and coaching in yoga and meditation and those who have an interest and aptitude can also take yoga teacher training. The Bio-Intensive system of organic food growing is taught as well as workshops on Permaculture and various DIY topics. Weekly classes on yoga philosophy are offered and volunteers will learn various practical skills such as vegetarian cooking, group facilitation and handyman skills through participation in the daily work of the Ashram.

Volunteer profile

Looking for volunteers with a strong interest in yoga & meditation & willing to practice on a daily basis. Cigarettes, drugs & alcohol not permitted. Would like volunteers with an interest in community living ready to take an active part in community life. Practical skills: gardening, carpentry, car/bike/appliance repair, music production, cooking. Social skills: group facilitation, organizing youth activities, social media advertising, fund-raising, project management & volunteer management. Teaching ability: any of above, NVC, conflict resolution, yoga, permaculture, etc., Art/music talent.

Placement dates

A total of 40 week(s) during the period 01/02/2019 to 31/12/2019

Placement location

Holbækvej 56, 4560 Vig

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Health and wellbeing

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 449: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/6200_en


The impossible is often the untried

Krugovi, Centar za edukaciju, savjetovanje i humanitarno djelovanje

Zagreb, Croatia

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

Searching for 1 more volunteer! :) Project duration: end of March 2019-end of September 2019 The project will encourage voluntary experience for young people providing support for vulnerable groups: for people who suffer from malignant diseases, elder and disabled people, socially vulnerable, as well as the introduction in the work of humanitarian associations. The aim of the activities is to improve skills and competencies of volunteers, through practical engagement and non-formal learning methods. Through activities we will encourage the volunteers to participate in community, to develop empathy for the socially vulnerable groups and to promote social inclusion and solidarity. The activities are: Support for socially excluded groups, charitable work, working with children in primary schools, creative work, Croatian language support, supervision and coordination and encouraging your learning process.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

All activities will be held in the Zagreb, capital city of Croatia, where will also be the accommodation for volunteers ( 2 participants sharing 1 room ). It is located in the northwest of the country, along the Sava river, at the southern slopes of the Medvednica mountain. Zagreb is the headquarters of the economic, political and cultural life in Croatia. The city is broken into 17 urban districts. - monthly food money, monthly pocket money, accommodation and utilities covered - every volunteer gets bicycle + bus/tram tickets

Training during the project

You will be included in two training in Croatia, organised by our National Agency: On Arrival and Midterm EVS training. In Circles we are organizing: - Education and supervisions for volunteers working with vulnerable people - Regular team meetings, meetings with mentors - Regular consultations with supervisors and coordinators - Additional support; psychotherapy meetings for personal and professional growt This project gives you opportunity for improving your social, communication, presentation and digital competences, cultural awareness, tolerance, solidarity.

Volunteer profile

We are searching for 1 more volunteer, between 18-30 years old, male or female, young people who are highly motivated to work with people under risk: people who suffer from malignant diseases, elder and disabled people. - Basic knowledge in English - Ability to live with at least three flat mates - Willing to share a room with one participant /same sex/ - Haven’t participated in long-term EVS project before - You have no Criminal Record - You don’t have chronic diseases and/or serious psychical/ physical illness - Plus is if you had experience in working with elder/disabled/sick people

Placement dates

A total of 24 week(s) during the period 01/03/2019 to 30/11/2019

Placement location

Kombolova 13, Utrina, 10020 Zagreb

Looking for volunteers from

Greece, Spain, France, Poland

Placement topics

Social challenges

Health and wellbeing

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 31/03/2019

Project 450: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/6185_en


ALL FOR ONE, ONE FOR ALL. TAKE A STEP FOR REFUGEES

Aufnahmezentrum für Asylbewerber "St. Elisabeth-Haus" des Belgischen Roten Kreuzes

Büllingen, Belgium

Apply

Project description

The asylum centre ‘St. Elisabeth-Haus’ (Belgian Red Cross) located in a small village in the German speaking community of Belgium, hosts up to 216 residents from different cultures, nationalities and religions. The mission of the Red Cross is the administration of the centre as well as the support of asylum seekers during their asylum procedure. The staff members perform several duties; that is to say social and medical support as well as entertainment in addition to answering day to day queries. The support of asylum seekers is going to be also the main task of the volunteers, i.e. they will perform determined duties in the basic daily work (provision of meals, distribution of bed linen and hygiene articles, etc.). Furthermore, they will organize and perform various leisure activities or even long-term projects, in which the asylum seekers strengthen their persona as well as their independence and autonomy. The volunteers will get a lot of space for their own projects, too.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation: an apartment will be rented by the hosting organization as to meet the requirements presented by the volunteers during their period at the project. Food: The volunteer will receive on a monthly bases a food allowance stipend. Furthermore, there is a kitchenette in the volunteer’s house where he/she can prepare the food. The volunteer is also allowed to eat at the Centre's canteen during the working period. Transport arrangements: the volunteer will receive train and bus tickets valid for travelling across all Belgium.

Training during the project

In addition to pre-departure training, on-arrival training, and mid-term training, the volunteers will have several opportunities to take part in trainings provided by Belgian Red Cross for his staff and internal volunteers, as well as to have the possibility to become more active and implement their own projects and ideas. In addition the volunteer will have a Mentor who will work as help, as to tackle any issues present during the period of their placement, and to follow the possibilities of non-formal learning.

Volunteer profile

Concerning the selection of the volunteers, a basic knowledge of one of the two languages of the project (French or German) is mandatory. One criterion is especially important: The volunteers have to be open-minded regarding other people and foreign cultures. In addition, they should have a particular interest in the topics refuge, asylum, migration, conflict and emotional management, education and/or pedagogy. Regarding placement in a rural area it is very important that the volunteer is in possession of a driver's license and can really practice the driving.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/09/2018 to 31/08/2019

Placement location

Manderfeld, 350, 4760 Büllingen

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Reception and integration of refugees and migrants

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 451: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/6180_en


EVS in VU Museum of Zoology

VU Museum of Zoology

Vilnius, Lithuania

Apply

Project description

Volunteer will have a pro - active role, assisting the staff of the Museum team in the individual work of grouping, inventory and data entry to the database of scientific collections. As well the volunteer would carry out individual projects, for example, could create virtual exhibition of selected animal group. The help of volunteers is expected in the following fields: • To be a helper of the scientists in the grouping of scientific material (Vertebrates or Invertebrates); • Looking after scientific material after primary fixation at the time when they have be to prepared for long-term storage; • To be a helper of the Museum staff in the inventory, documentation, digitization and data entry to the Museum database and Lithuanian Integral Museum Information System; • To help create dynamics of occupation of free time activities for visitors of VU Zoological museum, through the realization of games and group work, thematic conversations, practical tasks or projects;

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will be hosted in flat together with other volunteers in Vilnius. Each volunteer will have their own room. A monthly bus card will be provided. Volunteers will receive food and pocket money every month.

Training during the project

The volunteer will have an integration week organised by coordinting organisation. During the volunteery service, volunterers will also have On-Arrival and Mid Term trainings organised by National Agency.

Volunteer profile

There are no specific requirements for the volunteers: generally they must be self-motivated, willing to take new challenges, and open to working with people of all backgrounds and cultures, dynamic, versatile, good mood, flexible, with self-initiative, experienced in museum or scientific (biology) or designer-artistic or the media work, willing to take on new challenges, with ability to manage and solve working tasks in a creative way; enthusiastic to participate in the project; mature to work and to relate to a group of Museum community and willing to develop activities with responsibility.

Placement dates

A total of 44 week(s) during the period 30/04/2019 to 29/02/2020

Placement location

Vilnius

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

EVS in VU Botanic garden

Vilnius, Lithuania

Apply

Project description

The Botanical Garden is interesting as an object of heritage – a part of an outbuilding of an old estate that has survived in Kairėnai, as well as the old park with ponds. Volunteer will have taken care of plants (flowers, wooded plants, lawns, garden plants, etc.). There are many simple works that volunteers are awaiting – to hoe and to rake soil, to remove weeds, to water plants, to cut of old branches or flowers and inflorescences after blooming, after short training - volunteer can start to propagate plants, to prune woody plants, to help in date collection (for example to make photos for database). Second area where volunteers can do a lot is dealing with visitors or with social network accounts of Garden. There are possibility to help organize events (different technical activities – to prepare rooms, leaflets, information tables etc.), to help with guided tours in English, to help educators (assistance during Lithuanian educations, creation of new activities etc.).

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will be hosted in flat together with other volunteers in Vilnius. Each volunteer will have their own room. A monthly bus card will be provided. Volunteers will receive food and pocket money every month.

Training during the project

The volunteer will have an integration week organised by coordinting organisation. During the volunteery service, volunterers will also have On-Arrival and Mid Term trainings organised by National Agency.

Volunteer profile

There are no specific requirements for the volunteers: generally they must be self-motivated, willing to take on new challenges, and open to working with people of all backgrounds and cultures, dynamic, versatile, good mood, flexible, with self-initiative, experienced in being in nature (scouting, hiking, few horticulture experience) is advantage.

Placement dates

A total of 31 week(s) during the period 31/03/2019 to 31/10/2019

Placement location

Vilnius

Looking for volunteers from

EVS in Vievis Day Care Center

Vievis Day Care Center

Vievis, Lithuania

Apply

Project description

The day care centre is situated in Vievis, in a 2 floor house with a small garden, a lawn and a small playground for children to play sports. The target group of this centre are children from the social risk families, suffering from domestic violence in the families or alcohol abuse or having social problems. The main role for the volunteer: 1) to participate in the daily activities of the day centre; 2) to help to organize children free time occupation (different games, workshops, events); 3) presentation about the country of the volunteer, 4) to take part in development and realization of the day centre projects and own initiative projects: volunteer will have a possibility to teach children in an interactive and non formal way, if he or she has specific knowledge in some kind of sphere (music, art, sport, language skills) 5) participate in the educational process (participation in the learning seminars – organized by the HO and CO and National Agency.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will be hosted in flat together with other volunteers in Vilnius. Each volunteer will have their own room. A monthly bus card will be provided. Volunteers will receive food and pocket money every month.

Training during the project

The volunteer will have an integration week organised by coordinting organisation. During the volunteery service, volunterers will also have On-Arrival and Mid Term trainings organised by National Agency.

Volunteer profile

The applicants will have to be open-minded, motivated and interested in the topics of the project, such as: - Youth and non-formal education - Languages and communication - Team-working and working with people from different backgrounds - Adaptation and flexibility in order to participate in specific projects. Through doing outdoor, creative activities, communicating with youngsters, “just being” with them in non-formal space. Volunteer will learn how to make contacts and how to communicate with youngsters with fewer opportunities.

Placement dates

A total of 45 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 30/06/2020

Placement location

Vievis

Looking for volunteers from

The volunteer will learn how to work in a team, work with kids and teenagers, and how to solve various problems. The main tasks of the volunteer at to make sure, together with the worker of the center, that the children have various activities (every day after lunch till 6 pm.), learn new things, and most importantly, increase children's motivation for any activity. Besides the serious stuff, club also organizes various celebrations, parties and other fun stuff for the kids, so the volunteer will have an opportunity to organize some kind of celebration for children. Grigiškes day center is a great place for proactive person and the one who is seeking to realize his ideas.

EVS in Vilnius Balsiai School

Vilnius Balsiai school

Vilnius, Lithuania

Apply

Project description

Volunteer will have a pro-active role, assisting the school team: teachers, social pedagogue, speech therapist and special pedagogue in the individual work with children that have learning difficulties. As well the volunteer would organize the post school activities of non-formal learning. There are a lot of organized activities for pupils after classes; so the volunteer would join the educators to create the activities for children. The help of volunteers is expected the following fields: • To help create dynamics of occupation of free time activities during the breaks or free lessons, trough the realization of games and group work, thematic conversations; • Looking after children after classes at the time when they have to wait for transportation home; • To be a helper of the special pedagogist in the individual help of the students that have learning difficulties; • To be a helper of the social pedagogist in the individual or group work of pupils that have behaviour problems.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will be hosted in flat together with other volunteers in Vilnius or in a privat house with family, who lives very close to the school. Each volunteer will have their own room. A monthly bus card will be provided. Volunteers will receive food and pocket money every month.

The volunteer will have an integration week organised by coordinting organisation. During the volunteery service, volunterers will also have On-Arrival and Mid Term trainings organised by National Agency.

There are no specific requirements for the volunteers: generally they must be self-motivated, willing to take on new challenges, and open to working with people of all backgrounds and cultures, dynamic, versatile, good mood, flexible, with self-initiative, experienced in children work, willing to take on new challenges, with ability to manage and solve conflicts in a creative way; enthusiastic to participate in the project; mature to work and to relate to a group of children/youngsters and willing to develop new activities with sense of responsibility.

SUMMERCAMP for POLISH volunteers

Alce Nero soc.Coop.soc.Onlus

Mantova, Italy

Apply

Project description

The project will involve 2 volunteers from the first week of June 2019 untill the middle of September 2019 (3 months). The main activities that volunteers will support will be: Reception of children, Workshops (painting, clay processing, theater, music, languages, photography,..), Physical activity, Outputs and special events; every year the coordinator of the summercamp decide a theme to be dealt with children (feelings, family, integration,..) so as to have a guiding thread of the path and every week the activities are planned. The volunteer will support activities linked to preventing distress and promoting well-being (i.e. workshops art, sport, culture, health, intercultural workshop), and foster games, excursions, specific courses. They can also support the educators with children and youngsters with handicap or fewer opportunities, taking after them through specific educational actions.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will be hosted in a flat provided by cooperative Alce Nero and settled in Mantova. The flat has double bedrooms, a kitchen facilities, a living room, a bathroom with two shower, wi-fi and washing machine. They will share the flat with volunteers engaged in others projects. The rule’s flat will be presented on arrival.The volunteers can go to work on foot, by byke or by bus (payed by Alce Nero), while travel costs for free time will be on charge of the volunteers.

Training during the project

During the project the volunteers will attend the ON ARRIVAL training manage by National Agency and all supervision meeting manage by Cooperative Alce Nero.

Volunteer profile

The volunteers would be: POLISH nationality intererested into activities flexible and extroverted and smart interested and sensitive towards educational and social issues able to speak a little bit of italian language

Placement dates

A total of 13 week(s) during the period 01/06/2019 to 31/10/2019

Placement location

Via Leopoldo Camillo Volta 9/A, 46100 Mantova

Looking for volunteers from

Poland

Voluntariado europeo en ayuntamiento de Sliven (Bulgaria)

asociacion building bridges

sliven, Bulgaria

Apply

Project description

Te traemos este interesante voluntariado europeo de la mano de uno de nuestros mejores socios en Bulgaria, del Ayuntamiento de Sliven, con un proyecto sobre juventud en cooperación con otras comunidades locales. En años anteriores ya hemos enviado voluntarios y actualmente tenemos ya uno allí. With the “Different but together” we want to bring a European dimension to the partnership between the youth community and executive institutions working with children and young people different from others and bring them into the formation of adequate youth policy, subservient to European norms and morality of respecting differences. We will show tolerance, respect and support, perceiving and regarding others as unique with its flaws and differences. hrough the participation of volunteers from Croatia, Portugal, Romania, Spain will encourage social inclusion and well-being of young people, promote intercultural skills and increase the capacity of the organization

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

According to the rules of Erasmus + each volunteer will receive individual support (91.75 euro per volunteer per month (1101 euro per one year.)AccommodationVolunteers will live in two flats (bedroom, living room, bathroom) in the city center of Sliven. Both are really close to the building of the Youth House. Volunteers will have wi-fi internet connection – fully covered by the organization. The travel conditions according to European distance calculator Maximum costs per country Spain 360 euro

Training during the project

pre-departure training provided by Building Bridges on-arrival training mid-term training trainings privided by coordinating oranisation

Volunteer profile

Participation in training seminars – intercultural communication, language skills, teamwork, development of ideas for activities; • Presenting of the project, the activities and the EVS volunteers to the local media; • Introduction to and communication with: – the media, interviews, participation in TV shows;

Placement dates

A total of 51 week(s) during the period 10/05/2018 to 01/05/2019

Placement location

sliven

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

An EVS Bridge 3

Tokat Provincial Directorate of Youth Services and Sports

TOKAT, Turkey

Apply

Project description

Our young people will come together with other young people from abroad especially young people from Europe and this will help them to have the idea of European and Global citizenship. And we also plan to get European youth together with our youth living in the city to gather them around on mutual goals. We plan to host volunteers from our partners as EVS volunteers too. And we plan to enhance their education, that is why we are applying for this project. Our main target group is young people with fewer opportunities and our activities are designed to include these youth group. In the end of activities these young people with fewer opportunities will develop theirselves in social and cultural way. Their employability will be developed as well as they are going to develop their personal and social skills. Our project aims to create international mobility and mobility awareness within the young people in long term we are aiming to contribute youth participation.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Tokat Provincial Directorate of Youth Services and Sports will provide accommodation. The bedroom will be placed in Tokat. In the accommodations provided by Tokat Provincial Directorate of Youth Services and Sports the volunteer will live in single bedroom with fully equipped kitchen, toilet, and laundry machine. For four months the volunteer will have 320 Euro food + 364 Euro pocket money. Flight will be reimbursed by 360 Euros.

Training during the project

Coordinating organization Guarantees that the volunteer will have linguistic support: online or if it’s not available provide budget to the receiving organization so that language support can be provided. If the language support is not on-line it will last up to 30 hours. The classes are given in groups together with other volunteers. EVS is not a language course, so the language support provided is initial level to help volunteers in their integration in local community and in their project. If the volunteer already have knowledge of Turkish it will be to provide advance Turkish support.

Volunteer profile

We generally look for volunteers who are dynamic, creative, sociable, patient and that know what they want to do. You have to be motivated, willing to learn, able to work in team, be sociable, flexible and creative, we would like to host people with interesting and own ideas and open to different cultures. Strong motivation, willingness to see and to do something new, curiosity about the world and other cultures are welcome.

Placement dates

A total of 17 week(s) during the period 01/04/2019 to 30/07/2019

Placement location

Yeni Mah. GOP Bulvari No: 3, 60100 TOKAT

Looking for volunteers from

Spain, Italy

Placement topics

Creativity and culture

Physical education and sport

Placement deadline

No application deadline

He/she will have meetings with the staff and other volunteers, to know, what is going on in the centre, to discuss difficult situations and to create new projects. The role of the volunteer in this centre has two characters: assistance in the activities, organized by the other people and embodying own ideas the volunteer may have (musical, artistic skills are strongly recommended). It is very important that the volunteer would be interested in open youth work and responsibly take his/her role, initiative is very welcome.

Unimpeded Smile 8

Foundation of Education, Culture, Health, Sport for the Disabled

Ankara, Turkey

Apply

Project description

Social exclusion is one of the most important problems of disabled people, these individuals are living away from the society and are put into passive life. If these individuals are given the opportunity, they can perform their skills in society. Opportunities to be recognized will enable these individuals to trust themselves and become active citizens. At the same time, they will have the opportunity to communicate with people from different social and cultural backgrounds who will make the cultural transmission. We will receive 10 volunteer, 5 disabled volunteers and 5 companions from Azerbaijan with 2 weeks periods.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will be accommodated on the second floor of the same building of the foundation. S/he will share the room with other volunteers during his/her stay. Accommodation is fully equipped. Your workplace is also your living place. So, you will not need transport to come to your place and go back. During the week, we have common lunch. Rest of time you can prepare your own meal in the kitchen equipped with every need.

Training during the project

Training related to the activities of the project.

Volunteer profile

An individual with at least 40% of re

Overcome borders - Grenzen überwinden

Pfarre Hildegard Burjan

Vienna, Austria

Apply

Project description

We are a Catholic parish in the 15. district of Vienna. We regard our parish work as not limited through any culture, religion, party or nationality. Especially as believers we experience working with all people of good will as an enrichment. One main working area is in various children and youth groups. In our parish there is the catholic kindergarten “Maria Salesia” which has explicitly the aim to provide children lots of social tasks, values and skills in order to develop a strong and healthy personality. Apart from this structured youth work our organisation is an important link in a system of open youth work in our area. Additionally our organisation takes part in the struggle against poverty and social exclusion, with a project LeO, where poor people can come once a week and buy for the symbolic prize of 3,5 Euro food and can get social expert advice. An extra benefit is the possibility for volunteers to gain experiences in the intercultural and interreligious dialog.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accomodation is in the second floor of our parish center in a single room. You share kirchen and bathroom with three other people. Food: During the week we have common lunch, that we take from the kindergarten. Rest of the time you can prepare in your kitchen. Local transport: Your work place is also your living address. Nevertheless we pay you local transport for Vienna. We also pay german courses at university.

Training during the project

Of cours all the trainings of EVS. Additionally waht you need for your work.

Volunteer profile

dedicated, able to work in team and on your own

Placement dates

A total of 54 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

Vogelweidplatz 7, 1150 Vienna

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Education and training

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 26/04/2019

Sign in / Join

Project 464: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/5685_en


Xperience volunteering in a small town nearby the polar circle

Vevelstad Frivilligsentral (Vevelstad Voluntary Central)

Vevelstad, Norway

Apply

Project description

"The only limitation is your own imagination" Come and help us out on the voluntary central, we’re in need of some extra hands and brains! The main goal will be working with and for the local youth and organizing different kind of activities, both indoors and outdoors. Support the local youth council in their political work and environmental projects. You will also be working with and for the elderly and immigrants. We can offer a wide range of possibilities for personal growth! Learn the Norwegian language and the way of living in one of Norway’s smallest municipalities located way up north. The program covers all your expenses! We have a facebook-page called EVS Vevelstad, where you can send a message or post questions. We are looking forward to future volunteers and welcome you with warm hospitality.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation will be with a host family. It will be in or nearby the town center.All activities will take place here. Transport to/from work will be arranged. Accommodation, food, pocket money and transport arrangements will be covered by European Solidarity Corps funding.

Training during the project

You will get to know other European volunteers, discuss about the project with them and become friends. Education in the Norwegian language will be provided. You will get to learn practical life skills. You will be mostly learning by doing.

Volunteer profile

You must be at least 18 years old and you need to have an accredited sending organization! Are you enthusiastic, open minded and creative? Can you take a leading role but also work together with different kind of people? Do you enjoy wild nature and have no problems with sometimes harsh weather-conditions? Would you like to really get to know the rural Norwegian culture? Do you have questions? Don't hesitate, please contact us, or APPLY by sending e-mail with the letter of motivation and the CV! With kind regards, Michelle frivev@vevelstad.kommune.no

Placement dates

A total of 44 week(s) during the period 01/08/2019 to 31/07/2020

Placement location

Industriveien 7, 8976 Vevelstad

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Social challenges

Reception and integration of refugees and migrants

Citizenship and democratic participation

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 14/07/2019

SKY IS THE LIMIT 2019 / Summer Animator

Fundacja Rozwoju Międzykulturowego EBU

Minsk Mazowiecki, Poland

Apply

Project description

This is a group activity focused on intercultural education, social animation and youth empowerment. It also aims at developing intercultural dialogue and understanding, as well as promoting positive thinking and tolerance. The project consists of two parts. In the first month the volunteers play the role of intercultural animators during the summer camp for children. They have the opportunity to create and implement their own ideas for creative and educative free time activities for local kids including intercultural education and communication in foreign languages. In the second part of the project the group designs and implements social animation events for the whole local community or selected groups with the theme “Happy Minsk”. The actions depend on team’s preferences and interests. The project is very intenstive and requires high level of commitment and responsibility from the volunteers.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers are hosted in the volunteers' house shared amongst several young people of different cultures. Each volunteer receives food allowance which helps him/her take care of individual dietry needs. There is no need for public transport as Minsk Mazowiecki is a small town. When the activities require the volunteer to commute to the working place, the hosting organisation provides the reimbursement of any transportation expenses.

Training during the project

The hosting organisation provides support and training in the area of social animation, intercultural education, communication and non-formal methodology. Depending on the volunteer's interest the organisation may also offer training or practical experience in other areas such as coordination, administration, public relations or organisation of bigger events.

Volunteer profile

Strongly motivated to contribute skills and to interact with the community; passionate about working with children of different ages; open to work in varied environments; interested in proposing and implementing new initiatives; creative and well-organized. Non-EU countries are not eligible.

Placement dates

A total of 8 week(s) during the period 18/06/2019 to 17/08/2019

Placement location

ul. Piękna 26, 05-300 Minsk Mazowiecki

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

"Deep Roots" short-term eco project (15.05 - 12.07.2019)

Youth Development Center-Mutual Aid

Kazanlak, Bulgaria

Apply

Project description

This short-term EVS project enables volunteers to participate in our organization’s activities and to cooperate with other partner institutions to organize thе local ecological festival “Kazanlak” (7th edition). The project will take place in Kazanlak (Bulgaria), during its famous Festival of Roses, and it will be dealing with: cleaning the area of the river Starata Reka and the park Tyulbeto, workshops for recycling and composting, renovation of YDCMA mosaic and an old picnic area, meetings with environmental tourist and accredited EVS organizations, shooting and screening of eco movies, making of a summer movie, creating trash art items, organizing concerts with young talents. The project gives an opportunity to young people from different countries to realize their common values by creating different works of art and embody in them their own cultural identities and backgrounds.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The hosting organization will provide a fully equipped private house in Kazanlak, shared among the participants of the project. Participants will be responsible for cleaning the space. The financial support in form of pocket money for the mobility period has a maximum amount of 177 EUR for 59 days which include 2 days of travel. The amount of money for food is 220 EUR for 59 days. Money for food will be separated into equal parts for each week and given weekly to all volunteers together. Volunteers can buy food and cook together. Every participant has a limit of 290 EUR for travel costs.

Volunteer profile

The project is open to young people aged between 18-30 years old, from any Programme Country. Volunteers participating in the project should have a strong interest in ecology, art and creativity, and be ready to work as photographers, scriptwriters, film directors, writers and artists.

Placement dates

A total of 8 week(s) during the period 16/05/2019 to 12/07/2019

Placement location

Iskra 22, 6100 Kazanlak

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Project 467: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/5489_en


Great 10 months with wonderful children from "difficult" families

ELEOS Prawoslawny Osrodek Milosierdzia

Bialystok, Poland

Apply

Project description

With their work the volunteers support 6 daily activities carried out. Each of them is attended by a fixed group of around 15 children from disfunctional families, (alcohol, domestic violence, poverty) in the age of 6 to 14 years. On Mondays the whole group of volunteers (6 people) meets together and prepare a plan of activities for all week. Tuesdays and Fridays every volunteer works individually in his allocated facility. This time is dedicated to the realization of own ideas in the chosen field (e.g.theatrical, photographical or circus workshops). The choice of working area depends on the volunteer’s personal interests, knowledge and abilities. On Wednesdays and Thursdays volunteers work in couples, carrying out the workshop according to the scheme prepared with the whole group. The workshops deal with such issues like: cuisine, traditions, national holidays. The volunteers realize their ideas with assistance of the educator.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers receive money for a ticket to Poland (Warsaw) and a bus ticket for the route Warsaw – Bialystok. Coordinator wait at the bus stop in Bialystok, bring the volunteer to his new flat and help with the arrangement there. Volunteers are accomodated in apartments (2-3 peopel together. The payments of rent is carried out by ELEOS. Each of them have their own, fully furnished room. The kitchen is equipped too. In flats are washing machines, too. We assure the participants public transportation tickets. We also pay for groceries and pocket money from the first day on.

Training during the project

On Arrival Training in Warsaw Mid Term Training in Torun

Volunteer profile

Our Volunteers are poeple whose main requirement is the development in a broadly understood context. They should furthermo aim to raise their level of professional qualification and social abilities. We seek the persons who plan to link their professional future to social work or pedagogical work. Contact with children from disfunctional families demands a lot of psychic toughness, patience, comprehension and empathy are very important, too. We count on the participating person’s communicational and group working abilities, because they will work in international team.

Placement dates

A total of 43 week(s) during the period 16/09/2018 to 14/07/2019

Placement location

Sw. Mikolaja 5, 15-420 Bialystok

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Social challenges

Education and training

Physical education and sport

Placement deadline

Horse Riding and Leisure for people with a mental disability

Dienstverleningscentrum De Triangel

Lovendegem, Belgium

Apply

Project description

The Triangel Service Centre is an organisation supporting children and adults with a (moderate unto deeply) mental handicap (or in combination with other handicaps) handicap. The project is situated within our working and leisure time facilities for adults. This activities are organised for approximately 150 persons. Some of them are there once or twice a week, others every day. 25 stafmembers are responsible for this part of the organisation. 2 long term volunteers are helping them. In this project there are two subprojects with their own accents: “horse riding/sports” (1) and “leisure and working time” (2). The activities that needed to be supported are very various. In the leisure time we speak about swimming, athletics, , dancing, snoezelen, go-car riding, massage, trips, music, horse riding , …..with one or more clients together. In the working time it concerns supporting

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Housing: We look for a room in Gent and makes an agreement with the housekeeper concerning the rent price. We give the volunteer each month this budget money to pay the rent. If during the project the volunteer wants another room (needs a more luxury room, wants to live together with (new) friend(s),....) the extra costs (costs for leaving the room, higher rent) are charged to the volunteer. Transport: We pay the transport costs from the housing to our organization Volunteer gets a food budget

Training during the project

Duch lessons

Volunteer profile

Youngsters interested in working with persons wit a mental disability. Having some experiences with this group is an added value. youngsters with special interests in art, creativity, dance, music, photography, painting, cooking,....... for the part of horse riding it's not necessary to be used at horse riding but it's important not to be afraid of animals, working in the garden and/of the farm. Because most of the clients are very vulnerable we expect form the evs volunteers an absolute respect for the clients, there possibilities, the slower tempo, sometimes strange behaviour, families

Project 469: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/5297_en


Good Energies 2020

Good Energies Alliance Ireland

Ballinaglera, County Leitrim, Ireland

Apply

Project description

Good Energies 2020 is a 2-year project that will use the enthusiasm and skills of our EVS volunteers to tackle the "Powerful Communities", campaign coordinated by GEAI. "Powerful Communities" focuses on the potential of NW Ireland communities to generate their own electricity from renewable energies and move to smart use of power and electric cars.The campaign will focus locally as well as nationally. This will give our volunteers experience in campaigning and lobbying, social media and publicity, democratic systems and actions, and community interaction and empowerment. It will raise awareness of Erasmus+ locally through delivery of workshops to local schools and through publicity of the project. Our volunteers will be supported through mentoring, supervision and training to achieve high-quality learning outcomes (knowledge, skills and competences), to improve their personal development, their involvement as active citizens in society and their employability.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Independent living in rented accommodation with four bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, one bedroom per EVS volunteer, shared kitchen and living area. Private or shared bathroom. Adequate food allowance, car and fuel allowance provided for volunteers. Area is very rural and isolated, accommodation is in village of 400 persons. Our volunteers are in general OVER 24 YEARS and have lived away from home. Work time is spent mainly in community centre 1 km from nearest village so very isolated. Volunteer needs to be able to cope with limited daily social opportunities. Also with challenging Irish weather!

Training during the project

The following training will provided for all volunteers: Induction training. Training in Introduction to First Aid, Child Protection training, Social Media training, Campaigning Methodologies. Volunteers will attend conferences, seminars or workshops as desired and available. On-line language training - Erasmus+ or other. Time given within office hours for this training.

Volunteer profile

WE ARE CURRENTLY LOOKING FOR A VOLUNTEER FROM CROATIA! Interested in Environment and Climate Change Attended 3rd level college. Interested in communications and working with communities English language B1 or higher As our volunteers live together and work together, we are looking for people who are flexible, mid twenties and can adjust to diversity in cultures and personalities. This EVS is a huge opportunity to experience the richness of different cultures. Must be resilient and able to cope with solitude. Interest in Music is an advantage in rural Ireland

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/10/2018 to 31/12/2019

Placement location

Ballinaglera Community Hall, N41 A2N8 Ballinaglera, County Leitrim

Looking for volunteers from

Greece, Spain, France, Romania, Italy, Croatia, Portugal

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Environment and natural protection

Education and training

Placement deadline

No application deadline

SKY IS THE LIMIT 2019 / Youth Worker

Fundacja Rozwoju Międzykulturowego EBU

Minsk Mazowiecki, Poland

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

The project is focused on the intercultural education, youth empowerment and development of social skills. It's implemented via various activities, workshops, events, meetings and social animation. The project involves the whole local community. The volunteers work with youth from 11 to 25 years old. Example of the activities: intercultural workshops and presentations in schools, language cafes, animating space of the Youth Volunteering and Initiative Centre by presenting a variety of activities, local campaigns for youth, developing youth projects along with local teenagers. Volunteer’s tasks are based on individual activities, according to the competence and confidence. The host organization provides space and support for development of independent initiatives.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers are hosted in the volunteers' house shared amongst several young people of different cultures. Each volunteer receives food allowance which helps him/her take care of individual dietry needs. There is no need for public transport as Minsk Mazowiecki is a small town. When the activities require the volunteer to commute to the working place, the hosting organisation provides the reimbursement of any transportation expenses.

Training during the project

The hosting organisation provides support and training in the area of social animation, intercultural education, communication and non-formal methodology. Depending on the volunteer's interest the organisation may also offer training or practical experience in other areas such as coordination, administration, public relations or organisation of bigger events.

Volunteer profile

Strongly motivated to contribute skills and to interact with the community; passionate about working with young people and motivating them to be active in the local environment; open to work in varied environments; interested in proposing and implementing new initiatives; with potential to be a role model; responsible; creative and well-organized.

Integrationswerkstätten Oberschwaben Arbeit und Beschäftigung

Integrationswerkstätten Oberschwaben

Weingarten, Germany

Apply

Project description

The Werkstatt für behinderte Menschen (WfbM) (Workshop for Disabled People) is a part of the Integrationswerkstätten Oberschwaben GmbH (IWO). It offers very good integration and support of people with mental (mind), physical (body) and severe multiple disabilities. The institution offers varied and challenging group work opportunities and individual care and therapy activities. These are structured daily. The structure of the facilities is very good and there is disabled-friendly work equipment. Our disabled workers receive many benefits, for example: the participation in work and community life, rehabilitation, personal and employment development, self-determination and independence. Physically, mentally or severely disabled people can find meaningful work in our workshop. Work is an important purpose of life. This is why we offer over 400 job spaces for people with disabilities at our Workshop for Disabled People (WfbM).

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will get a separated single room in a flat near the hosting organisation. Bathroom and kitchen are to share with other volunteers. His accommodation remains available for him throughout the entire service period including holidays. The volunteer will get an amount of 241,- € per month for food. As an additional benefit the volunteer will get a monthly ticket which is valid for all means of public transport in the cities of Weingarten and Ravensburg. During weekend and school holidays the ticket is also valid in the entire administrative district of Bodensee-Oberschwaben.

Training during the project

The leader of the special needs department will act as a tutor for the volunteer. She will support the volunteer from the first contact to the delivery of the final report. She will take care for practical preparations in the host organisation and prepare the arrival of the volunteer. The volunteer can take part in a language course at the local adult education center. A maximum of 3 hours language training will be allowed as working time. The volunteer will be send to the compulsory On-arrival-training and Mid-term-meeting organised by the German National Agency.

Volunteer profile

Volunteers should be open to working with disabled people and people who are excluded from society. Past experience in working with disabled people is helpful. Volunteers must be ready to helping disabled people to use the toilet or changing incontinence aids (such as diapers). Volunteers should be able to individually design and plan activities. They should also be helpful and be able to work with other team members. A basic or beginner level of the German language would be helpful for volunteers. An interest in learning German is expected. A Class B driver’s licence is an asset.

Placement dates

A total of 54 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

Stefan-Rahl-Straße 2, 88250 Weingarten

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Social challenges

Health and wellbeing

Education and training

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

#Youth_plays_languages

Treinta Profesores SCA

Sevilla, Spain

Apply

Project description

Treinta Profesores Cooperative is intimately related to the Bilingual Center Lope de Vega, which is a school of concerted education. Our center has the stages of Infant, Primary and Secondary. Overcoming the 900 students and with a staff of more than 60 teachers, we have an orientation department that works with our students with specific educational needs to support integration. Our centre: http://lopedevega.net https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gC2sPlmZ3do Our European Development Plan: http://lopedevega.net/desarrolloeuropeo.html We have extensive experience in European projects. In order to internationalize our center and improve educational practices we have founded an international department, which considers this project as a unique opportunity to achieve education in peace and tolerance through emotional education.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Treinta Profesores Cooperative will provide accommodation and food and transport to our centre. They will also give the volunteers pocket money, so they can cover their needs. The volunteers will stay in shared apartments with other international volunteers.

Training during the project

Our project will use the Youthpass certificate to validate the skills acquired by the volunteers during their stay in our center.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for young volunteers between the ages of 18 and 25, active, eager to learn and teach, motivated to live experiences and respectful of the environment. They should like to treat children and young people, and be sensitive to diversity and special educational needs. In addition, they should have the values ​​of peace and tolerance. An application form has been provided to know the concerns, motivations, potentials and experiences, which can favour the development of the project and knowledge about the culture of our country.

Placement dates

Placement location
