Integrative Wohngemeinschaft "Weserstrand'

Dienststelle für Selbstbestimmtes Leben (Träger, nicht WG-Adresse) Vennbahnstr 4/4 B4780 St Vith

B 4700 Eupen, Belgium

Apply

Project description

Wir sind eine WG mit 2 Jugendlichen ohne und 2 mit einer (leichten geistigen und körperlichen) Behinderung in Eupen, der sympatischen Hauptstadt der deutschsprachigen Gemeinschaft Belgiens. Jeder Bewohner verfügt in unserem Projekt über ein eigenes Zimmer und die Möglichkeit am gemeinsamen Leben in großzügig bemessenen neuen Gemeinschaftsräumen teilzunehmen. Der Freiwillige soll täglich einige Stunden für die Menschen mit Behinderung Ansprechpartner sein, jedoch natürlich auch die Möglichkeit haben sich zurückziehen zu können. An seinen freien Tagen kann er sich natürlich auch aus dem Leben der WG ausklinken. Unser Gebäude liegt am Fluss Weser unweit des Naturschutzgebietes Hohes Venn/Eifel und den attraktiven Studentenstädten Aachen(D), Lüttich(B) und Maastricht(NL)

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Lebensmittel und eigenes Zimmer stellt die WG zur Verfügung. Der Freiwillige erhält ein Jahresbusabo für die gesamte deutschsprachige und französischsprachige Gemeinschaft Belgiens. Die WG liegt an einer Bushaltestelle, die den IC-Bahnhof der Stadt anfährt von wo aus stündlich Brüssel (150 km) und die Nordseestädte (240 km) und indirekt problemlos das deutsche Zug-und Busnetz erreichbar ist (Aachen, 20 km, Köln 100 km). der Gopass erlaubt jede belgische Ortschaft für 5 € zu erreichen.

Training during the project

Alle 14 Tage findet in der WG eine Evaluationsrunde des Trägers, der Dienststelle für Selbstbestimmtes Leben Ostbelgien, statt. Der Freiwillige kann kostenlos bei Bedarf an Supervisionen unseres Dienstes und natürlich an Treffen der European volonteers teilnehmen.

Volunteer profile

Der/die Freiwillige braucht keinerlei Vorausbildung, soll jedoch die Bereitschaft zum Zusammenleben mit anderen deutschsprachigen Menschen mit und ohne Behinderung seines Alters haben. Sie/er sollte offen sein, im Rahmen der WG und des Gesamtteams kooperativ und positiv mit den anderen auf eventuelle Probleme zu reagieren. Er/sie soll Verantwortung übernehmen können und ein gewisses Selbstvertrauen und Einfühlungsvermögen mitbringen. Hat er/sie zudem kreative Ideen im Bereich Freizeitgestaltung/Alltagsleben wäre dies noch ein Plus. Pflegearbeiten sind übrigens nicht zu leisten.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 30/06/2018 to 31/05/2019

Placement location

WG Weserstrand Haagenstr.6, 4700 B 4700 Eupen

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Placement deadline

No application deadline

Volunteers for Val d'Argent Social Centre, France

Centre Socioculturel du Val d'Argent

Sainte-Marie-aux-Mines, France

Apply

Project description

A 12 months volunteering placement at the Val d'Argent Community Centre, situated in Sainte-Marie Aux Mines, in France. The volunteers’ tasks will be to help the youth workers and social workers in implementing a variety of activities and workshops: • work with children; • intercultural workshops; • intergenerational activities; • the volunteers will also have the possibility to propose activities according to their capacities and interests. The Centre was founded in 1992 to offer a variety of leisure and cultural activities for a wide range of beneficiaries, from childhood to elderly. Nowadays, the Centre has around 60 employees and a big number of volunteers. It’s located in Sainte Marine aux Mines, a town with around 6000 inhabitants, and it’s close to Ribeauvillé and Sélestat, two beautiful medieval towns, and it is 1h time away from Strasbourg.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

1. Accommodation and food: The volunteers will be accommodated in a furnished apartment located in the neighbour town of Sélestat (30mn from the work place). They will be accommodated in single rooms. The apartment is fully equipped with all the necessary commodities. The volunteer will receive a monthly allowance for their food expenses and another allowance for pocket money. The local transport during work time will be covered 100%. 2. International travel Round-trip ticket will be covered by the coordinating organisation within the limits of the received grant.

Volunteer profile

Young men and young women aged between 20 and 30 yours old, motivated and interested in working with children, young adults and elderly. The volunteers must be open-minded, friendly and communicative. ### A BASIC LEVEL (A2) IN FRENCH LANGUAGE IS REQUIRED ### PROFILES THAT DO NOT SHOW ANY LEVEL IN FRENCH LANGUAGE WILL NOT BE ANSWERED.

Placement dates

A total of 54 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

Sainte-Marie-aux-Mines

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

EVS IN A BUTTERFLY HOUSE IN ITALY

Farfalle nella Testa

Bordano (Udine), Italy

Apply

Project description

Farfalle nella Testa is looking for 2 volunteers that will be involved in the management of the Butterfly House and in the environmental education activities: - Support during guided tours, educational workshops and events organized especially during the summer season - Participation in the conception, planning and realization of such events - Creation and realization of activities, events or workshops, enriching the Butterfly House with their ideas and experiences - Assistance to the staff during the ordinary and extraordinary management of the Butterfly House: management and maintenance of tropical greenhouses and more in general of the museum structure - Help during the breeding and care of insects and other invertebrates and vertebrates - Assistance to the staff for the care of plants and outdoor gardening activities - Participation in staff meetings and specific meetings on various aspects.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will be hosted in a flat in Bordano composed by 2 single bedroom (or a double one), living room with kitchenette and bathroom. Volunteers can eat at the Butterfly House tavern or shopping and cooking using the economic support for food provided by Farfalle nella Testa. A Pocket money of 5 euro per day will be provided monthly. If the volunteers like it, Farfalle nella Testa can put at their disposal bicycles for the whole duration of the EVS. The travel expenses will be refunded on the basis defined by the European Commission.

Training during the project

Volunteers will participate in the On Arrival Training organized by the Italian National Agency. Also Joint, the coordinating organization will organize an on arrival training with the volunteers and the coordinator and mentor of Farfalle nella Testa.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for 2 EVS volunteer. The ideal volunteer - is a nature and animals lover - has a willingness to work in a group and in contact with children - is willing to do manual work - is ready and interested in spending a prolonged period of time in a small town located in a valley - is a curious person, who asks questions and is capable of making constructive criticism and self-criticism. Not necessary but appreciated will be a scientific background and previous experiences in the field of environmental education and/or horticulture.

Placement dates

A total of 39 week(s) during the period 01/03/2019 to 30/11/2019

Placement location

via Roma 45, 33010 Bordano (Udine)

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Placement deadline

No application deadline

Volunteering is sharing

Centrum ds Katastrof i Klęsk Żywiołowych Tratwa

Wrocław, Poland

Apply

Project description

There will be four main fields of the volunteers work: 1. LET'S GO WITH IDEAS With workshops about intercultural education, mobility, democracy, language animation activities for the kids and youth we visit schools in our city and in region of Lower Silesia. We visit not only schools but some events, festivals and animations in the backyards of our district. 2. CZASOPRZESTRZEŃ “Czasoprzestrzeń” is an old tram depot from 1915 which we are transforming into a social and cultural centre. EVS volunteers will be engaged in some renovation tasks, help us with ongoing events: promotion, organisation. There is plenty of events and place for your individual ideas! 3. MY PLACE The youth initiative centre at PPM Zajezdnia is addressed to teenagers and young people in risk of social exclusion and a meeting place for a elders. The main aim is to support the youth working with non-formal education. Our EVS volunteers implement there language and cooking workshops.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will be accommodated in rented appartments in the city area (very often walking distance from the office and/or centre). They are fully furnished and equipped. However, one often shares a room with another volunteer (of the same gender). Since we work in different venues we provide months cards for a public transport. Volunteers are given their money for food and organise it by themselves.

Training during the project

Volunteers will be learning in various fileds: 1. Non-formal education. While having activities for kids and youth they will learn how to use non-formal education, running language activities, workshops of various kind, trainings about European values. 2. Event production. Thanks to working in "Czasoprzestrzeń" EVS will learn how to organise a cultural event (planning, contact with partners, promotion, preparation, organisation and evaluation). An oppportunity to create their own individual project (photo exhibition, concert, escaperoom, etc.) will give them chance to implement know-how.

Volunteer profile

Right now we are looking for people from: Italy, Spain, Romania, Bulgaria, France, Croatia, Greece, Portugal. Volunteers aged 18-30 years, open minded, eager to learn and motivated to work on the proposed project activities. The volunteers should be motivated to work with people in a non-formal education context. The participants should like to develop and improve their skills and abilities, be open for experiments, have some hobbies and like to share them when organizing activities. Various talents, hobbies, interests are welcomed.

Placement dates

A total of 30 week(s) during the period 01/10/2018 to 31/05/2019

Placement location

Probusa 9/4, 50-242 Wrocław

Looking for volunteers from

Italy, Greece, Spain, Portugal, Romania, Croatia, Bulgaria

Placement topics

Social challenges

Citizenship and democratic participation

Education and training

Creativity and culture

No application deadline

EVS "Volunteer to grow"

Curba de Cultura

Izvoarele, Prahova county, Romania

Apply

Project description

The main objective of the project is to give to young persons from Croatia the opportunity to develop themselves through a series of nonformal activities and through living and working in a different environment. Hosting organization Curba de Cultură focuses on teenagers and youth development. We want to create the premises for a better development of the young people and their more suited integration within their respective communities. The youth centre will be the base of operations for all projects. One volunteer from Croatia is already started her EVS volunteering adventure in Curba de cultura. ;) The activities the volunteers can organize and take part in: - Promoting nonformal learning and volunteering -Documenting activities and reporting -Managing the library within the youth centre -Organizing cinema nights -Non-formal learning activities with young people and children We are also encouraging and supporting volunteers to realize their own ideas and initiatives.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will be hosted in a traditional mountain house in the community (with kitchen, bathroom, phone, access to a washing machine, ironing machine and a vacuum cleaner). The house will be shared among volunteers. Broadband wireless internet (1 Gbps) and cable TV will be available in the office/ youth centre. Monthly food allowence: equivalent of 100 EUR Monthly allowence: equivalent of 60 EUR Transportation: bicycles for transportation within the municipalities. For farther transportation they will get monthly cards for public transportation.

Training during the project

The volunteers will receive on-line language courses. The volunteers will also receive the support of a local mentor to help integrate within the community and develop and follow his/her personal development plan during the project. In order to be able to fully respond to the tasks of the project, the volunteers will receive training in: - basic nonformal learning - feedback and communication techniques - basic event management

Volunteer profile

Volunteer has to be between 18 and 30 years old, from Croatia. Volunteers facing geographical (from rural areas, islands, peripheral areas...), social (discriminated based on religion, nationality, sexual orientation,etc.) or economical obstacles (low standard of living, low income, facing unemployment...) are also welcomed.

Placement dates

A total of 24 week(s) during the period 01/09/2018 to 30/06/2019

Placement location

Looking for volunteers from

Croatia

SKY IS THE LIMIT 2019 / Animator

Fundacja Rozwoju Międzykulturowego EBU

Minsk Mazowiecki, Poland

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

The EVS project is focused on the intercultural education, animation and development of social competences. It's implemented via various activities, workshops, events, meetings and social animation. The volunteers work mainly with kids from 3 to 12 years old. Example of the activities: reading books to toddlers, animation games for kids in kindergartens, intercultural workshops for children in schools, local libraries or culture houses, theme workshops for children age 6-11 years old within the Kids’ University. The volunteers will work also with general community: families, seniors, etc. Example of activities: family picnics, local festivals and social events. Volunteer’s tasks are based on individual activities, according to the competence and confidence. The host organization provides space and support for development of independent initiatives.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers are hosted in the volunteers' house shared amongst several young people of different cultures. Each volunteer receives food allowance which helps him/her take care of individual dietry needs. There is no need for public transport as Minsk Mazowiecki is a small town. When the activities require the volunteer to commute to the working place, the hosting organisation provides the reimbursement of any tranportation expenses.

Training during the project

The hosting organisation provides support and training in the area of social animation, intercultural education, communication and non-formal methodology. Depending on the volunteer's interest the organisation may also offer training or practical experience in other areas such as coordination, administration, public relations or organisation of bigger events.

Volunteer profile

Strongly motivated to contribute skills and to interact with the community; passionate about working with children of different ages; open to work in varied environments; interested in proposing and implementing new initiatives; creative and well-organized.

Placement dates

A total of 7 week(s) during the period 27/04/2019 to 15/06/2019

Placement location

ul. Piękna 26, 05-300 Minsk Mazowiecki

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Project 479: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/4659_en


ACCOMPANYING ELDERLY PEOPLE

Foyer Ste-Anne

Namur, Belgium

Apply

Project description

Accommodation and Rest and Care House with a "safe quarter" for confused elderly. The hosting and care for confused Elderly is mainly characterized by the creation of a secure living space. Every effort is made to ensure that each resident can "feel him good" in this area of life enabling them to realize, to come true and to open up and despite the poly-pathology that afflicts him. The main focus is on support and / or replacement on a daily basis and that in every detail of life. This allows the resident to "stabilize him" in its loss of autonomy, or even cover a bit more autonomy for certain acts that could be done again, which again gives a satisfaction of fullfilment. The Foyer Ste-Anne offers the full range of specialists dedicated to these goals. Volunteers will be mainly in contact with the healthcare, physiotherapist or animation team.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers are accomodated in the "pedagogy" of a school for nurses and have their own room (with common kitchen facilities and showers) During the service they will eat in the Foyer and receive monthly money to buy food. They will have a season ticket to travel by bus through the city of Namur.

Training during the project

The volunteer tasks are mainly focused on the "relational" through: - Animation activities (representing 70% of the time) such as: games, singing, painting on silk, ... - Support of the elderly for meals, walks, ... (about 20% of the time) Volunteers will eventually develop initiatives based on their personal experience as long as these initiatives are matching the goals set by the teaching team. A French course is foreseen in a public school of the city

Volunteer profile

- Basic knowledge of French - The interest of (the) volunteer for a social purpose mission, centered on the elderly. This profile is assessed jointly by the coordinating and host Org -based on the application file and on a telephone interview with the candidates (coordinating Org in charge). A CV with photo and a letter of motivation are required.

Placement dates

A total of 40 week(s) during the period 02/09/2019 to 02/06/2020

Placement location

rue Julien Colson 57, 5000 Namur

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Health and wellbeing

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 15/04/2019

School Support and New Technologies in Chios Island

Experimental Technology Education Sports TES-HIENET

Vrontados, Greece

Apply

Project description

a) (70%) Educational, Cultural & Sport cooperation on New Technologies: a1) Assisting at a Day Nursery, a Kindergarten, a Primary School or similar Institutions. a2) Organizing summer activities for children. a3) “Learning by using and Producing" Educational, Cultural, Sport & Tourist Projects. a4) Helping and learn how to sail on a sailing yacht. The (a1,a2,a3,a4,) activities depend on the capacity of the volunteer and the needs of the cooperating organizations. b) (20%) Realization of Non-profit making New Technologies, Educational, Sports and Cultural programs and Presentations. Creation of new ideas and realization of activities, texts translation participation in social activities. c) (05%) Our EVS Internet Radio. Development and realization of recordings, sound mixing, interviews, news to the Hosting organization’s EVS Internet Radio and web site www.chiosradio.gr. e) (05%) Our Place. Keeping the hosting and working place clean and in order (house, garden, yacht etc).

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The hosting organization is offering adequate accommodation for the volunteer, equipped with the necessary appliances and furniture to cover the basic needs of the volunteers. The Young volunteers live in shared rooms. Every two weeks the responsible of the H/O checks that everything is clean and in order at the hosting and the working place. Food: The young volunteers are responsible for making a cooking scheduler at home. They provide H/O a weekly list of the (regular) goods that they need each week for cooking at home and the H/O is supplying them.

Training during the project

Volunteers will be given, (by using the cooperative learning method), any training necessary to carry out their tasks. (Computer programs, sailing lessons etc). The mentors will meet regularly with the volunteers to check on their progress and help solve any problems. They will also ensure ongoing support for the volunteer in every possible way. Attempts will be made to help the volunteers integrate into the local community. At the end of each project, the volunteers will have more technical (computer programs) and educational skills that will make them have a very good Youth pass certificate.

Volunteer profile

We are not interested on high qualifications, millions of certificates, presidents, queens or kings. We are usually selecting positive and creative young people ready to "offer" and learning in cooperation and offer their time on the realization of New Technologies, Educational, Cultural and Sport projects. The suitable volunteer is a person who don’t need 5 stars accommodation, privacy and comforts, but a person who has as priority on learning, cooperating and living with European young people and looks the glass "half full" instead of "half empty".

Placement dates

A total of 50 week(s) during the period 01/08/2019 to 31/07/2020

Placement location

60 ANDRONIKOU STREET, 82200 Vrontados

Looking for volunteers from

Poland, Germany, Austria

Placement topics

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Physical education and sport

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 30/04/2019

ESC at Association of Educational Initiatives SIQA in Georgia

Georgian Association of Educational Initiatives SIQA

Rustavi, Georgia

Apply

Project description

The volunteers will organise diverse types of activities for/ with local youth e.g: - Educational activities such as language clubs in German, English and/ or other languages and cultures, workshops, discussion clubs, movie screening’s, on European values, intercultural dialogue, etc. - depending on the interest and skills of the volunteers; - Leisure activities for local young people such as arts and crafts workshops, music club, sport activities, role games, theatre club, etc. – depending on the interest and skills of the volunteers - Promotion of volunteering via photo exhibitions, open events in public space, presentations in schools, shooting and editing of short movies, etc. - Blogging and writing articles on volunteering in Georgia - Learning the local language, Georgian, and participating in activities of the local community

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The programme provides following: • Accommodation (together with other volunteers in a shared furnished flat), • Monthly food allowance based on local standards, • Local transportation costs (home to office), • International insurance, • Language support in Georgian, • Vaccination costs (if applicable), • Pocket money: 90 EUR per month • International travel costs home-project-home The volunteers will work about 35 hours a week and are entitled to 2 days off per worked months and local national holidays.

Training during the project

- Support during preparation - On-arrival training in Georgia organised by SALTO-EECA - Mid-term evaluation in Georgia organised by SALTO-EECA - Final evaluation upon return in Germany

Volunteer profile

• Resident in Germany (of any citizenship) and age: 18-29 years old • Highly motivated to volunteer in the youth sector • Showing a great deal of flexibility and adaptability • Motivated and enthusiastic to live for one year in another culture We particularly encourage young people with no or few experiences but with high motivation and adaptability to apply!

Youth Cooperation Centre of Dilijan NGO

Dilijan, Armenia

Apply

Project description

The volunteers will support the activities of the hosting organisation and especially organise non-formal educational activities for and with local young people (up to 25 years old): - Organisation of workshops, discussion clubs, movie screening’s on intercultural dialogue and Europe (concrete topics and types of activities depending on the interest/ skills of the volunteers) - Organisation of leisure activities for local young people (music group, arts and crafts, dancing classes, sport activities, role games – concrete activities depend on the interest/ skills of the volunteers) - Support to YCCD with running activities and projects in Dilijan and in the region - Support to visibility of the project by blogging, writing articles and shooting and editing videos on the activities of YCCD for online promotion - Promotion of volunteering and active participation in local schools, youth clubs and events - Learning Armenian and participating in communities’ activities

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The project covers following: - Accommodation in a shared furnished flat, eventually the first month in a hosting family if wished by the volunteer, - Monthly food allowance and pocket money (90 EUR) - International insurance, - Armenian language course - International travel costs home-project-home up to a fixed budget The volunteers will work about 35 hours a week including language course and are entitled to 2 days off per worked months and local national holidays.

Training during the project

- Support during preparation - on-arrival training in Georgia (4 days) organised by SALTO-EECA - mid-term evaluation in Georgia (4 days) organised by SALTO-EECA - final evaluation meeting upon return in Germany and participation in the Comeback Event, if wished by the volunteer

Volunteer profile

• Resident in Germany (of any citizenship) and age: 18-29 years old • Highly motivated to volunteer in the youth sector • Showing a great deal of flexibility and adaptability • Motivated and enthusiastic to live for one year in another culture We particularly encourage young people with no or few experiences but with high motivation and adaptability to apply!

URGENT - Let's build bridges!.4

Ville de Nevers

NEVERS, France

Apply

Project description

Nous recherchons un ou une volontaire pour une mission à partir d'avril 2019. Le projet est proposé par la Ville de Nevers qui accueille chaque année 2 ou 3 volontaires dans le cadre du volontariat européen. If you' re interested in journalism, information, communication and want to discover the life in a small French town during one year, if you are motivated by practicing foreign languages and feel able to write articles, make videos, manage a radio program in French, then you can apply ! Your tasks will be : animate our weekly multilingual coffee with other volunteers, update our blog and social networks, prepare and animate our radio programs, write articles, make small video, prepare and manage public events, promote European volunteering and international mobility in general, networking and promotion of our activities.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Our volunteers share a flat in a big house with a garden in front of the Loire River, about 10 minutes' walk from the office. Each volunteer has his/her own bedroom and shares kitchen, bathroom, toilet, washing room and a living-room with a little balcony. Each volunteer has to open a French bank account at arrival and get pocket money (180 €) and food allowance (315€) by transfer to this account by the end of each month.

Training during the project

Online Linguistic Support On arrival seminar provided by National Agency Mid-term seminar provided by National Agency French courses (50 hours)

Volunteer profile

We are looking for a communicative and creative person interested by journalism, communication, who enjoys writing articles and communicate in French. Having a basic knowledge of social networks management and photography is a must. Having certain skills for graphic design and blogging with Wordpress is also a plus.

Placement dates

Mobilité et culture

MJCCSA81

Saïx, France

Apply

Project description

We are glad to welcome volunteers because we think that having young volunteers here is the best way to make young people aware of the benefits of multi-culturalism and discovering of other cultures. This program will energize our youth-oriented actions. Objectives : - to promote international mobility on our territory and in particular ERASMUS + - to help the development of youth information networks in the area - to develop a project with a cultural theme for youth - create a cultural event 2 European volunteers go through our actions to become "mobility ambassadors". They will participate in different projects that we will put in place over the year (holidays, youth camps, cultural activities, sports events ...). For application fill in the google form https://goo.gl/forms/12i9wHU367Rsupj03. Also, click APPLY at the beginning of this page

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

You will accommodated in a fully equipped apartment just 1 min by foot from MJC Saix. Each volunteer will have a single room and they will share kitchen, big living room and bathroom. For transportation you will be given a car and bicycles. Please, keep in mind that you will need a car here almost every day – to go to CCSA & RIJ (the two offices where you will work) ,to the shops or cafes. An allowance no less than 295 euros/ months will be provided for food and pocket money.

Training during the project

- We will make sure that the volunteers follow Erasmus trainings (on-arrival and midterm training) and evaluation cycles and upon request of the volunteer we will issue the "Youthpass" certificate - First diploma of animation (BAFA) and / or first aid (PSC1) (possible if you wish) - Language diploma: DELF (possible if you wish)

Volunteer profile

- Between 20 and 30 years old - Has a little experience in organizing events - Passionate about working with children and young people - Able to take initiatives and propose their ideas - Interested in culture - Willing to spend a year in a small town - Has driving license - Speaks at least basic French The candidates do not have to fit all the criteria mentioned above. We choose our volunteers according to their motivation first of all. For application fill in the google form https://goo.gl/forms/12i9wHU367Rsupj03 . Also, click APPLY at the beginning of this page.

Open your mind through international mobility

Ville de Nevers

NEVERS, France

Apply

Project description

Ville de Nevers (local government) promotes international mobility for young people, regardless of their qualifications or experience. We believe that everyone should have an access to international mobility projects and be able to communicate in more than one language. If you share our goals, than we would be happy to host you in one of our EVS missions. This specific position starts from January and can last up to 12 months. There have been 8 volunteers from 7 countries in this volunteering activity since 2011. Currently the tasks are youth information and counselling, individual or collective support to our candidates to mobility projects, animation of our weekly multilingual coffee, participation to our radio programs, project preparation and management, public events preparation and management, promotion of European volunteering and international mobility in general. Some activities are implemented in team with another European volunteer and the project coordinator.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Our volunteers share a flat in a big house with garden in front of the Loire River, about 10 minutes' walk from the office. Each one has his/her own bedroom. Each volunteer has to open a French bank account at arrival and get pocket money and food allowance by transfer to this account by the end of each month. We provide bus tickets when needed to go to a specific place for a volunteering activity.

Training during the project

Online Linguistic Support On arrival seminar provided by National Agency Mid-term seminar provided by National Agency Depending of needs and budget, French courses in a small group.

Volunteer profile

We look for a volunteer willing to stay from 10 to 12 months, with good communication skills, highly motivated by our project and not only by volunteering in France, proactive, willing to learn and share his/her own knowledges and competences. Basic French language skills are needed.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/01/2020 to 31/03/2021

Placement location

place de l'Hôtel de Ville, 58036 NEVERS

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Project 486: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/4477_en


Kindergarten der Kulturen

Kindergarten der Kulturen

Freiburg, Germany

Apply

Project description

The non-profit haubsache sozial.aktiv.engagiert. was started in May 2014 as a private limited company. It is the private financial sponsor of the Kindergarten der Kulturen. The Kindergarten der Kulturen opened in November 2014. The name in English means „kindergarten of cultures“. It is a private institution with two groups for children from the age of 3 years to the age before entering school. The institution’s important interests are: cultural exchange, understanding of the world’s many differences and more sensitivity to the imbalance in our society. Children should see being different as part of their self-image and natural fact. The old categories like “First World”, “Second World” and “Third World” should stop being used. We should look at the world as a “whole” and act in this manner. Intercultural education is the teaching and learning of intercultural knowledge and skills. This allows people to have a positive opinion of cultural and individual differences.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will get a single room in a shared apartment with kitchen and bathroom. For daily lunch, volunteers will get free meals at the kindergarten. For breakfast and dinner they will get money for food or to cook on their own. To travel around the region, European Volunteers get a monthly ticket. This ticket is for all forms of public transportation in the area of Breisgau-Hochschwarzwald. On weekends and during school holidays, volunteers can use the ticket in the neighbouring areas of Ortenau, Schwarzwald-Baar, Lörrach and Waldshut-Tiengen.

Training during the project

On-arrival training and midterm-meeting organised by the German National Agency Weekly language training at the local adult education centre (Volkshochschule) At the beginning, volunteers get important training and support so they can complete their duties. There is standard training for all workers. This will help to avoid problems from the start of the program. Volunteers will learn their rights and duties, and the rules of the host organization. They will also learn the results of bad behaviour.

Volunteer profile

Volunteers should be interested in child care. Past experience in working with children and young people could be helpful. Volunteers should be sociable, outgoing, have enthusiasm, and be accepting of foreign cultures. Volunteers should be able to act individually, but also work well with a team. Volunteers should have a basic level of the German language. An interest in learning German is expected. Volunteers should write a ‘project-related motivation letter’. The decision will be based on motivation. It will not be based on background, gender, language skills, or level of education.

Placement dates

A total of 54 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/08/2020

Recognizing Young Entrepreneurs & Teaching Entrepreneurship-Yerrf 2019

Association. Les Amis De La Giraudiere

Brossac 100km from Bordeaux, France

Apply

Project description

It will be Entrepreneurs with entrepreneurial skills that will create the jobs of the future and help reduce unemployment, it is for this reason that the second part of the YERRF project is to widen the awareness of Entrepreneurship, commercially and socially, as both a career option and also as a subject which should be taught in education. Following part 1 of the project which finished in November 2017 we saw in place the website for the project, and now we are looking to advance to the next step of constructing workshops on the subject of Entrepreneurship Learning and Teaching. Help us to produce educational materials, videos, games and guides on the subject of Entrepreneurship and encourage Entrepreneurial education.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The Accommodation and all meals are at the center La Giraudiere. Volunteers would have to arrive at Chalais gare, or station, where they will be met. Brossac is 10 k from Chalais and Chalais is on the Angouleme to Bordeaux rail Line. Weekly trips to Chalais for trains etc are arranged for those exploring the area. Bycycles are provided for visitng the village of Brossac or it's lake & beach ideal for exploring the surrounding countryside. Excursions are arranged every three weeks.

Training during the project

The main subjects of training or informally learning would be Entrepreneurship social and commercial, Marketing, Business start-up's, finance, banking, accounting, social media, website creation and internet marketing, Search engine optimization, SEO, blogging, living with an international group, English and or French language lessons included more information at our website.http://volunteer-france.lagiraudiere.com/erasmus_2019_Project.html

Volunteer profile

Volunteers should be able to speak, or understand, either English or French, You should be available for at least 3 months of the 5 mobility. The target group for this project is those interested in the topic of Entrepreneurship, socially or commercially. Those who maybe thinking of starting their own business or project. Those who have an interest in Marketing, Website creation, Finance or Banking and foreign languages ie French and English will be used on this project.

Placement dates

A total of 21 week(s) during the period 06/05/2019 to 05/10/2019

Placement location

La Giraudiere, 16480 Brossac 100km from Bordeaux

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Czech Republic, France, Italy, Portugal, United Kingdom, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Latvia, Netherlands, Slovakia, Sweden, Belgium, Denmark, Finland, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Poland

Green Voluntary Service

Green Association

Momin prohod / Sofia / Small villages, Bulgaria

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

Green Voluntary Service is a strategic EVS project of Green Association with two short term mobilities, receiving 16 volunteers for 2 months, which will take place between 28.05.19-25.07.19 and 01.08.19-28.09. Long term volunteering is also available. Most of the volunteering will be held at: Beglika festival http://greenassn.com/portfolio/#prettyPhoto/23/ Green Summit http://greenassn.com/portfolio/#prettyPhoto/24/ Wake up festival http://greenassn.com/portfolio/#prettyPhoto/25/ Another part of the activities will take place in the social centre of Green Association in Momin prohod, Sofia and the partnering farms and places of the association. Green volunteers can get extremely rich experience in organizing events promoting sustainable living. Among the main activities to achieve our objectives are the organization of workshops, seminars, festivals and other events providing experience in the field of PR, communication, advertising and event management in general.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The working hours of the volunteers will be in general, 6-7 hours a day from Monday to Friday, within 30-35 hours per week. During the conduct of weekend events their due days will be compensated before and after the event. Volunteers will be accommodated in mixed rooms in а guest house. For food volunteers will receive a lump sum of 130 euro each on a monthly basis or when food will be organised by the hosts, the allowance is calculated by deducting the sum of multiplying the number of days with provided food with 1/30 of the unit cost per month. Pocket money are fixed to 177 euro in total.

Volunteer profile

Between 18 and 30 years old, living in an Erasmus+ program country; With different backgrounds (including fewer opportunities); With different competences and interests (sustainability, permaculture, event management, project’s development, youth activities, multimedia, etc.). Willingness to stand basic living conditions (no hot water, no shops or services nearby, etc.), to travel by bus or car and to sleep in a tent for long periods (more than 2 weeks) is a must! It's not easy being green... If interested, send your CV and short motivation to 2greena3@gmail.com.

Placement dates

A total of 8 week(s) during the period 01/05/2019 to 31/12/2019

Placement location

Momin prohod / Sofia / Small villages

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Strategic EVS of Hradec Kralove - 2nd wave

KURO Hradec Králové z.s.

Hradec Králové, Czech Republic

Apply

Project description

Team of EVS volunteers will support KURO HK on daily basis, partner organizations and local community of Hradec Králové and region. Moreover, there are opportuntities: -To promote Erasmus+ programme and EVS as a learning experience in the city of Hradec Kralove. -Volunteers are welcome to discover different learning strategies and contribute to local community by organization of educational/leisure activities for children and teenagers aged 4-18. They will be preparing and organizing presentations, workshops and other activities that will support the children’s development as well as personal development of themselves. -The volunteer will have a chance to share his culture, cuisine, language, etc. through organizing workshops, discussions and lectures for local people. -Volunteer will also help with day to day work of the hosting organization KURO Hradec Králové and will have an opportunity to take part in events organized by partners of the hosting organization.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteer will live in a shared apartment (in separate room or shared room with other volunteer of the same gender) Volunteer will receive monthly money for food (about 90€) and pocket money (120 €). Moreover, volunteers will get train and public transport discount card, discount to water pool, city library card, opportunity to use bicycle etc.

Training during the project

 Volunteer will take part in pre-departure training in sending organization (country of origin).  After the arrival volunteer will be given brief training in hosting organization (NGO sector, project management, non-formal education etc)  Volunteer will also participate in training circle organized by Czech National Agency  Volunteer will have an opportunity to participate in Czech language course (online course and with a teacher in group lessons with other volunteers).

Volunteer profile

A volunteer we are looking for should be person open to new opportunities and willing to learn every day new things by work in motivating environment. As KURO HK often shaped by particular EVS projects and volunteers with different background and experience, we don't have special criteria. Volunteers who enjoy working with children are most welcome to join this project. Together they will work with children in kindergartens, elementary schools, organizing a wide scale of activities in fields of education, culture and social issues.

A total of 62 week(s) during the period 01/05/2019 to 30/06/2020

Placement location

Gagarinova 587, 50003 Hradec Králové

Looking for volunteers from

Umweltbildung und Naturschutz am Ätna

Associazione Nazionale Giacche Verdi Sicilia Raggruppamento Provinciale Bronte

Bronte (CT), Italy

Apply

Project description

Environmental Education and Nature protection at the Etna - We can only send volunteers resident in Germany to Italy, we are not a Hosting organisation - Unser Anliegen ist es, in der Ätnaregion Natur- und Umweltschutz umzusetzen, u.a. unterstützen wir die traditionelle kleinbäuerliche Landwirtschaft, indem wir zum naturverträglichen (Bio-)Anbau animieren. Wir engagieren uns langfristig für die Errichtung eines UNESCO-Biosphärenreservates. Unsere Freiwilligen sind an dieser Kommunikation, der Planung und an naturkundlichen Untersuchungen sowie der Umsetzung von Naturschutzmaßnahmen intensiv beteiligt. Darüber hinaus unterstützen wir die kleine lokale NGO "Giacche Verdi Bronte", die sich im Bereich Jugend, Umweltbildung und Sozialem engagiert. Unsere Volontäre sind in die gesamte Vereinsarbeit integriert, erfahren intensiven kulturellen Austausch und können kleine (Umwelt-)Projekte selbst entwickeln, in die sie lokale Jugendliche mit einbinden.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Einsatzort ist Bronte in Italien (20.000 Einwohner), "Stadt der Pistazien", am Nordwesthang des Vulkans Ätna gelegen, fernab von Industrie und den Haupttourismusrouten. Die Aufnahmeorganisation kann derzeit bis zu 4 europäische Freiwillige aufnehmen und beherbergt weitere Freiwillige aus anderen Programmen. Die Unterkunft ist schlicht aber praktikabel, es gibt Mehrbettzimmer, eine Gemeinschaftsküche und -Bad. Die Volontäre erhalten i.d.R. Verpflegunsgeld und versorgen sich selbst. Die Mobilität vor Ort geschieht zu Fuß, per Bus und Bahn und über die Aufnahmeorganisation.

Training during the project

Informelles Lernen steht im Vordergrund. Die Volontäre erleben und erfahren die Sprache und Kultur vor allem im Alltag, bei Bedarf gibt es zu Beginnn zusätzliches Unterstützung. Je nach Einsatzmöglichkeiten können die Teilnehmer Kenntnisse und Fertigkeiten in verscheidenen Bereichen, von Umweltbildung über technische und handwerkliche Arbeiten, bis zu fachlichem Wissen (Umwelt, Natur, Ökoanbau etc) erlangen.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for applicants from Germany who would like to join our projects in Sicily. Wir suchen Bewerber die echtes, ehrliches Interesse am Mitwirken mitbringen, Engagement, Eigeninitiative, Einsatzfreude, und die Fähigkeit selbständig sowie im Team zu arbeiten. Außerdem Anpassungs- und Lernfähigkeit, Fairness und Geduld, Respekt der anderen Mentalität des Gastlandes gegenüber und Bescheidenheit. Gut wären Italienischkenntnisse, aber keine Voraussetzung.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 31/05/2018 to 30/09/2019

Placement location

Via Cavalieri di Vittorio Veneto 1, 95034 Bronte (CT)

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Voluntariado en Alemania con refugiados

asociacion building bridges

Erfurt, Germany

Apply

Project description

Voluntariado con refugiados en Alemania con todos los gastos pagados por el programa Erasmus+ de viaje, alojamiento, comida, transporte y dinero bolsillo. Program duration and start Projects available for the arrival in September 2018. Project – Heideruh e.V. Founded in 1945 by anti-fascists as resort for fellow campaigners  It serves as a hostel mainly for victims of fascism, their relatives and bereaved  The hostel offers 21 single and double bed rooms and an apartment for families as well as a camping ground for youth groups

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

35h per week  Working on weekends is required (therefore you will get appropriated time off in lieu)  Working on public holiday is required  You are going to work five days a week, according to the booking of guest groups you are either required to work on the weekends or not  You share your room with another volunteer of the same sex  In winter times it might be possible that the volunteers can have their own rooms

Training during the project

 Project work: open and administer an international facebook group, support the refugees, develop new projects together with the refugees  Work in the outdoors of Heidruh together with the refugees, like maintaining the play ground or working in the garden.  Support the house staff in their daily tasks and help in the kitchen with breakfast and the other meals  Develop your own projects and ideas with/for the guests  Make contact with people from all ages Gain insight in a historic project

Volunteer profile

 Our aim is to enhance the job chances for disadvantaged groups of people. Those who have been long-term unemployed are our target group.  Participants have to be without job, university enrollment or the like for at least 6 month  Between 18 and 30 years of age upon arrival  Mandatory willingness to learn German. It is advisable that applicant has German skills at level A2 on arrival Organisation Germany asks for a skype interview with participant before application is accepted. Please inform us about your personal preferences regarding the following projects a

Let’s Celebrate the EU Heritage!: A2 "Intercultural EUropean Heritage"

American International School of Transylvania

Dumbravita, Romania

Apply

Project description

LCtEH project will take place in the city of Baia Mare & 14 other rural & urban communities from the Metropolitan Area, within AIST & local partner premises. The geographic scope of the project covers Romania plus 8 other Programme countries: Danmark, France, Germany, Italy, Latvia, Spain, Portugal, United Kingdom, involving 12 other promoters acting as SOs. As 2018 was declared the "European Year of Cultural" we'll be celebrating diversity & richness of our European heritage. Our project has two youth mobility Activities, A1 & A2, that follow our project objectives: A2: "Intercultural European Heritage": 9 months long term activity: 15.09.2018-15.06.2019, 10 EVS youth mobilities: Target group: kindergarten (4-6) primary (7-11) secondary & highschool.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Travel: project coordinator informs counterparts in SOs/EVSers on travel routes & prices to match set budget. AIST reimburses eligible costs to SO/EVSer using transport documents, invoices & boarding passes/tickets needed to justify travel. AIST will provide volunteers with bikes for local transport & bus tickets for activities in rural areas outside Baia Mare city. Accommodation: EVSers will be hosted in safe & central lodging within Baia Mare, all facilities & utilities included. 120 euro/month - food allowance 60 euro/month - volunteer's allowance Romanian courses & mentoring included.

Training during the project

Learning environment & outcomes: EVSers will gain diverse social & educational skills & competences, that will be useful for their upcoming educational/training & employment opportunities. They will be involved in designing & implementing activities of social inclusion through nonformal educational methods practiced daily. EVSers will learn to plan, implement & adjust educational activities for children & youth, typical & underprivileged, from urban & rural environments as well. They'll also learn to be more flexible & adapt to changes as unexpected situations come up despite all planning

Volunteer profile

Volunteers, over 18 years old, need to be interested in learning & personal development, enjoy working with kids & youth, be open & tolerant to other cultures. Flexibility is required, as they'll work in a multicultural environment as part of an international team. Being responsible, positive, energetic, communicative & a basic level of English is desirable to ease communication during project activities & within the international project team of staff & volunteers.

Placement dates

A total of 39 week(s) during the period 15/09/2018 to 15/06/2019

Placement location

244A, strada Principala, RO- 0437145, Maramures Dumbravita

Looking for volunteers from

United Kingdom, Latvia, Germany, Denmark, Spain, Italy, Portugal, France

"The Awakening" at Plymouth Hope

Plymouth Hope

Plymouth, United Kingdom

Apply

Project description

Plymouth Hope was started in 2008 as a football club aimed at providing football activities to refugees and indigenous population living in the poorest areas of the city. Using football as a tool for community and social cohesion was its main focus and continued to be until in 2013: the organisation expanded to other sport-based community projects and youth work. From there our renewed vision became to continue to do what we were good at and also focus on supporting young people as well as engaging in work overseas using the same principles. The organisation has been widely recognised for its unique work of building bridges between communities and changing the race relations in Devon and Cornwall in the sporting and voluntary sector. Plymouth Hope has gone from a small community project to one of the most reputable organisations in the city. We now run the most diverse and multicultural events where participation is over 2000 per event.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Plymouth Hope can arrange either host families stay or rented accommodation. Volunteers will be collecting their pocket money as agreed, on weekly or monthly basis. PH will support the volunteers with opening a bank account if needed. Where a volunteer doesn't have a bank account, PH will consider giving them allowance in cash on a weekly basis to reduce any risks associated with cash handling of large sums. PH will take all the necessary steps to ensure the volunteer safety and positive integration at work and in the wider community.

Training during the project

Volunteers will be provided with an end of volunteering certificate. All other training provided come with certificates, specifically the volunteers will be able to attend training in first aid, coaching football and sport and roles, and understanding of functions and purpose of statutory and non-statutory agencies in the field of refugees.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for young people of all genders with strong interpersonal and communication skills, a good understanding and empathy towards vulnerable groups, including refugees, asylum-seekers and people from deprived areas. Volunteers should be committed to equal opportunities and anti-discriminatory practices and the promotion of diversity. The ideal applicant would have an avid interest in football and sport in general. We welcome some experience in leading groups or any experience of coaching football or sport to any groups/ages/genders (although we will provide full training for this).

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/03/2019 to 30/04/2020

Placement location

Plymouth

Looking for volunteers from

Ireland, Spain, Portugal, Hungary, Czech Republic, Estonia, Croatia, Poland

Placement topics

Reception and integration of refugees and migrants

Citizenship and democratic participation

Physical education and sport

Placement deadline

No application deadline

Project 494: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/4207_en


"The Awakening" at Success4All

Success4all

Newcastle-upon-Tyne, United Kingdom

Apply

Project description

We are a charity that tackles educational inequality with free to low-cost access to a peer tutor, online learning programmes, clubs and summer schools. Our motto is 'Young People Learning From Each Other'. We believe that young people learn best from each other, provided that the right relaxed learning environment is created. We run 7 Learning Hubs in deprived areas of Newcastle-upon-Tyne, numerous clubs and 2 Summer Schools per year, in the East End and West End of the city. We run Learning Hubs and Clubs in community centres, IT-centres or schools, for children & young people aged 8-25. At the moment, there are 4 computer coding clubs, a young entrepreneurs club, the West End Young Digital Artists group, an Animal Science Club and 2 music clubs. The Summer Schools have a different focus every year. With regards to organizing mobility activities, we have experience of organizing local mobility activities during our Summer Schools.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Success4all will arrange accommodation with host families, which can also provide food. The homes will be checked for health & safety. The volunteer will be given a health & safety tour of the house and be told what to do in case of a fire or emergency. Bus passes will be arranged. During the Summer Schools mini-buses will collect volunteers and children. The mentor assigned by S4a will be the first point of contact for practicalities and settling in the volunteer, and for solving minor problems. S4a will keep the volunteer and the family updated of all practical arrangements.

Training during the project

At S4a volunteers will receive a certificate from a national volunteer organisation in England, called V-inspired (www.vinspired.com) and upon completion of training, placement and logbook, they will receive a LEVEL 3 AQA Skills Award as Tutor/Befriender. All the volunteers of this project will be offered a Youthpass to document their learning, and will fill it in with the help of their project supervisor or mentors.

Volunteer profile

The ideal volunteers for Success4all will be preferably aged 21-30, highly motivated in working with children, young people, and families, and have an interest or a degree of previous experience in the field of non-formal education, youth work, youth clubs and summer camps. We would like to host caring, enthusiastic, funny, creative, sporty, musical, practical, socially engaged and/or entrepreneurial young people with or without relevant qualifications. We will expect volunteers to abide by our rules of conduct, which include, among others, a non-smoking and non-drinking policy.

Placement dates

A total of 36 week(s) during the period 01/06/2019 to 31/03/2020

Placement location

Newcastle-upon-Tyne

Looking for volunteers from

Estonia, Poland, Czech Republic, Spain, Croatia, Portugal, Hungary, Ireland

Placement topics

Reception and integration of refugees and migrants

Citizenship and democratic participation

Education and training

Placement deadline

No application deadline

Sign in / Join

Project 495: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/4205_en


"The Awakening" at the Grassmarket Community Project

Grassmarket Community Project

Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Apply

Project description

Grassmarket Community Project is a UK (Scottish) registered Charity which supports vulnerable and marginalised adults with support needs. These support needs include: mental health issues, physical impairments, learning disabilities, social isolation, homelessness and recovery from addictions. We provide a varied programme of cultural programmes and educational activities including: literacy classes, numeracy, IT, art, drama, book clubs, creative writing and photography. We also train, support and employ ex-members in 4 social businesses, including a tartan weaving and a furniture making workshop, which generate income for the charity whilst training them in vital skills and increasing their self-worth, independence and confidence. We seek to change the face of services to homeless adults and people with mental health issues by providing a safe, secure, bright and dynamic space where they can participate in stimulating and nurturing activities.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The accommodation arranged by the GCP is at a host family with own private room and shared bathroom and kitchen. This has been found to be a secure, safe and nurturing option - allowing the participant to make maximum use of their free time, whilst having all modern practicalities, conveniences and comforts such as laundry, cooking, Internet and heating guaranteed and taken care of. Travel to the Community Centre would be reimbursed. Alternatively, the EVS participant may have free hire of a bike during their stay and the city enjoys excellent cycle ways!

Training during the project

Volunteers will attend the EVS on-arrival and mid-term training. GCP will offer in-house certification of learning. The participant will also have the opportunity to participate in the John Muir Awards alongside the beneficiaries. GCP also use recognised training providers to certificate key training and qualifications. This includes the possibility to attend the following training sessions: First Aid Medical, Food Safety Hygiene and Walking Group Leader.

Volunteer profile

They would demonstrate to respect all persons regardless of ability, background, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation or gender. They would also demonstrate an interest in learning about Scottish/UK culture and local customs as well as be interested in working with people from disadvantaged backgrounds, sharing the daily life of the community including mealtimes and group tasks. The ideal volunteers will be enthusiastic to learn new practical skills while assisting in the delivery of sessions in a range of practical, training, creative and educational activities for the community members.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/10/2020

Placement location

Edinburgh

Looking for volunteers from

Croatia, Czech Republic, Estonia, Hungary, Ireland, Poland, Portugal

Placement topics

Social challenges

Citizenship and democratic participation

Placement deadline

No application deadline

EVS at the Circus School of Brussels (Ecole de Cirque de Bruxelles)

Ecole de Cirque de Bruxelles

Bruxelles, Belgium

Apply

Project description

The main objective of l'Ecole de Cirque de Bruxelles is to allow each and everyone to progress, to blossom and to strengthen their autonomy thanks to circus arts…whether they are young or old, amateur or professional, physically/mentally challenged or not, fortunate or underprivileged. The school is a microcosm of modern urban society. At l'Ecole de Cirque de Bruxelles, we have developped our own specific pedagogy, that is based on six main values : creativity, learning, pleasure, engagement, personal development and respect. The main fields of activity of the school are the following: Circus Arts Academy (Weekly classes), Professional Trainings, Social Projects (with disabled people and children with fewer opportunities), performing groups, international activities… The volunteers working with us at l'Ecole de Cirque de Bruxelles are mainly involved in 4 sectors : Administration, Pedagogy, Communication and Logistics.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation : the volunteers will be able to choose to be hosted by a partner of ours (Dynamo International) that has a community house for international volunteers. If the volunteers prefer to be hosted somewhere else, they can also choose their own accommodation, helped by their tutor. Food & transport : the volunteers will receive meal vouchers that they will be able to use to eat in our school. They will also receive a stated amount of money per month for buying their own food, paying accommodation and transport.

Training during the project

The volunteers will never be alone : they will be supported by their mentor for all practical and well being aspects, and by a reference person for all the activities of the circus school they will be involved into. For their own personal development and in the frame of our circus lessons dedicated to adults, we also encourage the volunteers (if they want) to discover our pedagogy by following one or several circus techniques. This experience which will allow them to feel all the benefits of this practice on their social and personal development.

Volunteer profile

Four sectors have been specifically selected in order to be able to qualitatively host a volunteer : Administration, Communication, Logistics and Pedagogy (more info here : https://www.ecbru.be/accueil/sve/info.html) . We are thus looking for volunteers who have experience in one or several of those domains (it is possible to work in more than one of those sectors). To integrate our team, it’s important to be open-minded, share our values, willing to work in team, have of course interest in our circus projects, a great sense of adaptability, and know a minimum level of French.

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 02/09/2019 to 01/09/2020

Placement location

3, rue Picard, 1000 Bruxelles

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Physical education and sport

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 26/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 497: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/4092_en


Budde-Haus Cultural Center

Leipzig, Germany

Apply

Project description

The Budde Haus is a sociocultural centre in Leipzig. The center has a small garden, garden house, sculpture house and a beer garden. In the focus of the centre are offers and courses in the areas of culture, education and encounters. Diverse cultural initiatives and associations are both long term and temporal residents of the Budde Haus. Budde Haus offers a wide range of programs: movies and literature, art and concerts, festivities and celebrations. The target group of the events and of the centre are all resident living in the area. The aim of the center is to create an open, vivid cultural location which satisfies demands in the areas of culture, free time and social contacts.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Normally all the volunteers live in shared flats: have their own room but share a kitchen and a bathroom with 3 other volunteers. Food money will be paid out to you as well as money to buy the local transportation monthly ticket or you just buy a bike. Leipzig is a very nice city to ride a bike.

Training during the project

We will help you to find a German language course which fits your needs and level. The volunteer will also attend two seminars for volunteers organized by the German National Agency.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for one volunteer, who is: - interested in art and music, creative and open-minded - like working with people - has B1/B2 level German knowledge - is fit to help with arrangements of tables, carrying drinks

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 07/10/2019 to 06/10/2020

Placement location

Leipzig

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Finland, France, Croatia, Luxembourg, Italy, Spain, Lithuania, Poland, Sweden, Slovakia, Slovenia, Latvia

Placement topics

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 03/04/2019

Sign in / Join

Project 498: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/4090_en


Kindergarten Goyastraße - sport, healthy lifestyle & outdoor activity

Leipzig, Germany

Apply

Project description

The main concept of Kindergarten Goaystrasse is to include sport activities and a healthy lifestyle in every kid's life. In the kindergarten children have 10 friendly group rooms, a studio, a children's kitchen and a multipurpose room. A green outdoor area with various play equipment, a sandbox, various sitting areas and a large terrace area invite kids to play and run outdoors. Children can be included in the facility from the first year of their life. The volunteer will be working together with the educators, supporting their daily work with children. He/she will have an opportunity to develop their own interesting projects and activities for children.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Normally all the volunteers are living in shared flats, have their own room - but share kitchen and bathroom with 3 other volunteers. Food money will be paid out to you as well as money to buy the local transportation monthly ticket or you just buy a bike. Leipzig is a very nice city to ride a bike. If you wish we can as well try to organise a host family.

Training during the project

We will help you to find a German language course which fits your needs and level.

Volunteer profile

Do you love working with children? Are you creative and open-minded? Do you have any interesting hobbies that you can share with others? (Music, sports, art ... everything is welcome) Are you a responsible person? Do you have a lot of new ideas for fun&educative activities? Are you willing to learn German? If yes, then you are a perfect candidate for this position! Don't hesitate to apply, we are waiting for you!

KITA Waldkindergarten - discover nature in the Forest Kindergarten

Leipzig, Germany

Apply

Project description

Kindergarden “Waldkindergarten” in Leipzig offers places for up to 60 children aged 2 – 7 years and focuses on „natural education”. The Forest Kindergarten (Waldkindergarten) means that the children go into the forest every day, no matter the weather. There are places which can be used by the children and educators during the day. The children have the chance to discover nature every day with their senses, they discover the way of life in harmony of the forest and find out that they are a part of this.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Normally all the volunteers are living in shared flats, have their own room - but share kitchen and bathroom with 3 others volunteers. Food money will be paid out to you as well as money to buy the local transportation monthly ticket or you just buy a bike. Leipzig is a very nice city to ride a bike. If you wish we can as well try to organise a host family.

Training during the project

We will help you to find a German language course which fits your needs and level.

Volunteer profile

The following points are important for our kindergarten regarding the selection of the volunteers: Willingness to go to the forest with the children, no matter the weather - this the important point! Interest in work with children age 2-6 years Interest in nature and environment Interest to learn German Creativity - because the forest kindergarten is “without toys”, the creativity in the game is important

Go East! UK volunteers needed for Klitschko Foundation

Klitschko Foundation

Kiev, Ukraine

Apply

Project description

Klitschko Foundation is a nationwide charitable organization established in 2003. Since then, we have been successfully implementing projects in the field of sports, education and science. Klitschko Foundation's mission is to create an environment that supports Ukrainian young people and provides them with opportunities for development. The motto of the Foundation is "Fight for your dreams". We believe that everything is possible. In pursuit of this, we design and introduce social projects, locate additional finances for them and develop cooperative partnerships. Our goal is to increase the number of Ukrainian young people who choose to pursue self-development and a healthy lifestyle. To achieve this, we work in three main areas: 1) We support sports events and projects that encourage a healthy lifestyle. 2) We promote learning opportunities for young people 3) We conduct international scientific conferences to develop a scientific community and promote breakthrough ideas.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Klitschko Foundation’s accommodation is provided within one of the sports schools in Kiev, which has residential facilities for its students. The volunteer will have a private single room and share other living environments with the residents. Food and transport money will be provided.

Training during the project

The volunteer will receive Ukrainian classes and on-the-job training and support.

Volunteer profile

This project is only open to UK residents aged 18-25 (preferably). The ideal volunteer can show empathy, motivation and interest in youth work and sport. We are looking for a volunteer wanting to make a difference in the world, who is up for standing out from the crowd and accompanying others in doing the same. Preferably we are looking for someone with some previous volunteering experience, locally or internationally, and a degree awareness of what volunteering means and how organisations can benefit from volunteer involvement. benefit from volunteer involvement.

Placement dates

A total of 38 week(s) during the period 01/02/2019 to 31/10/2019

Placement location

Kiev

Looking for volunteers from

United Kingdom

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Health and wellbeing

Physical education and sport

Placement deadline

No application deadline

EVS - New Horizons - 6 month project in POLAND

Ośrodek Pomocy Społecznej w Swarzędzu

Swarzędz, Poland

Apply

Project description

Ośrodek Pomocy Społecznej in Swarzędz (Poland) is a hosting and coordinating organization. We have had 13 volunteers in 12 EVS projects since 2007. Now we are looking for a new volunteer on the term from March 2019 till August 2019 (6 months stay and activity in Poland). More information about the hosting placement: Main tasks of the volunteer in the project will be realized in the youth centers - specialists centers for children, who live in families which have different social problems (addictions, unemployment, educational difficulties) and in the senior centers with elderly people. The volunteers will help in organizing various activities for children and seniors like: sport activities, educational activities (concerning emotions, solving conflicts, assertiveness, prevention of alcohol and drug addiction, knowledge about human relations etc.), artistic activities, cook courses, doing a homework.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer lives in Poznań at the student house in a triple room with two Polish students. From Monday to Friday the volunteer goes to work to Swarzędz (around 20 minutes by bus). First days after arrival are devoted on knowing how things work :) Shopping, getting to know surrounding area, learning to use a public transport etc. We provide bus and tram tickets, pocket money, food allowance, money for travel from home to Poznań and from Poznań to home, Polish language course with an international certificate, contact information to other EVS volunteers in Poznań.

Training during the project

Work language is English but also we provide very good Polish language course at Adam Mickiewicz University with international certificate. Actions taken in the project are also orientated on gaining new skills and competences connected with working with children, youth, learning language, budget and free time management. The volunteer will gain a Youthpass and a language certificate so that chances on the labour market will increase. Living in a new, different than before environment will influence on expansion of the volunteer's horizons and checking himself in the new conditions.

Volunteer profile

Open, motivated and English speaking person.

Placement dates

A total of 26 week(s) during the period 01/03/2019 to 29/08/2019

Placement location

Poznańska 25, 62-020 Swarzędz

Looking for volunteers from

Italy, Austria, Sweden, Czech Republic, Germany, Netherlands

Placement topics

Social challenges

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

Tea 4 Unity

Fundacja Laja

Cieszyn, Poland

Apply

Project description

Project "Tea4Unity" Activities include: - work in Laja Tea House (learning about tea culture, tea degustations, organizing regional culinary evenings, food degustations) - work for Tea Festival (in July 2018 we will organize 10th edition). Preparations last the whole year. This is a multicultural 2-days long festival, with over 30 workshops, 10 concerts, 12 traveler's lectures, 12 tea degustations) and many more. Every year around 1000 visitors from Poland, Czech Rep. and Slovakia come to visit the festival, over 50 local and international volunteers support the organisation of the festival. Thus focusing on active and conscious free time spending with respect towards nature in friendly atmosphere learning about various cultures and lifestyles.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

5-persons volunteer flat in the center of the city. International group of people. 2 minutes to the train station, 1 minute to the main square, 5 minutes to the park. Internet included. Food organized by volunteers themselves- 4,5 Euro/day. Transportation rarely needed - bicycles are provided, other activities by train covered by the project.

Training during the project

On-arrival and Mid-term trainings provided by NA. Other internal trainings together with organisation's members.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for an active person, that likes to learn but can act also on their own. Creative, open to new challenges with positive approach interested in environmental topics. A person that likes to organize events and communicate with others and work in group.

Placement dates
