Project 503: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/3850_en


Volunteers stop motion

PHOENIX s.c.s. per azioni

Rutigliano, Italy

Apply

Project description

The project "Volunteers stop motion" is designed to host 2 volunteers from Spain (1) and Greece (1), who will perform activities within the Dual Diagnosis Center andPsychiatric Community located in Rutigliano (Puglia, Italy) managed by Phoenix Cooperative for a period of six months. The two centers are part of the so-called PSYCHO-SOCIAL REHABILITATION AREA of the complex of services offered by Phoenix to people with both problems of drug addiction and mental health. The psycho-social rehabilitation area is a critical area for patients who have completed their therapeutic path and need to be reintegrated into the social context through activities which helps them to return to "everyday life". Volunteers will support operators and guests of the centers in carrying out different activities (Web TV, daily activities of the centers, creating stop motion and audio video work) seven hours daily from 09:30 to 16:30 from Monday to Friday.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

-Travel costs: 100% covered (up to the maximum travel gant per participant imposed by the Erasmus+ Programme) - Accomododation : Apartment in Torre a Mare (20 minutes away from Rutigliano) with single rooms, shared kitchen and bathroom, free Wifi - Pocket Money: distributed once a month - Local transport costs: 100% covered Food costs: - Lunch: offered by the centers during working days - Breakfast , dinner (and lunch during free days): prepared by the volunteers themselves (covered by a contribution of 150 € per month distribuited every month)

Training during the project

- Pre departure training – SENDING ORGANIZATION Main content: methodologies and tools to prevent and manage risk situation and conflict - On arrival training - ANG - On arrival training - PHOENIX S.C.S. Main content: role in the structure, apartment cleaning rules, tools and methods of management of possible critical situations that arise with patients / staff / other volunteer, general information - OLS - Italian language course - Linguistic support – PHOENIX S.C.S. Italian language course 4 working hours per week - Mid-term evaluation– ANG

Volunteer profile

- age between 18 and 30 years old - very motivated to work in multicultural context - very motivated to being involved in an international experience - willing to try to learn new languages - willing to understand Erasmus+ Programme - proactive attitude - ability to manage potential critical situations

Placement dates

A total of 24 week(s) during the period 01/11/2018 to 31/10/2019

Placement location

S.P. 240 delle Grotte Orientali km 13,8, 70018 Rutigliano

Looking for volunteers from

Greece, Bulgaria, Romania, Turkey, Spain, France, Belgium, Portugal

Placement topics

Health and wellbeing

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 30/09/2019

A house for handicapped people

Behindertenstätten Eupen

Eupen, Belgium

Apply

Project description

In this residential home live persons with a handicap who by daytime exert a job outside this house. A great deal of the task will consist of the care and looking after of persons with a handicap. These are in general slower in their rhythm and the volunteer will have to learn to cope with this slow rhythm. The volunteer can improve the quality of life of the handicapped people. This can be done in different ways. Often this happens by means of small individual activities. Es handelt sich um eine Wohnstätte für Personen mit Behinderung, die tagsüber einer Arbeit außer Haus nachgehen. Von daher findet die Betreuung vorwiegend in den Nachmittagsstunden bzw. in den Abendstunden und am Wochenende sowie an Feiertagen statt. Ein Großteil der Aufgaben liegen in der Betreuung der Menschen mit Behinderung. Die von uns begleiteten Menschen haben alle eine starke Beeinträchtigung.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Wohnung im Stadtzentrum Nahrungsmittelbudget für die Freiwillgen sowie Einnahme von Mahlzeiten auf der Arbeitsstelle Zur Verfügung stellen eines Fahrrades

Training during the project

Aufnahmetraining, Mid-term traning, Sprachkurs, fachspezifische Beratung,...

Volunteer profile

Community Of Open Learners (COOL)

International Initiatives fro Cooperation

Razlog, Bulgaria

Apply

Project description

The project will be upgrade of a previous projects implemented by association IIC. The project will host 24 volunteers from programme (16 volunteers) and partner countries (8 volunteers) in different six-months and twelve-months periods which will carry out their voluntary activities in the territory of the Municipality of Razlog, Bulgaria in the frame of 24 months. The project envisage 4 six months period in which will take part 5 volunteers from programme and partner countries in each period and 2 twelve months periods in which 2 volunteers from programme countries will participate in each period and who will support the activities of the other groups. For the realisation of the foreseen activities and aims of the project the association is planning to work with partners from programme and partner countries as each organisation will send 1 volunteer for each period and that's how each group of volunteers will consist of mixed cultures and nationalities.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation, food and pocket money are covered by the Erasmus + programme and travel costs are according to the distance calculator of European commission.

Training during the project

The volunteers they will have a chance to attend an onarrival training, a mid term training which will be organise from Bulgarian NA in Sofia.The host organisation will organise for them a team building activities.

Volunteer profile

The volunteers have to be between 18-30 years old, they have to speak english and ofcourse to looking for some new adventure in their daily life.They have to be motivated to learn another language and another culture.The task of the volunteers will be to organise attractive activities for the school students and children from the region using non-formal learning methods as well as interactive clubs and classes which will attract the other part of the local community.

Future Kindergartens of Europe 2 project in Hungary

VILAGJARO ONKENTES TANACSADO ES SZOLGALTATO NONPROFIT KORLATOLT FELELOSSEGU TARSASAG

Debrecen, Hungary

Apply

Project description

We are looking for highly motivated candidates to join our approved EVS project in Debrecen, working with children in traditional kindergartens. There will be 6 volunteers from different countries (Portugal, France, Romania, Germany, Spain, and Italy) in the same project. They will be assisting in day-to-day activities of kindergartens under professional supervision. In these activities, volunteers can try their existing skills, creativity in music and handicrafts, and improve them. We aim to create awareness and openness towards other people and other cultures with creative activities, a healthy lifestyle, and intercultural media. Volunteers will also be involved in the activities of Világjáró Önkéntes in which they can get acquainted with the Erasmus + Program and have the opportunity to develop their ideas within personal projects. They will have the chance to go to schools and present the EVS as well as share their own country and culture.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation and food will be provided. The volunteers will share equipped rooms with 2-3 separate beds in a university dormitory with other local and international students. Internet connection, shared kitchen with all equipment, showers and clothes dryer will also be available. Volunteers will organize the food themselves for the weekends (for that purpose they get a lump sum of money monthly). During weekdays, they get preordered meals from a restaurant in the city center. We facilitate their local transportation by buying monthly bus tickets.

Training during the project

During their voluntary service, on-arrival training and mid-term evaluation are included as well as the opportunity to take Hungarian language classes in the official online platform and a language school in Debrecen.

Volunteer profile

Candidates applying for this EVS should meet the following requirements: - PORTUGUESE or ITALIAN or ROMANIAN or FRENCH nationality -Age between 18-30; -Available for the whole duration of the volunteering period and pre-departure training; -Interest in the work with children and youth or social work in general; -Creative - interested in creating handicrafts, planning&organizing activities, sharing own culture; -Basic English knowledge is a must; -Dedicated, open-minded, communicative and resourceful; -Patient, flexible, easy-going; -Able to work in a team.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/09/2018 to 30/09/2019

Placement location

Csapó Street 76. 8/29., 4029 Debrecen

Looking for volunteers from

France

Placement topics

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

ESC volunteer to attract youth via marketing/social media

Vicki Brown House

's-Hertogenbosch, Netherlands

Apply

Project description

The main goal of the project (ESC volunteer) is to attract more youth to the Vicki Brown House in ‘s-Hertogenbosch by organising activities such as Artistic assistance for children from 7 to 12 years and from 12 to 16 years. Creativity is used as an aid to convey feelings, fears or desires in a pleasant way. In this way, the Vicki Brown House tries to relate, understand, and place a thorough experience. During the meetings, the children make use of artistic means, such as drawing, painting and carpentry. Stories, poems and music, adapted to the age and interest of the child, support the assignments. Based on the work done, conversations are conducted, where the children listen to each other and recognize each other. The fellow contact is an important part of the meetings. For youth of 14-18 years other activities are organised, see http://www.vbrownhuis.nl/jeugd/jongeren-14-18-jaar/.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Pocket money and food allowance are provided. Dutch lessons are provided. Bicycle is available. You will be part of 10 European Solidarity Corps volunteers you will have your own room.

Training during the project

There will be an on-arrival workshop and a mid-term workshop. Dutch lessons are provided

Volunteer profile

Open-minded energetic, social, creative and curious youngsters who like to communicate in written and oral with youngsters so also through social media. The volunteer likes to organize and plan events. Marketing minded.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/04/2019 to 31/05/2020

Furthermore, the volunteer can set up projects for an eTwinning knowledge exchange. Moreover, there is a possibility to be involved with an EEP ‘s-Hertogenbosch, where the ESC volunteer can join planning ideas, observe or even teach lessons in other schools as well as taking part in a play with other volunteers. The ESC volunteer will develop new activities such as playing games during short breaks and lunch breaks. Ideas for this can be taken from the foundations TEAMUP.Depending on the interest and talents of the volunteer, he/she can help the professional with cultural activities for example, music, dance, act, craftsmanship or physical education. During the summer holidays the ESC volunteer will assist with a Spanish Summercamp.

Great opportunities at a health care provider in the Netherlands

Stichting Vivent

's-Hertogenbosch, Netherlands

Apply

Project description

The EVS volunteer 1 will work in two homes in ‘s-Hertogenbosch, de Hooghe Clock and Het hof van Hintham. He or she will try together with experienced volunteers to improve physical activity for their “clients” (patients). This can be sports in general but also activities at the table such as ball games at the table and the “tovertafel” https://tovertafel.nl/zorginnovatie-dementie/. Moreover, improving experiences through listening music is important. A volunteer who plays for example guitar is most welcome. The EVS volunteer will help to organize creative activities as well. This is to improve the domestic feeling and have extra attention for the clients. EVS volunteer 2 Here the focus will be to further develop the animal grazing (child farm) and a butterfly garden together with experienced volunteer. Furthermore, it will be the same activities as with EVS volunteer 1. During the project the activities can be extended according the talents of the EVS volunteers.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will live with other volunteers in ’s-Hertogenbosch (one hour from Amsterdam). A bicycle is available.

Training during the project

There will be an on-arrival workshop and a mid-termworkshop with other EVS volunteers. Dutch lessons are provided.

Volunteer profile

EVS volunteer 1: Open-minded, social, and creative youngsters who like to help people to feel at home. Like to organize and plan events. EVS volunteer 2: Open-minded, social, and creative youngsters who like to work outside, like animals and like to help people as well to feel at home. Like to organize and plan events. Show schoolchildren the butterfly garden.

Europe and Youth participation EVS in Amiens, France

Europe Direct Hauts-de-France

Amiens, France

Apply

Project description

Europe Direct Hauts-de-France is an official EU information centre in Northern France. Our main goals are to bring the EU closer to its citizens and to encourage the youth of the region to take part in a mobility programme. The main tasks of the volunteers will be: - to prepare and give presentations about their country, the EVS and the EU to different groups (pupils, students, adults, young people with fewer opportunities, etc.), to speak about their own experiences, cultures, customs and diversity. - to welcome the general public at the office and during fairs and forums - to promote the European Solidarity Corps to the youth of the region - to create educational tools (e.g.games and posters) and new concepts for presentations - to help the team in the organisation of events (debates, Europe Day, European day of languages…) - to raise awareness, especially among young people, towards the upcoming European elections

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will stay in a shared house, where they will have their own room. The volunteers will get 12€/day for food and pocket money.

Training during the project

During their stay, the volunteers will take part in 2 seminars organised by the French National Agency. One on arrival and the other mid-stay. The volunteers will get free French language classes at the University of Picardie Jules Verne.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for highly-motivated volunteers ready to commit until December 2019. We are looking for volunteers only from Germany. As the project will be in French, the volunteers should have knowledge in French OR a strong desire to learn the language.

Placement dates

A total of 40 week(s) during the period 01/04/2019 to 31/12/2019

Placement location

8 Rue Albert Dauphin, 80000 Amiens

Looking for volunteers from

Germany

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Education and training

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 511: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/3221_en


Do the (r) evolution! vol.5 in Maribor

Pekarna Magdalenske mreže Maribor

Maribor, Slovenia

Apply

Project description

Hosting organisation, Pekarna Magdalenske mreže is a non-governmental, non-profit institution, founded in 1997 as an organisation for encouraging, supporting programme and project cooperation among individuals and groups conducting cultural, informative and humanitarian activities. Our organisation is small, we work with a team of paid staff and with co-workers and local volunteers. Programme-wise our organisation works in three main areas: independent culture, youth/volunteer work and civil engagement. The main aim of the project Do the (r) evolution! vol.5 is to develop high quality activities for young people in the fields of youth, art, creation and civil engagement with the help of informal and non formal learning. The project will last for 10 months and give the possibility to participate in the formation of cultural, youth, youth-information.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Organization is a part of independent cultural center (Pekarna Cultural Centre) in northwest Slovenia, Maribor. Maribor is the second largest city of Slovenia with about 96,000 inhabitants and the capital of Stajerska and is embraced by Pohorje forests. Volunteers can live within striking distance of Pekarna Cultural Centre in rental flat (single room). Volunteers will get pocket money and food money - every month and bicycle - each volunteer gets 300 euro monthly. They can cook at their flat, the kitchen is fully equipped. The travelling costs are covered.

Training during the project

Spoken English in Maribor is on the level of other European countries in the nearby region, but most of the public events are in Slovene language, nevertheless we will offer Slovene language courses. In our organisation we try to include EVS volunteers in all organisation's activities, that seem interesting to them or that they want to learn, and we actively encourage them in creating and performing their own projects. Volunteer will have on arrival training and mid term training organized by Slovene National agency.

Volunteer profile

At Pekarna Magdalenske mreže Maribor we want to host volunteers who are enthusiastic, sociable, creative and open for different opportunities and collaborations. We are looking for three volunteers (from September 2019 to June 2020) for our host project Do the (r) evolution! vol.5 More information: http://www.infopeka.org/web/?p=68196

Placement dates

A total of 41 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 01/06/2020

Placement location

Evs for Cascina Goliarda ONLY for Spanish volunteer

Cooperativa La.Co.Sa

Curtatone (Mn), Italy

Apply

Project description

At Cascina Goliarda the volunteer will be involved in the activities of Cascina Goliarda, a B&B in Curtatone, near Mantova, run by Cooperative La.Co.Sa, that employ personnel with psychological problem reported by Mental Healthy Dipartment of Carlo Poma Hospital. The building is composed by 6 rooms and a common kitchen for breakfast/lunch/dinner, and it can host 24 clients. The volunteers will support the coordinators with the activities of front-office, back-office, booking, receiving, garden and henhouse maintenance, rooms supervision and collaboration with the staff composed by users from Mental Healthy Department. The activities are divided into the week from Monday to Friday, but sometimes are provided activities in the weekend and in this case the volunteer can rest in the days after the weekend.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will be hosted in a flat provided by Cooperative La.Co.Sa. and settled in Mantova. The flat will be share with other volunteers. The flat is composed: a kitchen/living room, a bathroom and share bedroom. The volunteer will receive a pocket money por month and a variable amount for food if will eat/not eat with the staff of the cooperative. The volunteers can go to work by bus or by bicycle because the flat is near of the B&B, while travel costs for free time will be on charge of the volunteer

Training during the project

Trainings for the volunteer: 1. Pre-Departure Training, organized by SENDING ORGANISATION 2. On-Arrival Training, organized by NA of program Erasmus + Youth 3. Mid-term training organized by NA of program Erasmus + Youth 4. Final Evaluation, organized by SENDING ORGANISATION

Volunteer profile

The Volunteer will be: open minded, flexible interested in the project sociable and patient responsible and motivated BASIC ITALIAN LEVEL

Placement dates

A total of 32 week(s) during the period 01/03/2019 to 30/11/2019

Placement location

Via Al Lago 7, 46010 Curtatone (Mn)

Evs to help Migrants ONLY for french volunteer

Cooperativa La.Co.Sa

Curtatone (MN), Italy

Apply

Project description

From 2015 the Cooperative La.Co.Sa is involved in migration projects and reception for people who request international protection, in particular runs a host community and some of cohabitation accommodation of migrants in the outskirts of Mantova, which houses families with children, single women and lonely men. The project deals the support of the aspects of the daily lives of the guests, the aim is to make them independent, at different levels, promoting wellness, spread the culture of integration and sharing, and preventing, as far as possible, situations of marginalization, isolation, deviance and conflict, also supporting them in their legal path request asylum. Migrant area want to promote activities for international protection by managing all aspects of residential, the daily lives of the guests, the legal aspects, the care of children accommodated, literacy and other activities support;

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will be hosted in a flat provided by Cooperative La.Co.Sa. and settled in Mantova and share with other volunteers. The flat will be shared with another volunteer and it has double bedroom, a kitchen/living room and a bathroom. The volunteer will receive a pocket money por month and a variable amount for food if will eat/not eat with the staff of the cooperative.

Training during the project

Trainings for the volunteer: 1. Pre-Departure Training, organized by SENDING ORGANISATION 2. On-Arrival Training, organized by NA of program Erasmus + Youth 3. Mid-term training organized by NA of program Erasmus + Youth 4. Final Evaluation, organized by SENDING ORGANISATION

Volunteer profile

The Volunteer will be: open minded, flexible interested in the project sociable and patient responsible and motivated

Placement dates

A total of 32 week(s) during the period 01/03/2019 to 30/11/2019

Placement location

Via Al Lago 7, 46010 Curtatone (MN)

Volunteering in ALPA

ALPA

Aix en Provence, France

Apply

Project description

ALPA is a social and solidarity association that has been committed since 1989 to the right to housing. This organization manages a social residence which accommodates about thirty residents; most of them have a rather chaotic path in terms of access to housing. ALPA is helping them to rebuild themselves and build a personal project. In this residence people can find listening, reception and accompaniment. The volunteers will integrate the social residence; they will have the opportunity to be in direct contact with the people who are hosted on a daily basis. They will be involved in the implementation of cultural and artistic activities for the residents (especially with a theater) but also of environmental activities (in the shared garden of ALPA with the collaboration of a social center). Volunteer will be in charge to animate these activities for the residents.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will be hosted in the social residence in a private flat. They will receive from ALPA money for food, pocket money and local transports.

Training during the project

The volunteers will participate to the 2 seminars organised by the french national agency during the first month after their arrival and after 6 months as mid term seminar. The coordinating organisation Hors Pistes will also organise some trainings in Marseille with regional EVS coordinated

Volunteer profile

The volunteer needs to be between 18 and 30 years old. He/She doesn’t need to have a diploma to apply to the EVS but we would like someone who is: - Motivated by the mission - Open minded and able to communicate with other people - Being at ease at leading workshops (of course helped with the tutor) - Sensitive to the discovery of other cultures - Who wants to develop and animate cultural and environmental activities

Placement dates

A total of 54 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

Aix en Provence

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Aid to teaching Dutch

Institut Notre-Dame de Loverval

Loverval, Belgium

Apply

Project description

he association "Institute of Notre Dame Loverval" provides education from kindergarten to the end of the traditional humanities. www.indloverval.be General educational school, our Institute has the ambition to provide all students with an intellectual formation value to pursue higher education and to train young people, blossomed, respectful of others, responsible for their actions and able to integrate into civil society. We are ready to welcome young people whose first language is Dutch to develop workshops conversationsunder the guidance of our teachers, . We believe that "native speakers" will allow our students to gain not only additional knowledge but also further practice which will master the accent of the taught language. Other activities are offered to them : - Participation in the organization of the "Review" (show performed by final year students) - "Afternoon discoveries" (chemistry workshops, computer, math) - Conversations tables - School works

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

1. Accomodation Two furnished houses situated inside the school grounds are foreseen for the volunteers. The accommodations include a fully equipped kitchen: fridge, stove, kitchen utensils and dishes, a lounge with TV and two communicating bedrooms. Regarding the bedding, only towels are not provided but will be furnished by the Coord Org. A washing machine, connections wifi and TV are available. 2. Food an allowance to buy food to be prepared in their home is given to the volunteers. 3. Transport The volunteers will have a monthly bus pass to travel to the city of Charleroi.

Training during the project

Language Training Belgian Service Club Namur, coordinating organization, in association with the Institute of Notre Dame de Loverval, will take measures to ensure that volunteers receive, throughout their stay, a language training (French as foreign language) in a competent school. The program of the service will be accordingly adapted. In addition, BSC Namur grant a license for learning French online (via OLS) Sport, cultural and horticultural activities are also possible

Volunteer profile

The volunteers we would like to participate would be interested in the world of education, have good knowledge of the Dutch and wish to integrate into a school for young people of all ages and have the willingness to learn French. A CV with photo and a letter of motivation are required Number of volunteers: 2

Placement dates

A total of 44 week(s) during the period 02/09/2019 to 30/06/2020

Placement location

chaussée de Philippevile 35, 6280 Loverval

Only applicants fr. POLAND: Mit HochDrei in der politischen Bildung

HochDrei e.V.

Potsdam, Germany

Apply

Project description

We applied for funding with a polish partner organisation. Therefore we can only consider applications from people living in Poland! You are going to support our activities in the field of international youth exchanges and civic eduation. Apart fom that we encourage you to carry out your own project with the help of our pedagogical staff. Some work will take place at the seminar house: You assist in preparing/implementing our activities: organise the seminar rooms, assist children/youth groups in selforganisation, look after them, be a point of contact and explain educational activities. Beside, there will be office-related tasks: Helping to acquire participants, documentation, research on topics or practical information, collecting data or represent our organisation and our offers for young people on events. Your work will be very varied if you are ready to take own initiative, bring in ideas and the motivation to realise them. Please check our website before applying!

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

You're going to live in a studio with kitchenette in a side-building of the seminar house. There's a separate entrance for more privacy. Nevertheless, you need to be aware of the fact of sharing the courtyard with guestgroups. Especially in summer this can entail a lively atmosphere in front of the window. The house is 10 minutes by foot from the historical center of Potsdam and 5 minutes by tramway from the HochDrei office. You get monthly money for food but during seminars you are envolved it can be necessary that you take part at the shared meals.

Training during the project

We highly appreciate your attendence at our yearly qualification seminar for trainers of international youth exchanges to get to know methods, foster important skills and understand our pedagogical focus and principles. Furthermore you can always, in agreement with us, attend other trainings and seminars at HochDrei. If necessary we provide language support so that you will soon be able to work in german language and live your life in Potsdam.

Volunteer profile

Project with polish sending organisation. Therefore application only considered if you live in Poland at the moment. You agree with the main principles of our association diversity and gender equality. You are open towards our different target groups (children, youth, refugees…). We don't expect any special work experience or education background, but you should be willing to learn and try new things. We expect you to work sometimes on weekends – in exchange for free days during the week. Every interest or skill you bring is welcome and we are happy if we can make use of it in our work.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/07/2019 to 30/09/2020

Placement location

Schulstraße 9, 14482 Potsdam

Looking for volunteers from

Poland

Social challenges

Education and training

Volunteer in a Montessori school in Tirol, Austria - only EU/EEA

SCHULGARTEN - Aktive Montessorischule Telfs

Telfs, Austria

Apply

Project description

Find all details and how to apply directly on www.mei-infoeck.at/volunteer We do not accept applications through this portal, only via e-mail, as described in the project description (follow the link above) Only open for EU or EEA residents. * We live “green”: Our School is situated amidst the Tyrolean mountains Alps, is located at the edge of the town Telfs in western Tyrol and is surrounded by green fields. * We work actively: Our huge garden is a learning field as well as an adventurous and recreational playground for our children. One day a week teaching takes place outdoor in the surrounding forests, using the offerings of nature for learning and exploring. * We teach child-based: Momentarily, our school hosts 69 children aged 6 to 15. Each one of them is treated like an intelligent, emotional and mature human being and is coached based on personal possibilities, abilities and interests by our pedagogic team (12 teachers). All details on www.mei-infoeck.at/volunteer

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

We offer a flat for our two volunteers. Each volunteer has his/her own room and there are shared facilities, kitchen, living room and bathroom. Transportation to work is not needed, everything is within walking-distance. Local people speak a German dialect (“Tirolerisch”). The majority of people in Tyrol can speak English, especially young people. The volunteer will receive monthly food money and EUR 150,-- of pocket money. All details in the proejct description www.mei-infoeck.at/volunteer

Training during the project

The volunteer will have regular meetings with her or his mentor and with Angelika Widauer of the hosting organisation, to talk about the wellbeing or about the project activities. In the hosting organisation the volunteer will receive orientation and support for the activities from the main responsible employee and from the entire team. The coordinating organisation InfoEck will hold a regular group meeting with all volunteers in Tyrol in order to share experiences. More info in the Project description www.mei-infoeck.at/volunteer

Volunteer profile

We would be happy to host a volunteer who: · wants to experience working with school children aged 6 to 9 years or 12-14 years and is eager to participate actively · is interested in learning more about another culture and different backgrounds · is open-minded, friendly, enthusiastic, creative and communicative · is willing to reflect the work · is motivated to learn German · brings her/his own culture and interests into the project You need to send your CV and the application form via E-mail to Mrs. Angelika Widauer to apply: www.mei-infoeck.at/volunteer Only EU/EEA!

Placement dates

A total of 45 week(s) during the period 02/09/2019 to 10/07/2020

Placement location

Georgenweg 64, 6410 Telfs

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Project 519: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/2745_en


DIAKONIA3

Diakonia Agapis

THIVA, Greece

Apply

Project description

“Diakonia Agapis" is a Chronically Diseases Infirmary belonging to the Holy Metropolis of Thiva and Levadia and offers social services to persons seeking personal, psychological, medical, recreational and any other form of support. The inmates live inside the infirmary and the personnel takes care of them in accordance to medical and social department meeting the individual needs of each inmate. The Infirmary is located in Thiva city center in a multi-story building. The social services provided by trained and specialized personnel for this work. Daily schedule involve personal care and keeping company to inmates, implementation of creative activities, and collaboration with other institution to promote voluntarism. We expect that young volunteers will express their willingness to participate in voluntary actions and give joy and happiness to inmates and gain personal experiences and develop life skills.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers’ accommodation will be in a rented flat with single bedrooms and shared bathroom & toilet, kitchen and sitting room. Volunteers are responsible for keeping the room and house, along with the other volunteers, clean and to take care of the equipment inside the house (electrical equipment, TV, beds, tables, chairs, among others). In case of damage due to willful negligence they may be asked to pay the repairing costs. Lunch and dinner will be prepared by professional cooks and provided on a daily No transportation is needed since the flat in 50 meter away from the Infirmary.

Training during the project

An introduction practical training will be realized at the beginning of EVS from the supervisors of the nursing department and from the social work department. The training will include practices fro volunteers to follow and actions to avoid and a special emphases will be given to safety of volunteers and inmates. Social worker will provide examples of creative activities and give the opportunity to implement under monitoring. Communication skills will be improved among volunteers and personnel and Greek language lessons will be given for helping them to integrate into local society.

Volunteer profile

– 18-30 years old – willing to follow the daily program – capable to create activities with simple materials by using their hands – skilled to provide physical education activities – open minded, in basics self-independent, responsible and with a strong motivation for international youth work and intercultural communication with elderly persons – capable to help in preparing international youth exchanges and activities; – motivated to learn basic Greek phrases in a short time; – playing an musical instrument which will be mostly appreciated; – able to communicate in english.

Placement dates

A total of 20 week(s) during the period 15/03/2019 to 31/07/2019

Placement location

Pelopidou 26, 32200 THIVA

Looking for volunteers from

Italy

Placement topics

Health and wellbeing

Placement deadline

No application deadline

Dejovenes towards Europe

DELEGACIÓN DE JUVENTUD AYUNTAMIENTO DE LEGANÉS

LEGANÉS- MADRID, Spain

Apply

Project description

Leganés is a municipality that is part of the Autonomous Community of Madrid. It is located within the Metropolitan Area of Madrid and is located eleven kilometers southwest of the capital. Its population is of 188,691 inhabitants.From Dejovenes (Delegation of Youth of the city council of Leganés), there are general information services related to young people and specialized information with sexual, legal, psychological, voluntary, employment and information on any other topic related to youth.The Youth Delegation ( Dejovenes ) has been working for more than twenty-five years with the young people of our municipality and in recent years manages mobility projects where it has participated in numerous youth exchanges, besides hosting volunteers for three years .One of the priorities in Dejovenes this year is the promotion among participants of the activities related to mobility European level volunteering and employment. Therefore we have decided to promote actions by Erasmus +.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will receive a monthly check with the assignment of the Erasmus + Program for accommodation, support and pocket money. As for accommodation, we look for a room in a shared apartment where there is a good youth environment.

Training during the project

At the beginning we want to create a group between the volunteers and our team and that they feel accompanied, creating a friendly and communicative work environment, so at the beginning the volunteers will carry out the activities together so that they can support and share the experience. As the project progresses, we want the afternoon activities to be carried out separately and to manage their progress in the project, developing their personal idea and acquiring the necessary confidence to carry them out.

Volunteer profile

The volunteers will be mainly involved in the Mobility Advisory, they will have to know the Erasmus + Program. We will also show you how it works and is the Eurodesk Network. They will also collaborate with the employment department in Europe. Once their level of Spanish allows it, they realize their own workshops of languages Italian and French.

Placement dates

A total of 40 week(s) during the period 01/10/2019 to 30/06/2020

Placement location

PLAZA DE ESPAÑA, 1, 28912 LEGANÉS- MADRID

Looking for volunteers from

France, Italy, Germany

'Step into the world of sailing' – for Norway

Sail Training Association Netherlands

Amsterdam, Netherlands

Apply

Project description

Sail Training Association Netherlands’ main focus is to organise sail training voyages on Tall Ships. These adventures involve the youngsters in every aspect of life on board: from sailing a Tall Ship, to learning about themselves, discovering their talents and maximising their potential. We bring young people from all over Europe together and as a part of our team you will be working in the engine room of this exact goal. We communicate with Tall Ships, future and past trainees, mentors and the organisations we cooperate with. We update our website and communicate on social media. We work with everything related to Sail Training and often develop new projects. Maybe you have the idea for our next? As a volunteer, your activities will include mostly a variety of office tasks, depending on your strengths and areas you want to develop. As we are a small organisation, you will be directly involved in the projects and - of course - sail on Tall Ships.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Your main home will be a recently converted freight ship “Brandaris” docked near the centre of Amsterdam. It is fully equipped for your stay. You will have your own cabin and share the living space with other volunteers. Grocery stores are nearby. You will be provided with a bike, and public transport is also very close. The office and your living area are one the same ship. That makes for a very short commute, but can also mean little privacy sometimes. There are occasional weekend meetings at the office. The Brandaris shipdog Tibbe lives onboard and spends some of his time in the office.

Training during the project

- Upon arrival training offered by the national EVS agency, - Personal development workshops, - Coaching by a friendly mentor, - Coaching sessions with project leader, - Daily guidance by our office crew or professional sailing crew (when on board a vessel), - Fundraising workshops, - Training/preparation to become a mentor for trainees on board sail training tall ships, - Sail training on board certified sail training vessels.

Volunteer profile

Our perfect EVS volunteer is: - proficient in English, both spoken and in writing; - over 21 years old; - able to work independently, self-motivated; - creative, flexible and inspired; - sailing experience (even better if it’s on Tall Ships); - with good communication skills – or the willingness to develop them; - prepared to come up with her/his own project after an adjustment period; Some additional qualities which will be a big plus: - the ability to make and edit videos/vlogs – or the willingness to learn; - driver’s license; - relevant work experience and/or education;

Placement dates

A total of 32 week(s) during the period 01/01/2019 to 31/10/2019

Placement location

Marinierskade 58, 1018 HZ Amsterdam

Looking for volunteers from

Norway

Placement topics

Education and training

Employment and entrepreneurship

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 522: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/2638_en


Save the Mediterranean Wetlands!

Tour du Valat

Arles, France

Apply

Project description

Do you want to discover science life in a unique international institute ? Motivate by the protection of nature, mix of culture and friendly life ? We wish to host volunteers during the same period in order to integrate them in our 3 thematic teams. The volunteer will work for one of our projects, depending of the needs of the differents teams and on the feeling of the volunteer. He/she will take part of data collecting, field observations (with ornithologists, botanists or ichtyologists…). He/she will take part of data analysis (on computer) under the responsibility of a project leader. If interest, he/she could work with communication team.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accomodation in a "two beds" room on the site of Tour du Valat, canteen for lunch and shared kitchen for breakfast and dinner. Car at disposal if needed.

Training during the project

French lesson Scientific methods with unformal training

Volunteer profile

Strong interest for nature conservation Curious Dynamic

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/04/2019 to 31/05/2020

Le Sambuc, 13200 Arles

Lets we make an EVS Together III

Engeli olan Bireyler ve Aileleri Gelisim Merkezi Dernegi

Mersin, Turkey

Apply

Project description

During the one volunteers from Italy will stay 6 months and fulfill his/her EVS projects. The aim of the Project is to provide the participation of disabled youngsters to EVS for their social inclusion, improvement of social awareness of disabled people, improvement of their independent life skills and contribution of employment of disabled people. In the frame of the program of mobility projects, learner centred non formal education methods, presentations and visits will be conducted. The more involvement of young people to the social life, development of young people in vocational and personal bases and to be employed are expected from the young people participated to the Project . The target group of the Project is young people aged 17-30 and included at least on of the following listed groups: 1. young people who has disability 2. young people who has a disabled relative 3. young people who are working with disabled people or the families of disabled people.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Our office is in a rented apartment where is in central of our city. There is near shopping centre, bus stop and seaside. It has a kitchen, one bathroom and 4 rooms. They will also have access to all the necessary utilities within the apartments such as, television, wi-fi, a washing machine, an oven, a refrigerator etc. The apartment has an antiburglar alarm.Our office is very close to cheaper restaurant, fast food restaurants, farmer’s markets and groceries. We will go to groceries with our volunteers every mouth. We will buy their foods, drinks and other needs.

Volunteer profile

We would seek participants who are disabled individuals who are independent and has disabled relatives firstly. And then University students or recent graduates who are interested in work with disabled individuals and has disabled relatives. Selection criteria are; - To be between 18-30 years of age - To being able to communicate in English. - Participants with background working with people with disabilities or their families - Volunteerism.

Placement dates

A total of 27 week(s) during the period 01/04/2019 to 30/04/2020

Placement location

Mersin

Looking for volunteers from

Project description

EVS- 3 volunteer from EU contry will participate in the project " We Can Together ", long-term volunteer service at the Kindergarten " Detelina " and Professional School of equipment and clothing "Docho Mikhailov" in Tervel. The short-term goals of the project are a targeted and systematic impact on participants for their personal development, promotion of intercultural, inter-religious dialogue and linguistic diversity; Promoting a healthy lifestyle through sport, tourism and outdoor activities; Inclusion of European values. At the Kindergarten "Detelina", one volunteer will support the organization's activities related to early language education for children. At the School board "Docho Mihaylov" two volunteers will working with young people,will participat in informal language courses, volunteering campaigns, sports activities with youth from the organization and from the city, early language training with children from kindergartens.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The Volunteer will be accommodated in a single room in a house with two other volunteers from the project. He going to share kitchen and bathroom with them Volunteer's allowance “Pocket money”of the volunteer for additional personal expenses is 70 € per month Food money for the volunteer are part of the Organizational support - 128 € per month Travel costs of volunteers will be reimbursed up to the lump sum according to the distance calculator of the EC calculated from registration address of the sending organisation to the registration address of the receiving organization

Training during the project

The Volunteer must attend full EVS training cycle: Preparation, on- arrival, mid – term and final evaluation seminars;

Volunteer profile

мotivated, communicative, inquisitive, open, active, creative, a citizen of a European country

Non-Formal Life 4.0

Association VOX Iuventutis - Saint Anne Youth Center

Baile Tusnad, Romania

Apply

Project description

The Saint Anne Youth Center, located in Baile Tusnad, is looking for long term ESC (European Solidarity Corps (EVS)) volunteer from Hungary for our ongoing project. Activity period is from April until the end of August (5 months), 2019. The objective of our project is to involve the volunteers into our regular activities of St. Anne Youth Centre. The Youth Center’s indoor and outdoor activities are mostly connected to develop different kind of skills, abilities and competences of children and youngsters, and to provide non-formal activities for the local kindergarten groups and school classes during the school time, and to organize summer camps/activities using these experience. The topic of these activities are highly depends on the interest of the volunteers and the need of the local children as well, it can be related to teaching English, doing handicraft activities, organizing thematic workshops (environment protection, EU, social media, making video, dance, music, etc.).

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Food : Volunteers will prepare food for them and can cook in the kitchen of the apartment. It provides opportunity for learning how to maintain themselves, can learn basics of cooking or developing their previous knowledge and also gives opportunity for inter cultural learning. Accommodation: the volunteer shares a bigger room with 2 other volunteers. The apartment is well equipped and is a 10 minute walk from the city center and the Youth Center. They have internet access in the center and at the accommodation as well.

Training during the project

Volunteers will take part in On Arrival Training organized by the National Agency. Beside this, they will receive proper language course (OLS). As our Youth Center is only apart of activities of our bigger co-working place, called Tusnad HUB, volunteers will have chance to participate on training might be organized in our HUB, by partner organizations.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for volunteers who are willing to work in team but able to accept individual tasks also. Who has patient with foreign people, open for learning about new cultures, meet new people. Who likes to work with children and who is interested about organizing different activities (handicraft activities, workshops, film clubs, etc.) and events. Who would like to learn, and also open to share his/her ideas and experience. Who like to work in good atmosphere, doing creative work with and within an enthusiastic group of youngsters from different backgrounds and cultures.

Placement dates

A total of 44 week(s) during the period 01/10/2019 to 30/07/2020

Placement location

str. Oltului nr. 43., 535100 Baile Tusnad

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Sociocultural animation in youth structures

Commune de Tarbes

TARBES cedex 9, France

Apply

Project description

The project is articulated around the host of 3 volunteers on 3 different structures from Tarbes' urban area, the Foyer des Jeunes Travailleurs of Tarbes, the Youth Service of the town of Tarbes and the Maison des Jeunes et de la Culture of Aureilhan. This 3 Youth structures welcome a different public between 3 and 30 years old. The volunteers will be a member, in the 3 structures, of the team of animation. The goal of the project is to value the European citizenship, the mobility and the intercultural exchanges. To do it, we want to inform the widest possible public, first of all that of the host organizations, to widen then to all the young people of the urban area. The activities envisaged : Animation to the children or the young people according to the structures, administartive tasks in connection with the projects of animation or the functioning of the structure, participation in the team meetings, , participation in the local exhibitions to promote Europe and ERASMUS+ program.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will be host at the Foyer des jeunes travailleurs for the accomodation. All the meal will be payed by the host structure. Concerning the transport during the CES the City of Tarbes will propose to the volunteer one reduction card for the train and a free bus pass and a bike.

Training during the project

During the opportunity the volunteer will have french course by the ERASMUS + platform. More we'll try to find partners who propose french course adapted to our volunteer and his need. Project of the city of Tarbes : In order to work on commitment, citizenship, youth autonomy and their empowerment, the CES volunteer accompanied by the animation teams will implement a unifying project around European mobility by organizing a European exchange on the theme of solidarity building site. It will be a valuable resource for networking in its home country and connecting youth and youth groups

Volunteer profile

We wish to welcome a volunteer with relational, creative and dynamic skills who would like to work in a team. The volunteer must be motivated, involved, able to federate other young people, other educational actors around a project. He will have to have a social approach (human qualities sense of listening, respect of the confidentiality and to be able to be) and to be force of proposal.He will have to be motivated, interested by the animation with the young people from 11 to 25 years old, as well as projects around the "support to parenthood" and new actions around the European mobility.

Placement dates

A total of 48 week(s) during the period 01/04/2019 to 29/02/2020

Placement location

Hotel de ville, place Jean Jaures , BP 31329, 65013 TARBES cedex 9

Looking for volunteers from

Spain

Citizenship and democratic participation

Only EU residents: EVS at biodynamic farm

Vorden, Netherlands

Apply

Project description

Volunteers are active with operational activities related to farm work: growing fruits, herbs and vegetables, making dairy products, work in the garden. This will take place together with other volunteers, clients that face psychological and psychiatric issues and professional staff. Volunteers work from Monday until Thursday and execute operational activities.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation: there is a house available where two volunteers have their own bedroom; other facilities are shared. The house is 5 minutes walking distance from the farm. It is in the middle of the nature, surrounded by forest. There are two volunteers participating in this project. Food: you will receive food allowance and you can purchase a meal when working, but it is also possible to bring your own food. Transportation: you will receive a bicycle. But please take into account that cyclying to the nearby city Zutphen takes about 45 minutes. The farm is located in a rural area.

Training during the project

Training will be provided by the national agency: an on arrival training (5 days) and a midterm training (2/3 days). While working at the farm, you will learn how to execute the activities.

Volunteer profile

We are looking forward to applications of motivated volunteers who are interested in biodynamic farming and working with people who are in need of extra support. Because of the ristrictions of this project, we can only host EU residents. Although we appreciate volunteers who have an educational background in social work, we would like to stress that volunteers only execute operational activities, working together with clients who live at the farm or visit it to work there. It is important that volunteers do not mind to work outside, also when weather circumstances are not ideal.

Placement dates

A total of 35 week(s) during the period 29/02/2020 to 31/10/2020

Placement location

Vorden

FOR YOUTH, WITH YOUTH

GÖNÜLLÜ HİZMETLER DERNEĞİ - GHD

ISTANBUL, Turkey

Apply

Project description

GÖNÜLLÜ HİZMETLER DERNEĞİ - GHD (Old Name : GENÇTUR-GENÇLİK TURİZMİ DERNEĞİ EI Ref No: 2014-1-TR01-KA110-13501 / PIC No: 925425494), is a voluntary organisation based in Istanbul and founded 2002. The main working field of GHD is sending and hosting short, mid and long term volunteers such as EVS and international voluntary work camps. Details can be seen at www.genctur.org By the end of 2018, GHD has sent 380 Turkish volunteers to short or long term EVS Project in EU countries. At the same time we have hosted 11 EVS volunteers from EU countries.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation, food and pocket money will be supplied under the Erasmus+ Program EVS rules. The volunteer will share a house with another student / volunteer and will have his/her own room. Kitchen, bathroom and the living room is shared. The volunteer receives a fix amount of Turkish Liras as living cost which is predefined by the beginning of each year. The flat rate pocket money for Turkey is 90 Euros.

Training during the project

The volunteer will get an office training by the staff. Later on will participate in "On Arrival" and " Mid Term Evaulation" trainings organized by the Turkish National Agency. The office work experience developes day by day with the help of the staff but the volunteer is expected to be familiar with computer, Microsoft Office programs, social media, etc.

Volunteer profile

The volunteer must be: - citizen of an Erasmus+ Program country - bilingual (Turkish and English and or any other language. Turkish is not a must but preferred. Any other language is a plus) - Communicative, talkative, smiling, patient, disciplined, punctual, encouraging, hard working, flexible, non smoking. - Able to use Microsoft Office programs. - No gender priority, everyone welcome. - Responsible team member.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/01/2020 to 31/12/2020

Placement location

ISTIKLAL CAD. 108/8 BEYOGLU, 34430 ISTANBUL

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Eurosensibiliza2 en la inclusión

Fundacion Ramon Rey Ardid

Zaragoza, Spain

Apply

Project description

This project will allow the young people to contribute to the daily work of an organization that is working for the management of Services and Programs of social inclusion of different groups at risk of social exclusion (young people with difficulties, disabled, elderly, immigrants, etc.). There are six programs in which the volunteers can participate along the mobility: cognitive stimulation, accompaniment, leisure, therapeutic play, sports and training. These programs are carried out in different areas, in their respective devices: Espacio Visiones and Social Club (Mental Health Area), Residence and Day Care Centers (Area of Seniors), Central offices of FRRA (Training and Employment Area).

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The travel, accommodation and subsistence costs will be funded by Erasmus + Programme. Keep in mind that travel costs will be funded under the Erasmus+ distance calculator (http://ec.europa.eu/programmes/erasmus-plus/tools/distance_en.htm).

Training during the project

You can improve your Spanish language and your experience in social inclusión of collectives of Mental HEalth, Elderly, Young people in difficulty, etc.

Volunteer profile

People aged between 18 and 30, a legal resident of Programme countries. We value positively that is an active person, with initiative and motivation to learn about the intervention areas addressed in the project: mental health, immigration, elderly, youth training,... and someone who wants to learn and collaborate on activities to contribute to the social integration of these target collectives. We also value positively a acceptable level of Spanish (minimum A2).

Positive vibes:European Youth Day, European Youth Week events

FUNDACJA CENTRUM AKTYWNOŚCI TWÓRCZEJ

Leszno, Poland

Apply

Project description

EVS project in Poland assumes an animation of free time children and young people from Leszno and promotion of foreign cultures and ideas for volunteering,. As for two months, we will Celebrate Common Europe, - volunteers will be involved in organising Event for kids/youth during that time. EVS volunteers themselves will be able to share their passions and learn new social skills. Participate in School and Uni activities. If you are still not sure show movie :https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jk0HJ1p_qOk&feature=youtu.be or fb page leaded by our volunteers:https://www.facebook.com/EVSfundacjaCAT/ The tasks of the volunteers: · Sharing culture in a special cultural diversity educational program for the Polish children and youth in Leszno and in rural areas ·Leading winter camp by managing their own workshops · making cultural presentation -making awarness about human rights

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accomodation Volunteers will live in a common flats with 2 or 3 rooms . Every volunteer will have a roommate. The kitchen and the bathrooms are common in every flat.The volunteers can prepare the food on their own. Every flat has Internet wireless connections. Every volunteer will receive a Polish SIM card Working hours: Volunteers will be working 35 hours per week, and will have 2 days off per month of holidays, Saturdays and Sundays are free. Money: The volunteer will receive monthly pocket money on – 120 euros, Food allowances - The volunteer will receive monthly 400 PLN for food

Training during the project

• Each volunteer will have a mentor – there will be one mentor for max. of 2 volunteers. The coordinator will facilitate volunteers schedule, if a translator is needed we will find for their activities. •adaptation weeks - The training will be organized by the stuff of our organisation, during the first week of stay of volunteers – April 2019. • we will offer the methodology of working with kids/ youth.

Volunteer profile

·Speak communicative English ·Be enthusiastic and motivated A short EVS project needs motivated volunteers. Please show us in your application why you want to join the project and our organisation. Make nice interactive movie, song, power pont, poem?:)) whatever creatie way can be!! · Be proactive We expect the volunteer to work with us to come up with clear goals and expectations and make the most from his/her time in the EVS. · Like the multimedia Because those positions involve working with videos, photos and graphic design and other publications, · Like moving around, sports
