Project 531: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/1823_en


Coordination Socio-Culturelle de Sainte Marguerite

Coordination Socio-Culturelle de Sainte Marguerite

Liège, Belgium

Apply

Project description

Sainte-Marguerite's Socio-Cultural Coordination (CSCSM) is a local coordination created in 1997.It is a place for exchange, where the 15 local associations define the common projects. EVS volunteering activities take place with the permanent staff of CSCSM and of some of the member associations (e.g. La Baraka ngo). Depending on his motivation and personality, the volunteer could contribute to: - help editing of the information bimonthly newspaper « Salut Maurice! » (supervised by the person responsible for the newspaper); - if his linguistic knowledge is sufficient, participation in the courses of French as a Foreign Language for non-Francophone adolescents who have just arrived; - participation in the organization of common activities for the local associations (e.g. Brocante, St Nicolas, etc); - help to run workshops and/or discussion groups within the French courses at the La Baraka or in another member association on various topics.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will live with ohter young visually impaired volunteers in an apartment; kitchen, bathroom and toilet will be shared, whereas bedrooms are individual. The appartment is a 20-minute walk from the service placement. The centre of town is also at walking distance (25 minutes): an urban neighbourhood close to the centre, but calm and green nonetheless. The volunteer will get a monthly sum of pocket money and food & hosehold money. He will mange his budget according to his needs.

Training during the project

During the first two weeks, the volunteers don't work: they benefit from orientation and mobility classes (to learn to go to places for daily life and work, routes, shops in the neighbourhood), as well as from daily living skills sessions (to prepare meals, do the shopping, do the laundry and take care of the linen and the house, first aid), and intensive French classes, so as to make them as autonomomus. All along the project they will get support regarding their special needs from the coordinating association, Views International

Volunteer profile

This project mainly targets young visually impaired people. In order to better adapt to the daily tasks, the volunteer must have a basic knowledge of French (beginner level). The volunteer will be motivated and will have the desire to be integrated in the working team. Besides, the volunteer will strive for the autonomy and integration necessary in his private and daily life, both with his housemates and his multicultural neighbours. Being open and knowing how to listen are essential qualities for the tasks that the volunteer will be required to carry out.

Placement dates

A total of 35 week(s) during the period 16/09/2019 to 17/05/2020

Placement location

Rue Sainte-Marguerite 9, 4000 Liège

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Social challenges

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 07/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 532: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/1821_en


IRHOV

IRHOV fondamental

Liège, Belgium

Apply

Project description

IRHOV, the hosting organization is a primary and secondary school for young people (between 3 and 21 years) with hearing or visual impairment.Most of the young visually impaired volunteers who apply for an experience abroad know little or nothing at all about specialized education, as they attended mainstream schools. This project will enable them to meet young people who study in a specialised school. They will thus have the chance to compare the two types of experience and to talk about them with the young pupils they will get in contact with during their service. Volunteers can: - help to better understand difficulties related to visual impairment, even when specific material is available; - strengthening links with families and between families; - ensuring the links between people responsible for extracurricular activities (sport day, theatre, reading) and the young pupils; - giving a positive image of visual impairment to young pupils from the mainstreem school.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will live with ohter young visually impaired volunteers in an apartment; kitchen, bathroom and toilet will be shared, whereas bedrooms are individual. The appartment is a 20-minute walk from the service placement. The centre of town is also at walking distance (25 minutes): an urban neighbourhood close to the centre, but calm and green nonetheless. The volunteer will get a monthly sum of pocket money and food & hosehold money. He will mange his budget according to his needs.

Training during the project

During the first two weeks, the volunteers don't work: they benefit from orientation and mobility classes (to learn to go to places for daily life and work, routes, shops in the neighbourhood), as well as from daily living skills sessions (to prepare meals, do the shopping, do the laundry and take care of the linen and the house, first aid), and intensive French classes, so as to make them as autonomomus. All along the project they will get support regarding their special needs from the coordinating association, Views International.

Volunteer profile

This project mainly targets young visually impaired people. In order to better adapt to the daily tasks, the volunteer must have a basic knowledge of French (beginner level). The volunteer will be motivated and will have the desire to be integrated in the working team. Besides, the volunteer will strive for the autonomy and integration necessary in his private and daily life, both with his housemates and his multicultural neighbours. Being open and knowing how to listen are essential qualities for the tasks that the volunteer will be required to carry out.

Placement dates

A total of 35 week(s) during the period 16/09/2019 to 17/05/2020

Placement location

Rue Monulphe 78, 4000 Liège

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Social challenges

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 07/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 533: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/1819_en


BUCANEVE for disabilities

Cooperativa Bucaneve

Castel Goffredo, Italy

Apply

Project description

We are looking for 2 volunteers that will work in the centre for adult disables run by Bucaneve for 9 months. It is a structure for people with medium and heavy handicaps, most of them stay only during the day and few users live there permanently. All activities aim to develop the users’ residual skills and to maintain the acquired levels as much as possible. In the Centre the disabled find a strong support integrating the different pedagogical and leisure time occasions given by their families. At present the Centro Diurno hosts users, dissimilar for age and pathology, and therefore with different needs. The volunteers will be involved in all activities of the Centre and support the staff during: Workshops: Psychomotor therapy, arts&crafts, music therapy, cookery. Excursions, special events and Summercamp: trips, Spring day, folk fairs, art competitions,.. (also proposed by the local community) Help educators when they share daily moments with users

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will stay in an apartment in the parallel street of the Center, so they can go to work by foot. The flat will be shared among two volunteers and it has two bedroom, one bath and an equipped kitchen/living room, wi-fi and bedding. For every displacement the volunteers can go to the train station or to bus stop.

Training during the project

During this EVS project the volunteers will partecipate at two training manage by National Agency: - On Arrival Training, some weeks after the start of the project - Mid Term Evaluation , in the middle of the project Every month Alce Nero will organize a monitoring meeting to supervise the volunteers and to resolve every insorgents conflict or trouble

Volunteer profile

Candidates should: -Be motivated and interested about the project issues -Have previously experienced in the field of disability -Be flexible and willing to adapt to possible hitches and to respect the community rules -Ready to live in a small village in the countryside.

Placement dates

A total of 40 week(s) during the period 01/10/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

Via Ferrari 2, 46042 Castel Goffredo

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Health and wellbeing

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 10/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 534: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/1740_en


Dobrovolná služba v Ackermann-Gemeinde ve Würzburgu

Ackermann-Gemeinde Würzburg

Würzburg, Germany

Apply

Project description

Od září roku 2019 nabízíme v naší organizaci Ackermann-Gemeinde ve Würzburgu mladému člověku z České republiky možnost strávit roční dobrovolnou službu v rámci Evropského sboru solidarity. Dokonce i dobrovolník/dobrovolnice s malou nadějí může u nás dostat šanci. Organizace Ackermann-Gemeinde je součástí katolické církve. Její členové se angažují na poli česko-německo-slovenských vztahů, přičemž jednají na základě křesťanské odpovědnosti za společnou Evropu. Mezi Tvé konkrétní činnosti bude patřit: • spolupráce při organizaci česko-německých vzdělávacích projektů s mládeží a dospělými • podpora zaměstnanců a dobrovolníků při přípravě dalších projektů • úprava a aktualizace účtu na Facebooku

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

A co za to? • měsíční kapesné a peníze na stravování • ubytování (zajišťuje organizace) • zdravotní pojištění (bezplatné) • kurz německého jazyka • účast na dvou seminářích pro dobrovolníky v Německu, které povedou profesionální referenti a na kterých se seznámíš s jinými dobrovolníky z celého světa • tutorka, která tě bude provázet celým rokem dobrovolníka • Youthpass, kde budou zapsány všechny tvé pokroky a zkušenosti, které za svůj dobrovolnický rok získáš Dobrovolnický projekt je otevřen pro účastníky s omezenými možnostmi - kulturní rozdíly, zeměpisné překážky.

Training during the project

Na co se můžeš těšit? • pěkný, aktivní a rozmanitý rok ve Würzburgu • různorodé činnosti při organizaci projektů a v kanceláři, spolupráce se zaměstnanci a dobrovolníky v Ackermann-Gemeinde Würzburg • spolupráce při vytváření různých seminářů, akcí a jiných internacionálních projektů • spousta zkušeností v oblasti mezinárodních vztahů

Volunteer profile

Je ti 18–30 let, pocházíš z České republiky, mluvíš (alespoň trochu) německy a máš od září 2019 do srpna 2020 čas a zajímá tě česko-německá oblast vzdělávání? Pak se přihlaš přímo u Veroniky Tomsové na e-mailu ackermann-gemeinde@bistum-wuerzburg.de nebo klikni nahoře na "podat přihlášku". Těšíme se na Tebe!

Placement dates

A total of 54 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

Kilianshaus – Kürschnerhof 2, 97070 Würzburg

Looking for volunteers from

Czech Republic

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 31/05/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 535: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/1726_en


Freiwilligendienst im Deutsch-tschechischen Kindergarten Junikorn

Junikorn, z. s.

Plzeň, Czech Republic

Apply

Project description

Zusammen mit einem erfahrenen Erzieher wird sich der/die Freiwillige an der Vorbereitung und Umsetzung des Tagesablaufes im Kindergarten und an der täglichen Arbeit mit Kindern beteiligen. Der/die Freiwillige wird auch die Chance haben, eine eigene regelmäßige Freizeitaktivität mit Kindern anzuleiten. Weiter wird der/die Freiwillige in die Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedenen Partnerorganisationen, die Öffentlichkeitsarbeit und Verwaltung eingebunden. Als vollwertiges Teammitglied beteiligt er/sie sich an weiteren Veranstaltungen und den Teambesprechungen des Kindergartens.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Die wöchentliche Arbeitszeit beträgt 35 Stunden. Der/die Freiwillige erhält ein monatliches Taschengeld, Verpflegungsgeld, freie Unterkunft, einen Tschechisch-Sprachkurz und zwei Urlaubstage pro Monat. Das Freiwilligenprojekt ist für die Menschen mit geringeren Chancen offen - kulturelle Unterschiede, Gesundheitsprobleme, geografische Hindernisse.

Volunteer profile

Von Vorteil für den/die Bewerber/-in sind: * Interesse an Arbeit mit Kinder im Vorschulbereich * Interesse für Deutsch-tschechische Zusammenarbeit * sichere Deutschkenntnisse und Interesse Tschechisch zu lernen * der/die Bewerber/-in sollte kommunikativ und aufgeschlossen sein und Spaß an der Arbeit in einem binationalen Team haben * erforderlich sind Wohnsitz außerhalb Tschechiens, Unbescholtenheit und ein Alter 18–30 Jahren

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 29/07/2019 to 28/07/2020

Placement location

Ulice Boženy Němcové 3, 323 00 Plzeň

Looking for volunteers from

Germany

Placement topics

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Physical education and sport

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 30/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 536: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/1725_en


Dobrovolná služba v Junge Aktion v Mnichově

Junge Aktion der Ackermann-Gemeinde

München, Germany

Apply

Project description

Od září 2019 nabízí Junge Aktion v centrále Ackermann-Gemeinde v Mnichově opět možnost pro mladého člověka z České republiky nebo Slovenska vykonávat po dobu 12 měsíců evropskou dobrovolnou službu v rámci Evropského sboru solidarity. JUNGE AKTION der ACKERMANN-GEMEINDE je společenství dětí a mladých lidí z Německa ve věku od 10 do 26 let. Svými projekty a aktivitami přispívá k „Evropě lidí“. Tato organizace vznikla v roce 1950 jako společenství mladých lidí odsunutých z Čech, Moravy a Slezska. Mezi její hlavní cíle patří díky její historii setkávání se středo- a východoevropskými sousedy. Junge Aktion je členem Aktion West-Ost ve Svazu německé katolické mládeže (BDKJ). Pokud máš zájem podílet se spolu s Junge Aktion dvanáct měsíců na přípravě a realizaci mezinárodních setkání mládeže z Česka, Německa, Slovenska a Maďarska, naučit se spoustu nových věcí, zašli nám svou žádost!

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Co obdržíš? • měsíční kapesné a stravné • ubytování na studentské koleji • zdravotní, úrazové a životní pojištění, pojištění odpovědnosti za škodu • účast na dvou seminářích pro dobrovolníky v Německu, kde poznáš ostatní dobrovolníky z celé Evropy • jazykový kurz dle tvých znalostí • Youth pass - doklad o absolvování dobrovolné služby

Training during the project

Co Tě čeká? • aktivní a pestrý rok • různé úkoly v rámci projektů i při práci v kanceláři, spolupráce s kolegy a dobrovolníky Junge Aktion a její zastřešující organizace Ackermann-Gemeinde • příprava symposií, akcí, seminářů a dalších mezinárodních projektů • mnoho interkulturních zkušeností Dobrovolnický projekt je otevřen pro účastníky s omezenými možnostmi - kulturní rozdíly, zeměpisné překážky.

Volunteer profile

Pokud je ti od 18 do 30 let, máš alespoň minimální znalost němčiny a od září 2019 do srpna 2020 čas a zájem, můžeš se ucházet o místo přímo u Junge Aktion der Ackermann-Gemeinde (junge-aktion@ackermann-gemeinde.de), nebo jednoduše klikni nahoře na "podat přihlášku". Michal Vosinek, náš nynější dobrovolník, ti rád poskytne bližší informace a poví o svých zkušenostech (evs@junge-aktion.de). Těšíme se na Tebe!

Placement dates

A total of 54 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

Heßstraße 24, 80799 München

Looking for volunteers from

Czech Republic

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 17/05/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 537: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/1723_en


Centrum Bavaria Bohemia

Bavaria Bohemia e. V.

Schönsee, Germany

Apply

Project description

Spolek Bavaria Bohemia e.V., zřizovatel Centra Bavaria Bohemia v Schönsee (Bavorsko), nabízí od září 2019 do srpna 2020 místo dobrovolníka v rámci Evropského sboru solidarity. Dobrovolník bude členem pětičlenného týmu a bude se podílet se na organizaci přeshraničních kulturních přeshraničních projektů a na jejich propagaci, bude komunikovat s německými a českými partnery a kulturními aktéry, sledovat českou a německou kulturní scénu v regionu a připravovat programové přehledy a tipy pro obyvatele druhé země a spolupracovat na redakci kulturního portálu www.bbkult.net. . Všechny akce Centra jsou organizovány pro lidi z obou stran hranice a jejich cílem je vyvolat společnou debatu o kulturních, politických a společenských tématech, a tím tak udržovat, prohlubovat a rozšiřovat česko-něměcké vztahy. Hledáme: * zájemce o česko-německou spolupráci * zájem o kulturní témata * komunikativní znalost němčiny * spolehlivost * kreativitu * věk mezi 18 a 30 lety

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Dobrovolnice/dobrovolník bude dostávat měsíční kapesné, příspěvek na stravu, obdrží také měsíční příspěvek na dopravu. Ubytování mu bude zajištěno hostitelskou organizací, vzdálenost jen 5 minut chůze od centra. V rámci dobrovolné služby bude mít také něměcký jazykový kurz. Dobrovolnický projekt je otevřen pro účastníky s omezenými možnostmi - kulturní rozdíly, sociální překážky, ekonomické překážky.

Training during the project

Nabízíme: * kreativní činnost v mladém kolektivu * vlastní zodpovědnost v zajímavém přeshraničním projektu * koncepci a realizaci kulturních projektů * jazykový kurz

Volunteer profile

Hledáme: * zájemce o česko-německou spolupráci * zájem o kulturní témata * komunikativní znalost němčiny * spolehlivost * kreativitu * věk mezi 18 a 30 lety * bydliště v Česku

Placement dates

A total of 54 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

Freyung 1, 92539 Schönsee

Looking for volunteers from

Czech Republic

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 538: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/1717_en


Projekt ahoj.info - dobrovolná služba v Regensburgu

Koordinační centrum česko-německých výměn mládeže

Regensburg, Germany

Apply

Project description

Dva čeští dobrovolníci v Regensburgu spolu s jedním německým dobrovolníkem v Plzni společně v přeshraničním týmu spravují dvojjazyčný česko-německý internetový portál pro mladé lidi www.ahoj.info a organizují dva nebo tři vlastní vícedenní vzdělávací semináře pro mladé lidi z Česka a Německa, případně další jednodenní česko-německé akce. Jako plnohodnotní členové týmu naší kanceláře se účastní dalších aktivit v oblasti mezinárodní práce s mládeží, pracovních porad nebo akci pro veřejnost.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Dobrovolník obdrží měsíční kapesné, stravné, paušální příspěvek na cestu, je mu zajištěno ubytování, jazykový kurz a dva dny dovolené za každý měsíc. Týdenní pracovní doba je 35 hodin. Více informací naleznete na www.ahoj.info/evsproject. Obecné informace o dobrovolné službě v rámci programu Evorpského sboru solidarity naleznete na www.ahoj.info/volunteering. Dobrovolnický projekt je otevřen pro účastníky s omezenými možnostmi - kulturní rozdíly, zeměpisné překážky, zdravotní znevýhodnění.

Training during the project

Dobrovolník se během služby účastní na příjezdovém a střednědobém školení, která pořádá německá národní agentura. Během dobrovolnického roku se může dobrovolník zůčastnit také dalších vzdělávacích seminářů, které Koordinační centrum Tandem v Regensburgu pořádá.

Volunteer profile

Výhodou uchazeče / uchazečky je: - zájem o práci s mládeží a česko-německou spolupráci - zájem o on-line žurnalistiku - základní znalosti němčiny - komunikativní a otevřená osobnost, schopnost nalézt radost v práci ve dvojjazyčném týmu - podmínkou je věk mezi 18 a 30 lety a bydliště v Česku. Jak se přihlásit: - zašlete krátký průvodní dopis, strukturovaný životopis a motivační dopis v němčině nebo angličtině e mailem na adresu tandem@tandem-org.de - uzávěrka pro přihlášky je 03. května 2019, do předmětu e-mailu uveďte prosím „Bewerbung - Freiwilligendienst ahoj.info 2019“

Placement dates

A total of 54 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

Maximilianstraße 7, 93047 Regensburg

Looking for volunteers from

Czech Republic

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 03/05/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 539: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/1701_en


SPJ/Entreville

Entreville

Lobbes, Belgium

Apply

Project description

Service volontaire dans une Maison d'enfants accueillant des enfants et adolescents placés par le juge. Le volontaire soutiendra l'équipe éducative sur place en proposant des activités diverses aux enfants et en les accompagnant dans la vie quotidienne. Ce sont surtout des petites choses que le volontaire pourra mettre en place. Par exemple: aider pour les devoirs, accompagner un enfant au foot, présenter son pays d'accueil,... aider pour les repas, seconder l'équipe éducative dans les tâches quotidiennes.... Ce sont des enfants qui viennent de situations familiales pas faciles et qui peuvent par moment montrer des comportements inhabituels.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Le volontaire aura une petite chambre dans la maison d'enfants. Il prendra ses repas avec les enfants et l'équipe éducative. Il aura aussi la possibilité de cuisiner s'il le souhaite.

Training during the project

Le volontaire va participer aux séminaires organisés par l'organisation de coordination (+/- 15 jours) ainsi qu'aux séminaires organisés par l'agence nationale belge. Dans le projet il aura un tuteur et un "parrain" qui sera là pour des questions plus spécifiques concernant le service dans le projet local.

Volunteer profile

Une personne qui a envie de s'engager dans un projet social auprès d'enfants placés en institution.

Placement dates

A total of 44 week(s) during the period 02/09/2019 to 30/06/2020

Placement location

6540 Lobbes

Looking for volunteers from

Bulgaria, Croatia, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Norway

Placement topics

Social challenges

Education and training

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 30/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 540: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/1697_en


SPJ Centre Reine Fabiola

SPJ/Centre Reine Fabiola

Neufvilles, Belgium

Apply

Project description

Projet avec des personnes en situation d'handicap. Les volontaires commenceront par un mois de découverte de la structure durant lequel ils auront la possibilité de passer dans les différents foyers et ateliers pour se familiariser avec le travail et les différentes équipes. Par après ils choisiront, en accord avec leur tuteur, un foyer ou un atelier dans lesquels ils vont s'investir plus. Les tâches des volontaires consisteront en un suivi pratique et pédagogique de la personne handicapée. Les volontaires vont soutenir l'équipe pédagogique dans l'encadrement quotidien des résidents, tout en gardant un statut particulier. Ils participeront régulièrement à des réunions d'équipe et auront toujours quelqu'un qui pourra les guider en cas de difficulté. Les apprentissages seront multiples et pourront se résumer comme suit: Découverte et progression dans le monde du travail social et plus spécialement de la personne présentant un handicap.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Les volontaires vont partager un appartement sur le site du centre. Le Centre se trouve dans un petit village en Hainaut. Bus pour Soignies et de là trains vers Bruxelles, Mons etc.. La nourriture est fournie par le centre. Ils pourront faire une commande alimentaire à la cuisine centrale ou cuisiner eux même dans leur appartement. Possibilité de se restaurer au restaurant du centre.

Training during the project

Les volontaires participeront aux formations organisées par l'agence nationale pour les volontaires SVE ainsi qu'aux séminaires organisés par l'équipe du SPJ (organisation de coordination).

Volunteer profile

Une personne intéressée par les personnes présentant un handicap mental. Quelqu'un qui a envie de s'engager dans un projet social. Une personne intéressée par les différences et les rencontres.

Placement dates

A total of 44 week(s) during the period 02/09/2019 to 30/06/2020

Placement location

Neufvilles

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Czech Republic, Finland, Spain, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Latvia, Iceland, Malta, Italy, Netherlands, Norway

Placement topics

Social challenges

Health and wellbeing

Education and training

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 25/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 541: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/1694_en


SPJ Centre Reine Fabiola

SPJ/Centre Reine Fabiola

Neufvilles, Belgium

Apply

Project description

Projet avec des personnes en situation d'handicap.Les volontaires commenceront par un mois de découverte de la structure durant lequel ils auront la possibilité de passer dans les différents foyers et ateliers pour se familiariser avec le travail et les différentes équipes. Par après ils choisiront, en accord avec leur tuteur, un foyer ou un atelier dans lesquels ils vont s'investir plus. Les tâches des volontaires consisteront en un suivi pratique et pédagogique de la personne handicapée. Les volontaires vont soutenir l'équipe pédagogique dans l'encadrement quotidien des résidents, tout en gardant un statut particulier. Ils participeront régulièrement à des réunions d'équipe et auront toujours quelqu'un qui pourra les guider en cas de difficulté. Les apprentissages seront multiples et pourront se résumer comme suit: Découverte et progression dans le monde du travail social et plus spécialement de la personne présentant un handicap.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Les volontaires vont partager un appartement sur le site du centre. Le Centre se trouve dans un petit village en Hainaut. Bus pour Soignies. De la gare de Soignies train pour Bruxelles, Mons et d'autres grandes villes belges. La nourriture est fournie par le centre. Ils pourront faire une commande alimentaire à la cuisine centrale ou manger dans le restaurant du Centre.

Training during the project

Les volontaires participeront aux formations organisées par l'agence nationale pour les volontaires SVE ainsi qu'aux séminaires organisés par l'équipe du SPJ (organisation de coordination).

Volunteer profile

Une personne intéressée par les personnes présentant un handicap mental. Quelqu'un qui a envie de s'engager dans un projet social. Une personne ouverte aux différences et qui a envie de rencontrer des personnes de différents horizons.

Placement dates

A total of 48 week(s) during the period 02/09/2019 to 31/07/2020

Placement location

Neufvilles

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Social challenges

Health and wellbeing

Education and training

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 30/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 542: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/1590_en


New Technologies, Sports and School Support in Chios Island

Experimental Technology Education Sports TES-HIENET

Vrontados, Greece

Apply

Project description

a) (70%) Educational, Cultural & Sport cooperation on New Technologies: a1) Assisting at a Day Nursery, a Kindergarten, a Primary School or similar Institutions. a2) Organizing summer activities for children. a3) “Learning by using and Producing" Educational, Cultural, Sport & Tourist Projects. a4) Helping and learn how to sail on a sailing yacht. The (a1,a2,a3,a4,) activities depend on the capacity of the volunteer and the needs of the cooperating organizations. b) (20%) Realization of Non-profit making New Technologies, Educational, Sports and Cultural programs and Presentations. Creation of new ideas and realization of activities, texts translation participation in social activities. c) (05%) Our EVS Internet Radio. Development and realization of recordings, sound mixing, interviews, news to the Hosting organization’s EVS Internet Radio and web site www.chiosradio.gr. e) (05%) Our Place. Keeping the hosting and working place clean and in order (house, garden, yacht etc).

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The hosting organization is offering adequate accommodation for the volunteer, equipped with the necessary appliances and furniture to cover the basic needs of the volunteers. The Young volunteers live in shared rooms. Every two weeks the responsible of the H/O checks that everything is clean and in order at the hosting and the working place. Food: The young volunteers are responsible for making a cooking scheduler at home. They provide H/O a weekly list of the (regular) goods that they need each week for cooking at home and the H/O is supplying them.

Training during the project

Volunteers will be given, (by using the cooperative learning method), any training necessary to carry out their tasks. (Computer programs, sailing lessons etc). The mentors will meet regularly with the volunteers to check on their progress and help solve any problems. They will also ensure ongoing support for the volunteer in every possible way. Attempts will be made to help the volunteers integrate into the local community. At the end of each project, the volunteers will have more technical (computer programs) and educational skills that will make them have a very good Youth pass certificate.

Volunteer profile

We are not interested on high qualifications, millions of certificates, presidents, queens or kings. We are usually selecting positive and creative young people ready to "offer" and learning in cooperation and offer their time on the realization of New Technologies, Educational, Cultural and Sport projects. The suitable volunteer is a person who don’t need 5 stars accommodation, privacy and comforts, but a person who has as priority on learning, cooperating and living with European young people and looks the glass "half full" instead of "half empty".

Placement dates

A total of 42 week(s) during the period 01/05/2019 to 31/03/2020

Placement location

Andronikou 60 Chios Island Greece, 82200 Vrontados

Looking for volunteers from

Poland, Germany, Austria

Placement topics

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Physical education and sport

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 20/04/2019

Project 543: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/1589_en


New Technologies, Sports and School Support in Chios Island

Experimental Technology Education Sports TES-HIENET

Vrontados, Greece

Apply

Project description

a) (70%) Educational, Cultural & Sport cooperation on New Technologies: a1) Assisting at a Day Nursery, a Kindergarten, a Primary School or similar Institutions. a2) Organizing summer activities for children. a3) “Learning by using and Producing" Educational, Cultural, Sport & Tourist Projects. a4) Helping and learn how to sail on a sailing yacht. The (a1,a2,a3,a4,) activities depend on the capacity of the volunteer and the needs of the cooperating organizations. b) (20%) Realization of Non-profit making New Technologies, Educational, Sports and Cultural programs and Presentations. Creation of new ideas and realization of activities, texts translation participation in social activities. c) (05%) Our EVS Internet Radio. Development and realization of recordings, sound mixing, interviews, news to the Hosting organization’s EVS Internet Radio and web site www.chiosradio.gr. e) (05%) Our Place. Keeping the hosting and working place clean and in order (house, garden, yacht etc).

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The hosting organization is offering adequate accommodation for the volunteer, equipped with the necessary appliances and furniture to cover the basic needs of the volunteers. The Young volunteers live in shared rooms. Every two weeks the responsible of the H/O checks that everything is clean and in order at the hosting and the working place. Food: The young volunteers are responsible for making a cooking scheduler at home. They provide H/O a weekly list of the (regular) goods that they need each week for cooking at home and the H/O is supplying them.

Training during the project

Volunteers will be given, (by using the cooperative learning method), any training necessary to carry out their tasks. (Computer programs, sailing lessons etc). The mentors will meet regularly with the volunteers to check on their progress and help solve any problems. They will also ensure ongoing support for the volunteer in every possible way. Attempts will be made to help the volunteers integrate into the local community. At the end of each project, the volunteers will have more technical (computer programs) and educational skills that will make them have a very good Youth pass certificate.

Volunteer profile

We are not interested on high qualifications, millions of certificates, presidents, queens or kings. We are usually selecting positive and creative young people ready to "offer" and learning in cooperation and offer their time on the realization of New Technologies, Educational, Cultural and Sport projects. The suitable volunteer is a person who don’t need 5 stars accommodation, privacy and comforts, but a person who has as priority on learning, cooperating and living with European young people and looks the glass "half full" instead of "half empty".

Placement dates

A total of 45 week(s) during the period 01/08/2019 to 31/07/2020

Placement location

Andronikou 60 Chios Island Greece, 82200 Vrontados

Looking for volunteers from

Italy, Poland, Austria, Germany, United Kingdom, Cyprus

Placement topics

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Physical education and sport

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 30/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Helping children and homeless in Moldova

Casa Providentei

Chisinau, Moldova (Republic of)

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

The volunteer must to support the activities of working with children and to have a good relation with them. The day-care centre for children provides social assistance and protection, medical care, school education 5 days a week, from 12:00 till 17:30, a meal and a snack per day for 25 children aged 7 to 14, selected from socially vulnerable families from Chişinău. The aim of this project is to provide assistance to children during their school education, as well as providing support to pupils who have difficulties in adapting to the educational requirements. Children are supported and guided by a social worker in preparing their homework.Also volunteers will be helping in the social canteen: The volunteer will be involved in the work with the old lonely people. The main work will consist of helping in the Canteen (homeless shelter) where 150 people are coming to eat. It is necessary to help with the distribution of the food and afterwards to collect dishes from tables.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteer(s) will live in a host family or volunteer's flat with shared kitchen, toilet and bathroom. Also volunteer(s) will have access to the land line phone in their accommodation. Internet can be accessed in the internet cafes and wi-fi spots in the city, also some volunteer flats have internet access at individual basis. As well volunteer will be able to use internet in his Host Organization. Depending on the district of the city where volunteer will live he/she can reach the center by foot or by public transportation

Training during the project

OAT and mid term evaluation made by SALTO EECA and other trainings done by the Host and coordinating organization

Volunteer profile

interest in working with kids and homeless adults, interest in learning the local language quick.

Placement dates

A total of 54 week(s) during the period 01/06/2019 to 01/06/2020

Placement location

Chisinau

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Social challenges

Reception and integration of refugees and migrants

Citizenship and democratic participation

Disaster prevention and recovery

Environment and natural protection

Health and wellbeing

Education and training

Employment and entrepreneurship

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 31/03/2019

Project 550: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/1499_en


Janakkala´s municipality Youth Department

Janakkalan kunta Nuorisopalvelut

Turenki, Finland

Apply

Project description

During this project volunteers will work in various places all over Janakkala municipality. Here we have two youth centers. There volunteers can play board games, billiard, table tennis with teenagers, but most importantly they have to be available to talk with them and create positive environment. As well as at that, volunteers will be working in local schools, kindergartens and in Kiipula vocational school with students that have special needs. Municipality also owns a movie theatre, where we organize workshops for young unemployed people. During the summer we organize camps for children and young people, where we have different themes such as culture, sports and nature. The working tasks can change depending on the working place, but still the most important thing to do is to keep conversations with youngsters.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The 2 volunteers will live together in Turenki. They will have their seperate rooms, shared living area and sauna. The flat is close to the town center, markets, forests, lakes, bus and train stations. They will have their bikes, a food account in the closest supermarket and a bus card to go to Hämeenlinna, a bigger city 20 km away. Janakkala is quite small municipality (about 17 000 inhabitants) 100 kilometres from our capital Helsinki. There are two main areas in Janakkala: Turenki and Tervakoski. Janakkala offers a comfortable setting; all major southern Finnish cities are easy to reach.

Training during the project

There are two trainings during the project: on-arrival training in September and mid-term training in January. During those trainings they will meet some of the other European Volunteers in Finland. Volunteers will also go to the finnish language course in Hämeenlinna twice per week. There is also a possibility to have english language course if needed.

Volunteer profile

We are very motivated to host Erasmus+ volunteers here in Janakkala. We co-operate closely with sending organizations and we want to make perfect projects for every participants. The volunteers should be really willing to share their culture and knowledge. They have to be ready to become role models for the youth of Janakkala and show positive example in everyday life. We hope that volunteers will be self-confident, independent, open-minded, motivated and ready to work with children and youngsters.

Placement dates

A total of 49 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/07/2020

Placement location

Juttilantie 1, 14200 Turenki

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Education and training

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 06/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 551: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/1199_en


VIEWS International

VIEWS International

Liège, Belgium

Apply

Project description

Views International is an European NGO having its Executive Office situated in the city of Liège, Belgium. The usual activities of VIEWS International are: the organization of European projects (youth exchanges, EVS, seminars...). And then there are the local activities, carried out together with our Belgian partners. Our projects are adapted for young visually impaired persons, 18-30 years old. The volunteer can develop intercultural activities with sighted and visually impaired young Belgians, and help them create European activities where they are involved (in the field of music, sport...) He/She can help organize leisure activities (cultural gatherings, sport activities) for sighted or visually impaired young people, together with our network of local partners (La Baraka asbl, etc.); he/she can help with awareness-raising sessions (such as dinners in the dark, info sessions on visual impairment, etc.) or organising logistics/ set up activities for international youth projects.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will have his own room, but will share kitchen, bathroom and toilet with the group of young volunteers, boys and girls separated. The apartment will be in the neighbourhood, so as to allow a relatively quick autonomy, thanks to the mobility and orientation classes. The neighbourhood counts many small shops, more accessible to young people. Electrical household appliances will be equipped with tactile marks, and tools will be adapted (table sets with contrasting colours, marked storing boxes, freezer...).

Training during the project

In his first two weeks, the visually impaired volunteer will be given classes of orientation, as well as daily-living and professional skills sessions, with a timetable agreed by mutual consent with the supervisors and which takes into account everyone's needs and possibilities. French classes will also be provided during this period in an intensive fashion, with adapted material and provided by a teacher specialized in French as a Foreign Language and with a lot of experience with visually impaired students.

Volunteer profile

This project mainly targets young visually impaired people, 18-30 years old. In order to better adapt to the daily tasks, the volunteer must have a basic knowledge of French (beginner level). The volunteer will be motivated and will have the desire to be integrated in the working team. Besides, the volunteer will strive for the autonomy and integration necessary in his private and daily life, both with his housemates and his multicultural neighbours. Being open and knowing how to listen are essential qualities for the tasks that the volunteer will be required to carry out.

Placement dates

A total of 35 week(s) during the period 16/09/2019 to 17/05/2020

Placement location

19 Quai Van Beneden, 4020 Liège

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Social challenges

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 07/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 552: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/1191_en


SPJ/La Pommeraie

SPJ/ La Pommeraie

Ellignies Sainte Anne, Belgium

Apply

Project description

Projet avec des personnes en situation d'handicap.Les volontaires commenceront par un mois de découverte de la structure durant lequel ils auront la possibilité de passer dans les différents foyers et ateliers pour se familiariser avec le travail et les différentes équipes. Par après ils choisiront, en accord avec leur tuteur, un foyer et un atelier dans lesquels ils vont s'investir plus. Les tâches des volontaires consisteront en un suivi pratique et pédagogique de la personne handicapée. Les volontaires vont soutenir l'équipe pédagogique dans l'encadrement quotidien des résidents, tout en gardant un statut particulier. Ils participeront régulièrement à des réunions d'équipe et auront toujours quelqu'un qui pourra les guider en cas de difficulté. Les apprentissages seront multiples et pourront se résumer comme suit: Découverte et progression dans le monde du travail social et plus spécialement de la personne présentant un handicap.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Logement en appartement avec un autre volontaire. Possibilité de manger dans le centre ou de faire la cuisine dans l'appartement qui se trouve pas loin du Centre la Pommeraie.

Training during the project

Les volontaires vont participer au séminaires organisés par l'organisation de coordination (+/- 15 jours) ainsi qu'aux séminaires organisés par l'agence nationale belge. Dans le projet ils auront un tuteur et un "parrain" qui sera là pour des questions plus spécifiques concernant le service dans le projet local.

Volunteer profile

Motivation de travailler dans un projet social en lien avec des adultes présentant un handicap mental. Personne ouverte aux autres, aux différences. Savoir vivre dans un petit village. Possibilité de participer à des ateliers créatifs ou pratiques pour des personnes en situation d'handicap.

Placement dates

A total of 44 week(s) during the period 03/09/2019 to 30/06/2020

Placement location

Ellignies Sainte Anne

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Italy, Luxembourg, Latvia, Netherlands, Norway, Portugal, Poland

Placement topics

Health and wellbeing

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 30/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 553: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/1168_en


EVS in Old Age Care Home Emmaus - Haiterbach

Seniorenzentrum Emmaus

Haiterbach, Germany

Apply

Project description

The Seniorenzentrum Emmaus is a qualified institution for inpatient care of old people (residents live there). The house has 78 care spaces that are double or single rooms. There is also a day care programme for people in the area who need help. The institution offers holistic (mind and body) and encouraging support care with additional therapy services. There are also many free-time activities, varied events and a high level of comfort. Volunteer workers are a valuable part of the team, which improves the life of our seniors (elderly residents). While working at the Center, volunteers will develop their qualifications in the areas of personal, social and language competence. They will learn about different lifestyles and how to support old people. Some of these old people may be very fragile or have psychiatric changes (mental disease). Volunteers will learn about the organization and duties of an old age care institution, the volunteering activities include also some work of routine

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers get a single room at the institution or in a separate home near the institution. Volunteers get their meals for free at the old age home or vouchers for the local supermarket to buy foodstuff for self catering. To travel around the area, European Volunteers get a monthly transportation ticket. This is for the regional transportation authority of Bäderkreis Calw. With this ticket, volunteers can use all transportation of the ÖPNV in the Calw region for free (no cost). Volunteers can use this ticket in the VCG fee-area on: workdays after 9am and 24 hours on weekends.

Training during the project

To decrease problems from the start, volunteers go to important introduction seminars where they'll receive information about the institution and their duties. There is continuous professional support for the volunteers. One example of support is regular reflection talks. A neutral person from outside of the core group will lead these talks. Apart from the compulsory EVS training cycle provided by the National Agency there is also weekly language training at the local adult education center.

Volunteer profile

Volunteers should be interested in social work in the area of old-age care. They should also be open to working with old people who need care. Some of the residents may also have old-age diseases of the mind (for example, Alzheimer’s). Volunteers should be able to connect with other people. Basic knowledge of the German language is helpful for the daily contact with: the residents, day-guests of the institution, family members and co-workers. Learning the German language should not be the volunteers’ only or main motivation for volunteering with this project.

Placement dates

A total of 54 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

Schwandorfer Str. 20, 72221 Haiterbach

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Social challenges

Education and training

Employment and entrepreneurship

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.

Project 554: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/1165_en


Vocational Education and Consultation Centre for the Hearing-Impaired

unerhört“, Sozialwerk für hörgeschädigte Kinder und Jugendliche Freiburg e.V.

Stegen, Germany

Apply

Project description

The association “unerhört” - Sozialwerk für hörgeschädigte Kinder und Jugendliche Freiburg e.V. (Charity Organization for Hearing-Impaired Children and Young People Freiburg) is a non-profit organization. It mainly supports students of the Bildungs- und Beratungszentrums für Hörgeschädigte Stegen (Vocational Education and Consultation Centre for the Hearing-Impaired Stegen). This includes hearing impaired children and young people who get their care in other institutions and families in the region. In their work, volunteers learn about the social demands of hearing impaired people. Working on a social project gives the volunteers job orientation and perspective for their future. When volunteers independently design care activities, they can be proud and learn to depend on their own skills. School and residence workers guide the volunteers. So, the volunteers can help organize the support programme and free time events for the students.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will get a single room in the residence hall of the center. Cooking facilities and bathroom have to be shared with other volunteers. The volunteer will get full board in the refectory of the center or food stuff for self catering, and a payment in kind according to the degree of the German tax authorities during holidays. To travel around the area, volunteers get a monthly transportation ticket. This includes free-use of all the public transportation of the Breisgau-Hochschwarzwald transportation authority region. Volunteers can also use the ticket in the bordering counties.

Training during the project

During the voluntary service the volunteer will be supported in all administrative affairs (announcement at the registry office, applying for residence permit, opening an account with the bank, insurance affairs etc.). The volunteer will be send to the on arrival- training and the obligatory mid-term-meeting organised by the National Agency. The language training will take place during the semester at one or two evenings per week at the University of Freiburg. 3 hours of language training will be counted as working hours.

Volunteer profile

Volunteers should like working for the development of needy people. They should be open to working with disadvantaged young people or youth who might be excluded from society. Past experience in working with special needs children and youth would be helpful. Volunteers should be able to individually design and plan activities. They should also be helpful and be able to work with other team members. Basic knowledge in german language will be helpful. Learning the German language should not be the volunteers’ only or main motivation for volunteering with this project.

Placement dates

A total of 49 week(s) during the period 05/09/2019 to 04/08/2020

Placement location

Erwin-Kern-straße 1-3, 79252 Stegen

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Social challenges

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

Social work in Moldova vs Clipa Siderala

Clipa Siderala

Chisinau, Moldova (Republic of)

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

Clipa Siderala is an NGO with the main goals tosupport children in crisis situations and to promote the development of the voluntary movement. The tasks that we can provide to the volunteer are very different. - proof reading and translation of the project draft; - sending letters to the organizations that we work with; - correspondence; - answering on children's letters during the activity "Poşta lui Moş Crăciun», where every child can write a letter to Moş Crăciun (Santa Claus) and get, in response, a colorful congratulation letter; - during "Christmas Caravan" participating in the Christmas story and visiting centers; - work with social networks and promotional activities; - assitance during the anual charity event; - the cultural program and participating and assisting in all the mentioned below projects of the organization; - as well volunteer will be asked to assist on the project writing

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteer(s) will live in a host family or volunteer's flat with shared kitchen, toilet and bathroom. Also volunteer(s) will have access to the land line phone in their accommodation. Internet can be accessed in the internet cafes and wi-fi spots in the city, also some volunteer flats have internet access at individual basis. As well volunteer will be able to use internet in his Host Organization. Depending on the district of the city where volunteer will live he/she can reach the center by foot or by public transportation

Training during the project

OAT and mid term evaluation made by SALTO EECA and other trainings done by the Host and coordinating organization

Volunteer profile

We encourage to apply volunteers: - open to know a new culture and live in another country, being able to adapt to a new environment; - aware of their responsibilities and tasks as EVS volunteer; - young people who are cooperative and flexible; - interested in developing interpersonal, organizational and fundraising/project writing skills; - able to work in an autonomous way as well as in a team; - big motivation to learn the local language very soon. - good knowledge of English is more then welcome.

Placement dates

A total of 54 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 01/09/2020

Placement location

Chisinau

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

EVS vacancies for EU residents

Lava Legato foundation

Rotterdam, Netherlands

Apply

Project description

We are recruiting volunteers (EU RESIDENTS) who are interested in volunteering in the Netherlands for a period of 8/9 months, starting in May 2019. Volunteers will work for different organizations like a primary school, youth center, community gardens, boxing school, a gallery which work with less priviliged youth, Middin, a big care organizations that provides services for people with limitations. The activities can be supporting art related projects, hosting activities for a location where activities for the neighborhood are organzied, consist of cooking activities, supporting people with limitations in doing light work activities, attend leisure activities (like sports activities).

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

You will live in one of the apartments with other volunteers. You each have a separate bedroom. Volunteers receive food allowance; together with pocket money the amount that the volunteers receive is 300+ euro's per month. The volunteer will receive a lease bicycle to organize his/her own transportation. There is a mentor available and the monthly meetings that take place are obligatory.

Training during the project

Two training programs are provided by the national agency: an on arrival training and a mid term training.

Volunteer profile

We very much appreciate: volunteers, who show own initiative, take responsibility, take voluneer work seriously, be open to work in a very multicultural city and showing a result driven approach. It is important that volunteers have an interest in working with people with limitations, because that will cover the main volunteer activities. The volunteer work is an excellent possibility to gain working experience in the social field. Candidates who have studied or have experience with; farming/gardening, social work or gastronomy (kitchen/chef) are more than welcome to apply.

Placement dates

A total of 40 week(s) during the period 01/05/2019 to 31/01/2020

Placement location

Overblaak 96, Rotterdam

Editing and making video at the Association of Independent Press

The Association of Independent Press

Chisinau, Moldova (Republic of)

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

API is recognised as one of the most important mass-media organisations in R. Moldova which promotes and provides assistance to independent media. API is highly appreciated for its media campaigns in various public interest sectors, advocacy activities for mass-media development, defence of the freedom of expression, access to information, promotion of journalistic self-regulation, etc.The typical tasks for the volunteers that will be involved may include (but are not limited to): - providing assistance in organizing and carrying out activities for trainings, meetings round tables in and outside the office, - also this includes taking photos, filming, editing this materials in order to be published after, also helping in writing reports. - editing/proofreading texts in English, - providing assistance in maintaining and coordinating the API’s website www.api.md, and others webpages that API is coordinating,.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteer(s) will live in a host family or volunteer's flat with shared kitchen, toilet and bathroom. Also volunteer(s) will have access to the land line phone in their accommodation. Internet can be accessed in the internet cafes and wi-fi spots in the city, also some volunteer flats have internet access at individual basis. As well volunteer will be able to use internet in his Host Organization. Depending on the district of the city where volunteer will live he/she can reach the center by foot or by public transportation

Training during the project

OAT and mid term evaluation made by SALTO EECA and other trainings done by the Host and coordinating organization

Volunteer profile

We would like to host a volunteer who possess basic skills in the areas of computer literacy, photo and video shooting, or video editing, or graphic design and/or organizing art and cultural activities. As our working team is composed from open-minded and professional members. We accept anyone with any individual aspects as religious, gender, ethnicity or sexual minorities, this is not a priority, the only thing that is important for as is to be freindly open-minded and to respect the others.

Project 558: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/1124_en


EVS: innovative social center - female candidates only

Bologna, Italy

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

The EVS volunteers will be hosted in Bologna (about 400.000 inhabitants), capital of the Emilia-Romagna region. Bologna is famous for its university dimension and it hosts the oldest European university that with its 90.000 students contributes to make the city a lively cultural and intercultural forge. Bologna is very open to youths and it offers a lot in term of personal growth and cultural activities. The volunteers will be actively embedded in this multiethnic and stimulating environment by exploiting the activities and the network of contacts of Centro Sociale Montanari. This will enable them to approach this context and act as protagonists thus making the most of the unique opportunity of the EVS. This close contact with the local community and the active participation in volunteering, informative and formative activities carried out by the center will widely enhance the growing possibility for the volunteers.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteer will share the room with another volunteer (same sex) in a flat with all facilities, shared with other volunteers (local or international). The flat is composed by 3 double bedrooms, 2 toilets, small kitchen and dining room. There is wi-fi and washing machine. From Monday to Friday the lunch will be served at the Social Center. Volunteer will receive food money, to cover the other meals during the week. Volunteer will have available a monthly or annual bus ticket for the city of Bologna.

Training during the project

Volunteers will attend training on soft skills development during the EVS

Volunteer profile

The perfect candidate is a pro-active person, with strong spirit of adaptation and motivated to try and develop new experiences. At least a basic knowledge of Italian language is recommended. We can accept applications only by female

Placement dates

A total of 39 week(s) during the period 01/03/2019 to 30/11/2019

Placement location

Bologna

Looking for volunteers from

Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Estonia, Greece, Croatia, Hungary, Lithuania, Latvia, Poland, Romania, Cyprus

EVS vacancies: youth center - rural development

Anzola dell'Emilia - Bologna, Italy

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

The project in Anzola involves the Youth Center, Library and schools based there. The volunteer will be involved in the activities of the territory, in network with other organisations and institutions. Mainly the volunteer will carry out local initiatives with young people like thematic workshops, outdoor games, excursions, exhibitions, activities connected with art and culture, supporting the work of the staff of the Municipality and local volunteers. As local impact, thanks to the presence of international volunteers the local community can develop a particular sensitivity and interest towards European issues. In fact, the daily presence of European volunteers contributes to the realization of local activities, stimulating in the local youngsters new interests, open-mindedness and curiosity towards new cultures, and also a different evaluation of their own territory, fostering a more positive approach to foreign language learning and practicing.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The accommodation is the guest house of the Municipality. Volunteer will have a single room, private toilet in the room. Each room has its own key and the privacy of each person will be respected. Volunteer will receive a food money based on the cost of life Volunteer will have the bus ticket for activities.

Training during the project

Trainings on development of soft skills will be provided during the year.

Volunteer profile

Volunteer should have interest in small communities and their development, social issues, sensitivity towards European main topics. Previous experience in the field of entertainment and education would also give us an interesting opportunity for sharing best practices.

Placement dates

A total of 39 week(s) during the period 01/03/2019 to 31/12/2019

40100 Anzola dell'Emilia - Bologna

Sport and health oriented Kindergarten

Kindergarten "Wasserläufer"

Potsdam, Germany

Apply

Project description

We are searching for 1 ESC volunteer from Spain for our Kindergarten “Wasserläufer” for a 12 month project starting 19.08.2019. Volunteer will be integrated in the "on the move and health oriented" program of Kindergarten by supporting the pedagogues in their daily activities. Sport, movement and healthy lifestyle are the key words in the daily work at the Kindergarten. Volunteer will help pedagogues with on the move exercises, communicate with children and lead them to the better consciousness for the health. Also, volunteer will have opportunity to organize his own projects, e.g. about his own country, culture, traditions. Possible fields of activity: - Involvement whilst looking after 1 to 5 year old children - Assistance whilst practicing aged-based movement exercises in a playful way - Accompanying children in their daily activities - Support by the planning of activities, thematical workshops and festivities

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation: The volunteer will live in Potsdam in shared apartment and will have single room. Pocket money: 150,00 € will be provided via bank transfer. Food: A monthly food allowance of 229,00 € will be provided via bank transfer. Local transport: monthly card will be provided.

Volunteer profile

- be interested in work with young children - be interested in sport orientated work - be interested in the conception and implementation of sport orientated events and projects with children - dedicated commitment and creativity (music, sport, games, dance etc.) - sociable, friendly, patient and open-minded - willing to learn new skills - curious and be interested in German culture and language - body hygiene

YEP! Young Europeans for Padova 2020

Ufficio Progetto Giovani - Comune di Padova

Padova, Italy

Apply

Project description

Ufficio Progetto Giovani is the Office of Municipality of Padua dealing with services and initiatives in favour of the local youth. Progetto Giovani is searching for 1 volunteer for the in-coming Volunteering project “YEP! Young Europeans for Padova Capital of Volunteering 2020”. The project lasts 10 months (from the beginning of October 2019 to August 2020). Main activities: • linguistic and cultural interactive laboratories in the schools of Padua (non-formal ed. methods) • linguistic tandem learning activities • after-school activities for under-age people with fewer opportunities • promotion of EVS and the activities of Progetto Giovani in schools or university Other possible activities: • back-office activity: research of opportunities for youth in EU within the sectors of education, training and free time • creation of material for the promotion and dissemination of results of Progetto Giovani's EVS projects through years • organizational support for cultural events

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will be hosted in a flat rented by the Municipality of Padova and located a few minutes from the city center. The volunteer will have his/her own bedroom and will share kitchen, living room and bathroom with another volunteer. Monthly bus tickets will be provided by the office. Pocket money and an amount of money for accomodation and food will be transferred to the volunteers at the beginning of each month.

Volunteer profile

We will positively value the following attitudes: – predisposition to human interpersonal relationship; – good motivation to the projec activities and proactivity; – adaptation skills and capacity to manage the work schedule and tasks – flexibility and availability to move around the city to reach different work locations. A basic knowledge of italian language is recommended.
