Project 562: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/1091_en


Kingsriver Life-Sharing Community

Kingsriver Community Holdings CLG.

Kilkenny, Co. Kilkenny, Ireland

Apply

Project description

Kingsriver is a LIFE-SHARING COMMUNITY supporting adults with disabilities. It provides residential & day-care in the form of training, therapy & meaningful work. Kingsriver advocates for inclusion and the breaking down of barriers & stereotypes around people with special needs. We are committed to provide quality person-centered opportunities for people of various abilities & to support them to realize their full potential. Our target group learn to participate in their community through a variety of programmes & activities. Volunteers support & enhance those activities & help our target group to become more independent & better included in society. This happens through our weekly programmes, dialogue, teamwork & activities such as art & crafts, sport, gardening, woodwork, cooking. I.T skills, etc. Tolerance, acceptance & empathy to people being different are the main features volunteers encounter. They learn a lot of practical & organizational skills AND a lot about themselves.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

This is a LIFE-SHARING COMMUNITY therefore volunteers live AND work in the same place. So, accommodation is in one of the residential houses in Kingsriver Community. Volunteers have their own bedroom and share a bathroom. Our meals are shared and we take turns cooking. Volunteers look after themselves on their days off. We are located in a rural area and have our own mini bus that travels to Kilkenny City every day. It take approx 15mins.

Training during the project

Volunteers are encouraged to use their YouthPass as reflection tool throughout their Project to support and develop their skills. Training opportunities include: Volunteer Guide to Practical Tips; Residents & Community Info; Manual Handling; Management of Actual and Potential Aggression; Code of Conduct; Privacy & Confidentiality; Health & Safety; Infection Control; Fire Safety & Evacuation Procedures; Epilepsy; Safeguarding & Adult Protection; Disability; etc. These are supported by practical skills learned by doing and through shadowing professional staff; supervision & mentoring meetings

Volunteer profile

While we do not look for formal qualifications, we find that our Project is suited to flexible people who have a good sense of humour & strong motivation. We prioritize candidates with a good level of English as we provide formal training where volunteers need to read, learn & understand our work's policies & procedures. This is necessary to comply with Irish law for people who work with vulnerable individuals. It is important that candidates have an interest in working in disability & are available for ONE year. We also prioritize applicants of 22 years of age & older as we work with adults

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 29/07/2019 to 31/07/2020

Placement location

Ennisnag, Stoneyford, R95KR25 Kilkenny, Co. Kilkenny

Looking for volunteers from

Italy, Spain, France

Placement topics

Social challenges

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 563: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/1064_en


Centrum Molenmoes - environmental challenge

Centrum Molenmoes

wezemaal, Belgium

Apply

Project description

In 2011 we did start with developing the environment of our center. Bit by bit new things entered the space all given birth by a volunteer with a passion: a garden, a compost toilet, a baking oven , a nature exploring path, compost system, art in the garden,... The aim is that we bring the youngsters of the day center in contact with different environmental issues. Not just by offering them activities, but mainly by acting immediately in the environment. The garden is a place where volunteers take care of and vegetables can be used in the kitchen. By creating interesting corners in the environment the place gets more attractive and may have an educational level. Main tasks are taking care of the garden and environmental spaces, develop new ideas, make a connection between garden and kitchen and make a connection towards the youngsters of Rizsas daycentre. Our days start at 9am and we end at 16pm.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will live in a house near to the project(app 500m) together with other EVS volunteers. It is located in a small village. The volunteer will have a room that he/she can lock with a key. Bathroom and kitchen are in common with other volunteers. Terras and outside places are in common with another project. The volunteer is getting a food budget to arrange his food outside the work hours. During work the volunteer has lunch in the project. The volunteer will get a bike to go to the shop, the bus or train station. A bus card is provided to travel with the bus to the city.

Training during the project

In the first month the volunteer will get some preparation about life in the project, Language course, working in a team and living together with other volunteers. In September the volunteer will take part in an on arrival training organized by the National agency and in January again in the mid term training. During the year the project is providing some language support to learn Dutch and coaching moments for personal learning and understanding of philosophy of the work. A local volunteer will also on request give some training about how to set up targets, how to make a good CV.

Volunteer profile

A volunteer with a passion for environmental issues, garden and eventually cooking. willing to work outdoors, keep outdoor spaces in a good shape Being able to organize some work by yourself, taking initiative for own projects and activities to develop. able to live in rural setting (nearest city Leuven is 12km), willing to use the bike or bus independant in living,cooking, taking care of the house willing to learn Dutch

Placement dates

A total of 50 week(s) during the period 21/08/2019 to 01/08/2020

Placement location

blauwmolenstraat 1a, 3111 wezemaal

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Social challenges

Environment and natural protection

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 564: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/1059_en


Kindergarten Thünenstrasse - watch, discover, try!

Leipzig, Germany

Apply

Project description

Our kindergarten is focusing on natural sciences and language learning in the children's daily life. The goal is to enable the children to get social competences and knowledge as well as own learning experiences. Our aim is it to concentrate on the science education of the children, to help them to discover the „secrets of our world“. Through „watching, astonishment -trying“ the children are guided on their way of discovering and understanding. We believe that the collected discoveries and experiences have a meaning for the whole life. Volunteer will be working together with the educationalists, supporting their daily work with children. He/she will have an opportunity to develop their own interesting projects and activities for children.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Normally all the volunteers are living in shared flats, have their own room - but share kitchen and bathroom with 3 others volunteers. Food money will be paid out to you as well as money to buy the local transportation monthly ticket or you just buy a bike. Leipzig is a very nice city to ride bike. If you wish we can as well try to organise a host family.

Training during the project

We will help you to find a German language course which fits your needs and level.

Volunteer profile

Do you love working with children? Are you creative and open-minded? Do you have any interesting hobbies that you can share with others? (Music, sports, art ... everything is welcome) Are you a responsible person? Do you have a lot of new ideas for fun&educative activities? Are you willing to learn German? If yes, then you are a perfect candidate for this position! Don't hestitate to apply, we are waiting for you!

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 01/11/2019 to 31/10/2020

Placement location

Leipzig

Looking for volunteers from

Belgium, Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Ireland, Greece, Spain, France, Croatia, Italy, Cyprus, Lithuania, Hungary, Malta, Netherlands, Austria, Poland, United Kingdom

Project 565: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/1057_en


Kindergarten Goyastraße - sport&healthy lifestyle&outdoor activity

Leipzig, Germany

Apply

Project description

The main concept of the Goaystrasse Kindergarten is to include sport activities and healthy life-style in every kid's life. In the kindergarten children have 10 friendly group rooms, a studio, a children's kitchen and a multipurpose room. A green outdoor area with various play equipment, a sandbox, various sitting areas and a large terrace area invite kids to play and run outdoors. Children can be included in the facility from the first year of their life. Volunteer will be working together with the educationalists, supporting their daily work with children. He/she will have an opportunity to develop their own interesting projects and activities for children.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Normally all the volunteers are living in shared flats, have their own room - but share kitchen and bathroom with 3 others volunteers. Food money will be paid out to you as well as money to buy the local transportation monthly ticket or you just buy a bike. Leipzig is a very nice city to ride bike. If you wish we can as well try to organise a host family.

Training during the project

We will help you to find a German language course which fits your needs and level.

Volunteer profile

Do you love working with children? Are you creative and open-minded? Do you have any interesting hobbies that you can share with others? (Music, sports, art ... everything is welcome) Are you a responsible person? Do you have a lot of new ideas for fun&educative activities? Are you willing to learn German? If yes, then you are a perfect candidate for this position! Don't hestitate to apply, we are waiting for you!

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 01/11/2019 to 31/10/2020

Placement location

Leipzig

Looking for volunteers from

Belgium, Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Ireland, Greece, Spain, France, Croatia, Italy, Cyprus, Hungary, Malta, Netherlands, Austria, United Kingdom, Poland

Helping needy ones in Moldova vs Planeta Caritatii

Chisinau, Moldova (Republic of)

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

Every day there is a schedule that is respected. Approximately it looks like: Time Activity 9:00 – 10:00 Sport activity (every day except wednesday) 10:00 – 11:00 Work with natural materials 11:00 – 12:00 Educational activity* 12:00 – 12:30 Lunch 12:00 – 14:00 Educational activity* • Educational activites change every day – Monday - glina, mathematic, grammar; Tuesday and Thursday – social activity – estetic education (concerts, theater); Wednesday – work in the garden / cleaning the teritoryaround the building / excursions, theater, museum, gardening in the village/ sewing 11:00 till 14:00; Friday – grammar, mathematic, embrodery ribbons. If the weather is good on Friday we go gardening, Wednesday – excursions. After adaptation volunteer will be asked to help some beneficiaries to to come to the center and after activities to go with them back home

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteer(s) will live in a host family or volunteer's flat with shared kitchen, toilet and bathroom. Also volunteer(s) will have access to the land line phone in their accommodation. Internet can be accessed in the internet cafes and wi-fi spots in the city, also some volunteer flats have internet access at individual basis. As well volunteer will be able to use internet in his Host Organization

Training during the project

OAT and mid term organized by SALTO EECA and other trainings organized by Host and supporting organizations

Volunteer profile

We are welcoming young volunteers with creative interests and experience in the arts and crafts (theatre, visual arts, film/video making, music and so forth), sports and/or games.

Helping kids at The Center for Social Rehabilitation of Children

Chisinau, Moldova (Republic of)

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

The Center for Social Rehabilitation of Children “Casa Gavroche” is a shelter for children living and working on the streets and other categories of children at risk from Chisinau. The main role of the volunteers is to assist the employees in work and to give support to the children in every day activities of the Centre. Everyday duties of volunteers are: - help in preparing a snack; - help with homework; - help in organizing and running recreational and interpersonal games; - help in cleaning up rooms when activities finished; - picking up children from the school; - read stories and songs in easy language; - participate in painting and crafts workshops - participate in theatre and music groups.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteer(s) will live in a host family or volunteer's flat with shared kitchen, toilet and bathroom. Also volunteer(s) will have access to the land line phone in their accommodation. Internet can be accessed in the internet cafes and wi-fi spots in the city, also some volunteer flats have internet access at individual basis. As well volunteer will be able to use internet in his Host Organization. Depending on the district of the city where volunteer will live he/she can reach the center by foot or by public transportation

Training during the project

OAT and mid term organized by SALTO EECA and other trainings organized by supporting organization

Volunteer profile

The volunteer should be interested in the work with children and youth. She/he should be an open person, willing to share with his/her culture. A volunteer should like to develop and improve his/her skills and abilities, be open for experiments, have some hobbies/interests and like to share with them when organizing some activities for children. The volunteer should be interested and open-minded to contribute with his/her own creativity in the organization's work and willingly develop his/her personality. Both male and female volunteers are wanted

Project description

AmCham Moldova connects businesses and business leaders to share the common goal of bringing the entrepreneurial spirit and the cultures of Moldova and the United States closer together. The Mission of AmCham Moldova is to promote American trade and investment in Moldova and to work with the Moldovan government and business leaders to foster a more favorable business climate in Moldova for foreign trade and investment.Vol. tasks:administration of AmCham communication tools, coordination of services to members, assisting Project Mangers within current running projects. 1. Assure the efficient communication with AmCham membership by means of: a. Administration of AmCham’s website www.amcham.md & Facebook page; b. Elaboration & distribution of AmCham Weekly Bulletin; Travel Guide; c. Administration of AmCham Job Center; 2. Administration of AmCham E-Manager by maintaining and updating members data base and major mailing lists; 3. Provide assistance in coordination of projects

Project description

Atentie is a social services provider. Our beneficiaries are children with disabilites, vulnerable children. Our main activities are based on: - psychological recovery - Speech Therapy - Pedagogy - Music Therapy - Primary medical assistance. Volunteer tasks: - Working with disabled children, go on walk with them etc. - Participate with all the staff in organizing every week the sanitary day, when are cleaned all offices and spaces for children - assist during language courses (only the candidates that can prove these capacity) - Assists the educators and teachers in organizing and facilitation of day-to-day activities with children (games, visits in the city, hygiene, educational activities, etc.) – available only for the candidates that can prove these capabilities; - Networking with children from our center;

Volunteer profile

It is very important for the future volunteer to be:1) to be very patient to disabled children 2) eager to work with people from a multicultural environment, of different backgrounds, religions and ethnicity; 3) dedicated to the work that has to be done; 4) punctual and responsible.

Vol tasks:- Assist PR manager in organizing the PR events like public social campaigns, fundraising activities or to maintain facebook and web pages: copy documents, prepare materials, taking photos, elaborating summaries, etc. - Participate with all the staff in organizing every week the sanitary day, when are cleaned all offices and spaces for children - Offer language courses - Assists the staff in organizing and facilitation of day-to-day activities with children - available only for the candidates that can prove these capabilities; - translation, small reoorts, research

International Centre of Professional Training and Development (ICPTD)

Chisinau, Moldova (Republic of)

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

ICTPD is an NGO with a misssion“To assist the development of the organizations, leaders and professionals with the help of the modern educational technologies and effective methods of training". ICTPD has a comparatively long history as an organization. It has first started working as a part of the Institute of Social and Community workers and then, starting from 2003 was working as a separate organization. Volunteer tasks:Volunteers get acquainted with educational and training techniques. They are encouraged to develop and perform new methods of training and teaching as well as creating and writing their own projects. At the same time there are everyday tasks like preparation of the course materials for the programs that are running.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

volunteers will live in the rented flats with other volunteers or in the host families. Food allowance and local transportation allowance will be transfered to volunteer bank account monthly

Training during the project

OAT and mid term organized by SALTO EECA

Volunteer profile

We encourage to apply volunteers: - open to know a new culture and live in another country, being able to adapt to a new environment; - aware of their responsibilities and tasks as EVS volunteer; - young people who are cooperative and flexible; - interested in developing interpersonal, organizational and IT skills; - able to work in an autonomous way as well as in a team; - good knowledge of English is more then welcome.

Dog protection in Moldova - LOIZ

The association for the protection of animals "LOIZ"

Chisinau, Moldova (Republic of)

Apply

Project description

The association for the protection of animals "LOIZ" is a non-profit organization. We started as an organization in 2013. Even though our organization is still young, we strongly believe that we can bring our energy and enthusiasm into a matter of homeless animals. Our team consists only from volunteers, who dedicate money, time and care to help animals. This care is given through various activities which may include not only rescuing stray dogs from the harsh city streets, but essentially finding them new homes. In between these two main objectives volunteers work with the animals to make sure they are healthy, people- and animal-friendly, as well as ready for adoption. Thus, regular activities of volunteers include: finding financial help for the organization, working at the rescue center (which would include cleaning the kennels, cooking the food, making sure everything is going as it should - that all animals are in good condition and health, playing with the animals etc

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

volunteers will live in the rented flats with other volunteers or in the host families. Food allowance and local transportation allowance will be transfered to volunteer bank account monthly

Training during the project

OAT and mid term organized by SALTO EECA

Volunteer profile

We would like to host a person who loves animals. Everything else - really doesn't matter.

Opportunity for EU volunteers with old people - Italy - 6 months

Rifugio Re Carlo Alberto

Luserna San Giovanni, (TO) North of Italy, Italy

Apply

Project description

Are you from SPAIN, FRANCE, CROATIA, GERMANY or ESTONIA? Are you between 18 and 30 years old? Are you looking for a volunteering experience in Italy? Do not miss these opportunity. You will be involved in social acitivties with ELDERLY PEOPLE in Rifugio Re Carlo Alberto (based Luserna San Giovanni town) . The EVS will start on Novembre/December 2018 for 6 months. The activities will be: HELPING IN EVERYDAY LIFE: The volunteer will support the operators in preparing meals and the hosts with special needs during the meal by cutting the meat, helping them to drink water and to eat, etc. SUPPORT IN RECREATIONAL ACTIVTIES with old people: The volunteer will be supporting staff members in the recreative and rehabilitation activities run inside and outside the center. These activities are: -Serve meals -Gym -Shopping -Excursion to the near by zone -Music-therapy -Exercises for the maintenance of the cognitive functions -Workshops with paper and other materials.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

ACCOMMODATION: The volunteer will have a shared room with bathroom inside the project structure at the last floor which is an area reserved to the volunteers. Food is given in the organization. FOOD: Food is always provided inside the hosting project. Everyday the volunteer will have breakfast, lunch and dinner in the dining room of the social workers. LOCAL TRANSPORTS: volunteers will live and volunteer in the same place. If they ask they will be given a bike to move around. WI-FI: yes POCKET MONEY: 150,00 euros per month.

Training during the project

The volunteers will join a complementary activty related to the promotion of volunteering opportunities to Italian students. The they will be asked to make presentations about their experience in Italy.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for motivated volunteers from SPAIN , FRANCE, CROATIA , GERMANY or ESTONIA interested in working with elderly people. The volunteer should also be flexible, easy going and should like team work. Volunteers should be 18-30 years old.

Placement dates

A total of 31 week(s) during the period 25/11/2018 to 25/06/2019

Placement location

Località Musset, 1, Luserna San Giovanni, (TO) North of Italy

Looking for volunteers from

France, Spain, Croatia, Germany, Estonia

Placement topics

Social challenges

Placement deadline

Multimedia & social animator vacancy from EU needed 02/04 - 31.01.2020

FUNDACJA CENTRUM AKTYWNOŚCI TWÓRCZEJ

Leszno, Poland

Apply

Project description

Project assumes promotion of foreign cultures and ideas for volunteering, human rights education. Volunteer will work on making audiovisual concepts of those areas /comics,board games, posters etc/ During 10 months we will develop the skills of volunteer in the area of audiovisual but also in social work /promotion of country, working with disadvantages. EVS volunteers themselves will be able to share their passions and learn new social skills especially in schools, making lot's of promotion /audiovisual/ of different activities The tasks of the volunteers: ·Promote CAT events ·Sharing culture in a special cultural diversity educational program for the Polish children&youth ·Promoting a volunteer attitude to disadvantaged and youth from Leszno and rural areas ·Creating promotional events and dissemination materials ·Making CAT magazine with activities -making audiovisual campaigns

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

We will provide the following facilities and logistics: - Accommodation: Shared room in Leszno town centre with internet access. - Office equipments: desks, computers, Wireless internet, Telephone, polish mobile number - Training courses: we offer a lot of possibilities to participate in special workshops and training - Personal support - mentor, coordinator of work, coordinator of project. - Pocket money –The volunteer will receive monthly pocket money on – 85euros - Food allowances -The volunteer will receive monthly food allowance –400 PLN /dont worry Poland is quite cheap:)/

Training during the project

- basic animation training -On Arrival training The training will be organized by the stuff of our organisation, during the first week of the stay of volunteer. In the same time in 2 months after comming to Poland volunteer will go to Warsaw, for organised training by Polish National Agency. . soft skills/group work, communication etc/ -online language support /polish/ - mentor /1 for volunteer/

Volunteer profile

-Speak English -Be enthusiastic and motivated A short EVS project needs motivated volunteers. Please show us in your application why you want to join the project and our organization -Be proactive - Like the multimedia Because those positions involve working with videos, photos and graphic design and other publications, it will be helpful if the volunteers like to work on multimedia. - Like to moving During our project you will meet different kids, youth and people, so you have to be ready for moving from one place to another - be interested in Human Rights education

MEETING POINT SAXONY X

Jugend- & Kulturprojekt e.V. (JKPeV)

Dresden, Germany

Apply

Project description

JKPeV aims to provide young people with the opportunity to use their creative skills and to be part of the team. For this reason, the association carries out projects which integrate young people and adults into the European and multicultural community. Through JKPeV's projects, young people from different cultural backgrounds are given the possibility to bring in their ideas and to develop them. The volunteers are going to support our association's cultural activities and our office work tasks. He or she is given the opportunity to initiate activities according to his/her own cultural background, to co-organize events and to put his/her own ideas and projects into practice. JKPeV organises youth exchanges, training courses, seminars, meetings, conferences and exhibitions on different topics such as arts & culture, entrepreneurship, creativity, environment, employability and remembrance culture.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

You'll live in your own room in a shared flat with students from Dresden. They can support you in learning German and will spent as well their leisure time with you. We'll provide you a food allowance so that you will be independent in the choice of your food. We'll provide either a bicycle or a monthly card for the puublic transport, this depends on hwo far you live from the office.

Training during the project

You'll work in our international team in an nice office in Dresden Neustadt, which is the most lively and alternative area of Dresden. It is a student and youth area and it is characterised by great diversity in its cultural and artistic events. Here you can learn how to plan a events like a youth conference, an art exhibition or a festival. You'll have the chance to learn about video and photoshooting and editing. You can get an insight into the application writing procedure for European project. You'll get German courses and you'll meet our members.

Volunteer profile

We are interested in cooperating with young people who have knowledge and some experience in: * Fundraising, project management, PR and networking * Graphic design and web design * Programming and web developing * Film shooting/editing We search for motivated people they like to get resposibilities and want to achieve something special.

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/09/2018 to 31/03/2020

Placement location

Hechtstraße 17, 01097 Dresden

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Project 577: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/911_en


Steinbeis Strategic EVS in a Residential Home for the Elderly

Krankenhaus Löffingen

Löffingen, Germany

Apply

Project description

The St. Martin care home for old people is in the city of Löffingen. The supporter of this institution is the hospital charity foundation in Löffingen. This is a legally independent public charity; it is not for profit. The care and support of residents in the old-age care home St. Martin is organized by an all-inclusive (mind and body) programme. The newest knowledge is used in the areas of nursing care, medicine, and social aspects. Meeting the individual needs of the residents is a team effort. The residents, family members, doctors and the care specialists all work together. Basic care, treatment care, and social care are all focused on the resident. The nursing specialists work together with social care workers to help the residents. This makes all-inclusive care possible. The use of European Volunteers is mainly for the social care and daytime support of the residents. Volunteers can co-design the daily programme. They are supported by the nursing support staff.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers get a single room at the institution or in a separate home nearby. Volunteers get their meals for free at St. Martin. To travel around the area, volunteers get a monthly transportation ticket. This includes free-use of all the public transportation of the Breisgau-Hochschwarzwald transportation authority region. Volunteers can also use the ticket in the bordering counties of Lörrach, Waldshut-Tiengen, Schwarzwald-Baar and Ortenau on: workdays after 2pm, 24 hours on weekends and during school holidays.

Training during the project

To decrease problems from the start, volunteers go to important introduction seminars where they'll receive information about the institution and their duties. There is continuous professional support for the volunteers. One example of support is regular reflection talks. A neutral person from outside of the core group will lead these talks. Apart from the compulsory EVS training cycle provided by the National Agency there is also weekly language training at the local adult education center.

Volunteer profile

This project is only for young people with less opportunities in terms of education (= without university entrance qualification). Volunteers should like working with disabled people. Past experience in working with disabled people is helpful. Volunteers should be able to individually design activities. A basic or beginner level of the German language would be helpful, an interest in learning German is expected. A Class B car driver’s licence is an asset. Volunteers should write a ‘project-related motivation letter’.

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 01/02/2019 to 31/01/2020

Placement location

Seppenhofer Strasse 7, 79843 Löffingen

Looking for volunteers from

Italy

Placement topics

Social challenges

Education and training

Employment and entrepreneurship

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 578: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/891_en


Steinbeis EVS 17.02 / Family Holiday Village in the Black Forest

Familienferiendorf Eckenhof Schramberg

Schramberg, Germany

Apply

Project description

Volunteers get the opportunity to get involved – according to their individual abilities and previous knowledge - with the respective tasks in the hosting organisation and hereby to gain an insight in the mission and functioning of a Family Holiday Village. Through their activities in the project the volunteer will get to know about her/his personal abilities and competences, furthermore s/he can act as a part of a team, in which all members are working as an equal. Volunteers can work in various areas: children’s programme (daily childcare during school holidays), nature exploration (guided nature tours and outdoor activities) and supporting the outdoor and nature education team, but also in reception and guest services; volunteers can support guests with planning and going on daytrips The integration in a foreign culture and a self-determined daily life in the local community provide volunteers a personal orientation and foster the development of personal future perspectives.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

There are living spaces for the volunteers at the institution. Volunteers can take their meals in the dining hall of the host organisation or can get foodstuff from the kitchen for self catering. To travel around the region, European Volunteers get a free (no cost) monthly ticket. This ticket is for all forms of public transportation in the area of Rottweil.

Training during the project

The Family Holiday Village will select a mentor to support the European Volunteers. The mentor helps volunteers from the beginning to the completion of their ending notes. While volunteering, the mentor supports the volunteers with all organizational matters. The mentor helps the volunteers integrate into the facility and educates the volunteers in their areas of work. The mentor regularly leads evaluation meetings with the volunteers. This is a time for the volunteers to talk about their experiences. Apart from the obligatory EVS training cycle the volunteer will get weekly language courses

Volunteer profile

Since the volunteer is supposed to work mainly in the department of maintenance of facilities he should be handy with tools and deft in manual dexterity. Furthermore he should speak already german because the supervisor is from the region and doesn't speak any foreign language. Having a Class B driver’s license is also helpful.

Placement dates

A total of 54 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

Dr.-Helmut-Junghans-Straße 50, 78713 Schramberg

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Education and training

Employment and entrepreneurship

Placement deadline

Project 579: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/844_en


Building a community volunteer program

OPEN MIND Foundation

Shipka/Kazanlak, Bulgaria

Apply

Project description

The project is approved. It is an unique opportunity for getting hands on experience in the areas of community building and overall town improvement, development cultural tourism, working with youth, permaculture and ecological gardening, low waste management. It is an a opportunity to meet like-minded people and be the change in the world. Shipka has many advantages – life is calmer around here, the air is fresh, water and food are clean, we are in the outskirts of the mountain and near a lake. Shipka is rich in cultural heritage. The disadvantages of Shipka’s are that cultural and social life is very limited. There are hardly any activities for youth and children. The town needs modernizing in lots of areas. We want to change that. This is why we need your help. We want to attract young people who want to live in a quiet place with fresh air for a few months. In the long run we want to attract people to live in Shipka, so this program can also be viewed as trial run.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The sleeping arrangements will be in a house in the town of Shipka, that has everything necessary. The house is good and comfortable. Travel, food and accommodation and pocket money (set amount) are covered by the host organisation (funded by E+). Location - Shipka is a historical place with rich cultural heritage and stunning nature. There are lots of tourists that visit the town, mainly to see the Russian church with the golden domes. The nature around Shipka is very beautiful and nice for hikes and walks. There is a bus to the town of Kazanlak (43,000 people) every 30 minutes.

Training during the project

• Developing Social entrepreneurship project at the Shipka ethographic museum Cultural and educational activity - Cultural center, gallery, library experience in promotion, exhibitions, funding, organizational activities • Non-formal education – working with youth and children • Design and making of productive permaculture gardens (building raised beds, perennial plants, observation skills, chicken tractor, worm farm, mulching , composting, making seed and seedling mixtures and raising seedlings) • Town composting and recycling - pilot project for a small town

Volunteer profile

People who want to gain practical experience in cultural activities, ecological gardening, permaculture, biodiversity, community building, transformation, transition economy, low waste management for small communities. People who are willing to learn and like to spend time outdoors. We would like to host volunteers who demonstrate a strong interest for the main themes of the project and main areas of activities.

Placement dates

A total of 44 week(s) during the period 01/03/2019 to 31/05/2020

Placement location

22, Dobri Kartalov St,, 6150 Shipka/Kazanlak

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Environment and natural protection

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 580: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/824_en


Bring your interests and skills to youth work in ESTONIA!

Eesti Avatud Noortekeskuste Ühendus

Põltsamaa, Estonia

Apply

Project description

We have vacancies for long-term volunteering services (6-12 months) available in Estonian youth centers in different locations. See a video invitation created by previous international volunteers here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BO1c6TfLKAY More info about the current vacancies can be found here: https://goo.gl/forms/VM5eXONB1gvNpVQa2 or asked over e-mail (contact: stiina.kutt@ank.ee). Open youth centers offer non-formal education activities for young people aged 7-26. Youth centres follow the principles of open youth work- they permit open access to all youth, diverse opportunities for leisure time, support for young people and their ideas, space for socializing and partnership. You will be able to co-create your own volunteering journey and contribute with your ideas and skills. We'd like you to start your volunteering experience in February 2019 and stay for 6-12 months. We'd be glad to welcome you in Estonia! :)

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Participation in European Solidarity Corps Volunteering Service (EVS) ensures you: + Reimbursement of international transport costs according to Erasmus+ rules + Cigna health insurance + Accommodation + Work-related transport + Monthly pocket money: 4€ per each day + Monthly food allowance: 6€ per each day +Online language course + On-arrival and mid-term training and other meetings with other international volunteers + Work-related training and preparation in youth centre + Tutor to instruct you at work + Mentor- a local friend + A life full of new experiences!

Training during the project

The volunteer will participate in on-arrival and mid-term training organized by the Estonian National Agency. Work-related training and guidance will be performed in the hosting organisation. During the service, the volunteer will have possibilities to meet other international volunteers coordinated by the organisation and participate in common gatherings and evaluation sessions.

Volunteer profile

* Aged 18-30 * Motivated to volunteer, to try and learn new things * Interested in working and communicating with young people * Able to communicate in English * Willing to live in Estonia for long-term service and experience local life

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 01/02/2019 to 31/01/2020

Placement location

Veski 4, 48106 Põltsamaa

Looking for volunteers from

Greece, Germany, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Spain, Portugal, Poland, Finland

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Education and training

Employment and entrepreneurship

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Project description

The Republican Center for Children and Youth “ARTICO” is a public institution of non-formal education which provides children and youth with information as well as training, consulting, supporting opportunities of development through involvement in social, cultural, sporting and technical activities. - assistance in choreography (sport, flamenco, modern, ballet, contemporary, neoclassic) - part-time or full-time support in visual arts domain (origami, textile, DIY crafts, mask creation, painting, décor, sculpture, woodcarving) - help in music domain (vocals, choir, musical theater, musical instruments) - involvement in social domain (art of communication, European cultures, emotional and individual development, education through music)- support in writing and organizing Erasmus+ projects; - office logistics (communication with project partners through social media and mail, monitoring logistic work in the section)

Project description

CCI RM focuses on assisting local and foreign enterprises in a variety of ways including business development, as well as other areas vital to the success of a company.Typical tasks in the International Relations Department: - Initiate and organize economic missions, business forums, international conferences, - Implement activities pertaining to international and regional organization cooperation, - Identify partners for projects aimed at developing external relations, cooperate with similar subdivisions in foreign chambers of commerce. - Internationalization of local businesses - Promote local companies abroad through various instruments, including through the European Enterprise Network, develop marketing and branding strategies for the launch of export oriented production on foreign markets.

Educational activities in Michalowo

ANAWOJ

Michalowo, Poland

Apply

Project description

We are looking for creative people, who helps us to make kids and youngsters in our village more active and engaged, with innovative, creative and mostly outdoor activities. We propose the following tasks for volunteers: • Organization of creative non-formal activities, sport and outdoor activities for children and youth in Michalowo, • Organizing outdoor ad creative animation for kids/ youngsters on the playgrounds of our local community - Assisting in organization, preparation and creating of different kinds of seminars, workshops and trainings on regional, national and international level - Assisting in development of new non-formal educational, creative and innovational projects - Assisting in office work (especial correspondence, public relations, updating of our homepage and local web-forum, edition of newsletter, creation of posters and information sheets etc.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will live in Michalowo, small village with 3000 inhabitants, in a own house. Every volunteer has his own room and a kitchen and bathroom the share. In the accomodation the volunteer will find basic equipment (including bed sheet, towels ect.) . Living conditions will be simple (for instance wooden house heated by stove), so the volunteer should be sure that he/ she want to live in such rough conditions. Instead we offer stay in nice and quit environment near nature and a lot of forrest. For food volunteers receive money each month and have to feed himself.

Training during the project

The On-arrival will be organised by Polish National Agency in Warsaw. The receiving organisation offers more training activities for the volunteers in field of: intercultural learning, how to prepare and to create own activities and workshops, animation and theatre performance, and of course polish language course.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for 2-3 voluneers: - The volunteer should be interested in work with kids and youth; • The volunteer should be interested in different form of animation, and outdoor-activities and need to have the ability to take initiative; • He/ she should be open to live in a small village (3000 inhabitants). The next big city is far 40 km and can be reached by local busses.

Placement dates

A total of 20 week(s) during the period 01/08/2018 to 30/06/2019

Placement location

Michalowo

Looking for volunteers from

KITA Waldkindergarten - discover nature in the Forest Kindergarten

Leipzig, Germany

Apply

Project description

Kindergarden “Waldkindergarten” in Leipzig offers places for up to 60 children aged 2 – 7 years and focuses on „natural education”. The Forest Kindergarten (Waldkindergarten) means that the children go into the forest every day, no matter the weather. There are places which can be used by the children and educators during the day. The children have the chance to discover nature everyday with their senses, they discover the way of life, the harmony of the forest and they find out that they are a part of this.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Normally all the volunteers are living in shared flats, have their own room - but share kitchen and bathroom with 3 others volunteers. Food money will be paid out to you as well as money to buy the local transportation monthly ticket or you just buy a bike. Leipzig is a very nice city to ride bike. If you wish we can as well try to organise a host family.

Training during the project

We will help you to find a German language course which fits your needs and level.

Volunteer profile

The following points are important for our kindergarten regarding the selection of the volunteers: Willingness to go to the forest with the children, no matter the weather! Interest in work with children age 2-6 years Interest in nature and environment Interest to learn German Creativity- because the forest kindergarten is “without toys”, the creativity in the game is important

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 01/06/2019 to 31/05/2020

Leipzig

Project 586: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/621_en


Lernwerkstatt im Wasserschloss

Schule

St. Pölten, Austria

Apply

Project description

Our school is a private school, organized by the parents of our students. We are the biggest and oldest alternative private school of Austria. Our school was found in 1990 by a group of parents. At the moment we have about 80 students who are between 6 and 15 years old. The students can choose where they want to be, who they want to be, work and play with and for how long. Children from 6 to 12 are called the Primaria and Children from 12 to 15 are called the Sekundaria. Our school is situated in one part of the water castle in Pottenbrunn. It is situated directly in the center of the village, so the volunteer can walk to the next bus station, to the supermarket, the doctor, the coffeehouse,…

Volunteer profile

Our volunteer should be very interested in our padeagogical concept based on Maria Montessori and the experiences of Rebeca and Maricio Wild and in working in a team. Our volunteer should be interested in working together with children and youngsters. He/she should be creative in at least one of these fields: playing music, singing, painting or playing theatre, etc. He/she shoult be mature and highly motivated. For the communication it`s important that he/she has at least good English skills and is willing to lern German and visit course. He/she should be open minded and act independently.

Social youth work through sport

Project Center Neuseddin

Seddiner See, Germany

Apply

Project description

The project implies the integration of the volunteer in the Project Centre by supporting the co-workers in their daily work with youth. By learning to use sport as the educational tool and working method the volunteer will have a possibility to assist, to take part and engage himself in the Social projects: 1) Mobile “Street Sport on Tour” (trendy sport offers during sport events); 2) “Integration through Sport” - programme for the integration of "repatriates of German ancestry" into community through sport; 3) “Street Soccer for Tolerance”. Possible fields of activity: - assist with the organisation and implementation of sport tournaments and other events - learn about the educational method „Street Soccer for Tolerance“ - support the communication with foreign partner organisations coming to summer youth camps - look after young people from abroad during youth camps - teamwork with other volunteers - get acquainted with sports structures in Germany

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation: The volunteer will live in one of our 2 accommodation places for EVS volunteers in Potsdam. Each of the volunteer has his/her own room. Necessary living arrangements for the project time has been done. Food: A monthly food allowance of 229,00 € will be provided via bank transfer. Local Transport: A monthly ticket to use public transport within the area of Potsdam/Brandenburg will be provided.

Volunteer profile

- be interested in social youth work - be interested in sport oriented social youth work - be interested in the conception and implementation of locally and internationally oriented sport events and projects - be interested to work with children and young people - dedicated commitment and creativity implementing projects activity area - sociable, friendly, patient and open-minded - willing to learn new skills - curious and be interested in German culture and language - readiness to commit also in some weekends (Summer season)

Project 588: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/596_en


MOBILITY AND PROJECT PROMOTER FOR YOUNG EUROPEAN CITIZENS

Lycée Félix Le Dantec

Lannion, France

Apply

Project description

The main part of the mission will be in one of the secondary schools partners of the project as hosting organizations. He / she will be given three tasks: 1. A mission to develop a spirit and European citizenship among the students (25%): 2. A mission to assist the educational team and the students with their projects (20%) 3. Project support (monitoring EU news, research on topics, translation...)(10%): 4. Approach to self-learning (20%) We promote the European Voluntary approach as part of long life training and popular education. To reach this aim, we invest time to the personal self-training. Even if the main activity is within the secondary school, the volunteer may participate in activities in the coordinating organization like Culture, Sports and Stays depending on his/her activities. However, the main activity will be in the secondary school and 10% of her/his time could be on other activities with the coordinating organisation.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will be accommodated in an appartment within the high school. The appartment has a kitchen, and a bathroom with a toilet. The volunteer will have a bed and a cupboard/cabinet. The volunteer will share appartment with language assistants. The young volunteer can eat during the week at noon and evening to the canteen of the high school.

Training during the project

• A regular time devoted to the learning process Youthpass, through the weekly assessment (2h/week) and we add 5 days/35h for writing the Youthpass document at the end of the EVS. • Some time is given to enroll in school, college or high school (1/2 day per week). • Language training thanks to “Online Linguistic Support” (Erasmus+) and in a second time by the volunteer's participation in school type sequences mentioned above. Plus, seminaries with the N/A and opportunity to access international training courses organized by the coordinating organization.

Volunteer profile

At least, the role of the volunteer will be to be in a process of Popular Education and Volunteering. That means to be in an active way of cross-training: pass on to others and learn from others, to catch the richness of an environment and to give to this environment. Indeed, he / she will have a rich environment, at the same time by the diversity of our actions, by the opportunities offered, by the city and its services, but he / she must has a basic level of autonomy to enjoy it.

Placement dates

A total of 25 week(s) during the period 01/01/2019 to 30/06/2019

Placement location

rue des Cordiers, 22300 Lannion

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 589: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/595_en


FOR AN EUROPE OF DIVERSITY

Ligue de l'enseignement des Côtes d'Armor

Saint-Brieuc, France

Apply

Project description

What we will offer will give you a high diversified learning potential framework. The choice will be determined by the objectives that the volunteer will have established at the beginning and through his/her activity. Even if the main activity is within the International-Europe Service and the Youth-Volunteering Service, the volunteer may participate in activities like Culture, Sports and Stays depending on his/her activities. For us, it is important that he can learn how to be an active citizen and we will give him the means to achieve this goal to be an active citizen in the society. Meanwhile, these opportunities are part of a personal enrichment, and each action can make different and complementary learning, which will be an additional factor of personal development. However, the main activity will be in the International-Europe and Youth-Volunteering service and 15% of her/his time could be on other activities.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

There will be two different type of accomodation, depending on the approved projects: The European Volunteer may lives: 1. In FJT (Young Worker’s Home) in a single studio. This home hosts many international young people which creates a rich and colorful atmosphere. It is possible for volunteers to eat locally for 3.70€/meal. 2. In a shared apartment within a partner high school. The apartment has 4 bedrooms, a small common room, a kitchen, a bathroom and separate toilet. Each bedroom has a bed and a cupboard/cabinet. It is possible for volunteers to eat at the cantina for 2.50€/meal

Training during the project

We promote the European Voluntary approach as part of long life training and popular education. To reach this aim, we invest time (30%) to the personal self-training. This will mean: • A regular time devoted to the learning process Youthpass, through the weekly assessment (2h/week) and we add 5 days for writing the Youthpass document at the end of the EVS • Some time is given to enroll in school, college or high school (1/2 day per week). • Language training thanks to “Online Linguistic Support” (Erasmus+) and in a second time by the volunteer's participation in school type sequences.

Volunteer profile

At least, the role of the volunteer will be to be in a process of Popular Education and Volunteering. That means to be in an active way of cross-training: pass on to others and learn from others, to catch the richness of an environment and to give to this environment. Indeed, he / she will have a rich environment, at the same time by the diversity of our actions, by the opportunities offered, by the city and its services, but he / she must has a basic level of autonomy to enjoy it.

Placement dates

A total of 38 week(s) during the period 01/01/2019 to 30/09/2019

Placement location

89 boulevard Edouard Prigent, 22000 Saint-Brieuc

Looking for volunteers from

Germany

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 590: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/594_en


EVS in a Day Care Center for the Disabled

Integrations-Werkstätten Oberschwaben gGmbH

Weingarten, Germany

Apply

Project description

The Day care Center for the Disabled is a part of the Integrationswerkstätten Oberschwaben GmbH (IWO). It offers very good integration and support of people with mental (mind), physical (body) and severe multiple disabilities. The institution offers varied and challenging group work opportunities and individual care and therapy activities. Specifically, these people are not yet able or won’t be able to work in a workshop. The purpose is to develop and preserve the person’s individual skills (body, mind and social). So, we offer and develop individual living areas, quality of life, and life perspective for severely disabled people. We help people to live and participate in a community. We also encourage the realization and development of their personalities. The special needs department is near the workshop. This offers many possibilities for meeting with others. Our orientation group also gives our workers the possibility to test and develop their own skills.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will get a single room in flat in the city of Weingarten, bathroom and kitchen are to share with 4 more international and german volunteers. In addition to the monthly pocket money volunteers will get 230 € money for food per months. To travel around the area, volunteers get a monthly ticket. This includes free-use of all the public transportation of the Bodensee-Oberschwaben transportation authority.

Training during the project

At the beginning, volunteers get important training and support so they can complete their duties. The European volunteers and the Federal Volunteer Service youth at the IWO have regular meetings. In the meetings, they have the possibility to exchange information about: their work, their living environment, their values and their social and employment development. Certified education specialists give the volunteers individual support, training and guidance. At weekly language training, volunteers can meet with the volunteers from other projects to trade experiences.

Volunteer profile

Volunteers should be open to working with disabled people and people who are excluded from society. They should be able to individually design and plan activities. They should also be helpful and be able to work with other team members. Past experience in working with disabled people is helpful. A basic or beginner level of the German language would be helpful for volunteers. An interest in learning German is expected. A Class B driver’s licence is an asset.

Placement dates

A total of 54 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

Stefan-Rahl-Straße 2, 88250 Weingarten

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Social challenges

Health and wellbeing

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

Project 591: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/593_en


EVS in a Sheltered Workshop for the Disabled

Integrations-Werkstätten Oberschwaben gGmbH

Weingarten, Germany

Apply

Project description

The Werkstatt für behinderte Menschen (WfbM) (Workshop for Disabled People) is a part of the Integrationswerkstätten Oberschwaben GmbH (IWO). It offers very good integration and support of people with mental (mind), physical (body) and severe multiple disabilities. The institution offers varied and challenging group work opportunities and individual care and therapy activities. These are structured daily. The structure of the facilities is very good and there is disabled-friendly work equipment. Physically, mentally or severely disabled people can find meaningful work in our workshop. Work and personal qualification, and the conservation and development of physical abilities are very important in our work. So, we offer various educational, therapeutic and support activities. Our disabled workers receive many benefits, for example: the participation in work and community life, rehabilitation, personal and employment development, self-determination and independence.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteers will get a single room in flat in the city centre of Weingarten, bathroom and kitchen are to share with 4 more international and german volunteers. In addition to the monthly pocket money volunteers will get 230 € money for food per months. To travel around the area, volunteers get a monthly ticket. This includes free-use of all the public transportation of the Bodensee-Oberschwaben transportation authority.

Training during the project

At the beginning, volunteers get important training and support so they can complete their duties. The European volunteers and the Federal Volunteer Service youth at the IWO have regular meetings. In the meetings, they have the possibility to exchange information about: their work, their living environment, their values and their social and employment development. Certified education specialists give the volunteers individual support, training and guidance. At weekly language training, volunteers can meet with the volunteers from other projects to trade experiences.

Volunteer profile

Volunteers should be open to working with disabled people and people who are excluded from society. They should be able to individually design and plan activities. They should also be helpful and be able to work with other team members. Past experience in working with disabled people is helpful. A basic or beginner level of the German language would be helpful for volunteers. An interest in learning German is expected. A Class B driver’s licence is an asset.

Placement dates

A total of 54 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

Stefan-Rahl-Straße 2, 88250 Weingarten

Looking for volunteers from

PR of NPO and International Youth Exchange

FAIRbund e.V.

Leipzig, Germany

Apply

Project description

This project is carried out in the FAIRbund EU-projects office. It is situated in the main office together with management, the child care centers coordination office and also the public relations office. A total of 10 employees work in the main office of FAIRbund. The groups of people targeted by the EU-projects office are potential participants in the sending projects, young local unemployed people and professionals involved in youth exchanges. In addition, the project includes guiding and helping the interns from various European countries who have come to Leipzig in order to undertake their own Erasmus+ based projects. The volunteer should be interested in international work, project management, PR, social media. He/she will have the opportunity to develop his/her own projects, events or youth exchanges - for local people, other volunteers or international groups. The volunteer can take care of the website and Facebook page, write articles, work in the graphic design field.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Normally all the volunteers are living in shared flats, have their own room - but share kitchen and bathroom with 3 others volunteers. Food money will be paid out to you as well as money to buy the local transportation monthly ticket or you just buy a bike. Leipzig is a very nice city to ride bike. If you wish we can as well try to organise a host family.

Training during the project

We will help you to find a German language course which fits your needs and level.

Volunteer profile

Enthusiasm for the idea of Europe Interest in learning German and in learning about Leipzig and its surroundings Interest in new media Creativity Motivation to develop new projects and events

Project 593: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/584_en


Mendelssohn House Museum

Mendelssohn House

Leipzig, Germany

Apply

Project description

The Mendelssohn House in Leipzig was constructed in 1844/1845 and is the last and the only remaining and preserved privat address of Felix Mendelssohn Bartholdy who has been residing here with his family since 1845 and died here on the 4th of November 1847. The museum is thus concentrated on the time when Felix Mendelssohn Bartholdy lived and died and is considered to be the musical and museum-like center for the cultural inheritance of the composer. Its' aim is to present the life, work and the historical influence of the composer, director, piano virtuoso and mediator between the religions and the europeans. The volunteer tasks are mainly: welcoming the guests, giving the information about museum, helping with events&concerts managment and promotion. The volunteer will have an opportunity to create and develop his/her own projects.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Normally all the volunteers are living in shared flats, have their own room - but share kitchen and bathroom with 3 others volunteers. Food money will be paid out to you as well as money to buy the local transportation monthly ticket or you just buy a bike. Leipzig is a very nice city to ride bike. If you wish we can as well try to organise a host family.

Training during the project

We will help you to find a German language course which fits your needs and level.

Volunteer profile

We are looking for one volunteer, who is: ineterested in music and art creative and open-minded like working with people has at least B1 level German knowledge

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 01/11/2019 to 31/10/2020

Placement location

Leipzig

Looking for volunteers from

Belgium, Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Ireland, Greece, Spain, France, Croatia, Italy, Cyprus, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Hungary, Malta, Netherlands, Austria, Poland

Placement topics

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

Charity Centre for Refugees

Chisinau, Moldova (Republic of)

Project description

CCR's main objectives are to provide cultural, moral and material assistance to refugees and asylum seekers.Monday to Friday: Individual assistance to the beneficiaries of the Charity Centre and to its staff. Individual assistance to the beneficiaries of the Charity Centre and to its staff. Planning of and preparation for events. Assistance to the supervisor. Lunch Visit to State Reception Centre for Refugees and Asylum Seekers. Pottery workshop. Help in coordinating pottery workshop; Making Power-Point presentations, articles for blog. Preparing workshops. Looking for fundraising opportunities Making Power-Point presentations, articles for blog. Preparing workshops. Looking for fundraising opportunities Making Power-Point presentations, articles for blog. Preparing workshops.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

ADVIT Moldova as EVS contact point ensures all measures to be taken in order to ensure volunteer’s safety and feeling comfortable in Moldova. Volunteer would be living in a shared volunteers’ flat or a host family and provided with all necessary facilities according to Moldovan standarts of life.

Training during the project

OAT and mid term evaluation done by SALTO EECA

Volunteer profile

The main recruitment criterion for the project Charity Centre for Refugees is flexibility, ability to work in multicultural environment and work individually. Charity Centre for Refugees is a non-political organisation, it does not stand for or support any political party of Moldova and is not involved in any political campaigns.That is why we expect the EVS volunteer to respect our internal policy and to be politically neutral and to avoid participation in any political actions or strikes in Moldova.

After school care center "Wellenreiter"

Hort "Wellenreiter"

Brandenburg an der Havel, Germany

Apply

Project description

Volunteer will be integrated in the "on the move and health oriented" program of the after school care center by supporting the pedagogues in their daily activities. Sport, movement and healthy lifestyle are the key words in the daily work at the after school care center. For this reason, the "on the move" education has the highest priority as a pedagogical basic principle. Volunteer will help pedagogues with on the move exercises, communicate with children and lead them to the better consciousness for the health. Also, volunteer will have opportunity to organize his own projects, e.g. about his own country, culture, traditions. Possible main fields of activity: - support by the independent learning of children - accompanying children from the school and in their daily activities - support by the fulfillment of homeworks - cooking together with children healthy food - support by the planning and implementation of activities, e.g. Easter, autumn festival, Christmas event.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation: The volunteer will live in one of our 2 accommodation places for EVS volunteers in Potsdam. Each of the volunteer has his/her own room. Necessary living arrangements for the project time has been done. Food: A monthly food allowance of 229,00 € will be provided via bank transfer. Pocket money: 150,00 € will be provided via bank transfer. Local Transport: A monthly ticket to use public transport within the area of Potsdam/Brandenburg will be provided.

Volunteer profile

- be interested in work with young children - be interested in sport orientated work - be interested in the conception and implementation of sport orientated events and projects with children - dedicated commitment and creativity (music, sport, games, dance etc.) - sociable, friendly, patient and open-minded - willing to learn new skills - curious and be interested in German culture and language - body hygiene

Placement dates

Placement location

Trauerberg 24, 14776 Brandenburg an der Havel

Arts&Culture @ Bäckerei Kulturbackstube in Innsbruck, Austria

Die Bäckerei - Kulturbackstube

Innsbruck, Austria

Apply

Project description

The “Bäckerei” (the German word for bakery) is an old former bakery which had been abandoned for ten years, until 2010. A motivated bunch of people took over and breathed life into the building. It has now become a successful platform for cultural exchange and social innovation in Innsbruck, which aims to enable people to share knowledge and know-how on cultural themes and topics of social interest. There is no specific target group - we have a wide range of activities suitable for a big spectrum of audience. Whether someone wants to host weekly Yoga classes, music workshops, regular start up meetings or organize a concert or any kind of artistic endeavour, we provide support to make it happen. Our wish for this project is that the volunteer is highly interested in culture management, creating new event formats and working with existing ones! The main topic for this year is social innovation. Find all details and how to apply directly on www.mei-infoeck.at/volunteer Only EU/EEA

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation in a shared flat in Innsbruck, quite centrally. A bike can be used for Transportation. During the voluntary service the volunteer will receive accommodation, food money (300,- Euro per month), pocket money (150,- Euro) and a German course. The volunteer can also have lunch on weekdays during the season at Die Bäckerei. You can find more info in the Project Description on www.mei-infoeck.at/volunteer

Training during the project

On Arrival Training Midterm Training German Language Course at the University (4 months) Support and Meetings with coordinating Organisation (regular Group Evaluation and individual contact possibilities) All information and how to apply can be found on the coordinating organisation's website: www.mei-infoeck.at/volunteer Applications ONLY via e-mail directly to Ms. Baiba Dekena

Volunteer profile

We would be happy to host a volunteer who: • Is between 18 and 30 years old and an EU/EEA resident • Has a personal interest and/or experience in arts, media, photography, film, communication or social innovation • Is open-minded, flexible, pro-active and communicative • Is interested in learning and creating web content • Brings in practical handcraft skills or is willing to learn • Is highly interested in culture management, creating new event formats and working with existing ones here • Has an intermediate English level and is motivated to learn German

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 02/09/2019 to 30/08/2020

Placement location

Dreiheiligenstrasse 21a, 6020 Innsbruck

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Reception and integration of refugees and migrants

Education and training

Employment and entrepreneurship

Placement deadline

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

The Center for Social Rehabilitation of Children Casa Gavroche

Chisinau, Moldova (Republic of)

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

The Center for Social Rehabilitation of Children “Casa Gavroche” is a shelter for children living and working on the streets and other categories of children at risk from Chisinau. The main role of the volunteers is to assist the employees in work and to give support to the children in every day activities of the Centre. Everyday duties of volunteers are: - help in preparing a snack; - help with homework; - help in organizing and running recreational and interpersonal games; - help in cleaning up rooms when activities finished; - picking up children from the school; - read stories and songs in easy language; - participate in painting and crafts workshops - participate in theatre and music groups.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteer(s) will live in a host family or volunteer's flat with shared kitchen, toilet and bathroom. Also volunteer(s) will have access to the land line phone in their accommodation. Internet can be accessed in the internet cafes and wi-fi spots in the city, also some volunteer flats have internet access at individual basis. As well volunteer will be able to use internet in his Host Organization. Depending on the district of the city where volunteer will live he/she can reach the center by foot or by public transportation.

Training during the project

OAT and mid term organized by SALTO EECA and other trainings organized by supporting organization

Volunteer profile

The volunteer should be interested in the work with children and youth. She/he should be an open person, willing to share with his/her culture. A volunteer should like to develop and improve his/her skills and abilities, be open for experiments, have some hobbies/interests and like to share with them when organizing some activities for children. The volunteer should be interested and open-minded to contribute with his/her own creativity in the organization's work and willingly develop his/her personality. Both male and female volunteers are wanted.

Placement dates

A total of 45 week(s) during the period 01/06/2019 to 01/04/2020

Placement location

N.Dimo 11/5 Street, MD2021 Chisinau

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Chisinau, Moldova (Republic of)

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

Family Type Placement Centre “Small Group Homes” aims to provide a temporary home to vulnerable children to those leaving large-scale residential units to family reunification or to be placed with Foster Carers.The volunteers will work mainly with the age group 6-12. Their main tasks will consist in: - playing with the children, using his /her creativity and games he/she knows - assisting the children with their daily needs and responsibilities - picking up children from the school - read stories and songs in easy language - organize painting and crafts workshops - helping centre’s staff in cleaning, laundering and cooking for children

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteer(s) will live in a host family or volunteer's flat with shared kitchen, toilet and bathroom. Also volunteer(s) will have access to the land line phone in their accommodation. Angelus Moldova
