Project description

The aim was to create a new system of medical-social assistance for the incurable patients with cancer in advanced and terminal stages of the disease, as well as for their relatives. The proposed activities for the EVS volunteer(s) are the following: (90% of the work will be office based): Activities for fundraising in support of our direct services (an EVS volunteer with clerical skills can serve our foundation by helping in the office with simple administrative duties; fundraising responsibilities can range from preparing mailings or thank you letters to organizing fundraising events and contacting possible donors);The volunteer will be involved in assisting project coordinators in organizing logistically all kinds of events: trainings, seminars, conferences, roundtables, other. He/She will get acquainted first-hand with all the organizational and logistic stages of a successful training event. Involvement in such activities brings multicultural exposure to the volunteers, as we

Motivation, communication, an open mind and ability to work with different people are the most important key defining features of the sought volunteer profile and will be counted as standard criteria in recruitment process. Dogs protection in Moldova

Chisinau, Moldova (Republic of)

The application deadline has passed.

Project description

Association for the Protection of Homeless Animals “ALGA” is a non-profit organization, created in 2006. The Association is run solely by volunteers, who are dedicating their time and money to helping the homeless animals of the country. Volunteer will help to: - Clean and take care of the places where the animals stay. - Play with animals. - Create the places where the animals stay (putting the attributes on the right places) and make this places ready for the animals. - Do fortification and does behavior observation on the animals. - Feed the animals. - Help veterinary doctor. - Register animals and prepare reports this

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Volunteer(s) will live in a host family or volunteer's flat with shared kitchen, toilet and bathroom. Also volunteer(s) will have access to the land line phone in their accommodation. Internet can be accessed in the internet cafes and wi-fi spots in the city, also some volunteer flats have internet access at individual basis. As well volunteer will be able to use internet in his Host Organization. Depending on the district of the city where volunteer will live he/she can reach the center by foot or by public transportation. Chisinau is not a big city

Training during the project

OAT and mid term evaluation organized by SALTO EECA

Volunteer profile

The main recruitment criteria is: - To be motivated; - Having experience with working in a NGO. It would be good if volunteer would have a small experience in being active in an NGO in his/her own country to show that the person really wants to take part in exactly this project; - Having affinity and experience in the work with animals.

BETA - unemployed youngsters in Wörgl, Austria - only from EU / EEA

BETA / Volkshilfe Tirol

Wörgl, Austria

Apply

Project description

We are looking for a volunteer in Tirol, Austria in a project with training and education activities for youth with special needs! Find all details and how to apply directly on www.mei-infoeck.at/volunteer We do not accept applications through this portal, only via e-mail, as described in the project description (follow the link above). Only for EU residents (28 states) or people who live in Norway, Iceland or Liechtenstein. * This project will involve you as a volunteer at the organisation Volkshilfe Tirol in the project BETA for unemployed youngsters in Wörgl in Tyrol, Austria. * BETA qualifies young people between 16 and 24 years for work and for finding a job. Most of the youngsters who come to BETA are school drop-outs, have attended special schools for people with learning difficulties, have achieved only poor school marks or very bad reports and they face difficulties in finding a job. * About 10 youngsters are employed at BETA for one year at the same time.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will have a studio apartment in the hosting organisation’s building in the centre of Wörgl. The town Wörgl lies in the middle of the Alps and there are warm summers and cold winters. Wörgl has good infrastructure, numerous bars and stores or outdoor and indoor facilities for leisure time and good train connections to Innsbruck, the capital of Tyrol. Innsbruck is at only 30 minutes by train. The volunteer will receive financial support for an annual ticket for public transportation in the region of Tirol!

Training during the project

On Arrival Training, Midterm Training Language Training (you should have at least A2 German skills when you start this project, as the young people do not speak English) Networking with other volunteers in the Region Support of a mentor In the hosting organisation the volunteer will receive orientation and support for the activities from the main responsible employee and from the entire team. Details can be found on www.mei-infoeck.at/volunteer

Volunteer profile

We are looking for a volunteer who identifies with the project description and is willing to enrich our team. We are open to host a volunteer who is a youngster with low educational background or jobless youngsters and young people with similar economic difficulties. · You are open, friendly and interested in communicating with youngsters · Beginner German skills are important, as our youngsters do not speak much English · You are interested in working with young unemployed people and in social work · Mechanical skills, computer skills or creativity welcome Only for EU/EEA residents!

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 02/09/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

Sepp Gangl Straße 18, 6300 Wörgl

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Social challenges

Health and wellbeing

Education and training

Employment and entrepreneurship

Volunteering @ Mikado home for children - in Austria - only EU/EEA

Pro Juventute Mikado

Kirchbichl in Tirol, Austria

Apply

Project description

We are looking for one volunteer from anywhere in the EU or EEA, who is between 20 and 30 years old, open-minded, interested in working with children and teenagers and motivated to enrich our team during 12 Months. Pro Juventute Mikado is part of the international Pro Juventute network. It is a Social pedagogic community (a little bit like a children´s home, but much more familiar) taking care of children whose parents aren’t able to care for them. Some children live at Mikado for one or two years and some until they are adults, depending on social problems or illnesses of their parents. The aim is to allow children and teenagers in the rural area of Kufstein a life in a safe, sheltered and happy environment. Pro Juventute gives children a home and the chance for a healthy development. PLEASE READ THE DOWNLOAD FOR FURTHER DETAILS: www.mei-infoeck.at/volunteer You can also find the Application Form (download) following the same link. Application ONLY via e-mail to Daniel.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will be provided with a room in a shared flat (probably in the town of Wörgl, nearby Kirchbichl). At present, this two-bedroom flat is comprised of a kitchen, living room and bathroom. The flat is 30 minutes away (by foot) from Mikado but can be reached much faster by bike or bus. A bike will be made available. The volunteer will receive a sufficient amount of food money. Additionally, the volunteer can enjoy meals at Mikado during working times. More info: www.mei-infoeck.at/volunteer

Training during the project

The volunteer will have regular meetings with her or his mentor and with the hosting organisation in order to review progress, reflect on experiences or discuss project activities. The volunteer will mainly receive orientation and support from his/her coordinator and mentor. At the same time, the team members working on any given day will offer this support. The coordinating organisation InfoEck will hold a regular group meeting with all volunteers in Tyrol in order to share experiences, give support to one another and to stay connected. On Arrival Training, Midterm Training

Volunteer profile

We are looking for a volunteer who is between 20 and 30 years old, can identify with the project description and is willing to enrich our team for one year. We would like to host an enthusiastic and open-minded volunteer, who is willing to play an active part in working with the children. Team work and the ability to reflect on one’s own actions and attitudes are essential. The ability to speak German is an advantage, but the willingness to learn essential. This may include learning the basics of German before the project start in order to be able to communicate a bit with the children.

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 02/10/2019 to 30/09/2020

Placement location

Kirchbichl in Tirol

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Social challenges

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 10/04/2019

Project 607: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/305_en


Community Communication - media project for 12 months

Hang-Kép Egyesület

Debrecen, Hungary

Apply

Project description

The volunteers will be working with the members of the association in taking photos, preparing short videos, animations on youth and cultural activities. They will be involved in the different stages of the work depending on their interests and skills. Personal training will be provided to learn these skills. The volunteers will actively participate in the trainings of the communication courses that are organised for high school and university students and to youth workers. These are team building, public speech, media literacy, photo courses. The volunteers will be working with local youth teams, communicating different issues to other young people and to the members of the local community. These actions also include the promotion of the Erasmus+ Program and the EVS itself. Every Monday there is a staff meeting where the activities of the week will be jointly discussed, deadlines will be set and feedback will be given. Working hrs 9-17 (lunch: 13.00-14.30) - flexible based on tasks.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteers will live in rental apartment of the association (all having separate rooms). For breakfast, dinner and non-working days the volunteers receive 30.000 HUF (~100 EUR) in cheques, the cost of lunch for the working days (about an additional 25.000 HUF (80 EUR)/month) is also covered. Lunch is ordered or will be provided in a restaurant depending on the on-going activities. The volunteers get tickets for the local transport. We can provide bikes too. The pocket money for Hungary is 5 EUR/ day (150 EUR/ month), paid at the beginning of each month.

Training during the project

The volunteers will be working with the members of the association in taking photos, filming, editing, recording, gathering information, preparation, making interviews. The volunteers will be helped to learn and to try out in practice all the activities (creation of an image, editing photo, spots and preparing animations, organising events). We offer consultations with special local experts too. If the volunteer does not speak Hungarian,she/he will have access to the an online Hungarian course.

Volunteer profile

We are searching for young people who are interested in taking photos, making videos on different topics, but are open not only for becoming a reporter, but would like to learn the ends and bits of the profession as well (photography, filming, information gathering, news writing, editing, interviews, recording editing and mixing). The volunteers should actively participate in the trainings of the association not only as students, but also as helpers. Personal traits: community person, able to work individually and in team, open, tidy, hard-working

Placement dates

A total of 52 week(s) during the period 13/07/2018 to 12/07/2019

Placement location

Garai u. 13., 4026 Debrecen

Looking for volunteers from

Romania, Spain

Placement topics

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 01/05/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 608: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/244_en


EFD @ WTV-Bürgerfernsehen und medienpädagogische Einrichtung

WTV - Der Offene Kanal aus Wettin e.V.

Wettin-Löbejün, Germany

Apply

Project description

Der Offene Kanal Wettin ermöglicht es Bürgern seit 1999 im Sinne der Presse- und Meinungsfreiheit unentgeltlich nach Ihren eigenen Vorstellungen Film- und Fernsehbeiträge zu produzieren und über den Bürgerfernsehsender WTV auszustrahlen. Dazu werden interessierte Bürger bei der Vorbereitung (Entwicklung von Drehbuch und Interviewfragen), Durchführung (Kameraführung) und Nachbereitung (Schnitt) Ihrer Beiträge unterstützt und erhalten alles dafür notwendige technische Equipment. Freiwillige aus verschiedenen Programmen (Bundesfreiwilligendienst, Freiwilliges Soziales Jahr, Europäischer Freiwilligendienst) unterstützen die Bürger ebenfalls bei der Produktion. Außerdem produzieren sie projektbezogen eigene Beiträge, z.B. Spielfilme, Reportagen oder Dokumentarfilme. Ein weiterer Schwerpunkt der Tätigkeit der Freiwilligen ist die Unterstützung von pädagogischen Fachkräften bei der medienpädagogischen Projektarbeit in Horten, Schulen, Jugendclubs und anderen sozialen Einrichtungen.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Jede*r Freiwillige wohnt während des Projekts kostenlos in einem voll möblierten Zimmer in Halle an der Saale. Das Taschengeld und die Verpflegungspauschale werden voll ausbezahlt. Jede*r Freiwillige erhält kostenlos ein Jahresticket für die Öffentlichen Verkehrsmittel. An- und Abreise und Krankenversicherung werden ebenfalls voll bezahlt.

Training during the project

Einerseits die von der Nationalagentur angebotenen On-Arrival- und Mid-Term-Trainings. Außerdem Fortbildungen in der Einsatzstelle zu medienspezifischen Themen.

Volunteer profile

Bewerber*innen sollten zwischen 17 und 30 Jahren alt sein (Für das Mindestalter ist der Dienstbeginn maßgeblich, für das Höchstalter die jeweilige Antragsfrist). Wichtigste Voraussetzung ist - auch ohne Vorkenntnisse - eine sehr hohe Motivation, im Bereich der Film- und Fernsehproduktion mitarbeiten und Fachkräfte bei der medienpädagogischen Arbeit mit Kindern, Jugendlichen und Erwachsenen unterstützten zu wollen. Außerdem sind eine gute Belastbarkeit, Teamfähigkeit und gute Deutschkenntnisse von großem Vorteil.

Placement dates

A total of 54 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

Lange Reihe 49, 06193 Wettin-Löbejün

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Germany, Czech Republic, Cyprus, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia

Placement topics

Reception and integration of refugees and migrants

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 609: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/121_en


AtivArte

Associação Social Recreativa Juventude de Vila Fonche/Juventude

Arcos de Valdevez, Portugal

Apply

Project description

General description With this project we aim to increase the active participation of young people in mobility projects and also to provide to children and youngsters new activities for their free times. The volunteers will bring a new dynamic and will be received as a real part of our team, we'll give them all the support needed. Tasks for 2 volunteers: - organization of weekly workshops (according to the abilities/knowledge of each volunteer) - organize and implement dissemination actions about Erasmus + - create new projects/activities for youngsters - support the youngsters and the workers with future Erasmus+ projects - support to the activities of the kindergarten and the free time activities center. Tasks for 1 volunteer: - Updating our webpage and social media pages; - Develop graphic contents; - Create videos and promotional materials about the activities; The volunteers will work as a team cooperating among the group and can always propose new ideas.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

Accommodation: Flat in the village. The volunteers may have to share the room (with another volunteer with the same gender). Food: Lunch and afternoon snack, during the week, will be under the organization responsibility. For the rest of the meals we will give 125€/month to each volunteer for groceries and/or restaurant. Transport: The flat and the office are very close to each other and the village is small so the volunteers can walk. The organization will provide a bike for each volunteer. Pocket money: 5€/day given to the volunteers in the beginning of each month

Training during the project

The volunteers will take part in the EVS training cycle. Pre-departure: sending organization On-arrival and mid-term: Portuguese National Agency Support on the activities: provided by the hosting organization. Portuguese classes: will be given by a portuguese teacher in the organization.

Volunteer profile

- 18 to 30 years - dynamic - creative - able to work in a team - open minded - sense of initiative - able to adapt to new situations - with a good level of english, spanish or portuguese - willing to work with youngsters and children - willing to develop their own activities - good communication skills - One volunteer should have graphic design/communication knowledge; The volunteer should be prepared to take part in all the steps of the volunteer process and assume the compromise of attending the all duration of the project.

Placement dates

A total of 40 week(s) during the period 01/10/2019 to 30/06/2020

Placement location

Rua Prof. Dr. José Sebastião da Silva Dias, Loja 74, 4970-745 Arcos de Valdevez

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Seniors' Residence Innsbruck, Austria - only EU/EEA

Seniorenresidenz Veldidenapark

Innsbruck, Austria

Apply

Project description

Find all details and how to apply directly on www.mei-infoeck.at/volunteer We do not accept applications through this portal, ONLY VIA E-MAIL, as described in the project description (follow the link above). Only open for EU or EEA residents. * Seniorenresidenz Veldidenapark, a residence for elderly people, is situated in the centre of Innsbruck, the capital city of Tirol, in a rather quiet but central surrounding of the town. * SRV is a private nursing home for elderly people, some of them are still independent, but most of them are in need of some care. Our main goal is to find a way to keep up their biggest possible autonomy, while giving all the support needed. * Based on the biographies of every resident, SRV generates an individual care plan, which will be realized by our specialized nursing staff. In addition to our support service we offer an all-round activities program. Two volunteers from different countries (also outside of the EU) are hosted at the same time.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

SRV is situated in the centre of Innsbruck, the capital of Tyrol, with 130.000 inhabitants. The volunteers will live in our organisation. Each volunteer will have a fully equipped room on her/his own includeing a bathroom. The volunteers have to accept the house rules of the hosting organisation. The volunteer will receive a monthly pocket money of Euro 150,- and also some monthly sufficient extra food money for holidays or days off. She/he can have full board in our organisation and will be supported to receive an annual ticket valid for the public transport in the region of Tirol.

Training during the project

On Arrival Training, Midterm Meeting, German course and more! All info is available in the project description: www.mei-infoeck.at/volunteer Please read it closely.

Volunteer profile

We would be happy to host a volunteer between 18 and 30 years who: ¦ wants to experience working with elderly people and participating actively ¦ is interested in learning more about another generation and their biographies ¦ is open-minded, friendly, enthusiastic, creative and communicative ¦ is willing to work in an interdisciplinary team and reflect her/his work ¦ is motivated to learn German (and some Tyrolean dialect) ¦ brings in her/his own culture and interests ONLY EU/EEA residents can apply. We ONLY accept applications via e-mail as described on www.mei-infoeck.at/volunteer

Placement dates

A total of 49 week(s) during the period 01/10/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

Neuhauserstraße 5, 6020 Innsbruck

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Arche Tirol - people with disabilities, Austria - only EU/EEA!

Arche Tirol

St. Jodok, Austria

Apply

Project description

Find all details and how to apply directly on www.mei-infoeck.at/volunteer We do NOT accept applications through this portal, ONLY via e-mail, as described in the project description (follow the link above)! Only open for EU or EEA residents. Arche Tirol is part of an international community of people with and without (multiple) disabilities, who live and work together in a rural surrounding 30 minutes from the capital Innsbruck. At the moment 10 people are living in two houses, one house is in Steinach and one is in St. Jodok am Brenner (few kilometers distance). Our main philosophy is not only taking care of them, but also to offer relationship and a home. The main tasks are care/nursing, household and creating a family-like and welcoming atmosphere for our core-members. We try to create a familiar atmosphere and to structure social life. We try to participate actively in the life of the local villages and stay in regular contact with the people and the public.

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer has his/her own room in Arche house in Jodok. The Arche philosophy is to work and live together with people with disabilities. So, the volunteer lives in the same house as our core-members, but he/she will have their privacy. It is important to know that living as part of the community is an important part of this project and experience. All common facilities can be used by the volunteer. The volunteer has to accept the house rules. The volunteer can eat in our community and takes whatever she/he needs. He/she receives 150 Euro pocket-money monthly and 80 Euro money food.

Training during the project

The volunteer will receive On Arrival, Midterm, Midterm Meeting, occasional Group Meetings with other volunteers. The volunteer may have regular meetings with her or his mentor and with the hosting organisation, to talk about the wellbeing or about the project activities. In the hosting organisation the volunteer will receive orientation and support for the activities from the main responsible employee and from the entire team. The volunteer will receive a German course, offered by a public education institution in Innsbruck. More info in the project description following the link.

Volunteer profile

We would be happy to host a volunteer who * wants to get to know our organisation “Arche Tirol” * is interested in working with people with mental and multiple disabilities * has a stable personality, in order to be able to work with our core-members * can imagine to live in a community for one year (in an own separate room) * wants to work in a team * is motivated to learn German (and Tyrolean dialect) * wants to gain social, intercultural, communication and nursing skills * brings her or his own culture and interests You need to live in an EU/EEA country to apply. ONLY via E-mail!

Placement dates

A total of 53 week(s) during the period 02/10/2019 to 30/09/2020

Placement location

Hnr. 73, 6154 St. Jodok

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Social challenges

Citizenship and democratic participation

Health and wellbeing

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 10/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 612: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/75_en


doing youth work at its origin

CVJM - YMCA Göttingen

Göttingen, Germany

Apply

Project description

Volunteers will involve their social, communicative competences. Our daily task is to be involved in After School Care group, which means to help the School kids (6-10), to do their homework, and make their afternoons special with creative games. We give space to volunteers to bring their own ideas. Our group consists of EVS volunteers and an YMCA exchange program participant from Peru. We are also making overnight-programs for the kids which gives the volunteers confidence and responsibilities. We run also projects with the local schools. We make trainings in schools which are aimed to improve the leadership competences of the children through reflexion, team building games etc. Biggest and most entertaining projects are the season camps in which we bring our ideas all together and plan many camps organised in and out of Germany. For supporting all these amazing programs we need enthusiastic, creative, flexible and cooperative people!

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The YMCA has a shared flat for the volunteers. The house is located near the station and 15 minutes by bike to YMCA. Göttingen is quite a small town where you can go everywhere by bycicle. YMCA will afford the bycicles for the volunteers.

Volunteer profile

We are searching for English speaking volunteers, willing to learn German, who are ready to be flexible, creative, social and responsible. Our job is with children and young people so we need active volunteers who are really into youth work and organising events, camps, and if you have own ideas – your own projects. You must be open minded for Christian values, (perfect would be a YMCA background), and it would be excellent if you have experiences in youth work. You have to be open to work with international people and must not be afraid of responsibilities.

Placement dates

A total of 54 week(s) during the period 01/09/2019 to 31/08/2020

Placement location

Baurat-Gerber-Straße 2, 37073 Göttingen

Looking for volunteers from

Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Germany, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Finland, France, Croatia, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia, Slovakia, Turkey, United Kingdom

Placement topics

Citizenship and democratic participation

Education and training

Creativity and culture

Placement deadline

Application deadline: 20/04/2019

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join

Project 613: https://europa.eu//youth/solidarity/placement/14_en


Cultural Recreational and Sporting Activities

Vertigem - Associação Promoção do Património

Arrimal, Portugal

Apply

Project description

Exchange of knowledge, skills and ideas is the key to spread and confirm the idea for protecting the nature in Europe. Volunteers participating in this project will be integrated in groups with members of Vertigem specialised in the different areas, who will give all the specific technical support for the different activities. They will have the chance to learn and develop their skills and competences in technical areas, such as flora, fauna, environment protection, environmental education, recycling and cartography. They wil also have linguistic training and support troughout all the project. Accommodation is in mountain shelter and food is prepared by the staff of the host organisation, at weekends and hollydays volunteers can use the flat rent by the hosting organisation in the close city (Porto de Mós).

Accommodation, food and transport arrangements

The volunteer will be accommodated in Bezerra's Ecological Residence that has as a privilege the fabulous landscape. The Residence is divided in three areas: Wards for men and women with WC, Lounge and Bathrooms for men and women, and common room with library, TV, stereo and two computers The residence can host up to 14 people. The Residence is equipped with energy efficient heating equipment, internet with free wifi, an outside space with aromatic plants and novelty equipment for children. Good enviromental practises are emphasized

Training during the project

training in the areas: Portuguese language, mapping, flora and wildlife

Volunteer profile

For this project we would like to receive enthusiastic people with good communicational skills, who are independent and willing to participate in the project. Qualities taken into account by Vertigem in the selection of candidates for this project are: love of nature and protection of the environment; enthusiasm, motivation to participate in our specific project, appreciation in being useful; enjoy communicating and learning new skills and competences, interest to work in a team, tolerance towards difference.

Placement dates

A total of 24 week(s) during the period 01/04/2019 to 30/11/2019

Placement location

Portela Vale Espinho, 19, 2480-216 Arrimal

Looking for volunteers from

Luxembourg

Placement topics

Environment and natural protection

Placement deadline

No application deadline

In order to check if you can apply for this project, you must first Sign In or Join the Corps.
Sign in / Join
